text2: As nagh lhisin ' s sparail Nineveh yn ard - valley mooar shen , ayn ta ny smoo na shey feed thousane persoon , nagh vel fys oc er nyn laue yesh shaghey nyn laue chiare , as myrgeddin ymmodee maase ?

text: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ , the son of David , the son of Abraham .
text2: Lioar sheeloghe Yeesey Creest , mac Ghavid , mac Abraham

text: Abraham begat Isaac ; and Isaac begat Jacob ; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren ;
text2: Hooar Abraham Isaac , as hooar Isaac Jacob , as hooar Jacob Judas as e vraaraghyn .

text: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar ; and Phares begat Esrom ; and Esrom begat Aram ;
text2: As hooar Judas Phares as Zarah rish Thamar , as hooar Phales Esrom , as hooar Esrom Aram .

text: And Aram begat Aminadab ; and Aminadab begat Naasson ; and Naasson begat Salmon ;
text2: As hooar Aram Aminadab , as hooar Aminadab Naason , as hooar Naason Salmon

text: And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab ; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth ; and Obed begat Jesse ;
text2: As hooar Salmon Booz rish Rachab , as hooar Booz Obed rish Ruth , as hooar Obed Jesse .

text: And Jesse begat David the king ; and David the king begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias ;
text2: As hooar Jesse David yn ree , as hooar David yn ree Solomon reeish v ' er ny ve ben Urias .

text: And Solomon begat Roboam ; and Roboam begat Abia ; and Abia begat Asa ;
text2: As hooar Solomon Roboam , as hooar Roboam Abia , as hooar Abia Asa :

text: And Asa begat Josaphat ; and Josaphat begat Joram ; and Joram begat Ozias ;
text2: As hooar Asa Josaphat , as hooar Josaphat Joram , as hooar Joram Ozias .

text: And Ozias begat Joatham ; and Joatham begat Achaz ; and Achaz begat Ezekias ;
text2: As hooar Ozias Joatham , as hooar Joatham Achaz , as hooar Achaz Ezekias .

text: And Ezekias begat Manasses ; and Manasses begat Amon ; and Amon begat Josias ;
text2: As hooar Ezekias Manasses , as hooar Manasses Amon , as hooar Amon Josias .

text: And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren , about the time they were carried away to Babylon :
text2: As hooar Josias Jechonias as e vraaraghyn , mysh traa yn chappeeys Babylonagh .

text: And after they were brought to Babylon , Jechonias begat Salathiel ; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel ;
text2: As rish earish yn chappeeys Babylon agh hooar Jechonias Salathiel , as hooar Salathiel Zorobabel .

text: And Zorobabel begat Abiud ; and Abiud begat Eliakim ; and Eliakim begat Azor ;
text2: As hooar Zorobabel Abiud , as hooar Abiud Eliakim , as hooar Eliakim Azor .

text: And Azor begat Sadoc ; and Sadoc begat Achim ; and Achim begat Eliud ;
text2: As hooar Azor Sadoc , as hooar Sadoc Achim , as hooar Achim Eliud .

text: And Eliud begat Eleazar ; and Eleazar begat Matthan ; and Matthan begat Jacob ;
text2: As hooar Eliud Eliazar , as hooar Eliazar Matthan , as hooar Matthan Jacob .

text: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary , of whom was born Jesus , who is called Christ .
text2: As hooar Jacob Joseph sheshey Voirrey , j ' eeish ruggyr Yeesey , ta enmyssit Creest .

text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations ; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations ; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ are fourteen generations .
text2: Myr shen ta ooilley ny sheelogheyn veih Abraham gys David , kiare sheelogheyn jeig : as veih David derrey ' n chappeeys ayns Babylon , kiare sheelogheyn jeig : as veih ' n chappeeys ayns Babylon derrey Creest kiare sheelogheyn jeig .

text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise : When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph , before they came together , she was found with child of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Nish shoh myr haink ( Yeesey ) Creest er y theihll : Erreish da e voir Moirrey ve nasht rish Joseph , roish my daink ad dy vaghey cooidjagh , v ' ee ry - akin dy ve corrym liorish yn Spyrryd Noo .

text: Then Joseph her husband , being a just man , and not willing to make her a publick example , was minded to put her away privily .
text2: As myr va Joseph e sheshey ny ghooinney cairal , as neu - wooiagh dy choyrt ee gys nearey foshlit , v ' eh smooinaghtyn dy scarrey

text: But while he thought on these things , behold , the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream , saying , Joseph , thou son of David , fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife : for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Agh choud as va ny reddyn shoh er e aigney , cur - my - ner haink ainle y Chiarn huggey ayns ashlish , gra , Yoseph , vac Ghavid , ny bee aggle ort dy ghoaill hood Moirrey dty ven : son shen t ' er ny ghientyn aynjee , te jeh ' n Spyrryd Noo .

text: And she shall bring forth a son , and thou shalt call his name JESUS : for he shall save his people from their sins .
text2: As ver ee mac son y theihll , as nee oo genmys eh Yeesey , son sauee eh e phobble veih nyn beccaghyn .

text: Now all this was done , that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet , saying ,
text2: ( Shoh myr va er ny chooilleeney ooilley ny loayr y Chiarn liorish y phadeyr , gra

text: Behold , a virgin shall be with child , and shall bring forth a son , and they shall call his name Emmanuel , which being interpreted is , God with us .
text2: Cur - my - ner nee moidyn gientyn , as ver ee mac son y theihll , as nee ad genmys eh Emmanuel , ta shen dy ghra , Jee marin . )

text: Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him , and took unto him his wife :
text2: Tra va Joseph eisht er n ' irree veih cadley , ren eh myr va ainle y Chiarn er chur roish , as ghow eh thie e ven :

text: And knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son : and he called his name JESUS .
text2: As cha row veg echey dy yannoo r ' ee , derrey hug ee e ynrycan mac son y theihll , as denmys eh yn ennym echey Yeesey .

text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king , behold , there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem ,
text2: Nish tra rug Yeesey ayns Bethlehem dy Yudea , rish lhing ree Herod , cur - my - ner haink deiney - creeney veih ' n shiar gys Jerusalem ,

text: Saying , Where is he that is born King of the Jews ? for we have seen his star in the east , and are come to worship him .
text2: Gra , Cre vel ree ny Hewnyn t ' er jeet er y theihll ? son honnick shin y rollage echey ayns y shiar , as ta shin er jeet dy chur ooashley da .

text: When Herod the king had heard these things , he was troubled , and all Jerusalem with him .
text2: Tra cheayll ree Herod shoh , v ' eh dy mooar seaghnit , as ooilley Jerusalem marish .

text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together , he demanded of them where Christ should be born .
text2: As tra v ' eh er symney cooidjagh ooilley ny ard - saggyrtyn , as scrudeyryn y phobble , denee eh jeu cre ' n raad va Creest dy heet er y theihll .

text: And they said unto him , In Bethlehem of Judaea : for thus it is written by the prophet ,
text2: As dooyrt adsyn rish , Ayns Bethlehem dy Yudea : son shoh myr te scruit liorish y phadeyr :

text: And thou Bethlehem , in the land of Juda , art not the least among the princes of Juda : for out of thee shall come a Governor , that shall rule my people Israel .
text2: As uss Vethlehem ayns cheer Yudea , cha nee oo sloo ta mastey princeyn Yuda : son assyd ' s hig Kiannoort nee reill my phobble Israel .

text: Then Herod , when he had privily called the wise men , inquired of them diligently what time the star appeared .
text2: Eisht hug Herod fys follit er ny deiney creeney , as deysht eh ad dy imneagh mychione y traa haink yn rollage rish .

text: And he sent them to Bethlehem , and said , Go and search diligently for the young child ; and when ye have found him , bring me word again , that I may come and worship him also .
text2: As hug eh ad gys Bethlehem , gra , Immee - jee , as shir - jee magh dy jeidjagh son y lhiannoo , as tra vees shiu er gheddyn magh eh , tar - jee lesh fys hym ' s , dy voddym ' s neesht cheet as ooashley ' choyrt da .

text: When they had heard the king , they departed ; and , lo , the star , which they saw in the east , went before them , till it came and stood over where the young child was .
text2: Erreish daue v ' er chlashtyn y ree , jimmee ad rhymboo , as cur - my - ner hie yn rollage honnick ad ayns y shiar er e toshiaght roue , derrey haink ee , as hass ee erskyn yn ynnyd raad va ' n lhiannoo .

text: When they saw the star , they rejoiced with exceeding great joy .
text2: Tra honnick ad y rollage , va boggey erskyn - towse orroo .

text: And when they were come into the house , they saw the young child with Mary his mother , and fell down , and worshipped him : and when they had opened their treasures , they presented unto him gifts ; gold , and frankincense , and myrrh .
text2: As goll stiagh ' sy thie , hooar ad y lhiannoo marish Moirrey e voir , as gliooney sheese , hug ad ooashley da as fosley ny tashtaghyn oc , heb ad giootyn da ; airh , as frankincense , as myrrh .

text: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod , they departed into their own country another way .
text2: As myr va Jee er chur raaue daue ayns ashlish , gyn ad dy hyndaa gys Herod , ghow ad raad elley gys nyn jeer hene .

text: And when they were departed , behold , the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream , saying , Arise , and take the young child and his mother , and flee into Egypt , and be thou there until I bring thee word : for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him .
text2: As tra v ' ad er n ' immeeaght , cur - my - ner haink ainle y Chiarn gys Joseph ayns ashlish , gra , Trog ort , gow yn lhiannoo as e voir , cosne royd gys Egypt , as fuirree ayns shen derrey ver - yms fys hood : son shirree Herod y lhiannoo dy stroie eh .

text: When he arose , he took the young child and his mother by night , and departed into Egypt :
text2: Eisht dirree eh , as ghow eh yn lhiannoo , as e voir ayns yn oie , as hie eh roish er - chea gys Egypt :

text: And was there until the death of Herod : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet , saying , Out of Egypt have I called my son .
text2: As shen - y raad v ' eh derrey baase Herod : as shoh myr va cooilleenit shen loayr y Chiarn liorish y phadeyr , gra , Magh ass Egypt deie mee er my vac .

text: Then Herod , when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men , was exceeding wroth , and sent forth , and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem , and in all the coasts thereof , from two years old and under , according to the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men .
text2: Eisht Herod toiggal dy row eh mollit liorish ny deiney - creeney , v ' eh erskyn - towse eulyssagh , as hug eh magh sarey , as varr eh ooilley ny lhiennoo - mec v ' ayns Bethlehem , as ayns ooilley ny ardjyn shen , veih daa vlein dy eash as fo , corrym rish y traa v ' eh dy imneagh er vriaght jeh ny deiney creeney .

text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet , saying ,
text2: Shen y traa va cooilleenit ny va loayrit liorish Jeremy yn phadeyr , gra ,

text: In Rama was there a voice heard , lamentation , and weeping , and great mourning , Rachel weeping for her children , and would not be comforted , because they are not .
text2: Ayns Rama va eam treih er ny chlashtyn , yllaghey as keayney , as dobberan hrimshagh , Rachel keayney son e cloan , as gobbal dy ve er ny gherjaghey , er - yn - oyr nagh row ad er - mayrn .

text: But when Herod was dead , behold , an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt ,
text2: Agh lurg baase Herod , cur - my - ner haink ainle y Chiarn ayns ashlish gys Joseph ayns Egypt ,

text: Saying , Arise , and take the young child and his mother , and go into the land of Israel : for they are dead which sought the young child ' s life .
text2: Gra , Irree , as gow yn lhiannoo as e voir , as immee gys cheer Israel : son t ' adsyn marroo va shleeuit er bioys y lhiannoo .

text: And he arose , and took the young child and his mother , and came into the land of Israel .
text2: As dirree eh , as ghow eh yn lhiannoo as e voir , as haink eh gys cheer Israel .

text: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod , he was afraid to go thither : notwithstanding , being warned of God in a dream , he turned aside into the parts of Galilee :
text2: Agh clashtyn dy row Archelaus reill ayns Judea , ayns ynnyd e ayr Herod , va aggle er dy gholl gys shen : agh myr va Jee er chur roish ayns ashlish , hyndaa eh gys ardjyn Ghalilee .

text: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets , He shall be called a Nazarene .
text2: As jimmee eh dy chummal ayns ard - valley enmyssit Nazareth : as shoh myr va cooilleenit shen loayr ny phadeyryn , Bee eh enmyssit ny Nazarene .

text: In those days came John the Baptist , preaching in the wilderness of Judaea ,
text2: Ayns ny laghyn shen haink Ean Bashtey , preacheil ayns faasagh Yudea ,

text: And saying , Repent ye : for the kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: As gra , Gow - jee arrys : son ta reeriaght Yee er gerrey .

text: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias , saying , The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Son shoh eshyn va loayrit jeh liorish y phadeyr Esaias , gra , Coraa fer geamagh ayns yn aasagh , Kiartee - jee raad y Chiarn , jean - jee ny cassanyn echey jeeragh .

text: And the same John had his raiment of camel ' s hair , and a leathern girdle about his loins ; and his meat was locusts and wild honey .
text2: As v ' ec Ean cheddin coamrey dy fynney chamel , as cryss liare mysh e veeghyn ; as va e veaghey locustyn as mill feie .

text: Then went out to him Jerusalem , and all Judaea , and all the region round about Jordan ,
text2: Eisht hie magh huggey Jerusalem as ooilley Judea , as Ooilley yn cheer mygeayrt Jordan .

text: And were baptized of him in Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: As goaill - rish nyn beccaghyn v ' ad er nyn mashtey liorish ayns Jordan .

text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism , he said unto them , O generation of vipers , who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
text2: Agh tra honnick eh ymmodee jeh ny Phariseeyn as ny Sadduceeyn cheet gys e vashtey , dooyrt eh roo , O shiuish heeloghe dy ard - nieughyn , quoi t ' er chur raaue diu dy hea veih yn jymmoose ta ry - heet ?

text: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance :
text2: Cur - jee magh nish er - y - fa shen messyn cooie dy arrys .

text: And think not to say within yourselves , We have Abraham to our father : for I say unto you , that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham .
text2: As ny smooinee - jee dy ghra , riu hene , Ta Abraham ain son nyn ayr : son ta mee gra riu , dy vel Jee pooaral eer jeh ny claghyn shoh dy hroggal seose cloan da Abraham

text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees : therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: As nish hene ta ' n teigh er ny choyrt gys fraue ny biljyn : shen - y - fa ta dy chooilley villey nagh vel gymmyrkey magh mess mie , dy ve giarit sheese as tilgit ayns yn aile .

text: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance : but he that cometh after me is mightier than I , whose shoes I am not worthy to bear : he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost , and with fire :
text2: Ta mish dy jarroo bashtey shiu lesh ushtey gys arrys : agh t ' eshyn ta cheet my yei ny s ' pooaral ny mish , ny braagyn echey cha vel mee feeu dy ymmyrkey : bashtee eshyn shiu lesh y Spyrryd Noo as lesh aile .

text: Whose fan is in his hand , and he will throughly purge his floor , and gather his wheat into the garner ; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire .
text2: Ta ' n cleayst echey ayns e laue , as nee eh dy bollagh e laare - vooie y ghlenney , as gowee eh e churnaght stiagh ayns e hie - tashtee : agh loshtee eh yn choau lesh aile nagh bee er ny vooghey .

text: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John , to be baptized of him .
text2: Eisht haink Yeesey veih Galilee gys Jordan , dy ve bashtit liorish Ean .

text: But John forbad him , saying , I have need to be baptized of thee , and comest thou to me ?
text2: Agh va Ean noi shen , gra , Ta feme aym ' s dy ve er my vashtey liort ' s , as vel uss cheet hym ' s ?

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Suffer it to be so now : for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness . Then he suffered him .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh rish , Cur raad dou nish : son shoh myr te cooie dooin dy chooilley chairys y chooilleeney . Eisht lhig eh da .

text: And Jesus , when he was baptized , went up straightway out of the water : and , lo , the heavens were opened unto him , and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove , and lighting upon him :
text2: As lurg da Yeesey ve bashtit , hie eh seose jeeragh ass yn ushtey : as cur - my - ner va ny niaughyn er nyn vosley er - e - skyn , as honnick eh Spyrryd Yee cheet neose myr calmane , as soie er .

text: And lo a voice from heaven , saying , This is my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: As cur - my - ner , coraa veih niau , gra , Shoh my vac ennoil , jeh ta mee dy mooar soiaghey .

text: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil .
text2: Eisht va Yeesey er ny leeideil liorish Spyrryd Yee gys yn aasagh , dy v ' er ny violaghey liorish y drogh - spyrryd .

text: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights , he was afterward an hungred .
text2: As tra v ' eh er drostey da - eed laa as da - eed oie v ' eh ny lurg shen accryssagh .

text: And when the tempter came to him , he said , If thou be the Son of God , command that these stones be made bread .
text2: As haink y mioleyder huggey , gra , My she mac Yee oo , cur sarey da ny claghyn shoh dy ve jeant nyn arran .

text: But he answered and said , It is written , Man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God .
text2: Agh dreggyr eshyn , gra , Te , scruit , Cha nee liorish arran ny lomarcan nee dooinney beaghey , agh liorish dy chooilley ockle ta cheet magh ass beeal Yee .

text: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city , and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple ,
text2: Eisht ghow y drogh - spyrryd lesh seose eh gys yn ard - valley casherick , as hoie eh eh er beinn toor syrjey yn chiamble ,

text: And saith unto him , If thou be the Son of God , cast thyself down : for it is written , He shall give his angels charge concerning thee : and in their hands they shall bear thee up , lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , My she Mac Yee oo tilg oo hene sheese : son te scruit , Ver eh currym da e ainleyn my - dty - chione , as ayns nyn laueyn nee ad oo y ymmyrkey , nagh bwoaill oo ec traa erbee dty chass noi chlagh .

text: Jesus said unto him , It is written again , Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Te scruit myrgeddin , Cha jean oo yn Chiarn dty Yee y violaghey .

text: Again , the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain , and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world , and the glory of them ;
text2: Reesht hug y drogh - spyrryd lesh eh seose er slieau feer ard , as yeeagh eh da ooilley reeriaghtyn y theihll as y ghloyr oc :

text: And saith unto him , All these things will I give thee , if thou wilt fall down and worship me .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Ooilley shoh ver - ym ' s dhyt ' s , my huittys oo sheese , as ooashley chur dou .

text: Then saith Jesus unto him , Get thee hence , Satan : for it is written , Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God , and him only shalt thou serve .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish , Ass my enish oo , Noid - ny - hanmey : son te scruit , Ver oo ooashley da ' n Chiarn dty Yee , as eshyn ynrycan nee oo shirveish .

text: Then the devil leaveth him , and , behold , angels came and ministered unto him .
text2: Eisht daag y drogh - spyrryd eh , as cur - my - ner haink ainleyn as ren ad shirveish er .

text: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison , he departed into Galilee ;
text2: Nish tra cheayll Yeesey dy row Ean ny phryssoonagh , jimmee eh dy lhiattee gys Galilee .

text: And leaving Nazareth , he came and dwelt in Capernaum , which is upon the sea coast , in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim :
text2: As faagail Nazareth , haink eh dy chummal ayns Capernaum , ta rish oirr ny marrey , rish ardjyn Zabulon as Nephthalim :

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying ,
text2: As shoh myr va cooilleenit shen ny loayr Esaias yn phadeyr , gra

text: The land of Zabulon , and the land of Nephthalim , by the way of the sea , beyond Jordan , Galilee of the Gentiles ;
text2: Thalloo Zabulon , as thalloo Nephthalim , er slyst ny marrey , cheu elley dy Yordan , Galilee ny Ashoonee :

text: The people which sat in darkness saw great light ; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up .
text2: Ta ' n pobble va nyn soie ayns dorraghys , er vakin soilshey mooar : as orroosyn va nyn soie ayns cheer as scadoo ' n vaaish , ta soilshey er n ' irree seose .

text: From that time Jesus began to preach , and to say , Repent : for the kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: Veih yn traa shen ren Yeesey toshiaght dy phreacheil , as dy ghra , Gow - jee arrys , son ta reeriaght niau er - gerrey .

text: And Jesus , walking by the sea of Galilee , saw two brethren , Simon called Peter , and Andrew his brother , casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: As myr va Yeesey shooyl liorish keayn Ghalilee , honnick eh daa vraar , Simon va enmyssit Peddyr , as Andreays e vraar , cur magh lieen ' sy cheayn : ( son v ' ad nyn eeasteyryn )

text: And he saith unto them , Follow me , and I will make you fishers of men .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Eiyr - jee orrym ' s , as neem ' s shiu nyn eeasteyryn dy gheiney .

text: And they straightway left their nets , and followed him .
text2: As chelleeragh daag ad nyn lieenteenyn , as deiyr ad er .

text: And going on from thence , he saw other two brethren , James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , in a ship with Zebedee their father , mending their nets ; and he called them .
text2: As goll er e hoshiaght veih shen , honnick eh daa vraar elley , Jamys mac Zebedee as Ean e vraar , ayns lhong marish Zebedee nyn ayr , karraghey nyn lieen : as deie eh orroo .

text: And they immediately left the ship and their father , and followed him .
text2: As chelleeragh daag ad y lhong as nyn ayr , as deiyr ad er .

text: And Jesus went about all Galilee , teaching in their synagogues , and preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people .
text2: As hie Yeesey mygeayrt ooilley Galilee , gynsaghey ayns nyn gialteenyn , as preacheil sushtal y reeriaght , as lheihys dy chooilley hingys , as dy chooilley ghoghan mastey ' n pobble .

text: And his fame went throughout all Syria : and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments , and those which were possessed with devils , and those which were lunatick , and those that had the palsy ; and he healed them .
text2: As hie goo jeh magh trooid ooilley Syria : as hug ad lhieu huggey ooilley ny aslayntee , fo doghanyn as pianyn , adsyn va seaghnit lesh drogh - spyrrydyn , sleih ass nyn geeayl , as an - lheiltee , as ren eh ad y lheihys .

text: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee , and from Decapolis , and from Jerusalem , and from Judaea , and from beyond Jordan .
text2: As deiyr er chaglym mooar dy leih veih Galilee , as Decapolis , as Jerusalem , as Judea , as veih cheu elley dy Yordan .

text: And seeing the multitudes , he went up into a mountain : and when he was set , his disciples came unto him :
text2: As fakin lheid ny earrooyn dy leih , hie eh seose er slieau : as tra v ' eh er hoie sheese , haink e ynseydee huggey

text: And he opened his mouth , and taught them , saying ,
text2: As hrog eh seose e choraa , as dynsee eh ad , gra ,

text: Blessed are the poor in spirit : for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Bannit t ' adsyn ta imlee ayns spyrryd : son lhieusyn reeriaght niau .

text: Blessed are they that mourn : for they shall be comforted .
text2: Bannit t ' adsyn ta dobberan : son bee ad er nyn gherjaghey .

text: Blessed are the meek : for they shall inherit the earth .
text2: Bannit t ' adsyn ta meen surransagh : son bee yn thalloo oc ayns eiraght .

text: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness : for they shall be filled .
text2: Bannit t ' adsyn ta accryssagh as paagh lurg yn ynrickys : son bee ad er nyn yannoo magh .

text: Blessed are the merciful : for they shall obtain mercy .
text2: Bannit ta ' n vooinjer vyghinagh : son bee myghin er ny hoilshaghey daue .

text: Blessed are the pure in heart : for they shall see God .
text2: Bannit t ' adsyn ta glen ayns cree : son ver ad Jee my - ner .

text: Blessed are the peacemakers : for they shall be called the children of God .
text2: Bannit t ' adsyn ta tayrn sleih gys shee : son bee ad enmyssit nyn gloan dy Yee .

text: Blessed are they which are persecuted for righteousness ' sake : for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Bannit t ' adsyn ta surranse tranlaase er graih cairys : son lhieusyn reeriaght niau .

text: Blessed are ye , when men shall revile you , and persecute you , and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely , for my sake .
text2: Bannit ta shiuish tra vees shiu oltooanit , as tranlaasit , as dy chooilley ghrogh - ghoo currit ass nyn lieh dy aggairagh er y choontey aym ' s .

text: Rejoice , and be exceeding glad : for great is your reward in heaven : for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you .
text2: Gow - jee boggey , as bee - jee erskyn towse gennal : son s ' mooar ta nyn leagh ayns niau : son shoh myr ren ad tranlaase er ny phadeyryn va rhymbiu .

text: Ye are the salt of the earth : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be salted ? it is thenceforth good for nothing , but to be cast out , and to be trodden under foot of men .
text2: Shiuish sollan y thallooin : agh my ta ' n sollan er choayl e vlass , kys hig e vree ayn reesht ? cha vel ymmyd erbee sodjey ny chour , agh dy ve tilgit magh , as stampit fo cassyn deiney .

text: Ye are the light of the world . A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid .
text2: Shiuish soilshey yn theihll Cha vod ard - valley ta soit er cronk ve follit .

text: Neither do men light a candle , and put it under a bushel , but on a candlestick ; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house .
text2: Chamoo ta sleih foaddey cainle , as dy choyrt ee fo saagh ; agh ayns cainleyr , as t ' ee cur soilshey da ' n slane lught - thie .

text: Let your light so shine before men , that they may see your good works , and glorify your Father which is in heaven .
text2: Lhig da ' n soilshey euish myr shen soilshean fenish deiney , dy vod ad fakin ny obbraghyn mie eu , as gloyr y choyrt da nyn ayr t ' ayns niau .

text: Think not that I am come to destroy the law , or the prophets : I am not come to destroy , but to fulfil .
text2: Ny smooinee - jee dy daink mish dy chur naardey yn leigh as ny phadeyryn : cha nee dy chur naardey haink mee , agh dy chooilleeney .

text: For verily I say unto you , Till heaven and earth pass , one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law , till all be fulfilled .
text2: Son dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Derrey nee yn aer as yn ooir lheie ersooyl , cha bee un ockle , ny ' n floag sloo er ny ghoaill veih ' n leigh , derrey vees ooilley jeant mie .

text: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments , and shall teach men so , he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven : but whosoever shall do and teach them , the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Quoi - erbee er - y - fa shen vrishys unnane jeh ny annaghyn sloo shoh , as ynsys myr shen , bee eh enmyssit yn fer sloo ayns reeriaght niau : agh quoi erbee nee nyn yannoo as nyn ynsaghey , bee eh enmyssit mooar ayns reeriaght niau .

text: For I say unto you , That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees , ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Son ta mee gra riu , Mannagh bee yn ynrickys euish erskyn ynrickys ny Scrudeyryn as ny Phariseeyn , cha vod shiu er aght erbee goll stiagh ayns reeriaght niau .

text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time , Thou shalt not kill ; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment :
text2: Ta shiu er chlashtyn dy row eh er ny ghra rish nyn shenn - ayryn , Cha jean oc dunverys : as quoi - erbee nee dunverys , hig eh fo kerraghey yn vriwnys .

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment : and whosoever shall say to his brother , Raca , shall be in danger of the council : but whosoever shall say , Thou fool , shall be in danger of hell fire .
text2: Agh ta mish gra riuish , Quoi - erbee ta fargagh rish e vraar gyn oyr , dy jig eshyn neesht fo kerraghey yn vriwnys : as quoi erbee jir rish e vraar , Raca : dy jig eh fo briwnys yn ard - whuaiyl : agh quoi - erbee jir , Uss ommydan , dy bee eh ayns gaue aile niurin ,

text: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar , and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee ;
text2: Shen - y - fa tra hebbys oo dty oural ec yn altar , my chooinys oo ayns shen dy vel nhee erbee ec dty vraar dt ' oi

text: Leave there thy gift before the altar , and go thy way ; first be reconciled to thy brother , and then come and offer thy gift .
text2: Faag ayns shen dty oural roish yn altar , as immee royd , jean coardail rish dty vraar hoshiaght , as eisht tar , as cheb dty oural .

text: Agree with thine adversary quickly , whiles thou art in the way with him ; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and thou be cast into prison .
text2: Coard dy tappee rishyn ta streeu rhyt , choud as vees shiu goll cooidjagh er y raad , er - aggle dy der eshyn oo fo laue yn vriw , as dy der yn briw oo fo currym y tidoor , as dy bee oo tilgit ayns pryssoon .

text: Verily I say unto thee , Thou shalt by no means come out thence , till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , Nagh jig oo magh ass shen , derrey t ' ou er n ' eeck yn farling s ' jerree .

text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time , Thou shalt not commit adultery :
text2: Ta shiu er chlashtyn dy row eh er ny ghra rish nyn shenn - ayryn , Cha brish oo poosey .

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart .
text2: Agh ta mish gra riu , Quoi - erbee ta jeeaghyn er ben , dy chur saynt j ' ee , dy vel eh er vrishey poosey r ' ee hannah ayns e chree .

text: And if thy right eye offend thee , pluck it out , and cast it from thee : for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish , and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell .
text2: As my ta dty hooill yesh dy dty hayrn gys peccah , pluck assyd ee , as tilg void ee : son te ny share dhyt unnane jeh dty hooillyn y choayl , na dty slane corp dy ve tilgit ayns niurin .

text: And if thy right hand offend thee , cut if off , and cast it from thee : for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish , and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell .
text2: As my ta dty laue yesh dy dty hayrn gys peccah , giare jeed , as tilg void ee : son te ny share dhyt unnane jeh dty oltyn y choayl , na dty slane corp dy ve tilgit ayns niurin .

text: It hath been said , Whosoever shall put away his wife , let him give her a writing of divorcement :
text2: Ve er ny ghra , Quoi - erbee ver e ven voish , lhig da screeuyn - scarree y chur jee .

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever shall put away his wife , saving for the cause of fornication , causeth her to commit adultery : and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery .
text2: Agh ta mish gra riu , Quoi - erbee scarrys rish e ven , agh son oyr maarderys , dy vel eh cur urree poosey y vrishey : as quoi - erbee phoosys ish ta scart , t ' eh ny vaarderagh .

text: Again , ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time , Thou shalt not forswear thyself , but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths :
text2: Myrgeddin ta shiu er chlashtyn dy row eh er ny ghra rish nyn shenn - ayryn , Cha jean oo loo - oaiagh y ghoaill , agh cooilleenee oo gys y Chiarn dty vreearaghyn .

text: But I say unto you , Swear not at all ; neither by heaven ; for it is God ' s throne :
text2: Agh ta mish gra riu , Ny loo - jee er aght erbee ; edyr liorish niau , son she stoyl - reeoil Yee eh :

text: Nor by the earth ; for it is his footstool : neither by Jerusalem ; for it is the city of the great King .
text2: Ny liorish y thalloo , son shen stoyl e choshey : ny liorish Jerusalem , son shen ard - valley yn Ard - ree .

text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head , because thou canst not make one hair white or black .
text2: Chamoo looys oo liorish dty chione , er - yn - oyr nagh vod oo un renaig y yannoo bane ny doo .

text: But let your communication be , Yea , yea ; Nay , nay : for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil .
text2: Agh lhig da ' n ghlare eu ve , She , she , Cha nee , cha nee : son cre - erbee ta harrish shoh , te cheet veih yn olk .

text: Ye have heard that it hath been said , An eye for an eye , and a tooth for a tooth :
text2: Ta shiu er chlashtyn dy row eh er ny ghra , Sooill son sooill , as feeackyl son feeackyl .

text: But I say unto you , That ye resist not evil : but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek , turn to him the other also .
text2: Agh ta mish gra riu , Ny shir - jee aggair y chooilleeney : agh quoi - erbee woaillys oo er y lieckan yesh , chyndaa huggey yn lieckan elley .

text: And if any man will sue thee at the law , and take away thy coat , let him have thy cloke also .
text2: As my ta fer erbee dy dty eignagh ec y leigh , as goaill ersooyl dty chooat , lhig dty chloagey lesh myrgeddin .

text: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile , go with him twain .
text2: As quoi - erbee chionnys ort dy gholl un veeley marish , gow marish jees .

text: Give to him that asketh thee , and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away .
text2: Cur dasyn ta jannoo aghin hood , as veihsyn ta shirrey geeasaght void , ny chyndaa ersooyl .

text: Ye have heard that it hath been said , Thou shalt love thy neighbour , and hate thine enemy .
text2: Ta shiu er chlashtyn dy row eh er ny ghra , Ver oo graih da dty naboo , as feoh da dty noid .

text: But I say unto you , Love your enemies , bless them that curse you , do good to them that hate you , and pray for them which despitefully use you , and persecute you ;
text2: Agh ta mish gra riu , Bee - jee dooie da nyn noidyn , bannee - jee adsyn ta gwee mollaght diu , jean - jee mie dauesyn ta cur dwoaie diu , as gow - jee padjer er nyn son ocsyn ta dy goanlyssagh jannoo tranlaase erriu :

text: That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven : for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good , and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust .
text2: Dy vod shiu ve cloan nyn Ayr t ' ayns niau , son t ' eshyn cur er e ghrian girree er mie as sie , as cur fliaghey neose er y vooinjer chairagh as neu - chairagh .

text: For if ye love them which love you , what reward have ye ? do not even the publicans the same ?
text2: Son my ta shiu graihagh orroosyn ta graihagh erriuish , cre ' n leagh ta nyn gour ? nagh vel eer ny publicanee jannoo yn lheid cheddin ?

text: And if ye salute your brethren only , what do ye more than others ? do not even the publicans so ?
text2: My she da nyn mraaraghyn ny lomarcan ta shiu coyrt oltaghey - bea , cre smoo ta shiu dy yannoo na feallagh elley ? nagh vel ny eer publicanee jannoo myr shen ?

text: Be ye therefore perfect , even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect .
text2: Bee - jee shiuish er - y - fa shen slane - ynrick , eer myr ta nyn Ayr t ' ayns niau slane - ynrick .

text: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men , to be seen of them : otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven .
text2: Gow - jee tastey , nagh jean shiu nyn ghiastyllys fenish deiney , dy ve er ny akin lioroo : er - nonney cha vow shiu leagh veih ' n Ayr eu t ' ayns niau .

text: Therefore when thou doest thine alms , do not sound a trumpet before thee , as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets , that they may have glory of men . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: Shen - y - fa tra t ' ou jannoo dty ghiastyllys , ny jean cayrn y heidey royd , myr ny crauee oalsey ayns ny margaghyn , as ayns ny straidyn , er - chee cosney moylley ' n theay . Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Shen nyn leagh .

text: But when thou doest alms , let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth :
text2: Agh tra t ' ou uss jannoo dty ghiastyllys , ny lhig da fys y ve ec dty laue - chiare cre ta dty laue yesh dy yannoo :

text: That thine alms may be in secret : and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly .
text2: Dy vod dty yeirk ve follit : as nee dty Ayr ta fakin ny ta jeant dy follit , dty leagh y chur dhyt dy foshlit .

text: And when thou prayest , thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are : for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets , that they may be seen of men . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: As tra vees oo goaill padjer , cha jean oo myr ny crauee - oalsey : son shynney lhieu syn shassoo seose ayns ny margaghyn , as ayns king ny straidyn dy ghoaill padjer , er - chee dy v ' er ny akin liorish deiney . Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy vel ad er gheddyn nyn leagh .

text: But thou , when thou prayest , enter into thy closet , and when thou hast shut thy door , pray to thy Father which is in secret ; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly .
text2: Agh uss , tra t ' ou goaill padjer , immee stiagh ayns dty hiamyr ; as dooney dty ghorrys , guee gys dty Ayr dy follit , as nee dty Ayr ta fakin ny ta jeant dy follit , leagh y chur dhyt dy foshlit .

text: But when ye pray , use not vain repetitions , as the heathen do : for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking .
text2: As ayns nyn badjeryn , ny gow - jee lhieu harrish as harrish myr ny Ashoonee : son er - lhieu dy vow ad clashtyn liorish nyn ymmodee goan fardalagh .

text: Be not ye therefore like unto them : for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of , before ye ask him .
text2: Ny bee - jee shiuish er - y fa shen goll roosyn : son ta fys ec nyn Ayr cre ta nyn ymmyrch , roish my jean shiu aghin huggey

text: After this manner therefore pray ye : Our Father which art in heaven , Hallowed be thy name .
text2: Shen y fa er yn aght shoh gow - jee padjer : Ayr ain t ' ayns niau , Casherick dy row dty ennym .

text: Thy kingdom come . Thy will be done in earth , as it is in heaven .
text2: Dy jig dty reeriaght . Dty aigney dy row jeant er y thalloo , myr te ayns niau .

text: Give us this day our daily bread .
text2: Cur dooin nyn arran jiu as gagh laa .

text: And forgive us our debts , as we forgive our debtors .
text2: As leih dooin nyn loghtyn , myr ta shin leih dauesyn ta jannoo loghtyn nyn ' oi .

text: And lead us not into temptation , but deliver us from evil : For thine is the kingdom , and the power , and the glory , for ever . Amen .
text2: As ny leeid shin ayns miolagh , agh livrey shin veih olk : Son lhiat ' s y reeriaght , as y phooar , as y ghloyr , son dy bragh , Amen .

text: For if ye forgive men their trespasses , your heavenly Father will also forgive you :
text2: Son my leihys shiuish da deiney nyn loghtyn , leihee nyn Ayr flaunyssagh myrgeddin diuish .

text: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses , neither will your Father forgive your trespasses .
text2: Agh mannagh leihee shiuish da deiney nyn loghtyn , cha jean yn Ayr eu nyn loghtyn y leih diuish .

text: Moreover when ye fast , be not , as the hypocrites , of a sad countenance : for they disfigure their faces , that they may appear unto men to fast . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: As tra vees shiu trostey , ny bee - jee groymagh myr ny crauee - oalsey , son t ' adsyn caghlaa cummey nyn eddin , er - chee deiney dy chur tastey da ' n trostey oc . Ta mee shickyrys diu , dy nee shoh ( ooilley ) nyn leagh .

text: But thou , when thou fastest , anoint thine head , and wash thy face ;
text2: Agh uss , tra t ' ou trostey , jean dty chione y ooillaghey , as dty eddin y oonlaghey :

text: That thou appear not unto men to fast , but unto thy Father which is in secret : and thy Father , which seeth in secret , shall reward thee openly .
text2: Nagh bee oo ry - akin liorish deiney dy hrostey , agh liorish dty Ayr t ' ayns folliaght : as nee dty Ayr ta fakin ayns folliaght , uss y chooilleeney dy foshlit .

text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth , where moth and rust doth corrupt , and where thieves break through and steal :
text2: Ny stoyr - jee seose berchys diu hene er y thalloo , raad ta ' n lhemeen as y mergey cur - mow , as raad ta maarlee brishey stiagh as geid :

text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt , and where thieves do not break through nor steal :
text2: Agh stoyr - jee seose berchys diu hene ayns niau , raad nagh vel y lhemeen ny ' n mergey cur mow , as raad nagh vel maarlee brishey stiagh as geid .

text: For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
text2: Son raad ta nyn stoyr , shen - y - raad vees y cree eu myrgeddin .

text: The light of the body is the eye : if therefore thine eye be single , thy whole body shall be full of light .
text2: Ta yn tooill soilshey yn chorp : shen - y - fa my ta ' n tooill gyn foill , bee soilshey ec ooilley dty chorp .

text: But if thine eye be evil , thy whole body shall be full of darkness . If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness , how great is that darkness !
text2: Agh my ta assee er dty hooill , bee dty slane corp ayns dorraghys . My ta ' n soilshey ta aynyd ' s er - y - fa shen ny ghorraghys , nagh mooar yn dorraghys eh !

text: No man can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: Cha vod dooinney erbee daa vainshter y hirveish : son edyr ver eh dwoaie da ' n derrey yeh , as graih da ' n jeh elley ; ny bee eh jeidjagh da ' n derrey yeh , ny soiaghey beg jeh ' n jeh elley . Cha vod shiu Jee as Mammon y hirveish .

text: Therefore I say unto you , Take no thought for your life , what ye shall eat , or what ye shall drink ; nor yet for your body , what ye shall put on . Is not the life more than meat , and the body than raiment ?
text2: Er - yn - oyr shoh ta mee gra riu , Ny bee Jee ro - imneagh son nyn mea , cre ee - ys , ny cre iu - ys shiu : ny foast son nyn girp cre ver shiu miu : Nagh vel y vea ny smoo dy ve soit jeh na ' n beaghey , as y corp na ' n coamrey ?

text: Behold the fowls of the air : for they sow not , neither do they reap , nor gather into barns ; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them . Are ye not much better than they ?
text2: Cur - jee my - ner eeanlee yn aer : son cha vel ad cuirr ny buinn , ny chymsaghey stiagh ayns soaltyn ; foast ta nyn Ayr flaunyssagh dyn meaghey ad . Nagh vel shiuish foddey share na adsyn ?

text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature ?
text2: Quoi jiuish liorish imnea erbee oddys un chubit y chur gys e yrjid hene ?

text: And why take ye thought for raiment ? Consider the lilies of the field , how they grow ; they toil not , neither do they spin :
text2: As cre ' n - fa ta shiu imneagh son coamraghyn ? Gow - jee tastey jeh lilleeyn ny magheragh kys t ' ad gaase ; cha vel ad tooilleil , chamoo t ' ad sneeu .

text: And yet I say unto you , That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these .
text2: As foast ta mee gra riu , nagh row Solomon hene ayns ooilley e ghloyr er ny choamrey myr unnane jeu shoh .

text: Wherefore , if God so clothe the grass of the field , which to day is , and to morrow is cast into the oven , shall he not much more clothe you , O ye of little faith ?
text2: My ta Jee er - y - fa shen myr shoh coamrey blaa ny magheragh , ta jiu ayn , as mairagh ceaut ayns yn oghe , nagh jean eh foddey smoo shiuish y choamrey , O gheiney faase chredjuagh ?

text: Therefore take no thought , saying , What shall we eat ? or , What shall we drink ? or , Wherewithal shall we be clothed ?
text2: Ny bee - jee er - y - fa shen imneagh , gra , Cre nee mayd gee ? ny cre nee mayd giu ? ny kys yiow mayd coamrey ?

text: ( For after all these things do the Gentiles seek : ) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things .
text2: ( Son lurg ooilley ny reddyn shoh ta ny Ashoonee imneagh ) agh ec yn Ayr flaunyssagh euish ta fys , dy vel shiu feme dy chooilley nhee jeu shoh .

text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God , and his righteousness ; and all these things shall be added unto you .
text2: Agh shir - jee hoshiaght reeriaght Yee as e chairys , as bee shiu jeant magh lesh ooilley ny reddyn shoh .

text: Take therefore no thought for the morrow : for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself . Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof .
text2: Ny bee - jee er - y - fa shen ayns imnea erbee son y laa mairagh , son tra hig y laa mairagh , hig e chiarail marish s ' lioar da ' n laa t ' ayn e heaghyn hene .

text: Judge not , that ye be not judged .
text2: Ny jean - jee briwnys , as cha bee shiu er nyn mriwnys .

text: For with what judgment ye judge , ye shall be judged : and with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you again .
text2: Son lesh y vriwnys cheddin ta shiuish briwnys , bee shiu hene er nyn mriwnys : as lesh y towse ta shiuish towse , bee eh er ny howse diu reesht .

text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye , but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye ?
text2: As cre ' n - fa t ' ou cronnaghey yn brinneen t ' ayns sooill dty vraarey , agh cha vel geill ayd da ' n darrag t ' ayns dty hooill hene ?

text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother , Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye ; and , behold , a beam is in thine own eye ?
text2: Ny kys jir oo rish dty vraar , Lhig dou yn brinneen y ghoaill ass dty hooill , as cur - my - ner ta darrag ayns dty hooill hene ?

text: Thou hypocrite , first cast out the beam out of thine own eye ; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother ' s eye .
text2: Er - crauee - oalsey , tilg hoshiaght yn darrag ass dty hooill hene ; as eisht nee oo dy baghtal fakin dy ghoaill yn brinneen ass sooill dty vraarey .

text: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs , neither cast ye your pearls before swine , lest they trample them under their feet , and turn again and rend you .
text2: Ny cur - jee shen ny ta casherick da ny moddee , chamoo hilgys shiu ny pearlyn eu roish muckyn , er - aggle dy stamp ad orroo fo chosh , as dy jyndaa ad reesht , as shiu y lhottey .

text: Ask , and it shall be given you ; seek , and ye shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened unto you :
text2: Yeearree - jee , as yiow shiu : shir - jee , as nee shiu feddyn : cronk - jee , as yiow shiu fosley .

text: For every one that asketh receiveth ; and he that seeketh findeth ; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened .
text2: Son ta dy chooilley unnane ta geearree , geddyn : as y fer ta shirrey feddyn : as dasyn ta cronkal , bee ' n dorrys er ny osley .

text: Or what man is there of you , whom if his son ask bread , will he give him a stone ?
text2: Ny quoi yn dooinney ny mast ' euish , ver clagh da e vac , my hirrys eh arran ?

text: Or if he ask a fish , will he give him a serpent ?
text2: Ny my hirrys eh eeast , der eh ard - nieu da ?

text: If ye then , being evil , know how to give good gifts unto your children , how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him ?
text2: Shen - y - fa my ta fys euish ta nyn beccee , kys dy choyrt giootyn mie da nyn gloan , cre woad smoo nee ' n Ayr eu t ' ayns niau nheeghyn mie y choyrt dauesyn ta jannoo aghin huggey .

text: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you , do ye even so to them : for this is the law and the prophets .
text2: Shen - y - fa dy chooilley nhee cre erbee bailliuish deiney dy yannoo riuish , jean - jee shiuish y lheid cheddin roosyn : son shoh yn leigh as ny phadeyryn

text: Enter ye in at the strait gate : for wide is the gate , and broad is the way , that leadeth to destruction , and many there be which go in thereat :
text2: Immee - jee stiagh er y ghiat coon ; son lhean ta ' n giat , as feayn ta ' n raad ta leeideil gys toyrt - mow , as shimmey ta goll er :

text: Because strait is the gate , and narrow is the way , which leadeth unto life , and few there be that find it .
text2: Er - yn - oyr dy nee chion ta ' n giat , as coon ta ' n raad ta leeideil gys bea , as s ' tiark ad ta dy haaghey eh .

text: Beware of false prophets , which come to you in sheep ' s clothing , but inwardly they are ravening wolves .
text2: Bee - jee er nyn dwoaie jeh phadeyryn foalsey , ta cheet hiu ayns coamrey keyrragh , agh cheu - sthie t ' ad nyn moddee - oaldey jollyssagh .

text: Ye shall know them by their fruits . Do men gather grapes of thorns , or figs of thistles ?
text2: Ver shiu enney orroo liorish nyn messyn . Vel mess y villey - feeyney er ny heiy jeh drineyn , ny mess y villey - figgagh jeh onnaneyn ?

text: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit ; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit .
text2: Myr shen ta dagh billey mie tilgey mess mie : agh ta drogh - villey tilgey drogh vess .

text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit , neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit .
text2: Cha vod billey mie drogh - vess y chur magh : ny drogh - villey mess mie .

text: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: Bee dy chooilley villey nagh vel gymmyrkey magh mess mie , giarit sheese , as ceaut ayns yn aile .

text: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them .
text2: Shen - y - fa liorish nyn messyn ver shiu enney orroo .

text: Not every one that saith unto me , Lord , Lord , shall enter into the kingdom of heaven ; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Cha nee dy chooilley unnane jir rhym ' s , Hiarn , Hiarn , hed stiagh er reeriaght niau : agh eshyn ta jannoo aigney my Ayrey t ' ayns niau .

text: Many will say to me in that day , Lord , Lord , have we not prophesied in thy name ? and in thy name have cast out devils ? and in thy name done many wonderful works ?
text2: Jir ymmodee rhym ' s ' sy laa shen , Hiarn , Hiarn , nagh vel shin er n ' yannoo phadeyrys ayns dt ' ennym ' s ? as ayns dt ' ennym er chastey drogh - spyrrydyn ? as ayns dt ' ennym er n ' yannoo ymmodee obbraghyn yindyssagh ?

text: And then will I profess unto them , I never knew you : depart from me , ye that work iniquity .
text2: As eisht neem ' s fockley - magh orroo , Cha row aym rieau ainjys erbee erriu : reue - jee voym , O shiuish ghrogh - yantee .

text: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine , and doeth them , I will liken him unto a wise man , which built his house upon a rock :
text2: Quoi - erbee er - y - fa shen ta clashtyn ad shoh my ghoan ' s , as jannoo ymmyd mie jeu soylee - ym eh gys dooinney creeney hrog e hie er creg :

text: And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house ; and it fell not : for it was founded upon a rock .
text2: As haink y fliaghey neose , as dhatt ny thooillaghyn , as heid ny geayghyn , as cheau ad er y thie shen : as cha huitt eh , son dy row yn undin echey er creg .

text: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine , and doeth them not , shall be likened unto a foolish man , which built his house upon the sand :
text2: As dy chooilley unnane ta clashtyn ad shoh my ghoan ' s , as nagh vel jannoo ymmyd mie jeu , bee eh er ny hoylaghey gys dooinney ommijagh , hrog e hie er y gheinnagh :

text: And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house ; and it fell : and great was the fall of it .
text2: As huitt y fliaghey , as dhatt ny thooillaghyn , as heid ny geayghyn , as cheau ad er y thie shen : as huitt eh , as s ' mooar va e lhieggey !

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had ended these sayings , the people were astonished at his doctrine :
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , erreish da Yeesey v ' er loayrt ny goan shoh , dy row yn pobble ayns ard - yindys jeh ' n ynsaghey echey .

text: For he taught them as one having authority , and not as the scribes .
text2: Son dynsee eh ad myr fer ayns slane pooar , as cha nee myr ny Scrudeyryn .

text: When he was come down from the mountain , great multitudes followed him .
text2: Tra v ' eh er jeet neose jeh ' n clieau , deiyr earrooyn mooarey dy leih er .

text: And , behold , there came a leper and worshipped him , saying , Lord , if thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: As cur - my - ner haink lourane , as hug eh ooashley da , gra , Hiarn , my she dt ' aigney eh , foddee oo mish y yannoo glen .

text: And Jesus put forth his hand , and touched him , saying , I will ; be thou clean . And immediately his leprosy was cleansed .
text2: As heeyn Yeesey magh e laue , as venn eh rish , gra , My aigney ' s eh , bee er dty ghlenney . As chelleeragh va ' n louraanys echey er ny ghlenney .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , See thou tell no man ; but go thy way , shew thyself to the priest , and offer the gift that Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Jeeagh nagh n ' insh oo shoh da dooinney erbee , agh immee royd , as jeeagh oo hene da ' n taggyrt , as cheb yn oural doardee Moses son feanish daue .

text: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum , there came unto him a centurion , beseeching him ,
text2: As tra va Yeesey er n ' gholl stiagh ayns Capernaum , haink centurion huggey , guee er ,

text: And saying , Lord , my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy , grievously tormented .
text2: As gra , Hiarn , ta my er - mooinjerey ny lhie ching ec y thie jeh ' n chingys - craaee , ayns stayd feer treih .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , I will come and heal him .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Hig - yms , as nee ' m eh y lheihys .

text: The centurion answered and said , Lord , I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof : but speak the word only , and my servant shall be healed .
text2: As dreggyr yn centurion , gra , Hiarn , cha vel mee feeu oo dy heet stiagh fo my chlea : agh ynrycan loayr y fockle , as bee my harvaant er ny lheihys .

text: For I am a man under authority , having soldiers under me : and I say to this man , Go , and he goeth ; and to another , Come , and he cometh ; and to my servant , Do this , and he doeth it .
text2: Son ta mish mee hene my ghooinney ayns pooar , as sidooryn aym foym : as ta mee gra rish y dooinney shoh , Immee , as t ' eh goll : as rish fer elley , Tar , as t ' eh cheet : as rish my harvaant , Jean shoh , as t ' eh dy yannoo eh .

text: When Jesus heard it , he marvelled , and said to them that followed , Verily I say unto you , I have not found so great faith , no , not in Israel .
text2: Tra cheayll Yeesey shoh , ghow eh yindys , as dooyrt eh roosyn va geiyrt er , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Lheid y credjue lajer shoh , cha vel mee er gheddyn ayns Israel hene .

text: And I say unto you , That many shall come from the east and west , and shall sit down with Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: As ta mee gra riu , dy jig ymmodee veih yn niar as veih yn neear , as dy soie ad sheese marish Abraham , as Isaac , as Jacob , ayns reeriaght niau .

text: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Agh bee cloan y reeriaght er nyn yiooldey magh gys y dorraghys sodjey - mooie : ayns shen vees keayney as snaggeraght feeacklyn .

text: And Jesus said unto the centurion , Go thy way ; and as thou hast believed , so be it done unto thee . And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish y centurion , Immee royd , as ' naght myr t ' ou er chredjal , myr shen dy jig oo jeh . As va e er - mooinjerey er ny lheihys ayns yn oor cheddin .

text: And when Jesus was come into Peter ' s house , he saw his wife ' s mother laid , and sick of a fever .
text2: As tra va Yeesey er jeet stiagh ayns thie Pheddyr , honnick eh moir e ven ny lhie , as ching ayns y chiassaghey .

text: And he touched her hand , and the fever left her : and she arose , and ministered unto them .
text2: As venn eh rish y laue eck , as daag yn chiassaghey ee : as ren ee girree , as shirveish orroo .

text: When the even was come , they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils : and he cast out the spirits with his word , and healed all that were sick :
text2: Tra va ' n fastyr er jeet , hug ad lhien huggey ymmodee va drogh - spyrrydyn ayndoo : as deiyr eh magh ny spyrrydyn lesh fockle , as laanee eh ooilley ny va ching .

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying , Himself took our infirmities , and bare our sicknesses .
text2: Myr shoh va cooilleenit shen ny loayr Esaias y phadeyr , gra , Ghow eh - hene er ny aslayntyn ainyn , as dymmyrk eh nyn ghoghanyn .

text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him , he gave commandment to depart unto the other side .
text2: Nish tra honnick Yeesey earrooyn mooarey dy leih mygeayrt y mysh , hug eh sarey dy gholl gys y cheu elley .

text: And a certain scribe came , and said unto him , Master , I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest .
text2: As haink scrudeyr dy row huggey , as dooyrt eh rish , Vainshter , eiyr - yms ort raad erbee dy jed oo .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , The foxes have holes , and the birds of the air have nests ; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Ta tuill ec ny shynnee , as idd ec eeanlee yn aer , agh cha vel ec mac y dooinney wheesh boayl aaght son e chione .

text: And another of his disciples said unto him , Lord , suffer me first to go and bury my father .
text2: As dooyrt fer elley jeh e ynseydee rish , Hiarn , lhig dou hoshiaght goll thie dy oanluckey my ayr .

text: But Jesus said unto him , Follow me ; and let the dead bury their dead .
text2: Agh dooyrt Yeesey rish , Eiyr orrym ' s , as lhig da ny merriu nyn merriu y oanluckey .

text: And when he was entered into a ship , his disciples followed him .
text2: As tra v ' eh er ghoaill lhuingys , hie e ynseydee marish .

text: And , behold , there arose a great tempest in the sea , insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves : but he was asleep .
text2: As cur - my - ner hrog sterrym mooar ayns yn aarkey , myr shen dy row ny tonnyn brishey harrish y lhong : agh v ' eshyn ny chadley .

text: And his disciples came to him , and awoke him , saying , Lord , save us : we perish .
text2: As haink e ynseydee huggey , as ghooisht ad eh , gra , Hiarn , saue shin : bee mayd caillit .

text: And he saith unto them , Why are ye fearful , O ye of little faith ? Then he arose , and rebuked the winds and the sea ; and there was a great calm .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu agglagh , shiuish dy chredjue moal ? Eisht dirree eh , as hug eh yn gheay , as yn aarkey fo - harey as va kiuney vooar ayn .

text: But the men marvelled , saying , What manner of man is this , that even the winds and the sea obey him !
text2: Agh ghow ny deiney yindys , gra , Cre ' n dooinney eh shoh , dy vel ny eer geayghyn as y faarkey ayns biallys da !

text: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes , there met him two possessed with devils , coming out of the tombs , exceeding fierce , so that no man might pass by that way .
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet gys y cheu elley , gys cheer ny Gergesenee haink daa ghooinney va drogh - spyrrydyn ayndoo magh ny whail , veih mastey ny hoiaghyn , as cha keoi shen v ' ad , nagh by - lhoys da dooinney erbee goaill yn raad shen .

text: And , behold , they cried out , saying , What have we to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of God ? art thou come hither to torment us before the time ?
text2: As cur - my - ner deie ad , gra , Cre ' n eie t ' ayd orrin , Yeesey Vac Yee ? vel oo er jeet dy nyn dorchaghey roish y traa ?

text: And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding .
text2: As tammylt voue va beiyhaghey griagh mooar dy vuckyn .

text: So the devils besought him , saying , If thou cast us out , suffer us to go away into the herd of swine .
text2: As ghuee ny drogh - spyrrydyn er , gra , My eiyrys oo magh shin , lhig dooin goll stiagh ayns ny muckyn .

text: And he said unto them , Go . And when they were come out , they went into the herd of swine : and , behold , the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea , and perished in the waters .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Gow - jee reue . As tra v ' ad er jeet ass ny deiney , hie ad stiagh ayns y ghriagh dy vuckyn : as cur - my - ner roie yn slane griagh gour nyn mullee lesh yn eaynee gys y cheayn , as v ' ad baiht ayns ny ushtaghyn .

text: And they that kept them fled , and went their ways into the city , and told every thing , and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils .
text2: As roie ny bochillyn roue , as haink ad gys yn ard - valley , as dinsh ad dy chooilley nhee : as mychione ny deiney va seaghnit lesh ny drogh - spyrrydyn .

text: And , behold , the whole city came out to meet Jesus : and when they saw him , they besought him that he would depart out of their coasts .
text2: As cur - my - ner , haink y slane ard - valley magh quail Yeesey , as tra honnick ad eh , ghuee ad er , eh dy gholl roish ass ny ardjyn oc .

text: And he entered into a ship , and passed over , and came into his own city .
text2: As ghow eh lhuingys , as hioill eh harrish , as haink eh gys e ard - valley hene .

text: And , behold , they brought to him a man sick of the palsy , lying on a bed : and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy ; Son , be of good cheer ; thy sins be forgiven thee .
text2: As cur - my - ner , hug ad lhieu huggey dooinney doghanit lesh y chingys craaee , ny lhie er lhiabbee : as Yeesey goaill tastey jeh ' n chredjue oc , dooyrt eh rish y varter , Vac , bee dy yien mie , ta dty pheccaghyn er ny leih dhyt .

text: And , behold , certain of the scribes said within themselves , This man blasphemeth .
text2: Er shoh , dooyrt shiartanse jeh ny scrudeyryn roo hene , T ' eh shoh loayrt goan mollaghtagh .

text: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said , Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts ?
text2: As Yeesey toiggal ny smooinaghtyn oc , dooyrt , Cre ' n - fa ta drogh smooinaghtyn troggal ayns ny creeaghyn eu ?

text: For whether is easier , to say , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Arise , and walk ?
text2: Son cre sassey dy ghra , Ta dty pheccaghyn er ny leih dhyt ? ny dy ghra , Irree seose as shooill ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , ( then saith he to the sick of the palsy , ) Arise , take up thy bed , and go unto thine house .
text2: Agh dy vod fys y ve eu , dy vel pooar ec Mac y dooinney er y thalloo dy leih peccaghyn : ( eisht dooyrt eh rish y varter ) Irree , trog lhiat dty lhiabbee , as immee royd gys dty hie .

text: And he arose , and departed to his house .
text2: As dirree eh seose as jimmee eh gys e hie .

text: But when the multitudes saw it , they marvelled , and glorified God , which had given such power unto men .
text2: Agh tra honnick y pobble shoh , ghow ad yindys , as hug ad moylley da Jee , v ' er choyrt lheid y phooar da deiney .

text: And as Jesus passed forth from thence , he saw a man , named Matthew , sitting at the receipt of custom : and he saith unto him , Follow me . And he arose , and followed him .
text2: As tra yn Yeesey er n ' gholl veih shen , honnick eh dooinney va enmyssit Mian , ny hoie ec boayrd y cheesh : as dooyrt eh rish , Eiyr orrym ' s . As dirree eh seose , as deiyr eh er .

text: And it came to pass , as Jesus sat at meat in the house , behold , many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr va Yeesey ny hoie ec bee ayns y thie , cur - my - ner haink ymmodee publicanee as peccee , as hoie ad sheese marishyn as marish e ynseydee .

text: And when the Pharisees saw it , they said unto his disciples , Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Tra honnick ny Phariseeyn shoh , dooyrt ad rish e ynseydee , Cre ' n - fa ta ' n mainshter eu gee marish publicanee as peccee ?

text: But when Jesus heard that , he said unto them , They that be whole need not a physician , but they that are sick .
text2: Agh cheayll Yeesey ad , as dooyrt eh roo , Cha vel feme ocsyn ta slane er yn er - lhee , agh ec sleih chingey .

text: But go ye and learn what that meaneth , I will have mercy , and not sacrifice : for I am not come to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Agh immee - jee shiuish , as ynsee - jee cre ta dy ve toiggit liorish y raa shoh , S ' bare lhiam myghin na oural : son cha daink mish dy eamagh er y vooinjer chairagh , agh er peccee gys arrys .

text: Then came to him the disciples of John , saying , Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: Eisht haink huggey ynseydee Ean , as dooyrt ad , Cre ' n - fa ta shinyn as ny Phariseeyn trostey dy mennick , agh cha vel y vooinjer ayd ' s trostey ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber mourn , as long as the bridegroom is with them ? but the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken from them , and then shall they fast .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Vod caarjyn y dooinney - poosee dobberan , choud as ta dooinney yn phoosee maroo ? agh hig ny laghyn , tra vees dooinney yn phoosee er ny ghoaill ersooyl voue , as shen y traa nee ad trostey .

text: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment , for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment , and the rent is made worse .
text2: Cha vel dooinney erbee cur peesh dy eaddagh noa er shenn gharmad : son ta ' n pheesh goaill e laane ass y gharmad , as ta ' n assee wheesh shen smessey ,

text: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles : else the bottles break , and the wine runneth out , and the bottles perish : but they put new wine into new bottles , and both are preserved .
text2: Chamoo ta sleih coyrt feeyn noa ayns shenn voteilyn : er - nonney ta ny boteilyn scoltey , as ta ' n feeyn er ny gheayrtey , as ta ny boteilyn dy choayl orroo ; agh t ' ad cur feeyn noa ayns boteilyn noa , as t ' ad ny neesht sauchey .

text: While he spake these things unto them , behold , there came a certain ruler , and worshipped him , saying , My daughter is even now dead : but come and lay thy hand upon her , and she shall live .
text2: Choud as v ' eh loayrt ny goan shoh roo , cur - my - ner haink fer - reill , as hug eh ooashley da , gra , Ta m ' inneen eer nish paartail : agh tar , as cur dty laue urree , as bee ee bio .

text: And Jesus arose , and followed him , and so did his disciples .
text2: As hrog Yeesey , as deiyr eh er , as myr shen ren e ynseydee .

text: And , behold , a woman , which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years , came behind him , and touched the hem of his garment :
text2: ( As cur - my - ner haink ben cheu - e - chooylloo , va doghanit lesh roie - folley rish daa vlein jeig , as venn ee rish oirr e gharmad .

text: For she said within herself , If I may but touch his garment , I shall be whole .
text2: Son dooyrt ee r ' ee hene , My oddym agh bentyn rish e gharmad bee - ym er my lheihys .

text: But Jesus turned him about , and when he saw her , he said , Daughter , be of good comfort ; thy faith hath made thee whole . And the woman was made whole from that hour .
text2: Agh hyndaa Yeesey mygeayrt , as tra honnick eh ee , dooyrt eh , Inneen bee dy yien mie ; ta dty chredjue er dty laanaghey . As va ' n ven er ny lheihys veih yn oor shen magh . )

text: And when Jesus came into the ruler ' s house , and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise ,
text2: As tra va Yeesey er jeet stiagh ayns thie yn er - reill , as tra honnick eh ny bardoonee , as y cheshaght ooilley ' syn un chiaull .

text: He said unto them , Give place : for the maid is not dead , but sleepeth . And they laughed him to scorn .
text2: Dooyrt eh roo , Scugh - jee , son cha vel y ven - aeg marroo , agh ny cadley . As hie ad son craidey mysh .

text: But when the people were put forth , he went in , and took her by the hand , and the maid arose .
text2: As tra va ' n sleih er skeayley , hie eh stiagh , as ghow eh ee er laue , as dirree yn ven - aeg .

text: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land .
text2: As hie goo magh jeh shoh trooid ooilley yn cheer .

text: And when Jesus departed thence , two blind men followed him , crying , and saying , Thou Son of David , have mercy on us .
text2: As tra va Yeesey er n ' immeeaght veih shen , deiyr daa ghooinney doal er gyllagh as gra , Jean myghin orrin , Vac

text: And when he was come into the house , the blind men came to him : and Jesus saith unto them , Believe ye that I am able to do this ? They said unto him , Yea , Lord .
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet stiagh ayns y thie , haink ny deiney doal huggey : as dooyrt Yeesey roo , Vel shiu credjal dy voddym shoh y yannoo ? Dooyrt adsyn rish , Ta Hiarn .

text: Then touched he their eyes , saying , According to your faith be it unto you .
text2: Eisht venn eh rish ny sooillyn oc , gra Cordail rish nyn gredjue dy row nyn aghin eu .

text: And their eyes were opened ; and Jesus straitly charged them , saying , See that no man know it .
text2: As va ny sooillyn oc er nyn vosley , as hug Yeesey currym gyere orroo , gra , Jeeagh Jee nagh vow dooinney erbee fys er .

text: But they , when they were departed , spread abroad his fame in all that country .
text2: Agh tra v ' adsyn er n ' gholl roue , hug ad goo jeh magh trooid ooilley yn cheer shen .

text: As they went out , behold , they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil .
text2: Erreish daue shoh v ' er n ' gholl ersooyl , cur - my - ner , hug ad lhieu huggey dooinney balloo va drogh - spyrryd ayn .

text: And when the devil was cast out , the dumb spake : and the multitudes marvelled , saying , It was never so seen in Israel .
text2: As tra va ' n drogh - spyrryd er ny chastey , ren y balloo loayrt : as ghow yn pobble yindys , gra , Cha row rieau lheid shoh er ny akin ayns Israel .

text: But the Pharisees said , He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils .
text2: Agh dooyrt ny Phariseeyn , Liorish yn ard ghrogh - spyrryd t ' eshyn castey drogh - spyrrydyn .

text: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages , teaching in their synagogues , and preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing every sickness and every disease among the people .
text2: As hie Yeesey mygeayrt ooilley ny ard - valjyn as ny baljyn - cheerey oc , gynsaghey ayns ny kialteenyn oc , as preacheil sushtal yn reeriaght , as lheihys dy chooilley hingys , as dy chooilley ghoghan mastey ' n pobble .

text: But when he saw the multitudes , he was moved with compassion on them , because they fainted , and were scattered abroad , as sheep having no shepherd .
text2: Agh tra honnick eh yn chaglym mooar dy leih , v ' eh er ny veiyghey lesh chymmey orroo , er - yn - oyr dy row ad tooillit , as er nyn skeayley noon as noal , myr kirree fegooish bochilley .

text: Then saith he unto his disciples , The harvest truly is plenteous , but the labourers are few ;
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish e ynseydee , Ta ' n fouyr dy jarroo palchey , agh s ' coan ta ny beayneeyn .

text: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest , that he will send forth labourers into his harvest .
text2: Guee - jee shiuish , er - y - fa shen , er Chiarn y fouyr , eh dy chur magh labreeyn gys y fouyr echey .

text: And when he had called unto him his twelve disciples , he gave them power against unclean spirits , to cast them out , and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease .
text2: As tra v ' eh er n - eamagh er e ghaa ostyl jeig huggey , hug eh daue pooar harrish spyrrydyn neu - ghlen dy chastey ad , as dy lheihys dy chooilley vonney dy hingys , as dy chooilley ghoghan .

text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these ; The first , Simon , who is called Peter , and Andrew his brother ; James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother ;
text2: As shoh va enmyn yn daa ostyl yeig ; Yn chied - er , Simon , ta enmyssit Peddyr , as Andreays e vraar , Jamys mac Zebedee , as Ean y braar echeysyn

text: Philip , and Bartholomew ; Thomas , and Matthew the publican ; James the son of Alphaeus , and Lebbaeus , whose surname was Thaddaeus ;
text2: Philip as Parlane , Thomase , as Mian yn publican , Jamys mac Alpheus , as Lebbeus va slennooit Thaddeus .

text: Simon the Canaanite , and Judas Iscariot , who also betrayed him .
text2: Simon yn Canaanite , as Yuaase Iscariot , ren myrgeddin eh y vrah .

text: These twelve Jesus sent forth , and commanded them , saying , Go not into the way of the Gentiles , and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not :
text2: Yn ghaa - yeig shoh hug Yeesey magh , as doardee eh daue , gra , Ny immee - jee raad ny Hashoonee , ny gys ard - valjyn ny Samaritanee .

text: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
text2: Agh immee - jee hoshiaght gys kirree cailjey thie Israel .

text: And as ye go , preach , saying , The kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: As myr vees shiu goll , jean - jee preacheil , gra , Ta reeriaght niau er - gerrey .

text: Heal the sick , cleanse the lepers , raise the dead , cast out devils : freely ye have received , freely give .
text2: Slaanee - jee sleih chingey , glen - jee ny louranee , jean - jee ny merriu y aa - vioghey , as drogh - spyrrydyn y chastey : nastee ta shiu er gheddyn , as dy nastee cur - jee veue .

text: Provide neither gold , nor silver , nor brass in your purses ,
text2: Ny kiare - jee son airh , ny argid , ny prash y ve eu ayns nyn sporranyn :

text: Nor scrip for your journey , neither two coats , neither shoes , nor yet staves : for the workman is worthy of his meat .
text2: Ny spagey son y raad , ny daa chooat , ny braagyn , ny lorg : ( son ta ' n obbree toilliu e veaghey ) .

text: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter , inquire who in it is worthy ; and there abide till ye go thence .
text2: As ard - valley ny balley erbee dy jed shiu stiagh ayn , Jean - jee briaght quoi ayn ta feeu , as marishyn gow - jee aaght derrey hed shiu reue .

text: And when ye come into an house , salute it .
text2: As tra hed shiu stiagh ayns thie , bannee - jee daue .

text: And if the house be worthy , let your peace come upon it : but if it be not worthy , let your peace return to you .
text2: As my vees y thie feeu , lhig da ' n shee eu cheet er : agh mannagh bee eh feeu , lhig da ' n shee eu chyndaa hiu hene reesht .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear your words , when ye depart out of that house or city , shake off the dust of your feet .
text2: As quoi - erbee nagh der oltaghey bea diu , as nash der geill da ny goan eu : tra aagys shiu yn thie ny ' n ard - valley shen , crie - jee veue joan nyn goshey .

text: Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Dy bee eh ny sassey da cheer Sodom as Gomorrah , ec laa ny briwnys , na da ' n ard - valley shen .

text: Behold , I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves : be ye therefore wise as serpents , and harmless as doves .
text2: Cur - my - ner ta mish dy choyrt shiu magh myr kirree mastey moddee oaldey : Bee - jee er - y - fa shen tastagh myr ard - nieughyn , as oney myr calmaneyn .

text: But beware of men : for they will deliver you up to the councils , and they will scourge you in their synagogues ;
text2: Agh bee - jee er nyn dwoaie roish deiney , son livrey - ee ad shiu seose gys ny coonceilyn , as scuitchee ad shiu ayns nyn quaiylyn oc .

text: And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake , for a testimony against them and the Gentiles .
text2: As bee shiu er nyn goyrt fenish kiannoortyn as reeaghyn er y choontey aym ' s , myr shoh gymmyrkey feanish dauesyn , as da ny Ashoonee .

text: But when they deliver you up , take no thought how or what ye shall speak : for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak .
text2: Agh tra ver ad stiagh shiu , ny bee - jee imneagh cre ' n aght , ny cre nee shiu gra , son bee eh er ny choyrt diu ayns yn oor cheddin cre nee shiu y ghra .

text: For it is not ye that speak , but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you .
text2: Son cha nee shiuish ta loayrt , agh spyrryd yn Ayr eu ta loayrt ayndiu .

text: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death , and the father the child : and the children shall rise up against their parents , and cause them to be put to death .
text2: As livreyee braar seose e vraar gys baase , as yn ayr e lhiannoo : as nee cloan girree magh noi nyn ayr as nyn moir , as bee ad feanishyn baaish orroo .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake : but he that endureth to the end shall be saved .
text2: As ver yn ymmodee feoh diu er coontey yn ennym aym ' s : agh eshyn nee shassoo magh gys y jerrey , bee eh er ny hauail .

text: But when they persecute you in this city , flee ye into another : for verily I say unto you , Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel , till the Son of man be come .
text2: Agh tra nee ad tranlaase erriu ayns un ard - valley , cosne - jee reue gys ard - valley elley : son ta mee shickyrys diu , nagh bee shiu er n ' gholl harrish ard - valjyn Israel derrey vees Mac y dooinney er jeet .

text: The disciple is not above his master , nor the servant above his lord .
text2: Cha vel y scoillar erskyn e vainshter ny ' n charvaant erskyn e hiarn .

text: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master , and the servant as his lord . If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub , how much more shall they call them of his household ?
text2: S ' lioar da ' n scoillar dy ve myr e vainshter , as y charvaant myr e hiarn : my t ' ad er cheau Beelzebub er mainshter y thie , cre woad smoo nee ad e vooinjer y oltooaney .

text: Fear them not therefore : for there is nothing covered , that shall not be revealed ; and hid , that shall not be known .
text2: Ny gow - jee er - y - fa shen aggle roue : son cha vel nhee erbee follit nagh jir gys soilshey : ny nhee erbee keillit , nagh jig er - ash .
