text: What I tell you in darkness , that speak ye in light : and what ye hear in the ear , that preach ye upon the housetops .
text2: Shen ta mish dy insh diu ayns folliaght fockle - jee shiuish magh eh dy foshlit : as shen ta shiu er chlashtyn myr hannish voym ' s , jean - jee y phreacheil er mullagh ny dhieyn .

text: And fear not them which kill the body , but are not able to kill the soul : but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell .
text2: As ny bee aggle erriu rouesyn varrys y corp , agh nagh jarg er yn annym y varroo : agh bee - jee ayns aggle smoo roishyn oddys annym as callin neesht y stroie ayns niurin .

text: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing ? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father .
text2: Nagh vel daa sparroo er nyn greck son farling ? as cha duitt unnane oc marroo er y thalloo fegooish oardagh yn Ayr eu .

text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered .
text2: Agh ta eer renaigyn nyn ghing ooilley er nyn earroo .

text: Fear ye not therefore , ye are of more value than many sparrows .
text2: Ny bee - jee shiuish er - y - fa shen ayns aggle , ta ny smoo dy ve soit jiuish na jeh ymmodee sperriu .

text: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men , him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Quoi - erbee er - y - fa shen ghoys rhym ' s kiongoyrt rish deiney , goym ' s rishyn myrgeddin kiongoyrt rish my Ayr t ' ayns niau .

text: But whosoever shall deny me before men , him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Agh quoie - erbee obbys mish kiongoyrt rish deiney , eshyn neem ' s myrgeddin y obbal kiongoyrt rish my Ayr t ' ayns niau .

text: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth : I came not to send peace , but a sword .
text2: Ny smooinee - jee dy daink mish dy chur lhiam shee er y thalloo : cha daink mee dy chur lhiam shee , agh cliwe .

text: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father , and the daughter against her mother , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Son ta mish er jeet dy scarrey dooinney veih e ayr , as yn inneen veih e moir , as y ven - chleuin veih e moir - ' sy - leigh

text: And a man ' s foes shall be they of his own household .
text2: As noidyn dooinney vees adsyn jeh ' n lught - thie echey hene .

text: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me : and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me .
text2: Eshyn ta ny s ' graihee er ayr ny moir na orrym ' s , cha vel eh feeu jee ' m : as eshyn ta ny s ' graihee er mac ny inneen na orrym ' s cha vel eh feeu jee ' m .

text: And he that taketh not his cross , and followeth after me , is not worthy of me .
text2: As eshyn nagh jean e chrosh y ymmyrkey , as geiyrt orrym ' s , cha vel eh feeu jee ' m .

text: He that findeth his life shall lose it : and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it .
text2: Eshyn ta aggindagh e vioys y hauail , caillee eh eh : agh eshyn chaillys e vioys er my ghraih ' s , nee eh eh y hauail .

text: He that receiveth you receiveth me , and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
text2: Eshyn ta soiaghey jiuish , t ' eh soiaghey jeem ' s : as eshyn ta soiaghey jeem ' s , t ' eh soiaghey jehsyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet ' s reward ; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man ' s reward .
text2: Eshyn ta cur oltaghey - bea da phadeyr ayns ennym phadeyr , yiow eh leah phadeyr as eshyn ta cur oltaghey - bea da dooinney cairagh ayns ennym dooinney cairagh , yiow eh leagh dooinney cairagh .

text: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple , verily I say unto you , he shall in no wise lose his reward .
text2: As quoi - erbee ver agh cappan dy ushtey feayr da unnane jeh ' n vooinjer veggey shoh dy iu , son dy vel eh credjal aynym ' s , dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , nagh jean eh er aght erbee e leagh y choayl .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples , he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , erreish da Yeesey v ' er choyrt ny curmyn shoh da e ghaa ostyl jeig dy jagh eh veih shen dy ynsaghey , as dy phreacheil ayns ny ard - valjyn mygeayrt .

text: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Nish tra va Ean er chlashtyn ayns y phryssoon jeh obbraghyn Chreest , hug eh jees jeh e ynseydee hene er chaghteraght huggey ,

text: And said unto him , Art thou he that should come , or do we look for another ?
text2: Dy ghra rish , Nee uss eh va dy heet ny vel shin dy yeeaghyn son fer elley ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see :
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Immee - jee , as soilshee - jee da Ean ny reddyn ta shiu dy chlashtyn as dy akin :

text: The blind receive their sight , and the lame walk , the lepers are cleansed , and the deaf hear , the dead are raised up , and the poor have the gospel preached to them .
text2: Ta ny doail geddyn nyn soilshey , as ny croobee shooyll , ny louraanee er nyn ghlenney , ny beuyr clashtyn , ny merriu er nyn mioghey , as yn sushtal er ny phreacheil da ny boghtyn .

text: And blessed is he , whosoever shall not be offended in me .
text2: As bannit ta eshyn nagh jean beg y hoiaghey jeem ' s .

text: And as they departed , Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John , What went ye out into the wilderness to see ? A reed shaken with the wind ?
text2: As myr v ' ad goll roue , ren Yeesey toshiaght dy ghra rish y pobble mychione Ean , Cre hie shiu magh gys yn aasagh dy akin ? Nee cuirtlagh criht lesh y gheay ?

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A man clothed in soft raiment ? behold , they that wear soft clothing are in kings ' houses .
text2: Agh cre hie shiu magh dy akin ? Dooinney coamrit ayns garmad moyrnagh ? Cur - my - ner , t ' adsyn ta ceau coamrey moyrnagh ayns cooyrtyn reeoil .

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A prophet ? yea , I say unto you , and more than a prophet .
text2: Agh cre hie shiu magh dy akin ? Nee phadeyr ? dy jarroo ta mee gra riu , as fer syrjey na phadeyr .

text: For this is he , of whom it is written , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Son shoh eh , my - e - chione te scruit , Cur - my - ner ta mee cur my haghter magh royd , dy chiartaghey ' n raad kiongoyrt rhyt .

text: Verily I say unto you , Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist : notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , ny mast ' ocsyn t ' er ve ruggit jeh mraane , cha vel fer syrjey na Ean Bashtey er droggal : ny - yeih ta ' n fer sloo t ' ayns reeriaght niau ny syrjey na eshyn .

text: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence , and the violent take it by force .
text2: As er - dy laghyn Ean Bashtey derrey nish , ta sleih chionney stiagh gys reeriaght niau , as t ' adsyn ta cheet lesh jeeanid cosney stiagh ayn .

text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John .
text2: Son ren ooilley ny phadeyryn as y leigh phadeyrys derrey Ean .

text: And if ye will receive it , this is Elias , which was for to come .
text2: As my ta shiu booiagh goaill - rish , shoh Elias va ry - hoi cheet .

text: He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Eshyn ta cleayshyn echey dy chlashtyn lhig da clashtyn .

text: But whereunto shall I liken this generation ? It is like unto children sitting in the markets , and calling unto their fellows ,
text2: Agh cre gys nee ' m yn cheeloghe shoh y hoylaghey ? T ' ad goll - rish cloan ta nyn soie ayns ny margaghyn , as geamagh da ny sheshaghyn oc .

text: And saying , We have piped unto you , and ye have not danced ; we have mourned unto you , and ye have not lamented .
text2: As gra , Ta shin er n ' yannoo bingys diu , as cha vel shiu er ghaunsin : ta shin er hroggal bardoon diu , as cha vel shiu er ghobberan .

text: For John came neither eating nor drinking , and they say , He hath a devil .
text2: Son cha daink Ean gee ny giu , as t ' ad gra , Ta drogh - spyrryd ayn .

text: The Son of man came eating and drinking , and they say , Behold a man gluttonous , and a winebibber , a friend of publicans and sinners . But wisdom is justified of her children .
text2: Haink Mac yn dooinney gee as giu , as t ' ad gra , Cur - my - ner dooinney jollyssagh , as iuder feeyney , carrey dy publicanee as dy pheccee : agh ta creenaght er ny heyrey liorish e cloan hene .

text: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done , because they repented not :
text2: Eisht ren eh toshiaght dy phlaiynt er ny ard - valjyn , ayndoo va ' n chooid smoo jeh e obbraghyn yindyssagh er nyn yannoo , er - yn - oyr nagh ghow ad arrys .

text: Woe unto thee , Chorazin ! woe unto thee , Bethsaida ! for if the mighty works , which were done in you , had been done in Tyre and Sidon , they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes .
text2: Smerg dhyt ' s Chorazin , smerg dhyt ' s Vethsaida : son dy beagh ny obbraghyn yindyssagh er ny ve jeant ayns Tyre as Sidon t ' er ny ve jeant ayndiuish , veagh ad er ghoaill arrys foddey er - dy - henney ayns aanrit - sack as leoie

text: But I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment , than for you .
text2: Agh ta mee gra riu , Dy bee kerraghey s ' eddrym er ny choyrt er Tyre as Sidon ec laa ny briwnys , na vees er ny choyrt erriuish .

text: And thou , Capernaum , which art exalted unto heaven , shalt be brought down to hell : for if the mighty works , which have been done in thee , had been done in Sodom , it would have remained until this day .
text2: As uss , Chapernaum , ta dty ooashley roshtyn gys niau , bee oo er dty hilgey sheese gys niurin : son dy beagh ny obbraghyn yindyssagh er ve jeant ayns Sodom , t ' er ve jeant aynyd ' s , veagh eh er ve er - mayrn gys y laa t ' ayn jiu .

text: But I say unto you , That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment , than for thee .
text2: Agh ta mee gra riu , dy bee kerraghey sassey er ny choyrt er thalloo Sodom ec laa ny briwnys , na vees ort ' s .

text: At that time Jesus answered and said , I thank thee , O Father , Lord of heaven and earth , because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent , and hast revealed them unto babes .
text2: Ec y traa shen dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh , Ta mee cur booise dhyt , O Ayr , Hiarn niau as thalloo , er - yn - oyr dy vel oo er cheiltyn ny reddyn shoh vouesyn ta creeney as tushtagh , as dy vel oo er hoilshaghey ad da oikanyn .

text: Even so , Father : for so it seemed good in thy sight .
text2: Shen dy jarroo myr te , Ayr , son shen myr ve mie ayns dty hilley ' s .

text: All things are delivered unto me of my Father : and no man knoweth the Son , but the Father ; neither knoweth any man the Father , save the Son , and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him .
text2: Ta dy chooilley nhee er ny livrey dooys liorish my Ayr : as cha nhione da dooinney erbee yn Mac , agh yn Ayr : chamoo shione da dooinney erbee yn Ayr , agh y Mac , as eshyn da s ' gooidsave lesh yn Mac eh y hoilshaghey .

text: Come unto me , all ye that labour and are heavy laden , and I will give you rest .
text2: Tar - jee hym ' s ooilley shiuish ta deinagh as trome laadit , as neem ' s shiu y ooraghey .

text: Take my yoke upon you , and learn of me ; for I am meek and lowly in heart : and ye shall find rest unto your souls .
text2: Gow - jee my whing erriu , as ynsee - jee voym ' s , son ta mee meen as imlee ayns cree : as yiow shiu fea da nyn amneenyn .

text: For my yoke is easy , and my burden is light .
text2: Son ta my whing aashagh , as my errey eddrym .

text: At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn ; and his disciples were an hungred , and began to pluck the ears of corn , and to eat .
text2: Ec y traa shen hie Yeesey trooid magher arroo - er y doonaght , as va e ostyllyn accryssagh , as ghow ad toshiaght dy phluckey ny jeeassyn arroo , as dy ee .

text: But when the Pharisees saw it , they said unto him , Behold , thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day .
text2: Agh tra honnick ny Phariseeyn ad , dooyrt ad rish , Cur - my - ner ta dty vooinjer ' s jannoo shen nagh vel lowal dy ve jeant er y doonaght .

text: But he said unto them , Have ye not read what David did , when he was an hungred , and they that were with him ;
text2: Agh dooyrt eshyn roo , Nagh vel shiuish er lhaih cre ren David , tra v ' eh hene as e heshaght accryssagh .

text: How he entered into the house of God , and did eat the shewbread , which was not lawful for him to eat , neither for them which were with him , but only for the priests ?
text2: Kys hie eh stiagh ayns thie Yee , as d ' ee eh yn arran casherick , nagh row lowit dasyn dy ee , agh da ny saggyrtyn ny - lomarcan ?

text: Or have ye not read in the law , how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath , and are blameless ?
text2: Er - nonney , nagh vel shiu er lhaih ayns y leigh , kys er laghyn y doonaght ta ny saggyrtyn ayns y chiamble brishey yn doonaght , as foast cha vel peccah er ny choyrt ass nyn lieh ?

text: But I say unto you , That in this place is one greater than the temple .
text2: Agh ta mish gra riuish , dy vel ayns shoh fer syrjey na ' n chiamble .

text: But if ye had known what this meaneth , I will have mercy , and not sacrifice , ye would not have condemned the guiltless .
text2: Agh dy beagh fys er ve euish , cre ta er ny hoiggal liorish y raa shoh , Share lhiam myghin na oural , cha beagh shiu er gheyrey yn vooinjer neu - chyndagh .

text: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day .
text2: Son ta Mac y dooinney ny Hiarn er y doonaght hene .

text: And when he was departed thence , he went into their synagogue :
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' gholl veih shen , hie eh stiagh ayns nyn synagogue .

text: And , behold , there was a man which had his hand withered . And they asked him , saying , Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days ? that they might accuse him .
text2: As cur - my - ner , va dooinney ayns shen va ' n laue echey er shyrgaghey : as , dy vod dagh oyr plaiynt y ve oc noi Yeesey , denee ad jeh , gra , Vel eh lowal dy lheihys er laghyn y doonaght ?

text: And he said unto them , What man shall there be among you , that shall have one sheep , and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day , will he not lay hold on it , and lift it out ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Quoi yn dooinney ny mast ' eu , vees un cheyrrey echey , as my huittys ee ayns jeeg er y doonaght , nagh daare eh greme urree , as nagh drog eh ass ee ?

text: How much then is a man better than a sheep ? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days .
text2: Nagh vel dooinney eisht foddey share na keyrrey ? Shen - y - fa te lowal dy yannoo mie er y doonaght .

text: Then saith he to the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it forth ; and it was restored whole , like as the other .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish y dooinney , Sheeyn magh dty laue : as heeyn eh magh ee ; as va ' n laue echey er ny lheihys myr y laue elley .

text: Then the Pharisees went out , and held a council against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: Eisht hie ny Phariseeyn magh , as hug ad nyn goyrle dy - cheilley n ' oi , kys oddagh ad eh y stroie .

text: But when Jesus knew it , he withdrew himself from thence : and great multitudes followed him , and he healed them all ;
text2: Agh tra va fys ec Yeesey er , jimmee eh veih shen : as deiyr earrooyn mooarey dy leih er , as ren eh ad ooilley y lheihys .

text: And charged them that they should not make him known :
text2: As hug eh currym daue , gyn ad dy vrah eh :

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying ,
text2: As shoh myr va cooilleenit shen ny loayr Esaias y phadeyr , gra ,

text: Behold my servant , whom I have chosen ; my beloved , in whom my soul is well pleased : I will put my spirit upon him , and he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles .
text2: Cur - my - ner , my hirveishagh hene ta mee er reih , my er - graihagh hene , eer taitnys my anmey : ver - yms yn spyrryd aym ' s ersyn , as soilshee eh briwnys da ny Ashoonee .

text: He shall not strive , nor cry ; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets .
text2: Cha bee eh streeuagh ny anveaagh , chamoo chluinnys fer erbee e choraa ayns ny straidyn .

text: A bruised reed shall he not break , and smoking flax shall he not quench , till he send forth judgment unto victory .
text2: Cuirtlagh vroojit cha jean eh y vrishey , as y bite giare - cheaut cha der eh ass , derrey ver eh magh briwnys ayns barriaght .

text: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust .
text2: As ayns yn ennym echeysyn nee ny Ashoonee treishteil .

text: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil , blind , and dumb : and he healed him , insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw .
text2: Eisht hug ad lhieu huggey dooinney seaghoit lesh drogh - spyrryd , doal as balloo : as ren eh eh y lheihys , myr shen dy ren eshyn va doal as balloo chammah loayrt as fakin .

text: And all the people were amazed , and said , Is not this the son of David ?
text2: As ghow ooilley yn pobble yindys , as dooyrt ad , Nagh nee shoh mac Ghavid ?

text: But when the Pharisees heard it , they said , This fellow doth not cast out devils , but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils .
text2: Agh tra cheayll ny Phariseeyn shoh , dooyrt ad , Cha vel eh shoh castey drogh spyrrydyn , agh liorish Beelzebub prince ny drogh - spyrrydyn .

text: And Jesus knew their thoughts , and said unto them , Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation ; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand :
text2: As Yeesey toiggal ny smooinaghtyn oc , dooyrt roo , Ta dy chooilley reeriaght ta girree magh n ' oi hene goll naardey : as ard - valley ny thie erbee ta girree - magh fo - my - cheilley , cha vod ad shassoo .

text: And if Satan cast out Satan , he is divided against himself ; how shall then his kingdom stand ?
text2: As my ta Satan castey Satan , t ' eh girree - magh n ' oi hene : kys eisht oddys y reeriaght echey shassoo ?

text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils , by whom do your children cast them out ? therefore they shall be your judges .
text2: As my ta mish liorish Beelzebub castey drogh - spyrrydyn , quoi liorish ta nyn mooinjer hene dy chastey ad ? adsyn er - y - fa shen vees ny briwnyn eu .

text: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God , then the kingdom of God is come unto you .
text2: Agh my ta mish liorish spyrryd Yee castey drogh - spyrrydyn , eisht ta reeriaght Yee er jeet hiuish .

text: Or else how can one enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he first bind the strong man ? and then he will spoil his house .
text2: Er - nonney , kys oddys fer goll stiagh ayns thie yn treanagh , as e chooid y ghoaill er - niart , mannagh geulee eh hoshiaght yn treanagh , as eisht nee eh e hie y roostey ?

text: He that is not with me is against me ; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad .
text2: Eshyn nagh vel lhiam , t ' eh m ' oi : as eshyn nagh vel chymsaghey marym , t ' eh skeayley .

text: Wherefore I say unto you , All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men : but the blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta mee gra riu , Bee dy chooilley pheccah as raa mollaghtagh er ny leih da deiney : agh goan mollaghtagh noi yn Spyrryd Noo cha bee er nyn leih da deiney .

text: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him : but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost , it shall not be forgiven him , neither in this world , neither in the world to come .
text2: As quoi - erbee loayrys fockle noi Mac y dooinney , bee eh er ny leih da : agh quoi erbee loayrys noi yn Spyrryd Noo , cha bee eh er ny leih da , edyr ' sy theihll shoh , ny ' sy theihll ta ry - heet .

text: Either make the tree good , and his fruit good ; or else make the tree corrupt , and his fruit corrupt : for the tree is known by his fruit .
text2: Edyr jean - jee yn billey mie , as e vess mie ; er - nonney jean - jee yn billey olk , as e vess olk : son liorish e vess , ta enney er ny choyrt er y villey .

text: O generation of vipers , how can ye , being evil , speak good things ? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh .
text2: O shiuish heeloghe dy ard - nieughyn , kys oddys shiuish ta olk shiu hene , reddyn mie y loayrt ? son ass laanid y chree ta ' n beeal loayrt .

text: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things : and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things .
text2: Ta dooinney mie ass stoyr mie yn chree echey , cur magh reddyn mie : as drogh ghooinney ass y drogh - stoyr cur magh drogh reddyn .

text: But I say unto you , That every idle word that men shall speak , they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment .
text2: Agh ta mee gra riu , Dy chooilley ghrogh - ockle nee deiney y loayrt , dy der ad coontey er y hon ec laa ny briwnys .

text: For by thy words thou shalt be justified , and by thy words thou shalt be condemned .
text2: Son liorish dty ghoan bee oo er dty heyrey , as liorish dty ghoan bee oo er dty gheyrey .

text: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered , saying , Master , we would see a sign from thee .
text2: Eisht dreggyr shiartanse jeh ny scrudeyryn as jeh ny Phariseeyn , gra , Vainshter , baillhien cowrey y akin void .

text: But he answered and said unto them , An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign ; and there shall no sign be given to it , but the sign of the prophet Jonas :
text2: Agh dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Ta drogh - heeloghe as neu - ghooghyssagh shirrey cowrey , agh cha bee cowrey erbee er ny chur daue , agh cowrey yn adeyr Jonas .

text: For as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale ' s belly ; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth .
text2: Son myr va Jonas three laghyn as three oieghyn ayns bolg y whale : myr shen bee Mac y dooinney three laghyn as three oieghyn ayns cree yn thallooin .

text: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : because they repented at the preaching of Jonas ; and , behold , a greater than Jonas is here .
text2: Nee deiney Nineveh girree seose ayns briwnys , as y cheeloghe shoh y gheyrey , er - yn - oyr dy ghow ad arrys ec preacheil Yonas , as cur - my - ner , ta fer syrjey na Jonas ayns shoh .

text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon ; and , behold , a greater than Solomon is here .
text2: Nee ben - rein y jiass girree seose ayns briwnys noi yn cheeloghe shoh , as ad y gheyrey : son haink ish veih ardjyn sodjey magh y thallooin , dy chlashtyn creenaght Solomon , as cur - my - ner ta fer s ' ooasle na Solomon ayns shoh .

text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man , he walketh through dry places , seeking rest , and findeth none .
text2: Tra ta ' n spyrryd neu - ghlen er n ' gholl ass dooinney , t ' eh shooyll trooid faasaghyn fadane , chee aash , agh ayns fardail .

text: Then he saith , I will return into my house from whence I came out ; and when he is come , he findeth it empty , swept , and garnished .
text2: Eisht t ' eh gra , Chyndaa - ym gys my hie , ass haink mee ; as tra t ' eh cheet , t ' eh dy gheddyn eh follym , sceabit , as soit magh dy stooamey .

text: Then goeth he , and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself , and they enter in and dwell there : and the last state of that man is worse than the first . Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation .
text2: Eisht t ' eh goll , as cur lesh marish shiaght spyrrydyn elley ta ny smessey na eh hene , as t ' ad goll shagh as cummal ayns shen : as ta stayd yerrinagh yn dooinney shen ny s ' doogh na ' n toshiaght . Eer myr shoh hig eh dy ve er y cheeloghe vee chrauee shoh .

text: While he yet talked to the people , behold , his mother and his brethren stood without , desiring to speak with him .
text2: Choud as v ' eh foast loayrt rish y pobble , cur - my - ner va e voir as e vraaraghyn nyn shassoo mooie , shirrey loayrt rish .

text: Then one said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren stand without , desiring to speak with thee .
text2: Eisht dooyrt fer rish , Cur - my - ner , ta dty voir as dty vraaraghyn nyn shassoo mooie , shirrey loayrt rhyt .

text: But he answered and said unto him that told him , Who is my mother ? and who are my brethren ?
text2: Agh dreggyr eshyn yn fer dinsh shoh da , gra , Quoi my voir ? as quoi my vraaraghyn ?

text: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: As heeyn eh magh e laue lhieusyn va sheer geiyrt er , as dooyrt eh , Cur - my - ner my voir , as my vraaraghyn .

text: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven , the same is my brother , and sister , and mother .
text2: Son quoi - erbee nee aigney my Ayrey t ' ayns niau , eh shen my vraar , as my huyr as my voir .

text: The same day went Jesus out of the house , and sat by the sea side .
text2: Yn laa cheddin hie Yeesey magh ass y thie , as hoie eh sheese rish oirr ny marrey .

text: And great multitudes were gathered together unto him , so that he went into a ship , and sat ; and the whole multitude stood on the shore .
text2: As va earrooyn mooarey dy leih er nyn jaglym cooidjagh huggey , myr shen dy jagh eh er board lhong , as hoie eh sheese , as va ooilley yn pobble nyn shassoo er y traie .

text: And he spake many things unto them in parables , saying , Behold , a sower went forth to sow ;
text2: As loayr eh mooarane reddyn roo ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey , gra , Cur - jee my - ner , hie correyder magh dy chuirr .

text: And when he sowed , some seeds fell by the way side , and the fowls came and devoured them up :
text2: As myr v ' eh cuirr , huitt paart jeh ' n rass rish oirr y raad , as haink ny eeanlee , as d ' ee ad seose eh .

text: Some fell upon stony places , where they had not much earth : and forthwith they sprung up , because they had no deepness of earth :
text2: Huitt paart er thalloo cloaie , raad nagh row mooarane ooir as daase eh er - y - chooyl , er - yn - oyr nagh row diunid hallooin echey :

text: And when the sun was up , they were scorched ; and because they had no root , they withered away .
text2: As tra ghow yn ghrian niart , ve fiojit ; as er - yn - oyr nagh row eh er n ' ghoaill fraue , ren eh shymley ersooyl .

text: And some fell among thorns ; and the thorns sprung up , and choked them :
text2: As huitt paart mastey drineyn : as daase ny drineyn seose as phloogh ad eh .

text: But other fell into good ground , and brought forth fruit , some an hundredfold , some sixtyfold , some thirtyfold .
text2: Agh huitt cooid elley jeh ayns thalloo mie , as dymmyrk eh mess , paart keead - filley paart three - feed - filley , as paart jeih fillaghyn as feed .

text: Who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Eshyn ta cleayshyn echey dy chlashtyn , lhig da clashtyn .

text: And the disciples came , and said unto him , Why speakest thou unto them in parables ?
text2: As haink e ostyllyn huggey , as dooyrt ad rish , Cre ' n - fa t ' ou loayrt roo ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey ?

text: He answered and said unto them , Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven , but to them it is not given .
text2: Dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Er - yn - oyr dy vel eh er ny choyrt diuish folliaghtyn reeriaght niau y hoiggal , agh dauesyn cha vel eh er ny choyrt .

text: For whosoever hath , to him shall be given , and he shall have more abundance : but whosoever hath not , from him shall be taken away even that he hath .
text2: Son quoi - erbee ta echey , dasyn vees er ny choyrt , as bee towse s ' feoiltey er ny choyrt da : agh quoi - erbee nagh vel echey , veihsyn vees shen ny ta echey , er ny ghoaill ersooyl .

text: Therefore speak I to them in parables : because they seeing see not ; and hearing they hear not , neither do they understand .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta mee loayrt roo ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey : er - yn - oyr , ga dy vel ad fakin , cha vel ad cur - my - ner : as clashtyn cha vel ad cur geill , chamoo t ' ad toiggal .

text: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias , which saith , By hearing ye shall hear , and shall not understand ; and seeing ye shall see , and shall not perceive :
text2: As ayndoosyn ta cooilleenit phadeyrys Esaias , ta gra , Ayns clashtyn , cluinnee shiu , agh cha jean shiu toiggal : as ayns fakin , hee shiu , agh cha der shiu my - ner

text: For this people ' s heart is waxed gross , and their ears are dull of hearing , and their eyes they have closed ; lest at any time they should see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , and should understand with their heart , and should be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Son ta cree yn phobble shoh er n ' aase roauyr , as ta ny cleayshyn oc moal dy chlashtyn , as ny sooillyn oc t ' ad er n ' yeigh ; er - aggle dy vaikagh ad lesh nyn sooillyn , as dy gluinnagh ad lesh nyn gleayshyn , as dy doiggagh ad lesh nyn gree , as dy beagh ad er nyn jyndaa , as dy jinnin ad y lheihys

text: But blessed are your eyes , for they see : and your ears , for they hear .
text2: Agh bannit ta ny sooillyn euish , son t ' ad fakin , as ny cleayshyn eu , son t ' ad clashtyn .

text: For verily I say unto you , That many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which ye see , and have not seen them ; and to hear those things which ye hear , and have not heard them .
text2: Son dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy vel ymmodee phadeyryn as deiney cairagh er ve aignagh dy akin ny reddyn ta shiuish dy akin , agh cha vel ad er vakin ad : as dy chlashtyn ny reddyn ta shiuish dy chlashtyn , agh cha vel ad er chlashtyn ad .

text: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower .
text2: Clasht - jee er - y - fa shen coraa - dorraghey yn chorreyder .

text: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom , and understandeth it not , then cometh the wicked one , and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart . This is he which received seed by the way side .
text2: Quoi - erbee ta clashtyn goo yn reeriaght , as nagh vel dy hoiggal eh , ta ' n drogh er cheet , as tayrtyn lesh shen ny va cuirt ayns e chree : shoh eh ghow yn rass rish oirr y raad .

text: But he that received the seed into stony places , the same is he that heareth the word , and anon with joy receiveth it ;
text2: Agh eshyn ghow yn rass ayns ynnydyn claghagh , shen eh ta clashtyn y goo , as jeeragh lesh boggey dy ghoaill eh :

text: Yet hath he not root in himself , but dureth for a while : for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word , by and by he is offended .
text2: Foast cha vel fraue echey ayn hene agh t ' eh cummal rish son tammylt : agh tra ta seaghyn as tranlaase cheet er , er coontey yn ghoo chelleeragh ta e chredjue failleil .

text: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word ; and the care of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , choke the word , and he becometh unfruitful .
text2: Eshyn myrgeddin ghow yn rass mastey ny drineyn , yn fer ta clashtyn y goo : as ta kiarail y theihll shoh , as molteyrys berchys plooghey yn goo , as te cheet dy ve ne vessoil .

text: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word , and understandeth it ; which also beareth fruit , and bringeth forth , some an hundredfold , some sixty , some thirty .
text2: Agh eshyn ghow yn rass ayns thalloo mie , shen eh ta clashtyn y goo as dy hoigg eh , as t ' eh tilgey mess , as gymmyrkey , paart keead - filley , paart three feed , as paart jeih fillaghyn as feed .

text: Another parable put he forth unto them , saying , The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field :
text2: Coraa - dorraghey elley loayr eh roo gra , Ta reeriaght niau er ny hoylaghey gys dooinney chuirr rass mie ayns e vagher :

text: But while men slept , his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat , and went his way .
text2: Agh choud as va sleih nyn gadley haink e noid , as chuirr eh coggyl mastey y churnaght , as jimmee eh roish .

text: But when the blade was sprung up , and brought forth fruit , then appeared the tares also .
text2: Agh tra va ' n chass er n ' aase , as e n ' gholl my - yeish , eisht haink y coggyl rish myrgeddin .

text: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him , Sir , didst not thou sow good seed in thy field ? from whence then hath it tares ?
text2: Er shen haink fir - vooinjerey yn er - thie , as dooyrt ad rish , Vainshter , nagh chuirr uss rass mie ayns dty vagher ? cre voish eisht ta ' n coggyl t ' ayn ?

text: He said unto them , An enemy hath done this . The servants said unto him , Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up ?
text2: Dooyrt eshyn roo , Noid t ' er n ' yannoo shoh . Dooyrt ny fir - vooinjerey rish , Nailt eisht shin dy gholl as dy ghaartlian ass eh ?

text: But he said , Nay ; lest while ye gather up the tares , ye root up also the wheat with them .
text2: As dooyrt eshyn , Cha naill - ym ; er aggle ayns gaartlian yn coggyl , dy n ' astyrt shiu yn churnaght myrgeddin ass ny fraueyn marish .

text: Let both grow together until the harvest : and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers , Gather ye together first the tares , and bind them in bundles to burn them : but gather the wheat into my barn .
text2: Lhig - jee daue ny - neesht gaase cooidjagh derrey ' n fouyr : as ayns earish yn ouyr jir - yms rish ny beayneeyn , Chymsee - jee cooidjagh hoshiaght yn coggyl ayns bunneeyn ry - hoi lostey ; agh tayrn - jee yn churnaght stiagh ayns my hoalt .

text: Another parable put he forth unto them , saying , The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and sowed in his field :
text2: Coraa - dorraghey elley loayr eh roo , gra , Ta reeriaght niau goll - rish grine dy rass mustard ghow dooinney , as chuirr eh ayns e vagher eh .

text: Which indeed is the least of all seeds : but when it is grown , it is the greatest among herbs , and becometh a tree , so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof .
text2: As ga dy nee eh sloo jeh dy chooilley rass : foast tra te er n ' aase , eh smoo ta mastey lossreeyn , as te cheet dy ve ny villey : myr shen dy vel eeanlee yn aer cheet as goaill fastee ayns ny banglaneyn echey .

text: Another parable spake he unto them ; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven , which a woman took , and hid in three measures of meal , till the whole was leavened .
text2: Coraa - dorraghey elley loayr eh roo , Ta reeriaght niau goll - rish soorid ren ben y ghoaill as coodaghey seose ayns three towseyn dy veinn , derrey va ' n clane soorit .

text: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables ; and without a parable spake he not unto them :
text2: Ooilley ny goan shoh loayr Yeesey rish y pobble ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey , as fegooish coraa - dorraghey , cha loayr eh roo :

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , saying , I will open my mouth in parables ; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world .
text2: As shoh myr va cooilleenit shen loayr y phadeyr , gra , Foshlym my veeal dy loayrt coraaghyn - dorraghey , soilshee - ym magh reddyn t ' er ve follit er - dy hoshiaght y theihll .

text: Then Jesus sent the multitude away , and went into the house : and his disciples came unto him , saying , Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field .
text2: Eisht hug Yeesey yn cheshaght ersooyl , as hie eh stiagh ayns y thie : as haink huggey adsyn va sheer marish , gra , Soilshee dooin coraa dorraghey coggyl yn vagheragh .

text: He answered and said unto them , He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man ;
text2: Dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh roo Eshyn chuirr yn rass mie , Mac yn dooinney :

text: The field is the world ; the good seed are the children of the kingdom ; but the tares are the children of the wicked one ;
text2: Yn magher yn seihll : yn rass mie cloan y reeriaght : agh y coggyl cloan y drogh - er :

text: The enemy that sowed them is the devil ; the harvest is the end of the world ; and the reapers are the angels .
text2: Yn noid chuirr ad yn Jouyl : yn fouyr jerrey yn theihll : as ny beayneeyn ny ainleyn .

text: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire ; so shall it be in the end of this world .
text2: Myr , er - y - fa shen , ta ' n coggyl er ny haglym , as er ny lostey ayns yn aile ; shen myr vees eh ec jerrey ' n theihll .

text: The Son of man shall send forth his angels , and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend , and them which do iniquity ;
text2: Ver yn Mac dooinney magh e ainleyn , as teiyee ad ass e reeriaght dy chooilley nhee ta tayrn sleih gys peccah , as adsyn ta cur rish yn olk ;

text: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire : there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth .
text2: As tilgee ad ad ayns coirrey aileagh : ayns shen vees keayney as snaggeraght feeacklyn .

text: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father . Who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Eisht nee yn chloan chairagh soilshean magh myr y ghrian , ayns reeriaght nyn Ayrey . Eshyn ta cleayshyn echey dy chlashtyn , lhig da clashtyn .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field ; the which when a man hath found , he hideth , and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath , and buyeth that field .
text2: Reesht ta reeriaght niau goll - rish berchys follit ayns magher : yn verchys cheddin tra ta dooinney dy gheddyn magh t ' eh dy choodaghey eh , as ayns boggey jeh t ' eh goll as creck ooilley ny t ' echey , as kionnaghey yn magher cheddin .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man , seeking goodly pearls :
text2: Reesht ta reeriaght niau dy ve soylit rish marchan va shirrey pearlyn costal :

text: Who , when he had found one pearl of great price , went and sold all that he had , and bought it .
text2: As tra v ' eh er gheddyn un phearl dy phrice vooar , hie eh , as chreck eh ooilley ny v ' echey , as chionnee eh eh .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net , that was cast into the sea , and gathered of every kind :
text2: Reesht ta reeriaght niau goll - rish lieen va cuirt ' sy cheayn as haare jeh dy chooilley horch dy eeast .

text: Which , when it was full , they drew to shore , and sat down , and gathered the good into vessels , but cast the bad away .
text2: As tra ve lane , hayrn ad eh gys thalloo , as hoie ad sheese , as haggil ad yn eeast mie ayns siyn , agh cheau ad yn drogh eeast ersooyl .

text: So shall it be at the end of the world : the angels shall come forth , and sever the wicked from among the just ,
text2: Shen myr vees eh ec jerrey yn theihll : hig ny ainleyn magh , as scarree ad yn vee chrauee veih mastey yn chloan chairal ;

text: And shall cast them into the furnace of fire : there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth .
text2: As tilgee ad ad ayns coirrey dy aile : ayns shen vees keayney as snaggeraght feeacklyn .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Have ye understood all these things ? They say unto him , Yea , Lord .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Vel shiu er hoiggal ooilley ny reddyn shoh ? Dooyrt adsyn rish , Ta shin , Hiarn .

text: Then said he unto them , Therefore every scribe which is instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder , which bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh roo , Shen - y - fa ta dy chooilley scrudeyr , ta ynsit gys reeriaght niau , goll - rish dooinney ta ny er - thie ( mie ) ta cur magh ass e hashtaghyn reddyn noa as shenn .

text: And it came to pass , that when Jesus had finished these parables , he departed thence .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , tra va Yeesey erreish ny coraaghyn - dorraghey shoh y loayrt , dy jimmee eh veih shen .

text: And when he was come into his own country , he taught them in their synagogue , insomuch that they were astonished , and said , Whence hath this man this wisdom , and these mighty works ?
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet gys e heer hene , dynsee eh ad ayns ny synagogueyn oc , ayns wheesh as dy row ad atchimagh , as dy dooyrt ad , Cre voish ta creenaght as mirrillyn y dooinney shoh ?

text: Is not this the carpenter ' s son ? is not his mother called Mary ? and his brethren , James , and Joses , and Simon , and Judas ?
text2: Nagh nee shoh mac y teyr ? Nagh vel e voir enmyssit Moirrey , as e vraaraghyn Jamys as Joses , as Simon , as Judas ?

text: And his sisters , are they not all with us ? Whence then hath this man all these things ?
text2: As nagh vel ny shayraghyn echey ooilley marin ? cre voish eisht ta ooilley ny reddyn t ' ec y dooinney shoh ?

text: And they were offended in him . But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , save in his own country , and in his own house .
text2: As v ' ad jymmoosagh rish . Agh dooyrt Yeesey roo , Cha vel phadeyr gyn ooashley , agh ayns e heer hene , as ayns e hie hene .

text: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief .
text2: As cha nhimmey mirril dobbree eh ayns shen , kyndagh rish y vee - chredjue oc .

text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus ,
text2: Ec y traa shen cheayll Herod yn Tetrarch jeh goo Yeesey ,

text: And said unto his servants , This is John the Baptist ; he is risen from the dead ; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish e ir - oik , Shoh Ean Bashtey , t ' eh er n ' irree veih ny merriu , as er - yn - oyr shen ta mirrillyn er nyn obbraghey

text: For Herod had laid hold on John , and bound him , and put him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife .
text2: Son va Herod er ghoaill Ean , as er choyrt eh ayns geulaghyn ' sy phryssoon , er coontey Herodias ben e vraar Philip .

text: For John said unto him , It is not lawful for thee to have her .
text2: Son va Ean er ghra rish , Te noi yn leigh , ee dy ve ayd son ben .

text: And when he would have put him to death , he feared the multitude , because they counted him as a prophet .
text2: As tra baillish v ' er choyrt eh gy - baase v ' eh ayns aggle roish y pobble , er - yn - oyr dy row ad dy ghoaill eh son phadeyr .

text: But when Herod ' s birthday was kept , the daughter of Herodias danced before them , and pleased Herod .
text2: Agh er y laa v ' er ny reayll corrym rish y laa ruggyr Herod , ghaunse inneen Herodias ayns yn enish oc , as ghow Herod lane boggey j ' ee .

text: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask .
text2: Er shen ghiall eh lesh breearrey , dy choyrt - jee cre erbee hirragh ee .

text: And she , being before instructed of her mother , said , Give me here John Baptist ' s head in a charger .
text2: As dooyrt ish , myr va e moir er chur roee , Cur dou ayns shoh kione Ean Bashtey er claare .

text: And the king was sorry : nevertheless for the oath ' s sake , and them which sat with him at meat , he commanded it to be given her .
text2: As by - hrimshey lesh y ree : ny - yeih e coontey yn vreearrey , as y vooinjer v ' ec gien marish , doardee eh ( yn kione ) dy v ' er ny livrey huic .

text: And he sent , and beheaded John in the prison .
text2: As hug eh fys yn kione dy ve giarit jeh Ean ayns y phryssoon .

text: And his head was brought in a charger , and given to the damsel : and she brought it to her mother .
text2: As va ' n kione er ny choyrt er claare as livreit gys y ven - aeg , as hug ish lh ' ee eh gys e moir .

text: And his disciples came , and took up the body , and buried it , and went and told Jesus .
text2: As haink e ynseydee , as hrog ad y corp , as doanluck ad eh , as hie ad , as dinsh ad da Yeesey .

text: When Jesus heard of it , he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart : and when the people had heard thereof , they followed him on foot out of the cities .
text2: Tra cheayll Yeesey jeh , ghow eh lhuingys , as jimmee eh veih shen gys ynnyd faasagh er - lheh : as tra cheayll y pobble jeh , deiyr ad er ry nyn gosh ass ny ard - valjyn .

text: And Jesus went forth , and saw a great multitude , and was moved with compassion toward them , and he healed their sick .
text2: As hie Yeesey magh , as honnick eh chaglym mooar dy leih , as v ' eh er ny veiyghey lesh chymmey orroo , as laanee eh adsyn va ching .

text: And when it was evening , his disciples came to him , saying , This is a desert place , and the time is now past ; send the multitude away , that they may go into the villages , and buy themselves victuals .
text2: As tra va ' n fastyr er , haink e ostyllyn huggey , gra , She boayl faasagh shoh , as te nish lesh yn anmys ; lhig y raad da ' n cheshaght , dy vod ad goll roue gys ny baljyn cheerey , as beaghey y chionnaghey daue hene .

text: But Jesus said unto them , They need not depart ; give ye them to eat .
text2: Agh dooyrt Yeesey roo , Cha lhiass daue goll roue cur - jee shiuish beaghey daue

text: And they say unto him , We have here but five loaves , and two fishes .
text2: As dooyrt ad rish , Cha vel ain ayns shoh agh queig bwilleenyn , as daa eeast .

text: He said , Bring them hither to me .
text2: Dooyrt eshyn , Cur - jee lhieu ad ayns shoh hym ' s .

text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass , and took the five loaves , and the two fishes , and looking up to heaven , he blessed , and brake , and gave the loaves to his disciples , and the disciples to the multitude .
text2: As doardee eh yn pobble dy hoie sheese er y faiyr , as ghow eh ny queig bwilleenyn as y daa eeast , as yeeagh eh seose gys niau , as vannee eh , as vrish eh , as hug eh ny bwilleenyn da ny ostyllyn , as hirveish adsyn ad er y pobble .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled : and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full .
text2: As ren ad ooilley gee , as v ' ad jeant magh : as hrog ad jeh ' n fooilliagh daag ad , lane daa vaskad jeig .

text: And they that had eaten were about five thousand men , beside women and children .
text2: As adsyn v ' er n ' ee v ' ad queig thousane dooinney , cheu - mooie jeh mraane as cloan .

text: And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship , and to go before him unto the other side , while he sent the multitudes away .
text2: As chelleeragh hug Yeesey er e ostyllyn goaill lhuingys , as goll harrish gys y cheu elley roish , choud as v ' eshyn lhiggey yn raad da ' n pobble .

text: And when he had sent the multitudes away , he went up into a mountain apart to pray : and when the evening was come , he was there alone .
text2: As tra v ' eh er chur y pobble ersooyl , hie eh - hene er - lheh seose er slieau , dy ghoaill padjer : as tra va ' n fastyr er jeet , v ' eh ayns shen ny - lomarcan .

text: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea , tossed with waves : for the wind was contrary .
text2: Agh va ' n lhong nish ayns mean ny marrey , eiyrit noon as noal lesh ny tonnyn : son va ' n gheay nyn ' oi .

text: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them , walking on the sea .
text2: As ayns y chiarroo arrey jeh ' n oie , haink Yeesey huc , shooyll er y cheayn .

text: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea , they were troubled , saying , It is a spirit ; and they cried out for fear .
text2: As tra honnick ny ostyllyn eh shooyll er y cheayn , v ' ad atchimagh , gra , She scaan t ' ayn ; as deie ad magh ayns aggle .

text: But straightway Jesus spake unto them , saying , Be of good cheer ; it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Agh chelleeragh loayr Yeesey roo , gra , Bee - jee dy yien mie , she mish t ' ayn , ny gow - jee aggle .

text: And Peter answered him and said , Lord , if it be thou , bid me come unto thee on the water .
text2: As dreggyr Peddyr eh , gra , Hiarn , my she oo t ' ayn , abbyr rhym cheet hood er yn ushtey .

text: And he said , Come . And when Peter was come down out of the ship , he walked on the water , to go to Jesus .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Tar royd . As tra va Peddyr er jeet neose ass y lhong , huill eh er yn ushtey , dy gholl gys Yeesey .

text: But when he saw the wind boisterous , he was afraid ; and beginning to sink , he cried , saying , Lord , save me .
text2: Agh gennaghtyn yn gheay rastagh , v ' eh agglit : as aarloo dy gholl fo , dyllee eh , gra , Hiarn , saue mee .

text: And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand , and caught him , and said unto him , O thou of little faith , wherefore didst thou doubt ?
text2: As ayns y tullogh , heeyn Yeesey magh e laue , as haare eh eh , as dooyrt eh rish , O ghooinney faase - chredjuagh , cre ' n - fa v ' ou mee - ouryssagh ?

text: And when they were come into the ship , the wind ceased .
text2: As tra v ' ad er n ' gholl er - board y lhong , huitt yn gheay .

text: Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him , saying , Of a truth thou art the Son of God .
text2: Eisht haink yn cheshaght - lhuingey , as hug ad ooashley da , gra , Ayns firrinys oo Mac Yee .

text: And when they were gone over , they came into the land of Gennesaret .
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet harrish , haink ad gys cheer Ghennesaret .

text: And when the men of that place had knowledge of him , they sent out into all that country round about , and brought unto him all that were diseased ;
text2: As tra hoig cummaltee yn voayl shen quoi v ' eh , hug ad fys magh gys ooilley yn cheer mygeayrt , as hug ad lhieu huggey ooilley adsyn va doghanit .

text: And besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment : and as many as touched were made perfectly whole .
text2: As ghuee ad er , ynrycan dy ventyn rish oirr e gharmad : as whilleen as venn rish , v ' ad er nyn lheihys .

text: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees , which were of Jerusalem , saying ,
text2: Eisht haink gys Yeesey scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn veih Jerusalem , gra ,

text: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders ? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread .
text2: Cre ' n - fa ta dty ostyllyn brishey oardaghyn y chanstyr ? son cha vel ad niee nyn laueyn ec goaill beaghey .

text: But he answered and said unto them , Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition ?
text2: Agh dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - oyr ta shiuish brishey sarey Yee liorish nyn oardaghyn ?

text: For God commanded , saying , Honour thy father and mother : and , He that curseth father or mother , let him die the death .
text2: Son hug Jee sarey , gra , Cur arrym da dty ayr as da dty voir : as , Eshyn ta gwee mollaght er ayr ny moir , lhig da ve currit dy baase .

text: But ye say , Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother , It is a gift , by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me ;
text2: Agh ta shiuish gra , Quoi - erbee jir rish ayr ny moir , Yn chooid - choonee shen oddagh uss jerkal rish voym ' s , te gioot er ny chasherickey gys Jee .

text: And honour not his father or his mother , he shall be free . Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition .
text2: As nagh lhiass da cooney sodjey ' choyrt da e ayr ny e voir . Ta shiu myr shoh jannoo sarey Yee gyn vree liorish ny oardaghyn eu .

text: Ye hypocrites , well did Esaias prophesy of you , saying ,
text2: Chrauee - oalsey , s ' mie ren Esaias phadeyrys jiuish , gra ,

text: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth , and honoureth me with their lips ; but their heart is far from me .
text2: Ta ' n pobble shoh tayrn er - gerrey dou lesh nyn meeal , as cur ooashley dou lesh nyn meillyn , agh ta ' n cree oc foddey voym .

text: But in vain they do worship me , teaching for doctrines the commandments of men .
text2: Agh ayns fardail t ' ad cur ooashley dou , gynsaghey son y goo aym ' s oardaghyn deiney .

text: And he called the multitude , and said unto them , Hear , and understand :
text2: As deie eh er y pobble , as dooyrt eh roo , Eaisht - jee as toig - jee .

text: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man ; but that which cometh out of the mouth , this defileth a man .
text2: Cha nee shen ta goll stiagh ayns veeal ta jannoo dooinney neu - ghlen : agh ny ta cheet magh ass y veeal , shen ta jannoo neu - ghlen jeh .

text: Then came his disciples , and said unto him , Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended , after they heard this saying ?
text2: Eisht haink e ostyllyn huggey , as dooyrt ad rish , Vel fys ayd dy rowl ny Phariseeyn jymmoosagh , tra cheayll ad raa shoh ?

text: But he answered and said , Every plant , which my heavenly Father hath not planted , shall be rooted up .
text2: Agh dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh , Bee dy chooilley villey , nagh vel my Ayr flaunyssagh er hoiaghey , er ny astyrt ass ny fraueyn .

text: Let them alone : they be blind leaders of the blind . And if the blind lead the blind , both shall fall into the ditch .
text2: Lhig - jee daue : she leeideilee doal ad ta kione y vooinjer ghoal . As my ta ' n doal shooyll kione y doal , tuittee ad ny - neesht ayns y jeeg .

text: Then answered Peter and said unto him , Declare unto us this parable .
text2: Eisht dreggyr Peddyr , as dooyrt eh rish , Soilshee dooinyn yn coraa - dorraghey shoh .

text: And Jesus said , Are ye also yet without understanding ?
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Vel shiuish neesht foast fegooish tushtey ?

text: Do not ye yet understand , that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly , and is cast out into the draught ?
text2: Nagh vel shiu foast toiggal , cre - erbee ta goit stiagh ayns y veeal , dy vel eh goll sheese ayns y volg , as goll magh trooid y chorp ?

text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart ; and they defile the man .
text2: Agh ta ny reddyn ta cheet magh ass y veeal , cheet veih ' n chree , as t ' ad shen jannoo dooinney neu - ghlen .

text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts , murders , adulteries , fornications , thefts , false witness , blasphemies :
text2: Son magh veih ' n chree ta cheet drogh smooinaghtyn , dunverys , brishey - poosey , maarderys , maarlys , feanish foalsey , goan mollaghtagh .

text: These are the things which defile a man : but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man .
text2: Ad shoh ny reddyn ta jannoo dooinney neu - ghlen : agh dy ee lesh laueyn nagh ve nieet , cha vel shen jannoo dooinney neu - ghlen .

text: Then Jesus went thence , and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon .
text2: Eisht hie Yeesey veih shen , as jimmee eh gys ardjyn Tyre as Sidon .

text: And , behold , a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts , and cried unto him , saying , Have mercy on me , O Lord , thou Son of David ; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil .
text2: As cur - my - ner va ben va ny Canaanite , haink magh ass ny ardjyn shen , geamagh as gra , Jean myghin orrym , O Hiarn , vac Ghavid ; s ' mooar ta my inneen er ny torchaghey lesh drogh - spyrryd .

text: But he answered her not a word . And his disciples came and besought him , saying , Send her away ; for she crieth after us .
text2: Agh cha dug eh fockle dy ansoor jee . As haink e ostyllyn , as ghuee ad er , gra , Lhig y raad j ' ee , son t ' ee gyllagh nyn yei .

text: But he answered and said , I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
text2: Agh dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh , Cha vel mish er my choyrt , agh gys kirree - cailjey thie Israel .

text: Then came she and worshipped him , saying , Lord , help me .
text2: Eisht haink ee , as hug , ee ooashley da , gra , Hiarn , cooin lhiam .

text: But he answered and said , It is not meet to take the children ' s bread , and to cast it to dogs .
text2: Agh dreggyr eh , as dooyrt eh , Cha vel eh cooie arran ny clienney y ghoaill , as y hilgey eh gys ny moddee .

text: And she said , Truth , Lord : yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters ' table .
text2: S ' feer shen , Hiarn , dooyrt ish : foast ta ny moddee gee jeh ' n vrooillagh ta tuittym jeh boayrd nyn mainshter .

text: Then Jesus answered and said unto her , O woman , great is thy faith : be it unto thee even as thou wilt . And her daughter was made whole from that very hour .
text2: Er shen dansoor Yeesey , as dooyrt eh r ' ee , O ven , s ' mooar ta dty chredjue : yn aghin t ' ou dy yeearree dy row ayd . As va ' n inneen eck er ny lheihys veih ' n oor cheddin .

text: And Jesus departed from thence , and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee ; and went up into a mountain , and sat down there .
text2: As jimmee Yeesey veih shen , as haink eh er - gerrey da faarkey Ghalilee , as hie eh seose er slieau , as hoie eh ayns shen .

text: And great multitudes came unto him , having with them those that were lame , blind , dumb , maimed , and many others , and cast them down at Jesus ' feet ; and he healed them :
text2: As haink earrooyn mooarey dy leih huggey , as nyn mast ' oc va croobee , doail , balloo , baccee , as ymmodee elley , as hug ad ad nyn lhie ec cassyn Yeesey , as ren eh ad y lheihys .

text: Insomuch that the multitude wondered , when they saw the dumb to speak , the maimed to be whole , the lame to walk , and the blind to see : and they glorified the God of Israel .
text2: Ayns wheesh as dy ghow ooilley ' n pobble yindys , tra honnick ad ny balloo loayrt , ny baccee slane , ny croobee shooyll as ny doail fakin , as ren ad Jee Israel y ghloyraghey .

text: Then Jesus called his disciples unto him , and said , I have compassion on the multitude , because they continue with me now three days , and have nothing to eat : and I will not send them away fasting , lest they faint in the way .
text2: Eisht deie Yeesey er e ostyllyn , as dooyrt eh , Ta chymmey aym er y pobble , er - yn - oyr dy vel ad er ve marym nish three laa , as cha vel monney beaghey oc dy ghoaill : as cha der - ym ad ersooyl nyn drostey , er aggle dy gannooinee ad er y raad .

text: And his disciples say unto him , Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness , as to fill so great a multitude ?
text2: Dooyrt e ostyllyn rish , Cre raad yiow mayd wheesh shen dy arran ' syn aasagh , as magh lheid yn earroo mooar dy leih ?

text: And Jesus saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? And they said , Seven , and a few little fishes .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Cre - woad bwilleen t ' eu ? Dooyrt adsyn , Shiaght , as kuse fardalagh dy eeastyn beggey .

text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground .
text2: As doardee eh da ' n pobble dy hoie er y thalloo .

text: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes , and gave thanks , and brake them , and gave to his disciples , and the disciples to the multitude .
text2: As ghow eh ny shiaght bwilleenyn , as ny eeastyn , as hug e booise , as vrish eh , as hug eh ad da e ostyllyn , as hirveish adsyn er y pobble ad .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled : and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets full .
text2: As ren ad ooilley gee , as v ' ad er nyn yannoo magh : as hrog ad jeh ' n fooilliagh va er - mayrn lane shiaght baskadyn .

text: And they that did eat were four thousand men , beside women and children .
text2: As v ' adsyn ren gee , kiare thousane dooinney , marish mraane as cloan .

text: And he sent away the multitude , and took ship , and came into the coasts of Magdala ,
text2: As hug eh ersooyl yn pobble , as ghow eh lhuingys , as haink eh gys ardjyn Vagdala .

text: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came , and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven .
text2: As haink ny Phariseeyn as ny Sadduceeyn dy phrowal eh , as hir ad er , eh dy yeeaghyn cowrey ennagh daue veih niau .

text: He answered and said unto them , When it is evening , ye say , It will be fair weather : for the sky is red .
text2: Dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Tra ta ' n fastyr er , jir shiuish , Bee emshyr aalin ayn : son dy vel jirgid ' syn aer .

text: And in the morning , It will be foul weather to day : for the sky is red and lowring . O ye hypocrites , ye can discern the face of the sky ; but can ye not discern the signs of the times ?
text2: As ayns y voghrey , Bee emshyr vroghe ayn jiu ; son ta ' n aer jiarg as dullyr . O shiuish chrauee - oalsey , ta toiggal eu kys dy ghoaill baght jeh neeal yn aer , as nagh vod shiu baght y ghoaill jeh cowraghyn ny hearishyn ?

text: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign ; and there shall no sign be given unto it , but the sign of the prophet Jonas . And he left them , and departed .
text2: She drogh - heeloghe as neu - ghooghyssagh ta shirrey cowrey , as cha bee cowrey er ny chur daue , agh cowrey yn adeyr Jonas . As daag eh ad , as jimmee eh roish .

text: And when his disciples were come to the other side , they had forgotten to take bread .
text2: Nish tra va e ostyllyn er n ' aagail y cheu elley , v ' ad er yarrood arran y chur

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Gow - jee twoaie , as bee - jee er nyn arrey noi soorid ny Phariseeyn as ny Sadduceeyn .

text: And they reasoned among themselves , saying , It is because we have taken no bread .
text2: As loayr ad re - cheilley , gra , Ta shoh er yn oyr nagh dug shin lhien arran .

text: Which when Jesus perceived , he said unto them , O ye of little faith , why reason ye among yourselves , because ye have brought no bread ?
text2: Tra hoig Yeesey shoh , dooyrt eh roo , Gheiney faase - chredjuagh , cre ' n - fa ta shiu resooney riu hene son nagh dug shiu lhieu arran ?

text: Do ye not yet understand , neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand , and how many baskets ye took up ?
text2: Nagh vel shiu foast toiggal , as nagh vel cooinaghtyn eu er ny queig bwilleenyn ren magh ny queig thousaneyn , as cre whilleen baskad d ' ooilliagh v ' eu ?

text: Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand , and how many baskets ye took up ?
text2: Ny er ny shiaght bwilleenyn ren magh ny kiare thousaneyn , as cre - woad baskad hrog shiu ?

text: How is it that ye do not understand that I spake it not to you concerning bread , that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees ?
text2: Kys te nagh vel shiu goaill eu hene nagh nee er arran va mee cheet , agh shiu dy ghoaill twoaie jeh soorid ny Phariseeyn as ny Sadduceeyn ?

text: Then understood they how that he bade them not beware of the leaven of bread , but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees .
text2: Eisht hoig ad nagh dug eh raaue daue noi soorid arran , agh noi ynsagh ny Phariseeyn as ny Sadduceeyn .

text: When Jesus came into the coasts of Caesarea Philippi , he asked his disciples , saying , Whom do men say that I the Son of man am ?
text2: Tra va Yeesey er jeet gys ardjyn Cesarea Philippi , denee eh jeh e ostyllyn , gra , Cre ta deiney dy ghra my - mychione ' s , Mac y dooinney , quoi mee hene ?

text: And they said , Some say that thou art John the Baptist : some , Elias ; and others , Jeremias , or one of the prophets .
text2: Dooyrt adsyn , Ta paart gra dy nee Ean Bashtey oo , as paart Elias , as ta feallagh elley gra dy nee Jeremias oo , ny fer jeh ny phadeyryn .

text: He saith unto them , But whom say ye that I am ?
text2: Dooyrt eshyn roo , Agh quoi ta shiuish gra , dy vel mee ?

text: And Simon Peter answered and said , Thou art the Christ , the Son of the living God .
text2: Dreggyr Simon Peddyr , as dooyrt eh , Uss yn Creest , Mac y Jee bio .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , Blessed art thou , Simon Barjona : for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee , but my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Dansoor Yeesey , as dooyrt eh rish , Bannit t ' ou uss Simon mac Jona : son cha nee feill as fuill t ' er hoilshaghey shoh dhyt ' s agh my Ayr t ' ayns niau .

text: And I say also unto thee , That thou art Peter , and upon this rock I will build my church ; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it .
text2: As ta mee myrgeddin gra rhyt , Dy nee uss Peddyr , as dy nee er y chreg shoh trog - ym ' s my agglish : as cha vow giattyn niurin yn varriaght urree .

text: And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven : and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven : and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven .
text2: As ver - yms dhyt ' s ogheryn reeriaght niau : as cre - erbee chianglys oo er y thalloo , bee eh kianlt ayns niau : as cre - erbee eayslys oo er y thalloo , bee eh er ny eaysley ayns niau .

text: Then charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ .
text2: Eisht hug eh currym er e ostyllyn gyn ad dy insh da dooinney erbee , dy nee eshyn va Yeesey yn Creest .

text: From that time forth began Jesus to shew unto his disciples , how that he must go unto Jerusalem , and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes , and be killed , and be raised again the third day .
text2: Veih yn traa shen magh ren Yeesey toshiaght dy hoilshaghey da e ostyllyn , kys dy beign da goll seose gys Jerusalem , as goll fo mooarane surranse veih ' n chanstyr , as ny ard - saggyrtyn , as ny scrudeyryn , as dy beagh eh er ny choyrt gy baase , agh dy n ' irragh eh reesht er y trass laa .

text: Then Peter took him , and began to rebuke him , saying , Be it far from thee , Lord : this shall not be unto thee .
text2: Eisht ghow Peddyr eh er - lheh , as ghow eh toshiaght dy choyrlaghey eh , gra , Foddey dy row eh void , Hiarn , lheid shoh dy haghyrt dhyt .

text: But he turned , and said unto Peter , Get thee behind me , Satan : thou art an offence unto me : for thou savourest not the things that be of God , but those that be of men .
text2: Agh hyndaa eshyn , as dooyrt eh rish Peddyr , Ass my enish , y violeyder , t ' ou cur ribbey ayns my raad : son cha vel ennaghtyn ayd jeh ny reddyn ta bentyn rish Jee , agh jeh ny reddyn ta bentyn rish deiney .

text: Then said Jesus unto his disciples , If any man will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and follow me .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish e ostyllyn My ta dooinney erbee aggindagh geiyrt orrym ' s , lhig da eh - hene y obbal , as e chrosh y hroggal , as geiyrt orrym .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it : and whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it .
text2: Son quoi - erbee baillish e vioys y hauail , caillee eh eh : as quoi - erbee chaillys e vioys er my ghraih ' s , sauee eh eh .

text: For what is a man profited , if he shall gain the whole world , and lose his own soul ? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul ?
text2: Son cre ' n vondeish t ' ec dooinney , my chosnys eh yn seihll ooilley , as e annym hene y choayl ? ny cre nee dooinney y choyrt ayns coonrey son e annym ?

text: For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels ; and then he shall reward every man according to his works .
text2: Son hig Mac y dooinney ayns gloyr e Ayrey , as e ainleyn casherick marish : as ec y traa shen cooilleenee eh da dy chooilley ghooinney cordail rish e obbraghyn .

text: Verily I say unto you , There be some standing here , which shall not taste of death , till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Dy vel paart nyn shassoo ayns shoh , nagh jean blashtyn er y baase , derrey hee ad Mac y dooinney cheet ayns e reeriaght .

text: And after six days Jesus taketh Peter , James , and John his brother , and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart ,
text2: As ec kione shey laa , ghow Yeesey Peddyr , as Jamys , as Ean e vraar , as hug eh lesh ad er - lheh seose er slieau ard ,

text: And was transfigured before them : and his face did shine as the sun , and his raiment was white as the light .
text2: As va ' n cummey echey er ny chaghlaa kiongoyrt roo , as ren yn eddin echey soilshean myr y ghrian , as va ' n coamrey echey gial myr y soilshey .

text: And , behold , there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him .
text2: As cur - my - ner , honnick ad Moses as Elias taggloo rish .

text: Then answered Peter , and said unto Jesus , Lord , it is good for us to be here : if thou wilt , let us make here three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias .
text2: Eisht dreggyr Peddyr as dooyrt eh rish Yeesey , Hiarn , s ' maynrey dooin dy hannaghtyn ayns shoh : my she dty aigney ' s eh , lhig dooin ayns shoh troggal three cabbaneyn : cabbane er dty hon ' s , as cabbane son Moses , as cabbane son Elias .

text: While he yet spake , behold , a bright cloud overshadowed them : and behold a voice out of the cloud , which said , This is my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased ; hear ye him .
text2: Choud as v ' eh foast loayrt , ren bodjal sollys skeayley harrystoo : as cur - my - ner haink coraa ass y vodjal , gra , Shoh my vac ennoil , ayn ta mee goaill slane taitnys , eaisht - jee rishyn .

text: And when the disciples heard it , they fell on their face , and were sore afraid .
text2: As tra cheayll ny ostyllyn eh , huitt ad sheese er nyn eddin gys y thalloo , son s ' mooar yn aggle v ' orroo .

text: And Jesus came and touched them , and said , Arise , and be not afraid .
text2: As haink Yeesey as venn eh roo , as dooyrt eh , Trog - jee erriu , as ny gow - jee aggle .

text: And when they had lifted up their eyes , they saw no man , save Jesus only .
text2: As tra hrog ad seose nyn sooillyn , cha vaik ad fer erbee , agh Yeesey ny - lomarcan .

text: And as they came down from the mountain , Jesus charged them , saying , Tell the vision to no man , until the Son of man be risen again from the dead .
text2: As myr v ' ad cheet neose jeh ' n clieau hug Yeesey currym orroo , gra , Ny insh - jee yn ashlish da unnane erbee , derrey vees Mac yn dooinney er n ' irree veih ny merriu .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come ?
text2: As denee e ostyllyn jeh , gra , Cre ' n - oyr jir ny scrudeyryn dy vel Elias dy heet hoshiaght ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Elias truly shall first come , and restore all things .
text2: Dansoor Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Hig Elias dy jarroo hoshiaght , as lhiassee eh dy chooilley nhee :

text: But I say unto you , That Elias is come already , and they knew him not , but have done unto him whatsoever they listed . Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them .
text2: Agh ta mish gra riu , dy vel Elias er jeet hannah , as cha dug ad geill da , agh t ' ad er ghellal rish lurg nyn aigney hene as er yn aght cheddin nee Mac y dooinney neesht surranse lioroo .

text: Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist .
text2: Eisht hoig e Ostyllyn dy nee er Ean Bashtey v ' eh cheet .

text: And when they were come to the multitude , there came to him a certain man , kneeling down to him , and saying ,
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet gys y cheshaght , haink huggey dooinney dy row , gliooney sheese as gra ,

text: Lord , have mercy on my son : for he is lunatick , and sore vexed : for ofttimes he falleth into the fire , and oft into the water .
text2: Hiarn , jean chymmey er my vac , son t ' eh ass e cheeayl , as dy mooar seaghnit : son t ' eh dy mennick tuittym ayns yn aile , as dy mennick ayns yn ushtey .

text: And I brought him to thy disciples , and they could not cure him .
text2: As hug mee lhiam eh gys dty ostyllyn , as cha yarg ad eh y lheihys .

text: Then Jesus answered and said , O faithless and perverse generation , how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I suffer you ? bring him hither to me .
text2: Dansoor Yeesey as dooyrt eh , O heeloghe vee - chredjuagh as roonagh , caid ta mish dy ve meriu ? caid ta mee dy hurranse diu ? cur lhiat eh hym ' s ayns shoh .

text: And Jesus rebuked the devil ; and he departed out of him : and the child was cured from that very hour .
text2: As vaggyr Yeesey er y drogh - spyrryd , as hie eh magh ass : as va ' n lhiannoo er ny lheihys veih ' n oor shen .

text: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart , and said , Why could not we cast him out ?
text2: Eisht haink e ostyllyn gys Yeesey er - lheh , as dooyrt ad , Cre liorish nagh voddagh shinyn eh y lheihys ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Because of your unbelief : for verily I say unto you , If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye shall say unto this mountain , Remove hence to yonder place ; and it shall remove ; and nothing shall be impossible unto you .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Kyndagh rish nyn gredjue moal : son dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Dy beagh nyn gredjue wheesh grine dy rass mustard , jirragh shiu rish y slieau shoh , Scugh veih shoh noon gys shid , as nee eh scughey : as cha bee nhee erbee ro - ghoillee diu .

text: Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting .
text2: Ny - yeih cha vel y dooghys shoh dy ghrogh - spyrrydyn dy ve castit , agh liorish padjer as trostey .

text: And while they abode in Galilee , Jesus said unto them , The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men :
text2: As choud as v ' ad ayns Galilee , dooyrt Yeesey roo , Bee Mac y dooinney er ny vrah gys laueyn deiney :

text: And they shall kill him , and the third day he shall be raised again . And they were exceeding sorry .
text2: As ver ad eh gy - baase , as y trass laa nee eh girree reesht : as v ' ad feer trimshagh .

text: And when they were come to Capernaum , they that received tribute money came to Peter , and said , Doth not your master pay tribute ?
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet gys Capernaum , haink y vooinjer va troggal argid y cheesh gys Peddyr , gra , Nagh vel y mainshter euish geeck y cheesh ?

text: He saith , Yes . And when he was come into the house , Jesus prevented him , saying , What thinkest thou , Simon ? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute ? of their own children , or of strangers ?
text2: Dooyrt eshyn , Dy row . As tra v ' eh er jeet stiagh ayns y thie , va Yeesey ro - laue rish , gra , Cre t ' ou smooinaghtyn , Simon , quoi jeh ta reeaghyn y thallooin troggal custom ny keesh ? jeh nyn gloan hene , ny jeh joarreeyn ?

text: Peter saith unto him , Of strangers . Jesus saith unto him , Then are the children free .
text2: Dooyrt Peddyr rish , Jeh joarreeyn . Dooyrt Yeesey rishyn , Eisht ta ' n chloan seyr .

text: Notwithstanding , lest we should offend them , go thou to the sea , and cast an hook , and take up the fish that first cometh up ; and when thou hast opened his mouth , thou shalt find a piece of money : that take , and give unto them for me and thee .
text2: Ny - yeih , son nagh bee cumys er ny chur hooin , immee uss gys y cheayn , as lhig sheese dooan , as trog y chied eeast hig hood : as tra vees oo er vosley e veeal , yiow peesh dy argid ayn ; shen gow , as eeck eh er my hon ' s as er dty hon hene .

text: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus , saying , Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven ?
text2: Ec y traa cheddin haink e ostyllyn gys Yeesey , gra , Quoi syrjey ta ayns reeriaght niau ?

text: And Jesus called a little child unto him , and set him in the midst of them ,
text2: As deie Yeesey er lhiannoo beg , as hoie eh eh kiongoyrt roo

text: And said , Verily I say unto you , Except ye be converted , and become as little children , ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Mannagh jean shiu chyndaa , as cheet dy ve myr cloan veggey , cha jed shiu stiagh ayns reeriaght niau .

text: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child , the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Quoi - erbee er - y - fa shen , nee eh - hene y injillaghey myr y lhiannoo beg shoh , eh syrjey vees ayns reeriaght niau .

text: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me .
text2: As quoi - erbee nee soiaghey jeh lheid y lhiannoo beg shoh ayns yn ennym aym ' s , t ' eh jannoo soiaghey jeem ' s .

text: But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me , it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea .
text2: Agh quoi - erbee ver oyr da unnane jeh ' n vooinjer veggey shoh ta credjal aynym ' s dy huittym ( veih ' n chredjue ) veagh eh ny baare da dy beagh clagh - wyllin er ve croghit mysh e wannal , as eh dy ve baiht ayns diunid ny marrey .

text: Woe unto the world because of offences ! for it must needs be that offences come ; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh !
text2: Smerg da ' n theihll kyndagh rish oyryn peccah : son shegin da nyn lheid ' ve ayn ; agh smerg da ' n dooinney , liorish ta ' n loght cheet .

text: Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee , cut them off , and cast them from thee : it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed , rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire .
text2: Shen - y - fa my ta dty laue ny dty chass hene dy dty hayrn gys yn olk , giare jeed , as tilg void ad ; te ny share dhyt goll stiagh ayns bea croobagh ny baccagh , na daa laue ny daa chass y ve ayd , as oo dy ve tilgit ayns yn aile dy bragh farraghtyn .

text: And if thine eye offend thee , pluck it out , and cast it from thee : it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye , rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire .
text2: As my ta dty hooill dy dty hayrn gys peccah , pluck assyd , as tilg void ee : te ny share dhyt goll stiagh ayns bea lesh un hooill , na daa hooill y ve ayd , as oo dy ve tilgit ayns aile niurin .

text: Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones ; for I say unto you , That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Cur - jee twoaie nagh soie shiu beg jeh unnane jeh ' n vooinjer veggey shoh : son ta mee gra riu , dy vel ny ainleyn ocsyn ayns niau , kinjagh cur - my - ner eddin my Ayr flaunyssagh .

text: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost .
text2: Son ta Mac y dooinney er jeet dy hauail shen ny va caillit .

text: How think ye ? if a man have an hundred sheep , and one of them be gone astray , doth he not leave the ninety and nine , and goeth into the mountains , and seeketh that which is gone astray ?
text2: Cre ta shiu smooinaghtyn ? My ta keead keyrrey ec dooinney , as unnane jeu v ' er n ' gholl er - shaghryn , nagh vel eh faagail yn chiare - feed as yn nuy - jeig , as goll gys ny sleityn , as shirrey yn cheyrrey chailjey ?

text: And if so be that he find it , verily I say unto you , he rejoiceth more of that sheep , than of the ninety and nine which went not astray .
text2: As my she shen dy vel eh dy gheddyn ee , dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy vel eh goaill ny smoo dy voggey jeh ' n cheyrrey shen , ny jeh ' n chiare - feed as yn nuy - jeig , nagh jagh er - shaghryn .

text: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven , that one of these little ones should perish .
