text2: Er yn aght cheddin , cha nee aigney nyn Ayr t ' ayns niau eh , unnane jeh ' n vooinjer veggey shoh dy herraghtyn .

text: Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee , go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone : if he shall hear thee , thou hast gained thy brother .
text2: Myrgeddin my nee dty vraar aggair dhyt , immee as insh da e oill eddyr shiu hene nyn - lomarcan : my eaishtys eh rhyt , t ' ou er chosney dty vraar .

text: But if he will not hear thee , then take with thee one or two more , that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established .
text2: Agh mannagh n ' eaisht eh rhyt , eisht gow mayrt fer ny jees elley , ayns beeal ghaa ny three dy eanishyn dy vod dy chooilley ockle ve jeant mie .

text: And if he shall neglect to hear them , tell it unto the church : but if he neglect to hear the church , let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican .
text2: As mannagh der eh geill dauesyn , insh eh da ' n agglish : agh mannagh der eh geill da ' n agglish , jeeagh er myr an - chreestee as myr publican .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven : and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Cre erbee nee shiuish y chiangley er y thalloo , bee eh kianlt ayns niau : as cre - erbee nee shiu y eaysley er y thalloo , bee eh er ny eaysley ayns niau .

text: Again I say unto you , That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask , it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Reesht ta mee gra riu , my nee jees jiuish coardail er y thalloo ' syn un aghin bee nyn aghin er ny chooilleeney liorish my Ayr t ' ayns niau .

text: For where two or three are gathered together in my name , there am I in the midst of them .
text2: Son raad ta ghaa ny three er nyn jaglym cooidjagh ayns m ' ennym ' s , shen y raad ta mish nyn mastey .

text: Then came Peter to him , and said , Lord , how oft shall my brother sin against me , and I forgive him ? till seven times ?
text2: Eisht haink Peddyr huggey , as dooyrt eh , Hiarn , cre cha mennick as ta orrym ' s leih da my vraar , tra yioym aggair liorish ? nee choud as shiaght keayrtyn ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , I say not unto thee , Until seven times : but , Until seventy times seven .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Cha vel mish gra rhyt , Choud as shiaght keayrtyn : agh choud as three - feed as jeih keayrtyn shiaght .

text: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king , which would take account of his servants .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta reeriaght niau er ny hoylaghey gys ree dy row , baillish coontey rish e harvaantyn .

text: And when he had begun to reckon , one was brought unto him , which owed him ten thousand talents .
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' yannoo toshiaght dy choontey , haink fer huggey va lhiastyn da jeih thousane talent .

text: But forasmuch as he had not to pay , his lord commanded him to be sold , and his wife , and children , and all that he had , and payment to be made .
text2: Agh son wheesh as nagh row echey dy eeck , doardee e hiarn eh dy ve creckit as e ven , as e chloan , as ooilley ny v ' echey , as e eeaghyn dy ve eeckit .

text: The servant therefore fell down , and worshipped him , saying , Lord , have patience with me , and I will pay thee all .
text2: Huitt y charvaant er - y - fa shen sheese , as ghuee eh er , gra , Cur daill dou , Hiarn , as nee ' m ooilley y eeck dhyt .

text: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion , and loosed him , and forgave him the debt .
text2: Eisht va chiarn y charvaant shen er ny veiyghey lesh chymmey , as ren eh feaysley er , as leih eh da ny v ' eh dy lhiastyn .

text: But the same servant went out , and found one of his fellowservants , which owed him an hundred pence : and he laid hands on him , and took him by the throat , saying , Pay me that thou owest .
text2: Agh hie yn charvaant cheddin magh , as hooar eh fer jeh e heshaghyn - sharvaant va lhiastyn keead ping da : as haare eh greme er , as ghow eh eh er y scoarnagh , gra , Eeck shen ny t ' ou dy lhiastyn .

text: And his fellowservant fell down at his feet , and besought him , saying , Have patience with me , and I will pay thee all .
text2: As huitt e heshey - harvaant sheese ec e chassyn , as ghuee eh er , gra , Cur daill dou as nee ' m ooilley y eeck dhyt .

text: And he would not : but went and cast him into prison , till he should pay the debt .
text2: Agh cha lhiggagh eh lesh : agh hie eh , as hilg eh eh ayns pryssoon , derrey eeckagh eh ny v ' eh dy lhiastyn .

text: So when his fellowservants saw what was done , they were very sorry , and came and told unto their lord all that was done .
text2: Myr shen tra honnick e heshaghyn - sharvaant kys hie eh er , ghow ad dy feer olk rish , as haink ad , as dinsh ad da nyn jiarn ooilley ny va er daghyrt .

text: Then his lord , after that he had called him , said unto him , O thou wicked servant , I forgave thee all that debt , because thou desiredst me :
text2: Eisht deie e hiarn er , as dooyrt eh rish , O ghrogh harvaant , leih mish dhyt ' s yn slane lhiastynys shen , er - yn - oyr dy ren oo lheid yn aghin hym :

text: Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant , even as I had pity on thee ?
text2: Nagh lhisagh uss myrgeddin as chymmey er ve ayd er dty heshey - harvaant , eer myr va chymmey aym ' s ort ' s ?

text: And his lord was wroth , and delivered him to the tormentors , till he should pay all that was due unto him .
text2: As va e hiarn jymmoosagh , as livrey eh seose eh gys laue y tidoor ny phryssoonagh , derrey eeckagh eh ooilley ny v ' eh dy lhiastyn .

text: So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you , if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses .
text2: Er yn aght shoh myrgeddin nee my Ayr flaunyssagh riuish , mannagh leihee shiu veih nyn greeaghyn dy chooilley ghooinney da e vraar e loghtyn .

text: And it came to pass , that when Jesus had finished these sayings , he departed from Galilee , and came into the coasts of Judaea beyond Jordan ;
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , erreish da Yeesey v ' er loayrt ny goan shoh , dy jimmee eh veih Galilee , as dy daink eh gys ardjyn Yudea , er cheu elley dy Yordan :

text: And great multitudes followed him ; and he healed them there .
text2: As deiyr earrooyn mooarey dy leih er , ren eh ad y lheihys ayns shen .

text: The Pharisees also came unto him , tempting him , and saying unto him , Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause ?
text2: Haink ny Phariseeyn huggey myrgeddin dy phrowal eh , as dooyrt ad rish , Vel eh lowal da dooinney e ven y chur er sooyl son dy chooilley oyr ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , Have ye not read , that he which made them at the beginning made them male and female ,
text2: Dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Nagh vel shiu er lhaih , eshyn chroo ad ec y toshiaght , dy chroo eh ad fyrrynagh as bwoirrynagh ?

text: And said , For this cause shall a man leave father and mother , and shall cleave to his wife : and they twain shall be one flesh ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Er - yn - oyr shoh nee dooinney faagail e ayr as e voir , as lhiannee eh gys e ven : as bee ad ny - neesht un eill .

text: Wherefore they are no more twain , but one flesh . What therefore God hath joined together , let not man put asunder .
text2: Shen - y - fa cha vel ad ny sodjey jees , agh yn un eill . Cre - erbee er - y - fa shen ta Jee er chur cooidjagh , ny lhig da dooinney erbee y scarrey veih - my - cheilley .

text: They say unto him , Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement , and to put her away ?
text2: Dooyrt adsyn rish , Cre ' n - oyr eisht doardee Moses screeuyn - scarree y choyrt , as y ven y chur ersooyl ?

text: He saith unto them , Moses because of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives : but from the beginning it was not so .
text2: Dooyrt eshyn roo , kyndagh rish creoghys nyn greeaghyn , lhow Moses diu nyn mraane y chur ersooyl : agh ec y toshiaght cha row eh myr shen .

text: And I say unto you , Whosoever shall put away his wife , except it be for fornication , and shall marry another , committeth adultery : and whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adultery .
text2: As ta mish gra riu , Quoi - erbee scarrys rish e ven , cheu - mooie jeh son maarderys , as phoosys ben elley , t ' eh brishey - poosey : as quoi - erbee phoosys ish ta scarrit , t ' eh brishey poosey :

text: His disciples say unto him , If the case of the man be so with his wife , it is not good to marry .
text2: Dooyrt e ostyllyn rish , My she shoh yn chooish eddyr dooinney as e ven , cha vel eh mie dy phoosey .

text: But he said unto them , All men cannot receive this saying , save they to whom it is given .
text2: Agh dooyrt eshyn roo , Cha nee dy chooilley ghooinney oddys shen y ghoaill er , agh adsyn ny - lomarcan daue te er ny choyrt .

text: For there are some eunuchs , which were so born from their mother ' s womb : and there are some eunuchs , which were made eunuchs of men : and there be eunuchs , which have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven ' s sake . He that is able to receive it , let him receive it .
text2: Son ta deiney gennish ayn , rug myr shen veih brein nyn mayrey : as ta deiney gennish ayn , v ' er nyn yannoo gennish liorish deiney : as ta deiney gennish ayn , t ' er n ' yannoo ad - hene gennish er graih reeriaght niau . Eshyn oddys shoh y ghoaill er , lhig da ' ghoaill eh .

text: Then were there brought unto him little children , that he should put his hands on them , and pray : and the disciples rebuked them .
text2: Eisht hug ad lhieu huggey cloan veggey , dy chur e laueyn orroo , as dy vannaghey ad : as hug e ostyllyn oghsan daue .

text: But Jesus said , Suffer little children , and forbid them not , to come unto me : for of such is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Agh dooyrt Yeesey , Sur - jee cloan aegey , as ny jean - jee ad y lhiettal dy heet hym ' s : son jeh nyn lheid ta reeriaght niau .

text: And he laid his hands on them , and departed thence .
text2: As hug eh e laueyn orroo , as jimmee eh veih shen .

text: And , behold , one came and said unto him , Good Master , what good thing shall I do , that I may have eternal life ?
text2: As cur - my - ner , haink fer huggey , as dooyrt eh rish , Vainshter vie , cre ' n obbyr ne lhisins y yannoo dy chosney yn vea veayn ?

text: And he said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? there is none good but one , that is , God : but if thou wilt enter into life , keep the commandments .
text2: As dooyrt eshyn rish , Cre ' n - fa t ' ou genmys mish mie ? cha vel ayn ny ta mie , agh unnane , ynrycan Jee : agh my sailts goll stiagh ayns bea , freill ny annaghyn .

text: He saith unto him , Which ? Jesus said , Thou shalt do no murder , Thou shalt not commit adultery , Thou shalt not steal , Thou shalt not bear false witness ,
text2: Dooyrt eshyn rish , Cre ny annaghyn ? Dooyrt Yeesey , Cha jean oo dunverys , Cha brish oo poosey , Cha jean oo geid , Cha n ' ymmyrk oo feanish foalsey ,

text: Honour thy father and thy mother : and , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Cur arrym da dty ayr as da dty voir : as , Ver oo graih da dty naboo myr dhyt hene .

text: The young man saith unto him , All these things have I kept from my youth up : what lack I yet ?
text2: Dooyrt y dooinney aeg rish , Ooilley ny annaghyn shoh ta mee er vreayll veih my aegid : cre sodjey t ' orrym dy vannoo ?

text: Jesus said unto him , If thou wilt be perfect , go and sell that thou hast , and give to the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come and follow me .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , My sailt ve dy firrinagh mie , immee , as creck , as cur ny t ' ayd da ny boghtyn , as bee berchys ayd ayns niau ; as tar as eiyr orrym ' s .

text: But when the young man heard that saying , he went away sorrowful : for he had great possessions .
text2: Agh tra cheayll yn dooinney aeg yn raa shen , hie eh ersooyl dy trimshagh : son va state mooar hallooin echey .

text: Then said Jesus unto his disciples , Verily I say unto you , That a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish e ostyllyn , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , S ' doillee hed dooinney berchagh stiagh ayns reeriaght niau .

text: And again I say unto you , It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: As reesht ta mee gra riu , Te ny sassey da camel goll trooid croae snaidey , na da dooinney berchagh dy gholl stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee .

text: When his disciples heard it , they were exceedingly amazed , saying , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Tra cheayll e ostyllyn shoh , ghow ad yindys erskyn - towse , gra , Quoi eisht oddys ve er ny hauail ?

text: But Jesus beheld them , and said unto them , With men this is impossible ; but with God all things are possible .
text2: Agh yeeagh Yeesey orroo , as dooyrt eh roo , Gys deiney ta shoh neu - phossible , agh da Jee ta dy chooilley nhee possible .

text: Then answered Peter and said unto him , Behold , we have forsaken all , and followed thee ; what shall we have therefore ?
text2: Eisht dreggyr Peddyr , as dooyrt eh rish , Cur - my - ner , ta shinyn er dreigeil ooilley , as er n ' eiyrt ort ' s ; cre yiow mainyn er - y - fa shen .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Verily I say unto you , That ye which have followed me , in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit in the throne of his glory , ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones , judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , ' Sy stayd noa , tra nee Mac y dooinney soie er stoyl - reeoil e ghloyr , dy jean shiuish myrgeddin t ' er n ' eiyrt orrym ' s soie er daa stoyl - reeoil yeig , briwnys daa heeloghe yeig Israel .

text: And every one that hath forsaken houses , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or lands , for my name ' s sake , shall receive an hundredfold , and shall inherit everlasting life .
text2: As dy chooilley unnane t ' er hreigeil thieyn , ny braaraghyn , ny shayraghyn , ny ayr , ny moir , ny ben , ny cloan , ny thalloo , er graih m ' ennym ' s , yiow ad keead filley , as eiraght ayns y vea veayn .

text: But many that are first shall be last ; and the last shall be first .
text2: Agh bee ymmodee jeusyn ta hoshiaght , er - jerrey ; as jeusyn ta er - jerrey hoshiaght .

text: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder , which went out early in the morning to hire labourers into his vineyard .
text2: Son ta reeriaght niau casley rish dooinney va ny er - thie , hie magh dy moghey dy ailley labreeyn son e gharey - feeyney .

text: And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day , he sent them into his vineyard .
text2: As tra v ' eh er choardail rish ny labreeyn son ping ' sy laa , hug eh ad stiagh ayns e gharey - feeyney .

text: And he went out about the third hour , and saw others standing idle in the marketplace ,
text2: As hie eh magh mysh y trass oor , as honnick eh feallagh elley shassoo nyn daaue ' syn ynnyd - margee ,

text: And said unto them ; Go ye also into the vineyard , and whatsoever is right I will give you . And they went their way .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Immee - jee shiuish myrgeddin gys y gharey - feeyney , as cre erbee ta cair , shen yiow shiu . As hie ad rhymboo .

text: Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour , and did likewise .
text2: Reesht hie eh magh mysh y cheyoo as yn nuyoo oor , as ren eh er yn aght cheddin .

text: And about the eleventh hour he went out , and found others standing idle , and saith unto them , Why stand ye here all the day idle ?
text2: As mysh yn un oor jeig , hie eh magh , as hooar eh feallagh elley shassoo nyn daaue , as dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu nyn shassoo ayns shoh fey ny laa nyn daaue ?

text: They say unto him , Because no man hath hired us . He saith unto them , Go ye also into the vineyard ; and whatsoever is right , that shall ye receive .
text2: Dooyrt adsyn rish , Er - yn - oyr nagh vel dooinney erbee er vailley shin . Dooyrt eshyn roo , Immee - jee shiuish myrgeddin gys y gharey - feeyney , as yiow shiu cre - erbee ta cair .

text: So when even was come , the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward , Call the labourers , and give them their hire , beginning from the last unto the first .
text2: Myr shen tra va ' n fastyr er jeet , dooyrt chiarn y gharey - feeyney rish y stiurt echey , Eie er ny labreeyn , as cur daue nyn vaill , goaill toshiaght veih yn vooinjer s ' jerree gys y chied eallagh .

text: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour , they received every man a penny .
text2: As tra haink feallagh yn un oor jeig hooar ad dagh dooinney jeu ping y pheesh .

text: But when the first came , they supposed that they should have received more ; and they likewise received every man a penny .
text2: Agh tra haink y chied eallagh , heill ad dy voghe ad ny smoo , as hooar adsyn myrgeddin dagh dooinney e phing .

text: And when they had received it , they murmured against the goodman of the house ,
text2: As tra v ' ad er ghoaill eh , ren ad tallagh noi yn er - thie .

text: Saying , These last have wrought but one hour , and thou hast made them equal unto us , which have borne the burden and heat of the day .
text2: Gra , Cha vel yn vooinjer s ' jerree shoh er n ' obbraghey agh un oor , as t ' ou er n ' yannoo ad corrym rooinyn ta er n ' ymmyrkey yn errey as chiass y laa .

text: But he answered one of them , and said , Friend , I do thee no wrong : didst not thou agree with me for a penny ?
text2: Agh dreggyr eshyn fer jeu , gra , Heshey vie , cha vel mish jannoo aggair dhyt : nagh choard uss rhym ' s son ping ?

text: Take that thine is , and go thy way : I will give unto this last , even as unto thee .
text2: Trog shen ny ta lhiat , as immee royd : m ' aigney ' s eh dy choyrt da ' n fer s ' jerree shoh , myr ta mee er chur dhyt ' s .

text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own ? Is thine eye evil , because I am good ?
text2: Nagh vel eh lowal dou dy yannoo cre saillym rish my chooid hene ? vel dty hooill ' s olk , er - yn - oyr dy vel mish mie ?

text: So the last shall be first , and the first last : for many be called , but few chosen .
text2: Myr shen bee adsyn ta er - jerrey hoshiaght , as adsyn ta hoshiaght er - jerrey : son shimmey t ' er nyn eam , agh s ' tiark t ' er nyn reih .

text: And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way , and said unto them ,
text2: As myr va Yeesey goll seose gys Jerusalem , ghow eh yn daa ostyl yeig dy lhiattee er y raad , as dooyrt eh roo ,

text: Behold , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes , and they shall condemn him to death ,
text2: Cur - my - ner ta shin goll seose gys Jerusalem , as bee Mac y dooinney er ny vrah gys ny ard - saggyrtyn , as gys ny scrudeyryn , as deyree ad eh gy - baase .

text: And shall deliver him to the Gentiles to mock , and to scourge , and to crucify him : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: As livreyee ad seose eh gys ny Ashoonee , as nee ad faghid er , as eh y scuitchal , as y chrossey : as er y trass laa nee eh girree reesht ( veih ny merriu ) .

text: Then came to him the mother of Zebedee ' s children with her sons , worshipping him , and desiring a certain thing of him .
text2: Eisht haink huggey moir cloan Zebedee , as e mec maree , cur ooashley da , as shirrey aghin er .

text: And he said unto her , What wilt thou ? She saith unto him , Grant that these my two sons may sit , the one on thy right hand , and the other on the left , in thy kingdom .
text2: As dooyrt eh r ' ee , Cre ta dty yeearree ? Dooyrt ish rish , Giall daue shoh my ghaa vac dy hoie , yn derrey yeh er dty laue yesh , as y jeh elley er dty laue hoshtal ayns dty reeriaght .

text: But Jesus answered and said , Ye know not what ye ask . Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of , and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with ? They say unto him , We are able .
text2: Agh dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh , Cha vel fys eu hene cre ta shiu dy yeearree . Vod shiu giu jeh ' n cappan ta mish giu jeh , as v ' er nyn mashtey lesh y bashtey ta mish dy ve bashtit lesh ? Dooyrt adsyn rish , Foddee mayd .

text: And he saith unto them , Ye shall drink indeed of my cup , and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with : but to sit on my right hand , and on my left , is not mine to give , but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared of my Father .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Iuee shiu dy jarroo jeh my chappan , as bee shiu er nyn mashtey lesh y bashtey ta mish dy ve bashtit lesh : agh dy hoie er my laue yesh , as er my laue hoshtal , cha vel shen lhiam ' s dy - choyrt , agh ny - lomarcan dauesyn er nyn son te kiarit liorish my Ayr .

text: And when the ten heard it , they were moved with indignation against the two brethren .
text2: As tra cheayll yn jeih shoh , v ' ad feer jymmoosagh rish y daa vraar .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them , and they that are great exercise authority upon them .
text2: Agh deie Yeesey orroo huggey , as dooyrt eh , Ta fys eu dy vel princeyn ny Hashoonee gymmyrkey chiarnys harrystoo , as ta ny ard - gheiney gymmyrkey reill orroo .

text: But it shall not be so among you : but whosoever will be great among you , let him be your minister ;
text2: Agh cha bee shillish myr shen : agh quoi - erbee jiuish baillish ve ooasle , lhig da ve nyn shirveishagh .

text: And whosoever will be chief among you , let him be your servant :
text2: As quoi - erbee baillish ve yn ard - ghooinney nyn mast ' eu , lhig da ve yn charvaant eu .

text: Even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto , but to minister , and to give his life a ransom for many .
text2: Myr nagh daink yn Mac dooinney dy ve shirveishit er , agh dy hirveish , as dy chur e vioys ny lhiassaghey son ymmodee .

text: And as they departed from Jericho , a great multitude followed him .
text2: As tra v ' ad er n ' immeeaght veih Jericho deiyr earrooyn mooarey dy leih er .

text: And , behold , two blind men sitting by the way side , when they heard that Jesus passed by , cried out , saying , Have mercy on us , O Lord , thou Son of David .
text2: As cur - my - ner , va daa ghooinney doal nyn soie rish oirr yn raad , as tra cheayll ad dy row Yeesey goll shaghey , deie ad , gra , Jean myghin orrin , O Hiarn , vac Ghavid .

text: And the multitude rebuked them , because they should hold their peace : but they cried the more , saying , Have mercy on us , O Lord , thou Son of David .
text2: As hooar yn pobble foill daue , ad dy ve nyn - dhost : agh deie adsyn wheesh shen smoo , gra , Jean myghin orrin , O Hiarn , vac Ghavid .

text: And Jesus stood still , and called them , and said , What will ye that I shall do unto you ?
text2: As hass Yeesey , as deie eh orroo , as dooyrt eh , Cre bailliu mee dy yannoo er ny son eu ?

text: They say unto him , Lord , that our eyes may be opened .
text2: Dooyrt adsyn rish , Hiarn , dy vod ny sooillyn ain v ' er nyn vosley .

text: So Jesus had compassion on them , and touched their eyes : and immediately their eyes received sight , and they followed him .
text2: Myr shen va chymmey ec Yeesey orroo , as venn eh rish ny sooillyn oc : as chelleeragh hooar ny sooillyn oc nyn soilshey , as deiyr ad er .

text: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem , and were come to Bethphage , unto the mount of Olives , then sent Jesus two disciples ,
text2: As tra v ' ad tayrn er - gerrey da Jerusalem , as dy row ad er jeet gys Bethphage , gys cronk ny Oliveyn , hug Yeesey jees jeh e ostyllyn er chaghteraght ,

text: Saying unto them , Go into the village over against you , and straightway ye shall find an ass tied , and a colt with her : loose them , and bring them unto me .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Immee - jee gys y balley - cheerey ta shiu dy akin , as chelleeragh yiow shiu assyl kianlt as lhiy maree : feayshil - jee as cur - jee lhieu ad hym ' s .

text: And if any man say ought unto you , ye shall say , The Lord hath need of them ; and straightway he will send them .
text2: As my loayrys dooinney erbee veg riu , abbyr - jee shiuish , Ta feme ec y Chiarn orroo ; as chelleeragh lhiggee eh yn raad daue .

text: All this was done , that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , saying ,
text2: Va ooilley shoh jeant , dy voddagh shen ve cooilleenit va loayrit liorish y phadeyr gra ,

text: Tell ye the daughter of Sion , Behold , thy King cometh unto thee , meek , and sitting upon an ass , and a colt the foal of an ass .
text2: Insh - jee da inneen Sion , Cur - my - ner , ta dty ree cheet hood dy imlee , as ny hoie er assyl , as er lhiy sharragh assyl .

text: And the disciples went , and did as Jesus commanded them ,
text2: As hie adsyn rhymboo , as ren ad myr va Yeesey er n ' oardaghey daue .

text: And brought the ass , and the colt , and put on them their clothes , and they set him thereon .
text2: As hug ad lhieu yn assyl as y lhiy , as hug ad orroo nyn eaddeeyn , as hug ad eshyn ny hoie orroo .

text: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way ; others cut down branches from the trees , and strawed them in the way .
text2: As ren earrooyn mooarey dy leih skeayley nyn gharmadyn er y raad ; yiare feallagh elley banglaneyn jeh ny biljyn , as skeayl ad ad er y raad .

text: And the multitudes that went before , and that followed , cried , saying , Hosanna to the Son of David : Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord ; Hosanna in the highest .
text2: As deie yn pobble hie roish , as adsyn haink ny yei , gra , Hosanna gys mac Ghavid : bannit t ' eshyn ta cheet ayns ennym y Chiarn , Hosanna ayns yn yrjid .

text: And when he was come into Jerusalem , all the city was moved , saying , Who is this ?
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet gys Jerusalem , va ooilley yn ard - valley ayns anvea , gra , Quoi eh shoh ?

text: And the multitude said , This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee .
text2: Dooyrt y pobble , Shoh Yeesey yn phadeyr , ta veih Nazareth ayns Galilee .

text: And Jesus went into the temple of God , and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple , and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers , and the seats of them that sold doves ,
text2: As hie Yeesey stiagh ayns chiamble Yee , as deiyr eh magh ooilley adsyn va creck as kionnaghey ayns y chiamble , as hilg eh harrish ny buird ocsyn va caghlaa argid , as ny stuill ocsyn va creck calmaneyn .

text: And said unto them , It is written , My house shall be called the house of prayer ; but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Te scruit , Bee my hie ' s enmyssit thie yn phadjer , agh ta shiuish er n ' yannoo eh ny ooig dy vaarlee .

text: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple ; and he healed them .
text2: As haink ny doail as ny croobee huggey gys y chiamble , as ren eh ad y lheihys .

text: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did , and the children crying in the temple , and saying , Hosanna to the Son of David ; they were sore displeased ,
text2: As tra honnick ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny scruderyn ny reddyn yindyssagh v ' eh dy yannoo , as ny paitchyn geamagh ayns y chiamble , as gra , Hosanna gys mac Ghavid , v ' ad feer chorree .

text: And said unto him , Hearest thou what these say ? And Jesus saith unto them , Yea ; have ye never read , Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise ?
text2: As dooyrt ad rish , Vel oo clashtyn cre t ' ad shoh dy ghra ? Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Ta mee ; nagh lhaih shiuish rieau , Magh ass beill oikanyn as cloan er y cheeagh t ' ou er gheddyn moylley firrinagh ?

text: And he left them , and went out of the city into Bethany ; and he lodged there .
text2: As daag eh ad , as hie eh magh ass yn ard - valley gys Bethany , as ghow eh aaght ayns shen .

text: Now in the morning as he returned into the city , he hungered .
text2: Nish ayns y voghrey , myr v ' eh goll reesht gys yn ard - valley , v ' eh accryssagh .

text: And when he saw a fig tree in the way , he came to it , and found nothing thereon , but leaves only , and said unto it , Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever . And presently the fig tree withered away .
text2: As tra honnick eh billey - figgagh er y raad , haink eh huggey , as cha dooar eh monney er , agh ynrycan duillagyn , as dooyrt eh rish , Nar aase mess erbee ort ' s veih shoh magh er son dy bragh . As chelleeragh ren y billey - figgagh fioghey ersooyl .

text: And when the disciples saw it , they marvelled , saying , How soon is the fig tree withered away !
text2: As tra honnick e ostyllyn shoh , ghow ad yindys , gra , Cre cha leah as ta ' n billey figgagh er chreenagh roish ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Verily I say unto you , If ye have faith , and doubt not , ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree , but also if ye shall say unto this mountain , Be thou removed , and be thou cast into the sea ; it shall be done .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh roo , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , My vees shiu credjuagh , as gyn ve fo mee - ourys erbee , nee shiu cha nee ynrycan shoh ta jeant rish y villey - figggagh , agh my jir shiu rish y slieau shoh , Bee er dty scughey , as er dty hilgey ayns y cheayn ; bee eh er ny yannoo .

text: And all things , whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer , believing , ye shall receive .
text2: As cre - erbee nee shiu geearree ayns padjer , lesh credjue , yiow shiu eh .

text: And when he was come into the temple , the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching , and said , By what authority doest thou these things ? and who gave thee this authority ?
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet stiagh ayns y chiamble , haink ny ard - saggyrtyn as shanstyr yn phobble huggey myr v ' eh gynsaghey , gra , Cre ' n phooar t ' ayd ' s dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh ? as quoi hug yn phooar shoh dhyt ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , I also will ask you one thing , which if ye tell me , I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Fenym ' s jiuish un red ; as my inshys shiu dou eh , inshym ' s myrgeddin diuish , cre ' n phooar t ' aym dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh .

text: The baptism of John , whence was it ? from heaven , or of men ? And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say unto us , Why did ye not then believe him ?
text2: Bashtey Ean , cre voish ve ? veih niau , ny veih deiney ? As loayr ad nyn mast ' oc hene , gra , My jir mayd , Veih niau ; jir eshyn rooin , Cre ' n - fa eisht nagh chred shiu eh ?

text: But if we shall say , Of men ; we fear the people ; for all hold John as a prophet .
text2: Agh my jir mayd , Veih deiney ; ta aggle orrin roish y pobble ; son ta dy chooilley ghooinney goaill Ean son phadeyr .

text: And they answered Jesus , and said , We cannot tell . And he said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: As dreggyr ad Yeesey , as dooyrt ad , Cha vod mayd ginsh . As dooyrt eh roo , Chamoo ta mish ginsh diuish , cre ' n phooar t ' aym , dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh .

text: But what think ye ? A certain man had two sons ; and he came to the first , and said , Son , go work to day in my vineyard .
text2: Agh cre ta shiu dy smooinaghtyn ? Va dooinney dy row as daa vac echey , as haink eh gys yn er - shinney , as dooyrt eh , Vac , Immee as obbree jiu ayns my gharey - feeyney .

text: He answered and said , I will not : but afterward he repented , and went .
text2: Dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh , Cha jem : agh ny lurg shen ghow eh arrys , as hie eh .

text: And he came to the second , and said likewise . And he answered and said , I go , sir : and went not .
text2: As haink eh gys e vac saa , as loayr eh rish myrgeddin . As dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh , Hem , vainshter ; as cha jagh eh .

text: Whether of them twain did the will of his father ? They say unto him , The first . Jesus saith unto them , Verily I say unto you , That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you .
text2: Quoi jeu shoh ny - neesht ren aigney e ayrey ? Dooyrt adsyn rish , Yn mac shinney . Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy jed ny publicanee as ny drogh . vraane stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee reue - ish .

text: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness , and ye believed him not : but the publicans and the harlots believed him : and ye , when ye had seen it , repented not afterward , that ye might believe him .
text2: Son haink Ean hiuish ayns raad y chairys , as cha chred shiu eh : agh chred ny publicanee as ny drogh - vraane eh . As ga dy vaik shiu shoh , cha ghow shiu arrys ny lurg shen , dy chredjal ayn .

text: Hear another parable : There was a certain householder , which planted a vineyard , and hedged it round about , and digged a winepress in it , and built a tower , and let it out to husbandmen , and went into a far country :
text2: Eaisht - jee rish coraa - dorraghey elley : Va fer - thie dy row ren garey - feeyney y hoiaghey , as ren eh cleigh y yannoo mysh , as chleiy eh press - feeyney ayn , as hrog eh toor , as hoie eh eh rish tannys , as hie eh gys cheer foddey .

text: And when the time of the fruit drew near , he sent his servants to the husbandmen , that they might receive the fruits of it .
text2: As tra va earish ny mess tayrn er - gerrey , hug eh e ir - vooinjerey gys y tannys , dy gheddyn jeh ' n mess echey .

text: And the husbandmen took his servants , and beat one , and killed another , and stoned another .
text2: As ghow yn tannys e ir - vooinjerey , as woaill ad fer , as varr ad fer elley , as chlagh ad fer elley .

text: Again , he sent other servants more than the first : and they did unto them likewise .
text2: Reesht hug eh magh sharvaantyn elley ny s ' lhee na ' n chied eallagh : as ghell ad roosyn er yn aght cheddin .

text: But last of all he sent unto them his son , saying , They will reverence my son .
text2: Agh er - jerrey ooilley hug eh huc e vac , gra , Bee ad arrymagh da my vac .

text: But when the husbandmen saw the son , they said among themselves , This is the heir ; come , let us kill him , and let us seize on his inheritance .
text2: Agh tra honnick y tannys yn mac dooyrt ad nyn mast ' oc hene , Shoh ' n eirey , tar - jee , lhig dooin eh y varroo , as bee ' n eiraght echey lhien hene .

text: And they caught him , and cast him out of the vineyard , and slew him .
text2: As ghow ad eh , as hilg ad eh magh ass y gharey - feeyney , as varr ad eh .

text: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh , what will he do unto those husbandmen ?
text2: Tra hig er - y - fa shen Chiarn y gharey - feeyney , Cre nee eh rish yn tannys shen ?

text: They say unto him , He will miserably destroy those wicked men , and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen , which shall render him the fruits in their seasons .
text2: Dooyrt adsyn rish , Stroie - ee eh fegooish myghin ny drogh - gheiney shen , as nee eh soiaghey yn garey - feeyney rish tannys elley , livrey - ys ny messyn da ayns nyn imbagh cooie .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Did ye never read in the scriptures , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner : this is the Lord ' s doing , and it is marvellous in our eyes ?
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Nagh lhaih shiu rieau ayns goo Yee , Yn chlagh ren ny masoonee y vee - lowal , ta ' n chlagh cheddin er jeet dy ve yn ard - chlagh chorneilagh : shoh jannoo yn Chiarn , as te yindyssagh ayns ny sooillyn ainyn ?

text: Therefore say I unto you , The kingdom of God shall be taken from you , and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta mish gra riu , Dy bee reeriaght Yee er ny ghoaill veue - ish , as er ny choyrt da ashoon ymmyrkys magh yn mess echey .

text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken : but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: As quoi - erbee huittys er y chlagh shen bee eh er ny vroo : agh er quoi - erbee huittys y chlagh shen , nee ee cha meen as joan jeh .

text: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables , they perceived that he spake of them .
text2: As tra va ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn erreish ny coraaghyn - dorraghey echey y chlashtyn , dennee ad dy nee jeusyn v ' eh loayrt .

text: But when they sought to lay hands on him , they feared the multitude , because they took him for a prophet .
text2: Agh tra v ' ad shleeuit er goaill eh v ' ad ayns aggle roish y pobble , er - yn - oyr dy row ad jeeaghyn er dy ve ny adeyr .

text: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables , and said ,
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as loayr eh roo reesht liorish coraaghyn - dorraghey , gra ,

text: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king , which made a marriage for his son ,
text2: Ta reeriaght Yee er ny hoylaghey gys ree dy row , ren bannish son e vac

text: And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding : and they would not come .
text2: As hug eh magh e harvaantyn dy eamagh orroosyn va cuirt gys y vannish : as cha balliu cheet .

text: Again , he sent forth other servants , saying , Tell them which are bidden , Behold , I have prepared my dinner : my oxen and my fatlings are killed , and all things are ready : come unto the marriage .
text2: Reesht hug eh magh sharvaantyn elley , gra , Abbyr - jee roosyn ta cuirt , Cur - my - ner ta mee er n ' aarlaghey my yinnair : ta my ghew as my veiyn beiyht marroo , as dy chooilley nhee ullee ; tar - jee gys y vannish .

text: But they made light of it , and went their ways , one to his farm , another to his merchandise :
text2: Agh hoie adsyn beg jeh as hie ad rhymboo , fer gys e state - hallooin , as fer elley gys e varchantys

text: And the remnant took his servants , and entreated them spitefully , and slew them .
text2: As ghow yn chooid elley ny sharvaantyn echey , as ghell ad dy elgyssagh roo , as varr ad ad .

text: But when the king heard thereof , he was wroth : and he sent forth his armies , and destroyed those murderers , and burned up their city .
text2: Agh tra cheayll y ree jeh v ' eh feer chorree : as hug eh magh e heshaghtyn caggee , as stroie eh ny dunveryn shen , as losht eh yn ard - valley oc .

text: Then saith he to his servants , The wedding is ready , but they which were bidden were not worthy .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish e harvaantyn , Ta ' n vannish aarloo , agh y vooinjer va cuirt cha row ad feeu .

text: Go ye therefore into the highways , and as many as ye shall find , bid to the marriage .
text2: Gow - jee magh er - y - fa shen gys ny raaidyn mooarey , as whilleen as yiow shiu , cuir - jee gys y vannish .

text: So those servants went out into the highways , and gathered together all as many as they found , both bad and good : and the wedding was furnished with guests .
text2: As hie ny sharvaantyn shen magh gys ny raaidyn - mooarey , as ren ad whilleen as haink nyn raad y haglym cooidjagh , chammah sie as mie : as va thie ny banshey er ny lhieeney lesh goaldee .

text: And when the king came in to see the guests , he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment :
text2: As tra haink y ree stiagh dy akin ny goaldee , honnick eh dooinney ayns shen nagh row garmad - banshey er :

text: And he saith unto him , Friend , how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment ? And he was speechless .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Heshey vie , kys haink uss stiagh ayns shoh , fegooish garmad - banshey ? As cha row fockle echey dy ghra .

text: Then said the king to the servants , Bind him hand and foot , and take him away , and cast him into outer darkness ; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Eisht dooyrt y ree rish ny sharvaantyn , Kiangle - jee eh laue as cass , as gow - jee eh ersooyl , as tilg - jee eh ayns y dorraghys sodjey - mooie : shen - y - raad vees keayney as snaggeraght feeacklyn .

text: For many are called , but few are chosen .
text2: Son shimmey t ' er nyn eam , agh s ' tiark t ' er nyn reih .

text: Then went the Pharisees , and took counsel how they might entangle him in his talk .
text2: Eisht hie ny Phariseeyn , as hug ad nyn goyrle dy cheilley , kys dy ghoaill vondeish er ayns e ghoan .

text: And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians , saying , Master , we know that thou art true , and teachest the way of God in truth , neither carest thou for any man : for thou regardest not the person of men .
text2: As hug ad magh huggey shiartanse jeusyn v ' ad hene er n ' ynsaghey marish ny Herodianee , gra , Vainshter , ta fys ain dy vel oo firrinagh , as dy vel oo gynsaghey raad Yee syn ynrickys , chamoo t ' ou ayns aggle roish dooinney erbee : son cha vel oo soiaghey jeh persoon deiney .

text: Tell us therefore , What thinkest thou ? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar , or not ?
text2: Insh dooin er - y - fa shen , Cre t ' ou uss smooinaghtyn , Vel eh lowal keesh y eeck da Cesar mannagh vel ?

text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness , and said , Why tempt ye me , ye hypocrites ?
text2: Agh dennee Yeesey yn foalsaght oc , as dooyrt eh , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu shirrey vondeish y ghoaill orrym , shiuish chrauee - oalsey ?

text: Shew me the tribute money . And they brought unto him a penny .
text2: Jeeagh - jee dou argid y cheesh : as yeeagh ad ping da .

text: And he saith unto them , Whose is this image and superscription ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Quoi ta ' n jalloo as y screeu shoh cowraghey ?

text: They say unto him , Caesar ' s . Then saith he unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar ' s ; and unto God the things that are God ' s .
text2: Dooyrt adsyn rish , Cesar . Eisht dooyrt eh roo , Eeck - jee er - y - fa shen da Cesar shen ny ta lesh Cesar : as da Jee , shen ny ta lesh Jee .

text: When they had heard these words , they marvelled , and left him , and went their way .
text2: Tra cheayll ad shoh ghow ad yindys as daag ad eh , as hie ad rhymboo .

text: The same day came to him the Sadducees , which say that there is no resurrection , and asked him ,
text2: Yn laa cheddin haink huggey ny Sadduceeyn , ta gra , Nagh vel irree - seose reesht veih ny merriu dy ve ayn , as denee ad jeh

text: Saying , Master , Moses said , If a man die , having no children , his brother shall marry his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Gra , Vainshter , ta Moses er ghra , My ta dooinney geddyn baase gyn cloan , dy vel e vraar dy phoosey yn ven echey , as dy hroggal seose sluight gys e vraar .

text: Now there were with us seven brethren : and the first , when he had married a wife , deceased , and , having no issue , left his wife unto his brother :
text2: Nish va ny mast ' ain shiaght braaraghyn , as phoose y braar shinney , as geddyn baase gyn cloan , daag eh e ven da e nah vraar .

text: Likewise the second also , and the third , unto the seventh .
text2: As hooar y nah vraar myrgeddin baase as y trass , gys y chiaghtoo .

text: And last of all the woman died also .
text2: As er - jerrey ooilley hooar y ven baase myrgeddin .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven ? for they all had her .
text2: Shen - y - fa ec yn irree - reesht , quoi jeh ' n chiaght vees ee echey son ben , son v ' ee poost roo ooilley .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Ye do err , not knowing the scriptures , nor the power of God .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Ta shiu fo marranys , as cha vel toiggal eu jeh goo ny jeh pooar Yee .

text: For in the resurrection they neither marry , nor are given in marriage , but are as the angels of God in heaven .
text2: Son ec yn irree - reesht , cha vel ad poosey , ny er nyn goyrt ayns poosey ; agh t ' ad myr ainleyn Yee t ' ayns niau .

text: But as touching the resurrection of the dead , have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God , saying ,
text2: Agh mychione irree - reesht ny merriu , nagh vel shiu er lhaih shen va loayrit riu liorish Jee , gra ,

text: I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ? God is not the God of the dead , but of the living .
text2: Mish Jee Abraham , as Jee Isaac , as Jee Yacob ? cha vel Jee Jee ny merriu , agh Jee ny bioee .

text: And when the multitude heard this , they were astonished at his doctrine .
text2: As tra cheayll y pobble shoh , ghow ad yindys jeh ' n ynsaghey echey .

text: But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence , they were gathered together .
text2: Agh tra va ny Phariseeyn er chlashtyn dy row eh er chur ny Sadduceeyn nyn dhost , v ' ad er nyn jaglym cooidjagh .

text: Then one of them , which was a lawyer , asked him a question , tempting him , and saying ,
text2: As denee fer jeu ard - ynsit ' sy leigh , question jeh , dy phrowal eh , gra ,

text: Master , which is the great commandment in the law ?
text2: Vainshter , cre yn ard - anney ayns y leigh ?

text: Jesus said unto him , Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Ver oo graih da ' n Chiarn dty Yee lesh ooilley dty chree as lesh ooilley dty annym , as lesh ooilley dt ' aigney .

text: This is the first and great commandment .
text2: Shoh yn chied as yn ard - anney .

text: And the second is like unto it , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: As ta ' n nah anney casley rish , Ver oo graih da dty nahoo myr dhyt hene .

text: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets .
text2: Yn daa anney shoh bun y leigh as ny phadeyryn .

text: While the Pharisees were gathered together , Jesus asked them ,
text2: Choud as va ny Phariseeyn er nyn jaglym cooidjagh , denee Yeesey jeu ,

text: Saying , What think ye of Christ ? whose son is he ? They say unto him , The Son of David .
text2: Gra , Cre ta nyn smooinaghtyn my chione Creest ? quoi da mac eh ? Dooyrt adsyn rish , Mac Ghavid .

text: He saith unto them , How then doth David in spirit call him Lord , saying ,
text2: Dooyrt eshyn roo , Kys eisht dy vel David liorish yn spyrryd genmys eh ny Hiarn , gra ,

text: The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand , till I make thine enemies thy footstool ?
text2: Dooyrt y Chiarn rish my Hiarn ' s , Soie uss er my laue yesh , derrey neem ' s dty noidyn stoyl dty choshey ?

text: If David then call him Lord , how is he his son ?
text2: My ta David eisht genmys eh ny Hiarn , kys t ' eh yn mac echey ?

text: And no man was able to answer him a word , neither durst any man from that day forth ask him any more questions .
text2: As cha row dooinney ny vod oc son ansoor y chur da , chamoo by - lhoys da fer erbee jeu ( veih ' n laa shen magh ) question erbee sodjey y chur huggey .

text: Then spake Jesus to the multitude , and to his disciples ,
text2: Eisht loayr Yeesey rish y pobble , as rish e ostyllyn ,

text: Saying , The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses ' seat :
text2: Gra , Ta ny scrudeyryn as ny Phariseeyn nyn soie ayns stoyl Voses .

text: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe , that observe and do ; but do not ye after their works : for they say , and do not .
text2: Ooilley er - y - fa shen cre - er - bee nee ad y oardaghey diu dy reayll , freill - jee , as jean - jee eh ; agh ny jean - jee lurg ny obbraghyn oc : son t ' ad gra , agh cha vel ad jannoo .

text: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne , and lay them on men ' s shoulders ; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers .
text2: Son t ' ad kiangley erraghyn tromey as doillee dy ve er nyn ymmyrkey , as dyn goyrt ad er geayltyn deiney , agh cha lhie ad hene wheesh mair roo dy hroggal ad .

text: But all their works they do for to be seen of men : they make broad their phylacteries , and enlarge the borders of their garments ,
text2: Agh ooilley nyn obbraghyn t ' ad dy yannoo dy ve cronnit liorish deiney : t ' ad jannoo lhean ny phylactereeyn oc , as ceau chemmallyn mooarey er nyn gharmadyn ,

text: And love the uppermost rooms at feasts , and the chief seats in the synagogues ,
text2: As shynney lhieu ny ard ynnydyn - soie ec cuirraghyn , as ny ard - stuill ayns ny synagogueyn ,

text: And greetings in the markets , and to be called of men , Rabbi , Rabbi .
text2: As sleih dy vannaghey daue ayns ny margaghyn , as dy ve enmyssit liorish deiney , Rabbi , Rabbi .

text: But be not ye called Rabbi : for one is your Master , even Christ ; and all ye are brethren .
text2: Agh ny bee - jee shiuish enmyssit Rabbi : son ta un vainshter eu , ta shen dy ghra , Creest , as ta shiuish ooilley nyn mraaraghyn .

text: And call no man your father upon the earth : for one is your Father , which is in heaven .
text2: As ny enmys - jee dooinney erbee ny mast ' eu , Yn ayr : son ta un er ynrycan nyn Ayr , eer eh t ' ayns niau .

text: Neither be ye called masters : for one is your Master , even Christ .
text2: Chamoo gow - jee erriu dy ve mainshteryn , son ta un er nyn Mainshter , eer Creest .

text: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant .
text2: Agh eshyn syrjey ta nyn mast ' eu , bee eh nyn shirveishagh .

text: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased ; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted .
text2: Son quoi - erbee ta dy mooaralagh soiaghey seose eh - hene , bee eh er ny injillaghey , agh eshyn ta dy injillaghey eh - hene , bee eh er ny hoiaghey seose .

text: But woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men : for ye neither go in yourselves , neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in .
text2: Agh smerg diuish scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn , chrauee oalsey ; son ta shiu dooney seose reeriaght niau noi deiney : cha vel shiu goll stiagh shiu hene , as ta shiu dyn lhiettal adsyn ta aggindagh er goll stiagh .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye devour widows ' houses , and for a pretence make long prayer : therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation .
text2: Smerg diu scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn , chrauee - oalsey ; son ta shiu cleiy fo thieyn mraane - treoghe , as son scaa dy chraueeaght lhiggey erriu dy ve kinjagh ayns padjer : shen - y - fa ta kerraghey strimmey nyn gour .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte , and when he is made , ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves .
text2: Smerg diu scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn , chrauee - oalsey ; son ta shiu goll mygeayrt keayn as thalloo , dy hayrn agh un yoarree gys y chredjue eu hene , as tra t ' eh er jyndaa hiu , ta shiu dy yannoo eh ny lhiannoo dy niurin ghaa wheesh smessey na shiu hene .

text: Woe unto you , ye blind guides , which say , Whosoever shall swear by the temple , it is nothing ; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple , he is a debtor !
text2: Smerg diu leeideilee doal , ta gra , Quoi - erbee looys liorish y chiamble , nagh vel eh veg : agh quoi - erbee looys liorish airh y chiamble , t ' eh kianlt gys e vreearrey .

text: Ye fools and blind : for whether is greater , the gold , or the temple that sanctifieth the gold ?
text2: O shiuish vee - cheeayllee as doail : son quoi s ' ooasle ta , yn airh , ny ' n chiamble ta casherickey yn airh .

text: And , Whosoever shall swear by the altar , it is nothing ; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it , he is guilty .
text2: As quoi - erbee looys liorish yn altar , nagh vel eh veg : agh quoi - erbee looys liorish y gioot t ' er yn altar , t ' eh kianlt gys e vreearrey .

text: Ye fools and blind : for whether is greater , the gift , or the altar that sanctifieth the gift ?
text2: O shiuish vee - cheayllee as doail : son quoi s ' ooasle ta yn gioot , ny ' n altar ta casherickey ' n gioot ?

text: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar , sweareth by it , and by all things thereon .
text2: Quoi - erbee er - y - fa shen looys liorish yn altar , t ' eh loo liorish yn altar hene , as liorish dy chooilley nhee ta chebbit er .

text: And whoso shall swear by the temple , sweareth by it , and by him that dwelleth therein .
text2: As quoi - erbee looys liorish y chiamble , t ' eh loo liorish y chiamble , as liorishyn ta cummal ayn .

text: And he that shall swear by heaven , sweareth by the throne of God , and by him that sitteth thereon .
text2: As eshyn looys liorish niau , t ' eh loo liorish stoyl - reeoil Yee , as liorishyn ta ny hoie er .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin , and have omitted the weightier matters of the law , judgment , mercy , and faith : these ought ye to have done , and not to leave the other undone .
text2: Smerg diu scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn , chrauee - oalsey ; son ta shiu geeck jaghee jeh mynthey , anise as cummin , agh cha vel shiu er chooilleeney currymyn s ' ymmyrchee yn leigh , cairys , myghin as firrinys : ad shoh lhisagh shiu v ' er n ' yannoo , fegooish y chooid elley y aagail gyn jannoo .

text: Ye blind guides , which strain at a gnat , and swallow a camel .
text2: Shiuish leeideilee doal , ta sheeley veue yn char - chuilag , agh sluggee shiu camel .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter , but within they are full of extortion and excess .
text2: Smerg diu scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn , chrauee - oalsey : son ta shiu glenney yn cappan as y claare er cheu - mooie , agh cheu sthie t ' ad lane dy hranlaase as dy neu - heeltys .

text: Thou blind Pharisee , cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter , that the outside of them may be clean also .
text2: Pharisee ghoal , glen hoshiaght cheu - sthie yn chappan as y chlaare , dy vod y cheu - mooie ve glen myrgeddin

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres , which indeed appear beautiful outward , but are within full of dead men ' s bones , and of all uncleanness .
text2: Smerg diu scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn , chrauee - oalsey ; son ta shiu goll - rish oaiagh yn t ' er nyn ghiallaghey , ta dy jarroo jeeaghyn aalin er cheu - mooie , agh cheu - sthie t ' ad lane dy chraueyn ny merriu , as jeh dy chooilley eajeeys .

text: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men , but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity .
text2: Shen myr ta shiuish neesht er cheu - mooie cairagh ayns shilley deiney , agh cheu - sthie ta shiu lane dy chraueeaght - oalsey as dy vee - chairys .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! because ye build the tombs of the prophets , and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous ,
text2: Smerg diu scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn , chrauee oalsey , son dy vel shiu troggal oaiaghyn ny phadeyryn , as soiaghey magh lhiaghtyn ny deiney cairagh .

text: And say , If we had been in the days of our fathers , we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets .
text2: As gra , Dy beagh shinyn er ve ayns laghyn nyn ayraghyn , cha beagh shin er ve nyn baarteeasyn maroosyn ayns fuill ny phadeyryn .

text: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves , that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta shiu nyn veanishyn noi eu hene , ny nee shiuish yn sluight ocsyn hug ny phadeyryn dy baase .

text: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers .
text2: Lhieen - jee seose eisht towse nyn ayraghyn .

text: Ye serpents , ye generation of vipers , how can ye escape the damnation of hell ?
text2: Shiuish ard - nieughyn , sheeloghe dy ard - nieughyn , kys oddys shiu kerraghey niurin y scapail ?

text: Wherefore , behold , I send unto you prophets , and wise men , and scribes : and some of them ye shall kill and crucify ; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues , and persecute them from city to city :
text2: Shen - y - fa , cur - my - ner , ta mish coyrt hiu phadeyryn , as deiney creeney , as scrudeyryn ; as paart jeu nee shiu y varroo , as y chrossey , as paart jeu nee shiu y scuitchal ayns nyn guaiylyn , as geiyrt ad veih ard - valley gys ard - valley :

text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth , from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias , whom ye slew between the temple and the altar .
text2: Dy vod ooilley yn uill chairagh hie er deayrtey er y thalloo tuittym erriu , veih fuilt Abel cairagh , gys fuill Zecharias , mac Varachias , eh ren shiu y varroo eddyr y chiamble as yn altar .

text: Verily I say unto you , All these things shall come upon this generation .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Dy jig dy - chooilley nhee jeu shoh er y cheeloghe shoh .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , thou that killest the prophets , and stonest them which are sent unto thee , how often would I have gathered thy children together , even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: O Yerusalem , Yerusalem , uss ta cur dy baase ny phadeyryn , as claghey adsyn t ' er nyn goyrt er chaghteraght hood , cre cha mennick as va mish aggindagh v ' er haglym dty chloan cooidjagh , myr ta kiark goaill stiagh e hein , fo my skianyn , as cha jinnagh shiu !

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate .
text2: Cur - my - ner , ta ' n thie eu faagit diu follym - faase .

text: For I say unto you , Ye shall not see me henceforth , till ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Son ta mee gra riu , Nagh vaik shiu mish maghey shoh , derrey jirrys shiu , Bannit ta eshyn ta cheet ayns ennym y Chiarn .

text: And Jesus went out , and departed from the temple : and his disciples came to him for to shew him the buildings of the temple .
text2: As hie Yeesey magh as jimmee eh veih ' n chiamble ; as haink e ostyllyn huggey dy ghoaill baght marish jeh aalid y chiamble .

text: And Jesus said unto them , See ye not all these things ? verily I say unto you , There shall not be left here one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Nagh vaik shiu ooilley ny reddyn shoh ? dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Nagh bee faagit un chlagh er clagh elley , nagh bee er ny lhieggal .

text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives , the disciples came unto him privately , saying , Tell us , when shall these things be ? and what shall be the sign of thy coming , and of the end of the world ?
text2: As myr v ' eh ny hoie er cronk ny Oliveyn , haink e ostyllyn huggey er - lheh , gra , Insh dooin , cuin vees ny reddyn shoh ? as cre ' n cowrey vees jeh ' n cheet ayd , as jeh jerrey yn theihll ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Take heed that no man deceive you .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Cur - jee twoaie nagh moll dooinney erbee shiu .

text: For many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and shall deceive many .
text2: Son hig ymmodee ayns my ennym ' s , gra , Mish yn Creest : as nee ad ymmodee y volley .

text: And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars : see that ye be not troubled : for all these things must come to pass , but the end is not yet .
text2: As cluinnee shiu jeh caggaghyn , as jeh imraaghyn dy chaggaghyn : jeeagh nagh bee shiu seaghnit : son shegin da dy chooilley nhee jeu shoh cheet gys kione , agh cha bee yn jerrey foast .

text: For nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom : and there shall be famines , and pestilences , and earthquakes , in divers places .
text2: Son nee ashoon girree - magh noi ashoon , as reeriaght noi reeriaght : as bee gennaghyn as crampyn , as craaghyn - thallooin ayns ymmodee ynnydyn .

text: All these are the beginning of sorrows .
text2: Bee ooilley shoh toshiaght seaghyn diu .

text: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted , and shall kill you : and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name ' s sake .
text2: Eisht livreyee ad shiu seose dy ve seaghnit , as marree ad shiu : as bee dy chooilley ashoon dwoaiagh erriu er coontey yn ennym aym ' s .

text: And then shall many be offended , and shall betray one another , and shall hate one another .
text2: As eisht nee ymmodee scarrey rish nyn gredjue , as brahee ad , as ver ad feoh yn derrey yeh da ' n jeh elley .

text: And many false prophets shall rise , and shall deceive many .
text2: As nee ymmodee phadeyryn - foalsey girree seose , as mooarane y volley .

text: And because iniquity shall abound , the love of many shall wax cold .
text2: As er - yn - oyr dy jean olkys bishaghey , nee graih - ghiastyllagh ymmodee feayraghey .

text: But he that shall endure unto the end , the same shall be saved .
text2: Agh bee eshyn , nee tannaghtyn firrinagh gys y jerrey , er ny hauail .

text: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations ; and then shall the end come .
text2: As bee sushtal yn reeriaght er ny phreacheil ayns ooilley yn seihll , son feanish da dy chooilley ashoon , as eisht nee yn jerrey cheet .

text: When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation , spoken of by Daniel the prophet , stand in the holy place , ( whoso readeth , let him understand : )
text2: Tra hee shiu er - y - fa shen eajeeys yn traartys , ta loayrit jeh liorish Daniel y phadeyr , ny hassoo ayns yn ynnyd casherick , ( eshyn ta lhaih , lhig da tastey ' ghoaill ) .

text: Then let them which be in Judaea flee into the mountains :
text2: Eisht lhig dauesyn t ' ayns Judea chea gys ny sleityn .

text: Let him which is on the housetop not come down to take any thing out of his house :
text2: Eshyn t ' er mullagh y thie , ny lhig da cheet neose dy ghoaill marish nhee erbee ass e hie :

text: Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes .
text2: As ny lhig dasyn t ' ayns y vagher chyndaa back , dy chur lesh e eaddagh .

text: And woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck in those days !
text2: As smerg dauesyn ta torragh , as dauesyn ta cur keeagh ayns ny laghyn shen .

text: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter , neither on the sabbath day :
text2: Agh guee - jee shiuish nagh bee shiu eginit dy hea ayns y gheurey , ny er y doonaght .

text: For then shall be great tribulation , such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time , no , nor ever shall be .
text2: Son bee seaghyn mooar ec y traa shen , lheid as nagh row er - dy hoshiaght y theihll gys y traa t ' ayn nish , as lheid as nagh bee dy bragh arragh .

text: And except those days should be shortened , there should no flesh be saved : but for the elect ' s sake those days shall be shortened .
text2: As mannagh beagh ny laghyn shen dy leah harrish , cha beagh dooinney bio er ny hauail : agh er graih yn chloan reiht , bee ny laghyn shen dy leah harrish .

text: Then if any man shall say unto you , Lo , here is Christ , or there ; believe it not .
text2: Eisht my jir dooinney erbee riu , Cur my - ner , ta Creest ayns shoh , ny ayns shid ; ny cred - jee eh .

text: For there shall arise false Christs , and false prophets , and shall shew great signs and wonders ; insomuch that , if it were possible , they shall deceive the very elect .
text2: Son nee Creestyn foalsey , as phadeyryn foalsey girree , as cowraghyn mooarey as yindyssyn y hoilshaghey , ayns wheesh ( my oddagh eh ve ) dy jinnagh ad molley yn eer chloan reiht .

text: Behold , I have told you before .
text2: Cur - my - ner , ta mish er n ' insh diu ro laue .

text: Wherefore if they shall say unto you , Behold , he is in the desert ; go not forth : behold , he is in the secret chambers ; believe it not .
text2: Shen - y - fa my jir ad riu , T ' eh ayns yn aasagh , ny gow - jee magh : cur - my - ner , t ' eh ayns ny shamyryn follit , ny cred - jee eh .

text: For as the lightning cometh out of the east , and shineth even unto the west ; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Son myr ta ' n tendreil cheet ass y shiar , as cur soilshey choud as gys y sheear : myr shen neesht vees cheet Mac y dooinney .

text: For wheresoever the carcase is , there will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Son cre - erbee yn raad vees yn convayrt , shen y raad bee ny urlee er nyn jaglym cooidjagh .

text: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened , and the moon shall not give her light , and the stars shall fall from heaven , and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken :
text2: Chelleeragh lurg seaghyn ny laghyn shen , hig dorraghys er y ghrian , as cha der yn eayst e soilshey , as tuittee rollageyn yn aer , as bee pooaraghyn yn aer er nyn graa .

text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven : and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn , and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory .
text2: As eisht bee cowrey Mac y dooinney er ny akin ayns yn aer as ec y traa shen nee ooilley sheelogheyn y thallooin dobberan , as hee ad yn Mac dooinney cheet ayns bodjallyn yn aer , lesh pooar as gloyr vooar .

text: And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet , and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds , from one end of heaven to the other .
text2: As ver eh magh e ainleyn lesh yn trumpet dy ard - choraa , as nee ad e chloan reiht y haglym cooidjagh veih ny kiare geayghyn , veih ' n derrey ard fo ' n aer gys yn ard elley .

text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree ; When his branch is yet tender , and putteth forth leaves , ye know that summer is nigh :
text2: Ynsee - jee eisht coraa - dorraghey veih ' n villey - figgagh : tra ta ' n banglane echey foast oor , as cur magh duillagyn , ta fys eu dy vel y sourey er - gerrey .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall see all these things , know that it is near , even at the doors .
text2: Er yn aght cheddin shiuish , tra hee shiu ooilley ny reddyn shoh , toig - jee dy vel eh er - gerrey , dy jarroo ec ny dorryssyn .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass , till all these things be fulfilled .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Cha bee yn cheeloghe shoh harrish , derrey vees dy chooilley nhee jeu shoh cooilleenit .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away , but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Nee yn aer as yn ooir cherraghtyn , agh my ghoan ' s cha jean cherraghtyn .

text: But of that day and hour knoweth no man , no , not the angels of heaven , but my Father only .
text2: Agh er y laa as yn oor shen , cha vel fys ec dooinney erbee , cha vel ec ainleyn niau , agh ec my Ayr ny - lomarcan .

text: But as the days of Noe were , so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Agh myr va laghyn Noe , myr shen myrgeddin vees cheet Mac y dooinney .

text: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking , marrying and giving in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark ,
text2: Son myr ayns ny laghyn va roish y thooilley , v ' ad gee as giu , poosey as coyrt ayns poosey , derrey yn laa hie Noe stiagh ayns yn arg ,

text: And knew not until the flood came , and took them all away ; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: As cha dug ad tastey , derrey haink y thooilley as ghow eh ad ooilley ersooyl ; myr shen myrgeddin vees cheet Mac y dooinney .

text: Then shall two be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Shen y traa vees daa ghooinney ayns y vagher , bee fer goit as fer faagit .

text: Two women shall be grinding at the mill ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Bee daa ven blieh ec y wyllin , yn derrey yeh goit , as y jeh elley faagit .

text: Watch therefore : for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come .
text2: Shen - y - fa bee - jee er nyn arrey , son cha vel fys eu er yn oor tra hig nyn Jiarn .

text: But know this , that if the goodman of the house had known in what watch the thief would come , he would have watched , and would not have suffered his house to be broken up .
text2: Agh shoh toig - jee , dy beagh fys er ve ec mainshter y thie cre ' n oor veagh y maarliagh er jeet , veagh eh er e arrey , as cha beagh eh er lhiggey da brishey stiagh er hie .

text: Therefore be ye also ready : for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh .
text2: Shen - y - fa bee - jee shiuish myrgeddin ullee : son ec lheid yn oor as nagh vel shiu smooinaghtyn er , hig yn Mac dooinney .

text: Who then is a faithful and wise servant , whom his lord hath made ruler over his household , to give them meat in due season ?
text2: Quoi eisht yn charvaant firrinagh as creeney shen , ta e Hiarn er n ' yannoo ny er reill er e vooinjer , dy chur daue nyn meaghey ayns traa cooie ?

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: Bannit ta ' n charvaant cheddin . yiow e Hiarn , tra hig eh , jannoo myr shen .

text: Verily I say unto you , That he shall make him ruler over all his goods .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy livreyee eh gys y churrym echeysyn ooilley e chooid .

text: But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ;
text2: Agh my jir y drogh - harvaant shen ayns e chree , Ta my Hiarn lhiggey shaghey yn cheet echey ,

text: And shall begin to smite his fellowservants , and to eat and drink with the drunken ;
text2: As toshiaght y yannoo dy woalley e heshaghyn - sharvaant , as dy ee as dy iu marish ny meshtallee .

text: The lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him , and in an hour that he is not aware of ,
text2: Hig Chiarn y charvaant shen ec laa nagh bee eh jeeaghyn er e hon , as ayns oor nagh bee eh twoaiagh jeh ;

text: And shall cut him asunder , and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: As giaree eh eh veih - my - cheilley , as pointee eh e chronney marish ny crauee oalsey : ayns shen vees keayney as snaggeraght feeacklyn .

text: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins , which took their lamps , and went forth to meet the bridegroom .
text2: Eisht bee reeriaght niau er ny hoylaghey gys jeih moidynyn , ghow ny lampyn oc , as hie magh quail y dooinney poosee .

text: And five of them were wise , and five were foolish .
text2: As va queig jeu creeney , as queig ommijagh .

text: They that were foolish took their lamps , and took no oil with them :
text2: Hug adsyn va ommijagh lhieu ny lampyn oc , agh cha dug ad lhieu ooil maroo :

text: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps .
text2: Agh hug y vooinjer chreeney lhieu ooil ayns ny siyn oc marish nyn lampyn .

text: While the bridegroom tarried , they all slumbered and slept .
text2: Choud as v ' ad fieau er y dooinney poosee , huitt ad ooilley er saveenagh as cadley .

text: And at midnight there was a cry made , Behold , the bridegroom cometh ; go ye out to meet him .
text2: As ec main - oie va eam er ny choyrt , Cur - my - ner ta ' n dooinney - poosee cheet , gow - jee magh ny whail .

text: Then all those virgins arose , and trimmed their lamps .
text2: Eisht dirree ooilley ny moidynyn shen , as hooar ad aarloo nyn lampyn .

text: And the foolish said unto the wise , Give us of your oil ; for our lamps are gone out .
text2: As dooyrt y vooinjer ommijagh rish y vooinjer chreeney , Cur - jee dooinyn jeh ' n ooil euish , son ta ny lampyn ain goll ass .

text: But the wise answered , saying , Not so ; lest there be not enough for us and you : but go ye rather to them that sell , and buy for yourselves .
text2: Agh dreggyr y vooinjer chreeney , gra , Cha der ; er - aggle nagh bee dy liooar ain dooin hene as diuish neesht : share diu roie hucsyn ta creck , as kionnaghey diu hene .

text: And while they went to buy , the bridegroom came ; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage : and the door was shut .
text2: As choud as v ' ad goll dy chionnaghey haink y dooinney - poosee , as hie yn vooinjer va aarloo stiagh marish gys y vannish , as va ' n dorrys jeight .

text: Afterward came also the other virgins , saying , Lord , Lord , open to us .
text2: Ny lurg shen haink ny moidynyn elley gra , Hiarn , Hiarn , foshil dooin .

text: But he answered and said , Verily I say unto you , I know you not .
text2: Agh dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , nagh voddym goaill riu .

text: Watch therefore , for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh .
text2: Bee - jee er nyn dwoaie er - y - fa shen son cha vel fys eu er y laa ny ' n oor , nee Mac y dooinney cheet .

text: For the kingdom of heaven is as a man travelling into a far country , who called his own servants , and delivered unto them his goods .
text2: Son ta reeriaght niau myr dooinney va mysh goaill jurnah gys cheer foddey , deie er e harvaantyn hene , as livrey eh daue e chooid :

text: And unto one he gave five talents , to another two , and to another one ; to every man according to his several ability ; and straightway took his journey .
text2: As da fer hug eh queig talentyn , da fer elley jees , as da fer elley unnane , da dy chooilley ghooinney rere roshtyn e hushtey , as chelleeragh ghow eh e yurnah .

text: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same , and made them other five talents .
text2: Eisht hie yn fer v ' er gheddyn ny queig talentyn , as ren eh dellal lhieu , as chossyn eh queig talentyn elley .

text: And likewise he that had received two , he also gained other two .
text2: As myrgeddin eshyn v ' er gheddyn jees , chossyn eh neesht jees elley .

text: But he that had received one went and digged in the earth , and hid his lord ' s money .
text2: Agh eshyn va lesh yn un talent , hie eh as chleiy eh ayns y thalloo , as dollee eh argid e hiarn .

text: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh , and reckoneth with them .
text2: Agh lurg foddey dy hraa haink chiarn ny sharvaantyn shen , as ren eh coontey roo .

text: And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents , saying , Lord , thou deliveredst unto me five talents : behold , I have gained beside them five talents more .
text2: As haink eshyn v ' er gheddyn ny queig talentyn , as hug eh lesh queig talentyn elley , gra , Hiarn , livrey uss dooys queig talentyn : cur - my - ner , ta mee er chosney queig talentyn elley lhieu .

text: His lord said unto him , Well done , thou good and faithful servant : thou hast been faithful over a few things , I will make thee ruler over many things : enter thou into the joy of thy lord .
text2: Dooyrt e hiarn rish , S ' mie t ' ou er n ' yannoo , harvaant vie as firrinagh ; t ' ou er ny ve firrinagh ayns y veggan , livrey - yms mooarane gys dty churrym : immee uss stiagh gys boggey dty hiarn .

text: He also that had received two talents came and said , Lord , thou deliveredst unto me two talents : behold , I have gained two other talents beside them .
text2: Haink eshyn myrgeddin v ' er gheddyn yn daa halent , as dooyrt eh , Hiarn , livrey uss dooys daa halent : cur - my - ner , ta mee er chosney daa halent elley lhieu .

text: His lord said unto him , Well done , good and faithful servant ; thou hast been faithful over a few things , I will make thee ruler over many things : enter thou into the joy of thy lord .
text2: Dooyrt e hiarn rish , S ' mie t ' ou er n ' yannoo , harvaant vie as firrinagh : t ' ou er ny ve firrinagh ayns y veggan , livrey - yms mooarane gys dty churrym : immee uss stiagh gys boggey dty hiarn .

text: Then he which had received the one talent came and said , Lord , I knew thee that thou art an hard man , reaping where thou hast not sown , and gathering where thou hast not strawed :
text2: Agh y fer v ' er gheddyn yn un talent haink eh , as dooyrt eh , Hiarn , va fys aym ' s dy nee dooinney creoi oo ; buinn raad nagh ren oo cuirr , as chaglym raad nagh ren oo skeayley .

text: And I was afraid , and went and hid thy talent in the earth : lo , there thou hast that is thine .
text2: As ghow mee aggle , as hie mee as dollee mee dty halent ayns y thalloo : jeeagh , shoh dhyt dty chooid hene .

text: His lord answered and said unto him , Thou wicked and slothful servant , thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not , and gather where I have not strawed :
text2: Dreggyr e hiarn , as dooyrt eh rish , Harvaant vee - chairagh as neu - harroogh , va fys ayd ' s dy row mish buinn raad nagh ren mee cuirr , as chaglym raad nagh ren mee skeayley .

text: Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers , and then at my coming I should have received mine own with usury .
text2: Lhisagh oo er - y - fa shen v ' er chur my argid magh er - use , as eisht tra harrin , oddin v ' er gheddyn my chooid hene lesh bishaghey .

text: Take therefore the talent from him , and give it unto him which hath ten talents .
text2: Gow - jee er - y - fa shen yn talent veihsyn , as cur - jee eh dasyn ta jeih talentyn echey .

text: For unto every one that hath shall be given , and he shall have abundance : but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath .
text2: Son da dy chooilley ghooinney ta kuse echey vees er ny choyrt , as yiow eh ny smoo : agh veihsyn nagh vel echey vees er ny ghoaill ersooyl eer shen ny ta echey .

text: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: As tilg - jee yn charvaant neu - harroogh ayns y dorraghys sodjey - mooie : ayns shen vees keayney as snaggeraght feeacklyn .

text: When the Son of man shall come in his glory , and all the holy angels with him , then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory :
text2: Tra hig Mac y dooinney ayns e ghloyr , as ooilley e ainleyn casherick marish , shen y traa hoie - ys eh er stoyl - reeoil e ghloyr .

text: And before him shall be gathered all nations : and he shall separate them one from another , as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats :
text2: As kiongoyrt rish vees dy chooilley ashoon er nyn jaglym ; as scarree eh ad veih - my - cheilley , myr ta bochilley scarrey eddyr e chirree as ny goair :

text: And he shall set the sheep on his right hand , but the goats on the left .
text2: As soie - ee eh ny kirree er e laue - yesh , agh ny goair er e laue - chiare .

text: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand , Come , ye blessed of my Father , inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world :
text2: Eisht jir y ree roosyn er e laue - yesh , Tar - jee chloan vannit my Ayrey , gow - jee eiraght ' sy reeriaght ta kiarit diu er - dy hoshiaght y theihll .

text: For I was an hungred , and ye gave me meat : I was thirsty , and ye gave me drink : I was a stranger , and ye took me in :
text2: Son va mee accryssagh , as hug shiu beaghey dou : va mee paagh , as hug shiu jough dou : va mee my yoarree , as ghow shiu stiagh mee :

text: Naked , and ye clothed me : I was sick , and ye visited me : I was in prison , and ye came unto me .
text2: Rooisht , as ren shiu m ' y choamrey : va mee ching , as haink shiu dy my yeeaghyn : va mee ayns pryssoon , as haink shiu hym .

text: Then shall the righteous answer him , saying , Lord , when saw we thee an hungred , and fed thee ? or thirsty , and gave thee drink ?
text2: Eisht nee ' n chloan chairagh eh y reggyrt , gra , Hiarn , cuin honnick shin oo accryssagh , as dy dug shin beaghey dhyt ? ny paagh , as dy dug shin jough dhyt ?
