text: When saw we thee a stranger , and took thee in ? or naked , and clothed thee ?
text2: Cuin honnick shin oo dty yoarree , as dy - ghow shin stiagh oo ? ny rooisht , as dy ren shin dty choamrey ?

text: Or when saw we thee sick , or in prison , and came unto thee ?
text2: Ny cuin honnick shin oo ching , ny ayns pryssoon , as dy daink shin dy dty yeeaghyn ?

text: And the King shall answer and say unto them , Verily I say unto you , Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren , ye have done it unto me .
text2: As freggyree yn Ree , as jir eh roo , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Ayns wheesh as dy vel shiu er n ' yannoo eh son y fer sloo jeu shoh my vraaraghyn , ta shiu er n ' yannoo eh er my hon ' s .

text: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand , Depart from me , ye cursed , into everlasting fire , prepared for the devil and his angels :
text2: Eisht jir eh roosyn myrgeddin er y laue - chiare , Immee - jee voym , chloan churstey gys yn aile dy bragh farraghtyn , kiarit son y drogh - spyrryd as e ainleyn .

text: For I was an hungred , and ye gave me no meat : I was thirsty , and ye gave me no drink :
text2: Son va mee accryssagh , as cha dug shiu beaghey dou : va mee paagh , as cha dug shiu jough dou :

text: I was a stranger , and ye took me not in : naked , and ye clothed me not : sick , and in prison , and ye visited me not .
text2: Va mee my yoarree , as cha ghow shiu stiagh mee : rooisht , as cha ren shiu m ' y choamrey : ching , as ayns pryssoon , as cha daink shiu dy my yeeaghyn .

text: Then shall they also answer him , saying , Lord , when saw we thee an hungred , or athirst , or a stranger , or naked , or sick , or in prison , and did not minister unto thee ?
text2: Eisht nee adsyn myrgeddin eh y reggyrt , gra , Hiarn , cuin honnick shin oo accryssagh , ny paagh , ny dty yoarree , ny rooisht , ny ching , ny ayns pryssoon , as nagh chooin shin lhiat ?

text: Then shall he answer them , saying , Verily I say unto you , Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these , ye did it not to me .
text2: Eisht nee eh nyn reggyrt , gra , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Ayns wheesh as nagh ren shiu eh son unnane jeh ' n vooinjer sloo jeu shoh , cha ren shiu eh er my hon ' s .

text: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment : but the righteous into life eternal .
text2: As hed ad shoh ersooyl gys y kerraghey dy bragh farraghtyn : agh y chloan chairagh gys y vea veayn .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had finished all these sayings , he said unto his disciples ,
text2: As haink eh gy - kione erreish da Yeesey ve er loayrt ooilley ny goan shoh , dy dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn ,

text: Ye know that after two days is the feast of the passover , and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified .
text2: Ta fys eu lurg daa laa dy bee feailley ny caisht , as dy bee yn Mac dooinney er ny vrah dy ve er ny chrossey .

text: Then assembled together the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders of the people , unto the palace of the high priest , who was called Caiaphas ,
text2: Eisht va ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny scrudeyryn as shanstyr y phobble er nyn jaglym cooidjagh gys thie yn ard - saggyrt va enmyssit Caiaphas .

text: And consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty , and kill him .
text2: As hug ad nyn goyrle dy cheilley , my chione Yeesey y ghoaill dy follit , as dy choyrt eh gy - baase .

text: But they said , Not on the feast day , lest there be an uproar among the people .
text2: Agh dooyrt ad , Cha nee er laa ny feailley , er - aggle dy bee irree - magh ayn mastey ' n pobble .

text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany , in the house of Simon the leper ,
text2: Nish tra va Yeesey ayns Bethany , ayns thie Simon yn lourane ,

text: There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment , and poured it on his head , as he sat at meat .
text2: Haink huggey ben lesh box alabaster dy ooil feer chostal , as gheayrt ee eh er e chione , myr v ' eh ny hoie ec bee .

text: But when his disciples saw it , they had indignation , saying , To what purpose is this waste ?
text2: Agh tra honnick e ostyllyn shoh , v ' ad jymmoosagh , gra , Cre ' n - fa va ' n jummal shoh jeant ?

text: For this ointment might have been sold for much , and given to the poor .
text2: Son oddagh yn ooil shoh v ' er ny ve creckit son mooarane , as er ny choyrt da ny boghtyn .

text: When Jesus understood it , he said unto them , Why trouble ye the woman ? for she hath wrought a good work upon me .
text2: Tra hoig Yeesey shoh , dooyrt eh roo , Kys dy vel shiu boirey yn ven ? son t ' ee er n ' yannoo obbyr vie orrym ' s .

text: For ye have the poor always with you ; but me ye have not always .
text2: Son ta ny boghtyn eu kinjagh meriu , agh mish cha vel eu kinjagh .

text: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body , she did it for my burial .
text2: Son liorish dy vel ee er gheayrtey yn ooil shoh er n y chorp , t ' ee er n ' yannoo eh cour my oanluckey .

text: Verily I say unto you , Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world , there shall also this , that this woman hath done , be told for a memorial of her .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Cre theihll y raad vees yn sushtal shoh er ny phreacheil , dy bee shoh myrgeddin ta ' n ven shoh er n ' yannoo , er ny imraa ayns cooinaghtyn j ' ee .

text: Then one of the twelve , called Judas Iscariot , went unto the chief priests ,
text2: Eisht hie fer jeh ' n daa ostyl yeig , va enmyssit Yuaase Iscariot , gys ny ard - saggyrtyn .

text: And said unto them , What will ye give me , and I will deliver him unto you ? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cre ver shiu dooys , as livrey - ym diuish eh ? As choard ad rish son jeih peeshyn as feed dy argid .

text: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him .
text2: As veih ' n traa shen v ' eh shirrey caa dy vrah eh .

text: Now the first day of the feast of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus , saying unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover ?
text2: Nish er y chied laa jeh feailley yn arran - caisht , haink e ostyllyn gys Yeesey as dooyrt ad rish , Cre ' n raad sailt shin dy yannoo aarloo er dty hon dy ee yn eayn caisht ?

text: And he said , Go into the city to such a man , and say unto him , The Master saith , My time is at hand ; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Gow - jee gys yn ard - valley gys lheid y dooinney shen , as abbyr - jee rish , Ta ' n mainshter gra , Ta my hraa er gerrey , freill - ym y chaisht ec dty hie ' s marish my ostyllyn .

text: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them ; and they made ready the passover .
text2: As ren adsyn myr va Yeesey er n ' oardaghey daue , as daarlee ad yn eayn - caisht .

text: Now when the even was come , he sat down with the twelve .
text2: Nish tra va ' n fastyr er - jeet , hoie eh sheese marish yn daa ostyl yeig .

text: And as they did eat , he said , Verily I say unto you , that one of you shall betray me .
text2: As myr v ' ad gee , dooyrt eh , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy jean fer jiuish mish y vrah .

text: And they were exceeding sorrowful , and began every one of them to say unto him , Lord , is it I ?
text2: As v ' ad dy mooar seaghnit , as ren ad toshiaght dagh fer jeu dy ghra rish , Hiarn , nee orrym ' s t ' ou cheet ?

text: And he answered and said , He that dippeth his hand with me in the dish , the same shall betray me .
text2: As dansoor eshyn , gra , eshyn ta thummey e laue marym ayns y chlaare , eh shen nee mish y vrah .

text: The Son of man goeth as it is written of him : but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed ! it had been good for that man if he had not been born .
text2: Ta Mac y dooinney goll , myr te scruit jeh : agh smerg da ' n dooinney shen liorish vees Mac y dooinney er ny vrah : s ' mie veagh eh son y dooinney shen mannagh row eh rieau er jeet er y theihll .

text: Then Judas , which betrayed him , answered and said , Master , is it I ? He said unto him , Thou hast said .
text2: Eisht dansoor Yuaase , ren y vrah eh , as dooyrt eh , Vainshter , nee mish eh ? Dooyrt eshyn rish , T ' ou er ghra eh .

text: And as they were eating , Jesus took bread , and blessed it , and brake it , and gave it to the disciples , and said , Take , eat ; this is my body .
text2: As myr v ' ad gee , ghow Yeesey arran as vannee eh as vrish eh eh , as hug eh eh da ny ostyllyn , gra , Gow - jee , ee - jee , shoh my chorp ' s .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and gave it to them , saying , Drink ye all of it ;
text2: As ghow eh yn cappan , as hug eh booise , as hug eh eh daue , gra , iu - jee ooilley jeh shoh .

text: For this is my blood of the new testament , which is shed for many for the remission of sins .
text2: Son shoh my uill ' s jeh ' n conaant noa , t ' er ny gheayrtey son ymmodee son leih peccaghyn .

text: But I say unto you , I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine , until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father ' s kingdom .
text2: Agh ta mee gra riu , Nagh n ' iu - ym maghey shoh jeh mess y villey - feeyney , derrey ' n laa iu - ym eh ass - y - noa meriu ayns reeriaght my Ayrey .

text: And when they had sung an hymn , they went out into the mount of Olives .
text2: As tra v ' ad er ghoaill arrane - moyllee hie ad magh gys cronk ny Oliveyn .

text: Then saith Jesus unto them , All ye shall be offended because of me this night : for it is written , I will smite the shepherd , and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Failee yn credjue euish ooilley noght kyndagh rhym ' s : son te scruit , Bwoaill - ym ' s yn bochilley , as bee kirree yn chioltane er nyn skeayley .

text: But after I am risen again , I will go before you into Galilee .
text2: Agh erreish dou v ' er n ' irree reesht , hem reu gys Galilee .

text: Peter answered and said unto him , Though all men shall be offended because of thee , yet will I never be offended .
text2: Dansoor Peddyr as dooyrt eh rish , Ga dy vaill credjue dy chooilley ghooinney kyndagh rhyt ' s , cha vaill my chredjue ' s dy bragh .

text: Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , That this night , before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , Noght hene roish gerrym chellee , dy nob uss mish three keayrtyn .

text: Peter said unto him , Though I should die with thee , yet will I not deny thee . Likewise also said all the disciples .
text2: Dooyrt Peddyr rish , Dy beign dou goll dy baase mayrt , cha nobbin oo . As er yn aght cheddin loayr ooilley ny ostyllyn .

text: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane , and saith unto the disciples , Sit ye here , while I go and pray yonder .
text2: Eisht haink Yeesey maroo gys ynnyd va enmyssit Gethsemane , as dooyrt eh rish ny ostyllyn , Soie - jee shiuish ayns shoh , choud as hem ' s gys padjer ' sy voayl shid .

text: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee , and began to be sorrowful and very heavy .
text2: As ghow eh marish Peddyr , as daa vac Zebedee , as ren eh toshiaght dy ve trimshagh as trome - chreeagh .

text: Then saith he unto them , My soul is exceeding sorrowful , even unto death : tarry ye here , and watch with me .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh roo , Ta my annym feer trimshagh , dy jarroo gys y baase : fuirree - jee ayns shoh as freill - jee arrey marym .

text: And he went a little further , and fell on his face , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if it be possible , let this cup pass from me : nevertheless not as I will , but as thou wilt .
text2: As hie eh red beg sodjey , as huitt eh sheese er e eddin , as ghow eh padjer , as dooyrt eh , O my Ayr , my oddys eh ' ve , lhig da ' n cappan shoh goll shagh - ym : ny - yeih cha nee m ' aigney ' s , agh dty aigney ' s dy row jeant .

text: And he cometh unto the disciples , and findeth them asleep , and saith unto Peter , What , could ye not watch with me one hour ?
text2: As haink eh gys ny ostyllyn , as hooar eh ad nyn gadley , as dooyrt eh rish Peddyr , Kys ta shoh , nagh voddagh shiu arrey y reayll marym un oor ?

text: Watch and pray , that ye enter not into temptation : the spirit indeed is willing , but the flesh is weak .
text2: Bee - jee er nyn dwoaie as gow - jee padjer , nagh duitt shiu ayns miolagh : ta ' n spyrryd dy jarroo arryltagh , agh ta ' n eill annoon .

text: He went away again the second time , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if this cup may not pass away from me , except I drink it , thy will be done .
text2: Hie eh roish reesht yn nah cheayrt , as ghow eh padjer , gra , O my Ayr , mannagh vod yn cappan shoh goll shagh - ym , fegooish mee dy iu eh , dty aigney ' s dy row jeant .

text: And he came and found them asleep again : for their eyes were heavy .
text2: As haink eh as hooar eh ad nyn gadley reesht : son va ny sooillyn oc trome .

text: And he left them , and went away again , and prayed the third time , saying the same words .
text2: As daag eh ad , as hie eh roish reesht as ghow eh padjer yn trass cheayrt , gra ny goan cheddin .

text: Then cometh he to his disciples , and saith unto them , Sleep on now , and take your rest : behold , the hour is at hand , and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
text2: Eisht haink eh gys e ostyllyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Caddil - jee nish , as gow - jee nyn vea ; cur - my - ner ta ' n oor tayrn er - gerrey , as ta ' n Mac dooinney er ny vrah gys laueyn peccee .

text: Rise , let us be going : behold , he is at hand that doth betray me .
text2: Irree - jee , as lhig dooin goll : cur - my - ner t ' eshyn er - gerrey dooin ta dy my vrah .

text: And while he yet spake , lo , Judas , one of the twelve , came , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and elders of the people .
text2: As choud as v ' eh foast loayrt , cur my - ner , haink Yuaase , fer jeh ' n daa ostyl yeig , as va sheshaght vooar marish lesh cliwenyn as luirg veih ny ard - saggyrtyn as shanstyr y phobble

text: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign , saying , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that same is he : hold him fast .
text2: Nish hug eshyn v ' er vrah eh , cowrey daue , gra , Quoi - erbee ver - yms paag da , shen eh , cum - jee eh dy shickyr .

text: And forthwith he came to Jesus , and said , Hail , master ; and kissed him .
text2: As chelleeragh haink eh gys Yeesey , as dooyrt eh , Dy vannee dhyt , Vainshter ; as phaag eh eh .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Friend , wherefore art thou come ? Then came they , and laid hands on Jesus , and took him .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , My heshey , cre ' n - fa t ' ou er jeet ? Eisht haink ad , as ghreimm ad er Yeesey , as ghow ad eh .

text: And , behold , one of them which were with Jesus stretched out his hand , and drew his sword , and struck a servant of the high priest ' s , and smote off his ear .
text2: As cur - my - ner heeyn fer jeusyn va marish Yeesey magh e laue , as hayrn eh e chliwe , as woaill eh fer - mooinjerey yn ard saggyrt , as ghiare eh yn chleaysh jeh .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Put up again thy sword into his place : for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish , Cur seose dty chliwe reesht ' sy fine : son nee adsyn ooilley ta goaill y cliwe , cherraghtyn liorish y chliwe .

text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father , and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels ?
text2: Vel uss smooinaghtyn nagh voddym ' s nish guee gys my Ayr , as yinnagh eh chelleeragh hym erskyn daa legion jeig dy ainleyn ?

text: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled , that thus it must be ?
text2: Agh kys eisht vees ny scriptyryn er nyn gooilleeney , dy nee shoh myr te dy ve ?

text: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes , Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me ? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple , and ye laid no hold on me .
text2: Ayns yn oor cheddin dooyrt Yeesey rish y pobble , Vel shiu er jeet magh myr noi maarliagh , lesh cliwenyn as luirg dy my ghoaill ? hoie mee meriu gagh - laa gynsaghey ayns y chiamble , as cha ren shiu my ghoaill .

text: But all this was done , that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled . Then all the disciples forsook him , and fled .
text2: Agh va ooilley shoh jeant , dy voddagh scriptyryn ny phadeyryn ve cooilleenit . Eisht ren ooilley ny ostyllyn treigeil eh , as cosney roue .

text: And they that had laid hold on Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest , where the scribes and the elders were assembled .
text2: As leeid y vooinjer v ' er ghoaill Yeesey eh ersooyl gys Caiaphas yn ard saggyrt , raad va ny scrudeyryn as y chanstyr er nyn jaglym cooidjagh .

text: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest ' s palace , and went in , and sat with the servants , to see the end .
text2: Agh deiyr Peddyr er foddey ny yei , gys thie yn ard - saggyrt , as hie eh stiagh , as hoie eh marish y vooinjer dy yeeaghyn cre ' n erree harragh er .

text: Now the chief priests , and elders , and all the council , sought false witness against Jesus , to put him to death ;
text2: Nish yn ny ard - saggyrtyn as y chanstyr as ooilley yn choonceil , shirrey feanishyn foalsey noi Yeesey dy choyrt eh gy - baase .

text: But found none : yea , though many false witnesses came , yet found they none . At the last came two false witnesses ,
text2: Agh cha dooar ad veg : ga dy daink ymmodee feanishyn foalsey , foast cha dooar ad veg . Ec y jerrey haink daa eanish foalsey ,

text: And said , This fellow said , I am able to destroy the temple of God , and to build it in three days .
text2: As dooyrt ad , T ' eh shoh er ghra , Ta ' n phooar aym ' s dy lhieggal chiamble Yee , as dy hroggal eh reesht ayns three laa .

text: And the high priest arose , and said unto him , Answerest thou nothing ? what is it which these witness against thee ?
text2: As hass yn ard - saggyrt seose , as dooyrt eh rish , Nagh vel oo cur ansoor ? cre shoh t ' ad dy lhiassaghey dt ' oi ?

text: But Jesus held his peace . And the high priest answered and said unto him , I adjure thee by the living God , that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ , the Son of God .
text2: Agh va Yeesey ny - host . As dreggyr yn ard - saggyrt as dooyrt eh rish , Ta mee cur currym ort liorish y Jee bio , oo dy insh dooin , nee oo yn Creest mac Yee ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , Thou hast said : nevertheless I say unto you , Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power , and coming in the clouds of heaven .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , T ' ou uss er ghra eh : ny - yeih ta mish gra riu , Ny lurg shoh hee shiu Mac y dooinney ny hoie er laue yesh yn phooar , as cheet ayns bodjallyn yn aer .

text: Then the high priest rent his clothes , saying , He hath spoken blasphemy ; what further need have we of witnesses ? behold , now ye have heard his blasphemy .
text2: Eisht raip yn ard - saggyrt e choamrey , gra , ren er loayrt goan mollaghtagh , cre ' n feme sodjey t ' ain er feanishyn ? cur - my - ner , nish ta shiu er chlashtyn e ghoan mollaghtagh .

text: What think ye ? They answered and said , He is guilty of death .
text2: Cre ta shiu smooinaghtyn jeh ? Dansoor ad , as dooyrt ad , T ' eh toilchin dy ve er ny choyrt gy - baase .

text: Then did they spit in his face , and buffeted him ; and others smote him with the palms of their hands ,
text2: Eisht cheau ad shellaghyn ayns e eddin , as woaill ad eh , as woaill feallagh elley eh lesh bassyn nyn laueyn .

text: Saying , Prophesy unto us , thou Christ , Who is he that smote thee ?
text2: Gra , Jean phadeyrys dooin , uss yn Creest , quoi ta dy dty woalley ?

text: Now Peter sat without in the palace : and a damsel came unto him , saying , Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee .
text2: Nish va Peddyr ny hoie cheu - mooie jeh ' n cheshaght ayns y halley : as haink ben aeg huggey , gra , V ' ou uss myrgeddin marish Yeesey dy Ghalilee .

text: But he denied before them all , saying , I know not what thou sayest .
text2: Agh dob eh kiongoyrt roo ooilley , gra , Cha s ' aym cre t ' ou dy ghra .

text: And when he was gone out into the porch , another maid saw him , and said unto them that were there , This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: As tra v ' eh er gholl magh ayns y phorch , honnick ben - aeg elley eh , as dooyrt ee roosyn v ' ayns shen , V ' eh shoh myrgeddin marish Yeesey dy Nazareth .

text: And again he denied with an oath , I do not know the man .
text2: As reesht dob eh lesh loo , Cha nione dou yn dooinney .

text: And after a while came unto him they that stood by , and said to Peter , Surely thou also art one of them ; for thy speech bewrayeth thee .
text2: As tammylt ny lurg shen haink huggey paart jeh ' n cheshaght , as dooyrt ad rish Peddyr , Shickyr she fer jeu oo , son ta dty ghlare dy dty vrah .

text: Then began he to curse and to swear , saying , I know not the man . And immediately the cock crew .
text2: Eisht ren eh toshiaght dy ghweeaghyn as dy loo , gra , Cha nione dou yn dooinney . As chelleeragh ren y kellagh gerrym .

text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus , which said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice . And he went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: As chooinee Peddyr er ny goan va Yeesey er ghra rish , Roish gerrym y chellee , obbee uss mish three keayrtyn . As hie eh magh as cheayn eh dy sharroo .

text: When the morning was come , all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death :
text2: Tra va ' n moghrey er jeet rish , hug ooilley ny ard - saggyrtyn as shanstyr yn phobble nyn goyrle dy cheilley , dy choyrt eh gy - baase .

text: And when they had bound him , they led him away , and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor .
text2: As erreish daue v ' er chiangley eh , leeid ad eh ersooyl , as livrey ad eh gys Pontius Pilate yn kiannoort ,

text: Then Judas , which had betrayed him , when he saw that he was condemned , repented himself , and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders ,
text2: Tra honnick eisht Yuaase ren y vrah eh , dy row eh er ny gheyrey , ghow eh arrys , as hug eh lesh reesht ny jeih peeshyn as feed dy argid gys ny ard - saggyrtyn as y chanstyr ,

text: Saying , I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood . And they said , What is that to us ? see thou to that .
text2: Gra , Ta mee er n ' yannoo peccah , ayns dy vel mee er vrah yn uill neu - chyndagh . As dooyrt adsyn , Cre ta shen dooinyn ? jeeagh uss da shen .

text: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple , and departed , and went and hanged himself .
text2: As hilg eh sheese ny peeshyn argid ayns y chiamble , as jimmee eh roish , as hie eh as ren eh eh - hene y chroghey .

text: And the chief priests took the silver pieces , and said , It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury , because it is the price of blood .
text2: As ghow ny ard - Saggyrtyn ny peeshyn argid , as dooyrt ad , Cha vel eh lowal dy choyrt ad mastey tashtaghyn y chiamble er - yn - oyr dy nee leagh foalley t ' ayn .

text: And they took counsel , and bought with them the potter ' s field , to bury strangers in .
text2: As ghow ad coyrle , as chionnee ad lhieu magher yn phasheyder , dy oanluckey joarreeyn ayn .

text: Wherefore that field was called , The field of blood , unto this day .
text2: Shen - y - fa va ' n magher shen enmyssit , Yn magher - foalley , gys y laa t ' ayn jiu .

text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet , saying , And they took the thirty pieces of silver , the price of him that was valued , whom they of the children of Israel did value ;
text2: ( Shen y traa va cooilleenit ny va loayrit liorish Jeremy yn phadeyr , gra , As ghow ad ny jeih peeshyn as feed dy argid , yn phrice echeysyn v ' er ny phriceil , eshyn hug cloan Isra price er :

text: And gave them for the potter ' s field , as the Lord appointed me .
text2: As hug ad ad son magher yn phasheyder , myr va ' n Chiarn er n ' oardaghey dou ) .

text: And Jesus stood before the governor : and the governor asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And Jesus said unto him , Thou sayest .
text2: As hass Yeesey fenish y chiannoort , as denee yn kiannoort jeh , gra , Nee uss ree ny Hewnyn ? As dooyrt Yeesey rish , T ' ou uss dy ghra eh .

text: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders , he answered nothing .
text2: As tra v ' eh er ny chassid liorish ny ard - saggyrtyn as y chanstyr , cha dug eh ansoor erbee daue .

text: Then said Pilate unto him , Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt Pilate rish , Nagh vel oo clashtyn cre whilleen red t ' ad shoh cur stiagh

text: And he answered him to never a word ; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly .
text2: As cha dug eh un ockle dy ansoor da , ayns wheesh as dy ghow yn kiannoort yindys mooar .

text: Now at that feast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner , whom they would .
text2: Nish ec y feailley shen va ' n kiannoort cliaghtey feaysley daue pryssoonagh erbee dy bailloo .

text: And they had then a notable prisoner , called Barabbas .
text2: As va oc ec y traa shen ard - phryssoon agh va enmyssit Barabbas .

text: Therefore when they were gathered together , Pilate said unto them , Whom will ye that I release unto you ? Barabbas , or Jesus which is called Christ ?
text2: Shen - y - fa tra v ' ad er nyn jaglym cooidjagh , dooyrt Pilate roo , Quoi sailliu mee dy eaysley diu ? Barabbas , ny Yeesey , ta enmyssit Creest ?

text: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him .
text2: Son va fys echey dy nee ayns goanlys v ' ad er chur stiagh eh .

text: When he was set down on the judgment seat , his wife sent unto him , saying , Have thou nothing to do with that just man : for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him .
text2: Erreish da soie er stoyl y vriwnys , hug e ven fys huggey , gra , Ny bee veg ayd ' s dy yannoo rish y dooinney cairagh shen : son s ' mooar ta mee er hurranse jiu ayns my chadley , er y choontey echeysyn .

text: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas , and destroy Jesus .
text2: Agh choyrlee ny ard - saggyrtyn as shanstyr y phobble ad dy yannoo aghin son Barabbas , as Yeesey y choyrt gy - baase .

text: The governor answered and said unto them , Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you ? They said , Barabbas .
text2: Dansoor y kiannoort as dooyrt eh roo , Quoi jeh ' n jees sailliu mee dy eaysley diu ? Dooyrt adsyn , Barabbas .

text: Pilate saith unto them , What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ ? They all say unto him , Let him be crucified .
text2: Dooyrt Pilate roo , Cre nee ' m eisht rish Yeesey , ta enmyssit Creest ? Dooyrt ad ooilley rish , Lhig da v ' er ny chrossey .

text: And the governor said , Why , what evil hath he done ? But they cried out the more , saying , Let him be crucified .
text2: As dooyrt y kiannoort , Cre ' n - oyr , cre ' n olk t ' eh er n ' yannoo ? Agh deie adsyn ny smoo , gra , Lhig da v ' er ny chrossey .

text: When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing , but that rather a tumult was made , he took water , and washed his hands before the multitude , saying , I am innocent of the blood of this just person : see ye to it .
text2: Tra honnick Pilate nagh dug ad geill da e choyrle , agh dy row ad aarloo dy irree - magh , ghow eh ushtey , as niee eh e laueyn kiongoyrt rish y pobble , gra , Ta mish neu - chyndagh jeh fuill yn phersoon cairagh shen , jeeagh - jee shiuish da .

text: Then answered all the people , and said , His blood be on us , and on our children .
text2: Eisht dansoor ooilley yn pobble , gra , Yn uill echey dy row orrinyn , as er nyn gloan .

text: Then released he Barabbas unto them : and when he had scourged Jesus , he delivered him to be crucified .
text2: Eisht deayshil eh Barabbas daue ; as erreish da Yeesey ve scuitchit , hug eh briwnys er dy v ' er ny chrossey .

text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall , and gathered unto him the whole band of soldiers .
text2: Eisht hug sidooryn y chiannoort lhieu Yeesey gys halley ny briwnys , as deie ad er slane sheshaght ny sidooryn .

text: And they stripped him , and put on him a scarlet robe .
text2: As rooisht ad eh , as hug ad er coamrey scarleod .

text: And when they had platted a crown of thorns , they put it upon his head , and a reed in his right hand : and they bowed the knee before him , and mocked him , saying , Hail , King of the Jews !
text2: As fee attey dy ghrineyn hug ad eh mysh e chione , as cuirtlagh ayns e laue - yesh : as gliooney kiongoyrt rish dooyrt ad ayns craid , Dy vannee dhyt , Ree ny Hewnyn .

text: And they spit upon him , and took the reed , and smote him on the head .
text2: As cheau ad shellaghyn er , as ghow ad y chuirtlagh , as woaill ad eh er y chione

text: And after that they had mocked him , they took the robe off from him , and put his own raiment on him , and led him away to crucify him .
text2: As erreish daue v ' er n ' yannoo ( nyn saie ) craid er , ghow ad yn coamrey reeoil jeh as hug ad e gharmad hene er , as leeid ad eh ersooyl dy chrossey eh .

text: And as they came out , they found a man of Cyrene , Simon by name : him they compelled to bear his cross .
text2: As myr haink ad magh , hooar ad dooinney jeh Cyrene , enmyssit Simon : eshyn ren ad y eaginaghey dy ymmyrkey e chrosh .

text: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha , that is to say , a place of a skull ,
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet gys ynnyd ta enmyssit Golgotha , ta shen dy ghra , Ynnyd bollag .

text: They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall : and when he had tasted thereof , he would not drink .
text2: Hug ad da vinegar dy iu , as gall ny - chione : as tra v ' eh er vlashtyn eh , cha baillish giu .

text: And they crucified him , and parted his garments , casting lots : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , They parted my garments among them , and upon my vesture did they cast lots .
text2: As ren ad eh y chrossey , as rheynn ad e gharmadyn , tilgey lottyn : as shoh myr va cooilleenit shen loayr y phadeyr , Rheynn ad my gharmadyn nyn mast ' oc , as er my chooat ren ad lottyn y hilgey .

text: And sitting down they watched him there ;
text2: As hoie ad sheese as dreill ad arrey er ayns shen .

text: And set up over his head his accusation written , THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: As hoie ad erskyn e chione oyr e vaaish scruit , SHOH YEESEY REE NY HEWNYN .

text: Then were there two thieves crucified with him , one on the right hand , and another on the left .
text2: Eisht va daa vaarliagh er ny chrossey marish : yn derrey yeh er y laue - yesh , as y jeh elley er y laue - chiare .

text: And they that passed by reviled him , wagging their heads ,
text2: As doltooan y vooinjer va goll shaghey eh , craa nyn ghing .

text: And saying , Thou that destroyest the temple , and buildest it in three days , save thyself . If thou be the Son of God , come down from the cross .
text2: As gra , Uss ta lhieggal y chiamble , as dy hroggal eh reesht ayns three laa , saue oo hene : my she mac Yee oo , tar neose jeh ' n chrosh .

text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking him , with the scribes and elders , said ,
text2: Myr shen neesht ren ny ard saggyrtyn craidey mysh , marish ny scrudeyryn as y chanstyr , as dooyrt ad ,

text: He saved others ; himself he cannot save . If he be the King of Israel , let him now come down from the cross , and we will believe him .
text2: Haue eh feallagh elley , eh - hene cha vod eh sauail : my she ree Israel eh , lhig da cheet neose jeh ' n chrosh , as nee mayd credjal ayn .

text: He trusted in God ; let him deliver him now , if he will have him : for he said , I am the Son of God .
text2: Hreisht eh ayns Jee ; lhig da eh y livrey nish my saillish eh : son dooyrt eh , She mac Yee mee .

text: The thieves also , which were crucified with him , cast the same in his teeth .
text2: Hilg ny maarlee myrgeddin v ' er nyn grossey marish yn lheid cheddin er .

text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour .
text2: Nish veih yn cheyoo oor , va dorraghys harrish ooilley yn cheer , gys yn nuyoo oor .

text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice , saying , Eli , Eli , lama sabachthani ? that is to say , My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me ?
text2: As mygeayrt yn nuyoo oor , deie Yeesey lesh ard - choraa , gra , ELI , ELI , LAMA SABACTHANI ? ta shen dy ghra , My Yee , My Yee , cre ' n - fa t ' ou er my hreigeil ?

text: Some of them that stood there , when they heard that , said , This man calleth for Elias .
text2: Dooyrt paart jeusyn va nyn shassoo ayns shen , tra cheayll ad shen , Ta ' n dooinney shoh geamagh er Elias .

text: And straightway one of them ran , and took a spunge , and filled it with vinegar , and put it on a reed , and gave him to drink .
text2: As chelleeragh roie fer jeu , as ghow eh sponge as lhieen eh eh lesh vinegar , as hug eh eh er cuirtlagh , as heeyn eh eh huggey dy iu .

text: The rest said , Let be , let us see whether Elias will come to save him .
text2: Dooyrt y vooinjer elley , Faag - jee veue eh , hee mayd jig Elias dy hauail eh .

text: Jesus , when he had cried again with a loud voice , yielded up the ghost .
text2: Tra va Yeesey er n ' eamagh reesht lesh ard - choraa , phaart eh . .

text: And , behold , the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom ; and the earth did quake , and the rocks rent ;
text2: As cur - my - ner , va ' n coodaghey va eddyr , y chiamble as yn ynnyd casherick raipit veih - my - cheilley , veih ' n vullagh gys y laare ; as ren y thalloo craa , as ny creggyn scoltey .

text: And the graves were opened ; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose ,
text2: As va ny oaiaghyn er nyn vosley , as ren ymmodee jeh kirp ny nooghyn va nyn gadley , girree seose ,

text: And came out of the graves after his resurrection , and went into the holy city , and appeared unto many .
text2: As cheet ass ny oaiaghyn oc lurg yn irree - seose - reesht echey , hie ad stiagh ayns yn ard - valley casherick , as hoilshee ad ad hene da ymmodee .

text: Now when the centurion , and they that were with him , watching Jesus , saw the earthquake , and those things that were done , they feared greatly , saying , Truly this was the Son of God .
text2: Nish tra honnick yn captan , as adsyn va marish freayll arrey er Yeesey , yn craa thallooin , as ny reddyn v ' er jeet gy - kione , ghow ad aggle mooar , gra , Dy firrinagh shoh va Mac Yee .

text: And many women were there beholding afar off , which followed Jesus from Galilee , ministering unto him :
text2: As va ymmodee mraane ayns shen ( va jeeaghyn er tammylt voue ) va er n ' eiyrt er Yeesey veih Galilee dy hirveish er .

text: Among which was Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James and Joses , and the mother of Zebedee ' s children .
text2: Nyn mast ' oc va Moirrey Malaine , as Moirrey moir Yamys as Voses , as moir cloan Zebedee .

text: When the even was come , there came a rich man of Arimathaea , named Joseph , who also himself was Jesus ' disciple :
text2: Tra va ' n fastyr er jeet , haink dooinney berchagh ass Arimathea , va enmyssit Joseph va myrgeddin eh - hene credjal ayns Yeesey .

text: He went to Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus . Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered .
text2: Hie eh shoh gys Pilate , as ren eh aghin son corp Yeesey : eisht doardee Pilate yn corp dy ve er ny livrey .

text: And when Joseph had taken the body , he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth ,
text2: As tra va Joseph er n ' ghoaill y corp hoill eh eh ayns aanrit glen ,

text: And laid it in his own new tomb , which he had hewn out in the rock : and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre , and departed .
text2: As doanluck eh eh ayns yn oaie noa echey hene , v ' eh er chleiy ass y chreg : as rowl eh clagh vooar er beeal yn oaie , as jimmee eh roish .

text: And there was Mary Magdalene , and the other Mary , sitting over against the sepulchre .
text2: As va Moirrey Malaine , as Moirrey elley , nyn soie jeeragh er yn oaie .

text: Now the next day , that followed the day of the preparation , the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate ,
text2: Nish yn nah laa lurg laa yn aarlaghey haink ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn cooidjagh gys Pilate ,

text: Saying , Sir , we remember that that deceiver said , while he was yet alive , After three days I will rise again .
text2: Gra , Vainshter , ta cooinaghtyn ain dy dooyrt yn molteyr shen , choud as v ' eh foast bio , Lurg three laa neem ' s girree reesht .

text: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day , lest his disciples come by night , and steal him away , and say unto the people , He is risen from the dead : so the last error shall be worse than the first .
text2: Cur sarey er - y - fa shen yn oaie dy ve jeant shickyr , derrey yn trass laa , er - aggle dy jig e ostyllyn ayns yn oie , as dy geid ad eh ersooyl , as dy jir ad rish yn pobble , T ' eh er n ' irree veih ny merriu : myr shen bee yn molteyrys s ' jerree ny smessey na ' n chied volteyrys .

text: Pilate said unto them , Ye have a watch : go your way , make it as sure as ye can .
text2: Dooyrt Pilate roo , Ta watch eu immee - jee reue , jean - jee cha shickyr jeh as oddys shiu .

text: So they went , and made the sepulchre sure , sealing the stone , and setting a watch .
text2: Myr shen hie ad , as ren ad yn oaie shickyr , sealal y chlagh , as soiaghey watch .

text: In the end of the sabbath , as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week , came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre .
text2: Tra va ' n doonaght harrish , as y vadran cheet rish er y chied laa jeh ' n chiaghtin , haink Moirrey Malaine , as Moirrey elley dy voddagh ad yn oaie y akin .

text: And , behold , there was a great earthquake : for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven , and came and rolled back the stone from the door , and sat upon it .
text2: As cur - my - ner va craa thallooin mooar ayn ; son va ainle y Chiarn er jeet neose veih niau , as er jeet as er rowlal back yn chlagh jeh beeal yn oaie , as er hoie urree .

text: His countenance was like lightning , and his raiment white as snow :
text2: Va ' n eddin echey goll - rish y tendreil , as e choamrey gial myr y sniaghtey .

text: And for fear of him the keepers did shake , and became as dead men .
text2: As ayns aggle roish va ny arreyderyn er creau , as haink ad dy ve myr deiney marroo .

text: And the angel answered and said unto the women , Fear not ye : for I know that ye seek Jesus , which was crucified .
text2: As dreggyr yn ainle , as dooyrt eh rish ny mraane , Ny gow - jee aggle : son ta fys aym ' s dy vel shiu shirrey Yeesey , v ' er ny chrossey .

text: He is not here : for he is risen , as he said . Come , see the place where the Lord lay .
text2: Cha vel eh ayns shoh , son t ' eh er n ' irree myr dooyrt eh - hene : tar - jee , jeeagh - jee er yn ynnyd raad va ' n Chiarn oanluckit .

text: And go quickly , and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead ; and , behold , he goeth before you into Galilee ; there shall ye see him : lo , I have told you .
text2: As immee - jee dy tappee , as insh - jee da e ostyllyn , dy vel eh er n ' irree veih ny merriu ; as cur - my - ner , t ' eh goll reue gys Galilee , ayns shen hee shiu eh , cur - my - ner , ta mish er n ' insh diu .

text: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy ; and did run to bring his disciples word .
text2: As jimmee ad dy tappee veih ' n oaie lesh aggle as boggey mooar , as roie ad dy chur lhieu yn naight gys e ostyllyn .

text: And as they went to tell his disciples , behold , Jesus met them , saying , All hail . And they came and held him by the feet , and worshipped him .
text2: As myr v ' ad goll dy insh eh da e ostyllyn , cur - my - ner haink Yeesey nyn guail , gra , Dy vannee diu . As haink ad , as huitt ad sheese ec e chassyn , lesh nyn laueyn orroo , cur ooashley da .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Be not afraid : go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee , and there shall they see me .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Ny gow - jee aggle : immee - jee , as abbyr - jee rish my vraaraghyn ad dy gholl gys Galilee , as ayns shen hee ad mee .

text: Now when they were going , behold , some of the watch came into the city , and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done .
text2: Nish myr v ' ad goll , cur - my - ner , haink shiartanse jeh ' n arrey gys yn ard - valley , as dinsh ad da ny ard - saggyrtyn ooilley ny va er daghyrt .

text: And when they were assembled with the elders , and had taken counsel , they gave large money unto the soldiers ,
text2: As tra v ' adsyn as y chanstyr er nyn jaglym cooidjagh , as er chur nyn goyrle dy cheilley hug ad sym mooar dy argid da ny sidooryn ,

text: Saying , Say ye , His disciples came by night , and stole him away while we slept .
text2: Gra , Abbyr - jee shiuish , Haink e ostyllyn ayns yn oie , as gheid ad eh ersooyl choud as va shin nyn gadley .

text: And if this come to the governor ' s ears , we will persuade him , and secure you .
text2: As my chlinnys y kiannoort jeh , nee mayd eshyn y vreagey as shiuish y heyrey .

text: So they took the money , and did as they were taught : and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day .
text2: Myr shen ghow ad yn argid , as ren ad myr va currit roue : as ta ' n raa shoh dy cadjin er ny insh magh mastey ny Hewnyn gys y laa t ' ayn jiu .

text: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee , into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them .
text2: Eisht hie yn un ostyl yeig roue gys Galilee , gys slieau raad va Yeesey er n ' oardaghey daue .

text: And when they saw him , they worshipped him : but some doubted .
text2: As tra honnick ad eh , hug ad ooashley da : agh va paart jeu fo mee - ourys .

text: And Jesus came and spake unto them , saying , All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth .
text2: As haink Yeesey , as loayr eh roo , gra , Ta dy chooilley phooar er ny chur dou ayns niau as er y thalloo .

text: Go ye therefore , and teach all nations , baptizing them in the name of the Father , and of the Son , and of the Holy Ghost :
text2: Immee - jee er - y - fa shen , as ynsee - jee dy chooilley ashoon , as bashtee - jee ad ayns ennym yn Ayr , as y Vac , as y spyrryd Noo :

text: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you : and , lo , I am with you alway , even unto the end of the world . Amen .
text2: Gynsaghey daue dy reayll dy chooilley nhee cre - erbee ta mish er chur ayns sarey diu : as cur - my - ner , ta mish meriu kinjagh , eer gys jerrey yn theihll .

text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ , the Son of God ;
text2: Toshiaght sushtal Yeesey Creest , Mac Yee ;

text: As it is written in the prophets , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Myr te scruit ayns ny phadeyryn ; Cur - my - ner , ta mee cur my haghter roish dty eddin , dy chiartaghey dty raad kiongoyrt rhyt .

text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Coraa fer geamagh ayns yn aasagh , Kiartee - jee raad y Chiarn , jean - jee ny cassanyn echey jeeragh .

text: John did baptize in the wilderness , and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins .
text2: Ren Ean bashtey ayns yn aassagh , as preacheil bashtey arrys , son leih peccaghyn .

text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea , and they of Jerusalem , and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: As hie magh huggey ooilley cheer Yudea as cummaltee Yerusalem , as v ' ad ooilley er nyn mashtey liorish ayns awin Yordan , goaill rish nyn beccaghyn .

text: And John was clothed with camel ' s hair , and with a girdle of a skin about his loins ; and he did eat locusts and wild honey ;
text2: As va Ean coamrit lesh garmad jeh fynney chamel , as lesh cryss liare mysh e veeghyn : as v ' eh beaghey er locustyn as mill feie :

text: And preached , saying , There cometh one mightier than I after me , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose .
text2: As ren eh preacheil , gra , Ta fer s ' pooaral na mish cheet my - yei , kiangley ny braagyn echey cha vel mee feeu dy chroymmey sheese as dy eaysley .

text: I indeed have baptized you with water : but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ta mish dy jarroo er vashtey shiu lesh ushtey : agh bashtee eshyn shiu lesh y Spyrryd Noo .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee , and was baptized of John in Jordan .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione ayns ny laghyn shen , dy daink Yeesey veih Nazareth dy Ghalilee , as v ' eh er ny vashtey liorish Ean ayns Jordan .

text: And straightway coming up out of the water , he saw the heavens opened , and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him :
text2: As jeeragh myr haink eh seose ass yn ushtey , honnick eh ny niaughyn foshlit , as y spyrryd myr calmane cheet neose er .

text: And there came a voice from heaven , saying , Thou art my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: As haink coraa veih niau , gra , Oo my vac ennoil , jeed ta mee dy mooar soiaghey .

text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness .
text2: As chelleeragh hug yn spyrryd lesh eh gys yn aasagh .

text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days , tempted of Satan ; and was with the wild beasts ; and the angels ministered unto him .
text2: As v ' eh ayns shen ' syn aasagh da - eed laa er ny violaghey liorish y drogh - spyrryd , as v ' eh marish ny beiyn feie , as ren ny ainleyn shirveish er .

text: Now after that John was put in prison , Jesus came into Galilee , preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God ,
text2: Nish erreish da Ean ve currit ayns pryssoon , haink Yeesey gys Galilee , preacheil sushtal reeriaght Yee ,

text: And saying , The time is fulfilled , and the kingdom of God is at hand : repent ye , and believe the gospel .
text2: As gra , Ta ' n traa cooilleenit , as ta reeriaght Yee er - gerrey : gow - jee arrys , as credjee yn sushtal .

text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee , he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: Nish myr v ' eh shooyl liorish faarkey ghalilee , honnick eh Simon as Andreays e vraar cuirr magh lieen ayns y cheayn : ( son v ' ad nyn eeasteyryn )

text: And Jesus said unto them , Come ye after me , and I will make you to become fishers of men .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Tar - jee as eiyr - jee orrym ' s , as neem ' s shiu nyn eeasteyryn dy gheiney .

text: And straightway they forsook their nets , and followed him .
text2: As chelleeragh hreig ad nyn lieenteenyn , as deiyr ad er .

text: And when he had gone a little further thence , he saw James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , who also were in the ship mending their nets .
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' gholl red beg sodjey veih shen , honnick eh Jamys mac Zebedee , as Ean e vraar , va myrgeddin ayns y lhong kerraghey nyn lieen .

text: And straightway he called them : and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants , and went after him .
text2: As chelleeragh deie eh orroo as daag ad nyn ayr Zebedee ayns y lhong marish ny sharvaantyn failt , as hie ad geiyrt er .

text: And they went into Capernaum ; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue , and taught .
text2: As hie ad stiagh ayns Capernaum , as chelleeragh er laa yn doonaght , hie eh stiagh ayns y synagogue , as dynsee eh .

text: And they were astonished at his doctrine : for he taught them as one that had authority , and not as the scribes .
text2: As ghow ad yindys mooar jeh ' n ynsaghey echey : son dynsee eh ad myr fer ayns pooar , as cha nee myr ny scrudeyryn .

text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit ; and he cried out ,
text2: As va ayns y synagogue oc dooinney Iesh spyrryd neu - ghlen , as dyllee eh ,

text: Saying , Let us alone ; what have we to do with thee , thou Jesus of Nazareth ? art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art , the Holy One of God .
text2: Gra , Faag void shin , cre ' n eie t ' ayd orrin , Yeesey dy Nazareth ? vel oo er jeet dy nyn stroie ? ta fys aym quoi oo hene , eer fer casherick Yee .

text: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and come out of him .
text2: As hug Yeesey oghsan da , gra , Bee dty host , as tar magh ass .

text: And when the unclean spirit had torn him , and cried with a loud voice , he came out of him .
text2: As tra va ' n spyrryd neu - ghlen er n ' eiyrt eh noon as noal , as er n ' eamagh lesh ard choraa , haink eh magh ass .

text: And they were all amazed , insomuch that they questioned among themselves , saying , What thing is this ? what new doctrine is this ? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits , and they do obey him .
text2: As v ' ad ooilley fo atchim , ayns wheesh as dy row ad resooney nyn mast ' oc hene , gra , Cre ' n red shoh ? cre ' n ynsagh noa shoh ? son ta ny eer spyrrydyn neu - ghlen dy pooaral echey fo smaght , as t ' ad beasagh da .

text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee .
text2: As chelleeragh hie goo jeh magh trooid ooilley yn cheer mygeayrt Galilee .

text: And forthwith , when they were come out of the synagogue , they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew , with James and John .
text2: As cha leah as v ' ad er jeet magh ass y synagogue , hie ad stiagh ayns thie Simon as Andreays , marish Jamys as Ean .

text: But Simon ' s wife ' s mother lay sick of a fever , and anon they tell him of her .
text2: Agh va moir ben Simon ny lhie ching ' sy chiassaghey , as chelleeragh dinsh ad da mychione eck .

text: And he came and took her by the hand , and lifted her up ; and immediately the fever left her , and she ministered unto them .
text2: As haink eh as ghow eh ee er y laue , as hrog eh seose ee ; as chelleeragh daag y chiassaghey ee , as ren ee shirveish orroo .

text: And at even , when the sun did set , they brought unto him all that were diseased , and them that were possessed with devils .
text2: As ayns yn astyr mysh lhie ny greiney hug ad lhieu huggey dy chooilley unnane va doghanit , as adsyn va drogh - spyrrydyn ayndoo .

text: And all the city was gathered together at the door .
text2: As va ooilley yn ard - valley er nyn jaglym cooidjagh ec y dorrys .

text: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases , and cast out many devils ; and suffered not the devils to speak , because they knew him .
text2: As ren eh ymmodee y lheihys va seaghnit lesh mooarane doghanyn , as ymmodee drogh - spyrrydyn y chastey , as cha lhig eh da ny drogh - spyrrydyn dy loayrt , ny dy ghra dy row enney oc er .

text: And in the morning , rising up a great while before day , he went out , and departed into a solitary place , and there prayed .
text2: As moghrey laa - ny - vairagh dirree eh foddey roish y laa , as hie eh magh , as jimmee eh gys boayl faasagh , as ayns shen ghow eh padjer .

text: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him .
text2: As deiyr Simon er , as adsyn va marish .

text: And when they had found him , they said unto him , All men seek for thee .
text2: As tra v ' ad er gheddyn eh , dooyrt ad rish , Ta dy chooilley ghooinney briaght dty yei .

text: And he said unto them , Let us go into the next towns , that I may preach there also : for therefore came I forth .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Lhig dooin goll gys baljyn sniessey dooin , dy voddym preacheil ayndoo shen myrgeddin : son er - yn - oyr shen haink mee gys y theihll .

text: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee , and cast out devils .
text2: As ren eh preacheil ayns ny synagogueyn oc trooid ooilley Galilee , as chast eh drogh spyrrydyn .

text: And there came a leper to him , beseeching him , and kneeling down to him , and saying unto him , If thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: As haink lourane huggey , guee er , as gliooney sheese huggey , as gra rish , My she dty aigney eh , foddee oo mish y yannoo glen .

text: And Jesus , moved with compassion , put forth his hand , and touched him , and saith unto him , I will ; be thou clean .
text2: As va Yeesey er ny veiyghey lesh chymmey , as heeyn eh magh e laue , as venn eh rish , as dooyrt eh , M ' aigney ' s eh , bee er dty ghlenney .

text: And as soon as he had spoken , immediately the leprosy departed from him , and he was cleansed .
text2: As cha row eh ny s ' leah er loayrt , agh chelleeragh daag y louraanys eh , as v ' eh er ny ghlenney .

text: And he straitly charged him , and forthwith sent him away ;
text2: As hug eh currym geyre er , as chelleeragh hug eh ersooyl eh .

text: And saith unto him , See thou say nothing to any man : but go thy way , shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Jeeagh nagh loayr oo veg rish dooinney erbee : agh immee royd , jeeagh oo hene da ' n taggyrt , as cheb son dty ghlenney shen doardee Moses son cowrey daue .

text: But he went out , and began to publish it much , and to blaze abroad the matter , insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city , but was without in desert places : and they came to him from every quarter .
text2: Agh hie eh roish , as ren eh toshiaght dy hoilshaghey magh as dy skeayley mygeayrt yn chooish , ayns wheesh as nagh dod Yeesey goll ny smoo dy foshlit gys yn ard - valley , agh v ' eh mooie ayns ynnydyn faasagh : as haink ad huggey veih dy chooilley ard .

text: And again he entered into Capernaum , after some days ; and it was noised that he was in the house .
text2: As laghyn ny lurg shen , hie eh reesht gys Capernaum , as ve er ny insh magh dy row eh ayns y thie .

text: And straightway many were gathered together , insomuch that there was no room to receive them , no , not so much as about the door : and he preached the word unto them .
text2: As chelleeragh va ymmodee er nyn jaglym cooidjagh , ayns wheesh as nagh row room dy ghoaill ad , wheesh as mygeayrt y dorrys : as ren eh yn goo y phreacheil daue .

text: And they come unto him , bringing one sick of the palsy , which was borne of four .
text2: As haink ad huggey , cur lhieu fer va seaghnit lesh y chingys - craaee , v ' er ny hroggal stiagh liorish kiare dy leih .

text: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press , they uncovered the roof where he was : and when they had broken it up , they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay .
text2: As tra nagh dod ad cheet er - gerrey da kyndagh rish y chennid , rooisht ad kione y thie raad v ' eh : as erreish daue v ' er vosley stiagh ny hrooid , lhig ad sheese y lhiabbee ayn va ' n palsee - doghanit ny lhie .

text: When Jesus saw their faith , he said unto the sick of the palsy , Son , thy sins be forgiven thee .
text2: Tra hug Yeesey tastey da ' n chredjue oc , dooyrt eh rish y dooinney ching , Vac , ta dty pheccaghyn er nyn leih dhyt .

text: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there , and reasoning in their hearts ,
text2: Agh va shiartanse jeh ny scrudeyryn nyn soie ayns shen , as v ' ad resooney ayns nyn greeaghyn ,

text: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies ? who can forgive sins but God only ?
text2: Cre ' n - fa ta ' n dooinney shoh loayrt goan mollaghtagh ? quoi oddys peccaghyn y leih , agh Jee ny - lomarcan ?

text: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves , he said unto them , Why reason ye these things in your hearts ?
text2: As chelleeragh tra dennee Yeesey ayns e spyrryd dy row ad myr shoh resooney cheu - sthie jeu hene , dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu smooinaghtyn lheid ny reddyn shoh ayns nyn greeaghyn ?

text: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Arise , and take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Cre sassey dy ghra , rish y palsee - doghanit , Ta dty pheccaghyn er nyn leih dhyt : ny dy ghra , Irree , as trog seose dty lhiabbee , as jean shooyl .

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , ( he saith to the sick of the palsy , )
text2: Agh dy vod fys y ve eu dy vel pooar ec Mac y dooinney er y thalloo dy leih peccaghyn ( dooyrt eh rish y palsee - doghanit )

text: I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy bed , and go thy way into thine house .
text2: Ta mee gra rhyt , Irree , as trog seose dty lhiabbee , as immee royd gys dty hie .

text: And immediately he arose , took up the bed , and went forth before them all ; insomuch that they were all amazed , and glorified God , saying , We never saw it on this fashion .
text2: As chelleeragh dirree eh , hrog eh e lhiabbee , as hie eh magh kiongoyrt roo ooilley , ayns wheesh as dy row ad ooilley lhieent lesh atchim , as dy ren ad Jee y ghloyraghey , gra , Cha vaik shin eh rieau er yn aght shoh .

text: And he went forth again by the sea side ; and all the multitude resorted unto him , and he taught them .
text2: As hie eh magh reesht rish oirr ny marrey , as haink ooilley yn pobble huggey , as dynsee eh ad .

text: And as he passed by , he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom , and said unto him , Follow me . And he arose and followed him .
text2: As myr v ' eh goll shaghey , honnick eh Levi mac Alpheus ny hoie ec boayrd y cheesh , as dooyrt eh rish , Eiyr orrym ' s . As dirree eh seose as deiyr eh er .

text: And it came to pass , that , as Jesus sat at meat in his house , many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples : for there were many , and they followed him .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr va Yeesey ny hoie ec bee ayns y thie echey , dy ren myrgeddin ymmodee publicanee as peccee soie sheese marish Yeesey as e heshaght : son va ymmodee er n ' eiyrt er .

text: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners , they said unto his disciples , How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners ?
text2: As tra honnick ny scrudeyryn as ny Phariseeyn eh gee marish publicanee as peccee , dooyrt ad rish e ynseydee , Kys dy vel eh gee as giu marish publicanee as peccee ?

text: When Jesus heard it , he saith unto them , They that are whole have no need of the physician , but they that are sick : I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Tra cheayll Yeesey shoh , dooyrt eh roo , Cha vel feme ocsyn ta slane er yn er - lhee , agh ec sleih chingey : cha daink mish dy eamagh er y vooinjer chairagh , agh er peccee gys arrys .

text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast : and they come and say unto him , Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: As ve cliaghtey ynseydee Ean as ny Phariseeyn dy reayll trostey ; as haink ad as dooyrt ad rish , Kys te dy vel ynseydee Ean as ny Phariseeyn trostey , agh cha vel adsyn t ' ou uss er n ' ynsaghey trostey ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ? as long as they have the bridegroom with them , they cannot fast .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Vod cloan y chamyr - phoosee trostey , choud as ta ' n dooinney - poosee maroo ? choud as ta ' n dooinney - poosee maroo , cha vod ad trostey .

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: Agh hig ny laghyn , tra vees y dooinney - poosee er ny ghoaill ersooyl voue , as eisht nee ad trostey ayns ny laghyn shen .

text: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment : else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old , and the rent is made worse .
text2: As cha vel dooinney erbee whaaley peesh dy eaddagh noa er shenn gharmad : er - nonney ta ' n pheesh goaill y laane ass y chenn gharmad , as bee yn raipey ny smessey na ve .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles : else the new wine doth burst the bottles , and the wine is spilled , and the bottles will be marred : but new wine must be put into new bottles .
text2: Chamoo ta dooinney erbee cur feeyn noa ayns shenn voteilyn , er - nonney ta ' n feeyn noa scoltey ny boteilyn , as ta ' n feeyn deayrtit , as bee ny boteilyn dy choayl orroo : agh shegin da feeyn noa v ' er ny chur ayns boteilyn noa .

text: And it came to pass , that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day ; and his disciples began , as they went , to pluck the ears of corn .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' eh shooyl trooid ny magheryn arroo er laa ' n doonaght , dy ren e ynseydee toshiaght , myr v ' ad goll dy phluckey jeeassyn jeh ' n arroo .

text: And the Pharisees said unto him , Behold , why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful ?
text2: As dooyrt ny Phariseeyn rish , Cur - my - ner , cre ' n - fa t ' ad shoh er laa ' n doonaght jannoo shen nagh vel lowit ?

text: And he said unto them , Have ye never read what David did , when he had need , and was an hungred , he , and they that were with him ?
text2: As dooyrt eshyn roo , Nagh lhaih shiuish rieau , cre ren David , tra v ' eh ayns feme as accryssagh , eh - hene as y vooinjer va marish ?

text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest , and did eat the shewbread , which is not lawful to eat but for the priests , and gave also to them which were with him ?
text2: Kys hie eh stiagh ayns thie Yee , rish lhing Abiathar yn ard - saggyrt , as d ' ee eh yn arran - casherick , nagh row lowit dy ve eeit , agh liorish ny saggyrtyn , as hug eh eh myrgeddin dauesyn va marish ?

text: And he said unto them , The sabbath was made for man , and not man for the sabbath :
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Va ' n doonaght er ny yannoo son dooinney , as cha nee dooinney son y doonaght :

text: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta ' n Mac dooinney ny Hiarn myrgeddin er y doonaght .

text: And he entered again into the synagogue ; and there was a man there which had a withered hand .
text2: As hie eh reesht stiagh ayns y synagogue , as va dooinney ayns shen lesh laue shyrgit .

text: And they watched him , whether he would heal him on the sabbath day ; that they might accuse him .
text2: As va sooill oc er , dy yeeaghyn jinnagh eh eh y lheihys er laa yn doonaght , dy voddagh oyr y ve oc dy phlaiynt noi .

text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand , Stand forth .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish y dooinney lesh y laue shyrgit , Shass magh .

text: And he saith unto them , Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days , or to do evil ? to save life , or to kill ? But they held their peace .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Vel eh lowal dy yannoo mie er laghyn y doonaght , ny dy yannoo olk ? dy hauail bioys , ny dy stroie eh ? Agh v ' adsyn nyn - dhost .

text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger , being grieved for the hardness of their hearts , he saith unto the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it out : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: As tra v ' eh er yeeaghyn mygeayrt orroo lesh corree , v ' eh seaghnit son creoghys nyn greeaghyn , as dooyrt eh rish y dooinney , Sheeyn magh dty laue : as heeyn eh magh ee ; as va e laue er ny laanaghey myr y laue elley .

text: And the Pharisees went forth , and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: As hie ny Phariseeyn magh , as chelleeragh ghow ad - hene , as ny Herodianee coyrle n ' oi , kys oddagh ad eh y stroie .

text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea : and a great multitude from Galilee followed him , and from Judaea ,
text2: Agh hie Yeesey dy lhiattee marish e ynseydee gys oirr ny marrey : as deiyr earrooyn mooarey dy leih er veih Galilee , as veih Judea ,

text: And from Jerusalem , and from Idumaea , and from beyond Jordan ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
text2: As veih Jerusalem , as veih Idumea , as veih ' n cheu elley dy Yordan , as adsyn mygeayrt Tyre as Sidon , earroo mooar , tra cheayll ad cre ny reddyn yindyssagh v ' eh er n ' yannoo , haink ad huggey .

text: And he spake to his disciples , that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude , lest they should throng him .
text2: As loayr eh rish e ynseydee , lhong veg dy ve aarloo er e hon , kyndagh rish y pobble , son nagh jinnagh ad chionney stiagh er .

text: For he had healed many ; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him , as many as had plagues .
text2: Son v ' eh er laanaghey ymmodee , ayns wheesh as dy row ad chionney stiagh huggey , dy ventyn rish , whilleen as va dourinagh .

text: And unclean spirits , when they saw him , fell down before him , and cried , saying , Thou art the Son of God .
text2: As ny spyrrydyn neughlen tra honnick ad eh , huitt ad sheese kiongoyrt rish , as dyllee ad , gra , She Mac Yee oo .

text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known .
text2: As hug eh currym gyere orroo , gyn ad dy insh magh quoi v ' eh .

text: And he goeth up into a mountain , and calleth unto him whom he would : and they came unto him .
text2: As hie eh seose er slieau , as deie eh er y vooinjer baillish : as haink ad huggey .

text: And he ordained twelve , that they should be with him , and that he might send them forth to preach ,
text2: As doardee eh ghaa - yeig dy ve marish , dy voddagh eh coyrt ad magh dy phreacheil :

text: And to have power to heal sicknesses , and to cast out devils :
text2: As dy voddagh pooar y ve oc dy lheihys aslayntyn , as dy hilgey magh drogh - spyrrydyn .

text: And Simon he surnamed Peter ;
text2: As Simon lhiennoo eh Peddyr .

text: And James the son of Zebedee , and John the brother of James ; and he surnamed them Boanerges , which is , The sons of thunder :
text2: As Jamys mac Zebedee , as Ean braar Yamys ( as lhiennoo eh adsyn Boanerges , ta shen dy ghra , Cloan ny taarnee )

text: And Andrew , and Philip , and Bartholomew , and Matthew , and Thomas , and James the son of Alphaeus , and Thaddaeus , and Simon the Canaanite ,
text2: As Andreays , as Philip , as Bartholomew , as Mian , as Thomase , as Jamys mac Alpheus , as Thaddeus , as Simon yn Canaanite .

text: And Judas Iscariot , which also betrayed him : and they went into an house .
text2: As Yuaase Iscariot , ren myrgeddin eh y vrah : as hie ad stiagh ayns thie .

text: And the multitude cometh together again , so that they could not so much as eat bread .
text2: As va ' n pobble er nyn jaglym cooidjagh reesht , myr shen nagh row wheesh caa oc dy ghoaill beaghey .

text: And when his friends heard of it , they went out to lay hold on him : for they said , He is beside himself .
text2: As tra cheayll e gheiney - mooinjerey jeh , hie ad magh dy ghoaill eh : son dooyrt ad , T ' eh ass e cheeayl .

text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said , He hath Beelzebub , and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils .
text2: As dooyrt ny scrudeyryn haink neose veih Jerusalem , Ta Beelzebub echey , as liorish prince ny drogh - spyrrydyn t ' eh tilgey magh drogh - spyrrydyn .

text: And he called them unto him , and said unto them in parables , How can Satan cast out Satan ?
text2: As deie eh orroo huggey , as dooyrt eh roo ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey , kys oddys Satan Satan y chastey ?

text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself , that kingdom cannot stand .
text2: As my ta reeriaght girree - magh n ' oi hene , cha vod y reeriaght shen shassoo .

text: And if a house be divided against itself , that house cannot stand .
text2: As my ta thie girree - magh n ' oi hene , cha vod y thie shen shassoo .

text: And if Satan rise up against himself , and be divided , he cannot stand , but hath an end .
text2: As my ta Satan girree - magh , as my t ' eh n ' oi hene , cha vod eh shassoo , agh ta e phooar ec kione .

text: No man can enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he will first bind the strong man ; and then he will spoil his house .
text2: Cha vod dooinney erbee goll stiagh ayns thie yn treanagh , as cragh y yannoo jeh e chooid , mannagh giangle eh hoshiaght yn treanagh , as eisht nee eh cragh y yannoo er e hie .

text: Verily I say unto you , All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men , and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme :
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Bee dy chooilley pheccah er ny leih da mec gheiney , as ny goan mollaghtagh lioroo nee ad loayrt dy mollaghtagh :

text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness , but is in danger of eternal damnation :
text2: Agh eshyn loayrys dy mollaghtagh noi yn Spyrryd Noo , cha bee dy bragh leih ny chour , agh t ' eh ayns dangeyr coayl - anmey dy baagh farraghtyn .

text: Because they said , He hath an unclean spirit .
text2: Er - yn - oyr dy dooyrt ad , Ta spyrryd neu - ghlen echey .

text: There came then his brethren and his mother , and , standing without , sent unto him , calling him .
text2: Eisht haink e vraaraghyn as e voir as shassoo cheu - mooie ( jeh ' n dorrys ) hug ad fys huggey dy heet dy loayrt roo .

text: And the multitude sat about him , and they said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee .
text2: As va ' n pobble nyn soie mygeayrt - y - mysh , as dooyrt ad rish , Cur - my - ner , ta dty voir as dty vraaraghyn mooie fenaght er dty hon .

text: And he answered them , saying , Who is my mother , or my brethren ?
text2: As dreggyr eh ad , gra , Quoi my voir , ny my vraaraghyn ?

text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: As yeeagh eh mygeayrt orroosyn va nyn soie mygeayrt - y - mysh , as dooyrt eh , Cur - jee my - ner my voir as my vraaraghyn .

text: For whosoever shall do the will of God , the same is my brother , and my sister , and mother .
text2: Son quoi - erbee nee aigney Yee , she eshyn my vraar , as my huyr , as my voir .

text: And he began again to teach by the sea side : and there was gathered unto him a great multitude , so that he entered into a ship , and sat in the sea ; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land .
text2: As ren eh toshiaght reesht dy ynsaghey rish oirr ny marrey : as va earroo mooar dy leih er nyn jaglym cooidjagh huggey , myr shen dy jagh eh er - board lhong , as hoie eh er y cheayn , as va ooilley yn pobble liorish y cheayn , er y thalloo .

text: And he taught them many things by parables , and said unto them in his doctrine ,
text2: As dynsee eh daue ymmodee nheeghyn ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey , as dooyrt eh roo ayns e ynsagh ,

text: Hearken ; Behold , there went out a sower to sow :
text2: Clasht - jee , cur - my - ner hie correyder agh dy chuirr :

text: And it came to pass , as he sowed , some fell by the way side , and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione myr v ' eh cuirr , dy huitt paart jeh ' n rass rish oirr y raad , as haink eeanlee yn aer , as d ' ee ad seose eh .

text: And some fell on stony ground , where it had not much earth ; and immediately it sprang up , because it had no depth of earth :
text2: As huitt paart er thalloo claghagh , raad nagh row mooarane ooir echey , as chelleeragh daase eh , er - yn - oyr nagh row diunid thallooin echey .

text: But when the sun was up , it was scorched ; and because it had no root , it withered away .
text2: As tra ghow yn ghrian niart ve fiojit , as er - yn - oyr nagh row eh er n ' ghoaill fraue , ren eh shyrgaghey ersooyl .

text: And some fell among thorns , and the thorns grew up , and choked it , and it yielded no fruit .
text2: As huitt paart mastey drineyn , as daase ny drineyn seose marish , as phloogh ad eh , as cha dymmyrk eh mess .

text: And other fell on good ground , and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased ; and brought forth , some thirty , and some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Agh huitt cooid elley jeh ayns thalloo mie , as hug eh magh mess ren gaase seose as bishaghey , as dymmyrk eh , paart jeih fillaghyn as feed , as paart three - feed , as paart keead filley .

text: And he said unto them , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Eshyn ta cleayshyn echey dy chlashtyn , lhig da clashtyn .

text: And when he was alone , they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable .
text2: As tra v ' eh ny - lomarcan , denee yn vooinjer va mygeayrt - y - mysh marish y daa ostyl yeig jeh mychione y coraa - dorraghey .

text: And he said unto them , Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God : but unto them that are without , all these things are done in parables :
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Diuish te er ny choyrt dy hoiggal folliaght reeriaght Yee : agh dauesyn ta mooie , ta dy chooilley nhee jeant ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey :

text: That seeing they may see , and not perceive ; and hearing they may hear , and not understand ; lest at any time they should be converted , and their sins should be forgiven them .
text2: Son fakin hee ad , agh cha der ad tastey as clashtyn cluinnee ad , agh cha gow ad tushtey ; er - aggle ec traa erbee dy beagh ad er nyn jyndaa , as dy beagh nyn beccaghyn er nyn leih daue .

text: And he said unto them , Know ye not this parable ? and how then will ye know all parables ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Nagh vel toiggal eu jeh ' n choraa - dorraghey shoh ? as kys eisht nee shiu dy chooilley choraa - dorraghey y hoiggal ?

text: The sower soweth the word .
text2: Ta ' n correyder cuirr yn goo .

text: And these are they by the way side , where the word is sown ; but when they have heard , Satan cometh immediately , and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts .
text2: As ad shoh adsyn ta rish oirr y raad , ayn ta ' n goo er ny chuirr , agh tra t ' ad er chlashtyn , ta ' n drogh - spyrryd cheet jeeragh , as goaill ersooyl yn goo va cuirt ayns nyn greeaghyn .

text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground ; who , when they have heard the word , immediately receive it with gladness ;
text2: As ad shoh neesht yn vooinjer ta cuirt ayns thalloo claghagh , ta , erreish daue v ' er chlashtyn y goo , chelleeragh dy ghoaill eh dy aggindagh :

text: And have no root in themselves , and so endure but for a time : afterward , when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word ' s sake , immediately they are offended .
text2: Agh cha vel fraue oc ayndoo hene , as myr shen cha vel ad cummal rish agh son earish : ny lurg shen tra ta seaghyn ny tranlaase cheet orroo er coontey yn ghoo , chelleeragh ta nyn gredjue failleil .

text: And these are they which are sown among thorns ; such as hear the word ,
text2: As ad shoh yn vooinjer ta cuirt mastey drineyn : lheid as ta clashtyn y goo

text: And the cares of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , and the lusts of other things entering in , choke the word , and it becometh unfruitful .
text2: As ta kiarail y theihll shoh , as molteyraght berchys , as saynt reddyn elley goll stiagh , as plooghey yn goo , as te cheet dy ve neu - vessoil .

text: And these are they which are sown on good ground ; such as hear the word , and receive it , and bring forth fruit , some thirtyfold , some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: As ad shoh yn vooinjer ta cuirt ayns thalloo mie , lheid as ta clashtyn y goo , as ta dy ghoaill eh , as gymmyrkey magh mess , paart jeih fillaghyn as feed , paart three - feed , as paart keead - filley .

text: And he said unto them , Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel , or under a bed ? and not to be set on a candlestick ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Vel cainle dy ve er ny choyrt fo saagh , ny fo lhiabbee ? as nagh vel ee dy v ' er ny choyrt ayns cainleyr ?

text: For there is nothing hid , which shall not be manifested ; neither was any thing kept secret , but that it should come abroad .
text2: Son cha vel nhee erbee keillit , nagh bee er ny hoilshaghey : ny nhee erbee freilt follit , nagh jig er - ash ?

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: My ta cleayshyn ec dooinney erbee dy chlashtyn lhig da clashtyn .

text: And he said unto them , Take heed what ye hear : with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you : and unto you that hear shall more be given .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cur - jee tastey da ny ta shiu dy chlashtyn : lesh y towse ta shiu towse , bee eh er ny howse diu : as diuish ta clashtyn , bee ny smoo er ny choyrt .

text: For he that hath , to him shall be given : and he that hath not , from him shall be taken even that which he hath .
text2: Son eshyn ta echey , dasyn vees er ny choyrt : as eshyn nagh vel echey , veihsyn vees er ny ghoaill eer shen hene ny ta echey .

text: And he said , So is the kingdom of God , as if a man should cast seed into the ground ;
text2: As dooyrt eh , Shoh myr ta reeriaght Yee , myr dy dilgagh dooinney rass ayns y thalloo

text: And should sleep , and rise night and day , and the seed should spring and grow up , he knoweth not how .
text2: As eh dy chadley , as dy irree oie as laa ; as y rass dy heet er y hoshiaght , as dy aase seose , gyn - yss da .

text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself ; first the blade , then the ear , after that the full corn in the ear .
text2: Son ta ' n thalloo cur magh mess j ' ee hene , hoshiaght yn chass , eisht yn jeeas , ny lurg shen , yn arroo creen ayns y jeeas .

text: But when the fruit is brought forth , immediately he putteth in the sickle , because the harvest is come .
text2: Agh tra ta ' n mess er greenaghey , chelleeragh t ' eh cur yn corran fo , er - yn - oyr dy vel y fouyr er jeet .

text: And he said , Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God ? or with what comparison shall we compare it ?
text2: As dooyrt eh , Cre gys nee mayd reeriaght Yee y hoyllaghey ? ny lesh cre ' n co - chaslys nee mayd y hoiaghey magh eh ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when it is sown in the earth , is less than all the seeds that be in the earth :
text2: Te goll - rish grine dy rass mustard , ta ny sloo , tra te cuirt ayns y thalloo , na dy chooilley rass ta ayns y thalloo .

text: But when it is sown , it groweth up , and becometh greater than all herbs , and shooteth out great branches ; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it .
text2: Agh tra te cuirt , te gaase seose , as cheet dy ve ny smoo na ooilley ny lossreeyn , as cur magh banglaneyn mooarey , myr shen dy vod eeanlee yn aer fastee y ghoaill fo ' n scadoo echey .

text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them , as they were able to hear it .
text2: As lesh ymmodee dy lheid ny coraaghyn dorraghey loayr eh yn goo roo , myr v ' adsyn son goaill rish .

text: But without a parable spake he not unto them : and when they were alone , he expounded all things to his disciples .
text2: Agh fegooish coraa - dorraghey cha loayr eh roo : as tra v ' ad nyn - lomarcan hoilshee eh dy chooilley nhee da e ostyllyn .

text: And the same day , when the even was come , he saith unto them , Let us pass over unto the other side .
