text2: As yn laa cheddin tra va ' n fastyr er , dooyrt eh roo , Lhig dooin goll harrish gys y cheu elley .

text: And when they had sent away the multitude , they took him even as he was in the ship . And there were also with him other little ships .
text2: As tra v ' ad er chur ersooyl yn pobble , hug ad lhieu eh myr v ' eh ayns y lhong , as va myrgeddin lhongyn beggey elley marish .

text: And there arose a great storm of wind , and the waves beat into the ship , so that it was now full .
text2: As dirree sterrym mooar dy gheay , as va ny tonnyn brishey stiagh ayns y lhong , myr shen dy row ee nish er lhieeney .

text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship , asleep on a pillow : and they awake him , and say unto him , Master , carest thou not that we perish ?
text2: As v ' eshyn ayns jerrey ny lhuingey ny chadley er clooisag : as ghooisht ad eh , as dooyrt ad rish , Vainshter , nagh vel geill ayd dy bee mayd caillit ?

text: And he arose , and rebuked the wind , and said unto the sea , Peace , be still . And the wind ceased , and there was a great calm .
text2: As dirree eh , as smaghtee eh yn gheay , as dooyrt eh rish y faarkey , Gow fea , bee kiune : as ghow yn gheay fea , as va kiuney vooar ayn .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye so fearful ? how is it that ye have no faith ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu cha agglagh ? kys te nagh vel credjue eu ?

text: And they feared exceedingly , and said one to another , What manner of man is this , that even the wind and the sea obey him ?
text2: As v ' ad feer agglagh , as dooyrt ad yn derrey yeh rish y jeh elley , cre ' n monney dy ghooinney eh shoh , dy vel y gheay hene as faarkey cur biallys da ?

text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea , into the country of the Gadarenes .
text2: . As haink ad harrish gys y cheu elley jeh ' n cheayn , gys cheer ny Gadarenee .

text: And when he was come out of the ship , immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit ,
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet ass y lhong , chelleeragh haink ny whail veih mastey ny oaiaghyn , dooinney lesh spyrryd neu - ghlen .

text: Who had his dwelling among the tombs ; and no man could bind him , no , not with chains :
text2: Va cummal mastey ny oaiaghyn , as cha voddagh dooinney erbee y chiangley eh , eer lesh geulaghyn :

text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains , and the chains had been plucked asunder by him , and the fetters broken in pieces : neither could any man tame him .
text2: Er - y - fa dy row eh dy mennick er ny ve kianlt lesh yiarnyn as geulaghyn , as va ny geulaghyn er ny ve tayrnit veih - my - cheilley liorish , as ny yiarnyn brisht ayns peeshyn : as cha dod dooinney erbee eh y veeinaghey .

text: And always , night and day , he was in the mountains , and in the tombs , crying , and cutting himself with stones .
text2: As kinjagh oie as laa v ' eh ayns ny sleityn , as mastey ny oaiaghyn , gyllagh , as dy ghiarey eh - hene lesh claghyn .

text: But when he saw Jesus afar off , he ran and worshipped him ,
text2: Agh tra honnick eh Yeesey foddey jeh , roie eh , as hug eh ooashley da ,

text: And cried with a loud voice , and said , What have I to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of the most high God ? I adjure thee by God , that thou torment me not .
text2: As deie eh lesh ard - choraa , as dooyrt eh , Cre ' n eie t ' ayd orrym , Yeesey , Vac yn Jee smoo ard ? ta mee guee ort , ayns ennym Yee , gyn oo dy my horchaghey .

text: For he said unto him , Come out of the man , thou unclean spirit .
text2: ( Son v ' eh er ghra rish , Tar magh ass y dooinney , uss spyrryd neu - ghlen )

text: And he asked him , What is thy name ? And he answered , saying , My name is Legion : for we are many .
text2: As denee eh jeh , Cre ' n ennym t ' ort ? As dreggyr eh , gra , Ta m ' ennym Legion Son ta shin ymmodee .

text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country .
text2: As ren eh aghin jeean huggey , gyn eh dy chur ad ersooyl ass y cheer .

text: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding .
text2: Nish va ayns shen , er - gerrey da ny sleityn , griagh mooar dy vucyn fo bochillyn .

text: And all the devils besought him , saying , Send us into the swine , that we may enter into them .
text2: As ghuee ooilley ny drogh - spyrrydyn er , gra , Eiyr shin gys ny mucyn , dy vod mayd goll stiagh ayndoo .

text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave . And the unclean spirits went out , and entered into the swine : and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea , ( they were about two thousand ; ) and were choked in the sea .
text2: As chelleeragh hug Yeesey kied daue . As hie ny spyrrydyn neu - ghlen roue , as hie ad stiagh ayns ny mucyn , as roie yn ghriagh gour nyn mullee lesh yn eaynee gys y cheayn ( v ' ad mysh daa housane ) as v ' ad plooghit ayns y cheayn .

text: And they that fed the swine fled , and told it in the city , and in the country . And they went out to see what it was that was done .
text2: As roie bochillyn ny mucyn roue , as dinsh ad eh ayns yn ard - valley , as er y cheer . As hie ad magh dy akin cre va jeant .

text: And they come to Jesus , and see him that was possessed with the devil , and had the legion , sitting , and clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: As haink ad gys Yeesey , as honnick ad eshyn va ' n drogh - spyrryd as y legion er ny ve ayn , ny hoie , as e eaddagh er , as dy mie ayns e cheeayl , as ghow ad aggle .

text: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil , and also concerning the swine .
text2: As diush y vooinjer honnick eh daue , kys ve er daghyrt dasyn va ' n drogh - spyrryd er ve ayn , as myrgeddin mychione ny mucyn .

text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts .
text2: As ren ad toshiaght dy ghuee er , eh dy gholl roish ass ny ardjyn oc .

text: And when he was come into the ship , he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him .
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet gys y lhong , ren eshyn va ' n drogh spyrryd er ve ayn guee er kied y chur da goll marish .

text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not , but saith unto him , Go home to thy friends , and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee , and hath had compassion on thee .
text2: Agh cha lhiggagh Yeesey da , agh dooyrt e rish , Immee thie gys dty vooinjer hene , as insh daue cre ny reddyn mooarey ta ' n Chiarn er n ' yannoo er dty hon , as dy vel chymmey er ve echey ort .

text: And he departed , and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him : and all men did marvel .
text2: As jimmee eh roish , as ren eh toshiaght dy hoilshaghey magh ayns Decapolis , cre dy reddyn mooarey va Yeesey er n ' yannoo er e hon : as ghow dy chooilley ghooinney yindys .

text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side , much people gathered unto him : and he was nigh unto the sea .
text2: As tra va Yeesey er n ' gholl harrish reesht ayns y lhong gys y cheu elley , va earroo mooar dy leih er nyn jaglym cooidjagh huggey , as v ' eh er - gerrey da ' n cheayn .

text: And , behold , there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue , Jairus by name ; and when he saw him , he fell at his feet ,
text2: As cur - my - ner , haink fer jeh reiltee yn synagogue va enmyssit Jairus , as tra honnick eh eh , huitt eh sheese ec e chassyn ,

text: And besought him greatly , saying , My little daughter lieth at the point of death : I pray thee , come and lay thy hands on her , that she may be healed ; and she shall live .
text2: As ghuee eh er dy jeean , gra , Ta my inneen veg ny lhie raad y vaaish , tar as cur dty laueyn urree , dy vod ee v ' er ny lheihys , as bee ee bio .

text: And Jesus went with him ; and much people followed him , and thronged him .
text2: As hie Yeesey marish , as deiyr ymmodee dy leih , as ren ad chionney stiagh er .

text: And a certain woman , which had an issue of blood twelve years ,
text2: ( As va ben dy row va seaghnit lesh roie - foalley rish daa vlein jeig .

text: And had suffered many things of many physicians , and had spent all that she had , and was nothing bettered , but rather grew worse ,
text2: As v ' ee er hurranse mooarane liorish ymmodee fir - lhee , as er vaarail ooilley ny v ' eck , as cha row ee veg share , agh goll ny smessey ,

text: When she had heard of Jesus , came in the press behind , and touched his garment .
text2: Tra cheayll ee jeh Yeesey , haink ee ayns y chennid cheu e chooylloo , as venn ee rish e gharmad .

text: For she said , If I may touch but his clothes , I shall be whole .
text2: Son dooyrt ee , My oddym agh bentyn rish e eaddagh , bee ' m er my laanaghey .

text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up ; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague .
text2: As chelleeragh va ' n roie - foalley eck er ny hyrmaghey : as dennee ee ayns e corp dy row ee er ny lheihys jeh ' n doghan shen .

text: And Jesus , immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him , turned him about in the press , and said , Who touched my clothes ?
text2: As chelleeragh va fys ec Yeesey cheu sthie jeh hene , dy row bree er n ' gholl ass , as hyndaa eh mygeayrt ayns y chennid , as dooyrt eh , Quoi venn rish my eaddagh ?

text: And his disciples said unto him , Thou seest the multitude thronging thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: As dooyrt e ostyllyn rish , T ' ou fakin y pobble chionney stiagh ort , as vel oo gra , Quoi venn rhym ?

text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing .
text2: As yeeagh eh mygeayrt dy akin ish v ' er n ' yannoo shoh .

text: But the woman fearing and trembling , knowing what was done in her , came and fell down before him , and told him all the truth .
text2: Agh va ' n ven agglagh as er - creau , gennaghtyn ny va jeant aynjee , as haink ee as huitt ee sheese kiongoyrt rish , as dinsh ee da ooilley yn irriney .

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace , and be whole of thy plague .
text2: As dooyrt eh r ' ee , Inneen , ta dty chredjue , er dty laanaghey ; immee ayns shee , as bee slane jeh dty ghoghan ) .

text: While he yet spake , there came from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house certain which said , Thy daughter is dead : why troublest thou the Master any further ?
text2: Choud as v ' eh foast loayrt , haink feallagh veih thie fer - reill y synagogue dooyrt rish , ta dty inneen marroo , cre s ' lhiass dhyt trubbyl sodjey y chur er y vainshter ?

text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken , he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue , Be not afraid , only believe .
text2: Tra va Yeesey er chlashtyn yn fockle va loayrit , dooyrt eh rish fer - reill yn synagogue , Ny gow aggle ynrycan jean credjal .

text: And he suffered no man to follow him , save Peter , and James , and John the brother of James .
text2: As cha lhig eh da dooinney erbee cheet geiyrt er , cheu - mooie jeh Peddyr , as Jamys , as Ean braar Yamys

text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue , and seeth the tumult , and them that wept and wailed greatly .
text2: As haink eh gys thie fer - reill yn synagogue , as hug eh my - ner yn boirey , as adsyn va keayney as dobberan dy trimshagh .

text: And when he was come in , he saith unto them , Why make ye this ado , and weep ? the damsel is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet stiagh , dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta ooilley yn anvea as y cheayney shoh ? cha vel y ven - aeg marroo agh ny cadley .

text: And they laughed him to scorn . But when he had put them all out , he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel , and them that were with him , and entereth in where the damsel was lying .
text2: As hie ad son craidey mysh , agh tra v ' eh er chur ad ooilley magh , ghow eh ayr as moir y ven - aeg , as adsyn va marish , as hie eh stiagh raad va ' n ven - aeg ny lhie .

text: And he took the damsel by the hand , and said unto her , Talitha cumi ; which is , being interpreted , Damsel , I say unto thee , arise .
text2: As ghow eh yn ven - aeg er laue , as dooyrt eh r ' ee , Talitha cumi , ta shen dy ghra , Ven - aeg ( ta mee gra rhyt ) irree .

text: And straightway the damsel arose , and walked ; for she was of the age of twelve years . And they were astonished with a great astonishment .
text2: As chelleeragh dirree yn ven - aeg , as huill ee ; son v ' ee daa vlein jeig dy eash : as v ' ad erskyn - towse atchimagh .

text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it ; and commanded that something should be given her to eat .
text2: As hug eh currym gyere orroo , nagh voghe dooinney erbee fys er shoh : as doardee eh red ennagh dy ve er ny choyrt j ' ee dy ee .

text: And he went out from thence , and came into his own country ; and his disciples follow him .
text2: . As hie eh magh veih shen , as haink eh gys e heer hene , as deir e ostyllyn er .

text: And when the sabbath day was come , he began to teach in the synagogue : and many hearing him were astonished , saying , From whence hath this man these things ? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him , that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands ?
text2: As tra va ' n doonaght er jeet ren eh toshiaght dy ynsaghey ayns y synagogue : as ghow ymmodee jeusyn va dy chlashtyn eh yindys mooar , gra , Cre voish ta ny reddyn shoh ec y dooinney shoh ? as cre ' n chreenaght shoh t ' er ny choyrt da , dy vel lheid ny obbraghyn niartal er nyn obbraghey liorish ny laueyn echey ?

text: Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mary , the brother of James , and Joses , and of Juda , and Simon ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were offended at him .
text2: Nagh nee shoh yn seyir mac Voirrey braar Yamys as Yoses as Juda as Simon , as nagh vel ny shayraghyn echey ayns shoh marin ? as ghow ad comys rish .

text: But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , but in his own country , and among his own kin , and in his own house .
text2: Agh dooyrt Yeesey roo , Cha vel phadeyr fegooish ooashley , agh ayns e heer hene , as mastey e chynney hene , as ayns e hie hene .

text: And he could there do no mighty work , save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk , and healed them .
text2: As cha dod eh mirril erbee y obbraghey ayns shen , cheu - mooie jeh dy dug eh e laueyn er reggryn dy leih chingey , as dy ren eh ad y lheihys .

text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief . And he went round about the villages , teaching .
text2: As ghow eh yindys jeh ' n vee - chredjue oc . As hie eh mygeayrt ny baljyn - cheerey oc gynsaghey .

text: And he called unto him the twelve , and began to send them forth by two and two ; and gave them power over unclean spirits ;
text2: As deie eh er y daa ostyl yeig huggey , as ren eh toshiaght dy chur ad magh jees as jees , as hug eh daue pooar harrish spyrrydyn neu - ghlen ,

text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey , save a staff only ; no scrip , no bread , no money in their purse :
text2: As sarey gyn ad dy ghoaill red erbee cour nyn yurnah , agh ynrycan lorg : gyn ad dy ghoaill spaagey , ny arran , ny argid ayns nyn sporran :

text: But be shod with sandals ; and not put on two coats .
text2: Agh dy gholl ayns nyn mraagyn , as gyn ad dy chur orroo daa chooat .

text: And he said unto them , In what place soever ye enter into an house , there abide till ye depart from that place .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Raad erbee dy jed shiu stiagh ayns thie , fuirree jee ayn derrey aagys shiu yn ynnyd shen .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear you , when ye depart thence , shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them . Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: As quoi - erbee nagh jean goaill riu , ny geill y choyrt da ny goan eu , tra vees shiu goll reue , crie - jee yn Joan ta fo ny cassyn eu , son feanish nyn ' oi . Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Dy bee eh ny sassey son Sodom as Gomorrah ec laa ny briwnys , na son yn ard valley shen .

text: And they went out , and preached that men should repent .
text2: As hie ad magh , as ren ad preacheil , sleih dy ghoaill arrys .

text: And they cast out many devils , and anointed with oil many that were sick , and healed them .
text2: As deiyr ad magh ymmodee drogh - spyrrydyn , as d ' ooilee ad lesh ooil ymmodee sleih chingey , as ren ad ad y laanaghey .

text: And king Herod heard of him ; ( for his name was spread abroad : ) and he said , That John the Baptist was risen from the dead , and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: As cheayll ree Herod jeh ( son va ' n goo echey er n ' gholl magh ) as dooyrt eh , Dy row Ean Bashtey er n ' irree veih ny merriu , as er - yn - oyr shen dy row mirrillyn er nyn obbraghey liorish .

text: Others said , That it is Elias . And others said , That it is a prophet , or as one of the prophets .
text2: Dooyrt paart dy leih , dy nee Elias v ' ayn : dooyrt feallagh elley , Dy nee phadeyr v ' eh , ny myr fer jeh ny phadeyryn .

text: But when Herod heard thereof , he said , It is John , whom I beheaded : he is risen from the dead .
text2: Agh tra cheayll Herod jeh , dooyrt eh , She Ean Bashtey t ' ayn , hug mish y kione jeh , t ' eh er n ' irree veih ny merriu .

text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John , and bound him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife : for he had married her .
text2: Son va Herod hene er chur fys magh , as er ghoaill Ean , as er choyrt eh ayns geulaghyn ' sy phryssoon , kyndagh rish Herodias ben e vraar Philip son v ' eh er phoosey ee .

text: For John had said unto Herod , It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother ' s wife .
text2: Son va Ean er ghra rish Herod , Te noi yn leigh dhyt ben dty vraarey y ve ayd son ben .

text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him , and would have killed him ; but she could not :
text2: Shen - y - fa va Herodias ayns goanlys da , as v ' ee shleeuit er cur dy baase eh , agh cha daink eh lh ' ee .

text: For Herod feared John , knowing that he was a just man and an holy , and observed him ; and when he heard him , he did many things , and heard him gladly .
text2: Son va Herod ayns ammys Ean , toiggal dy row eh ny ghooinney cairagh as crauee as hug eh geill da , as er y choyrle echey v ' eh er n ' yannoo ymmodee reddyn , as deaisht eh rish dy arryltagh .

text: And when a convenient day was come , that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords , high captains , and chief estates of Galilee ;
text2: Agh tra va laa jesh er y hon er jeet , dy ren Herod corrym rish y laa ruggyr eh , shibber y yannoo , son e hiarnyn , ard - chaptanyn , as deiney ooasle Ghalilee :

text: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in , and danced , and pleased Herod and them that sat with him , the king said unto the damsel , Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt , and I will give it thee .
text2: As haink inneen Herodias cheddin stiagh , as ghaunse ee , as ghow Herod as e ghoaldee va marish ard - voghey j ' ee , as dooyrt y ree rish y ven - aeg , Shir orrym ' s aghin erbee dy nailt , as giall - ym dhyt eh .

text: And he sware unto her , Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me , I will give it thee , unto the half of my kingdom .
text2: As loo eh jee , Cre - erbee hirrys oo orrym , ver - ym dhyt eh , gys y derrey lieh jeh my reeriaght .

text: And she went forth , and said unto her mother , What shall I ask ? And she said , The head of John the Baptist .
text2: As hie ee magh , as dooyrt ee rish e moir , Cre hirrym ? As dooyrt ish , Kione Ean Bashtey .

text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king , and asked , saying , I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist .
text2: As haink ee stiagh er - y - chooyl ayns siyr gys y ree , as hir ee , gra , Saillym oo dy chur dou nish hene er claare kione Ean Bashtey .

text: And the king was exceeding sorry ; yet for his oath ' s sake , and for their sakes which sat with him , he would not reject her .
text2: As va ' n ree trome trimshagh , ny yeih er coontey e loo , as y vooinjer va nyn soie marish , cha row eh booiagh cur obbal jee .

text: And immediately the king sent an executioner , and commanded his head to be brought : and he went and beheaded him in the prison ,
text2: As chelleeragh hug y ree magh marrooder , as doardee eh cur lesh e chione : as hie eh , as hug eh yn kione jeh Ean ayns y phryssoon ,

text: And brought his head in a charger , and gave it to the damsel : and the damsel gave it to her mother .
text2: As hug eh lesh yn kione er claare , as livrey eh eh gys y ven - aeg as livrey ish eh gys e moir .

text: And when his disciples heard of it , they came and took up his corpse , and laid it in a tomb .
text2: As tra cheayll e ynseydee jeh shoh , haink ad as hrog ad e chorp , as doanluck ad eh ayns lhiaght

text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus , and told him all things , both what they had done , and what they had taught .
text2: As haink ny ostyllyn cooidjagh gys Yeesey , as dinsh ad da dy chooilley nhee , chammah cre v ' ad er n ' yannoo , as cre v ' ad er n ' ynsaghey .

text: And he said unto them , Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place , and rest a while : for there were many coming and going , and they had no leisure so much as to eat .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Tar - jee shiuish er - lheh gys boayl faasagh , as gow - jee tammylt dy nyn aash : son va ymmodee cheet as goll , as cha row caa oc wheesh as dy ee .

text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately .
text2: As jimmee ad ayns lhong gys ynnyd faasagh er - lheh .

text: And the people saw them departing , and many knew him , and ran afoot thither out of all cities , and outwent them , and came together unto him .
text2: Agh honnick y pobble ad goll roue , as hug ymmodee jeu enney er , as roie ad gys shen rish nyn gosh veih dy chooilley ard - valley , as haink ad gys shen rhymboo , as chruinnee ad huggey .

text: And Jesus , when he came out , saw much people , and was moved with compassion toward them , because they were as sheep not having a shepherd : and he began to teach them many things .
text2: As tra va Yeesey er jeet er thalloo honnick eh earroo mooar dy leih , as v ' eh er ny veiyghey lesh chymmey orroo , er - yn - oyr dy row ad myr kirree fegooish bochilley : as ren eh toshiaght dy ynsaghey ad ayns ymmodee reddyn .

text: And when the day was now far spent , his disciples came unto him , and said , This is a desert place , and now the time is far passed :
text2: As tra va ' n laa nish foddey baarit , haink e ostyllyn huggey , as dooyrt ad , Shoh boayl faasagh , as ta ' n traa nish er n ' gholl foddey shaghey :

text: Send them away , that they may go into the country round about , and into the villages , and buy themselves bread : for they have nothing to eat .
text2: Lhig y raad daue , dy vod ad goll er y cheer mygeayrt , as gys ny baljyn cheerey , dy chionnaghey arran daue hene : son cha vel veg y veaghey oc .

text: He answered and said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they say unto him , Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread , and give them to eat ?
text2: As dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh roo , Cur - jee shiuish bee daue . As dooyrt ad rish , Nailt shin goll dy chionnaghey feeagh daa cheead ping dy arran , as beaghey ' chur daue ?

text: He saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? go and see . And when they knew , they say , Five , and two fishes .
text2: Dooyrt eh roo , Cre - woad bwilleen t ' eu ? immee - jee as jeeagh - jee . As tra va fys oc , dooyrt ad , Queig , as daa eeast .

text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass .
text2: As doardee eh daue ad dy chur orroo ooilley soie sheese ayns sheshaghtyn er yn aiyr ghlass .

text: And they sat down in ranks , by hundreds , and by fifties .
text2: As hoie ad sheese ayns roaghyn , keead as lieh - cheead ayns roa .

text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes , he looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake the loaves , and gave them to his disciples to set before them ; and the two fishes divided he among them all .
text2: As tra v ' eh er ghoaill ny queig bwilleenyn as y daa eeast , yeeagh eh seose gys niau , as vannee eh , as vrish eh ny bwilleenyn , as hug eh ad da e ostyllyn dy hoiaghey rhymboo ; as y daa eeast rheynn eh ny mast ' oc ooilley .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled .
text2: As ren ad ooilley gee , as v ' ad er nyn n ' yannoo magh .

text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments , and of the fishes .
text2: As hrog ad jeh ' n fooilliagh as jeh ny eeastyn lane daa vaskad jeig .

text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men .
text2: As v ' adsyn v ' er n ' ee jeh ny bwilleenyn mysh queig thousane dooinney .

text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship , and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida , while he sent away the people .
text2: As chelleeragh hug eh er e ostyllyn lhuingys y ghoaill , as ad dy gholl roish gys y cheu elley gys Bethsaida , choud as v ' eh cur y pobble ersooyl .

text: And when he had sent them away , he departed into a mountain to pray .
text2: As tra v ' eh er chur ad ersooyl , hie eh seose er slieau dy ghoaill padjer .

text: And when even was come , the ship was in the midst of the sea , and he alone on the land .
text2: As tra va ' n fastyr er jeet , va ' n lhong ayns mean ny marrey , as eshyn ny - lomarcan er y thalloo .

text: And he saw them toiling in rowing ; for the wind was contrary unto them : and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them , walking upon the sea , and would have passed by them .
text2: As honnick eh ad tooilleil ayns gymmyrt ( son va ' n gheay nyn ' oi oc ) as mygeayrt y chiarroo arrey jeh ' n oie , haink eh huc shooyll er y cheayn , as ren eh myr dy ragh eh shaghey ad .

text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea , they supposed it had been a spirit , and cried out :
text2: Agh tra honnick ad eh shooyll er y cheayn , heill ad dy nee scaan v ' ayn , as dyllee ad .

text: For they all saw him , and were troubled . And immediately he talked with them , and saith unto them , Be of good cheer : it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: ( Son honnick ad ooilley eh , as v ' ad seaghnit . ) As chelleeragh loayr eh roo , as dooyrt eh roo , Bee - jee dy yien mie , she mish t ' ayn , ny gow - jee aggle .

text: And he went up unto them into the ship ; and the wind ceased : and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure , and wondered .
text2: As hie eh seose ' sy lhong huc , as ghow yn gheay fea : as v ' ad feer atchimagh ayndoo hene erskyn towse , as goaill yindys .

text: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves : for their heart was hardened .
text2: Son cha chooinee ad er ( mirril ) ny bwilleenyn , son va ' n cree oc er ny chreoghey .

text: And when they had passed over , they came into the land of Gennesaret , and drew to the shore .
text2: As tra v ' ad er n ' gholl harrish , haink ad gys cheer Ghennesaret , as hayrn ad gys thalloo .

text: And when they were come out of the ship , straightway they knew him ,
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet ass y lhong , chelleeragh hug y sleih enney er ,

text: And ran through that whole region round about , and began to carry about in beds those that were sick , where they heard he was .
text2: As roie ad trooid ooilley yn cheer mygeayrt , as hug ad lhieu er lhiabbaghyn adsyn va ching , raad v ' ad clashtyn v ' eh .

text: And whithersoever he entered , into villages , or cities , or country , they laid the sick in the streets , and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment : and as many as touched him were made whole .
text2: As raad erbee dy jagh eh , gys baljyn - cheerey , ny ard - valjyn , ny er y cheer , lhie ad yn vooinjer hingey ayns ny raaidyn , as ghuee ad er agh dy ventyn rish oirr e gharmad : as whilleen as venn rish , v ' ad er nyn lheihys .

text: Then came together unto him the Pharisees , and certain of the scribes , which came from Jerusalem .
text2: . Eisht haink cooidjagh huggey ny Phariseeyn as shiartanse jeh ny scrudeyryn , haink veih Jerusalem .

text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled , that is to say , with unwashen , hands , they found fault .
text2: As tra honnick ad paart jeh e ostyllyn gee arran lesh laueyn neu - ghlen ( ta shen dy ghra gyn - niee ) hooar ad foill .

text: For the Pharisees , and all the Jews , except they wash their hands oft , eat not , holding the tradition of the elders .
text2: Son cha vel ny Phariseeyn , ny veg jeh ny Hewnyn goaill beaghey mannagh vel ad dy kiaralagh niee nyn laueyn , freayll oardaghyn y chanstyr .

text: And when they come from the market , except they wash , they eat not . And many other things there be , which they have received to hold , as the washing of cups , and pots , brasen vessels , and of tables .
text2: As tra t ' ad cheet thie veih ' n vargey , cha vel ad gee , derrey t ' ad niee . As ta ymmodee dy reddyn elley , t ' ad er ghoaill orroo dy reayll , niee cappanyn as siyn crayee , siyn prashey as buird .

text: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him , Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders , but eat bread with unwashen hands ?
text2: Eisht denee ny Phariseeyn as ny scrudeyryn jeh , Cre ' n - fa nagh vel dty ostyllyn freayll oardaghyn y chanstyr , agh t ' ad gee arran lesh laueyn nagh vel nieet ?

text: He answered and said unto them , Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites , as it is written , This people honoureth me with their lips , but their heart is far from me .
text2: Dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh roo , S ' mie ren Esaias phadeyrys jiuish , chrauee - oalsey , myr te scruit , Ta ' n pobble shoh cur ooashley dou lesh nyn meillyn , agh ta ' n cree oc foddey voym .

text: Howbeit in vain do they worship me , teaching for doctines the commandments of men .
text2: Ny - yeih ayns fardail t ' ad cur ooashley dooys , gynsaghey son y goo aym ' s , oardaghyn deiney .

text: For laying aside the commandment of God , ye hold the tradition of men , as the washing of pots and cups : and many other such like things ye do .
text2: Son treigeil annaghyn Yee ta shiu freayll oardaghyn deiney , niee siyn crayee as cappanyn : as ymmodee lheid ny reddyn shen ta shiu dy yannoo .

text: And he said unto them , Full well ye reject the commandment of God , that ye may keep your own tradition .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , S ' mie ta shiu jannoo anney Yee gyn vree , dy hoiaghey seose ny oardaghyn eu hene .

text: For Moses said , Honour thy father and thy mother ; and , Whoso curseth father or mother , let him die the death :
text2: Son ta Moses er ghra , Cur arrym da dty ayr as da dty voir : as , Eshyn ta gweeaghyn da ayr ny moir , lhig da ve deyrit gy baase .

text: But ye say , If a man shall say to his father or mother , It is Corban , that is to say , a gift , by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me ; he shall be free .
text2: Agh ta shiuish gra , My jir dooinney rish e ayr ny e voir , She Corban eh , ta shen dy ghra , Yn chooid - choonee shen oddagh uss jerkal rish voym ' s , te gioot er ny chasherickey gys Jee :

text: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother ;
text2: As cha vel shiu lhiggey da red erbee sodjey y yannoo son e ayr ny e voir :

text: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition , which ye have delivered : and many such like things do ye .
text2: Jannoo goo Yee gyn vree trooid ny oardaghyn eu , ta shiu er harey : as ymmodee lheid ny reddyn shoh ta shiu dy yannoo .

text: And when he had called all the people unto him , he said unto them , Hearken unto me every one of you , and understand :
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' eamagh er ooilley yn pobble huggey , dooyrt eh roo , Eaisht - jee ooilley rhym ' s , as toig - jee .

text: There is nothing from without a man , that entering into him can defile him : but the things which come out of him , those are they that defile the man .
text2: Cha vel nhee erbee veih cheu - mooie jeh dooinney , oddys goll stiagh ayn , as jannoo neu - ghlen jeh : agh ny reddyn ta cheet veih cheu - sthie jeh , ad shen ta jannoo neu - ghlen jeh ' n dooinney .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: My ta dooinney erbee as cleayshyn echey dy chlashtyn , lhig da clashtyn .

text: And when he was entered into the house from the people , his disciples asked him concerning the parable .
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' gholl stiagh ayns y thie veih ' n pobble , denee e ostyllyn jeh my chione y coraa - dorraghey .

text: And he saith unto them , Are ye so without understanding also ? Do ye not perceive , that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man , it cannot defile him ;
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Vel shiuish myrgeddin lesh cha beg dy hushtey ? nagh vel shiu foast cur tastey , cre - erbee veih cheu - mooie ta goll stiagh ayns y dooinney , nagh vod eh jannoo neu - ghlen jeh ,

text: Because it entereth not into his heart , but into the belly , and goeth out into the draught , purging all meats ?
text2: Er - y - fa nagh vel eh goll stiagh ayns y chree ; agh ayns y volg , as goll magh trooid y chorp , glenney dy chooilley veaghey ?

text: And he said , That which cometh out of the man , that defileth the man .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Shen ta cheet magh ass y dooinney , ta jannoo yn dooinney neu - ghlen .

text: For from within , out of the heart of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , fornications , murders ,
text2: Son veih cheu - sthie , magh veih creeaghyn deiney , ta cheet drogh - smooinaghtyn , brishey - poosey , maarderys , dunverys ,

text: Thefts , covetousness , wickedness , deceit , lasciviousness , an evil eye , blasphemy , pride , foolishness :
text2: Maarlys , saynt , olkys , molteyrys , rouanys , drogh - hooill , goan mollaghtagh , moyrn , ommijys :

text: All these evil things come from within , and defile the man .
text2: Ta ooilley ny drogh reddyn shoh cheet veih cheu - sthie , as jannoo yn dooinney neu - ghlen .

text: And from thence he arose , and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon , and entered into an house , and would have no man know it : but he could not be hid .
text2: As hrog eh er veih shen , as jimmee eh gys ardjyn Tyre as Sidon , as hie eh stiagh ayns thie , as cha baillish fys y ve ec dooinney erbee er , agh cha dod eh ve keillit .

text: For a certain woman , whose young daughter had an unclean spirit , heard of him , and came and fell at his feet :
text2: Son va ben dy row , va ' n inneen aeg eck as spyrryd neu - ghlen aynjee , tra cheayll ee jeh , haink ee as huitt ee sheese ec e chassyn :

text: The woman was a Greek , a Syrophenician by nation ; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter .
text2: ( Va ' n ven ny Greek , jeh cheer Syrophenicia ) as ghuee ee er , eh dy hilgey magh yn drogh - spyrryd ass e hinneen .

text: But Jesus said unto her , Let the children first be filled : for it is not meet to take the children ' s bread , and to cast it unto the dogs .
text2: Agh dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Lhig da ' n chloan ve hoshiaght jeant magh : son cha vel eh cooie arran ny clienney y ghoaill as y hilgey eh gys moddee .

text: And she answered and said unto him , Yes , Lord : yet the dogs under the table eat of the children ' s crumbs .
text2: As dreggyr ish as dooyrt ee , S ' feer shen Hiarn : foast ta ny moddee fo yn voayrd as ad gee brooillagh ny clienney .

text: And he said unto her , For this saying go thy way ; the devil is gone out of thy daughter .
text2: As dooyrt eh r ' ee , Son y raa shoh , immee royd , ta ' n drogh - spyrryd er gholl ass dty inneen .

text: And when she was come to her house , she found the devil gone out , and her daughter laid upon the bed .
text2: As tra v ' ee er jeet thie , hooar ee e hinneen ny lhie er y lhiabbee , as y drogh spyrryd er gholl ass - jee .

text: And again , departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon , he came unto the sea of Galilee , through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis .
text2: As hie eh reesht veih ardjyn Tyre as Sidon , as haink eh gys faarkey Ghalilee , trooid mean ardjyn Decapolis .

text: And they bring unto him one that was deaf , and had an impediment in his speech ; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him .
text2: As hug ad lhieu huggey dooinney bouyr , balloo : as ghuee ad er eh dy chur e laue er .

text: And he took him aside from the multitude , and put his fingers into his ears , and he spit , and touched his tongue ;
text2: As ghow eh dy lhiattee eh veih ' n pobble , as hug eh e veir ayns e chleayshyn , as hug eh magh shelley , as venn eh rish e hengey .

text: And looking up to heaven , he sighed , and saith unto him , Ephphatha , that is , Be opened .
text2: As yeeagh eh seose gys niau , as lhig eh osney , as dooyrt eh rish , Ephphatha , ta shen , Bee foshlit .

text: And straightway his ears were opened , and the string of his tongue was loosed , and he spake plain .
text2: As chelleeragh va ny cleayshyn echey er nyn vosley , as streng e hengey er ny eaysley , as haink e ghlare lesh .

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man : but the more he charged them , so much the more a great deal they published it ;
text2: As hug eh currym orroo gyn ad dy insh shoh da dooinney erbee : agh myr smoo hug eh currym orroo , wheesh shen foddey smoo ren adsyn y hoilshaghey eh .

text: And were beyond measure astonished , saying , He hath done all things well : he maketh both the deaf to hear , and the dumb to speak .
text2: As v ' ad erskyn towse atchimagh , gra , T ' eh er n ' yannoo dy chooilley nhee dy mie : t ' eh cur chammah er ny beuyr dy chlashtyn , as ny balloo dy loayrt .

text: In those days the multitude being very great , and having nothing to eat , Jesus called his disciples unto him , and saith unto them ,
text2: . Ayns ny laghyn shen va earroo yn phobble feer vooar , as gyn veg y veaghey oc dy ghoaill , deie Yeesey er e ostyllyn huggey , as dooyrt eh roo :

text: I have compassion on the multitude , because they have now been with me three days , and have nothing to eat :
text2: Ta chymmey aym ' s er y pobble , er - yn - oyr dy vel ad er ny ve marym nish three laa , as nagh vel monney oc dy ee :

text: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses , they will faint by the way : for divers of them came from far .
text2: As my ver - ym ad ersooyl nyn drostey gys nyn dhieyn hene , nee ad gannooinaghey er y raad : son ta paart jeu er jeet veih foddey .

text: And his disciples answered him , From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness ?
text2: As dreggyr e ostyllyn eh , Cre voish oddys dooinney ad shoh y yannoo magh lesh arran ayns shoh ayns yn aasagh ?

text: And he asked them , How many loaves have ye ? And they said , Seven .
text2: As denee eh jeu , Cre - woad bwilleen t ' eu ? As dooyrt adsyn , Shiaght .

text: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground : and he took the seven loaves , and gave thanks , and brake , and gave to his disciples to set before them ; and they did set them before the people .
text2: As doardee eh da ' n pobble dy hoie sheese er y thalloo : as ghow eh ny shiaght bwilleenyn , as hug eh booise , as vrish eh , as hug eh ad da e ostyllyn dy hoiaghey rhymboo ; as ren adsyn shirveish ad er y pobble .

text: And they had a few small fishes : and he blessed , and commanded to set them also before them .
text2: As va kuse dy eeastyn beggey oc : as vannee eh , as doardee eh dy hoiaghey ad shen myrgeddin er nyn meealloo .

text: So they did eat , and were filled : and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets .
text2: Myr shen ren ad gee , as v ' ad er nyn n ' yannoo magh , as hrog ad jeh ' n fooilliagh va er - mayrn , lane shiaght baskadyn .

text: And they that had eaten were about four thousand : and he sent them away .
text2: As v ' adsyn ren gee mysh kiare thousaneyn , as hug eh ad ersooyl .

text: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples , and came into the parts of Dalmanutha .
text2: As jeeragh ghow eh lhuingys marish e ostyllyn , as haink eh gys ardjyn Dalmanutha .

text: And the Pharisees came forth , and began to question with him , seeking of him a sign from heaven , tempting him .
text2: As haink ny Phariseeyn magh , as ren ad toshiaght dy enaght questionyn jeh , as dy hirrey er cowrey veih niau , er - chee dy phrowal eh .

text: And he sighed deeply in his spirit , and saith , Why doth this generation seek after a sign ? verily I say unto you , There shall no sign be given unto this generation .
text2: As ren eh osnaghey dy trome ayns e spyrryd , as dooyrt eh , Cre ' n - fa ta ' n chee oghe shoh shirrey cowrey ? dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Nagh bee cowrey er ny choyrt da ' n cheeloghe shoh .

text: And he left them , and entering into the ship again departed to the other side .
text2: As daag eh ad , as ghow eh lhuingys reesht , as haink eh gys y cheu elley .

text: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread , neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf .
text2: Nish va e ostyllyn er yarrood dy ghoaill arran maroo , as cha row oc ayns y lhong agh un willeen .

text: And he charged them , saying , Take heed , beware of the leaven of the Pharisees , and of the leaven of Herod .
text2: As hug eh currym orroo , gra , Bee - jee er nyn arrey , cur - jee twoaie jeh soorid ny Phariseeyn , as jeh soorid Herod .

text: And they reasoned among themselves , saying , It is because we have no bread .
text2: As v ' ad pleadeil ry - cheilley , gra , Ta shoh er - yn - oyr nagh vel arran ain .

text: And when Jesus knew it , he saith unto them , Why reason ye , because ye have no bread ? perceive ye not yet , neither understand ? have ye your heart yet hardened ?
text2: As tra va fys ec Yeesey er , dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu arganey ny - vud eu hene , son nagh vel arran eu ? nagh vel shiu foast cur tastey , ny toiggal ? vel y cree eu foast moal ayns tushtey ?

text: Having eyes , see ye not ? and having ears , hear ye not ? and do ye not remember ?
text2: Shiuish ta sooillyn eu , nagh vel shiu fakin ? as cleayshyn , nagh vel shiu clashtyn ? as nagh vel eh eu ayns cooinaghtyn ?

text: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? They say unto him , Twelve .
text2: Tra vrish mish ny queig bwilleenyn mastey queig thousaneyn , cre whilleen baskad d ' ooilliagh hrog shiu ? Dooyrt ad rish , Daa vaskad jeig .

text: And when the seven among four thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? And they said , Seven .
text2: As tra vrish mee ny shiaght mastey kiare thousaneyn , cre whilleen baskad d ' ooilliagh hrog shiu ? As dooyrt adsyn , shiaght .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye do not understand ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Kys te nagh vel shiu goaill tushtey ?

text: And he cometh to Bethsaida ; and they bring a blind man unto him , and besought him to touch him .
text2: As haink eh gys Bethsaida , as hug ad lhieu dooinney doal huggey , as ghuee ad er eh dy ventyn rish .

text: And he took the blind man by the hand , and led him out of the town ; and when he had spit on his eyes , and put his hands upon him , he asked him if he saw ought .
text2: As ghow eh yn dooinney doal er laue as leeid eh eh magh ass y valley ; as tra v ' eh er chur shelley er e hooillyn , as er chur e laueyn er , denee eh jeh row eh fakin nhee erbee .

text: And he looked up , and said , I see men as trees , walking .
text2: As yeeagh eh seose , as dooyrt eh , Hee - ym deiney myr biljyn , shooyll .

text: After that he put his hands again upon his eyes , and made him look up : and he was restored , and saw every man clearly .
text2: Ny lurg shen , hug eh e laueyn reesht er e hooillyn , as hug eh er jeeaghyn seose : as hooar eh e hoilshey , as honnick eh dy chooilley ghooinney dy cronnal .

text: And he sent him away to his house , saying , Neither go into the town , nor tell it to any in the town .
text2: As hug eh eh ersooyl gys e hie , gra , Ny gow stiagh ayns y valley , chamoo inshys oo eh da unnane erbee ayns y valley .

text: And Jesus went out , and his disciples , into the towns of Caesarea Philippi : and by the way he asked his disciples , saying unto them , Whom do men say that I am ?
text2: As hie Yeesey as e ostyllyn magh gys baljyn Cesarea Philippi : as er y raad denee eh jeu , gra , Cre ta deiney dy ghra my - mychione ' s , quoi mee ?

text: And they answered , John the Baptist : but some say , Elias ; and others , One of the prophets .
text2: As dreggyr ad , Ean Bashtey : agh ta paart gra , Elias ; as feallagh elley , Fer jeh ny phadeyryn .

text: And he saith unto them , But whom say ye that I am ? And Peter answereth and saith unto him , Thou art the Christ .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Agh quoi ta shiuish dy ghra dy vel mee ? As dreggyr Peddyr as dooyrt eh rish , Oo yn Creest .

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him .
text2: As hug eh currym orroo gyn ad dy insh da doinney erbee quoi v ' eh .

text: And he began to teach them , that the Son of man must suffer many things , and be rejected of the elders , and of the chief priests , and scribes , and be killed , and after three days rise again .
text2: As ren eh toshiaght dy hoilshaghey daue , dy row yn Mac dooinney dy hurranse ymmodee reddyn , as dy ve mee - lowit liorish y chanstyr , as ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny scrudeyryn , as dy ve er ny choyrt gy - baase , as er y trass laa dy irree reesht .

text: And he spake that saying openly . And Peter took him , and began to rebuke him .
text2: As loayr eh yn raa shoh dy foshlit . As ghow Peddyr eh dy lhiattee , as ren eh toshiaght dy choyrlaghey eh .

text: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples , he rebuked Peter , saying , Get thee behind me , Satan : for thou savourest not the things that be of God , but the things that be of men .
text2: Agh tra v ' eh er jyndaa mygeayrt , as er yeeaghyn er e ostyllyn , hug eshyn oghsan da Peddyr , gra , Ass my enish , y violeyder : son cha vel ennaghtyn ayd jeh ny reddyn ta bentyn rish Jee , agh jeh ny reddyn ta bentyn rish deiney .

text: And when he had called the people unto him with his disciples also , he said unto them , Whosoever will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and follow me .
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' eamagh er y pobble huggey , marish e ostyllyn , dooyrt eh roo , Quoi - erbee ta aggindagh geiyrt orrym ' s , lhig da eh - hene y obbal , as e chrosh y hroggal , as geiyrt orrym .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it ; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel ' s , the same shall save it .
text2: Son quoi - erbee baillish e vioys y hauail , caillee eh eh ; agh quoi - erbee chailIys e vioys er my ghraih ' s as graih yn tushtal , sauee eh eh .

text: For what shall it profit a man , if he shall gain the whole world , and lose his own soul ?
text2: Son cre ' n vondeish vees ec dooinney my chosnys eh yn seihll ooilley , as e annym hene y choayl ?

text: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul ?
text2: Ny cre nee dooinney y choyrt ayns coonrey son e annym ?

text: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation ; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed , when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels .
text2: Quoi - erbee er - y - fa shen ghoys nearey roym ' s , as roish my ghoan , ayns y cheeloghe foalsey as peccoil shoh , roishyn myrgeddin ghoys Mac y dooinney nearey , tra hig eh ayns gloyr e Ayrey , as ny ainleyn casherick marish .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , That there be some of them that stand here , which shall not taste of death , till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Dy vel paart jeusyn ta nyn shassoo ayns shoh , nagh jean blashtyn er y baase , derrey vees ad er vakin reeriaght Yee er jeet lesh pooar .

text: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter , and James , and John , and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves : and he was transfigured before them .
text2: As ec kione shey laa , ghow Yeesey marish Peddyr as Jamys , as Ean , as hug eh lesh ad seose gys slieau ard ad - hene er - lheh : as va ' n cummey echey er ny chaghlaa kiongoyrt roo .

text: And his raiment became shining , exceeding white as snow ; so as no fuller on earth can white them .
text2: As haink y coamrey echey dy ve sollys , erskyn towse gial myr y sniaghtey ; nagh row walker er y thalloo oddagh jannoo cha gial roo .

text: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses : and they were talking with Jesus .
text2: As hug ad my - ner Elias , as Moses : as ad taggloo rish Yeesey .

text: And Peter answered and said to Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias .
text2: As dreggyr Peddyr as dooyrt eh rish Yeesey , Vainshter , s ' maynrey dooinyn dy hannaghtyn ayns shoh : as lhig dooin three cabbaneyn y hroggal , cabbane er dty hon ' s , as cabbane son Moses , as cabbane son Elias .

text: For he wist not what to say ; for they were sore afraid .
text2: Son cha row fys echey cre dy ghra , son s ' mooar yn aggle v ' orroo .

text: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them : and a voice came out of the cloud , saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
text2: As ren bodjal scadoo y hilgey harrystoo : as haink coraa ass y vodjal , gra , Shoh my vac ennoil ; eaisht - jee rish .

text: And suddenly , when they had looked round about , they saw no man any more , save Jesus only with themselves .
text2: As chelleeragh jeeaghyn mygeayrt , cha vaik ad dooinney erbee agh Yeesey ynrycan maroo hene .

text: And as they came down from the mountain , he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen , till the Son of man were risen from the dead .
text2: As myr v ' ad cheet neose jeh ' n clieau , hug eh currym orroo , gyn ad dy insh da dooinney erbee cre v ' ad er vakin , derrey veagh Mac y dooinney er n ' irree veih ny merriu .

text: And they kept that saying with themselves , questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean .
text2: As dreill ad y raa shen oc hene , resooney yn derrey yeh rish y jeh elley cre v ' er ny hoiggal liorish yn irree seose - reesht veih ny merriu .

text: And they asked him , saying , Why say the scribes that Elias must first come ?
text2: As denee ad jeh , gra , Cre ' n - oyr ta ny scrudeyryn gra , dy vel Elias dy heet hoshiaght ?

text: And he answered and told them , Elias verily cometh first , and restoreth all things ; and how it is written of the Son of man , that he must suffer many things , and be set at nought .
text2: As dreggyr eshyn as dinsh eh daue , Dy row Elias dy firrinagh dy heet hoshiaght , as dy lhiassaghey dy chooilley nhee , as kys te scruit mychione Mac y dooinney dy nhegin da goll trooid mooarane surranse , as beg dy ve soit jeh .

text: But I say unto you , That Elias is indeed come , and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed , as it is written of him .
text2: Agh ta mish gra riu , dy vel Elias dy jarroo er jeet , myr te scruit jeh , as dy vel ad er n ' yannoo rish myr bailloo .

text: And when he came to his disciples , he saw a great multitude about them , and the scribes questioning with them .
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet gys e ostyllyn honnick eh chaglym mooar dy leih my geayrt - y - moo , as ny scrudeyryn arganey roo .

text: And straightway all the people , when they beheld him , were greatly amazed , and running to him saluted him .
text2: As chelleeragh tra honnick yn pobble eh , ghow ad ooilley lane boggey jeh , as roie ad huggey goltaghey da .

text: And he asked the scribes , What question ye with them ?
text2: As denee eh jeh ny scrudeyryn , Cre ny questionyn va shiu dy enaght jeu ?

text: And one of the multitude answered and said , Master , I have brought unto thee my son , which hath a dumb spirit ;
text2: As dreggyr fer jeh ' n cheshaght , as dooyrt eh , Vainshter , Ta mee er chur lhiam my vac hood , ayn ta spyrryd balloo :

text: And wheresoever he taketh him , he teareth him : and he foameth , and gnasheth with his teeth , and pineth away : and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out ; and they could not .
text2: As raad erbee dy vel eh dy ghoaill eh , t ' eh dy eiyrt eh noon as noal ; as t ' eh keshal as snaggeraght Iesh e eeacklyn , as shymley ersooyl : as loayr mee rish dty ostyllyn , ad dy chastey eh ; agh cha daink eh lhieu .

text: He answereth him , and saith , O faithless generation , how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I suffer you ? bring him unto me .
text2: Dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh , O heeloghe vee - chredjuagh , caid ta mish dy ve meriu ? caid ta mee dy hurranse diu ? cur lhiat eh hym ' s .

text: And they brought him unto him : and when he saw him , straightway the spirit tare him ; and he fell on the ground , and wallowed foaming .
text2: As hug ad lhieu eh huggey : as tra honnick eh eh , chelleeragh deiyr y spyrryd eh noon as noal , as huitt eh er y thalloo , rowlal as keshal ec y veeal .

text: And he asked his father , How long is it ago since this came unto him ? And he said , Of a child .
text2: As denee eh jeh ' n ayr echey , Caid neayr as haink shoh er ? As dooyrt eh , T ' eh er ve myr shoh neayr as v ' eh ny lhiannoo .

text: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire , and into the waters , to destroy him : but if thou canst do any thing , have compassion on us , and help us .
text2: As dy mennick t ' eh er hilgey eh ayns yn aile , as ayns ny ushtaghyn , dy stroie eh : agh my oddys oo nhee erbee y yannoo , jean chymmey orrin , as cooin lhien .

text: Jesus said unto him , If thou canst believe , all things are possible to him that believeth .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , My oddys oo credjal , ta dy chooilley nhee cheet leshyn ta credjal .

text: And straightway the father of the child cried out , and said with tears , Lord , I believe ; help thou mine unbelief .
text2: As chelleeragh deie ayr y lhiennoo , as dooyrt eh lesh jeir , Hiarn , ta mee credjal ; niartee lesh my chredjue faase .

text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together , he rebuked the foul spirit , saying unto him , Thou dumb and deaf spirit , I charge thee , come out of him , and enter no more into him .
text2: Tra honnick Yeesey dy row yn pobble ayns preis chionney dy cheilley , vaggyr eh er y spyrryd neu - ghlen , as dooyrt eh rish , Uss spyrryd balloo as bouyr , ta mee dy dty harey , Oo dy heet magh ass , as gyn arragh dy gholl stiagh ayn .

text: And the spirit cried , and rent him sore , and came out of him : and he was as one dead ; insomuch that many said , He is dead .
text2: As dyllee yn spyrryd , as deiyr eh noon as noal eh , as haink eh magh ass ; as v ' eh myr dy beagh eh marroo , ayns wheesh as dy dooyrt ymmodee , T ' eh marroo .

text: But Jesus took him by the hand , and lifted him up ; and he arose .
text2: Agh ghow Yeesey eh er laue , as hrog eh eh seose , as dirree eh .

text: And when he was come into the house , his disciples asked him privately , Why could not we cast him out ?
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet stiagh ayns y thie , denee e ostyllyn jeh er - lheh , Cre ' n - oyr nagh voddagh shin y chastey eh ?

text: And he said unto them , This kind can come forth by nothing , but by prayer and fasting .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cha vel y keint shoh cheet magh er aght erbee , agh liorish padjer as trostey .

text: And they departed thence , and passed through Galilee ; and he would not that any man should know it .
text2: As jimmee eh veih shen , as hie ad trooid Galilee ; as cha baillish fys y ve ec dooinney erbee er .

text: For he taught his disciples , and said unto them , The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men , and they shall kill him ; and after that he is killed , he shall rise the third day .
text2: Son dynsee eh e ostyllyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Ta Mac y dooinney dy ve livreit gys laueyn deiney , as marree ad eh , as erreish da v ' er ny varroo , nee eh girree reesht yn trass laa .

text: But they understood not that saying , and were afraid to ask him .
text2: Agh cha hoig ad yn raa shen , as cha by - lhoys daue fenaghtyn jeh .

text: And he came to Capernaum : and being in the house he asked them , What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way ?
text2: As haink eh gys Capernaum , as ayns y thie denee eh jeu , Cre ' n taggloo shen va eu ny mast ' eu hene er y raad ?

text: But they held their peace : for by the way they had disputed among themselves , who should be the greatest .
text2: Agh v ' ad nyn - dhost : Son er y raad v ' ad pleadeil nyn mast ' oc hene , quoi syrjey veagh .

text: And he sat down , and called the twelve , and saith unto them , If any man desire to be first , the same shall be last of all , and servant of all .
text2: As hoie eh sheese , as deie eh er y ghaa - yeig , as dooyrt eh roo , My ta dooinney erbee geearree dy ve hoshiaght , bee eh er - jerrey ooilley , as ny harvaant da ooilley .

text: And he took a child , and set him in the midst of them : and when he had taken him in his arms , he said unto them ,
text2: As ghow eh lhiannoo , as hoie eh eh kiongoyrt roo : as tra v ' eh er ghoaill eh ayns e roihaghyn , dooyrt eh roo ,

text: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name , receiveth me : and whosoever shall receive me , receiveth not me , but him that sent me .
text2: Quoi - erbee nee soiaghey jeh unnane dy lheid y chloan shoh , t ' eh soiaghey jeem ' s : as quoi - erbee nee soiaghey jeem ' s , cha nee jeem ' s t ' eh soiaghey , agh jehsyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: And John answered him , saying , Master , we saw one casting out devils in thy name , and he followeth not us : and we forbad him , because he followeth not us .
text2: As dreggyr Ean eh , gra , Vainshter , honnick shin fer castey drogh - spyrrydyn ayns dty ennym ' s , as cha vel eh geiyrt orrinyn , as ren shin eh y lhiettal , er - yn - oyr nagh vel eh geiyrt orrinyn .

text: But Jesus said , Forbid him not : for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name , that can lightly speak evil of me .
text2: Agh dooyrt Yeesey , Ny jean - jee eh y lhiettal : son cha vel dooinney erbee nee mirril y yannoo ayns m ' ennym ' s , oddys dy eddrym loayrt olk jee ' m .

text: For he that is not against us is on our part .
text2: Son eshyn nagh vel nyn ' oi , t ' eh er nyn baart .

text: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name , because ye belong to Christ , verily I say unto you , he shall not lose his reward .
text2: Son quoi - erbee ver diu cappan dy ushtey dy iu , ayns m ' ennym ' s , er - yn - oyr dy vel shiu bentyn gys Creest , dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , nagh gaill eh e leagh .

text: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me , it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he were cast into the sea .
text2: As quoi - erbee ver oyr da unnane jeh ' n vooinjer veggey shoh ta credjal aynym ' s dy huittym ( veih ' n chredjue ) bare da clagh wyllin dy ve croghit mysh e wannal , as eh dy ve tilgit ayns y cheayn .

text: And if thy hand offend thee , cut it off : it is better for thee to enter into life maimed , than having two hands to go into hell , into the fire that never shall be quenched :
text2: As my ta dty laue dy dty hayrn gys yn olk , giare jeed ee : te ny share dhyt goll stiagh ayns y vea veayn , baccagh , na daa laue y ve ayd , as oo dy gholl gys niurin , gys yn aile nagh bee dy bragh er ny vooghey .

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Raad nagh vel y veishteig oc geddyn baase , as cha vel yn aile er ny vooghey .

text: And if thy foot offend thee , cut it off : it is better for thee to enter halt into life , than having two feet to be cast into hell , into the fire that never shall be quenched :
text2: As my ta dty chass dy dty hayrn gys peccah , giare jeed ee : te ny share dhyt goll croobagh stiagh ayns y vea veayn , na daa chass y ve ayd , as oo dy ve tilgit ayns niurin , ayns yn aile nagh bee dy bragh er ny vooghey :

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Raad nagh vel y veishteig oc geddyn baase , as cha vel yn aile er ny vooghey .

text: And if thine eye offend thee , pluck it out : it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye , than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire :
text2: As my ta dty hooill dy dty hayrn gys peccah , pluck assyd ee : te ny share dhyt goll stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee lesh un hooill , na daa hooill y ve ayd , as oo dy ve tilgit ayns aile niurin :

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Raad nagh vel y veishteig oc geddym baase , as cha vel yn aile er ny vooghey .

text: For every one shall be salted with fire , and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt .
text2: Son bee dy chooilley unnane jeh nyn lheid oc shoh er nyn sailley lesh aile , as dy chooilley oural er ny hailley lesh sollan .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his saltness , wherewith will ye season it ? Have salt in yourselves , and have peace one with another .
text2: Ta ' n sollan mie : agh my ta ' n sollan er choayl e hailjys , kys hig e vree ayn reesht ? Freill - jee sollan ayndiu hene , as bee - jee ayns shee yn derrey yeh rish y jeh elley .

text: And he arose from thence , and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan : and the people resort unto him again ; and , as he was wont , he taught them again .
text2: As hrog eh er veih shen , as haink eh gys ardjyn Yudea , trooid y cheer v ' er cheu elley dy Yordan : as haink y pobble huggey reesht ; as myr v ' eh cliaghtey , dynsee eh ad reesht .

text: And the Pharisees came to him , and asked him , Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife ? tempting him .
text2: As haink ny Phariseeyn huggey , as denee ad jeh , er - chee prowal eh , Vel eh lowal da dooinney scarrey rish e ven ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , What did Moses command you ?
text2: As dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n sarey hug Moses diu ?

text: And they said , Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement , and to put her away .
text2: As dooyrt adsyn , Lhow Moses screeuyn scarree y yannoo , as dy choyrt ee ersooyl .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept .
text2: As dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh roo , Son creoghys ny creeaghyn eu scrieu eh diu yn sarey shoh ,

text: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female .
text2: Agh er - dy hoshiaght y theihll , chroo Jee ad fyrrynagh as bwoirrynagh .

text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother , and cleave to his wife ;
text2: Er - yn - oyr shoh nee dooinney faagail e ayr as e voir , as lhiannee eh gys e ven .

text: And they twain shall be one flesh : so then they are no more twain , but one flesh .
text2: As bee ad ny - neesht un eill : myr shen cha vel ad ny - sodjey jees , agh yn un eill .

text: What therefore God hath joined together , let not man put asunder .
text2: Cre - erbee er - y - fa shen ta Jee er chur cooidjagh , ny lhig da dooinney erbee y scarrey veih - my - cheilley .

text: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter .
text2: As ayns y thie denee e ostyllyn jeh reesht , mychione y chooish cheddin .

text: And he saith unto them , Whosoever shall put away his wife , and marry another , committeth adultery against her .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Quoi - erbee scarrys rish e ven , as phoosys ben elley , t ' eh brishey poosey n ' oi eck .

text: And if a woman shall put away her husband , and be married to another , she committeth adultery .
text2: As my scarrys ben rish e sheshey , as ee dy ve poost rish dooinney elley , t ' ee brishey poosey .

text: And they brought young children to him , that he should touch them : and his disciples rebuked those that brought them .
text2: As hug ad lhieu cloan aegey gys Creest , dy jinnagh eh bentyn roo ; as hug e ostyllyn oghsan dauesyn hug lhieu ad .

text: But when Jesus saw it , he was much displeased , and said unto them , Suffer the little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Agh tra honnick Yeesey eh , v ' eh feer jymmoosagh , as dooyrt eh roo , Sur - jee cloan aegey dy heet hym ' s , as ny jean - jee ad y lhiettal : son jeh nyn lheid ta reeriaght Yee .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child , he shall not enter therein .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Quoi erbee nagh jean goaill reeriaght Yee myr lhiannoo beg , cha jed eh stiagh ayn .

text: And he took them up in his arms , put his hands upon them , and blessed them .
text2: As ghow eh ad seose ayns e roihaghyn , hug eh e laueyn orroo , as vannee eh ad .

text: And when he was gone forth into the way , there came one running , and kneeled to him , and asked him , Good Master , what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life ?
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' gholl magh er y raad , haink fer roie ny whuail , as gliooney huggey , denee eh jeh , Vainshter vie , cre neem ' s dy voddym eiraght y choshey ayns y vea veayn ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? there is none good but one , that is , God .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Cre ' n - fa t ' ou genmys mish mie ? cha vel ayn ny ta mie , agh unnane , ynrycan Jee .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Defraud not , Honour thy father and mother .
text2: Shione dhyt ny annaghyn , Ny jean poosey y vrishey , Ny jean dunverys , Ny jean geid , Ny jean feanish foalsey y ymmyrkey , Ny Jean molteyraght , Cur arrym da dty ayr , as da dty voir .

text: And he answered and said unto him , Master , all these have I observed from my youth .
text2: As dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh rish , Vainshter , ooilley ny annaghyn shoh ta mee er reayll veih my aegid .

text: Then Jesus beholding him loved him , and said unto him , One thing thou lackest : go thy way , sell whatsoever thou hast , and give to the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , take up the cross , and follow me .
text2: Eisht Yeesey , jeeaghyn dy ennoil er dooyrt rish , Ta un red ort foast dy yannoo immee royd , as creck ny t ' ayd , as cur eh da ny boghtyn , as bee berchys ayd ayns niau ; as tar , trog y chrosh , as eiyr orrym ' s .

text: And he was sad at that saying , and went away grieved : for he had great possessions .
text2: As v ' eh trimshagh ec y raa shen , as hie eh ersooyl : son va cummallyn mooarey echey .

text: And Jesus looked round about , and saith unto his disciples , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: As yeeagh Yeesey mygeayrt , as dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn , Cre cha doillee as vees eh dauesyn ta berchys oc dy gholl stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee !

text: And the disciples were astonished at his words . But Jesus answereth again , and saith unto them , Children , how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: As ghow adsyn yindys jeh ny goan echey . Agh dreggyr Yeesey reesht , as dooyrt eh roo , Chloan , cre cha doillee as te dauesyn ta treishteil ayns berchys , dy gholl stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee !

text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Te ny sassey da camel goll trooid croae snaidey , na da lheid y dooinney berchagh shoh dy gholl stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee .

text: And they were astonished out of measure , saying among themselves , Who then can be saved ?
text2: As v ' ad atchimagh erskyn towse , gra nyn mast ' oc hene , Quoi eisht oddys v ' er ny auail .

text: And Jesus looking upon them saith , With men it is impossible , but not with God : for with God all things are possible .
text2: As yeeagh Yeesey orroo , as dooyrt eh , Da deiney ta shoh neu - phossible , agh cha vel eh da Jee : son da Jee ta dy chooilley nhee possible .

text: Then Peter began to say unto him , Lo , we have left all , and have followed thee .
text2: Eisht ren Peddyr toshiaght dy ghra rish , Cur - my - ner ta shinyn er dreigeil ooilley , as er n ' eiyrt ort ' s .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or lands , for my sake , and the gospel ' s ,
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Nagh vel dooinney erbee , t ' er dreigeil thie , ny braaraghyn , ny shayraghyn , ny ayr , ny moir , ny ben , ny cloan , ny thalloo , er my ghraih ' s as graih yn tushtal ,

text: But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time , houses , and brethren , and sisters , and mothers , and children , and lands , with persecutions ; and in the world to come eternal life .
text2: Nagh vow keead - filley nish ayns y traa shoh , thieyn , as braaraghyn , as shayraghyn , as moiraghyn , as cloan , as thalloo , lesh seaghyn ; as ayns y theihll ta ry - heet yn vea veayn .

text: But many that are first shall be last ; and the last first .
text2: Agh bee ymmodee jeusyn ta hoshiaght er - jerrey : as jeusyn ta er - jerrey , hoshiaght .

text: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem ; and Jesus went before them : and they were amazed ; and as they followed , they were afraid . And he took again the twelve , and began to tell them what things should happen unto him ,
text2: As v ' ad er y raad goll seose gys Jerusalem : as hie Yeesey rhymboo ; as v ' ad atchimagh , as myr vad geiyrt er , va aggle orroo . As ghow eh yn daa ostyl yeig reesht , as ren eh toshiaght dy insh daue , cre ny reddyn harragh er ,

text: Saying , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests , and unto the scribes ; and they shall condemn him to death , and shall deliver him to the Gentiles :
text2: Gra , Cur - my - ner , ta shin goll seose gys Jerusalem , as bee Mac y dooinney er ny livrey gys ny ard - saggyrtyn , as gys ny scrudeyryn : as nee ad eh y gheyrey dy baase , as livreyee ad eh gys ny Ashoonee .

text: And they shall mock him , and shall scourge him , and shall spit upon him , and shall kill him : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: As craidee ad mysh , as custee ad eh , as tilgee ad shellaghyn er , as marree ad eh : as y trass laa nee eh girree reesht .

text: And James and John , the sons of Zebedee , come unto him , saying , Master , we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire .
text2: As haink Jamys as Ean mec Zebedee huggey , gra , Vainshter ; Ta shin guee ort , dy chur dooin yn aghin shen , nee mayd y yeearree ort .

text: And he said unto them , What would ye that I should do for you ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cre bailliu mee dy yannoo er nyn son ?

text: They said unto him , Grant unto us that we may sit , one on thy right hand , and the other on thy left hand , in thy glory .
text2: Dooyrt adsyn rish , Giall dooinyn dy hoie , yn derrey yeh er dty laue yesh , as y jeh elley er dty laue chiare , ayns dty ghloyr .

text: But Jesus said unto them , Ye know not what ye ask : can ye drink of the cup that I drink of ? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with ?
text2: Agh dooyrt Yeesey roo , Cha s ' eu cre ta shiu dy yeearree : vod shiu giu jeh ' n cappan ta mish giu jeh ? as v ' er nyn mashtey lesh y bashtey ta mish bashtit lesh ?

text: And they said unto him , We can . And Jesus said unto them , Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of ; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized :
text2: As dooyrt ad rish , Foddee mayd . As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Iu - ee shiu dy jarroo jeh ' n cappan ta mish giu jeh ; as bee shiu er nyn mashtey lesh y bashtey ta mish bashtit lesh :

text: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give ; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared .
text2: Agh dy hoie er my laue - yesh as er my laue - chiare , cha vel shen lhiam ' s dy choyrt , agh bee eh er ny choyrt ynrycan dauesyn er nyn son te kiarit .

text: And when the ten heard it , they began to be much displeased with James and John .
text2: As tra cheayll yn jeih shoh , ren ad toshiaght dy ve feer jymmoosagh rish Jamys as Ean .

text: But Jesus called them to him , and saith unto them , Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and their great ones exercise authority upon them .
text2: Agh deie Yeesey orroo huggey , as dooyrt eh roo , Ta fys eu dy vel fir - reill ny Hashoonee gymmyrkey chiarnys orroo , as ta ny ard - gheiney oc reill dy mooaralagh harrystoo .

text: But so shall it not be among you : but whosoever will be great among you , shall be your minister :
text2: Agh cha bee shiuish myr shen : agh quoi - erbee jiuish baillish ve ooasle , lhig da ve nyn shirveishagh :

text: And whosoever of you will be the chiefest , shall be servant of all .
text2: As quoi - erbee baillish ve yn ard ghooinney nyn mast ' eu , lhig da ve ny harvaant da ooilley .

text: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto , but to minister , and to give his life a ransom for many .
text2: Son cha daink yn eer Mac dooinney dy ve shirveishit , agh dy hirveish , as dy chur e vioys ny lhiassaghey son ymmodee .

text: And they came to Jericho : and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people , blind Bartimaeus , the son of Timaeus , sat by the highway side begging .
text2: As haink ad gys Jericho : as myr v ' eh goll magh ass Jericho marish e ostyllyn , as marish earroo mooar dy leih , va Bartimeus doal mac Timeus , ny hoie rish oirr yn raad , shirrey jeirk .

text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth , he began to cry out , and say , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: As tra cheayll eh dy nee Yeesey dy Nazareth v ' ayn , ren eh toshiaght dy eamagh as dy ghra , Yeesey Vac Ghavid , jean myghin orrym .

text: And many charged him that he should hold his peace : but he cried the more a great deal , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: As hooar ymmodee foill da eh dy ve ny - host : agh dyllee eshyn wheesh shen foddey smoo , Vac Ghavid , jean myghin orrym .

text: And Jesus stood still , and commanded him to be called . And they call the blind man , saying unto him , Be of good comfort , rise ; he calleth thee .
text2: As hass Yeesey , as doardee eh eh dy ve eit : as deie ad er y dooinney doal , gra rish , Bee dy yien mie , irree ; t ' eh geamagh ort .

text: And he , casting away his garment , rose , and came to Jesus .
text2: As hilg eh ersooyl e gharmad , as dirree eh , as haink eh - gys Yeesey .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , What wilt thou that I should do unto thee ? The blind man said unto him , Lord , that I might receive my sight .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh rish , Cre bailt mee dy yannoo er dty hon ? Dooyrt y dooinney doal rish , Hiarn , dy voddym my hoilshey y gheddyn .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Go thy way ; thy faith hath made thee whole . And immediately he received his sight , and followed Jesus in the way .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Immee royd ; ta dty chredjue er dty laanaghey . As chelleeragh hooar eh e hoilshey , as jimmee eh marish Yeesey er y raad .

text: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem , unto Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount of Olives , he sendeth forth two of his disciples ,
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet er - gerrey da Jerusalem , gys Bethphage as Bethany ec cronk ny Oliveyn , hug eh magh jees jeh e ostyllyn ,

text: And saith unto them , Go your way into the village over against you : and as soon as ye be entered into it , ye shall find a colt tied , whereon never man sat ; loose him , and bring him .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Gow - jee reue gys y balley - cheerey ta jeeragh erriu ; as cha leah as vees shiu er n ' gholl stiagh ayn , yiow shiu lhiy kainlt , urree nagh varkee rieau dooinney ; feayshil - jee as cur - jee lhieu ee .

text: And if any man say unto you , Why do ye this ? say ye that the Lord hath need of him ; and straightway he will send him hither .
text2: As my jir dooinney erbee riu , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu jannoo shoh ? abbyr - jee dy vel feme ec y Chiarn urree ; as chelleeragh nee eh yn raad y lhiggey jee ,

text: And they went their way , and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met ; and they loose him .
text2: As hie ad rhymboo , as hooar ad y lhiy kianlt cheu - mooie jeh ' n dorrys , ayns boayl va daa raad cheet dy cheilley : as deayshil ad ee .

text: And certain of them that stood there said unto them , What do ye , loosing the colt ?
text2: As dooyrt shiartanse jeusyn va nyn shassoo ayns shen , Kys dy vel shiu feaysley yn lhiy ?

text: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded : and they let them go .
text2: As dooyrt ad roo myr va Yeesey er n ' oardaghey daue , as lhig ad y raad daue .

text: And they brought the colt to Jesus , and cast their garments on him ; and he sat upon him .
text2: As hug ad lhieu yn lhiy gys Yeesey , as hilg ad ny garmadyn oc urree ; as hoie eshyn er y lhiy .

text: And many spread their garments in the way : and others cut down branches off the trees , and strawed them in the way .
text2: As ren ymmodee jeu nyn gharmadyn y skeayleyery raad : as ghiare feallagh elley banglaneyn jeh ny biljyn as skeayl ad ad er y raad .

text: And they that went before , and they that followed , cried , saying , Hosanna ; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord :
text2: As adsyn hie roish , as y vooinjer haink ny yei , deie ad , gra , Hosanna , bannit ta eshyn ta cheet ayns ennym y Chiarn .

text: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David , that cometh in the name of the Lord : Hosanna in the highest .
text2: Bannit dy row reeriaght yn ayr ain David , ta cheet ayns ennym y Chiarn ; Hosanna ayns yn yrjid .

text: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem , and into the temple : and when he had looked round about upon all things , and now the eventide was come , he went out unto Bethany with the twelve .
text2: As hie Yeesey gys Jerusalem , as hie eh stiagh ayns y chiamble ; as tra v ' eh er yeeaghyn mygeayrt er dy chooilley nhee , as nish dy row yn fastyr er jeet , hie eh magh gys Bethany marish y daa ostyl yeig .

text: And on the morrow , when they were come from Bethany , he was hungry :
text2: As laa ny vairagh , tra v ' ad er jeet veih Bethany , v ' eh accryssagh .

text: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves , he came , if haply he might find any thing thereon : and when he came to it , he found nothing but leaves ; for the time of figs was not yet .
text2: As honnick eh billey - figgagh er y raad , as duillagyn er , as haink eh , dy yeeaghyn voghe eh mess erbee er : as tra v ' eh er jeet huggey , cha dooar eh nhee erbee er , agh duillagyn ; son cha row imbagh ny figgyn ayn foast .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto it , No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever . And his disciples heard it .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh rish , Nar ee dooinney erbee mess jeeds veih shoh magh er son dy bragh . As cheayll e ostyllyn eh .
