text: And they come to Jerusalem : and Jesus went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple , and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers , and the seats of them that sold doves ;
text2: As haink ad gys Jerusalem : as hie Yeesey stiagh ayns y chiamble , as ren eh toshiaght dy eiyrt magh adsyn va creck as kionnaghey ayns y chiamble , as hilg eh harrish ny buird ocsyn va caghlaa argid , as ny stuill ocsyn va creck calmaneyn

text: And would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple .
text2: As cha lhowagh eh da dooinney erbee saagh erbee y chur lesh trooid y chiamble .

text: And he taught , saying unto them , Is it not written , My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer ? but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: As dynsee eh ad , gra , Nagh vel eh scruit , Bee my hie ' s enmyssit liorish dy chooilley ashoon , thie yn phadjer ? agh ta shiuish er n ' yannoo eh ny ooig dy vaarlee .

text: And the scribes and chief priests heard it , and sought how they might destroy him : for they feared him , because all the people was astonished at his doctrine .
text2: As cheayll ny scrudeyryn as ny ard - saggyrtyn jeh , as v ' ad shirrey kys oddagh ad eh y stroie : son v ' ad ayns aggle roish , er - yn - oyr dy row ooilley yn pobble goaill yindys jeh ' n ynsagh echey .

text: And when even was come , he went out of the city .
text2: As tra va ' n fastyr er jeet , hie eh magh ass yn ard - valley .

text: And in the morning , as they passed by , they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots .
text2: As ayns y voghrey , myr v ' ad goll shaghey , honnick ad y billey - figgagh dy row eh er greenaghey seose veih ny fraueyn .

text: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him , Master , behold , the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away .
text2: As by - chooinee lesh Peddyr , as dooyrt eh rish , Vainshter , cur - my - ner , ta ' n billey figgagh hug uss fo mollaght er fioghey ersooyl .

text: And Jesus answering saith unto them , Have faith in God .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Soie - jee nyn gredjue ayns Jee .

text: For verily I say unto you , That whosoever shall say unto this mountain , Be thou removed , and be thou cast into the sea ; and shall not doubt in his heart , but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass ; he shall have whatsoever he saith .
text2: Son dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Quoi erbee jir rish y slieau shoh , Bee er dty scughey , as er dty hilgey ayns y cheayn , as nagh jean mee - ourys ayns e chree , agh ta credjal dy jig ny reddyn t ' eh dy ghra gy kione , bee shen ny jir eh er ny chooilleeney .

text: Therefore I say unto you , What things soever ye desire , when ye pray , believe that ye receive them , and ye shall have them .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta mee gra riu , Cre - erbee ta shiu dy yeearree ayns padjer , cred - jee dy vow shiu ad , as bee ad eu .

text: And when ye stand praying , forgive , if ye have ought against any : that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses .
text2: As tra vees shiu shassoo dy ghoaill padjer , leih - jee , my ta nhee erbee eu noi dooinney erbee : dy vod nyn Ayr myrgeddin t ' ayns niau nyn loghtyn y leih diuish .

text: But if ye do not forgive , neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses .
text2: Son mannagh jean shiuish leih , cha jean nyn Ayr t ' ayns nian nyn loghtyn y leih diuish .

text: And they come again to Jerusalem : and as he was walking in the temple , there come to him the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders ,
text2: As haink ad reesht gys Jerusalem : as myr v ' eh walkal ayns y chiamble , haink huggey ny ard - saggyrtyn , as ny scrudeyryn , as y chanstyr .

text: And say unto him , By what authority doest thou these things ? and who gave thee this authority to do these things ?
text2: As dooyrt ad rish , Cre ' n phooar t ' ayd ' s dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh , as quoi hug y phooar shoh dhyt dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , I will also ask of you one question , and answer me , and I will tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Fenyms jiuish myrgeddin un red , as freggyr - jee mee , as insh - yms diuish cre ' n phooar t ' aym dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh .

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ? answer me .
text2: Bashtey Ean , nee veih niau ve , ny veih deiney ? cur - jee ansoor dou .

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then did ye not believe him ?
text2: As ren ad resooney roo hene , gra , My jir mayd , Veih niau , jir eshyn , Cre ' n - oyr eisht nagh ren shiu eh y chredjal ?

text: But if we shall say , Of men ; they feared the people : for all men counted John , that he was a prophet indeed .
text2: Agh my jir mayd , Veih deiney , v ' ad ayns aggle roish y pobble , son va dy chooilley ghooinney jeeaghyn er Ean dy ve dy jarroo ny adeyr .

text: And they answered and said unto Jesus , We cannot tell . And Jesus answering saith unto them , Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: As dreggyr ad as dooyrt ad rish Yeesey , Cha nod mayd ginsh . As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roosyn , Chamoo insh - yms diuish liorish cre ' n phooar ta mee dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh .

text: And he began to speak unto them by parables . A certain man planted a vineyard , and set an hedge about it , and digged a place for the winefat , and built a tower , and let it out to husbandmen , and went into a far country .
text2: As ren eh toshiaght dy loayrt roo liorish coraaghyn - dorraghey . Va dooinney dy row ren garey - feeyney y hoiaghey , as ren eh cleigh mygeayrt - y - mysh , as chleiy eh ynnyd son y press - feeyney , as hrog eh toor , as hoie eh eh rish eirrinnee , as hie eh gys cheer foddey .

text: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant , that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard .
text2: As ec yn imbagh cooie hug eh sharvaant gys ny eirinnee , dy gheddyn veih ny eirinnee jeh mess y gharey feeyney .

text: And they caught him , and beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: As ghow ad as woaill ad eh , as hug ad eh ersooyl follym .

text: And again he sent unto them another servant ; and at him they cast stones , and wounded him in the head , and sent him away shamefully handled .
text2: As reesht hug eh huc sharvaant elley as ersyn cheau ad claghyn , as vrish ad y kione er , as hug ad eh ersooyl lesh dellal feer scammyltagh .

text: And again he sent another ; and him they killed , and many others ; beating some , and killing some .
text2: As reesht hug eh huc sharvaant elley ; as eshyn ren ad y varroo : as ymmodee elley , bwoalley paart , as marroo paart .

text: Having yet therefore one son , his wellbeloved , he sent him also last unto them , saying , They will reverence my son .
text2: As va echey foast un vac , er v ' eh feer ghraihagh , as hug eh eshyn myrgeddin ec y jerrey huc , gra , Ver ad arrym da my vac .

text: But those husbandmen said among themselves , This is the heir ; come , let us kill him , and the inheritance shall be ours .
text2: Agh dooyrt ny eirinnee shen ny mast ' oc hene , Shoh ' n eirey : tar - jee as lhig dooin eh y varroo , as bee yn eiraght lhien hene .

text: And they took him , and killed him , and cast him out of the vineyard .
text2: As ghow ad , as varr ad eh , as hilg ad eh magh ass y gharey - feeyney .

text: What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do ? he will come and destroy the husbandmen , and will give the vineyard unto others .
text2: Cre nee Chiarn y gharey - feeyney er - y - fa shen y yannoo ? hig eh as stroie - ee eh ny eirinnee , as ver eh yn garey - feeyney da eirinnee elley .

text: And have ye not read this scripture ; The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner :
text2: Nagh vel shiuish er lhaih ayns goo Yee ? Ta ' n chlagh ren ny masoonee y vee - lowal , er jeet dy ve yn ard chlagh chorneilagh .

text: This was the Lord ' s doing , and it is marvellous in our eyes ?
text2: Shoh va jannoo yn Chiarn , as te yindyssagh ayns ny sooillyn ainyn .

text: And they sought to lay hold on him , but feared the people : for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them : and they left him , and went their way .
text2: As v ' ad shegin er goaill eh , agh v ' ad ayns aggle roish y pobble ; son va fys oc dy row eh er loayrt yn coraa - dorraghey noi ad - hene : as daag ad eh , as hie ad rhymboo .

text: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians , to catch him in his words .
text2: As hug ad huggey shiartanse jeh ny Phariseeyn , as ny Herodianee , dy ghoaill vondeish jeh ayns e ghoan .

text: And when they were come , they say unto him , Master , we know that thou art true , and carest for no man : for thou regardest not the person of men , but teachest the way of God in truth : Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar , or not ?
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet , dooyrt ad rish Vainshter , ta fys ain dy vel oo firrinagh , as nagh vel oo ayns imnea roish dooinney erbee ; son cha vel oo soiaghey jeh persoon deiney , agh gynsaghey raad Yee ayns firrinys : vel eh lowal keesh y choyrt da Cesar , mannagh vel ?

text: Shall we give , or shall we not give ? But he , knowing their hypocrisy , said unto them , Why tempt ye me ? bring me a penny , that I may see it .
text2: Jean mayd coyrt , ny dyn coyrt ? Agh va fys echeysyn er y chialgeyrys oc , as dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu shirrey dy my ghoaill ayns ribbey ? cur - jee lhieu ping hym , dy vaik - ym eh .

text: And they brought it . And he saith unto them , Whose is this image and superscription ? And they said unto him , Caesar ' s .
text2: As hug ad lhieu eh : as dooyrt eh roo , Quoi gys ta ' n cowrey as y screeu shoh bentyn ? As dooyrt adsyn rish , Gys Cesar .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar ' s , and to God the things that are God ' s . And they marvelled at him .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh roo , Eeck - jee da Cesar , shen ny ta lesh Cesar , as da Jee , ny reddyn ta lesh Jee . As ghow ad yindys jeh .

text: Then come unto him the Sadducees , which say there is no resurrection ; and they asked him , saying ,
text2: Eisht haink huggey ny Sadduceeyn , ta gra nagh vel irree - seose - reesht dy ve ayn ; as denee ad jeh , gra ,

text: Master , Moses wrote unto us , If a man ' s brother die , and leave his wife behind him , and leave no children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Vainshter , ta Moses er scrieu dooin , My ta braar dooinney geddyn baase , as faagail e ven ny yei , gyn cloan echey r ' ee , dy vel e vraar dy phoosey yn ven echey , as dy hroggal seose sluight da e vraar .

text: Now there were seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and dying left no seed .
text2: Nish va shiaght braaraghyn : as ghow yn braar shinney ben , agh geddyn baase cha daag eh sluight .

text: And the second took her , and died , neither left he any seed : and the third likewise .
text2: As ghow yn nah vraar ee , as hooar eh baase , as cha daag eh sluight : as y trass myrgeddin .

text: And the seven had her , and left no seed : last of all the woman died also .
text2: As v ' ee ec y chiaght , as cha daag ad sluight : er - jerrey ooilley hooar y ven baase myrgeddin .

text: In the resurrection therefore , when they shall rise , whose wife shall she be of them ? for the seven had her to wife .
text2: Shen - y - fa ec yn irree - seose - reesht veih ny merriu , tra nee ad girree , quoi jeu vees ee echey son ben ? son v ' ee ny ben da ' n chiaght .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Do ye not therefore err , because ye know not the scriptures , neither the power of God ?
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Nagh vel shiu er - y - fa shen fo marranys , er yn - oyr nagh vel toiggal eu jeh goo ny jeh pooar Yee ?

text: For when they shall rise from the dead , they neither marry , nor are given in marriage ; but are as the angels which are in heaven .
text2: Son ec yn irree - seose - reesht veih ny merriu , cha vel ad poosey , ny er nyn goyrt ayns poosey : agh t ' ad myr ny ainleyn t ' ayns niau .

text: And as touching the dead , that they rise : have ye not read in the book of Moses , how in the bush God spake unto him , saying , I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ?
text2: As mychione ny merriu , dy nirree ad ; nagh vel shiu er lhaih ayns lioar Voses , kys loayr Jee rish ass y thammag , gra , Mish Jee Abraham , as Jee Isaac , as Jee Yacob ?

text: He is not the God of the dead , but the God of the living : ye therefore do greatly err .
text2: Cha nee Jee ny merriu eh , agh Jee ny bioee : ta shiu er - y - fa shen fo marranys vooar .

text: And one of the scribes came , and having heard them reasoning together , and perceiving that he had answered them well , asked him , Which is the first commandment of all ?
text2: As haink fer jeh ny scrudeyryn cheayll ad resooney cooidjagh , as cur tastey dy row eh er n ' ansoor ad dy mie , denee eh jeh , Cre ' n ard - anney jeh ny annaghyn ooilley ?

text: And Jesus answered him , The first of all the commandments is , Hear , O Israel ; The Lord our God is one Lord :
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey eh , Yn chied anney jeh ooilley ny annaghyn , Clasht , O Israel , Ta ' n Chiarn yn Jee ain yn ynrycan Chiarn ;

text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind , and with all thy strength : this is the first commandment .
text2: As ver oo graih da ' n Chiarn dty Yee lesh ooilley dty chree , as lesh ooilley dty annym , as lesh ooilley dty aigney , as lesh ooilley dty niart : shoh ' n chied anney .

text: And the second is like , namely this , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself . There is none other commandment greater than these .
text2: As ta ' n nah anney casley rish , ta shen dy ghra , Ver oo graih da dty naboo , myr dhyt hene : cha vel anney erbee elley smoo na ad shoh .

text: And the scribe said unto him , Well , Master , thou hast said the truth : for there is one God ; and there is none other but he :
text2: As dooyrt y scrudeyr rish , S ' mie shen Vainshter , t ' ou er loayrt yn irriney : son ta un Jee ayn , as cha vel Jee erbee elley agh eh - hene .

text: And to love him with all the heart , and with all the understanding , and with all the soul , and with all the strength , and to love his neighbour as himself , is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices .
text2: As dy ve graihagh er lesh ooilley yn chree , as lesh ooilley yn tushtey , as lesh ooilley yn annym , as lesh ooilley yn niart , as dy ve graihagh er e naboo myr er hene ta shen ny smoo na ooilley ny slane chebballyn losht as ourallyn .

text: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly , he said unto him , Thou art not far from the kingdom of God . And no man after that durst ask him any question .
text2: As tra honnick Yeesey dy dansoor eh dy tushtagh , dooyrt eh rish , Cha vel oo foddey veih reeriaght Yee . As cha by - lhoys da dooinney erbee maghey shen question erbee sodjey y chur huggey .

text: And Jesus answered and said , while he taught in the temple , How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David ?
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey myr v ' eh gynsaghey ayns y chiamble , as dooyrt eh , Kys ta ny scurudeyryn gra dy nee Creest mac Ghavid ?

text: For David himself said by the Holy Ghost , The Lord said to my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand , till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: Son ta David eh - hene er ghra liorish y Spyrryd Noo , Dooyrt y Chiarn rish my Hiarn ' s , Soie uss er my laue yesh , derrey ver - ym dty noidyn son stoyl dty choshey .

text: David therefore himself calleth him Lord ; and whence is he then his son ? And the common people heard him gladly .
text2: Ta David er - y - fa shen eh - hene genmys eh ny Hiarn ; as kys t ' eh eisht yn mac echey ? As deaisht yn pobble v ' er nyn jaglym cooidjagh rish dy arryltagh .

text: And he said unto them in his doctrine , Beware of the scribes , which love to go in long clothing , and love salutations in the marketplaces ,
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , myr v ' eh gynsagh , Bee - jee er nyn dwoaie jeh ny scrudeyryn , ta geearree shooyll ayns coamraghyn liauyrey , as sleih dy vannaghey daue ayns ny margaghyn ,

text: And the chief seats in the synagogues , and the uppermost rooms at feasts :
text2: As ny ard - stuill y ve oc ayns ny synagogueyn , as ny ard ynnydyn - soie ec cuirraghyn :

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a pretence make long prayers : these shall receive greater damnation .
text2: T ' ad cur mow thieyn mraane treoghe , as son scaa dy chraueeaght lhiggey orroo dy ve mennick ec padjer : ta briwnys strimmey ny chour oc shoh .

text: And Jesus sat over against the treasury , and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury : and many that were rich cast in much .
text2: As myr va Yeesey ny hoie liorish kishtey yn stoyr , ghow eh tastey kys va ' n pobble cur argid ayns y stoyr : as ren ymmodee va berchagh cur ayn dy palchey .

text: And there came a certain poor widow , and she threw in two mites , which make a farthing .
text2: As haink ben voght treoghe dy row , as hilg ee ayn daa vite ta jannoo farling .

text: And he called unto him his disciples , and saith unto them , Verily I say unto you , That this poor widow hath cast more in , than all they which have cast into the treasury :
text2: As deie eh er e ostyllyn huggey , as dooyrt eh roo , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy vel y ven - treoghe voght shoh er chur ny smoo ayns kishtey yn stoyr , na dy chooilley unnane t ' er choyrt ayn .

text: For all they did cast in of their abundance ; but she of her want did cast in all that she had , even all her living .
text2: Son t ' adsyn ooilley er chur ayn ass nyn balchey : as t ' eeish myr s ' boght ee , er choyrt ayn ooilley ny v ' eck , dy jarroo ooilley e cooid - seihlt .

text: And as he went out of the temple , one of his disciples saith unto him , Master , see what manner of stones and what buildings are here !
text2: As myr v ' eh goll magh ass y chiamble , dooyrt fer jeh e ostyllyn rish , Jeeagh , Vainshter , cre ny claghyn ! as cre ' n vuildal t ' ayns shoh !

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Seest thou these great buildings ? there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , Vel oo fakin y vuildal vooar shoh ? cha bee faagit un chlagh er clagh elley nagh bee er ny lhieggal .

text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple , Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately ,
text2: As myr v ' eh ny hoie er cronk ny Oliveyn , jeeragh er y chiamble , denee Peddyr as Jamys , as Ean , as Andreays jeh er - lheh

text: Tell us , when shall these things be ? and what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled ?
text2: Insh dooin , cuin vees ny reddyn shoh ? as cre vees y cowrey tra vees dy chooilley nhee jeu shoh er nyn gooilleeney ?

text: And Jesus answering them began to say , Take heed lest any man deceive you :
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey ad , as ren eh toshiaght dy ghra , Bee - jee er nyn dwoaie nagh jean dooinney erbee shiu y volley .

text: For many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and shall deceive many .
text2: Son hig ymmodee ayns m ' ennym ' s , gra , Mish Creest : as nee ad ymmodee y volley .

text: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars , be ye not troubled : for such things must needs be ; but the end shall not be yet .
text2: As tra chluinnys shiu jeh caggaghyn as jeh imraaghyn dy bee - jee seaghnit : son shegin da lheid y ve ayn , agh cha vel yn jerrey foast .

text: For nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom : and there shall be earthquakes in divers places , and there shall be famines and troubles : these are the beginnings of sorrows .
text2: Son nee ashoon girree - magh noi ashoon as reeriaght noi reeriaght : as bee craaghyn thallooin ayns ymmodee ynnydyn , as gennaghyn as seaghyn : ad shoh toshiaght trimshaghyn .

text: But take heed to yourselves : for they shall deliver you up to councils ; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten : and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake , for a testimony against them .
text2: Agh jeeagh - jee shiuish diu hene : son livreyee ad shiu seose gys coonceilyn ; as ayns ny quaiyllyn vees shiu er nyn mwoalley , as ver ad lhieu shiu kiongoyrt rish fir - reill as reeaghyn er y choontey aym ' s , dy ve son feanishyn jeem ' s .

text: And the gospel must first be published among all nations .
text2: As shegin da ' n sushtal ve hoshiaght er ny phreacheil mastey dy chooilley ashoon .

text: But when they shall lead you , and deliver you up , take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak , neither do ye premeditate : but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour , that speak ye : for it is not ye that speak , but the Holy Ghost .
text2: Agh tra ver ad lhieu shiu dy ve currit stiagh , ny smooinee - jee ro - laue cre nee shiu loayrt , chamoo bee - jee imneagh cre dy ghra : agh cre - erbee vees er ny choyrt diu ayns yn oor cheddin , shen loayr - jee ; son cha nee shiuish ta loayrt , agh y Spyrryd Noo .

text: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death , and the father the son ; and children shall rise up against their parents , and shall cause them to be put to death .
text2: Eisht nee braar e vraar y vrah gys baase , as yn ayr e vac : as nee cloan girree seose noi nyn ayr as nyn moir , as bee ad feanishyn baaish daue .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake : but he that shall endure unto the end , the same shall be saved .
text2: As ver yn ymmodee feoh diu er coontey yn ennym aym ' s : agh bee eshyn nee tannaghtyn firrinagh gys y jerrey er ny hauail .

text: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation , spoken of by Daniel the prophet , standing where it ought not , ( let him that readeth understand , ) then let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains :
text2: Agh traa hee shiu eajeeid y traartys ta loayrit jeh liorish Daniel y phadeyr , ny hassoo raad nagh lhisagh eh , ( eshyn ta lhaih lhig da tastey ghoaill ) eisht lhig dauesyn t ' ayns Judea chea gys ny sleityn .

text: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house , neither enter therein , to take any thing out of his house :
text2: As eshyn t ' er mullagh y thie , ny lhig da cheet neose , ny goll stiagh , dy ghoaill marish nhee erbee ass e hie .

text: And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment .
text2: As ny lhig dasyn t ' ayns y vagher chyndaa back , dy chur lesh e gharmad .

text: But woe to them that are with child , and to them that give suck in those days !
text2: Agh smerg dauesyn ta torragh , as dauesyn ta cur keeagh ayns ny laghyn shen .

text: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter .
text2: As guee - jee nagh bee shiu eginit dy roie er - chea ' sy gheurey .

text: For in those days shall be affliction , such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time , neither shall be .
text2: Son bee seaghyn ayns ny laghyn shen , lheid as nagh row er - dy hoshiaght y theihll ta Jee er chroo , gys yn earish shen , as lheid , as nagh bee arragh dy bragh .

text: And except that the Lord had shortened those days , no flesh should be saved : but for the elect ' s sake , whom he hath chosen , he hath shortened the days .
text2: As mannagh beagh y Chiarn dy leah er n ' ghoaill ny laghyn shen giare , cha beagh dooinney bio er ny hauail : agh er graih e chloan reiht t ' eh er n ' yannoo giare ny laghyn :

text: And then if any man shall say to you , Lo , here is Christ ; or , lo , he is there ; believe him not :
text2: As eisht my jir dooinney erbee riu , Cur - my - ner , ta Creest ayns shoh , ny cur - my - ner , t ' eh ayns shid ; ny credjee eh .

text: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise , and shall shew signs and wonders , to seduce , if it were possible , even the elect .
text2: Son nee Creestyn foalsey , as phadeyr yn foalsey girree , as cowraghyn as yindyssyn y hoilshaghey , dy volley , my oddagh eh ve , yn eer chloan reiht .

text: But take ye heed : behold , I have foretold you all things .
text2: Agh gow - jee tastey : cur - jee my - ner , ta mish er n ' insh diu dy chooilley nhee ro - laue .

text: But in those days , after that tribulation , the sun shall be darkened , and the moon shall not give her light ,
text2: Agh ayns ny laghyn cheddin , lurg y seaghyn shen , aasee yn ghrian dorraghey , as cha der yn eayst e soilshey :

text: And the stars of heaven shall fall , and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken .
text2: As tuittee ny rollageyn veih niau , as bee pooaraghyn yn aer er nyn graa .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory .
text2: As eisht hee ad Mac y dooinney cheet ayns ny bodjallyn , lesh pooar as ard - ghloyr .

text: And then shall he send his angels , and shall gather together his elect from the four winds , from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven .
text2: As eisht ver eh magh e ainleyn , as nee eh e chloan reiht y haglym cooidjagh veih ny kiare geayghyn , veih ny ardjyn sodjey magh jeh ' n ooir , gys ny ardjyn sodjey magh jeh ' n aer .

text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree ; When her branch is yet tender , and putteth forth leaves , ye know that summer is near :
text2: Nish ynsee - jee coraa - dorraghey jeh ' n billey - figgagh : Tra ta ' n banglane echey foast oor , as cur magh duillagyn , ta fys eu dy vel y sourey er - gerrey :

text: So ye in like manner , when ye shall see these things come to pass , know that it is nigh , even at the doors .
text2: Myr shen myrgeddin shiuish , tra hee shiu ny reddyn shoh cheet gy kione , toig - jee dy vel eh er - gerrey , dy jarroo ec ny dorryssyn .

text: Verily I say unto you , that this generation shall not pass , till all these things be done .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , roish my vees yn cheeloghe shoh harrish , dy bee dy chooilley nhee jeu shoh er nyn gooilleeney

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Nee yn aer as yn ooir cherraghtyn : agh my ghoan ' s cha jean cherraghtyn .

text: But of that day and that hour knoweth no man , no , not the angels which are in heaven , neither the Son , but the Father .
text2: Agh jeh ' n laa as yn oor shen , cha vel fys ec dooinney erbee , ny ec ny ainleyn t ' ayns niau , ny ec y Mac , agh yn Ayr .

text: Take ye heed , watch and pray : for ye know not when the time is .
text2: Gow - jee tastey , bee - jee er nyn dwoaie as gow - jee padjer : son cha nione diu cuin ta ' n traa .

text: For the Son of man is as a man taking a far journey , who left his house , and gave authority to his servants , and to every man his work , and commanded the porter to watch .
text2: Son ta ' n Mac dooinney myr fer va goll er jurnah foddey , as daag e hie , as hug currym er e vooinjer , as da dy chooilley ghooinney e obbyr hene , as doardee eh da ' n porter dy reayll arrey .

text: Watch ye therefore : for ye know not when the master of the house cometh , at even , or at midnight , or at the cockcrowing , or in the morning :
text2: Bee - jee shiuish er - y - fa shen er nyn arrey ( son cha vel fys eu cuin hig mainshter y thie ; ayns yn astyr , ny ec mean - oie , ny ec gerrym y chellee , ny ayns y voghrey ) .

text: Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping .
text2: Er - aggle dy jig eh doaltattym , as dy vow eh shiu nyn gadley .

text: And what I say unto you I say unto all , Watch .
text2: As ny ta mee dy ghra riuish , ta mee dy ghra rish ooilley , Bee - jee er nyn arrey .

text: After two days was the feast of the passover , and of unleavened bread : and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft , and put him to death .
text2: Lurg daa laa va feailley ny Caisht as yn arran gyn soorid : as va ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny scruderyn shegin er goaill eh dy follit , as dy choyrt eh gy - baase .

text: But they said , Not on the feast day , lest there be an uproar of the people .
text2: Agh dooyrt ad , Cha nee er laa ny feailley , er - aggle dy bee irree - magh ayn mastey ' n pobble .

text: And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper , as he sat at meat , there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard very precious ; and she brake the box , and poured it on his head .
text2: As myr v ' eh ny hoie ec bee , ayns Bethany , ayns thie Simon yn lourane , haink ben as box alabaster dy ooil eck , jeh spikenard , feer chostal ; as doshil ee yn box , as gheayrt ee eh er y chione echey .

text: And there were some that had indignation within themselves , and said , Why was this waste of the ointment made ?
text2: As va paart va mooaraghey shoh ayns nyn greeaghyn , gra , Cre ' n - fa va ' n jummal shoh jeant er yn ooil ?

text: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence , and have been given to the poor . And they murmured against her .
text2: Son oddagh eh v ' er ny ve creckit son ny smoo na three cheead ping , as shen baarit er ny boghtyn . As v ' ad jymmoosagh r ' ee .

text: And Jesus said , Let her alone ; why trouble ye her ? she hath wrought a good work on me .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey , Faag - jee veue ee , cre ' n eie t ' eu urree ? t ' ee er n ' yannoo obbyr vie orrym ' s .

text: For ye have the poor with you always , and whensoever ye will ye may do them good : but me ye have not always .
text2: Son ta ny boghtyn eu kinjagh meriu , as tra erbee dy nailliu , foddee shiu ve mie roo : agh mish cha vel eu dy kinjagh .

text: She hath done what she could : she is come aforehand to anoint my body to the burying .
text2: T ' ee er n ' yannoo gys rere e pooar ; t ' ee er jeet ro - laue dy ooillaghey my chorp cour my oanluckey .

text: Verily I say unto you , Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world , this also that she hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Cre theihll yn raad bee yn sushtal shoh er ny phreacheil , dy bee shoh t ' eesh er n ' yannoo , er ny imraa ayns cooinaghtyn jeeish .

text: And Judas Iscariot , one of the twelve , went unto the chief priests , to betray him unto them .
text2: As hie Yuaase Iscariot , fer jeh ' n daa ostyl yeig , gys ny ard - saggyrtyn , dy vrah eh huc .

text: And when they heard it , they were glad , and promised to give him money . And he sought how he might conveniently betray him .
text2: As tra cheayll ad shoh , ghow ad boggey jeh , as ghiall ad argid da . As v ' eh fieau er caa dy vrah eh .

text: And the first day of unleavened bread , when they killed the passover , his disciples said unto him , Where wilt thou that we go and prepare that thou mayest eat the passover ?
text2: As er yn chied laa jeh ' n arran caisht , tra v ' ad marroo yn Eayn - caisht , dooyrt e ostyllyn rish , Cre ' n raad sailt shin dy gholl , as dy yannoo aarloo dhyts , dy ee yn Eayn

text: And he sendeth forth two of his disciples , and saith unto them , Go ye into the city , and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water : follow him .
text2: As hug eh magh jees jeh e ostyllyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Immee - jee gys yn ard - valley , as hig nyn guail dooinney cur lesh saagh craie dy ushtey : eiyr - jee ersyn .

text: And wheresoever he shall go in , say ye to the goodman of the house , The Master saith , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: As raad erbee dy jed eh stiagh , abbyr - jee rish y fer - thie , Ta ' n Mainshter gra , Cre vel shamyr ny goaldee , raad nee ' m yn Eayn - caisht y ee marish my ostyllyn ?

text: And he will shew you a large upper room furnished and prepared : there make ready for us .
text2: As jeeaghee eh diu ard - shamyr mooar soit magh as jeant aarloo : ayns shen aarlee - jee er nyn son .

text: And his disciples went forth , and came into the city , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: As jimmee ny ostyllyn rhymboo , as tra v ' ad er jeet gys yn ard - valley , hooar ad myr v ' eh er ghra roo : as daarlee ad yn Eayn - caisht .

text: And in the evening he cometh with the twelve .
text2: As ec yn astyr haink eh marish yn daa ostyl yeig .

text: And as they sat and did eat , Jesus said , Verily I say unto you , One of you which eateth with me shall betray me .
text2: As myr v ' ad nyn soie ec bee , dooyrt Yeesey , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Dy jean fer jiuish ta gee marym mish y vrah .

text: And they began to be sorrowful , and to say unto him one by one , Is it I ? and another said , Is it I ?
text2: As ren ad toshiaght dy ve trimshagh as dy ghra rish , fer lurg fer , Nee mish eh ? as dooyrt fer elley , Nee orrym ' s t ' ou cheet ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , It is one of the twelve , that dippeth with me in the dish .
text2: As dreggyr eh , as dooyrt eh roo , She fer jeh ' n daa ostyl yeig eh , ta cur e laue marym ayns y chlaare .

text: The Son of man indeed goeth , as it is written of him : but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed ! good were it for that man if he had never been born .
text2: Ta Mac y dooinney dy jarroo goll myr te scruit jeh : agh smerg da ' n dooinney shen , liorish ta Mac y dooinney er ny vrah ; s ' mie veagh eh er ve son y dooinney shen nagh beagh eh rieau er jeet er y theihll .

text: And as they did eat , Jesus took bread , and blessed , and brake it , and gave to them , and said , Take , eat : this is my body .
text2: As myr v ' ad gee , ghow Yeesey arran , as vannee eh , as vrish eh eh , as hug eh eh daue , gra , Gow - jee , ee - jee , shoh my chorp .

text: And he took the cup , and when he had given thanks , he gave it to them : and they all drank of it .
text2: As ghow eh yn cappan , as tra v ' eh er chur booise , hug eh eh daue : as diu ad ooilley jeh

text: And he said unto them , This is my blood of the new testament , which is shed for many .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Shoh my uill ' s jeh ' n conaant noa , t ' er ny gheayrtey son ymmodee .

text: Verily I say unto you , I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine , until that day that I drink it new in the kingdom of God .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Nagh n ' iuym arragh jeh mess y villey - feeyney , derrey ' n laa iu - ym eh ass - y - noa ayns reeriaght Yee .

text: And when they had sung an hymn , they went out into the mount of Olives .
text2: As tra v ' ad er ghoaill arrane - moyllee , hie ad magh gys cronk ny Oliveyn .

text: And Jesus saith unto them , All ye shall be offended because of me this night : for it is written , I will smite the shepherd , and the sheep shall be scattered .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Failee yn credjue euish ooilley noght kyndagh rhym ' s : son t ' eh scruit , Bwoaill - yms yn bochilley , as bee ny kirree er nyn skeayley .

text: But after that I am risen , I will go before you into Galilee .
text2: Agh erreish dou v ' er n ' irree reesht , hem reue gys Galilee .

text: But Peter said unto him , Although all shall be offended , yet will not I .
text2: Agh dooyrt Peddyr rish , Ga dy vaill credjue dy chooilley unnane , foast cha vaill my chredjue ' s .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , Verily I say unto thee , That this day , even in this night , before the cock crow twice , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , Yn laa jiu , eer yn oie noght roish my gerr y kellagh daa cheayrt , dy nob uss mish three keayrtyn .

text: But he spake the more vehemently , If I should die with thee , I will not deny thee in any wise . Likewise also said they all .
text2: Agh loayr eshyn ny s ' jeeanney , Dy beign dy gholl gy - baase mayrt , cha nobbin oo er coontey erbee . As er yn aght cheddin loayr ad ooilley .

text: And they came to a place which was named Gethsemane : and he saith to his disciples , Sit ye here , while I shall pray .
text2: As haink ad gys ynnyd va enmyssit Gethsemane : as dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn , Soie - jee shiuish ayns shoh , choud as hem ' s gys padjer .

text: And he taketh with him Peter and James and John , and began to be sore amazed , and to be very heavy ;
text2: As ghow eh marish Peddyr as Jamys as Ean , as ren eh toshiaght dy ve mooar seaghnit as trome - chreeagh ,

text: And saith unto them , My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death : tarry ye here , and watch .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Ta my annym feer trimshagh eer gys y baase : fuirree - jee ayns shoh , as freill - jee arrey .

text: And he went forward a little , and fell on the ground , and prayed that , if it were possible , the hour might pass from him .
text2: As hie eh red beg er e hoshiaght , as huitt eh er y thalloo , as ghow eh padjer , my oddys eh ve yn oor shen dy gholl shaghey .

text: And he said , Abba , Father , all things are possible unto thee ; take away this cup from me : nevertheless not what I will , but what thou wilt .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Abba , Ayr , ta dy chooilley nhee ayns dty phooar , gow ersooyl yn cappan shoh voym : ny - yeih cha nee my aigney ' s , agh dty aigney ' s dy row jeant .

text: And he cometh , and findeth them sleeping , and saith unto Peter , Simon , sleepest thou ? couldest not thou watch one hour ?
text2: As haink eh as hooar eh ad nyn gadley as dooyrt eh rish Peddyr , Simon , vel uss dty chadley ? nagh voddagh oo arrey y reayll marym un oor ?

text: Watch ye and pray , lest ye enter into temptation . The spirit truly is ready , but the flesh is weak .
text2: Bee - jee er nyn arrey , as gow - jee padjer nagh duitt shiu ayns miolagh : ta ' n spyrryd eu dy jarroo arryltagh , agh ta ' n eill annoon .

text: And again he went away , and prayed , and spake the same words .
text2: As hie eh roish reesht , as ghow eh padjer , as loayr eh ny goan cheddin .

text: And when he returned , he found them asleep again , ( for their eyes were heavy , ) neither wist they what to answer him .
text2: As tra haink eh reesht , hooar eh ad nyn gadley reesht , ( son va ny sooillyn oc trome ) as cha row fys oc cre ' n ansoor dy chor da .

text: And he cometh the third time , and saith unto them , Sleep on now , and take your rest : it is enough , the hour is come ; behold , the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
text2: As haink eh yn trass cheayrt , as dooyrt eh roo , Caddil - jee nish , as gow - jee nyn vea : s ' liooar eh , ta ' n oor er jeet ; cur - my - ner ta Mac y dooinney er ny vrah gys laueyn peccee .

text: Rise up , let us go ; lo , he that betrayeth me is at hand .
text2: Trog - jee erriu , lhig dooin goll : cur - my - ner , ta eshyn er - gerrey dooin ta dy my vrah .

text: And immediately , while he yet spake , cometh Judas , one of the twelve , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders .
text2: As chelleeragh choud as v ' eh foast loayrt , haink Yuaase , fer jeh ' n daa ostyl yeig , as marish va sheshaght vooar lesh cliwenyn as luirg , veih ny ard - saggyrtyn , as ny scrudeyryn , as y chanstyr .

text: And he that betrayed him had given them a token , saying , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that same is he ; take him , and lead him away safely .
text2: As hug eshyn v ' er vrah eh cowrey daue , gra , Quoi - erbee ver - yms paag da , shen eh ; gow - jee eh , as leeid - jee e ersooyl dy sauchey .

text: And as soon as he was come , he goeth straightway to him , and saith , Master , master ; and kissed him .
text2: As cha leah as v ' eh er jeet , hie eh chelleeragh huggey , as dooyrt eh , Vainshter , vainshter ; as phaag eh eh .

text: And they laid their hands on him , and took him .
text2: As hug ad nyn laueyn er , as ghow ad eh .

text: And one of them that stood by drew a sword , and smote a servant of the high priest , and cut off his ear .
text2: As hayrn fer jeusyn va nyn shassoo marish cliwe , as woaill eh fer - mooinjerey yn ard - saggyrt , as ghiare eh e chleaysh jeh .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Are ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and with staves to take me ?
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh roo , Vel shiu er jeet magh myr noi marliagh , lesh cliwenyn as luirg dy my ghoaill ?

text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching , and ye took me not : but the scriptures must be fulfilled .
text2: Va mee meriu gagh laa ayns y chiamble , gynsaghey , as cha ghow shiu mee : agh shegin da ny scriptyryn v ' er nyn gooilleeney .

text: And they all forsook him , and fled .
text2: As ren ny ostyllyn ooilley treigeil eh as cosney roue .

text: And there followed him a certain young man , having a linen cloth cast about his naked body ; and the young men laid hold on him :
text2: As deiyr er dooinney aeg dy row , nagh row monney agh brilleen mysh e chorp ; as haare ny deiney aegey greme er .

text: And he left the linen cloth , and fled from them naked .
text2: As daag eh yn vrilleen , as chossyn eh voue rooisht .

text: And they led Jesus away to the high priest : and with him were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes .
text2: As hug ad lhieu Yeesey ersooyl gys yn ard - saggyrt : as marishyn v ' er nyn jaglym cooidjagh ooilley ny ard - saggyrtyn as y chanstyr , as ny scrudeyryn .

text: And Peter followed him afar off , even into the palace of the high priest : and he sat with the servants , and warmed himself at the fire .
text2: As deiyr Peddyr er foddey ny yei , gys eer plaase yn ard - saggyrt : as hoie eh marish yn vooinjer , as hiow eh eh - hene ec yn aile .

text: And the chief priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus to put him to death ; and found none .
text2: As va ny ard saggyrtyn as ooilley ' n choonceil shirrey feanishyn noi Yeesey dy chur eh gy - baase ; as cha dooar ad veg .

text: For many bare false witness against him , but their witness agreed not together .
text2: Son dymmyrk ymmodee feanish foalsey n ' oi , agh cha row yn eanish oc coardail ry - cheilley .

text: And there arose certain , and bare false witness against him , saying ,
text2: As dirree shiartanse , as dymmyrk ad feanish foalsey n ' oi , gra ,

text: We heard him say , I will destroy this temple that is made with hands , and within three days I will build another made without hands .
text2: Cheayll shin eh gra , Lhieg - yms y chiamble shoh ta jeant lesh laueyn , as cheu sthie jeh three laa , trog - ym chiamble elley vees jeant fegooish laueyn .

text: But neither so did their witness agree together .
text2: Agh myr shen hene cha row yn eanish oc coardail ry - cheilley .

text: And the high priest stood up in the midst , and asked Jesus , saying , Answerest thou nothing ? what is it which these witness against thee ?
text2: As hass yn ard - saggyrt seose ayns mean y cheshaght , as denee eh jeh Yeesey gra , Nagh vel oo cur ansoor erbee ? cre ta ny feanishyn shoh dy lhiassaghey dt ' oi ?

text: But he held his peace , and answered nothing . Again the high priest asked him , and said unto him , Art thou the Christ , the Son of the Blessed ?
text2: Agh v ' eh ny - host , as cha dug eh ansoor erbee , Reesht denee yn ard - saggyrt jeh , as dooyrt eh rish , Nee uss yn Creest , Mac yn Er - vannit ?

text: And Jesus said , I am : and ye shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power , and coming in the clouds of heaven .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey , She shen mee : as hee shiuish Mac y dooinney ny hoie er laue yesh y phooar , as cheet ayns bodjallyn yn aer .

text: Then the high priest rent his clothes , and saith , What need we any further witnesses ?
text2: Eisht raip yn ard - saggyrt e eaddagh , as dooyrt eh , Cre ' n feme t ' ain er feanishyn erbee sodjey ?

text: Ye have heard the blasphemy : what think ye ? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death .
text2: Ta shiu er chlashtyn ny goan - mollaghtagh . cre ta shiu smooinaghtyn ? As hug ad ooilley briwnys er , dy row eh toilchin baase .

text: And some began to spit on him , and to cover his face , and to buffet him , and to say unto him , Prophesy : and the servants did strike him with the palms of their hands .
text2: As ren paart toshiaght dy cheau shellaghyn er , as dy choodaghey yn eddin echey , as dy woalley eh , as dy ghra rish , Jean phadeyrys : as woaill ny sidooryn e lesh nyn massyn

text: And as Peter was beneath in the palace , there cometh one of the maids of the high priest :
text2: As myr va Peddyr heese ayns halley yn ard - saggyrt , haink unnane jeh ny sharvaantyn ,

text: And when she saw Peter warming himself , she looked upon him , and said , And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: As tra honnick ee Peddyr dy hiow eh - hene , yeeagh ee er , as dooyrt ee , As v ' ou uss neesht marish Yeesey dy Nazareth .

text: But he denied , saying , I know not , neither understand I what thou sayest . And he went out into the porch ; and the cock crew .
text2: Agh dob eh , gra , Cha vel fys ny toiggal aym , cre t ' ou dy ghra . As hie eh magh ayns y phorch ; as gherr y kellagh .

text: And a maid saw him again , and began to say to them that stood by , This is one of them .
text2: As honnick ben - aeg elley eh reesht , as ren ee toshiaght dy ghra rish y cheshaght , T ' eh shoh fer jeu .

text: And he denied it again . And a little after , they that stood by said again to Peter , Surely thou art one of them : for thou art a Galilaean , and thy speech agreeth thereto .
text2: As dob eh reesht . As tammylt ny lurg shen , dooyrt paart jeh ' n cheshaght reesht rish Peddyr , Son shickyrys t ' ou uss fer jeu : son she Galilean oo , as ta dty ghlare dy hoilshaghey eh .

text: But he began to curse and to swear , saying , I know not this man of whom ye speak .
text2: Agh ren eh toshiaght dy ghweeaghyn as dy loo , gra , Cha nione dou yn dooinney shoh mychione ta shiu loayrt .

text: And the second time the cock crew . And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said unto him , Before the cock crow twice , thou shalt deny me thrice . And when he thought thereon , he wept .
text2: As ren y kellagh gerrym yn nah cheayrt . As chooinee Peddyr er ny goan va Yeesey er loayrt rish , Roish my gerr y kellagh daa cheayrt , nee uss mish y obbal three keayrtyn . As tra smooinee eh er shen , ren eh keayney .

text: And straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council , and bound Jesus , and carried him away , and delivered him to Pilate .
text2: As chelleeragh ayns y voghrey hug ny ard - saggyrtyn , as y chanstyr , as ny scrudeyryn , as y slane coonceil , nyn goyrle dy cheilley , as chiangle ad Yeesey , as leeid ad eh ersooyl , as livrey ad eh gys Pilate .

text: And Pilate asked him , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answering said unto him , Thou sayest it .
text2: As denee Pilate jeh , Nee uss ree ny Hewnyn ? As dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh rish , Ta mee ny t ' ou uss dy ghra .

text: And the chief priests accused him of many things : but he answered nothing .
text2: As ren ny ard - saggyrtyn ymmodee reddyn y lhiassaghey n ' oi , agh cha dreggyr eh gys nhee erbee .

text: And Pilate asked him again , saying , Answerest thou nothing ? behold how many things they witness against thee .
text2: As denee Pilate jeh reesht , gra , Nagh vel oo cur ansoor erbee ? cur - my - ner cre whilleen red as t ' ad shoh dy lhiassaghey dt ' oi .

text: But Jesus yet answered nothing ; so that Pilate marvelled .
text2: As cha dug Yeesey ansoor erbee da myr shen dy ghow Pilate yindys .

text: Now at that feast he released unto them one prisoner , whomsoever they desired .
text2: Nish ec y feailley shen ve ( yn cliaghtey dy ) eaysley daue un phryssoonagh ec yeearree yn phobble .

text: And there was one named Barabbas , which lay bound with them that had made insurrection with him , who had committed murder in the insurrection .
text2: As va fer va enmyssit Barabbas , va ny phryssoonagh maroosyn v ' er n ' irree magh marish , as v ' er n ' yannoo dunverys ayns nyn irree - magh .

text: And the multitude crying aloud began to desire him to do as he had ever done unto them .
text2: As dyllee yn pobble dy ard , as ren ad toshiaght dy ghuee er , Eh dy yannoo er nyn son , myr v ' eh rieau cliaghtey .

text: But Pilate answered them , saying , Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews ?
text2: Agh dreggyr Pilate ad , gra , Nailliu mee dy eaysley diu ree ny Hewnyn ?

text: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy .
text2: ( Son va fys echey dy nee trooid goanlys va ny ard - saggyrtyn er chur stiagh eh . )

text: But the chief priests moved the people , that he should rather release Barabbas unto them .
text2: Agh ghreinnee ny ard - saggyrtyn y pobble , ad dy yeearree er my reih , eh dy eaysley daue Barabbas .

text: And Pilate answered and said again unto them , What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews ?
text2: As dreggyr Pilate , as dooyrt eh reesht roo , Cre bailliu mee eisht dy yannoo rishyn ta shiu dy enmys ree ny Hewnyn ?

text: And they cried out again , Crucify him .
text2: As dyllee ad dy ard reesht , Jean y chrossey eh .

text: Then Pilate said unto them , Why , what evil hath he done ? And they cried out the more exceedingly , Crucify him .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Pilate roo , Cre ' n oyr , cre ' n olk t ' eh er n ' yannoo ? as dyllee ad wheesh shen s ' elgyssee , Jean y chrossey eh .

text: And so Pilate , willing to content the people , released Barabbas unto them , and delivered Jesus , when he had scourged him , to be crucified .
text2: As er shoh va Pilate booiagh nyn aigney y choyrt da ' n pobble , as deayshil eh Barabbas daue , agh livrey eh Yeesey , erreish da ve scuitchit , dy ve er ny chrossey .

text: And the soldiers led him away into the hall , called Praetorium ; and they call together the whole band .
text2: As hug ny sidooryn lhieu ersooyl eh gys yn halley va enmyssit Pretorium ; as deie ad er y slane sheshaght dy cheilley .

text: And they clothed him with purple , and platted a crown of thorns , and put it about his head ,
text2: As hug ad er coamrey gorrym - jiarg , as fee ad attey dy ghrineyn , as hug ad eh mysh y chione echey .

text: And began to salute him , Hail , King of the Jews !
text2: As ren ad toshiaght dy oltaghey da , Dy vannee dhyt , Ree ny Hewnyn .

text: And they smote him on the head with a reed , and did spit upon him , and bowing their knees worshipped him .
text2: As woaill ad eh er y chione lesh cuirtliagh , as cheau ad shellaghyn er , as chroym ad nyn ghlioonyn kiongoyrt rish , as hug ad ooashley da .

text: And when they had mocked him , they took off the purple from him , and put his own clothes on him , and led him out to crucify him .
text2: As tra v ' ad ( myr shoh ) er chraidey mysh , ghow ad yn coamrey purple jeh , as hug ad e eaddagh hene er , as chur ad lhieu magh eh dy chrossey eh .

text: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian , who passed by , coming out of the country , the father of Alexander and Rufus , to bear his cross .
text2: As d ' eginee ad fer va enmyssit Simon Cyrenian va goll shaghey , cheet ass y cheer , ayr Alexander as Rufus , dy ymmyrkey e chrosh .

text: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha , which is , being interpreted , The place of a skull .
text2: As hug ad lhieu eh gys yn ynnyd Golgotha , ta shen dy ghra ' sy ghlare ainyn , ynnyd bollag .

text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh : but he received it not .
text2: As hug ad da dy iu , feeyn as myrrh ny chione : agh cha ghow eh eh .

text: And when they had crucified him , they parted his garments , casting lots upon them , what every man should take .
text2: As tra v ' ad er chrossey eh , reynn ad e gharmadyn , tilgey lottyn orroo , son ayrn dagh dooinney .

text: And it was the third hour , and they crucified him .
text2: As ve yn trass oor tra ren ad y chrossey eh .

text: And the superscription of his accusation was written over , THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: As er - e - skyn va scruit oyr e vaaish , REE NY HEWNYN .

text: And with him they crucify two thieves ; the one on his right hand , and the other on his left .
text2: As marish ren ad daa vaarliagh y chrossey ; fer er e laue - yesh , as fer elley er e laue - chlare .

text: And the scripture was fulfilled , which saith , And he was numbered with the transgressors .
text2: As shoh myr va ' n scriptyr cooilleenit , ta dy ghra , As v ' eh er ny earroo marish ny drogh - yantee .

text: And they that passed by railed on him , wagging their heads , and saying , Ah , thou that destroyest the temple , and buildest it in three days ,
text2: As loayr yn vooinjer va goll shaghey dy lunagh n ' oi , craa nyn ghing , as gra , Ah , uss ta lhieggal y chiamble , as dy hroggal eh reesht ayns three laa ,

text: Save thyself , and come down from the cross .
text2: Saue oo hene , as tar neose jeh ' n chrosh .

text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes , He saved others ; himself he cannot save .
text2: Er yn aght cheddin neesht ren ny ard - saggyrtyn craidey mysh , gra ny mast ' oc hene marish ny scrudeyryn , Haue eh feallagh elley , agh eh - hene cha vod eh sauail .

text: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross , that we may see and believe . And they that were crucified with him reviled him .
text2: Lhig da Creest Ree Israel cheet neose nish jeh ' n chrosh , dy vod mayd fakin as credjal . As ren adsyn v ' er nyn grossey marish , eh y oltooan ,

text: And when the sixth hour was come , there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour .
text2: As tra va ' n cheyoo oor er jeet , va dorraghys harrish ooilley yn cheer , gys yn nuyoo oor .

text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice , saying , Eloi , Eloi , lama sabachthani ? which is , being interpreted , My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me ?
text2: As ec yn nuyoo oor deie Yeesey lesh ard - choraa , gra , ELOI , ELOI , LAMASABACH THANI ? ta shen dy ghra ' sy ghlare ainyn , My Yee , My Yee , cre ' n - fa t ' ou er my hreigeil

text: And some of them that stood by , when they heard it , said , Behold , he calleth Elias .
text2: As dooyrt paart jeusyn va nyn shassoo ayns shen , tra cheayll ad shoh , Cur - my - ner t ' eh geamagh er Elias .

text: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar , and put it on a reed , and gave him to drink , saying , Let alone ; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down .
text2: As roie fer , as lhieen eh spunge lesh vinegar , as hug eh eh er cuirtliagh , as heeyn eh huggey dy iu , gra , Faag - jee eh ; hee mayd jig Elias dy ghoaill neose eh .

text: And Jesus cried with a loud voice , and gave up the ghost .
text2: As deie Yeesey lesh ard - choraa , as ren eh paartail .

text: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom .
text2: As va ' n coodaghey va eddyr y chiamble as yn ynnyd casherick raipit veih - my - cheilley , veih ' n vullagh gys y laare .

text: And when the centurion , which stood over against him , saw that he so cried out , and gave up the ghost , he said , Truly this man was the Son of God .
text2: As tra honnick yn captan - keead va ny hassoo kiongoyrt rish , dy row eh myr shen er n ' eamagh , as er phaartail , dooyrt eh , Dy firrinagh she Mac Yee va ' n dooinney shoh .

text: There were also women looking on afar off : among whom was Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses , and Salome ;
text2: Va myrgeddin ymmodee mraane cur - my - ner veih foddey : nyn mast ' oc va Moirrey Malaine , as Moirrey moir Yamys by - loo as Joses as Salome ;

text: ( Who also , when he was in Galilee , followed him , and ministered unto him ; ) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem .
text2: Va myrgeddin er n ' eiyrt er , as v ' ad shirveishagh da choud ' s v ' eh ayns Galilee as maroosyn ymmodee mraane elley v ' er jeet seose marish gys Jerusalem .

text: And now when the even was come , because it was the preparation , that is , the day before the sabbath ,
text2: As nish tra va ' n fastyr er jeet ( er - yn oyr dy nee traa yn aarlaghey ve , ta shen , yn laa roish yn doonaght . )

text: Joseph of Arimathaea , and honourable counseller , which also waited for the kingdom of God , came , and went in boldly unto Pilate , and craved the body of Jesus .
text2: Haink Joseph dy Arimathea , fer coyrlee ooasle , va myrgeddin eh - hene farkiaght son reeriaght Yee , as cha ghow eh aggle , agh hie eh stiagh dy dunnal gys Pilate , as ren eh aghin son corp Yeesey .

text: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead : and calling unto him the centurion , he asked him whether he had been any while dead .
text2: As ghow Pilate yindys my v ' eh hannah marroo : as deie eh er y centurion huggey , as denee eh jeh , row eh er ve foddey marroo ?

text: And when he knew it of the centurion , he gave the body to Joseph .
text2: As tra hooar eh fys er veih ' n centurion , hug eh yn corp da Joseph .

text: And he bought fine linen , and took him down , and wrapped him in the linen , and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock , and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre .
text2: As chionnee eh aanrit - keyl as ghow eh neose eh , as hoill eh eh ayns yn aanrit , ass doanluck eh eh ayns oaie va cleight ayns creg , as rowll eh clagh er beeal yn oaie .

text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid .
text2: As honnick Moirrey Malaine , as Moirrey moir Voses , cre raad v ' eh er ny oanluckey .

text: And when the sabbath was past , Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James , and Salome , had bought sweet spices , that they might come and anoint him .
text2: As tra va ' n doonaght ec kione , va Moirrey Malaine , as Moirrey moir Yamys as Salome , er chionnaghey spisyn millish , dy voddagh ad cheet dy ooillaghey eh .

text: And very early in the morning the first day of the week , they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun .
text2: As feer voghey ayns y vadran , er y chied laa jeh ' n chaghtin , haink ad gys yn oaie ec irree ny greiney .

text: And they said among themselves , Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre ?
text2: As dooyrt ad nyn mast ' oc hene . Quoi rowlys ersooyl yn chlagh jeh beeal yn oaie ?

text: And when they looked , they saw that the stone was rolled away : for it was very great .
text2: ( As tra v ' ad er yeeaghyn , honnick ad y chlagh rowlit ersooyl ) son v ' ee feer vooar .

text: And entering into the sepulchre , they saw a young man sitting on the right side , clothed in a long white garment ; and they were affrighted .
text2: As hie ad stiagh ayns yn oaie , as honnick ad dooinney aeg ny hoie er y cheu yesh , coamrit ayns coamrey liauyr gial : as v ' ad agglagh .

text: And he saith unto them , Be not affrighted : Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth , which was crucified : he is risen ; he is not here : behold the place where they laid him .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Ny bee aggle erriu : ta shiu shirrey Yeesey dy Nazareth , v ' er ny chrossey : t ' eh er n ' irree ; cha vel eh ayns shoh : cur - jee my - ner shoh ' n boayl v ' eh oanluckit ayn .

text: But go your way , tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee : there shall ye see him , as he said unto you .
text2: Agh immee - jee reue , insh - jee da e ostyllyn as da Peddyr , dy vel eh goll reue gys Galilee : shen - y - raad hee shiu eh , myr dooyrt eh riu .

text: And they went out quickly , and fled from the sepulchre ; for they trembled and were amazed : neither said they any thing to any man ; for they were afraid .
text2: As hie ad magh ayns siyr , as roie ad roue veih ' n oaie , son v ' ad er - creau as atchimagh : chamoo loayr ad veg rish dooinney erbee ; son v ' ad agglit .

text: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week , he appeared first to Mary Magdalene , out of whom he had cast seven devils .
text2: Nish tra va Yeesey er n ' irree er moghrey yn chied laa jeh ' n chiaghtin , hoilshee eh eh hene hoshiaght da Moirrey Malaine , ass - jee v ' eh er hilgey shiaght drogh - spyrrydyn .

text: And she went and told them that had been with him , as they mourned and wept .
text2: As hie ish as dinsh ee yn naight dauesyn b ' oallagh ve sheer marish , myr v ' ad dobberan as keayney .

text: And they , when they had heard that he was alive , and had been seen of her , believed not .
text2: As tra cheayll ad dy row eh bio , as dy row ish er vakin eh , foast cha ren ad credjal .

text: After that he appeared in another form unto two of them , as they walked , and went into the country .
text2: Ny lurg shen hoilshee eh eh - hene ayns cummey elley da jees jeu , myr v ' ad shooyl er y raad , as goll er y cheer .

text: And they went and told it unto the residue : neither believed they them .
text2: As hie ad as dinsh ad eh da ' n chooid elley jeh ' n cheshaght : chamoo chred ad ad shoh .

text: Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat , and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart , because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen .
text2: Ny lurg shen hoilshee eh eh - hene da ' n un ostyl yeig , myr v ' ad nyn soie ec bee , as hooar eh foill daue son y vee - chredjue as y chreoghys cree oc , er - yn - oyr nagh ren ad credjal adsyn v ' er vakin eh , erreish da v ' er n ' irree .

text: And he said unto them , Go ye into all the world , and preach the gospel to every creature .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Immee - jee magh trooid ooilley yn seihll , as jean - jee yn sushtal y phreacheil da dy chooilley chretoor .

text: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved ; but he that believeth not shall be damned .
text2: Bee eshyn ta credjal as ta bashtit , er ny hauail ; agh bee eshyn nagh jean credjal er ny gheyrey .

text: And these signs shall follow them that believe ; In my name shall they cast out devils ; they shall speak with new tongues ;
text2: As eiyree ny cowraghyn shoh orroosyn ta credjal ; Ayns my ennym ' s nee ad drogh spyrrydyn y chastey , loayree ad lesh chengaghyn noa ,

text: They shall take up serpents ; and if they drink any deadly thing , it shall not hurt them ; they shall lay hands on the sick , and they shall recover .
text2: Nee ad loaghtey ard - nieughyn , as my iu - ys ad nhee erbee pushoonagh , cha jean eh skielley daue ; ver ad nyn laueyn er sleih chingey , as nee ad coural .

text: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them , he was received up into heaven , and sat on the right hand of God .
text2: Myr shen erreish da ' n Chiarn v ' er loayrt roo , v ' eh er ny ghoaill seose gys niau , as hoie eh er laue yesh Yee .

text: And they went forth , and preached everywhere , the Lord working with them , and confirming the word with signs following . Amen .
text2: As hie ad magh , as ren ad preacheil dy chooilley raad , yn Chiarn gobbraghey maroo ; as jannoo yn goo breeoil liorish ny mirrillyn va goll lesh . Amen . / HTML

text: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us ,
text2: Son wheesh as dy vel ymmodee er ghoaill ayns laue dy chur coontey cairagh jeh ny reddyn ta dy firrinagh er nyn gredjal nyn mast ' ain .

text: Even as they delivered them unto us , which from the beginning were eyewitnesses , and ministers of the word ;
text2: Eer myr hoilshee ad dooinyn ad , va er - dyn toshiaght nyn veanishyn sooilley as nyn shirveishee jeh ' n ghoo .

text: It seemed good to me also , having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first , to write unto thee in order , most excellent Theophilus ,
text2: Ta mish myrgeddin er vakin eh mie , myr ta slane toiggal aym jeh dy chooilley nhee er - dyn eer toshiaght , dy scrieu hoods ayns order , Theophilus smoo ooasle ,

text: That thou mightest know the certainty of those things , wherein thou hast been instructed .
text2: Dy vod tushtey share y ve ayd jeh firrinys ny reddyn shen , t ' ou er ny ve ynsit ayndoo .

text: There was in the days of Herod , the king of Judaea , a certain priest named Zacharias , of the course of Abia : and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron , and her name was Elisabeth .
text2: Rish lhing Heron ree Yudea , va saggyrt dy row enmyssit Zacharias , jeh coorse Abia ; as va ' n ven echey jeh inneenyn Aaron , as yn ennym eck Elizabeth .

text: And they were both righteous before God , walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless .
text2: As v ' ad ny - neesht cairagh kiongoyrt rish Jee , gimmeeaght ayns ooilley annaghyn as oardaghyn y Chiarn gyn loght .

text: And they had no child , because that Elisabeth was barren , and they both were now well stricken in years .
text2: As cha row sluight oc , er - yn - oyr dy row Elizabeth gennish , as v ' ad ny - neesht er roie dy mie ayns eash .

text: And it came to pass , that while he executed the priest ' s office before God in the order of his course ,
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , choud as v ' eh cooilleeney oik y taggyrt kiongoyrt rish Jee , myr va e choorse er jeet magh ,

text: According to the custom of the priest ' s office , his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord .
text2: Cordail rish cliaghtey oik y taggyrt , dy haghyr eh dy ve yn currym echey dy lostey oural - millish , tra v ' eh goll stiagh ayns chiamble y Chiarn .

text: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense .
text2: As va ' n slane chaglym jeh ' n pobble cheu - mooie ec padjer rish traa yn oural - millish .

text: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense .
text2: As haink ainle y Chiarn , as hass eh er cheu yesh altar yn oural - millish .

text: And when Zacharias saw him , he was troubled , and fear fell upon him .
text2: As tra honnick Zacharias eh , v ' eh seaghnit , as huitt aggle er .

text: But the angel said unto him , Fear not , Zacharias : for thy prayer is heard ; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son , and thou shalt call his name John .
text2: Agh dooyrt yn ainle rish , Ny gow aggle Zacharias : son ta dty phadjer er ny chlashtyn , as nee yn ven ayd Elizabeth mac y ymmyrkey dhyt , as nee oo genmys eh Ean .

text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness ; and many shall rejoice at his birth .
text2: As bee boggey as gerjagh ayd , as nee ymmodee boggey y ghoaill tra hig eh er y theihll .

text: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord , and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink ; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost , even from his mother ' s womb .
text2: Son bee eh ooasle ayns shilley yn Chiarn , as cha n ' iu eh feeyn ny jough lajer , as bee eh er ny lhieeney lesh y Spyrryd Noo , veih eer brein e vayrey .

text: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God .
text2: As ymmodee jeh cloan Israel nee eh y hyndaa gys y Chiarn y Jee oc .

text: And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias , to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children , and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just ; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord .
text2: As hed eh roishyn ayns spyrryd as pooar Elias , dy hyndaa creeaghyn ny ayragh yn gys y chloan , as ny mee - viallee gys creenaght yn vooinjer chairal , dy yannoo aarloo pobble kiarit son y Chiarn .

text: And Zacharias said unto the angel , Whereby shall I know this ? for I am an old man , and my wife well stricken in years .
text2: As dooyrt Zacharias rish yn ainle , Cre liorish vees fys aym ' s er shoh son ta mee shenn , as ta ' n ven er roie dy mie ayns eash .

text: And the angel answering said unto him , I am Gabriel , that stand in the presence of God ; and am sent to speak unto thee , and to shew thee these glad tidings .
text2: As dreggyr yn aile as dooyrt e rish , Mish Gabriel ta shirveish fenish Yee : as ta mee - er my choyrt dy loayrt rhyt , as dy hoilshaghey dhyt ny naightyn mie shoh .

text: And , behold , thou shalt be dumb , and not able to speak , until the day that these things shall be performed , because thou believest not my words , which shall be fulfilled in their season .
text2: As cur - my - ner bee oo balloo , as cha jig dty ghlare lhiat , derrey yn laa vees ny reddyn shoh cooilleenit , er - y - fa nagh vel oo er chredjal my ghoan ' s vees er nyn gooilleeney ayns nyn imbagh cooie .

text: And the people waited for Zacharias , and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple .
text2: As va ' n pobble fieau son Zacharias , as yindys orroo dy row eh cumrail choud ayns y chiamble .

text: And when he came out , he could not speak unto them : and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple : for he beckoned unto them , and remained speechless .
text2: As tra haink eh magh , cha voddagh eh loayrt roo ; as hoig ad dy row eh er vakin ashlish ayns y chiamble : son v ' eh jannoo signyn daue , as hannee eh balloo .

text: And it came to pass , that , as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished , he departed to his own house .
text2: As shen myr ve , tra v ' eh er chooilleeney laghyn e hirveish , dy jimmee eh gys e hie hene .

text: And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived , and hid herself five months , saying ,
text2: As lurg ny laghyn shen ren e ven Elizabeth giennaghtyn , as dollee ee ee - hene queig meeghyn , gra ,

text: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on me , to take away my reproach among men .
text2: Shoh myr ta ' n Chiarn er n ' yannoo er my hon tra yeeagh eh orrym , dy ghoaill ersooyl my oltooan mastey deiney .

text: And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee , named Nazareth ,
text2: As ayns y cheyoo vee , va ' n ainle Gabriel er ny choyrt veih Jee , gys ard - valley dy Ghalilee , va enmyssit Nazareth ,

text: To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph , of the house of David ; and the virgin ' s name was Mary .
text2: Gys moidyn nasht rish dooinney enmyssit Joseph , jeh thie Ghavid ; as va ennym y voidyn Moirrey .

text: And the angel came in unto her , and said , Hail , thou that art highly favoured , the Lord is with thee : blessed art thou among women .
text2: As haink yn ainle stiagh as dooyrt eh r ' ee , Dy vannee dhyt ' s ta ayns ard - foayr ta ' n Chiarn mayrt ; bannit t ' ou uss mastey mraane .

text: And when she saw him , she was troubled at his saying , and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be .
text2: As tra honnick ee eh , v ' ee seaghnit ec y raa echey , as smooinee ee r ' ee hene cre ' n monney dy vannaghey va shoh .

text: And the angel said unto her , Fear not , Mary : for thou hast found favour with God .
text2: As dooyrt yn ainle r ' ee , Ny bee aggle ort , O Voirrey ; son t ' ou er gheddyn foayr veih Jee .

text: And , behold , thou shalt conceive in thy womb , and bring forth a son , and shalt call his name JESUS .
text2: As cur - my - ner , nee oo giennaghtyn , as mac y ymmyrkey , as enmyssee oo yn ennym echey Yeesey .

text: He shall be great , and shall be called the Son of the Highest : and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David :
text2: Bee eshyn cronnal , as enmyssit Mac yn Er - syrjey ; as ver y Chiarn Jee dasyn stoyl - reeoil e ayr David .

text: And he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever ; and of his kingdom there shall be no end .
text2: As nee eh reill harrish thie Yacob gys earishyn foddey beayn , as er e reeriaght cha bee jerrey erbee .

text: Then said Mary unto the angel , How shall this be , seeing I know not a man ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt Moirrey rish yn ainle , Kys oddys shoh y ve , fakin nagh nione dou dooinney ?

text: And the angel answered and said unto her , The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee , and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee : therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God .
text2: As dreggyr yn ainle as dooyrt eh r ' ee , Hig yn Spyrryd Noo neose ort , as bee pooar yn Er - syrjey er ny skeayley harryd : shen - y - fa bee yn sluight chasherick shen ver oo son y theihll , enmyssit Mac Yee .

text: And , behold , thy cousin Elisabeth , she hath also conceived a son in her old age : and this is the sixth month with her , who was called barren .
text2: As cur - my - ner , dty ven - vooinjerey Elizabeth , t ' eeish myrgeddin er ghiennaght yn mac ayns ny shenn laghyn eck : as shoh yn cheyoo vee jeeish va raait dy ve gennish .

text: For with God nothing shall be impossible .
text2: Son da Jee cha bee nhee erbee neu - phossible .

text: And Mary said , Behold the handmaid of the Lord ; be it unto me according to thy word . And the angel departed from her .
text2: As dooyrt Moirrey , Cur - my - ner sharvaant y Chiarn , dy jig eh lhiam cordail rish dty ghoo . As jimmee yn ainle voee .

text: And Mary arose in those days , and went into the hill country with haste , into a city of Juda ;
text2: As mysh ny laghyn shen hrog Moirrey urree lesh siyr dy gholl gys cheer ny liargagh , gys ard - valley dy Yudah ,

text: And entered into the house of Zacharias , and saluted Elisabeth .
text2: As hie ee stiagh ayns thie Zacharias as vannee ee da Elizabeth .

text: And it came to pass , that , when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary , the babe leaped in her womb ; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost :
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , tra cheayll Elizabeth bannaghey Moirrey , dy lheim yn oikan ayns e brein , as va Elizabeth lhieent lesh y Spyrryd Noo .

text: And she spake out with a loud voice , and said , Blessed art thou among women , and blessed is the fruit of thy womb .
text2: As loayr ee lesh ard - choraa as dooyrt ee , Bannit t ' ou uss mastey mraane , as bannit ta sluight dty vreiuml ; n .

text: And whence is this to me , that the mother of my Lord should come to me ?
text2: As kys ta ' n ( ooashley ) aym , dy vel moir my Hiarn er jeet dy my yeeaghyn ?

text: For , lo , as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears , the babe leaped in my womb for joy .
text2: Son cur - my - ner , cha leah as ren coraa dty vannaghey bingys ayns my chleayshyn , lheim yn oikan ayns my vrein son boggey .

text: And blessed is she that believed : for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord .
text2: As bannit t ' eeish ta er chredjal : son bee slane cooilleeney ny reddyn shen v ' er ny hoilshaghey jee liorish y Chiarn .

text: And Mary said , My soul doth magnify the Lord ,
text2: As dooyrt Moirrey , Ta m ' annym cur ard - voylley da ' n Chiarn .

text: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour .
text2: As ta my spyrryd er ghoaill boggey ayns Jee my Haualtagh .

text: For he hath regarded the low estate of his handmaiden : for , behold , from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed .
text2: Son t ' eh er chur tastey da stayd injil e harvaant : son cur - my - ner , maghey shoh nee dy chooilley heeloghe mish y enmys bannit .

text: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things ; and holy is his name .
text2: Son s ' mooar ta ' n Ooilley - niartal er n ' yannoo er my hon , as s ' casherick ta e ennym .

text: And his mercy is on them that fear him from generation to generation .
text2: As ta e vyghin orroosyn ta goaill aggle roish , veih sheeloghe gys sheeloghe .

text: He hath shewed strength with his arm ; he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts .
text2: T ' eh er hoilshaghey niart lesh e roih t ' eh er skeayley ny moyrnee ayns mooaralys nyn greeaghyn .

text: He hath put down the mighty from their seats , and exalted them of low degree .
text2: T ' eh er lhieggal sheese ny treanee veih nyn stuill - reeoil , as er hoiaghey seose ny imlee .

text: He hath filled the hungry with good things ; and the rich he hath sent empty away .
text2: T ' eh er lhieeney ny accryssee lesh reddyn mie , as ny berchee t ' eh er chur follym ersooyl .

text: He hath holpen his servant Israel , in remembrance of his mercy ;
text2: T ' eh er chooney lesh e harvaant Israel ayns cooinaghtyn jeh e vyghin .

text: As he spake to our fathers , to Abraham , and to his seed for ever .
text2: ( Myr loayr eh rish nyn shenn - ayryn , rish Abraham as e luight ) er son dy bragh .

text: And Mary abode with her about three months , and returned to her own house .
text2: As duirree Moirrey macirc ; ree mysh three meeghyn , as haink ee reesht gys e thie hene .

text: Now Elisabeth ' s full time came that she should be delivered ; and she brought forth a son .
text2: Nish va slane traa Elizabeth er jeet dy ve livreit , as hug ee mac son y theihll .

text: And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her ; and they rejoiced with her .
text2: As cheayll ny naboonyn as y sleih mooinjerey eck , kys va ' n Chiarn er hoilshaghey ard - vyghin jee ; as ghow ad boggey macirc ; ree .

text: And it came to pass , that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child ; and they called him Zacharias , after the name of his father .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione er yn hoghtoo laa dy daink ad dy ghiarey - chymmylt yn lhiannoo ; as denmys ad eh Zacharias , lurg ennym e ayrey .

text: And his mother answered and said , Not so ; but he shall be called John .
text2: As dreggyr e voir , as dooyrt ee , Cha nee ; agh bee eh enmyssit Ean .

text: And they said unto her , There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name .
text2: As dooyrt ad r ' ee , Cha vel veg jeh dty chynney jeh ' n ennym shen .

text: And they made signs to his father , how he would have him called .
text2: As ren ad signyn gys e ayr , cre ' n ennym bailIishyn y ve er .

text: And he asked for a writing table , and wrote , saying , His name is John . And they marvelled all .
text2: As hir eh boayrd - screeuee , as scrieu eh , gra , Ta ' n ennym echey Ean . As ghow ad ooilley yindys .

text: And his mouth was opened immediately , and his tongue loosed , and he spake , and praised God .
text2: As er - y - chooyl va e veeal er ny osley , as e hengey er ny eaysley , as loayr eh , as hug eh moylley da Jee .

text: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them : and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea .
text2: As huitt aggle ( arrymagh ) er ooilley nyn naboonyn : as hie goo jeh ooilley ny reddyn shoh magh trooid ooilley cheer sleitagh Yudea .

text: And all they that heard them laid them up in their hearts , saying , What manner of child shall this be ! And the hand of the Lord was with him .
text2: As adsyn ooilley cheayll shoh , hasht ad ayns nyn greeaghyn ad , gra , Cren monney dy ghooinney vees eh shoh ? as va laue yn Chiarn macirc ; rish .

text: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost , and prophesied , saying ,
text2: As va ' n ayr echey Zacharias lhieent lesh y Spyrryd Noo , as ren eh phadeyrys , gra ,

text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel ; for he hath visited and redeemed his people ,
text2: Bannit dy row yn Chiarn Jee Israel , son t ' eh er yeeaghyn er , as er livrey e phobble ,

text: And hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David ;
text2: As t ' eh er hroggal seose saualtys niartal er nyn son , ayns thie e harvaant David ;

text: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets , which have been since the world began :
text2: Myr loayr eh liorish beeal e adeyryn crauee , t ' er ny ve er - dy hoshiaght y theihll ;

text: That we should be saved from our enemies , and from the hand of all that hate us ;
text2: Dy hauail shin veih nyn noidyn , as veih ' n lane ocsyn ooilley ta dwoaie oc orrin .
