text: To perform the mercy promised to our fathers , and to remember his holy covenant ;
text2: Dy chooilleeney yn vyghin va giallit da ny ayraghyn ain , as dy chooinaghtyn er e chonaant casherick :

text: The oath which he sware to our father Abraham ,
text2: Eer yn breearrey ren eh gys yn ayr ain Abraham ,

text: That he would grant unto us , that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear ,
text2: Dy giallagh eh dooinyn , dy beagh shin er nyn livrey veih laueyn nyn noidyn , as shirveish eh fegooish aggle .

text: In holiness and righteousness before him , all the days of our life .
text2: Ayns craueeaght as cairys kiongoyrt rish , ooilley laghyn nyn mea .

text: And thou , child , shalt be called the prophet of the Highest : for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways ;
text2: As bee uss lhiannoo enmyssit phadeyr yn Er - syrjey ; son hed oo roish eddin y Chiarn , dy yannoo aarloo e raaidyn ;

text: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins ,
text2: Dy chur tushtey dy haualtys da e phobble , liorish leih nyn beccaghyn ,

text: Through the tender mercy of our God ; whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us ,
text2: Trooid myghin meiygh yn Jee ain ; liorish ta irree - ny - greiney veih yn yrjid er hoilshean orrin

text: To give light to them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death , to guide our feet into the way of peace .
text2: Dy chur soilshey dauesyn ta nyn soie ayns dorraghys as ayns scadoo yn vaaish , dy leeideil ny cassyn ain ayns raad y chee .

text: And the child grew , and waxed strong in spirit , and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel .
text2: As daase y lhiannoo , as v ' eh er ny niartaghey ' sy spyrryd , as v ' eh ayns ny faasaghyn , derrey ' n laa v ' eh er ny hoilshaghey da Israel .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus , that all the world should be taxed .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione ayns ny laghyn shen , dy jagh sarey magh veih Cesar Augustus , dy beagh coontey er ny ghoaill jeh ' n slane rheam .

text: ( And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria . )
text2: ( As va ' n recortys shoh jeant magh roish my va Cyremus ny chiannoort er Syria . )

text: And all went to be taxed , every one into his own city .
text2: As hie ad ooilley dy chur stiagh nyn enmyn , dagh unnane gys e ard - valley hene .

text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee , out of the city of Nazareth , into Judaea , unto the city of David , which is called Bethlehem ; ( because he was of the house and lineage of David : )
text2: As hie Joseph myrgeddin seose veih Galilee , veih ard - valley Nazareth , gys Judea , gys ard - valley Ghavid , ta enmyssit Bethlehem ( son dy row eh jeh thie as kynney Ghavid . )

text: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife , being great with child .
text2: Dy chur stiagh e ennym hene as ennym Moirrey yn ven va nasht rish , va trome torragh .

text: And so it was , that , while they were there , the days were accomplished that she should be delivered .
text2: As shen myr ve , choud as v ' ad ayns shen , dy row yn traa er jeet jeeish dy ve livreit .

text: And she brought forth her firstborn son , and wrapped him in swaddling clothes , and laid him in a manger ; because there was no room for them in the inn .
text2: As hug ee son y theihll yn chied mac rug jee , as hoill ee eh ayns aanrityn soiuml ; llee , as hug ee eh ny lhie ayns manjoor , er - y - fa nagh row room er nyn son ayns y thie - oast .

text: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field , keeping watch over their flock by night .
text2: Nish v ' ayns y cheer cheddin bochilley mooie er y vagher freayll arrey er nyn shioltaneyn ' syn oie .

text: And , lo , the angel of the Lord came upon them , and the glory of the Lord shone round about them : and they were sore afraid .
text2: As cur - my - ner haink ainle y Chiarn neose orroo , as ren gloyr y Chiarn soilshean mygeayrt - y - moo ; as v ' ad fo aggle feer atchimagh .

text: And the angel said unto them , Fear not : for , behold , I bring you good tidings of great joy , which shall be to all people .
text2: As dooyrt yn ainle roo , Ny bee aggle erriu : son cur - my - ner , ta mish coyrt lhiam hiu naightyn mie dy voggey mooar vees gys dy chooilley phobble .

text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour , which is Christ the Lord .
text2: Son diuish t ' er ny ruggey jiu ayns ard valley Ghavid , Saualtagh , ta shen Creest yn Chiarn .

text: And this shall be a sign unto you ; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes , lying in a manger .
text2: As bee shoh son cowrey diu ; Yiow shiu yn oikan ayns aanrityn soillee , as ny lhie ayns manjoor .

text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God , and saying ,
text2: As ayns y tullogh va marish yn ainle ymmodee jeh ' n cheshaght flaunyssagh cur moylley da Jee , as gra ,

text: Glory to God in the highest , and on earth peace , good will toward men .
text2: Gloyr dy row gys Jee ayns yn yrjid , as er y thalloo shee , aigney - mie gys deiney .

text: And it came to pass , as the angels were gone away from them into heaven , the shepherds said one to another , Let us now go even unto Bethlehem , and see this thing which is come to pass , which the Lord hath made known unto us .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , cha leah as va ny ainleyn er n ' gholl ersooyl voue gys niau , dy dooyrt ny bochillyn yn derrey yeh rish y jeh elley , Lhig dooin goll nish derrey Bethlehem , dy akin yn red shoh t ' er jeet gy - kione , ta ' n Chiarn er hoilshaghey dooin .

text: And they came with haste , and found Mary , and Joseph , and the babe lying in a manger .
text2: As haink ad lesh siyr , as hooar ad Moirrey as Joseph , as yn oikan ny lhie ayns manjoor .

text: And when they had seen it , they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child .
text2: As tra honnick ad eh , hoilshee ad magh yn raa va er ny insh daue mychione y lhiannoo shoh .

text: And all they that heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds .
text2: As ghow dy chooilley unnane cheayll eh , yindys jeh ny reddyn va inshit daue liorish ny bochillyn .

text: But Mary kept all these things , and pondered them in her heart .
text2: Agh hasht Moirrey ooilley ny raaghyn shoh ( ayns e haigney ) as smooinee ee orroo dy dowin ayns e cree .

text: And the shepherds returned , glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen , as it was told unto them .
text2: As haink ny bochillyn roue , cur gloyr as moylley da Jee son dy chooilley nhee v ' ad er chlashtyn as er vakin , myr ve inshit daue .

text: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child , his name was called JESUS , which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb .
text2: As tra va hoght laa ec kione son giarey - chymmylt y lhiannoo , v ' eh enmyssit YEESEY , son shen yn ennym hug yn ainle er , roish my row eh er ny ghiennaghtyn ' sy vrein .

text: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished , they brought him to Jerusalem , to present him to the Lord ;
text2: As tra va laghyn nyn ghlenney , cordail rish leigh Voses , er jeet , hug ad lhieu eh gys Jerusalem , dy hebbal eh gys y Chiarn ,

text: ( As it is written in the law of the Lord , Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord ; )
text2: ( Myr te scruit ayns leih yn Chiarn , Bee dy chooilley chied - ruggit yrrynagh er ny chasherickey gys y Chiarn . )

text: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord , A pair of turtledoves , or two young pigeons .
text2: As dy hebbal yn oural t ' er ny harey ayns leigh yn Chiarn , Piyr dy chalmaneyn turtle , ny daa chalmane aegey .

text: And , behold , there was a man in Jerusalem , whose name was Simeon ; and the same man was just and devout , waiting for the consolation of Israel : and the Holy Ghost was upon him .
text2: As cur - my - ner va dooinney ayns Jerusalem va enmyssit Simeon ; as va ' n dooinney cheddin cairagh as crauee , farkiaght son gerjagh Israel : as va ' n Spyrryd Noo ersyn .

text: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost , that he should not see death , before he had seen the Lord ' s Christ .
text2: As ve er ny hoilshaghey da liorish y Spyrryd Noo , nagh noghe eh baase , roish da v ' er vakin Creest yn Chiarn .

text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple : and when the parents brought in the child Jesus , to do for him after the custom of the law ,
text2: As haink eh liorish y Spyrryd stiagh ayns y chiamble : as tra va ' n ayr as y voir er chur lhieu yn lhiannoo Yeesey stiagh , dy yannoo er e hon , lurg cliaghtey yn leigh ;

text: Then took he him up in his arms , and blessed God , and said ,
text2: Eisht ghow eh seose eh ayns e roihaghyn , as hug eh moylley da Jee , as dooyrt eh ,

text: Lord , now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace , according to thy word :
text2: Hiarn nish t ' ou cur kied da dty harvaant paartail ayns she , cordail rish dty ghoo .

text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation ,
text2: Son ta my hooillyn er vakin dty haualtys ;

text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people ;
text2: T ' ou er chiarail dy ve er ny hoilshaghey fenish dy chooilley phobble ;

text: A light to lighten the Gentiles , and the glory of thy people Israel .
text2: Soilshey dy hoilshean er ny Ashoonee as gloyr dty phobble Israel .

text: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him .
text2: As ghow Joseph as e voir yindys jeh ny reddyn va loayrit my - e - chione ,

text: And Simeon blessed them , and said unto Mary his mother , Behold , this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel ; and for a sign which shall be spoken against ;
text2: As vannee Simeon ad , as dooyrt eh rish Moirrey e voir , Cur - my - ner ta ' n lhiannoo shoh soit dy chur sheese as dy hoiaghey seose ymmodee ayns Israel ; as son cowrey dy oltooan .

text: ( Yea , a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also , ) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed .
text2: ( As dy jarroo hed cliwe trooid dty annym hene neesht ) dy vod smooinaghtyn ymmodee creeaghyn v ' er ny chronnaghey .

text: And there was one Anna , a prophetess , the daughter of Phanuel , of the tribe of Aser : she was of a great age , and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity ;
text2: As va myrgeddin phadeyrben enmyssit Anna , inneen Phanuel , jeh kynney Aser : v ' ee dy eash vooar , as v ' ee er veaghey marish e sheshey shiaght bleeaney neayr as v ' ee ny moidyn .

text: And she was a widow of about fourscore and four years , which departed not from the temple , but served God with fastings and prayers night and day .
text2: As v ' ee ny ben - treoghe mysh kiare feed as kiare bleeaney dy eash , as v ' ee dy kinjagh taaghey yn chiamble , shirveish Jee lesh trostey as padjeryn oie as laa .

text: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord , and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem .
text2: As haink ish stiagh ec y traa cheddin , as hug ee booise myrgeddin da ' n Chiarn , as loayr ee jeh roosyn ooilley va jeeaghyn son livrey - ys ayns Jerusalem .

text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord , they returned into Galilee , to their own city Nazareth .
text2: As tra v ' ad er chooilleeney dy chooilley nhee cordail rish leigh yn Chiarn , haink ad reesht gys Galilee , gys yn ard - valley oc hene Nazareth .

text: And the child grew , and waxed strong in spirit , filled with wisdom : and the grace of God was upon him .
text2: As daase y lhiannoo , as v ' eh er ny niartaghey ' sy spyrryd , as lhieent lesh creenaght , as va grayse Yee macirc ; rish .

text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover .
text2: Nish va e ayr as e voir goll seose gys Jerusalem dy chooilley vlein ec feailley ny caisht .

text: And when he was twelve years old , they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast .
text2: As tra v ' eh daa vlein jeig dy eash , hie ad seose gys Jerusalem lurg cliaghtey ny feailley .

text: And when they had fulfilled the days , as they returned , the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem ; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it .
text2: As tra va ny laghyn harrish , as ad goll thie reesht , duirree yn lhiannoo Yeesey nyn yei ayns Jerusalem , gyn - yss da Joseph as e voir .

text: But they , supposing him to have been in the company , went a day ' s journey ; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance .
text2: Agh smooinaghtgn dy row eh ayns y cheshaght , hie ad jurnah laa ; as v ' ad briaght er e hon mastey nyn gheiney mooinjerey as nyn ainjys .

text: And when they found him not , they turned back again to Jerusalem , seeking him .
text2: As tra nagh dooar ad eh , hie ad reesht gys Jerusalem shirrey er e hon .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days they found him in the temple , sitting in the midst of the doctors , both hearing them , and asking them questions .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , lurg three laa dy dooar ad eh ayns y chiamble , ny hoie mastey ny fir - ynsee , chammah geaishtagh roo , as cur feyshtyn orroo .

text: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers .
text2: As ghow ooilley ny va geaishtagh rish yindys jeh ' n toiggal as jeh ny ansooryn echey .

text: And when they saw him , they were amazed : and his mother said unto him , Son , why hast thou thus dealt with us ? behold , thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing .
text2: As tra honnick ad eh , v ' ad fo mooarane atchim ; as dooyrt e voir rish , Vac , cre ' n - fa t ' ou er n ' yannoo myr shoh rooin ? cur - my - ner , ta dty ayr as mish er ve briaght dy trimshagh er dty hon .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye sought me ? wist ye not that I must be about my Father ' s business ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Kys dy row shiu briaght er my hon ' s ? nagh row fys eu dy beign dou ve mysh obbyr my Ayrey ?

text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them .
text2: As cha row toiggyl oc jeh ' n raa loayr eh roo .

text: And he went down with them , and came to Nazareth , and was subject unto them : but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart .
text2: As hie eh sheese macirc ; roo , as haink eh gys Nazareth , as v ' eh biallagh daue : as hasht e voir ooilley ny raaghyn shoh ayns e cree .

text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature , and in favour with God and man .
text2: As ren Yeesey bishaghey ayns creenaght as aase , as ayns foayr rish Jee as dooinney .

text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar , Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea , and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee , and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis , and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene ,
text2: NISH ayns y wheiggoo vlein jeig jeh reill , Tiberius Cesar , tra va Pontius Pilate ny chiannoort er Judea , as Herod ny hetrarch er Galilee , as e vraar Philip reill ayns Iturea as cheer Trachonitis , as Lysanias reill ayns Abilene .

text: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests , the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness .
text2: Tra va Annas as Caiaphas nyn ard - saggyrtyn , haink goo Yee gys Ean mac Zacharias ayns yn aasagh .

text: And he came into all the country about Jordan , preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins ;
text2: As haink eh gys ooilley yn cheer my geayrt Jordan , preacheil bashtey arrys son leih peccaghyn .

text: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet , saying , The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Myr te scruit ayns lioar goan Esaias yn phadeyr , gra , Coraa fer geamagh ayns yn aasagh , Kiartee - jee raad y Chiarn , jean - jee ny cassanyn echey jeeragh .

text: Every valley shall be filled , and every mountain and hill shall be brought low ; and the crooked shall be made straight , and the rough ways shall be made smooth ;
text2: Bee dy chooilley choan er ny lhieeney as dy chooilley slieau as cronk er nyn injillaghey , as ny ynnydyn cammey er nyn yannoo jeeragh , as ny raaidyn garroo er nyn yannoo rea .

text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God .
text2: As hee dy chooilley eill saualtys Yee .

text: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him , O generation of vipers , who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish y pobble v ' er jeet magh huggey dy ve er nyn mashtey , O shiuish heeloghe dy ard - nieughyn , quoi t ' er chur raaue diu dy hea veih yn jymmoose ta ry - heet ?

text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance , and begin not to say within yourselves , We have Abraham to our father : for I say unto you , That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham .
text2: Cur - jee magh nish er - y - fa shen messyn cooie dy arrys , as ny jean - jee toshiaght dy ghra riu hene , Ta Abraham ain son nyn ayr : son ta mee gra riu , dy vel pooar ec Jee eer jeh ny claghyn shoh cloan y hroggal seose da Abraham .

text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees : every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: As nish hannah ta ' n teigh er ny choyrt gys fraue ny biljyn : shen - y - fa ta dy chooilley villey nagh vel gymmyrkey mess mie , dy ve giarit sheese as tilgit ayns yn aile .

text: And the people asked him , saying , What shall we do then ?
text2: As denee yn pobble jeh , gra , Cre ta orrinyn dy yannoo ?

text: He answereth and saith unto them , He that hath two coats , let him impart to him that hath none ; and he that hath meat , let him do likewise .
text2: Dreggyr eh as dooyrt eh roo , Eshyn ta daa chooat echey , lhig da y choyrt dasyn nagh vel cooat eddyr echey as eshyn ta beaghey echey , lhig da jannoo er yn aght cheddin .

text: Then came also publicans to be baptized , and said unto him , Master , what shall we do ?
text2: Eisht haink myrgeddin ny publicanee dy ve er nyn mashtey , as dooyrt ad rish , Vainshter , cre ta orrinyn dy yannoo ?

text: And he said unto them , Exact no more than that which is appointed you .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Ny trog - jee ny smoo na ta er nyn gurrym .

text: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him , saying , And what shall we do ? And he said unto them , Do violence to no man , neither accuse any falsely ; and be content with your wages .
text2: As decirc ; nee ny sidooryn myrgeddin , jeh , gra , As cre ta orrinyn dy yannoo ? As dooyrt eh roo , Ny jean - jee tranlaase er dooinney erbee , ny jean - jee cassid vreagagh er dooinney erbee , as bee - jee booiagh lesh nyn vaill .

text: And as the people were in expectation , and all men mused in their hearts of John , whether he were the Christ , or not ;
text2: As myr va ' n pobble ayns imnea , as dy chooilley ghooinney smooinaghtyn ayns nyn greeaghyn mychione Ean , nee eh va ' n Creest mannagh nee ;

text: John answered , saying unto them all , I indeed baptize you with water ; but one mightier than I cometh , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose : he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire :
text2: Dreggyr Ean as dooyrt eh roo ooilley , Ta mish dy jarroo bashtey shiu lesh ushtey ; agh ta fer s ' pooaral na mish cheet kiangley ny braagyn echey cha vel mee feeu dy eaysley : nee eshyn shiu y vashtey lesh y Spyrryd Noo , as lesh aile .

text: Whose fan is in his hand , and he will throughly purge his floor , and will gather the wheat into his garner ; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable .
text2: Ta ' n cleayst echey ayns e laue , as fasnee eh dy bollagh e laare - vooie , as gowee eh yn churnaght stiagh ayns e hie tashtee ; agh yn coau nee eh y lostey lesh aile nagh bee er ny vooghey .

text: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people .
text2: As ymmodee dy reddyn elley ren eh y choyrlaghey as y phreacheil gys y pobble .

text: But Herod the tetrarch , being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip ' s wife , and for all the evils which Herod had done ,
text2: Agh tra v ' eh er choyrt oghsan da Herod yn Tetrarch kyndagh rish Herodias ben e vraar Philip , as ooilley ny huilk va Herod er n ' yannoo ,

text: Added yet this above all , that he shut up John in prison .
text2: Ren eh shoh marish y chooid elley , dy dug eh Ean ayns pryssoon .

text: Now when all the people were baptized , it came to pass , that Jesus also being baptized , and praying , the heaven was opened ,
text2: Nish tra va ooilley ' n pobble er nyn mashtey , haink eh gy - kione dy row Yeesey myrgeddin er ny vashtey , as ghow eh padjer , as va niau er ny osley ;

text: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him , and a voice came from heaven , which said , Thou art my beloved Son ; in thee I am well pleased .
text2: As haink y Spyrryd Noo neose er , myr ayns cummey dooghyssagh calmane , as haink coraa veih niau , gra , Oo my vac ennoil , jeed ta mee dy mooar soiaghey .

text: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age , being ( as was supposed ) the son of Joseph , which was the son of Heli ,
text2: As ghow Yeesey eh - hene toshiaght dy ve mysh jeih bleeaney as feed dy eash , as ( goit dy ve ) mac Yoseph , mac Heli ,

text: Which was the son of Matthat , which was the son of Levi , which was the son of Melchi , which was the son of Janna , which was the son of Joseph ,
text2: Mac Matthat , mac Leyi , mac Melchi , mac Janna , mac Joseph ,

text: Which was the son of Mattathias , which was the son of Amos , which was the son of Naum , which was the son of Esli , which was the son of Nagge ,
text2: Mac Mattathias , mac Amos , mac Naum , mac Esli , mac Nagge ,

text: Which was the son of Maath , which was the son of Mattathias , which was the son of Semei , which was the son of Joseph , which was the son of Juda ,
text2: Mac Maath , mac Mattathias , mac Semei , mac Joseph , mac Juda ,

text: Which was the son of Joanna , which was the son of Rhesa , which was the son of Zorobabel , which was the son of Salathiel , which was the son of Neri ,
text2: Mac Joanna , mac Rhesa , mac Zorobabel , mac Salathiel , mac Neri ,

text: Which was the son of Melchi , which was the son of Addi , which was the son of Cosam , which was the son of Elmodam , which was the son of Er ,
text2: Mac Melchi , mac Addi , mac Cosam , mac Elmodam , mac Er ,

text: Which was the son of Jose , which was the son of Eliezer , which was the son of Jorim , which was the son of Matthat , which was the son of Levi ,
text2: Mac Jose , mac Eliezer , mac Jorim , mac Matthat , mac Levi ,

text: Which was the son of Simeon , which was the son of Juda , which was the son of Joseph , which was the son of Jonan , which was the son of Eliakim ,
text2: Mac Simeon , mac Juda , mac Joseph , mac Jonan , mac Eliakim ,

text: Which was the son of Melea , which was the son of Menan , which was the son of Mattatha , which was the son of Nathan , which was the son of David ,
text2: Mac Melea , mac Menan , mac Mattatha , mac Nathan , mac David ,

text: Which was the son of Jesse , which was the son of Obed , which was the son of Booz , which was the son of Salmon , which was the son of Naasson ,
text2: Mac Jesse , mac Obed , mac Booz , mac Salmon , mac Naasson ,

text: Which was the son of Aminadab , which was the son of Aram , which was the son of Esrom , which was the son of Phares , which was the son of Juda ,
text2: Mac Aminadab , mac Aram , mac Esrom , mac Phares , mac Juda

text: Which was the son of Jacob , which was the son of Isaac , which was the son of Abraham , which was the son of Thara , which was the son of Nachor ,
text2: Mac Jacob , mac Isaac , mac Abraham , mac Thara , mac Nachor ,

text: Which was the son of Saruch , which was the son of Ragau , which was the son of Phalec , which was the son of Heber , which was the son of Sala ,
text2: Mac Saruch , mac Ragan , mac Phalec , mac Heber , mac Sala .

text: Which was the son of Cainan , which was the son of Arphaxad , which was the son of Sem , which was the son of Noe , which was the son of Lamech ,
text2: Mac Cainan , mac Arphaxad , mac Sem , mac Noe , mac Lamech ,

text: Which was the son of Mathusala , which was the son of Enoch , which was the son of Jared , which was the son of Maleleel , which was the son of Cainan ,
text2: Mac Mathusala . mac Enoch , mac Ja red , mac Maleleel , mac Cainan ,

text: Which was the son of Enos , which was the son of Seth , which was the son of Adam , which was the son of God .
text2: Mac Enos , mac Seth , mac Adam , mac Yee .

text: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan , and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness ,
text2: As va Yeesey lane jeh ' n Spyrryd Noo , as hyndaa eh veih Jordan , as v ' eh er ny leeideil liorish y Spyrryd gys yn aasagh ,

text: Being forty days tempted of the devil . And in those days he did eat nothing : and when they were ended , he afterward hungered .
text2: As v ' eh da - eed laa er ny violaghey liorish y drogh - spyrryd , as ayns ny laghyn shen cha d ' ee eh veg ; as tra v ' ad harrish , v ' eh ny lurg shen accryssagh .

text: And the devil said unto him , If thou be the Son of God , command this stone that it be made bread .
text2: As dooyrt y drogh - spyrryd rish , My she Mac Yee oo , abbyr rish yn chlagh shoh dy ve jeant ny arran .

text: And Jesus answered him , saying , It is written , That man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word of God .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey eh , gra , Te scruit , Nagh nee er arran ny - lomarcan nee dooinney beaghey , agh liorish ooilley goan Yee .

text: And the devil , taking him up into an high mountain , shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time .
text2: As hug y drogh - spyrryd lesh seose eh gys mullagh slieau ard , as ayns y tullogh hug eh shilley da jeh ooilley reeriaghtyn y theihll .

text: And the devil said unto him , All this power will I give thee , and the glory of them : for that is delivered unto me ; and to whomsoever I will I give it .
text2: As dooyrt y drogh - spyrryd rish , Ooilley yn phooar shoh ver - ym dhyt ' s , as y ghloyr oc ; son ta shen er ny livrey dou , as da quoi - erbee saillym , ta mee dy choyrt eh .

text: If thou therefore wilt worship me , all shall be thine .
text2: My ver oo er - y - fa shen ooashley dou bee ooilley lhiat hene .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , Get thee behind me , Satan : for it is written , Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God , and him only shalt thou serve .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , Ass my enish oo , Noid - ny - hanmey : son te scruit , Ver oo ooashley da ' n Chiarn dty Yee , as eshyn ynrycan nee oo y hirveish .

text: And he brought him to Jerusalem , and set him on a pinnacle of the temple , and said unto him , If thou be the Son of God , cast thyself down from hence :
text2: As hug eh lesh eh gys Jerusalem , as hoie eh eh er beinn toor syrjey yn chiamble , as dooyrt eh rish , My she Mac Yee oo , tilg oo hene sheese veih shoh .

text: For it is written , He shall give his angels charge over thee , to keep thee :
text2: Son te scruit , Ver eh currym da e ainleyn harryd , dy dty reayll :

text: And in their hands they shall bear thee up , lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone .
text2: As ayns nyn laueyn nee ad oo y ymmyrkey , er - aggle ec traa erbee dy bwoaill oo dty chass noi clagh .

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , It is said , Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , Te er ny ghra , Cha jean oo daanys er y Chiarn dty Yee .

text: And when the devil had ended all the temptation , he departed from him for a season .
text2: As erreish da ' n drogh - spyrryd v ' er n ' yannoo jerrey er ooilley yn violagh , daag eh eh son earish .

text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee : and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about .
text2: As haink Yeesey reesht ayns pooar y spyrryd gys Galilee : as hie goo magh jeh trooid ooilley yn cheer mygeayrt .

text: And he taught in their synagogues , being glorified of all .
text2: As dynsee eh ayns ny kialteenyn oc , as v ' eh ayns ard - voylley rish y theay .

text: And he came to Nazareth , where he had been brought up : and , as his custom was , he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day , and stood up for to read .
text2: As haink eh gys Nazareth , raad v ' eh er ny ve troggit : as hie eh , myr v ' eh cliaghtey , stiagh ayns y synagogue er laa yn doonaght , as hass eh seose dy lhaih .

text: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias . And when he had opened the book , he found the place where it was written ,
text2: As va lioar y phadeyr Esaias er ny livrey da , as tra v ' eh er vosley yn lioar , hooar eh yn ynnyd raad v ' eh scruit ,

text: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me , because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor ; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted , to preach deliverance to the captives , and recovering of sight to the blind , to set at liberty them that are bruised ,
text2: Ta spyrryd y Chiarn orrym ' s , er - y - fa dy vel eh er my ooillaghey dy phreacheil y sushtal gys ny boghtyn , t ' eh er my choyrt dy laanaghey yn vooinjer hrome - chreeagh , dy phreacheil livrey - ys gys ny cappeeyn , dy chur soilshey da ny doail , as reamys dauesyn ta broojit ,

text: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord .
text2: Dy phreacheil blein eunyssagh y Chiarn .

text: And he closed the book , and he gave it again to the minister , and sat down . And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him .
text2: As yeigh eh yn lioar , as hug eh ee reesht da ' n chirveishagh , as hoie eh sheese : as va sooillyn dy chooilley unnane v ' ayns y synagogue dy jeean soit er .

text: And he began to say unto them , This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears .
text2: As ren eh toshiaght dy ghra roo , Jiu ta ' n scriptyr shoh cooilleenit ayns y chlashtyn euish .

text: And all bare him witness , and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth . And they said , Is not this Joseph ' s son ?
text2: As dymmyrk ad ooilley feanish lesh , as ghow ad yindys jeh ny goan graysoil haink ass y veeal echey . As dooyrt ad , Nagh nee shoh mac Yoseph ?

text: And he said unto them , Ye will surely say unto me this proverb , Physician , heal thyself : whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum , do also here in thy country .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Jir shiu ayns shickyrys yn chenn raa shoh rhym , Er - lhee , jean oo hene y lheihys : cre - erbee ta shin er chlashtyn va jeant ayns Capernaum , jean myrgeddin ayns shoh ayns dty heer hene .

text: And he said , Verily I say unto you , No prophet is accepted in his own country .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Nagh vel soiagh jeant jeh phadeyr erbee ayns e heer hene .

text: But I tell you of a truth , many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias , when the heaven was shut up three years and six months , when great famine was throughout all the land ;
text2: Agh ta mee ginsh diu ayns firrinys , dy row ymmodee mraane treoghe ayns Israel rish hing Elias , tra va ' n aer jeight seose three bleeaney as shey meeghyn , tra va genney vooar trooid ooilley yn cheer :

text: But unto none of them was Elias sent , save unto Sarepta , a city of Sidon , unto a woman that was a widow .
text2: Agh gys unnane oc cha row Elias er ny choyrt , cheu mooie jeh gys Sarepta ard - valley dy Sidon , gys ben - treoghe v ' ayns shen .

text: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet ; and none of them was cleansed , saving Naaman the Syrian .
text2: As va ymmodee louranee ayns Israel rish traa Eliseus yn phadeyr , as cha row fer jeu er ny ghlenney , cheu - mooie jeh Naaman yn Syrian .

text: And all they in the synagogue , when they heard these things , were filled with wrath ,
text2: As va ooilley ny v ' ayns y synagogue tra cheayll ad ny goan shoh , lhieent lesh jymmoose ,

text: And rose up , and thrust him out of the city , and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built , that they might cast him down headlong .
text2: As dirree ad , as deiyr ad eh magh ass yn ard - valley , as hug ad lhieu eh gys broogh yn chronk ( er va ' n ard - valley oc troggit ) ry - hoi tilgey sheese eh gour e vullee .

text: But he passing through the midst of them went his way ,
text2: Agh hie eh magh trooid mean y cheshaght , as jimmee eh roish :

text: And came down to Capernaum , a city of Galilee , and taught them on the sabbath days .
text2: As haink eh neose gys Capernaum , ard - valley dy Ghalilee , as dynsee eh ad er laghyn y doonaght .

text: And they were astonished at his doctrine : for his word was with power .
text2: As ghow ad yindys mooar jeh ' n ynsaghey echey : son va e ghoo lesh pooar .

text: And in the synagogue there was a man , which had a spirit of an unclean devil , and cried out with a loud voice ,
text2: As ayns y synagogue va dooinney seaghnit lesh spyrryd neu - ghlen , as dyllee eh lesh ard - choraa .

text: Saying , Let us alone ; what have we to do with thee , thou Jesus of Nazareth ? art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art ; the Holy One of God .
text2: Gra , Faag shin ; cre ' n eie t ' ayd orrin uss Yeesey dy Nazareth ? vel oo er jeet dy nyn stroie ? ta fys aym quoi oo hene ; Fer - casherick Yee .

text: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and come out of him . And when the devil had thrown him in the midst , he came out of him , and hurt him not .
text2: As hug Yeesey oghsan da , gra Bee dty - host , as tar magh ass . As tra va ' n drogh spyrryd er hilgey neeal eh , haink eh magh ass , gyn assee da .

text: And they were all amazed , and spake among themselves , saying , What a word is this ! for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits , and they come out .
text2: As v ' ad ooilley fo atchim , as loayr ad ny mast ' oc hene , gra , Cre ' n fockle ( vreeoil ) shoh ? son lesh pooar as niart t ' eh cur ny spyrrydyn neu ghlen fo harey , as t ' ad cheet magh .

text: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about .
text2: As hie goo magh jeh trooid dy chooilley ard jeh ' n cheer mygeayrt .

text: And he arose out of the synagogue , and entered into Simon ' s house . And Simon ' s wife ' s mother was taken with a great fever ; and they besought him for her .
text2: As hrog eh magh ass y synagogoe , as hie eh stiagh ayns thie Simon : as va moir ben Simon feer ching ayns y chiassaghey ; as ren ad aghin huggey er e son .

text: And he stood over her , and rebuked the fever ; and it left her : and immediately she arose and ministered unto them .
text2: As hass eh er - e - skyn , as hug eh oghsan da ' n chiassaghey , as daag eh ee . As chelleeragh dirree ee seose , as ren ee shirveish orroo .

text: Now when the sun was setting , all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him ; and he laid his hands on every one of them , and healed them .
text2: Nish ec lhie ny greiney , whilleen as va sleih chingey oc fo mooarane doghanyn hug ad lhieu ad huggey ; as hug eh e laueyn er dy chooilley unnane oc , as ren eh ad y lheihys .

text: And devils also came out of many , crying out , and saying , Thou art Christ the Son of God . And he rebuking them suffered them not to speak : for they knew that he was Christ .
text2: As haink drogh - spyrrydyn myrgeddin magh ass ymmodee , gyllagh as gra , Oo yn Creest Mac Yee . As hug eh oghsan daue , as cha lhig eh daue loayrt ; son va fys oc dy nee eh va ' n Creest .

text: And when it was day , he departed and went into a desert place : and the people sought him , and came unto him , and stayed him , that he should not depart from them .
text2: As ' sy vadran , jimmee eh roish , as hie eh gys boayl er - lheh : as va ' n pobble briaght er e hon , as cheet huggey , as chionney er , eh dy uirriaght macirc ; roo .

text: And he said unto them , I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also : for therefore am I sent .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Shegin dooys reeriaght Yee y phreacheil gys ard - valjyn elley myrgeddin : son er yn oyr shen ta mee er my choyrt .

text: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee .
text2: As ren eh preacheil ayns kialteenyn Ghalilee .

text: And it came to pass , that , as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God , he stood by the lake of Gennesaret ,
text2: As haink eh gy - kione myr va ' n pobble chionney stiagh er dy chlashtyn goo Yee , as eh ny hassoo liorish faarkey Ghennesareth ,

text: And saw two ships standing by the lake : but the fishermen were gone out of them , and were washing their nets .
text2: As honnick eh daa lhong rish oirr y traie : agh va ny eeasteyryn er n ' gholl assdoo , as v ' ad niee yn lieen .

text: And he entered into one of the ships , which was Simon ' s , and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land . And he sat down , and taught the people out of the ship .
text2: As hie eh er - board unnane jeh ny lhongyn va lesh Simon , as ghuee eh er , eh dy heiy magh tammylt veih yn thalloo : as hoie eh sheese , as dynsee eh yn pobble ass y lhong .

text: Now when he had left speaking , he said unto Simon , Launch out into the deep , and let down your nets for a draught .
text2: Nish tra v ' eh erreish loayrt , dooyrt eh rish Simon , Ymmyrt - jee magh gys y diunid , as cuir - jee yn lieen son tayrn .

text: And Simon answering said unto him , Master , we have toiled all the night , and have taken nothing : nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net .
text2: As dreggyr Simon as dooyrt eh rish , Vainshter , ta shin er hooilleil fud ny hoie , as cha vel shin er ghoaill monney : ny - yeih er dty ockle ' s cuir - yms yn lieen .

text: And when they had this done , they inclosed a great multitude of fishes : and their net brake .
text2: As tra v ' ad er n ' yannoo shoh chruinnee ad dy cheilley lheid yn earroo mooar dy eeastyn ; dy row yn lieen oc brishey .

text: And they beckoned unto their partners , which were in the other ship , that they should come and help them . And they came , and filled both the ships , so that they began to sink .
text2: As chrie ad er ny parteeassyn oc v ' ayns y lhong elley , ad dy heet dy chooney lhieu . As haink ad , as lhieen ad y daa lhong , myr shen dy row ad ayns gaue goll fo .

text: When Simon Peter saw it , he fell down at Jesus ' knees , saying , Depart from me ; for I am a sinful man , O Lord .
text2: Tra honnick Simon Peddyr shoh , huitt eh sheese ec glioonyn Yeesey , gra , Immee voym , son ta mee my ghooinney peccoil , O Hiarn .

text: For he was astonished , and all that were with him , at the draught of the fishes which they had taken :
text2: Son ghow eshyn , as ooilley ny va macirc ; rish , yindys mooar jeh ' n lught dy eeastyn v ' ad er ghoaill :

text: And so was also James , and John , the sons of Zebedee , which were partners with Simon . And Jesus said unto Simon , Fear not ; from henceforth thou shalt catch men .
text2: Myr ren neesht Jamys as Ean mec Zebedee , va nyn barteeassyn marish Simon . As dooyrt Yeesey rish Simon , Ny bee aggle ort , veih shoh magh nee oo goaill deiney .

text: And when they had brought their ships to land , they forsook all , and followed him .
text2: As tra v ' ad er chur lhieu nyn lhongyn gys thalloo , hreig ad ooilley , as deiyr ad er .

text: And it came to pass , when he was in a certain city , behold a man full of leprosy : who seeing Jesus fell on his face , and besought him , saying , Lord , if thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , tra v ' eh ayns ard - valley dy row , cur - my - ner , dooinney lane jeh ' n louraneys : as tra honnick eh Yeesey , huitt eh sheese er e eddin , jannoo aghin huggey as gra , Hiarn , my she dty aigney eh , foddee oo mish y yannoo glen .

text: And he put forth his hand , and touched him , saying , I will : be thou clean . And immediately the leprosy departed from him .
text2: As heeyn eh magh e laue , as venn eh rish , gra , M ' aigney ' s eh ; bee er dty ghlenney . As chelleeragh daag y louraneys eh .

text: And he charged him to tell no man : but go , and shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing , according as Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: As hug eh currym er gyn eh dy insh shoh da dooinney erbee : agh immee , as jeeagh oo hene da ' n taggyrt , as cheb son dty ghlenney , myr ta Moses er harey , dy ve son feanish daue .

text: But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him : and great multitudes came together to hear , and to be healed by him of their infirmities .
text2: Agh wheesh shen smoo hie goo magh jeh : as haink earrooyn mooarey dy leih cooidjagh dy chlashtyn , as dy ve er nyn lheihys liorish jeh nyn aslayntyn .

text: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness , and prayed .
text2: Agh hie eshyn eh - hene roish gys yn aasagh , dy ghoaill padjer .

text: And it came to pass on a certain day , as he was teaching , that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by , which were come out of every town of Galilee , and Judaea , and Jerusalem : and the power of the Lord was present to heal them .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione laa dy row , myr v ' eh gynsaghey , dy row Phariseeyn as fir - ynsee yn leigh nyn soie liorish , v ' er jeet magh ass ooilley baljyn Ghalilee , as Judea as Jerusalem : as va pooar y Chiarn feer vreeoil macirc ; rish ayns lheihys doghanyn .

text: And , behold , men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy : and they sought means to bring him in , and to lay him before him .
text2: As cur - my - ner , hug sleih lhieu ayns lhiabbee dooinney va ching jeh ' n palsee : as v ' ad shirrey y chur lhieu stiagh eh , dy hoiaghey eh kiongoyrt rish

text: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude , they went upon the housetop , and let him down through the tiling with his couch into the midst before Jesus .
text2: As tra nagh row saase erbee oc dy chur lhieu stiagh eh kyndagh rish chennid y phobble , hie ad seose er mullagh y thie , as lhig ad sheese ny hrooid , eh - hene as e lhaibbee , er y laare kiongoyrt rish Yeesey .

text: And when he saw their faith , he said unto him , Man , thy sins are forgiven thee .
text2: As tra hug eh tastey da ' n chredjue oc , dooyrt eh rish , Ghooinney , ta dty pheccaghyn er nyn leih dhyt .

text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason , saying , Who is this which speaketh blasphemies ? Who can forgive sins , but God alone ?
text2: As ren ny scrudeyryn as ny Phariseeyn toshiaght dy phleadeil ry - cheilley , gra , Quoi eh shoh ta loayrt goan mollaghtagh ? Quoi oddys peccaghyn y leih , agh Jee ny lomarcan ?

text: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts , he answering said unto them , What reason ye in your hearts ?
text2: Agh va fys ec Yeesey er ny smooinaghtyn oc , as dreggyr eh , as dooyrt eh roo , Cre er ta shiu resooney ayns nyn greeaghyn ?

text: Whether is easier , to say , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Rise up and walk ?
text2: Quoi sassey dy ghra , Ta dty pheccagh yn er nyn leih dhyt , ny dy ghra , Irree seose as shooill ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins , ( he said unto the sick of the palsy , ) I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy couch , and go into thine house .
text2: Agh dy vod fys y ve eu , dy vel pooar ec Mac y dooinney er y thalloo dy leih peccaghyn ( dooyrt eh rishyn va ching jeh ' n chingys craa - ee . ) Ta mee gra rhtt , Irree , as trog seose dty lhiabbee , as gow royd gys dty hie .

text: And immediately he rose up before them , and took up that whereon he lay , and departed to his own house , glorifying God .
text2: As chelleeragh dirree eh seose kiongoyrt roo , as hrog eh shen v ' eh ny lhie er , as jimmee eh gys e hie , cur moylley da Jee .

text: And they were all amazed , and they glorified God , and were filled with fear , saying , We have seen strange things to day .
text2: As ghow ad ooilley lane yindys , as ren ad Jee y ghloyraghey , as v ' ad lhieent lesh aggle , gra , Ta shin er vakin reddyn yindyssagh jiu .

text: And after these things he went forth , and saw a publican , named Levi , sitting at the receipt of custom : and he said unto him , Follow me .
text2: As ny lurg shoh hie eh magh , as honnick eh publican va enmyssit Levi , ny hoie ec boayrd y cheesh : as dooyrt eh rish , Eiyr orrym ' s .

text: And he left all , rose up , and followed him .
text2: As daag eh ooilley as dirree eh seose , as deiyr eh er .

text: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house : and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them .
text2: As ren Levi aarlaghey mooar er e hon ayns e hie hene : as va sheshaght vooar dy phublicanee as dy eallagh elley nyn soie ec y voayrd macirc ; roo .

text: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples , saying , Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Agh va ny scrudeyryn oc as ny Phariseeyn jymmoosagh rish e ynseydee , gra , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu gee as giu marish publicanee as peccee ?

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , They that are whole need not a physician ; but they that are sick .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Cha vel feme ocsyn ta slane er yn er - lhee : agh ec sleih chingey .

text: I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Cha daink mish dy eamagh er yn vooinjer chairagh , agh er peccee gys arrys .

text: And they said unto him , Why do the disciples of John fast often , and make prayers , and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees ; but thine eat and drink ?
text2: As dooyrt ad roo , Cre ' n - fa ta ynseydee Ean trostey dy mennick , as jannoo padjeryn , as myrgeddin ynseydee ny Phariseeyn ; agh ta ' n vooinjer ayd ' s gee as giu ?

text: And he said unto them , Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Bailliu mooinjer y chamyr - phoosee dy hrostey , choud as ta dooinney yn phoosee macirc ; roo ?

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: Agh hig ny laghyn , tra vees dooinney yn phoosee er ny ghoaill ersooyl voue , as eisht nee ad trostey ayns ny laghyn shen .

text: And he spake also a parable unto them ; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old ; if otherwise , then both the new maketh a rent , and the piece that was taken out of the new agreeth not with the old .
text2: As loayr eh myrgeddin coraa - dorraghey roo , Cha vel dooinney erbee cur peesh dy eaddagh noa er shenn gharmad : er - nonney , ta chammah yn noa raipey yn laane lesh , as cha vel yn pheesh va goit ass yn noa coardail rish y chenn

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles ; else the new wine will burst the bottles , and be spilled , and the bottles shall perish .
text2: As cha vel dooinney erbee cur feeyn noa ayns shenn voteilyn er - nonney scoltee yn feeyn noa ny boteilyn , as bee eh deayrit , as bee ny boteilyn dy choayl er .

text: But new wine must be put into new bottles ; and both are preserved .
text2: Agh shegin da feeyn noa v ' er ny chur ayns boteilyn noa ; as t ' ad ny - neesht sauchey .

text: No man also having drunk old wine straightway desireth new : for he saith , The old is better .
text2: Chamoo ta dooinney erbee , erreish da v ' er n ' iu shenn feeyn , chelleeragh shirrey feeyn noa : son t ' eh gra , Ta ' n shenn ny share .

text: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first , that he went through the corn fields ; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn , and did eat , rubbing them in their hands .
text2: AS haink eh gy - kione er y chied doonaght lurg yn nah laa jeh ' n chaisht , myr v ' eh goll trooid ny magheryn - arrooo dy ren e ynseydee ny jeeassyn y phluckey , as rubbey yn arroo assdoo ayns nyn laueyn ren ad gee jeh .

text: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them , Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days ?
text2: As dooyrt shiartanse jeh ny Phariseeyn roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu jannoo shen nagh vel lowal dy ve jeant er laghyn y doonaght ?

text: And Jesus answering them said , Have ye not read so much as this , what David did , when himself was an hungred , and they which were with him ;
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey ad , gra , Nagh vel shiu er lhaih wheesh shoh , cre ren David tra v ' eh hene as e heshaght accryssagh :

text: How he went into the house of God , and did take and eat the shewbread , and gave also to them that were with him ; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone ?
text2: Kys hie eh stiagh ayns thie Yee , as ghow eh as d ' ee eh yn arran casherick , as hug eh eh myrgeddin dauesyn va marish , ga nagh row eh lowit dy ve eeit , agh liorish ny sag gyrtyn ny - lomarcan ?

text: And he said unto them , That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Dy row yn Mac dooinney ny Hiarn myrgeddin er y doonaght .

text: And it came to pass also on another sabbath , that he entered into the synagogue and taught : and there was a man whose right hand was withered .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione er doonaght elley , dy jagh eh stiagh ayns y synagogne , as dy dynsee eh : as va dooinney ayns shen va ' n laue yesh echey er shyrgaghey .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him , whether he would heal on the sabbath day ; that they might find an accusation against him .
text2: As va sooill gheyre ec ny scruderyn as ny Phariseeyn er , dy yeeaghyn jinnag eh eh y lheihys er laa yn doonaght : dy voddagh cooish chassid ' ve oc n ' oi .

text: But he knew their thoughts , and said to the man which had the withered hand , Rise up , and stand forth in the midst . And he arose and stood forth .
text2: Agh va fys echeysyn er ny smooinaghtyn oc , as dooyrt eh rish y dooinney lesh y laue shyrgit , Irree seose as shass magh er y laare . As dirree eh , as hass eh magh .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , I will ask you one thing ; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good , or to do evil ? to save life , or to destroy it ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Fecirc ; nyms un red jiuish , Vel eh lowal er laghyn y doonaght dy yannoo mie , ny dy yannoo olk ? dy hauail bioys , ny dy stroie eh ?

text: And looking round about upon them all , he said unto the man , Stretch forth thy hand . And he did so : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: As yeeagh eh mygeayrt orroo ooilley , as dooyrt eh rish y dooinney , Sheeyn magh dty laue . As ren eh shen ; as va ' n laue echey er ny lheihys myr y laue elley .

text: And they were filled with madness ; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus .
text2: As v ' adsyn myr deiney baanrit ; as hug ad nyn goyrle dy cheilley , cre dy yannoo rish Yeesey .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that he went out into a mountain to pray , and continued all night in prayer to God .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione ayns ny laghyn shen , dy jagh eh seose er slieau dy ghoaill padjer , as dy ren eh tannaghtyn fud ny hoie ayns padjer gys Jee .

text: And when it was day , he called unto him his disciples : and of them he chose twelve , whom also he named apostles ;
text2: As tra va ' n laa er hoilshagh , deiuml ; e eh er e ynseydee huggey : as jeusyn reih eh ghhaa - yeig , denmys eh myrgeddin nyn os tyllyn :

text: Simon , ( whom he also named Peter , ) and Andrew his brother , James and John , Philip and Bartholomew ,
text2: Simon ( denmys eh myrgeddin Peddyr ) as Andreays e vraar , Jamys as Ean , Philip as Parlane ,

text: Matthew and Thomas , James the son of Alphaeus , and Simon called Zelotes ,
text2: Mian as Thomase , Jamys mac Alpheus , as Simon va enmyssit Zelotes

text: And Judas the brother of James , and Judas Iscariot , which also was the traitor .
text2: As Judas braar Yamys , as Yuaase Iscariot , va myrgeddin yn traitoor .

text: And he came down with them , and stood in the plain , and the company of his disciples , and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem , and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon , which came to hear him , and to be healed of their diseases ;
text2: As haink eh neose maroo gys y cheer - rea , as haggil huggey sheshaght e eiyrtee , as earroo mooar dy leih veih ooilley Judea as Jerusalem , as veih ardjyn ny marrey Tyre as Sidon , haink dy eaishtagh rish , as dy ve er nyn lheihys jeh nyn ghoghanyn ;

text: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits : and they were healed .
text2: As adsyn va seaghnit lesh spyrrydyn neu - ghlen ; as v ' ad er nyn lheihys .

text: And the whole multitude sought to touch him : for there went virtue out of him , and healed them all .
text2: As va ' n slane chaglym shirrey bentyn rish : son va bree goll magh ass , va dyn lheihys ad ooilley .

text: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples , and said , Blessed be ye poor : for yours is the kingdom of God .
text2: As hrog eh seose e hooillyn er e eiyrtee , as dooyrt eh , Bannit ta shiuish voghtyn : son lhieuish reeriaght Yee .

text: Blessed are ye that hunger now : for ye shall be filled . Blessed are ye that weep now : for ye shall laugh .
text2: Bannit ta shiuish ta accryssagh nish : son bee shiu er nyn yannoo magh . Bannit ta shiuish ta nish dobberan : son nee shiu garaghtee .

text: Blessed are ye , when men shall hate you , and when they shall separate you from their company , and shall reproach you , and cast out your name as evil , for the Son of man ' s sake .
text2: Bannit ta shiuish , tra ta deiney cur feoh diu , as tra nee ad nyn scarrey shiu voue , as nyn oltooaney shiu , as nyn ennym y ghiarey magh myr olk , er coontey Mac y dooinney .

text: Rejoice ye in that day , and leap for joy : for , behold , your reward is great in heaven : for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets .
text2: Bee - jee dy ghien mie ayns y laa shen , as lheim - jee son boggey son cur - my - ner , s ' mooar ta nyn leagh ayns niau : son er yn aght cheddin ren ny shenn - ayryn oc rish ny phadeyryn .

text: But woe unto you that are rich ! for ye have received your consolation .
text2: Agh smerg diuish verchee : son ta shiu er gheddyn nyn gherjagh .

text: Woe unto you that are full ! for ye shall hunger . Woe unto you that laugh now ! for ye shall mourn and weep .
text2: Smerg diuish ta lane : son bee shiu accryssagh . Smerg diuish ta garaghtee nish : son nee shiu dobberan as keayney .

text: Woe unto you , when all men shall speak well of you ! for so did their fathers to the false prophets .
text2: Smerg diuish tra nee dy chooilley ghooinney loayrt dy mie jiu : son shen myr ren ny ayraghyn oc jeh ny phadeyryn foalsey .

text: But I say unto you which hear , Love your enemies , do good to them which hate you ,
text2: Agh ta mish gra riuish ta clashtyn , Bee - jee graihagh er nyn noidyn , bee - jee dooie roosyn ta cur feoh diu :

text: Bless them that curse you , and pray for them which despitefully use you .
text2: Bannee - jee adsyn ta gwee mollaght diu , as gow - jee padjer er nyn son ocsyn ta cur seaghyn erriu .

text: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other ; and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid not to take thy coat also .
text2: As huggeysyn woaillys oo er y derrey lieckan , chyndaa myrgeddin yn lieckan elley : as eshyn ghoys ersooyl dty chloagey , ny bee noi dty chooat y lhiggey lesh myrgeddin .

text: Give to every man that asketh of thee ; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again .
text2: Cur da dy chooilley ghooinney ta jannoo aghin hood ; as jehsyn ta goaill ersooyl dty chooid voiuml ; d , ny shir ad reesht .

text: And as ye would that men should do to you , do ye also to them likewise .
text2: As myr bailliuish deiney dy yannoo riuish , jean - jee shiuish myrgeddin roosyn .

text: For if ye love them which love you , what thank have ye ? for sinners also love those that love them .
text2: Son my ta shiu dooie dauesyn ta dooie riu , s ' beg ta nyn mooise ; son ta eer drogh - yantee dooie dauesyn ta dooie roo .

text: And if ye do good to them which do good to you , what thank have ye ? for sinners also do even the same .
text2: As my ta shiu jannoo mie dauesyn ta jannoo mie diuish , cre ' n booise ta nyn gour ? son ta ny eer drogh - yantee jannoo yn lheid cheddin .

text: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive , what thank have ye ? for sinners also lend to sinners , to receive as much again .
text2: As my ta shiu geeasaght dauesyn voue ta shiu jeeaghyn son cooilleeney , cre ta nyn mooise ? son ta eer drogh - sleih geeasaght da drogh - sleih ; dy gheddyn wheesh cheddin reesht .

text: But love ye your enemies , and do good , and lend , hoping for nothing again ; and your reward shall be great , and ye shall be the children of the Highest : for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil .
text2: Agh cur - jee graih da nyn noidyn , as jean - jee mie , as eeasee - jee , fegooish jerkal rish veg y gheddyn reesht : as s ' mooar vees nyn leagh ! as bee shiu cloan yn Er - syrjey : son t ' eh dooie da ' n vooinjer neu - wooisal as ny mee - chrauee .

text: Be ye therefore merciful , as your Father also is merciful .
text2: Bee - jee er - y - fa shen myghinagh , myr ta ' n Ayr eu myrgeddin myghinagh .

text: Judge not , and ye shall not be judged : condemn not , and ye shall not be condemned : forgive , and ye shall be forgiven :
text2: Ny jean - jee briwnys , as cha bee shiu er nyn mriwnys : ny jean - jee deyrey , as cha bee shiu er nyn gheyrey : leih - jee , as yiow shiu leih :

text: Give , and it shall be given unto you ; good measure , pressed down , and shaken together , and running over , shall men give into your bosom . For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again .
text2: Jean - jee coyrt , as bee eh er ny choyrt diu ; towse mie , jingit sheese , as criht cooidjagh , as roie harrish , ver deiney diu ayns nyn oghrish . Son lesh y towse cheddin ta shiu towse , bee eh er ny howse diu reesht .

text: And he spake a parable unto them , Can the blind lead the blind ? shall they not both fall into the ditch ?
text2: As loayr eh coraa - dorraghey roo , Vod y doal shooyll kione y doal ? as nagh duitt ad ny - neesht ayns y jeeg ?

text: The disciple is not above his master : but every one that is perfect shall be as his master .
text2: Cha vel y schoillar erskyn e vainshter : agh bee dy chooilley unnane ta slane - ynsit , corrym rish e vainshter .

text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye , but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye ?
text2: As cre ' n - fa t ' ou cronnaghey yn brenneein t ' ayns sooill dty vraarey , agh cha vel oo gennaghtyn yn darrag t ' ayns dty hooill hene ?

text: Either how canst thou say to thy brother , Brother , let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye , when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye ? Thou hypocrite , cast out first the beam out of thine own eye , and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye .
text2: Ny kys oddys oo gra rish dty vraar , Vraar , lhig dou yn brenneein y ghoaill ass dty hooill ' s , tra nagh vel oo goaill tastey dy vel darrag ayns dty hooill hene ? Er - crauee - oalsey , tilg hoshiaght yn darrag ass dty hooill hene , eisht bee soilshey ayd dy ghoaill yn brenneein ass sooill dty vraarey .

text: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit ; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit .
text2: Son cha vel billey mie tilgey drogh vess : ny drogh villey tilgey mess mie .

text: For every tree is known by his own fruit . For of thorns men do not gather figs , nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes .
text2: Son ta dy chooilley villey er ny chronnaghey liorish e vess : son cha vel mess y villey figgagh er ny heiy jeh drineyn , ny mess y villey - feeyney jeh thammag - ghress .

text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good ; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil : for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh .
text2: Ta dooinney mie ass stoyr mie e chree , cur magh shen ny ta mie : as drogh - ghooinney ass drogh stoyr e chree , gymmyrkey shen ny ta olk : son magh ass stoyr y chree ta ' n beeal loayrt .

text: And why call ye me , Lord , Lord , and do not the things which I say ?
text2: As cre ' n - fa ta shiu dy my enmys Hiarn , Hiarn , fegooish jannoo ny reddyn ta mee dy ghra ?

text: Whosoever cometh to me , and heareth my sayings , and doeth them , I will shew you to whom he is like :
text2: Quoi - erbee ta cheet hym ' s , as clashtyn my ghoan , as jannoo ymmyd mie jeu , jeeaghym ' s diu quoi rish t ' eh er ny hoylaghey .

text: He is like a man which built an house , and digged deep , and laid the foundation on a rock : and when the flood arose , the stream beat vehemently upon that house , and could not shake it : for it was founded upon a rock .
text2: T ' eh er ny hoylaghey rish dooinney ren thie y hroggal , as chleiy dy dowin , as hoie yn undin er creg : as tra dhatt yn ushtey , vrish yn thooilley stiagh dy trome er y thie shen , agh cha yiarg eh er y chraa eh ; er - yn - oyr dy row yn undin echey er creg .

text: But he that heareth , and doeth not , is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth ; against which the stream did beat vehemently , and immediately it fell ; and the ruin of that house was great .
text2: Agh eshyn ta clashtyn as nagh vel jannoo ymmyd mie jeh , t ' eh goll - rish dooinney , ren fegooish undin thie y hroggal er yn ooir , as ren y thooilley brishey stiagh dy trome , as chelleeragh huitt eh , as s ' mooar va toyrt - mow yn thie shen .

text: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people , he entered into Capernaum .
text2: NISH tra v ' eh erreish ooilley ny goan shoh y loayrt ayns clashtyn y phobble , hie eh stiagh ayns Calpernaum .

text: And a certain centurion ' s servant , who was dear unto him , was sick , and ready to die .
text2: As va centurion dy row va fer - mooinjerey echey , v ' eh dy mooar soiaghey jeh , as v ' eh ching , as raad y vaaish .

text: And when he heard of Jesus , he sent unto him the elders of the Jews , beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant .
text2: As tra cheayll eh jeh Yeesey , hug eh shanstyr ny Hewnyn huggey , guee er eh dy heet dy laanaghey e er - mooinjerey .

text: And when they came to Jesus , they besought him instantly , saying , That he was worthy for whom he should do this :
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet gys Yeesey , ren ad aghin huggey dy jeean , gra , Dy row eshyn feeu v ' eh dy yannoo shoh er y hon :

text: For he loveth our nation , and he hath built us a synagogue .
text2: Son t ' eh ny charrey da ' n ashoon ain , as t ' eh er hroggal synagogue dooin .

text: Then Jesus went with them . And when he was now not far from the house , the centurion sent friends to him , saying unto him , Lord , trouble not thyself : for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof :
text2: Eisht hie Yeesey macirc ; roo . As tra v ' eh er jeet er - gerrey da ' n thie , hug y centurion caarjyn huggey , gra rish , Hiarn , ny boir oo hene , son cha vel mish feeu oo dy heet stiagh fo my chlea .

text: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee : but say in a word , and my servant shall be healed .
text2: As er - yn - oyr shen cha yeeagh mee orrym pene dy ve feeu dy heet hood : agh loayr y fockle , as nee my er - mooinjerey coural .

text: For I also am a man set under authority , having under me soldiers , and I say unto one , Go , and he goeth ; and to another , Come , and he cometh ; and to my servant , Do this , and he doeth it .
text2: Son ta mish mee hene my ghooinney ayns pooar , as ta sidooryn aym foym , as ta mee gra rish shoh , Immee , as t ' eh goll : as rish fer elley , Tar , as t ' eh cheet : as rish my harvaant , Jean shoh , as t ' eh dy yannoo eh .

text: When Jesus heard these things , he marvelled at him , and turned him about , and said unto the people that followed him , I say unto you , I have not found so great faith , no , not in Israel .
text2: Tra cheayll Yeesey shoh , ghow eh yindys , as hyndaa eh mygeayrt , as dooyrt eh rish y pobble va geiyrt er , Ta mee gra riu , Lheid y credjue lajer shoh , cha vel mee er gheddyn ayns Israel hene .

text: And they that were sent , returning to the house , found the servant whole that had been sick .
text2: As tra haink ny chaghteryn reesht gys y thie , hooar ad dy row yn fer - mooinjerey va ching dy slane er choural .

text: And it came to pass the day after , that he went into a city called Nain ; and many of his disciples went with him , and much people .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione yn laa er - giyn dy jagh eh gys ard - valley va enmyssit Nain , as hie ymmodee jeh e ynseydee marish , as mooarrane sleih .

text: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city , behold , there was a dead man carried out , the only son of his mother , and she was a widow : and much people of the city was with her .
text2: Nish tra haink eh er - gerrey da giat yn ard - valley , cur - my - ner , va sleih cur lhieu magh dooinney marroo , va ny ynrycan mac da e voir , as v ' eeish ny ben - treoghe : as va ymmodee jeh sleih yn ard - valley macirc ; ree .

text: And when the Lord saw her , he had compassion on her , and said unto her , Weep not .
text2: As tra honnick y Chiarn ee , va chymmey echey urree , as dooyrt eh r ' ee , Ny jean keayney .

text: And he came and touched the bier : and they that bare him stood still . And he said , Young man , I say unto thee , Arise .
text2: As haink eh , as venn eh rish y carbyd ( as hass adsyn va fo ) as dooyrt eh , Ghooinney aeg , ta mee gra rhyt , Irree .

text: And he that was dead sat up , and began to speak . And he delivered him to his mother .
text2: As hoie yn dooinney marroo seose , as ren eh toshiaght dy loayrt : as livrey eh eh gys e vo1r .

text: And there came a fear on all : and they glorified God , saying , That a great prophet is risen up among us ; and , That God hath visited his people .
text2: As haink aggle orroo ooilley : as hug ad moylley da Jee , gra , Ta phadeyr mooar er n ' irree seose ny mast ' ain ; as , Ta Jee er yeeaghyn er e phobble .

text: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea , and throughout all the region round about .
text2: As hie yn goo shoh magh my - e - chione trooid ooilley Judea , as trooid ooilley yn cheer mygeayrt .

text: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things .
text2: As hug ynseydee Ean coontey da jeh ooilley ny reddyn shoh .

text: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to Jesus , saying , Art thou he that should come ? or look we for another ?
text2: As deie Ean er jees jeh e ynseydee as hug eh ad er chaghteraght gys Yeesey , gra , Nee uss Eh va ry - hoi cheet , ny vel shin dy yeeaghyn son fer elley ?

text: When the men were come unto him , they said , John Baptist hath sent us unto thee , saying , Art thou he that should come ? or look we for another ?
text2: Tra va ny deiney er jeet huggey , dooyrt ad , Ta Ean Bastey er nyn goyrt shin dy ecirc ; naght jeed , Nee uss Eh va ry - hoi cheet , ny vel shin dy yeeaghyn son fer elley ?

text: And in that same hour he cured many of their infirmities and plagues , and of evil spirits ; and unto many that were blind he gave sight .
text2: As ayns yn oor cheddin v ' eh lheihys ymmodee jeh ny aslayntyn as ny doghanyn , as ny drogh - spyrrydyn oc , as da ymmodee va doal v ' eh coyrt soilshey .

text: Then Jesus answering said unto them , Go your way , and tell John what things ye have seen and heard ; how that the blind see , the lame walk , the lepers are cleansed , the deaf hear , the dead are raised , to the poor the gospel is preached .
text2: Eisht dregyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Immee - jee reue , as insh - jee da Ean cre y reddyn ta shiu er vakin as er chlashtyn kys dy vel ny doail geddyn nyn soilshey , ny croobee shooyll , ny louraanee er nyn ghlenney , ny beuyr clashtyn , ny merriu er nyn mioghey , as y sushtal er ny phreacheil da ny boghtyn .

text: And blessed is he , whosoever shall not be offended in me .
text2: As bannit ta eshyn nagh jean beg y hoiaghey jeem ' s .

text: And when the messengers of John were departed , he began to speak unto the people concerning John , What went ye out into the wilderness for to see ? A reed shaken with the wind ?
text2: As tra va chaghteryn Ean er n ' immeeaght , ren eh toshiaght dy ghra rish y pobble mychione Ean , Cre hie shiu magh gys yn aasagh dy akin ? Nee cuirtliagh criht lesh y gheay .

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A man clothed in soft raiment ? Behold , they which are gorgeously apparelled , and live delicately , are in kings ' courts .
text2: Agh cre hie shiu magh dy akin ? Dooinney soit magh ayns coamrey moyrnagh ! Cur - my - ner t ' adsyn ta ceau coamrey costal , as farrail dy seyr , ayns plaaseyn reeoil .

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A prophet ? Yea , I say unto you , and much more than a prophet .
text2: Agh cre hie shiu magh dy akin ? Phadeyr ? dy jarroo , ta mee gra riu , as fer s ' ooasle na phadeyr .

text: This is he , of whom it is written , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Shoh eh jeh te scruit , Cur - my - ner , ta mee cur my haghter magh royd , dy chiartaghey yn raad kiongoyrt rhyt .

text: For I say unto you , Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist : but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he .
text2: Son ta mee gra riu , Ny mast ' oc syn t ' er nyn ruggey jeh mraane , cha vel phadeyr syrjey na Ean Bashtey : agh ta ' n fer sloo t ' ayns reeriaght Yee ny syrjey na eshyn .

text: And all the people that heard him , and the publicans , justified God , being baptized with the baptism of John .
text2: As ren ooilley yn pobble cheayll eh as ny publicanee Jee y heyrey , as v ' ad er nyn mashtey lesh bashtey Ean .

text: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves , being not baptized of him .
text2: Agh ren ny Phariseeyn as fir - ynsee yn leigh soiaghey beg jeh coyrle Yee nyn ' oiuml ; oc hene , as cha row ad er nyn mashtey liorish .

text: And the Lord said , Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation ? and to what are they like ?
text2: As dooyrt y Chiarn , Cre gys nee ' m deiney yn cheeloghe shoh y hoylaghey ? as cre rish t ' ad goll ?

text: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace , and calling one to another , and saying , We have piped unto you , and ye have not danced ; we have mourned to you , and ye have not wept .
text2: T ' ad goll - rish cloan , ta nyn soie ayns ny margaghyn , geamagh yn derrey yeh gys y jeh elley , as gra , Ta shin er n ' yannoo bingys diu , as cha vel shiu er ghaunsin : ta shin er hroggal bardoon diu , as cha vel shiu er ghobberan .

text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine ; and ye say , He hath a devil .
text2: Son cha daink Ean Bashtey gee arran , ny giu feeyn ; as ta shiu gra , Ta drogh spyrryd echey .

text: The Son of man is come eating and drinking ; and ye say , Behold a gluttonous man , and a winebibber , a friend of publicans and sinners !
text2: Ta ' n Mac dooinney er jeet gee as giu ; as ta shiu gra , Cur - my - ner dooinney jollyssagh , as iuder - feeyney , carrey dy phublicanee as dy pheccee .

text: But wisdom is justified of all her children .
text2: Agh ta creenaght er ny heyrey liorish ooilley e cloan .

text: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him . And he went into the Pharisee ' s house , and sat down to meat .
text2: As chuir fer jeh ny Phariseeyn eh gys bee marish . As hie eh stiagh ayns thie yn Pharisee , as hoie eh sheese gys bee .

text: And , behold , a woman in the city , which was a sinner , when she knew that Jesus sat at meat in the Pharisee ' s house , brought an alabaster box of ointment ,
text2: As cur - my - ner va ben ayns yn ard - valley , va ny drogh yantagh , tra va fys eck dy row Yeesey ny hoie ec bee ayns thie yn Pharisee , hug ee lh ' ee box alabaster dy ooil chostal .

text: And stood at his feet behind him weeping , and began to wash his feet with tears , and did wipe them with the hairs of her head , and kissed his feet , and anointed them with the ointment .
text2: As hass ee ec e chassyn cheu e chooylloo keayney , as ren ee toshiaght dy niee e chassyn lesh jeir , as rub ee ad lesh folt e king , as phaag ee e chassyn , as ren ee ad y ooillaghey lesh yn ooil .

text: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw it , he spake within himself , saying , This man , if he were a prophet , would have known who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him : for she is a sinner .
text2: Nish yn Pharisee ren y chuirrey eh , tra honnick eh shoh , loayr eh cheu - sthie jeh hene , gra , Veagh fys er ve ec y dooinney shoh , dy beagh eh ny adeyr , quoi , as cre ' n monney dy ven ee shoh , ta bentyn rish : son t ' ee ny ben pheccoil .

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Simon , I have somewhat to say unto thee . And he saith , Master , say on .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh rish , Simon , ta red aym ' s dy ghra rhyt , As dooyrt eh , Abbyr eh , vainshter .

text: There was a certain creditor which had two debtors : the one owed five hundred pence , and the other fifty .
text2: Va dooinney dy row , as jees ayns lhiastynys da : va ' n derrey yeh lhiastyn queig cheead ping , as y jeh elley jeih pingyn as da - eed .

text: And when they had nothing to pay , he frankly forgave them both . Tell me therefore , which of them will love him most ?
text2: As tra nagh row oc dy eeck , leih eh daue ny - neesht dy arryltagh . Insh dou eisht , quoi jeu s ' booisal vees da ?

text: Simon answered and said , I suppose that he , to whom he forgave most . And he said unto him , Thou hast rightly judged .
text2: Dreggyr Simon as dooyrt eh , Er - lhiam dy nee eshyn , da smoo ren eh leih . As dooyrt eh rish , T ' ou er vriwnys dy cairagh .

text: And he turned to the woman , and said unto Simon , Seest thou this woman ? I entered into thine house , thou gavest me no water for my feet : but she hath washed my feet with tears , and wiped them with the hairs of her head .
text2: As hyndaa eh gys y ven , as dooyrt eh rish Simon , Vel oo cur - my - ner yn ven shoh ? Haink mee stiagh ayns dty hie ' s , as cha dug oo dou ushtey son my chassyn : agh t ' eeish er niee my chassyn lesh jeir , as er jyrmagh ad lesh folt e king .

text: Thou gavest me no kiss : but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet .
text2: Cha dug uss paag dou : agh ta ' n ven shoh , er - dyn traa haink mee stiagh , er ve kinjagh paagey my chassyn .

text: My head with oil thou didst not anoint : but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment .
text2: My chione lesh ooil cha ren oo y ooillaghey : agh ta ' n ven shoh er n ' ooillaghey my chassyn lesh ooil .

text: Wherefore I say unto thee , Her sins , which are many , are forgiven ; for she loved much : but to whom little is forgiven , the same loveth little .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta mee gra rhyt , Ta ny peccaghyn eck ta ymmodee , er nyn leih jee : shen - y - fa wheesh shen smoo ta yn ghraih eck : agh dasyn ta beggan er ny leih , cha vel e ghraih agh beggan .

text: And he said unto her , Thy sins are forgiven .
text2: As dooyrt eh r ' ee , Ta dty pheccaghyn er nyn leih dhyt .

text: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves , Who is this that forgiveth sins also ?
text2: As ren y vooinjer va nyn soie ec bee macirc ; rish , toshiaght dy ghra cheu - sthie jeu hene , Quoi eh shoh ta myrgeddin leih peccaghyn ?

text: And he said to the woman , Thy faith hath saved thee ; go in peace .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish y ven , Ta dty chredjue er dty hauail ; immee ayns shee .

text: And it came to pass afterward , that he went throughout every city and village , preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God : and the twelve were with him ,
text2: As haink eh gy - kione ny lurg shen , dy jagh eh trooid dy chooilley valley , mooar as beg preacheil as soilshaghey sushtal gerjoilagh reeriaght Yee : as va ' n daa ostyl yeig marish :

text: And certain women , which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities , Mary called Magdalene , out of whom went seven devils ,
text2: As shiartanse dy vraane , v ' er nyn lheihys jeh drogh - spyrrydyn , as aslayntyn , Moirrey va enmyssit Malaine , ass - jee hie shiaght drogh - spyrrydyn ,

text: And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod ' s steward , and Susanna , and many others , which ministered unto him of their substance .
text2: As Joanna ben Chusa stiurt Herod , as Susanna , as ymmodee elley , v ' er hirveish er Jeh nyn gooid .

text: And when much people were gathered together , and were come to him out of every city , he spake by a parable :
text2: As tra va earroo mooar dy leih er nyn jaglym cooidjagh , as er jeet huggey ass dy chooilley ard - valley ; loayr eh liorish coraa dorraghey :

text: A sower went out to sow his seed : and as he sowed , some fell by the way side ; and it was trodden down , and the fowls of the air devoured it .
text2: Hie correyder magh dy chuir e rass : as myr v ' eh cuir , huitt paart rish oirr y raad , as ve stampit sheese , as d ' ee eeanlee yn aer eh .

text: And some fell upon a rock ; and as soon as it was sprung up , it withered away , because it lacked moisture .
text2: As huitt paart er creg , as cha leah as ve er n ' aase seose , hie eh naardey , er - yn - oyr dy row eh laccal soo .

text: And some fell among thorns ; and the thorns sprang up with it , and choked it .
text2: As huitt paart mastey drineyn , as daase ny drineyn seose macirc ; rish , as phloogh ad eh .

text: And other fell on good ground , and sprang up , and bare fruit an hundredfold . And when he had said these things , he cried , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: As huitt cooid elley jeh ayns thalloo mie , as daase eh seose , as dymmyrk eh mess keead - filley . As tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , deiuml ; e eh , Eshyn ta cleayshyn echey dy chlashtyn , lhig da clashtyn .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , What might this parable be ?
text2: As decirc ; nee e ostyllyn jeh , gra , Cre ta er ny hoiggal liorish y coraa - dorraghey shoh ?

text: And he said , Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God : but to others in parables ; that seeing they might not see , and hearing they might not understand .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Diuish te er ny choyrt dy hoiggal folliaghtyn reeriaght Yee ; agh da feallagh elley ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey : ga t ' ad fakin cha vel ad cur - my - ner , as clashtyn cha vel ad toiggal .

text: Now the parable is this : The seed is the word of God .
text2: Nish shoh bun y choraa - dorraghey : Yn rass goo Yee .

text: Those by the way side are they that hear ; then cometh the devil , and taketh away the word out of their hearts , lest they should believe and be saved .
text2: Shen rish oirr y raad , yn vooinjer ta clashtyn : eisht ta ' n drogh - spyrryd cheet , as goaill ersooyl yn goo ass ny creeaghyn oc , er - aggle dy jinnagh ad credjal , as dy beagh ad er nyn sauail .
