text: They on the rock are they , which , when they hear , receive the word with joy ; and these have no root , which for a while believe , and in time of temptation fall away .
text2: Adsyn er y chreg , yn vooinjer , tra t ' ad er chlashtyn , ta goaill y goo dy arryltagh ; as cha vel fraue oc shoh , son tammylt t ' ad credjal , agh ayns earish miolagh ta nyn gredjue failleil .

text: And that which fell among thorns are they , which , when they have heard , go forth , and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life , and bring no fruit to perfection .
text2: As shen huitt mastey drineyn , yn vooinjer , tra t ' ad er chlashtyn , ta goll magh as ta plooghit lesh kiarail as berchys , as eunyssyn y vea shoh , as cha vel ad gymmyrkey magh mess gys lhieeney vie .

text: But that on the good ground are they , which in an honest and good heart , having heard the word , keep it , and bring forth fruit with patience .
text2: Agh shen er y thalloo mie , yn vooinjer ta lesh creeaghyn onneragh as mie , er chlashtyn yn goo , as ta dy reayll oc eh , as cur magh mess lesh meenid .

text: No man , when he hath lighted a candle , covereth it with a vessel , or putteth it under a bed ; but setteth it on a candlestick , that they which enter in may see the light .
text2: Cha vel doooinney erbee , tra t ' eh er voaddey cainle , dy choodaghey ee lesh saagh ny dy choyrt ee fo lhiabbee : agh soiaghey ee ayns cainleyr , dy vod adsyn ta cheet stiagh yn soilshey y akin .

text: For nothing is secret , that shall not be made manifest ; neither any thing hid , that shall not be known and come abroad .
text2: Son cha vel nhee erbee follit , nagh jig gys soilshey : ny nhee erbee kiellit , nagh bee fys er , as nagh jig magh .

text: Take heed therefore how ye hear : for whosoever hath , to him shall be given ; and whosoever hath not , from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have .
text2: Cur - jee twoaee er - y - fa shen kys ta shiu clashtyn : son quoi - erbee ta echey , dasyn vees er ny choyrt ; as quoi - erbee nagh vel echey , veihsyn vees er ny ghoaill eer shen hene er - lesh dy vel echey .

text: Then came to him his mother and his brethren , and could not come at him for the press .
text2: Eisht haink huggey e voir as e vraaraghyn , as cha voddagh ad cheet n ' aare , kyndagh rish y chennid .

text: And it was told him by certain which said , Thy mother and thy brethren stand without , desiring to see thee .
text2: As va shoh er ny insh da , lioroosyn dooyrt , Ta dty voir as dty vraaraghyn nyn shassoo mooie , geearee dy dty akin .

text: And he answered and said unto them , My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God , and do it .
text2: Agh dreggyr eh , as dooyrt eh roo , My voir as my vraaraghyn ad shoh ta clashtyn goo Yee , as ta dy yannoo eh .

text: Now it came to pass on a certain day , that he went into a ship with his disciples : and he said unto them , Let us go over unto the other side of the lake . And they launched forth .
text2: Nish haink eh gy - kione , er laa dy row , dy jagh eh er - board lhong marish e ostyllyn : as dooyrt eh roo , Lhig dooin goll harrish gys y cheu elley jeh ' n logh . As hie ad magh son y cheayn .

text: But as they sailed he fell asleep : and there came down a storm of wind on the lake ; and they were filled with water , and were in jeopardy .
text2: Agh myr v ' ad shiaulley , huitt eh ny chadley : as dirree sterrym mooar dy gheay er y cheayn , as lhieen yn ushtey stiagh orroo , dy row ad ayns gaue .

text: And they came to him , and awoke him , saying , Master , master , we perish . Then he arose , and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water : and they ceased , and there was a calm .
text2: As haink ad huggey as ghooisht ad eh , gra , Vainshter , vainshter , bee mayd caillit . Eisht dirree eh , as smaghtee eh yn gheay as freaney ny tonnyn : as ghow ad fea , as va kiuney ayn .

text: And he said unto them , Where is your faith ? And they being afraid wondered , saying one to another , What manner of man is this ! for he commandeth even the winds and water , and they obey him .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cre vel y credjue eu ? As va aggle orroo , goaill yindys as gra ry - cheilley , Cre ' n monney dy ghooinney eh shoh ? son t ' eh cur ny eer geayghyn as yn ushtey fo harey , as t ' ad ayns biallys da .

text: And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes , which is over against Galilee .
text2: As haink ad gys cheer ny Gadarenee ta harrish noi Galilee .

text: And when he went forth to land , there met him out of the city a certain man , which had devils long time , and ware no clothes , neither abode in any house , but in the tombs .
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' gholl er thalloo , haink ny whail ass yn ard - valley , dooinney dy row va ry - foddey seaghnit lesh drogh - spyrrydyn , as cha row eh ceau eaddagh , chamoo duirree eh ayns thie erbee , agh mastey ny hoaiaghyn .

text: When he saw Jesus , he cried out , and fell down before him , and with a loud voice said , What have I to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of God most high ? I beseech thee , torment me not .
text2: Tra honnick eh Yeesey , dyllee eh , as huitt eh sheese kiongoyrt rish , as dooyrt eh lesh ard - choraa , Cre ' n eie t ' ayd orrym Yeesey , Vac yn Jee smoo ard ? Guee - ym ort nagh jean oo my horchaghey .

text: ( For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man . For oftentimes it had caught him : and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters ; and he brake the bands , and was driven of the devil into the wilderness . )
text2: ( Son v ' eh er harey yn spyrryd neu ghlen dy heet magh ass y dooinney . Son v ' eh dy mennick er hoiaghey er : as v ' eh freilt kianlt lesh geulaghyn , as ayns yiarnyn ; as vrish eh ny geulaghyn , as v ' eh er ny ve eiyrit liorish y drogh - spyrryd gys yn aasagh . )

text: And Jesus asked him , saying , What is thy name ? And he said , Legion : because many devils were entered into him .
text2: As decirc ; nee Yeesey jeh , gra , Cre ' n ennym t ' ort ? As dooyrt eh , Legion : er - yn oyr dy row ymmodee drogh - spyrrydyn er n ' gholl stiagh ayn .

text: And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep .
text2: As ghuee ad er gyn eh dy oardaghey daue goll sheese gys y diunid .

text: And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain : and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them . And he suffered them .
text2: As va griagh mooar dy vuckyn fo bochillyn er y clieau : as ghuee ad er , eh dy chur kied daue goll stiagh ayndoo . As hug eh kied daue .

text: Then went the devils out of the man , and entered into the swine : and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake , and were choked .
text2: Eisht hie ny drogh - spyrrydyn ass y dooinney , as hie ad stiagh ayns ny muckyn : as roie yn ghriagh gour nyn mullee lesh yn eaynee gys y cheayn , as v ' ad plooghit .

text: When they that fed them saw what was done , they fled , and went and told it in the city and in the country .
text2: Tra honnick ny bochillyn cre va jeant , roie ad roue , as hie ad as dinsh ad eh ayns yn ard - valley , as trooid y cheer .

text: Then they went out to see what was done ; and came to Jesus , and found the man , out of whom the devils were departed , sitting at the feet of Jesus , clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: Eisht hie ad magh dy yeeaghyn cre va jeant ; as haink ad gys Yeesey , as hooar ad y dooinney , ass va ny drogh spyrrydyn er n ' gholl , ny hoie ec cassyn Yeesey , as e eaddagh er , as v ' eh dy mie ayns e cheeayl : as ghow ad aggle .

text: They also which saw it told them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed .
text2: Dinsh myrgeddin yn vooinjer honnick eh daue , kys va fer ny drogh - spyrrydyn er ny lheihys .

text: Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them ; for they were taken with great fear : and he went up into the ship , and returned back again .
text2: Eisht ren y slane chaglym jeh cheer y Gadalenee mygeayrt , guee er eh dy gholl roish : son va aggle mooar er duittym orroo : as hie eh er - board yn lhong , as hyndaa eh back reesht .

text: Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him : but Jesus sent him away , saying ,
text2: Nish va ' n dooinney ass va ny drogh spyrrydyn er n ' immeeaght geearree dy ve marish : agh hug Yeesey ersooyl eh , gra ,

text: Return to thine own house , and shew how great things God hath done unto thee . And he went his way , and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him .
text2: Gow royd gys dty hie hene , as soilshee cre ny reddyn mooarey ta Jee er n ' yannoo er dty hon . As hie eh roish , as dinsh eh magh trooid ooilley yn ard - valley , cre ny reddyn mooarey va Yeesey er n ' yannoo er e hon .

text: And it came to pass , that , when Jesus was returned , the people gladly received him : for they were all waiting for him .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , tra va Yeesey er jeet back , dy ghow yn pobble lane boggey jeh : son v ' ad ooilley fieau er .

text: And , behold , there came a man named Jairus , and he was a ruler of the synagogue : and he fell down at Jesus ' feet , and besought him that he would come into his house :
text2: As cur - my - ner , haink dooinney va enmyssit Jairus , as v ' eh fer jeh reiltee yn synagogue : as huitt eh sheese ec cassyn Yeesey , as ghuee eh er , eh dy heet stiagh ayns e hie :

text: For he had one only daughter , about twelve years of age , and she lay a dying . But as he went the people thronged him .
text2: Son va un ynrycan inneen echey , va mysh daa vlein jeig dy eash , as v ' ee raad y vaaish . ( Agh myr v ' eh goll , va ' n pobble chionney er .

text: And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years , which had spent all her living upon physicians , neither could be healed of any ,
text2: As va ben va roie foalley er ve eck rish daa vlein jeig , v ' er vaarail ooilley e cooid - seihlt er fir - lhee , as cha daink eh lesh veg jeu ee y lheihys ,

text: Came behind him , and touched the border of his garment : and immediately her issue of blood stanched .
text2: Haink ee shoh cheu e chooylloo , as venn ee rish oirr e gharmad : as chelleeragh hyrmee yn roie - foalley eck .

text: And Jesus said , Who touched me ? When all denied , Peter and they that were with him said , Master , the multitude throng thee and press thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey , Quoi venn rhym ? Tra ren ooilley gobbal , dooyrt Peddyr , as adsyn va marish , Vainshter , ta ' n pohble chionney ort , as dy dty yingey , as t ' ou uss gra , Quoi venn rhym ?

text: And Jesus said , Somebody hath touched me : for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey , Ta peccagh ennagh er ventyn rhym : son ta mee gennaghtyn dy vel bree er n ' gholl ass - ym .

text: And when the woman saw that she was not hid , she came trembling , and falling down before him , she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him and how she was healed immediately .
text2: As tra honnick yn ven dy row ee cronnit , haink ee er - creau , as huitt ee sheese ec e chassyn , as hoilshee ee da kiongoyrt rish ooilley yn pobble , cre ' n oyr v ' eck dy ventyn rish , as er - y - chooyl kys v ' ee er ny lheihys

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , be of good comfort : thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace .
text2: As dooyrt eh r ' ee , Inneen , bee dy ghien mie ; ta dty chredjue er dty laanaghey : immee ayns shee . )

text: While he yet spake , there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house , saying to him , Thy daughter is dead ; trouble not the Master .
text2: Choud as v ' eh foast loayrt , haink fer veih thie fer - reill yn synagogue , gra rish , Ta dty inneen marroo ; ny cur trubbyl sodjey da ' n Vainshter .

text: But when Jesus heard it , he answered him , saying , Fear not : believe only , and she shall be made whole .
text2: Agh tra cheayll Yeesey shoh , dreggyr eh eh , gra , Ny bee aggle ort : cha vel ort agh dy chredjal , as bee ee er ny lheihys .

text: And when he came into the house , he suffered no man to go in , save Peter , and James , and John , and the father and the mother of the maiden .
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet stiagh ' sy thie , cha lhig eh da dooinney erbee goll stiagh marish , agh Peddyr , as Jamys , as Ean , as ayr as moir y ven - aeg .

text: And all wept , and bewailed her : but he said , Weep not ; she is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: As v ' ad ooilley keayney , as jannoo dobberan er e son : agh dooyrt eshyn , Ny jean - jee keayney ; cha vel ee marroo , agh ny cadley .

text: And they laughed him to scorn , knowing that she was dead .
text2: Agh s ' beg hoie ad jeh e raa , as fys oc son shickyrys dy row ee marroo .

text: And he put them all out , and took her by the hand , and called , saying , Maid , arise .
text2: As hug eh ad ooilley magh , as ghow eh ee er laue , as deie eh , gra , Ven - aeg , irree seose .

text: And her spirit came again , and she arose straightway : and he commanded to give her meat .
text2: As haink y spyrryd eck reesht , as dirree ee jeeragh : as doardee eh bee y chur jee .

text: And her parents were astonished : but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done .
text2: As ghow yn ayr as y voir eck yindys mooar : agh hug eh currym daue gyn ad dy insh da dooinney erbee cre va jeant .

text: Then he called his twelve disciples together , and gave them power and authority over all devils , and to cure diseases .
text2: Eisht deie eh er y daa ostyl yeig cooidjagh , as hug eh daue pooar as eaghtyrys harrish dy chooilley ghrogh - spyrryd , as dy lheihys doghanyn .

text: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God , and to heal the sick .
text2: As hug eh ad magh dy phreacheil reeriaght Yee , as dy laanaghey sleih chingey .

text: And he said unto them , Take nothing for your journey , neither staves , nor scrip , neither bread , neither money ; neither have two coats apiece .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Ny cur - jee lhieu nhee erbee son nyn yurnah , chamoo luirg , ny spagey , ny arran , ny argid ; as ny lhig da daa chooat y pheesh y ve eu .

text: And whatsoever house ye enter into , there abide , and thence depart .
text2: As thie erbee dy jed shiu stiagh ayn , gow - jee aaght ayns shen , derrey hed shiu reue .

text: And whosoever will not receive you , when ye go out of that city , shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them .
text2: As quoi - erbee nagh jean goaill riu , tra aagys shiu yn ard - valley shen , crie - jee yn eer joan jeh ny cassyn eu , son feanish nyn ' oi

text: And they departed , and went through the towns , preaching the gospel , and healing every where .
text2: As hie ad magh , as jimmee ad trooid ny baljyn , preacheil yn sushtal , as lheihys dy chooilley raad .

text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him : and he was perplexed , because that it was said of some , that John was risen from the dead ;
text2: Nish va Herod yn tetrarch er chlasht yn jeh ooilley e yannoo : as v ' eh seaghnit , er - y - fa dy row paart gra , dy row Ean er n ' irree veih ny merriu :

text: And of some , that Elias had appeared ; and of others , that one of the old prophets was risen again .
text2: As paart , dy row Elias er jeet kionfenish : as feallagh elley , dy row fer jeh ny sbenn adeyryn er n ' irree reesht .

text: And Herod said , John have I beheaded : but who is this , of whom I hear such things ? And he desired to see him .
text2: As dooyrt Herod , Jeh Ean ren mish yn kione y ghoaill ; agh quoi eh shoh jeh ta mee clashtyn lheid ny reddyn ? As v ' eh aggindagh dy akin eh .

text: And the apostles , when they were returned , told him all that they had done . And he took them , and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida .
text2: tra va ny ostyllyn er jeet reesht , dinsh ad da [ Yeesey ] ooilley ny v ' ad er n ' yannoo . As ghow eh ad , as hie eh dy lhiattee gys boayl er - lheh ayns yn aasagh , bentyn gys ard - valley enmyssit Bethsaida

text: And the people , when they knew it , followed him : and he received them , and spake unto them of the kingdom of God , and healed them that had need of healing .
text2: As tra hooar y pobble fys er , deiyr ad er : as hug eh oltaghey daue , as loayr eh roo jeh reeriaght Yee , as laanee eh adsyn va feme slaanaghey .

text: And when the day began to wear away , then came the twelve , and said unto him , Send the multitude away , that they may go into the towns and country round about , and lodge , and get victuals : for we are here in a desert place .
text2: As tra va ' n laa faggys ceaut , haink yn daa ostyl yeig as dooyrt ad rish , Lhig y raad da ' n pobble , dy vod ad goll roue gys ny baljyn as er y cheer mygeayrt , dy gheddyn aaght as beaghey : son ta shin ayns shoh ayns boayl faasagh .

text: But he said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they said , We have no more but five loaves and two fishes ; except we should go and buy meat for all this people .
text2: Agh dooyrt eh roo , Cur - jee shiuish bee daue . As dooyrt ad , Cha vel ain agh queig bwilleenyn as daa eeast ; mannagh jem mayd dy chionnaghey bee son ooilley yn pobble shoh .

text: For they were about five thousand men . And he said to his disciples , Make them sit down by fifties in a company .
text2: Son v ' ad mysh queig thousane dooinney . As dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn , Cur - jee orroo soie sheese , jeih as da - eed ayns sheshaght .

text: And they did so , and made them all sit down .
text2: As ren ad shen , as hug ad orroo ooilley soie sheese .

text: Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes , and looking up to heaven , he blessed them , and brake , and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude .
text2: Eisht ghow eh ny queig bwilleenyn as y daa eeast , as yeeagh eh seose gys niau , as vannee eh , as vrish eh , as hug eh ad da e ostyllyn dy hoiaghey roish y pobble .

text: And they did eat , and were all filled : and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets .
text2: As ren ad ooilley gee , as v ' ad er nyn yannoo magh : as hrog ad jeh ' n fooilliagh daag ad , lane daa vaskad jeig .

text: And it came to pass , as he was alone praying , his disciples were with him : and he asked them , saying , Whom say the people that I am ?
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' eh ec padjer ayns ynnyd er - lheh , as e ostyllyn marish : dy denee eh jeu , gra , Cre ta ' n pobble dy ghra my - mychione ' s , quoi mee ?

text: They answering said , John the Baptist ; but some say , Elias ; and others say , that one of the old prophets is risen again .
text2: Dreggyr adsyn , as dooyrt ad , Ean Bashtey : agh ta paart gra , Elias : as paart elley , dy vel fer jeh ny shenn adeyryn er n ' irree reesht .

text: He said unto them , But whom say ye that I am ? Peter answering said , The Christ of God .
text2: Dooyrt eshyn roo , Agh quoi ta shiuish gra dy vel mee ? Dreggyr Peddyr as dooyrt eh , Yn Creest dy Yee .

text: And he straitly charged them , and commanded them to tell no man that thing ;
text2: As hug eh currym gyere orroo , gyn ad dy insh shen da dooinney erbee ,

text: Saying , The Son of man must suffer many things , and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes , and be slain , and be raised the third day .
text2: Gra , Shegin da Mac y dooinney ymmodee reddyn y hurranse , as ve beg soit jeh liorish y chanstyr , as ny ard - saggyrtyn , as ny scrudeyryn , as ve er ny varroo , as girree reesht yn trass laa .

text: And he said to them all , If any man will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross daily , and follow me .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo ooilley , My ta dooinney erbee aggindagh geiyrt orrym ' s lhig da eh - hene y obbal , as e chrosh y hroggal gagh laa , as geiyrt orrym .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it : but whosoever will lose his life for my sake , the same shall save it .
text2: Son quoi - erbee baillish e vioys y hauail , caillee eh eh : agh quoi - erbee chaillys e vioys er my ghraih ' s , sauee eh shoh eh .

text: For what is a man advantaged , if he gain the whole world , and lose himself , or be cast away ?
text2: Son cre ' n vondeish t ' ec dooinney , my chosnys eh yn seihll ooilley , as eh - hene dy ve caillit , ny ceaut ersooyl ?

text: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words , of him shall the Son of man be ashamed , when he shall come in his own glory , and in his Father ' s , and of the holy angels .
text2: Son quoi - erbee ghoys nearey jeem ' s as jeh my ghoan , jehsyn ghoys yn Mac dooinney nearey , tra hig eh ayns e ghloyr hene , as gloyr e Ayrey , as ny ainleyn casherick .

text: But I tell you of a truth , there be some standing here , which shall not taste of death , till they see the kingdom of God .
text2: Agh ta mee ginsh diu ayns firrinys , dy vel paart nyn shassoo ayns shoh nagh jean blashtyn er y baase , derrey hee ad reeriaght

text: And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings , he took Peter and John and James , and went up into a mountain to pray .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione mygeayrt hoght laa lurg ny raaghyn shoh , dy ghow eh marish , Peddyr as Ean as Jamys , as dy jagh eh seose er slieau dy ghoaill padjer .

text: And as he prayed , the fashion of his countenance was altered , and his raiment was white and glistering .
text2: As myr v ' eh ayns padjer , va cummey yn eddin echey er ny chaghlaa , as va ' n coamrey echey gial as follys .

text: And , behold , there talked with him two men , which were Moses and Elias :
text2: As cur - my - ner va daa ghooinney taggloo rish , ta shen dy ghra Moses as Elias :

text: Who appeared in glory , and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem .
text2: Haink kionfenish ayns gloyr , as loayr ad heh e vaase , v ' eh dy hurranse ec Jerusalem .

text: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep : and when they were awake , they saw his glory , and the two men that stood with him .
text2: Agh haink cadley trome er Peddyr as orroosyn va marish : as tra v ' ad er ghoostey , honnick ad yn ghloyr echey , as y daa ghooinney va nyn shassoo marish .

text: And it came to pass , as they departed from him , Peter said unto Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias : not knowing what he said .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione myr v ' ad goll dy aagail eh , dy dooyrt Peddyr rish Yeesey , Vainshter , s ' mie dooin dy ve ayns shoh ; as lhig dooin three cabbaneyn y yannoo , cabbane er dty hon ' s , as cabbane son Moses , as cabbane son Elias : s ' coan toiggal cre v ' eh dy ghra .

text: While he thus spake , there came a cloud , and overshadowed them : and they feared as they entered into the cloud .
text2: Choud as v ' eh loayrt shoh , haink bodjal lesh scadoo harrystoo : as ghow ad aggle myr va ' n bodjal cheet moo .

text: And there came a voice out of the cloud , saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
text2: As haink coraa ass y vodjal , gra , Shoh my vac graihagh ; eaisht - jee rishyn .

text: And when the voice was past , Jesus was found alone . And they kept it close , and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen .
text2: As lurg y choraa , hooar ad Yeesey ny lomarcan : as dreill ad shoh oc hene , as cha dinsh ad da dooinney erbee ayns ny laghyn shen , veg jeh ny reddyn v ' ad er vakin .

text: And it came to pass , that on the next day , when they were come down from the hill , much people met him .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione yn nah laa tra v ' ad er jeet neose jeh ' n clieau , dy daink ymmodee ny whail .

text: And , behold , a man of the company cried out , saying , Master , I beseech thee , look upon my son : for he is mine only child .
text2: As cur - my - ner , deie dooinney jeh ' n cheshaght , gra , Vainshter , ta mee guee ort jeeagh er my vac , son she my ynrycan lhiannoo eh .

text: And , lo , a spirit taketh him , and he suddenly crieth out ; and it teareth him that he foameth again , and bruising him hardly departeth from him .
text2: As cur - my - ner , ta spyrryd dy ghoaill eh , as doaltattym t ' eh gyllagh ; as tuittym neeal , t ' eh keshal , as s ' coan t ' eh cheet huggey hene , erreish da ve dy mooar broojit .

text: And I besought thy disciples to cast him out ; and they could not .
text2: As ghuee mee er dty ostyllyn ad dy hilgey magh eh , agh cha daink eh lhieu .

text: And Jesus answering said , O faithless and perverse generation , how long shall I be with you , and suffer you ? Bring thy son hither .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , gra , 0 heeloghe vee - chredjuagh as roonagh , caid ta mish dy ve meriu , as dy hurranse diu ? Cur lhiat dty vac ayns shoh .

text: And as he was yet a coming , the devil threw him down , and tare him . And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit , and healed the child , and delivered him again to his father .
text2: As myr v ' eh foast cheet , cheau yn drogh - spyrryd sheese eh ayns strepyn : agh vaggyr Yeesey er y spyrryd neu - ghlen , as laanee eh yn lhiannoo , as livrey eh eh reesht gys e ayr .

text: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God . But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did , he said unto his disciples ,
text2: As v ' ad ooilley ayns ard - yindys jeh pooar niartal Yee : Agh choud as va dy chooilley unnane ayns ard - imnea mychione dagh nhee va Yeesey er n ' yannoo , dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn ,

text: Let these sayings sink down into your ears : for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men .
text2: Lhig da ny raaghyn shoh goll dowin ayns nyn glashtyn : son bee yn Mac dooinney er ny livrey gys laueyn deiney .

text: But they understood not this saying , and it was hid from them , that they perceived it not : and they feared to ask him of that saying .
text2: Agh cha hoig ad y raa shoh , as ve gyn yss daue , nagh row toiggal oc jeh : as va aggle orroo fenaght jeh mychione y raa cheddin .

text: Then there arose a reasoning among them , which of them should be greatest .
text2: Eisht hie ad son argane ry - cheilley , quoi jeu syrjey veagh .

text: And Jesus , perceiving the thought of their heart , took a child , and set him by him ,
text2: As Yeesey toiggal smooinaghtyn y chree oc , ghow eh lhiannoo , as hoie eh eh liorish ,

text: And said unto them , Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me : and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me : for he that is least among you all , the same shall be great .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Quoi - erbee nee soiaghey jeh ' n lhiannoo shoh ayns m ' ennynn ' s , t ' eh jannoo soiaghey jeem ' s : as quoi - erbee nee soiaghey jeem ' s , t ' eh soiaghey jehsyn t ' er my choyrt : son eshyn sloo ta nyn mast ' eu ooilley , eshyn syrjey vees .

text: And John answered and said , Master , we saw one casting out devils in thy name ; and we forbad him , because he followeth not with us .
text2: As dreggyr Ean as dooyrt eh , Vainshter , honnick shin fer castey drogh spyrrydyn ayns dty ennym ' s ; as liett shin eh , er - yn - oyr nagh vel eh geiyrt ort ' s marinyn .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Forbid him not : for he that is not against us is for us .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Ny jean - jee eh y lhiettal : son , eshyn nagh vel nyn ' oi , t ' eh lhien .

text: And it came to pass , when the time was come that he should be received up , he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem ,
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr va ' n traa tayrn er - gerrey dasyn dy ve goit seose , dy row eh dy shickyr kiarit er soiaghey e eddin dy gholl gys Jerusalem .

text: And sent messengers before his face : and they went , and entered into a village of the Samaritans , to make ready for him .
text2: As hug eh chaghteryn roish : as jimmee ad , as haink ad gys balley jeh ny Samaritanee dy aarlaghey er e hon .

text: And they did not receive him , because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem .
text2: Agh cha dug adsyn oltaghey - bea da , er - yn - oyr dy dug ad my - ner dy row eh goll gys Jerusalem .

text: And when his disciples James and John saw this , they said , Lord , wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven , and consume them , even as Elias did ?
text2: As tra honnick e ostyllyn Jamys as Ean shoh , dooyrt ad , Hiarn , nailt shin dy harey aile orroo veih niau , dy stroie ad , eer myr ren Elias ?

text: But he turned , and rebuked them , and said , Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of .
text2: Agh hyndaa eh , as hug eh oghsan daue , gra , Cha s ' eu cre ' n monney dy spyrryd ta shiu jeh .

text: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men ' s lives , but to save them . And they went to another village .
text2: Son cha vel Mac yn dooinney er jeet dy stroie bioys deiney , agh dy nyn sauail . As hie ad roue gys balley elley .

text: And it came to pass , that , as they went in the way , a certain man said unto him , Lord , I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' ad goll er y raad , dy dooyrt dooinney dy row rish , Hiarn , eiyr - yms ort raad erbee dy jed oo .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Foxes have holes , and birds of the air have nests ; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Ta tuill ec ny shynnee , as idd ec eeanlee yn aer , agh ec Mac yn dooimley cha vel boayl , ayn dy chur e chione fo .

text: And he said unto another , Follow me . But he said , Lord , suffer me first to go and bury my father .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish fer elley , Eiyr orrym : Agh dooyrt eshyn , Hiarn , cur kied dou hoshiaeht goll thie dy oanluckey my ayr .

text: Jesus said unto him , Let the dead bury their dead : but go thou and preach the kingdom of God .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Lhig da ny me riu nyn merriu y oanluckey ; agh gow uss royd as jean reeriaght Yee y phreacheil .

text: And another also said , Lord , I will follow thee ; but let me first go bid them farewell , which are at home at my house .
text2: As dooyrt fer elley myrgeddin rish Hiarn , eiyr - yms ort - agh lhig dou hoshiaght bannaght y aagail ec y vooinjer t ' ec my hie .

text: And Jesus said unto him , No man , having put his hand to the plough , and looking back , is fit for the kingdom of God .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Dooinney erbee t ' er chur e laue gys y cheeaght , as ta jeeaghyn back , t ' eh an - chooid son reeriaght Yee .

text: After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also , and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place , whither he himself would come .
text2: Ny lurg shoh , doardee yn Chiarn three - feed as jeih elley , as hug eh ad magh jees as jees roish hene , gys dy chooilley ard valley as ynnyd , raad v ' eh hene ry - hoi cheet .

text: Therefore said he unto them , The harvest truly is great , but the labourers are few : pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest , that he would send forth labourers into his harvest .
text2: Shen - y - fa dooyrt eh roo , Ta ' n fouyr dy jarroo mooar , agh ta ny labreeyn beggan : guee - jee shiuish er - y - fa shen er Chiarn y fouyr , eh dy chur magh labreeyn gys y fouyr echey .

text: Go your ways : behold , I send you forth as lambs among wolves .
text2: Immee - jee eisht : cur - jee my - ner , ta mish dyn goyrt shiu magh myr eayin mastey moddee - oaldey .

text: Carry neither purse , nor scrip , nor shoes : and salute no man by the way .
text2: Ny cur - jee lhieu sporran , ny spagey , ny braagyn : as ny jean - jee cumrail ayns goltaghey dooinney erbee er y raad .

text: And into whatsoever house ye enter , first say , Peace be to this house .
text2: As thie erbee dy jed shiu stiagh ayn , abbyr - jee hoshiaght , Shee dy row gys y thie shoh .

text: And if the son of peace be there , your peace shall rest upon it : if not , it shall turn to you again .
text2: As my vees mac ny shee ayns shen , nee yn chee eu tannaghtyn er : mannagh vel , chyndaa - ee eh hiu hene reesht .

text: And in the same house remain , eating and drinking such things as they give : for the labourer is worthy of his hire . Go not from house to house .
text2: As ayns y thie cheddin fuirree - jee , gee as giu lheid as ver ad reue : son ta ' n labree toilliu e aill . Ny gow - jee veih thie dy thie .

text: And into whatsoever city ye enter , and they receive you , eat such things as are set before you :
text2: As ard - valley erbee dy jed shiu stiagh ayn , as ad dy oltaghey nyn mea , ee - jee lheid as vees soit reue .

text: And heal the sick that are therein , and say unto them , The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you .
text2: As slaanee - jee yn sleih chingey t ' ayn , as abbyr - jee roo , Ta reeriaght Yee er jeet er - gerrey diu .

text: But into whatsoever city ye enter , and they receive you not , go your ways out into the streets of the same , and say ,
text2: Agh ard - valley erbee dy jed shiu stiagh ayn , as nagh jean goaill riu , gow - jee reue magh ayns ny straidyn oc , as abbyr - jee ,

text: Even the very dust of your city , which cleaveth on us , we do wipe off against you : notwithstanding be ye sure of this , that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you .
text2: Eer joan yn ard - valley eu , ta lhiantyn hooin , ta shin dy chraa j ' in nyn ' oi eu : ny yeih , bee - jee shickyr jeh shoh , dy vel reeriaght Yee er jeet er - gerrey diu .

text: But I say unto you , that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom , than for that city .
text2: Agh ta mish gra riu , dy bee eh ny sassey da Sodom ec y laa shen , na da ' n ard valley shen .

text: Woe unto thee , Chorazin ! woe unto thee , Bethsaida ! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon , which have been done in you , they had a great while ago repented , sitting in sackcloth and ashes .
text2: Smerg dhyt ' s Chorazin , smerg dhyt ' s Vethsaida : son dy beagh ny obbraghyn yindyssagh er ve jeant ayns Tyre as Sidon , t ' er ny ve jeant ayndiuish , veagh ad er ghoaill arrys foddey er dy henney ayns aanrit - sack as leoie .

text: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment , than for you .
text2: Agh bee kerraghey s ' eddrym er ny choyrt er Tyre as Sidon ec y vriwnys , na vees er ny choyrt erriuish .

text: And thou , Capernaum , which art exalted to heaven , shalt be thrust down to hell .
text2: As uss Chapernaum , ta dty ooash ] ey roshtyn gys niau , bee oo er dty hilgey sheese eys niurin .

text: He that heareth you heareth me ; and he that despiseth you despiseth me ; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me .
text2: Eshyn eaishtys riuish , t ' eh geaishtagh rhym ' s : as eshyn ta soiaghey beg jiuish , t ' eh soiaghey beg jeem ' s : as eshyn ta soiaghey beg jeem ' s , t ' eh soiaghey beg jehsyn ta er mychoyrt .

text: And the seventy returned again with joy , saying , Lord , even the devils are subject unto us through thy name .
text2: As haink y three - feed as jeih huggey reesht lesh boggey , gra , Hiarn , ta ny eer drogh - spyrrydyn biallagh dooin , trooid dty ennym ' s .

text: And he said unto them , I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Honnick mee Noid ny hanmey , myr tendreil , tuittym veih niau .

text: Behold , I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions , and over all the power of the enemy : and nothing shall by any means hurt you .
text2: Cur - my - ner , ta mish coyrt diu pooar dy chur fo - chosh ard - nieughyn as scorpionee , as ooilley pooar y noid ; as cha jean nhee ' sy theihll , er aght erbee , skielley diu .

text: Notwithstanding in this rejoice not , that the spirits are subject unto you ; but rather rejoice , because your names are written in heaven .
text2: Ny - yeih ayns shoh ny gow - jee boggey , dy vel ny spyrrydyn biallagh diu : agh gow - jee boggey smoo , dy vel ny enmyn eu scruit ayns niau .

text: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit , and said , I thank thee , O Father , Lord of heaven and earth , that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent , and hast revealed them unto babes : even so , Father ; for so it seemed good in thy sight .
text2: Ayns yn oor cheddin ghow Yeesey boggey ayns e spyrryd , as dooyrt eh , Ta mee cur booise dhyt , O Ayr Hiarn niau as thalloo , dy vel oo er cheiltyn ny reddyn shoh vouesyn ta creeney as tushtagh , as dy vel oo er hoilshaghey ad da oikanyn : shen dy jarroo myr te , Ayr , sonshen myr ve mie ayns dty hilley ' s .

text: All things are delivered to me of my Father : and no man knoweth who the Son is , but the Father ; and who the Father is , but the Son , and he to whom the Son will reveal him .
text2: Ta dy chooilley nhee er ny livrey dooys liorish my Ayr : as cha vel fys ec unnane erbee quoi yn Mac , agh yn Ayr ; ny quoi yn Ayr , agh yn Mac , as eshyn da nee yn Mac eh y hoilshaghey .

text: And he turned him unto his disciples , and said privately , Blessed are the eyes which see the things that ye see :
text2: As hyndaa eh gys e ostyllyn , as dooyrt eh er - lheh , Bannit ta ny sooillyn ta fakin ny reddyn ta shiuish dy akin .

text: For I tell you , that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see , and have not seen them ; and to hear those things which ye hear , and have not heard them .
text2: Son ta mee ginsh diu , dy vel ymmodee phadeyryn as reeaghyn er ve aignagh dy akin ny reddyn shen ta shiuish er vakin , as cha vel ad er vakin ad ; as dy chlashtyn ny reddyn ta shiuish dy chlashtyn , as cha vel ad er chlashtyn ad .

text: And , behold , a certain lawyer stood up , and tempted him , saying , Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: As cur - my - ner , hass fer - ynsee dy row jeh ' n leigh seose , erchee y phrowal eh , gra , Vainshter , cre t ' orrym ' s dy yannoo dy vod eiraght y ve aym ayns y vea veayn ?

text: He said unto him , What is written in the law ? how readest thou ?
text2: Dooyrt eshyn rish , Cre ta scruit ayns y leigh ? kys t ' ou lhaih ?

text: And he answering said , Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy strength , and with all thy mind ; and thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: As dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh , Ver oo graih da ' n Chiarn dty Yee lesh ooilley dty chree , as lesh ooilley dty annym , as lesh ooilley dty niart , as lesh ooilley dty aigney as da dty naboo myr dhyt hene .

text: And he said unto him , Thou hast answered right : this do , and thou shalt live .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , T ' ou er n ' ansoor dy mie : jean shoh , as yiow yn vea .

text: But he , willing to justify himself , said unto Jesus , And who is my neighbour ?
text2: Agh v ' eshyn booiagh eh - hene y heyrey , as dooyrt eh rish Yeesey , As quoi my naboo ?

text: And Jesus answering said , A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho , and fell among thieves , which stripped him of his raiment , and wounded him , and departed , leaving him half dead .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , gra , Hie dooinney dy row sheese veih Jerusalem gys Jericho , as huitt eh mastey maarlee , rooisht eh jeh e choamrey , as lhott ad eh , as hie ad rhymboo , erreish daue y er vaagail eh lieh - varroo .

text: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way : and when he saw him , he passed by on the other side .
text2: As haghyr eh da saggyrt dy row goll sheese y raad shen ; as tra honnick eh eh , hie eh shaghey er y derrey heu jeh .

text: And likewise a Levite , when he was at the place , came and looked on him , and passed by on the other side .
text2: As myrgeddin Levite , tra v ' eh ec yn ynnyd , haink eh as yeeagh eh er , as hie eh shaghey er y cheu elley .

text: But a certain Samaritan , as he journeyed , came where he was : and when he saw him , he had compassion on him ,
text2: Agh haink Samaritan dy row , myr v ' eh er e yurnah , raad v ' eh : as tra honnick eh eh , va chymmey echey er .

text: And went to him , and bound up his wounds , pouring in oil and wine , and set him on his own beast , and brought him to an inn , and took care of him .
text2: As hie eh huggey , as chiangle eh seose ny lhottyn echey , niee ad lesh ooil as feeyn , as hoie eh eh er e vaagh hene , as hug eh lesh eh gys thie - oast , as ghow eh kiarail jeh .

text: And on the morrow when he departed , he took out two pence , and gave them to the host , and said unto him , Take care of him ; and whatsoever thou spendest more , when I come again , I will repay thee .
text2: As laa ny vairagh tra v ' eh goll roish ghow eh daa pheesh dy argid as hug eh ad da mainshter y thie - oast as dooyrt eh rish , Gow kiarail jeh ; as cre - erbee smoo vaarys oo er , eeck - ym dhyt eh , tra hig - ym reesht .

text: Which now of these three , thinkest thou , was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves ?
text2: Quoi nish jeu shoh nyn droor , t ' ou uss dy smooinaghtyn , va ny naboo dasyn huitt mastey ny maarlee ?

text: And he said , He that shewed mercy on him . Then said Jesus unto him , Go , and do thou likewise .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Eshyn ren myghin y hoilshaghey er , Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish , Immee , as jean uss er yn aght cheddin .

text: Now it came to pass , as they went , that he entered into a certain village : and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house .
text2: Nish haink eh gy - kione , myr vad goll , dy jagh ad stiagh ayns balley beg dy row : as ren ben v ' ayns shen enmyssit Martha , eh y chuirrey gys y thie eck .

text: And she had a sister called Mary , which also sat at Jesus ' feet , and heard his word .
text2: As va shuyr eck enmyssit Moirrey hoie myrgeddin ec cassyn Yeesey , clashtyn e ghoo .

text: But Martha was cumbered about much serving , and came to him , and said , Lord , dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone ? bid her therefore that she help me .
text2: Agh va Martha tooillit lesh y phreish vooar vurree , as haink ee huggey , as dooyrt ee , Hiarn , nee dty aighey ' s eh dy vel my huyr er n ' aagail y currym orryms my lomarcan dy hirveish er y cheshaght ? abbyr r ' ee er - y - fa shen , ee dy chooney lhiam .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto her , Martha , Martha , thou art careful and troubled about many things :
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh ree , Martha , Martha , t ' ou ro - imneagh as seaghnit mysh ymmodee nheeghyn :

text: But one thing is needful : and Mary hath chosen that good part , which shall not be taken away from her .
text2: Agh un red ta ymmyrchagh . As ta Moirrey er reih yn ayrn vie shen , nagh bee er ny ghoaill ersooyl vo ' ee .

text: And it came to pass , that , as he was praying in a certain place , when he ceased , one of his disciples said unto him , Lord , teach us to pray , as John also taught his disciples .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' eh ec padjer ayns ynnyd dy row , tra daag eh jeh , dy dooyrt fer jeh e ostyllyn rish , Hiarn ynsee dooinyn dy ghoaill padjer , myr dynsee Ean myrgeddin da ny ynseydee echeysyn .

text: And he said unto them , When ye pray , say , Our Father which art in heaven , Hallowed be thy name . Thy kingdom come . Thy will be done , as in heaven , so in earth .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Tra ghoys shiu padjer , abbyr - jee , Ayr ain t ' ayns niau , Casherick dy row dty ennym . Dy jig dty reeriaght . Dty aigney dy row jeant er y thalloo , myr te ayns niau .

text: Give us day by day our daily bread .
text2: Cur dooin laa Iurg laa nyn arran gagh laa .

text: And forgive us our sins ; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us . And lead us not into temptation ; but deliver us from evil .
text2: As leih dooin nyn beccaghyn ; son ta shinyn myrgeddin leih da dy chooilley unnane ta ayns lhiastynys dooin . As ny leeid shin ayns miolagh , agh livrey shin veih olk .

text: And he said unto them , Which of you shall have a friend , and shall go unto him at midnight , and say unto him , Friend , lend me three loaves ;
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Quoi jiuish vees carrey echey , as hed huggey ec main - oie , as jir rish , Charrey , eeasee dou three bwilleenyn ;

text: For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me , and I have nothing to set before him ?
text2: Son ta dooinney - mooinjerey dou , va er e yurnah , er jeet hym , as cha vel monney aym dy hoiaghey roish :

text: And he from within shall answer and say , Trouble me not : the door is now shut , and my children are with me in bed ; I cannot rise and give thee .
text2: As freggyr - ee eshyn veih cheu - sthie gra , Ny boir mee : ta ' n dorrys nish jeight , as ta my chloan ' sy lhiabbee marym ; cha voddym girree dy chur dhyt .

text: I say unto you , Though he will not rise and give him , because he is his friend , yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth .
text2: Ta mee gra riu , Ga nagh n ' irree eh dy chur da , er - coontey dy nee e charrey eh : ny - yeih kyndagh rish yn jeeanid echey , irree eh , as ver eh da whilleen as vees eh ny eme .

text: And I say unto you , Ask , and it shall be given you ; seek , and ye shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened unto you .
text2: As ta mish gra riuish , Yeearree - jee , as yiow shiu : shir - jee , as nee shiu feddyn : bee - jee aignagh fosley y gheddyn , as bee eh er ny osley diu .

text: For every one that asketh receiveth ; and he that seeketh findeth ; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened .
text2: Son ta dy chooilley unnane ta geearree , geddyn : as y fer ta shirrey , feddyn : as eshyn ta aignagh fosley y gheddyn , bee eh er ny osley da .

text: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father , will he give him a stone ? or if he ask a fish , will he for a fish give him a serpent ?
text2: My nee mac arran y hirrey er fer jiuish ta ny ayr , nee clagh ver eh da ? ny my hirrys eh eeast , jean eh ayns ynnyd eeast ard - nieu y chur da ?

text: Or if he shall ask an egg , will he offer him a scorpion ?
text2: Ny my hirrys eh ooh , jeb eh scorpion da ?

text: If ye then , being evil , know how to give good gifts unto your children : how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him ?
text2: My ta toiggal er - y - fa shen euish , ta olk , kys dy choyrt giootyn mie da nyn gloan ; cre - woad smoo nee yn Ayr flaunyssagh eu yn Spyrryd Noo y choyrt dauesyn ta jannoo aghin huggey ?

text: And he was casting out a devil , and it was dumb . And it came to pass , when the devil was gone out , the dumb spake ; and the people wondered .
text2: As v ' eh tilgey magh drogh - spyrryd , as v ' eh balloo . As haink eh gy - kione , tra va ' n drogh - spyrryd er gholl ass dy loayr y balloo : as ghow yn pobble yindys .

text: But some of them said , He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils .
text2: Agh dooyrt paart jeu , She liorish Beelzebub , yn ard drogh - spyrryd , t ' eh castey drogh - spyrrydyn .

text: And others , tempting him , sought of him a sign from heaven .
text2: As va feallagh elley er - chee prowal eh shirrey er cowrey veih niau .

text: But he , knowing their thoughts , said unto them , Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation ; and a house divided against a house falleth .
text2: Agh eshyn toiggal ny smooinaghtyn oc dooyrt roo , Ta dy chooilley reeriaght ta girree - magh n ' oi hene , er ny choyrt mow : as thie ta n ' oi hene goll naardey .

text: If Satan also be divided against himself , how shall his kingdom stand ? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub .
text2: As my ta ' n jouyl girree - magh n ' oi hene , kys nee yn reeriaght echey shassoo ? er - y - fa dy vel shiu gra , dy nee liorish Beelzebub ta mish castey drogh - spyrrydyn .

text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils , by whom do your sons cast them out ? therefore shall they be your judges .
text2: As my ta mish liorish Beelzebub castey drogh - spyrrydyn , quoi liorish ta ny mec eu hene dy chastey ad ? bee adsyn er - y - fa shen ny briwnyn eu .

text: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils , no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you .
text2: Agh my ta mish liorish mair Yee tilgey magh drogh - spyrrydyn , fegooish dooyt ta reeriaght Yee er jeet erriuish .

text: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace , his goods are in peace :
text2: Tra ta dooinney - caggee eillit freayll arrey er e hie , ta e chooid sauchey .

text: But when a stronger than he shall come upon him , and overcome him , he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted , and divideth his spoils .
text2: Agh tra ta fer stroshey na eh soiaghey er , as geddyn yn varriaght , t ' eh goaill veih ooilley e eilley , huggey v ' eh treishteil , as t ' eh rheynn e chooid .

text: He that is not with me is against me : and he that gathereth not with me scattereth .
text2: Eshyn nagh vel lhiam , t ' eh m ' oi ; as eshyn nagh vel chymsaghey marym , t ' eh skeayley .

text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man , he walketh through dry places , seeking rest ; and finding none , he saith , I will return unto my house whence I came out .
text2: Tra ta ' n spyrryd neu - ghlen er gholl ass dooinney , t ' eh shooyll trooid faasaghyn fadaneagh , chee aash , agh ayns fardail , eisht t ' eh gra , Hem reesht gys my hie , veih haink mee .

text: And when he cometh , he findeth it swept and garnished .
text2: As tra t ' eh cheet , t ' eh dy gheddyn eh sceabit as soit magh dy stooamey .

text: Then goeth he , and taketh to him seven other spirits more wicked than himself ; and they enter in , and dwell there : and the last state of that man is worse than the first .
text2: Eisht t ' eh goll as goaill marish shiaght spyrrydyn elley , ny smessey na eh - hene , as t ' ad goll stiagh as cummal ayns shen : as ta stayd yerrinagh yn dooinney shen ny s ' doogh na ' n toshiaght .

text: And it came to pass , as he spake these things , a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice , and said unto him , Blessed is the womb that bare thee , and the paps which thou hast sucked .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' eh loayrt ny goan shoh , dy hrog ben dy row jeh ' n cheshaght seose e coraa , as dooyrt ee rish , Bannit ta ' n vrein ren oo y ymmyrkey , as ny keeaghyn t ' ou er yiole .

text: But he said , Yea rather , blessed are they that hear the word of God , and keep it .
text2: Agh dooyrt eshyn , Dy jarroo foddey s ' bannee t ' adsyn ta clashtyn goo Yee , as freayll eh .

text: And when the people were gathered thick together , he began to say , This is an evil generation : they seek a sign ; and there shall no sign be given it , but the sign of Jonas the prophet .
text2: As tra va ' n pobble er nyn jaglym chion dy cheilley , ghow eh toshiaght dy ghra , s ' drogh y cheeloghe shoh : t ' ad shirrey cowrey , as cha bee cowrey er ny choyrt daue , agh cowrey yn phadeyr Jonas .

text: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites , so shall also the Son of man be to this generation .
text2: Son myr va Jonas ny chowrey da ny Nineviteyn , er yn aght cheddin neesht vees Mac y dooinney da ' n cheeloghe shoh .

text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation , and condemn them : for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon ; and , behold , a greater than Solomon is here .
text2: Nee ben - rein y jiass girree seose ayns briwnys noi deiney yn cheeloghe shoh , as ad y gheyrey : son haink ish veih ardjyn sodjey magh y thallooin dy chlashtyn creenaght Solomon ; as cur - my - ner , ta fer syrjey na Solomon ayns shoh .

text: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : for they repented at the preaching of Jonas ; and , behold , a greater than Jonas is here .
text2: Nee deiney Nineveh girree seose ayns briwnys , as y cheeloghe shoh y gheyrey : son ghow adsyn arrys ec preacheil Yonas ; as cur - my - ner , ta fer syrjey na Jonas ayns shoh .

text: No man , when he hath lighted a candle , putteth it in a secret place , neither under a bushel , but on a candlestick , that they which come in may see the light .
text2: Cha vel dooinney erbee , tra t ' eh er voaddey cainle , dy choyrt ee ayns ynnyd follit , ny fo saagh ; agh ayns cainleyr , dy vod adsyn ta cheet stiagh yn soilshey y akin .

text: The light of the body is the eye : therefore when thine eye is single , thy whole body also is full of light ; but when thine eye is evil , thy body also is full of darkness .
text2: Yn tooill ta cur soilshey da ' n chorp : shen - y - fa tra ta dty hooill glen , bee dty chorp ooilley ayns slane soilshey : agh tra ta lheamys er dty hooill , bee dty chorp myrgeddin ayns slane dorraghys .

text: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness .
text2: Cur twoaie er - y - fa shen nagh bee yn soilshey ta aynyd ny ghorraghys .

text: If thy whole body therefore be full of light , having no part dark , the whole shall be full of light , as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light .
text2: My ta ooilley dty chorp er - y - fa shen ayns slane soilshey , gyn dorraghys ayns ayrn erbee , bee yn clane sollys , myr t ' ou , tra ta soilshey sollys ayd veih cainle ,

text: And as he spake , a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him : and he went in , and sat down to meat .
text2: As myr v ' eh loayrt , chuir Pharisee dy row eh gys jinnair marish : as hie eh stiagh , as hoie eh sheese gys bee .

text: And when the Pharisee saw it , he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner .
text2: As tra honnick yn Pharisee shoh , ghow eh yindys nagh niee eh ( e laueyn ) roish jinnair .

text: And the Lord said unto him , Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter ; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness .
text2: As dooyrt y Chiarn rish , Nish ta shiuish Phariseeyn glenney yn cappan as y claare er cheu - mooie : agh ta ' n cheu - sthie eu lane dy hranlaase as dy olkys .

text: Ye fools , did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also ?
text2: Gheiney vee - cheaylagh , nagh nee eshyn ren y cheu - mooie , ren y cheu - sthie myrgeddin ?

text: But rather give alms of such things as ye have ; and , behold , all things are clean unto you .
text2: Agh cur - jee lheid as t ' eu da ny boghtyn : as cur - my - ner , bee dy chooilley nhee glen diu .

text: But woe unto you , Pharisees ! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs , and pass over judgment and the love of God : these ought ye to have done , and not to leave the other undone .
text2: Agh smerg diuish Phariseeyn : son ta shiu jagheenys mynthey , rue , as dy chooilley horch dy lossreeyn , agh s ' beg ta shiu soiaghey jeh briwnys as graih Yee : ad shoh lhisagh shiu v ' er n ' yannoo , gyn faagail y chooid elley gyn jannoo .

text: Woe unto you , Pharisees ! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues , and greetings in the markets .
text2: Smerg diuish Phariseeyn : son shynney lhieu ny ard - stuill ayns ny kialteenyn , as sleih dy vannaghey diu ayns ny margaghyn .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye are as graves which appear not , and the men that walk over them are not aware of them .
text2: Smerg diuish scrudeyryn as Phariseeyn , chrauee - oalsey : son ta shiu myr oaiaghyn nagh vel ry - akin , as ny deiney ta shooyl harrystoo , cha vel fys oc dy vel ad ayn .

text: Then answered one of the lawyers , and said unto him , Master , thus saying thou reproachest us also .
text2: Eisht dreggyr fer jeh fir - ynsee yn leigh , as dooyrt eh rish , Vainshter , liorish shen y ghra , t ' ou dy oltooan shinyn myrgeddin .

text: And he said , Woe unto you also , ye lawyers ! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne , and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Smerg diuish neesht fir - ynsee yn leigh son ta shiu laadey deiney lesh erraghyn doillee dy ve er nyn ymmyrkey , as cha vel shiu hene bentyn rish ny er raghyn lesh unnane jeh nyn meir .

text: Woe unto you ! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets , and your fathers killed them .
text2: Smerg diuish : son ta shiu troggal lhiaghtyn ny phadeyryn , as ny ayraghyn eu ren y varroo ad .

text: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers : for they indeed killed them , and ye build their sepulchres .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta shiu gymmyrkey feanish dy vel shiu lowal jeh jannoo ny ayraghyn eu : son ren adsyn dy jarroo y varroo ad , as ta shiuish coamrey ny lhiaghtyn oc .

text: Therefore also said the wisdom of God , I will send them prophets and apostles , and some of them they shall slay and persecute :
text2: As shoh yn oyr ta creenaght Yee er ghra , Ver - ym huc phadeyryn , as ostyllyn , as paart jeu nee ad y varroo , as tranlaase y yannoo orroo :

text: That the blood of all the prophets , which was shed from the foundation of the world , may be required of this generation ;
text2: Dy vod fuill ooilley ny phadeyryn v ' er ny gheayrtey er - dy hoshiaght y theihll v ' er ny chooilleeney er y cheeloghe shoh

text: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias , which perished between the altar and the temple : verily I say unto you , It shall be required of this generation .
text2: Veih fuill Abel gys fuill Zacharias ren cherraghtyn eddyr yn altar as y chiamble : dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy bee eh er ny chooilleeney er y cheeloghe shoh .

text: Woe unto you , lawyers ! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge : ye entered not in yourselves , and them that were entering in ye hindered .
text2: Smerg diu fir - ynsee yn leigh : son ta shiu er ghoaill ersooyl ogher yn ysseree : cha jagh shiu stiagh shiu hene , as adsyn va goll stiagh , ren shiu y lhiettal .

text: And as he said these things unto them , the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently , and to provoke him to speak of many things :
text2: As tra v ' eh er ghra ny reddyn shoh roo , ren ny scrudeyryn as ny Phariseeyn toshiaght dy eginaghey , as dy ghreinnaghey eh dy loayrt jeh ymmodee reddyn :

text: Laying wait for him , and seeking to catch something out of his mouth , that they might accuse him .
text2: Lhie ayns farkiaght er e hon , as shegin er tayrtyn red ennagh ass e veeal son oyr plaiynt n ' oi .

text: In the mean time , when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people , insomuch that they trode one upon another , he began to say unto his disciples first of all , Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees , which is hypocrisy .
text2: Nish mysh y traa shen va ymmodee erskyn - earroo dy leih er nyn jaglym cooidjagh , ayns wheesh as dy row ad stampey yn derrey yeh er yn jeh elley , ghow eh toshiaght dy ghra rish e ostyllyn , Erskyn ooilley bee - jee twoaiagh jeh soorid ny Phariseeyn , ta shen dy ghra , craueeaght oalsey .

text: For there is nothing covered , that shall not be revealed ; neither hid , that shall not be known .
text2: Son cha vel nhee erbee follit nagh jig gys soilshey ; ny kiellit , nagh jig er - ash .

text: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light ; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops .
text2: Shen - y - fa cre - erbee ta shiuish er loayrt ayns y dorraghys , bee eh er ny chlashtyn ayns y toilshey : as shen ta shiu er ghra myr hannish , ayns shamyryn , bee eh er ny ockley magh er mullagh ny dhieyn .

text: And I say unto you my friends , Be not afraid of them that kill the body , and after that have no more that they can do .
text2: As ta mee gra riuish , my chaarjyn , Ny gow - jee aggle rouesyn varrys y corp , as ny lurg shen nagh vel arragh oc oddys ad y vannoo .

text: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear : Fear him , which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell ; yea , I say unto you , Fear him .
text2: Agh ver - yms raaue diu quoi roish ghoys shiu aggle : Gow - jee aggle roishyn , echey ta pooar , erreish da v ' er varroo dy hilgey ayns niurin ; dy jarroo ta mee dy ghra riu , Gow jee aggle roishyn .

text: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings , and not one of them is forgotten before God ?
text2: Nagh vel queig sperriu er nyn greck son daa farling , as cha vel unnane oc jarroodit kiongoyrt rish Jee ?

text: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered . Fear not therefore : ye are of more value than many sparrows .
text2: Agh ta eer renaigyn nyn ghing ooilley er nyn earroo . Ny gow - jee aggle er - y - fa shen : ta ny smoo dy ve soit jiuish , na jeh ymmodee sperriu .

text: Also I say unto you , Whosoever shall confess me before men , him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God :
text2: Myrgeddin ta mee gra riu , Quoi - erbee ghoys rhyms kiongoyrt rish deiney , nee yn Mac dooinney myrgeddin goaill rishyn kiongoyrt rish ainleyn Yee .

text: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God .
text2: Agh bee eshyn obbys mie fenish deiney , er ny obbal fenish ainleyn Yee .

text: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him : but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven .
text2: As quoi - erbee loayrys fockle noi Mac y dooinney , bee eh er ny leih da : agh dasyn ta loayrt goan - mollaghtagh noi yn Spyrryd Noo , cha bee eh er ny leih .

text: And when they bring you unto the synagogues , and unto magistrates , and powers , take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer , or what ye shall say :
text2: As tra ver ad lhieu shiu gys ny quaiylyn , as gys fir - reill as pooaraghyn , ny bee - jee imneagh kys ny cre nee shiu y reggyrt , ny cre nee shiu y ghra :

text: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say .
text2: Son ynsee yn Spyrryd Noo diu , ayns yn oor cheddin cre lhisagh shiu y ghra .

text: And one of the company said unto him , Master , speak to my brother , that he divide the inheritance with me .
text2: As dooyrt fer jeh ' n cheshaght rish Vainshter , loayr rish my vraar eh dy rheynn yn eiraght rhym .

text: And he said unto him , Man , who made me a judge or a divider over you ?
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Ghooinney , quoi t ' er my hoiaghey ' s seose son briw ny rheynneyder harrishdiu ?

text: And he said unto them , Take heed , and beware of covetousness : for a man ' s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Gow - jee tastey , as cur - jee twoaie jeh saynt : son cha vel maynrys bea yn dooinney lhie ayns mooarane e chooid - seihlt .

text: And he spake a parable unto them , saying , The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully :
text2: As loayr eh coraa - dorraghey roo , gra , Ren thalloo dooinney berchagh dy row mess y chur magh dy palchey .

text: And he thought within himself , saying , What shall I do , because I have no room where to bestow my fruits ?
text2: As smooinee eh rish hene , gra , Cre share dou jannoo , tra nagh vel boayl tashtee aym dy ghoaill my hroar ?

text: And he said , This will I do : I will pull down my barns , and build greater ; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh , Shoh nee ' m y yannoo : Lhieg - ym my hoaltyn , as trog - ym soaltyn smoo ; as shen y raad nee ' m ooilley my vess as my chooid y hashtey .

text: And I will say to my soul , Soul , thou hast much goods laid up for many years ; take thine ease , eat , drink , and be merry .
text2: As jir - ym rish my annym , O my annym , ta mooarane cooid ayd tashtit seose cour ymmodee bleeantyn : gow dty aash , ee , iu , as bee gennal .

text: But God said unto him , Thou fool , this night thy soul shall be required of thee : then whose shall those things be , which thou hast provided ?
text2: Agh dooyrt Jee rish , Uss ommydan yn oie noght vees dty annym er ny ghoaill void : quoi lesh eisht vees yn chooid shen t ' ou uss er jaglym ?

text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself , and is not rich toward God .
text2: Myr shoh ta eshyn ta tashtey seose berchys ny chour hene , as nagh vel berchagh ass lieh Yee .

text: And he said unto his disciples , Therefore I say unto you , Take no thought for your life , what ye shall eat ; neither for the body , what ye shall put on .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn , Shen y fa ta mish gra riuish , Ny bee - jee imneagh son nyn mea , cre nee shiu y ee : ny son nyn girp , cre ver shiu miu .

text: The life is more than meat , and the body is more than raiment .
text2: Ta ' n vea ny smoo dy ve soit jeh na beaghey , as y corp na coamrey .

text: Consider the ravens : for they neither sow nor reap ; which neither have storehouse nor barn ; and God feedeth them : how much more are ye better than the fowls ?
text2: Smooinee - jee er ny fee : son cha vel ad cuirr , ny buinn : cha vel thie stoyr ny soalt oc , as ta Jee dyn meaghey ad : As nagh vel shiuish foddey share na ny eeanlee ?

text: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit ?
text2: Quoi jiuish liorish smooinaghtyn dy imneagh oddys un chubit y chur gys e yrjid hene ?

text: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least , why take ye thought for the rest ?
text2: Mannagh vod shiuish wheesh shen hene y yannoo , cre ' n - fa ta shiu imneagh son y chooid elley ?

text: Consider the lilies how they grow : they toil not , they spin not ; and yet I say unto you , that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these .
text2: Gow - jee tastey jeh lileeyn ny magher agh kys t ' ad gaase , cha vel ad tooilleil , chamoo t ' ad sneeu : as foast ta mee gra riu , nagh row Solomon ayns ooilley e ghloyr er ny choamrey myr unnane jeu shoh .

text: If then God so clothe the grass , which is to day in the field , and to morrow is cast into the oven ; how much more will he clothe you , O ye of little faith ?
text2: My ta Jee eisht myr shoh coamrey blaa ny magheragh , ta jiu ' sy vagher , as mairagh ceaut ayns yn oghe : nagh jean eh foddey smoo er nyn son euish , O gheiney faase - chredjuagh ?

text: And seek not ye what ye shall eat , or what ye shall drink , neither be ye of doubtful mind .
text2: As ny bee - jee seaghnit mysh cre ee - ys , ny cre iu - ys shiu , chamoo bee - jee jeh aigney imneagh nagh bee eh twoaiagh jeh , as giaree eh eh veih my - cheilley , as pointee eh e chronney marish y vooinjer vee - chredjuagh .

text: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after : and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things .
text2: Son er ooilley ny reddyn shoh ta ashoonyn y theihll dy jeean aggindagh : agh ta fys ec yn Ayr eu dy vel shiu feme ny reddyn shoh .

text: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God ; and all these things shall be added unto you .
text2: Agh shir - jee hoshiaght reeriaght Yee , as bee shiu jeant magh lesh ooilley ny reddyn shoh .

text: Fear not , little flock ; for it is your Father ' s good pleasure to give you the kingdom .
text2: Ny gow - jee aggle my hioltane veg ; son she aigney - mie nyn Ayr eh ; dy chur diuish yn reeriaght .

text: Sell that ye have , and give alms ; provide yourselves bags which wax not old , a treasure in the heavens that faileth not , where no thief approacheth , neither moth corrupteth .
text2: Creck - jee ny t ' eu , as cur - jee da ny boghtyn : kiare - jee diu hene sporranyn nagh naase shenn , berchys ayns ny niaughyn nagh vel failleil , raad nagh vel y maarliagh cheet er - gerrey , ny ' n lhemeen cur mow .

text: For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
text2: Son raad ta nyn merchys , shen y raad vees y cree eu myrgeddin .

text: Let your loins be girded about , and your lights burning ;
text2: Lhig da ny meeghyn eu ve cryssit , as ny cainleyn eu foaddit ;

text: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord , when he will return from the wedding ; that when he cometh and knocketh , they may open unto him immediately .
text2: As shiu hene goll - rish deiney ta farkiaght son cheet - thie nyn Jiarn veih ' n vannish , ec y cheet echey tra nee eh cronkal dy vod ad fosley da chelleeragh .

text: Blessed are those servants , whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching : verily I say unto you , that he shall gird himself , and make them to sit down to meat , and will come forth and serve them .
text2: Bannit ta ny sharvaantyn shen yiow yn Chiarn er nyn arrey , tra hig eh : dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy gryss eh e gharmad mysh , as dy der eh orroo soie sheese gys bee , as dy jig eh magh dy hirveish orroo .

text: And if he shall come in the second watch , or come in the third watch , and find them so , blessed are those servants .
text2: As my hig eh ayns yn nah arrey , ny my hig eh ayns y trass arrey , as ad y gheddyn myr shen , bannit ta ' n vooinjer cheddin .

text: And this know , that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come , he would have watched , and not have suffered his house to be broken through .
text2: As shoh toig - jee , dy beagh fys er ve ec mainshter y thie cre ' n oor veagh y maarliagh er jeet , veagh eh er ve er e arrey , as cha lhiggagh eh da e hie v ' er ny vrishey stiagh .

text: Be ye therefore ready also : for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not .
text2: Bee - jee shiuish myrgeddin er - y - fa shen er nyn arrey : son hig Mac y dooinney ec oor nagh vel shiu smooinaghtyn er .

text: Then Peter said unto him , Lord , speakest thou this parable unto us , or even to all ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt Peddyr rish , Hiarn nee orrinyn t ' ou cheet ' sy choraa - dorraghey shoh , ny myrgeddin er ooilley ?

text: And the Lord said , Who then is that faithful and wise steward , whom his lord shall make ruler over his household , to give them their portion of meat in due season ?
text2: As dooyrt y Chiarn , Quoi eisht yn stiurt firrinagh as creeney shen nee e hiarn y yannoo ny er - reill er lught e hie , dy hirveish orroo nyn meaghey ayns traa cooie ?

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: S ' maynrey yn charvaant cheddin , yiow e hiarn tra hig eh jannoo myr shen .

text: Of a truth I say unto you , that he will make him ruler over all that he hath .
text2: Ayns firrinys ta mee gra riu , dy der eh da yn stiurtys er ooilley e chooid .

text: But and if that servant say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens , and to eat and drink , and to be drunken ;
text2: Agh my jir y charvaant shen ayns e chree , Ta my hiarn lhiggey shaghey dy heet ; as goaill er dy woalley ny fir - vooinjerey , as ny inneenyn , as dy ee , as dy iu , as dy ve er meshtey .

text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him , and at an hour when he is not aware , and will cut him in sunder , and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers .
text2: Hig chiarn y charvaant shen ec laa nagh bee eh jeeaghyn er e hon , as ayns oor nagh bee eh twoaiagh jeh , as giaree ehe eh veih my - cheilley , as pointee eh e chronney marish y vooinjer vee - chredjuagh .

text: And that servant , which knew his lord ' s will , and prepared not himself , neither did according to his will , shall be beaten with many stripes .
text2: As y charvaant shen va toiggal aigney e hiarn , as nagh dooar eh - hene aarloo , as nagh ren cordail rish e aigney , s ' mooar vees y kerraghey echey .

text: But he that knew not , and did commit things worthy of stripes , shall be beaten with few stripes . For unto whomsoever much is given , of him shall be much required : and to whom men have committed much , of him they will ask the more .
text2: Agh eshyn nagh row toiggal , as ren foiljyn va toilliu kerraghey , cha bee yn kerraghey echey cha trome . Son da quoi erbee ta mooarane er ny choyrt , ersyn vees mooarane er ny hirrey : as da quoi - erbee ta lane currit er e churrym , veihsyn nee sleih jeeaghyn son ny smoo

text: I am come to send fire on the earth ; and what will I if it be already kindled ?
text2: Haink mish dy chur aile er y thalloo , as cre ta my yeearree , agh dy bee eh hannah er ny oaddey ?

text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with ; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished !
text2: Agh ta bashtey ayms dy ve er my vashtey lesh , as kys ta mee eginit , derrey vees eh er ny chooilleeney ?

text: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth ? I tell you , Nay ; but rather division :
text2: Vel shiu smooinaghtyn dy daink mish dy chur shee er y thalloo ? Cha nee , ta mee gra riu , agh anvea .

text: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided , three against two , and two against three .
text2: Son veih shoh magh bee queig ayns un thie noi - ry - hoi , three noi jees , as jees noi three .

text: The father shall be divided against the son , and the son against the father ; the mother against the daughter , and the daughter against the mother ; the mother in law against her daughter in law , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Bee yn ayr noi yn mac , as y mac noi yn ayr ; yn voir noi yn inneen , as yn inneen noi yn voir yn voir - ' sy - leigh noi e ben chleuin , as y ven - chleuin noi e moir - ' sy - leigh .

text: And he said also to the people , When ye see a cloud rise out of the west , straightway ye say , There cometh a shower ; and so it is .
text2: As dooyrt eh myrgeddin rish y pobble , Tra heeys shiu bodjal troggal ass y sheear ; chelleeragh ta shiu gra , Ta frass cheet ; as shen myr te .

text: And when ye see the south wind blow , ye say , There will be heat ; and it cometh to pass .
text2: As tra ta ' n gheay - jiass sheidey , ta shiu gra , Bee chiass ayn , as te cheet gy - kione .

text: Ye hypocrites , ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth ; but how is it that ye do not discern this time ?
text2: Chrauee - oalsey , ta shiu son baght y ghoaill jeh neeal yn aer as y thalloo : agh kys te nagh vel shiu goaill baght jeh ' n earish shoh ?

text: Yea , and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right ?
text2: As cre ' n - fa myrgeddin nagh vel shiu eer j ' iu hene briwnys shen ny ta cairagh ?

text: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate , as thou art in the way , give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him ; lest he hale thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and the officer cast thee into prison .
text2: Tra t ' ou goll fenish yn er - reill marishyn ta ec streeu rhyt , jean ny oddys oo er y raad dy gheddyn rea rish ; er - aggle dy dayrn eh lesh oo gys y vriw , as dy livrey yn briw oo da ' n tidoor , as dy dilg eh shen oo ayns pryssoon .

text: I tell thee , thou shalt not depart thence , till thou hast paid the very last mite .
text2: Ta mee ginsh dhyt , nagh jig oo magh ass shen derrey t ' ou er n ' eeck yn farling s ' jerree .

text: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans , whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices .
text2: Va kionfenish ec y traa shen paart dinsh y da mychione ny Galileanee , yn uill oc va Pilate er gheayrtey maStey ( filill ) ny ourallyn oc .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans , because they suffered such things ?
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Vel shiuish sheiltyn dy row ny Galileanee shoh nyn beccee erskyn ooilley ny Galileanee , er - y - fa dy duillee ad lheid y baase ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Ta mee ginsh diu , Nagh row : agh mannagh gow shiuish arrys , nee shiu ooilley myrgeddin cherraghtyn .

text: Or those eighteen , upon whom the tower in Siloam fell , and slew them , think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem ?
text2: Ny yn hoght - jeig shen , orroo ren y toor nyns Siloam tuittym , as ad y varroo , vel shiu smooinaghtyn dy row ad nyn beccee erskyn ooilley cummaltee Yerusalem ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Ta mee ginsh diu , Nagh row : agh mannagh gow shiuish arrys , nee shiu ooilley myrgeddin cherraghtyn .

text: He spake also this parable ; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard ; and he came and sought fruit thereon , and found none .
text2: Loayr eh myrgeddin yn coraa - dorraghey shoh : va dooinoey dy row va billey - figgagh echey soit ayns e gharey - feeyney , as haink eh dy yeeaghyn row mess er , as cha dooar eh veg .

text: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard , Behold , these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree , and find none : cut it down ; why cumbereth it the ground ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish y ghareyder , Cur - my - ner , ny three bleeaney shoh ta mee er jeet dy yeeaghyn voin mess er y villey - figgagh shoh , as cha vel mee geddyn veg : giare sheese eh , cha vel eh agh goaill seose room hallooin .

text: And he answering said unto him , Lord , let it alone this year also , till I shall dig about it , and dung it :
text2: As dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh rish , Hiarn , lhig da shassoo blein elley , derrey neem ' s reurey mygeayrt y mysh as lhiassaghey eh .

text: And if it bear fruit , well : and if not , then after that thou shalt cut it down .
text2: As my nee eh mess y ymmyrkey , s ' mie shen : as mannagh jean , foddee oo ny lurg shen y ghiarey sheese eh .

text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath .
text2: As v ' eh gynsaghey ayns unnane jeh ny synagogueyn er y doonaght .

text: And , behold , there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years , and was bowed together , and could in no wise lift up herself .
text2: As cur - my - ner va ben ayns shen seaghnit lesh spyrryd doghanagh rish hoght bleeaney jeig , as v ' ee crybbit dy cheilley , as cha dod ee er aght erbee ec hene y yeeraghey .

text: And when Jesus saw her , he called her to him , and said unto her , Woman , thou art loosed from thine infirmity .
text2: As tra honnick Yeesey ee , deie eh urree huggey , as dooyrt eh r ' ee , Ven , t ' ou er dty eaysley veih dty ghoghan .

text: And he laid his hands on her : and immediately she was made straight , and glorified God .
text2: As hug eh e laueyn urree ; as er - y chooyl v ' ee er ny yannoo jeeragh , as ren ee Jee y ghloyraghey .

text: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation , because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day , and said unto the people , There are six days in which men ought to work : in them therefore come and be healed , and not on the sabbath day .
text2: As dreggyr fer - reill yn synagogue lesh jymmoose , er - yn - oyr dy row Yeesey er lheihys er laa yn doonaght , as dooyrt eh rish y pobble , Ta shey laa ayn ry - hoi gobbraghey : er ny laghyn shen er - y - fa shen tar - jee dy ve er nyn lheihys , as cha nee er laa yn doonaght .

text: The Lord then answered him , and said , Thou hypocrite , doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall , and lead him away to watering ?
text2: Eisht dreggyr y Chiarn eh , gra , Er crauee - oalsey , nagh vel dagh fer jiuish er y doonaght feaysley e ghow ny e assyl veih ' n staik , as dy chur lesh magh dy ushtaghey eh ?

text: And ought not this woman , being a daughter of Abraham , whom Satan hath bound , lo , these eighteen years , be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day ?
text2: As nagh lhisagh y ven shoh ta ny hinneen da Abraham , ee ta satan er chiangley , cur - my - ner ny hoght bleeaney jeig shoh , ve er ny eaysley veih yn vondiaght shoh er laa yn doonaght ?

text: And when he had said these things , all his adversaries were ashamed : and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him .
text2: As tra v ' eh er loayrt ny goan shoh , ghow ooilley e noidyn nearey : agh va ooilley yn pobble ayns ard - voggey son ooilley ny reddyn gloyroil va jeant liorishyn .
