text: Then said he , Unto what is the kingdom of God like ? and whereunto shall I resemble it ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh , Cre ta reeriaght Yee goll - rish ? as cre gys nee ' m y hoylaghey eh ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and cast into his garden ; and it grew , and waxed a great tree ; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it .
text2: Te goll - rish grine dy rass mustard , ren dooinney y ghoaill , as y hilgey ayns e gharey , as daase eh , as haink eh dy ve ny villey vooar : as ren eeanlee yn aer fastee y ghoaill ayns ny banglaneyn echey .

text: And again he said , Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God ?
text2: As reesht dooyrt eh , Cre gys nee ' m reeriaght Yee y hoylaghey ?

text: It is like leaven , which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal , till the whole was leavened .
text2: Te goll - rish soorid , ren ben y ghoaill as follaghey ayns three towseyn dy veinn , derrey va ' n clane soorit .

text: And he went through the cities and villages , teaching , and journeying toward Jerusalem .
text2: As hie eh magh trooid ny ard - valjyn as ny baljyn - cheerey , gynsaghey as goll er e hoshiaght gys Jerusalem .

text: Then said one unto him , Lord , are there few that be saved ? And he said unto them ,
text2: Eisht dooyrt fer rish , Hiarn , nee beggan ta er nyn sauail ? As dooyrt eh roo .

text: Strive to enter in at the strait gate : for many , I say unto you , will seek to enter in , and shall not be able .
text2: Streeu - jee shiuush dy gholl stiagh er y ghiat coon : son nee ymmodee , ta mee gra riu , shirrey goll stiagh , agh cha jig eh lhieu .

text: When once the master of the house is risen up , and hath shut to the door , and ye begin to stand without , and to knock at the door , saying , Lord , Lord , open unto us ; and he shall answer and say unto you , I know you not whence ye are :
text2: Keayrt dy vel mainshter y thie er n ' irree , as y dorrys dooint , as dy jean shiuish toshiaght dy hassoo er cheu - mooie , as dy chronkal ec y dorrys , gra , Hiarn , Hiarn , foshil dooin ; as freggyree eshyn as jir eh riu , Cha nione dou shiu , cre veih ta shiu :

text: Then shall ye begin to say , We have eaten and drunk in thy presence , and thou hast taught in our streets .
text2: Eisht gowee shiuish toshiaght dy ghra , Ta shin er n ' ee as er n ' iu ayns dty enish , as t ' ou er n ' ynsaghey ayns ny straidyn ain .

text: But he shall say , I tell you , I know you not whence ye are ; depart from me , all ye workers of iniquity .
text2: Agh jir eshyn , Ta mee ginsh diu , nagh nione dou shiu , cre veih ta shiu : ersooyl - jee voym ooilley shiuish ghrogh - yantee .

text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth , when ye shall see Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , and all the prophets , in the kingdom of God , and you yourselves thrust out .
text2: Shen - y - raad vees keayney as snaggeraght feeacklyn , tra hee shiu Abraham , aa Isaac as Jacob as ooilley ny phadeyryn ayns reeriaght Yee , as shiu hene er nyn yioolaey magh .

text: And they shall come from the east , and from the west , and from the north , and from the south , and shall sit down in the kingdom of God .
text2: As hig ad veih ' n niar , as veih ' n neear , as veih ' n twoaie as veih ' n jiass , as soie - ee ad sheese ayns reeriaght - Yee .

text: And , behold , there are last which shall be first , and there are first which shall be last .
text2: As cur - my - ner , ta er - jerrey vees hoshiaght , as ta hoshiaght vees er - jerrey .

text: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees , saying unto him , Get thee out , and depart hence : for Herod will kill thee .
text2: Yn laa cheddin , haink shiartanse jeh ny Phariseeyn , as dooyrt ad rish , Fow ersooyl , as immee royd veih shoh ; son ta Herod sleeuit er dty rioys y ghoaill .

text: And he said unto them , Go ye , and tell that fox , Behold , I cast out devils , and I do cures to day and to morrow , and the third day I shall be perfected .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Immee - jee shiuish as insh - jee da ' n shynnagh shen , Cur - my - ner , ta mee castey drogh - spyrrydyn , as lheihys doghanyn jiu as mairagh , as y trass laa bee ' m er my ghloyraghey .

text: Nevertheless I must walk to day , and to morrow , and the day following : for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem .
text2: Ny yeih , Shegin dou shooyl jiu as mairagh , as y laa er - giyn : son s ' coan oddys phadeyr cherraghtyn agh ayns Jerusalem .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , which killest the prophets , and stonest them that are sent unto thee ; how often would I have gathered thy children together , as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: O Yerusalem , Yerusalem , ta cur dy baase ny phadeyryn , as dyn glaghey adsyn t ' er nyn goyrt er chaghteraght hood : cre cha mennick as va mish aggindagh v ' er hagIym dty chloan cooidjagh , myr ta kiark clussaghey e aalagh fo my skianyn , agh cha bailliu shen !

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate : and verily I say unto you , Ye shall not see me , until the time come when ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Cur - my - ner , ta ' n thie eu faagit diu follym - faase : as dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , nagh vaik shiu mish maghey shoh , derrey hig yn traa dy jir shiu , Bannit ta eshyn ta cheet ayns ennym y Chiarn .

text: And it came to pass , as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day , that they watched him .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , tra v ' eh er gholl stiagh ayns thie fer jeh ny ard Phariseeyn dy ee arran er y doonaght , dy row sooill oc er .

text: And , behold , there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy .
text2: As cur - my - ner , va dooinney kionfenish , va ' n dropsee er .

text: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees , saying , Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day ?
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as loayr eh rish fir - ynsee yn leigh as rish ny Phariseeyn , gra , Vel eh lowal dy lheihys er laayn doonaght ?

text: And they held their peace . And he took him , and healed him , and let him go ;
text2: As v ' ad nyn - dhost . As ghow eh as laanee eh eh , as lhig eh yn raad da :

text: And answered them , saying , Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit , and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day ?
text2: As dreggyr eh ad , gra , Quoi j ' iu vees dow ny assyl echey er huittym ayns jeeg , nagh jean jeeragh y hayrn ass eh er y doonaght ?

text: And they could not answer him again to these things .
text2: As cha row ansoor erbee oc dy choyrt gys ny goan shoh .

text: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden , when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms ; saying unto them ,
text2: As loayr eh coraa - dorraghey rish ny goaldee , tra hug eh tastey kys v ' ad reih ny stuill byrjey ; gra roo ,

text: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding , sit not down in the highest room ; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him ;
text2: Tra t ' ou cuirt liorish dooinney erbee gys bannish , ny soie sheese er y stoyl syrjey ; er - aggle dy bee dooinney s ' ooasle na uss er ny chuirrey liorish ;

text: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee , Give this man place ; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room .
text2: As dy jig eshyn ren shiu nyn neesht y chuirrey , as dy jir eh rhyt , Cur raad da ' n dooinney shoh ; as dy jean oo toshiaght lesh nearey dy ghoaill y stoyl s ' inshley .

text: But when thou art bidden , go and sit down in the lowest room ; that when he that bade thee cometh , he may say unto thee , Friend , go up higher : then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee .
text2: Agh tra vees oo cuirt , immee , as soie sheese er y stoyl s ' inshley ; tra hig eshyn ren dty chuirrey , dy vod eh gra rhyt , Charrey , gow seose ny syrjey : eisht bee ooashley ayd ayns yn enish ocsyn ta nyn soie ec bee mayrt :

text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Son quoi - erbee ta dy hoiaghey eh - hene seose , bee eh er ny injillaghey ; as eshyn ta dy injillaghey eh - hene , bee eh er ny hoiaghey seose .

text: Then said he also to him that bade him , When thou makest a dinner or a supper , call not thy friends , nor thy brethren , neither thy kinsmen , nor thy rich neighbours ; lest they also bid thee again , and a recompence be made thee .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rishyn ren y chuirrey eh , Tra t ' ou jannoo jinnair ny shibber , ny cuir dty chaarjyn , ny dty vraaraghyn , ny dty gheiney - mooinjerey , ny dty naboonyn berchagh ; er - aggle dy jean adsyn oo y chuirrey reesht , as dy bee lhiassaghey er ny yannoo dhyt .

text: But when thou makest a feast , call the poor , the maimed , the lame , the blind :
text2: Agh tra t ' ou jannoo cuirraghyn , eie er ny boghtyn , ny baccee , ny croobee , as ny doail :

text: And thou shalt be blessed ; for they cannot recompense thee : for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just .
text2: As bee oo bannit ; son cha vod adsyn cooilleeney ' chur dhyt : son bee oo cooilleenit ec irree - reesht y chloan chairagh .

text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things , he said unto him , Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God .
text2: As tra cheayll fer jeusyn va nyn soie ec bee marish ny goan shoh , dooyrt eh rish , Bannit ta eshyn ee - ys arran ayns reeriaght Yee .

text: Then said he unto him , A certain man made a great supper , and bade many :
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish , Ren dooinney dy row shibber vooar , as chuir eh ymmodee :

text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden , Come ; for all things are now ready .
text2: As hug eh magh e harvaant ec traa shibberagh dy ghra rish ny goaldee , Tar - jee , son ta dy chooilley nhee nish aarloo .

text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse . The first said unto him , I have bought a piece of ground , and I must needs go and see it : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: As ren ad ooilley toshiaght lesh un aigney dy yannoo leshtalyn . Dooyrt y chied er , Ta mee er chionnaghey peesh dy halloo , as shegin dou goll dy yeeaghyn er : guee - ym ort , jean my leshtal .

text: And another said , I have bought five yoke of oxen , and I go to prove them : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: As dooyrt fer elley , Ta mee er chionnaghey queig chubbil dy ghew , as ta mee goll dy phowal ad : ta mee guee ort jean my leshtal .

text: And another said , I have married a wife , and therefore I cannot come .
text2: As dooyrt fer elley , Ta mee er phoosey ben , as er - y - fa shen cha voddym cheet .

text: So that servant came , and shewed his lord these things . Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant , Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city , and bring in hither the poor , and the maimed , and the halt , and the blind .
text2: Myr shen haink y charvaant cheddin , as hoilshee eh da e hiarn ny reddyn shoh . Eisht va mainshter y thie jymmoosagh , as dooyrt eh rish e harvaant , Gow magh dy tappee gys straidyn as raaidyn yn ard - valley , as cur lhiat stiagh ayns shoh ny boghtyn , as ny baccee , as ny croobee , as ny doail :

text: And the servant said , Lord , it is done as thou hast commanded , and yet there is room .
text2: As dooyrt y charvaant , Hiarn , te jeant myr t ' ou er harey , as foast ta room .

text: And the lord said unto the servant , Go out into the highways and hedges , and compel them to come in , that my house may be filled .
text2: As dooyrt y chiarn rish y charvaant , Gow magh gys ny raaidyn mooarey as ny cleigh , as guee orroo dy heet stiagh , dy vod my hie ve er ny lhieeney .

text: For I say unto you , That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper .
text2: Son ta mee gra riu , nagh jean fer jeh ny deiney va cuirt , blashtyn jeh my hibber ,

text: And there went great multitudes with him : and he turned , and said unto them ,
text2: As hie earrooyn mooarey dy leih marish : as hyndaa eh , as dooyrt eh roo ,

text: If any man come to me , and hate not his father , and mother , and wife , and children , and brethren , and sisters , yea , and his own life also , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: My hig dooinney erbee hym ' s , as nagh vel graih sloo echey er e ayr as e voir , as e ven , as e chloan , as e vraaraghyn , as e hayraghyn , dy jarroo , as er e vioys hene ( na orrym ' s ) cha vod eh dy firrinagh gynsaghey voym ' s .

text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross , and come after me , cannot be my disciple .
text2: As quoi - erbee nagh vel gymmyrkey e chrosh , as cheet geiyrt orrym ' s , cha vod eh ve ny eiyrtyssagh dooys .

text: For which of you , intending to build a tower , sitteth not down first , and counteth the cost , whether he have sufficient to finish it ?
text2: Quoi jiuish ta kiarail toor y hroggal , nagh vel soie sheese hoshiaght , as coontey yn cost , vel wheesh echey as ver mullagh er ?

text: Lest haply , after he hath laid the foundation , and is not able to finish it , all that behold it begin to mock him ,
text2: Er - aggle erreish da yn undin y boiaghey , as nagh vel yn fort echey dy chur kione er , dy jean ooilley nee fakin eh toshiaght dy chraidey mysh ,

text: Saying , This man began to build , and was not able to finish .
text2: Gra , Ren y dooinney shoh toshiaght dy vuildal , as cha row fort echey kione y cur er e obbyr .

text: Or what king , going to make war against another king , sitteth not down first , and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand ?
text2: Ny cre ' n ree ragh dy yannoo caggey noi ree elley , nagh soiagh sheese hoshiaght dy ghoaill coyrle , vel eh son goll magh lesh jeih thousaneyn ny whail echeysyn ta cheet n ' oi lesh feed thousane ?

text: Or else , while the other is yet a great way off , he sendeth an ambassage , and desireth conditions of peace .
text2: Er - nonney , choud as ta ' n ree elley foddey veih , t ' eh cur chaghteraght huggey , as chebbal conaantyn shee .

text: So likewise , whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Myr shen myrgeddin quoi - erbee jiuish , nagh vel treigeil ooilley ny t ' echey , cha vod eh ve ny eiyrtyssagh dooys .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be seasoned ?
text2: Ta sollan mie : agh my ta ' n sollan er choayl e vlass , kys hig e vree ayn reesht ?

text: It is neither fit for the land , nor yet for the dunghill ; but men cast it out . He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Cha vel ymmyd ayn son y thalloo , ny foast son y torran ; agh ta deiney dy cheau magh eh . Eshyn ta cleayshyn echey dy chlashtyn , lhig da clashtyn .

text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him .
text2: Eisht haink er - gerrey da ooilley ny publicanee as ny peccee dy eaishtagh ; rish .

text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured , saying , This man receiveth sinners , and eateth with them .
text2: As ren ny Phariseeyn as ny scrudeyryn tallagh , gra , Ta ' n dooinney shoh goaill rish peccee , as gee maroo .

text: And he spake this parable unto them , saying ,
text2: as loayr eh yn coraa - dorraghey shoh roo , gra ,

text: What man of you , having an hundred sheep , if he lose one of them , doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness , and go after that which is lost , until he find it ?
text2: Quoi yn dooinney ny mast ' euish ta keead keyrrey echey , as coayl unnane jeu nagh vel eh faagail yn chiare - feed as yn nuy jeig ayns yn aasagh , as goll dy hirrey yn cheyrrey chailjey , derrey t ' eh dy gheddyn ee ?

text: And when he hath found it , he layeth it on his shoulders , rejoicing .
text2: As tra t ' eh er gheddyn ee , t ' eh dy choyrt ee er e gheayltyn , goaill boggey .

text: And when he cometh home , he calleth together his friends and neighbours , saying unto them , Rejoice with me ; for I have found my sheep which was lost .
text2: As tra t ' eh cheet thie , t ' eh geamagh er e chaarjyn as e naboonyn cooidjagh , as gra roo , Gow - Jee boggey marym , son ta mee er gheddyn my cheyrrey va caillit .

text: I say unto you , that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth , more than over ninety and nine just persons , which need no repentance .
text2: Ta mee gra riu , dy bee boggey myrgeddin ayns niau , jeh un pheccagh ta goaill arrys , ny smoo na jeh kiare - feed as nuy persoonyn jeig cairagh , nagh vel feme arrys .

text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver , if she lose one piece , doth not light a candle , and sweep the house , and seek diligently till she find it ?
text2: Ny cre ' n ven ta jeih peeshyn dy argid eck , as ee dy choayl un pheesh , nagh vel ee foaddey cainle , as sceabey yn thie , as shirrey dy kiaralagh , derrey t ' ee dy gheddyn eh ?

text: And when she hath found it , she calleth her friends and her neighbours together , saying , Rejoice with me ; for I have found the piece which I had lost .
text2: As tra t ' ee er gheddyn eh , t ' ee geamagh er e caarjyn as e naboonyn cooidjagh , gra , Gow - jee boggey marym , son ta mee er gheddyn yn pheesh ren mee y choayl .

text: Likewise , I say unto you , there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth .
text2: Myrgeddin ta mee gra riu , dy vel boggey ayns fenish ainleyn Yee jeh un pheccagh ta goaill arrys .

text: And he said , A certain man had two sons :
text2: As dooyrt eh , Va daa vac ec dooinney dy row :

text: And the younger of them said to his father , Father , give me the portion of goods that falleth to me . And he divided unto them his living .
text2: A s dooyrt y fer saa rish e ayr , Ayr , cur dooys yn ayrn dy chooid ta my chour . As rheynn eh e eh chooid orroo .

text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together , and took his journey into a far country , and there wasted his substance with riotous living .
text2: As laghyn ny lurg shen , hymsee yn mac saa ooilley cooidjagh as ghow eh jurnah gys cheer foddey , as ayns shen hug eh jummal er e chooid liorish baghey rouanagh .

text: And when he had spent all , there arose a mighty famine in that land ; and he began to be in want .
text2: As tra va ooilley baarit echey , dirree genney vooar ayns y cheer shen ; as ren eh toshiaght dy ve ayns feme .

text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country ; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine .
text2: As hie eh as daill eh eh - hene rish cummaltagh jeh ' n cheer shen ; as hug eshyn eh magh gys ny magheryn echey dy ve son bochilley muickey .

text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat : and no man gave unto him .
text2: As by - vian lesh e volg y lhieeney lesh ny bleaystyn va ny muckyn dy ee : as cha row dooinney erbee hug cooney da .

text: And when he came to himself , he said , How many hired servants of my father ' s have bread enough and to spare , and I perish with hunger !
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet huggey hene , dooyrt eh , Nagh nhimmey sharvaant failt t ' ec my ayr ta nyn saie arran oc , as fooilliagh , as ta mish goll mow laccal beaghey !

text: I will arise and go to my father , and will say unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and before thee ,
text2: Trog - ym orrym , as hem roym gys my ayr , as jir - ym rish , Ayr , ta mee er n ' yannoo peccah noi niau , as kiongoyrt rhyt ' s ,

text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
text2: As cha vel mee ny - sodjey feeu dy ve enmyssit dty vac : dell rhym myr
column6: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
column8: rish fer jeh dty harvaantyn sailt .

text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
text2: As cha vel mee ny - sodjey feeu dy ve enmyssit dty vac : dell rhym myr
column6: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
column8: rish fer jeh dty harvaantyn sailt .

text: And he arose , and came to his father . But when he was yet a great way off , his father saw him , and had compassion , and ran , and fell on his neck , and kissed him .
text2: As hrog eh er , as haink eh gys e ayr . Agh tra v ' eh foast foddey veih , honnick e ayr eh , as va chymmey echey er , as roie eh , as ghow eh eh ayns e roihaghyn as phaag eh eh .

text: And the son said unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and in thy sight , and am no more worthy to be called thy son .
text2: As dooyrt y mac rish , Ayr , ta mee er n ' yannoo peccah noi niau , as ayns dty hilley ' s , as cha vel mee ny - sodjey feeu dy ve enmyssit dty vac .

text: But the father said to his servants , Bring forth the best robe , and put it on him ; and put a ring on his hand , and shoes on his feet :
text2: Agh dooyrt yn ayr rish e harvaantyn , Cur - jee lhieu magh yn coamrey share , as cur - jee er eh , as cur - jee fainey er e laue , as braagyn er e chassyn .

text: And bring hither the fatted calf , and kill it ; and let us eat , and be merry :
text2: As cur - jee lhieu ayns shoh yn lheiy beiyht , as marr - jee eh ; as lhig dooin gee as ve gennal .

text: For this my son was dead , and is alive again ; he was lost , and is found . And they began to be merry .
text2: Son v ' eh shoh my vac marroo , as t ' eh bio reesht ; v ' eh caillit , as t ' eh er ny gheddyn reesht . As ren ad toshiaght dy yannoo gien mie .

text: Now his elder son was in the field : and as he came and drew nigh to the house , he heard musick and dancing .
text2: Nish va ' n mac shinney mooie ' sy vagher : as tra haink eh er - gerrey da ' n thie , cheayll eh kiaulleeaght as daunsin .

text: And he called one of the servants , and asked what these things meant .
text2: As deie eh er fer jeh ' n vooinjer , as denee eh cre son va shoh .

text: And he said unto him , Thy brother is come ; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf , because he hath received him safe and sound .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Ta dty vraar er jeet thie ; as ta dty ayr er varroo yn lheiy beiyht , er - yn - oyr dy vel eh er jeet thie huggey slane follan .

text: And he was angry , and would not go in : therefore came his father out , and intreated him .
text2: As v ' eh feer chorree , as cha baillish goll stiagh : shen - y - fa haink e ayr magh , as vreag eh eh .

text: And he answering said to his father , Lo , these many years do I serve thee , neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment : and yet thou never gavest me a kid , that I might make merry with my friends :
text2: As dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh rish e ayr , Cur - my - ner , ta mish rish whilleen blein shen ayns dty hirveish , chamoo ren mee rieau noi dty aigney , as foast cha dug oo dou rieau wheesh mannan , dy yannoo gien marish my gheiney - mooinjerey :

text: But as soon as this thy son was come , which hath devoured thy living with harlots , thou hast killed for him the fatted calf .
text2: Agh cha leah as v ' eh shoh dty vac er jeet , ta er vaarail dty chooid er streebeeyn t ' ou er varroo er e hon yn lheiy beiyht .

text: And he said unto him , Son , thou art ever with me , and all that I have is thine .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Vac , t ' ou er ny ve kinjagh marym , as lhiat ' s ooilley ny t ' aym .

text: It was meet that we should make merry , and be glad : for this thy brother was dead , and is alive again ; and was lost , and is found .
text2: Ve cooie dooin ve gennal , as boggey y ghoaill : son v ' eh shoh dty vraar marroo as t ' eh bio reesht : v ' eh caillit , as t ' eh er ny gheddyn .

text: And he said also unto his disciples , There was a certain rich man , which had a steward ; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods .
text2: AS dooyrt eh myrgeddin rish e ostyllyn , Va dooinney berchagh dy row as stiurt echey , va er ny chassid huggey son jummal e chooid .

text: And he called him , and said unto him , How is it that I hear this of thee ? give an account of thy stewardship ; for thou mayest be no longer steward .
text2: As deie eh er , as dooyrt eh rish , Kys dy vel mee clashtyn shoh jeed ? cur coontey jeh dty stiurtys : son cha vod oo ve ny sodjey dty stiurt ,

text: Then the steward said within himself , What shall I do ? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship : I cannot dig ; to beg I am ashamed .
text2: Eisht dooyrt y stiurt rish hene , Cre nee ' m ? son ta my hiarn goaill y stiurtys voym : cha voddym reurey , as dy huill ny dhieyn ta nearey orrym .

text: I am resolved what to do , that , when I am put out of the stewardship , they may receive me into their houses .
text2: Shoh ta mee kiarail dy yannoo tra chaill - ym y stiurtys , dy vod paart jeu goaill mee stiagh ayns ny thieyn oc .

text: So he called every one of his lord ' s debtors unto him , and said unto the first , How much owest thou unto my lord ?
text2: Er shoh deie eh orroosyn ooilley v ' ayns lhiastynys da e hiarn , as dooyrt eh rish y chied er , Cre - woad t ' ou uss dy lhiastyn dy my hiarn ?

text: And he said , An hundred measures of oil . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and sit down quickly , and write fifty .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Keead towse dy ooil As dooyrt eh rish , Gow dty lioar , as soie sheese - dy tappee , as scrieu jeih as da - eed .

text: Then said he to another , And how much owest thou ? And he said , An hundred measures of wheat . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and write fourscore .
text2: As doogrt eh rish fer elley , As cre - woad t ' ou uss dy lhiastyn ? As dooyrt eh , Keead owse dy churnaght . As dooyrt eh rish , Gow dty lioar as scrieu kiare - feed .

text: And the lord commended the unjust steward , because he had done wisely : for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light .
text2: As voyll y chiarn y stiurt neu - chairagh , er - y - fa dy row eh er n ' yannoo dy creeney : son ta cloan y theihll shoh ayns nyn sheeloghe ny s ' creeney na cloan y toilshey .

text: And I say unto you , Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness ; that , when ye fail , they may receive you into everlasting habitations .
text2: As ta mee gra riu , Jean - jee diu hene caarjyn liorish y mammon molteyragh ; tra nee shiu failleil dy vod ad shiu y ghoaill stiagh gys ny ynnydyn vaghee dy bragh farraghtyn .

text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much : and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much .
text2: Eshyn ta ynrick ayns yn nhee s ' fardalee , t ' eh ynrick myrgeddin ayns mooarane : as eshyn ta neu - charragh ayns y nhee s ' fadalee , t ' eh neu - chairagh myrgeddin ayns mooarane .

text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon , who will commit to your trust the true riches ?
text2: Mannagh vel shiu er - y - fa shen er ve ynrick ayns y mammon molteyragh , quoi ver yn verchys firrinagh fo nyn gurrym ?

text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man ' s , who shall give you that which is your own ?
text2: As mannagh vel shiu er ve firrinagh ayns ny ta lesh dooinney elley , quoi ver diu ny vees lhieu hene ?

text: No servant can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: Cha vod sharvaant erbee daa vainshter y hirveish : son eddyr ver eh feoh da ' n derrey yeh as graih da ' n jeh elley ; er nonney cummee eh gys y derrey yeh , as soie - ee eh beg jeh ' n jeh elley . Cha vod shiu Jee as mammon y hirveish .

text: And the Pharisees also , who were covetous , heard all these things : and they derided him .
text2: As cheayll ny Phariseeyn myrgeddin va sayntoilagh , ooilley ny reddyn shoh : as ren ad gannidys er .

text: And he said unto them , Ye are they which justify yourselves before men ; but God knoweth your hearts : for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Shiuish yn vooinjer ta dy heyrey shiu hene kiongoyrt rish deiney : agh ta fys ec Jee er ny creeaghyn eu : son ta shen ta dy mooar soit jeh mastey deiney , feohdoil ayns shilley Yee .

text: The law and the prophets were until John : since that time the kingdom of God is preached , and every man presseth into it .
text2: Va ' n leigh as ny phadeyryn derrey Ean : er - dyn traa shen , ta reeriaght Yee er ny phreacheil , as ta dy chooilley ghooinney chionney stiagh huggey .

text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass , than one tittle of the law to fail .
text2: Agh te ny sassey da ' n aer as da ' n thalloo dy herraghtyn , na da un floag jeh ' n leigh dy ailleil .

text: Whosoever putteth away his wife , and marrieth another , committeth adultery : and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery .
text2: Quoi - erbee scarrys rish e ven , as phoosys ben elley , t ' eh brishey poosey : as quoi - erbee phoosys ish ta scarrit veih e sheshey , t ' eh brishey poosey .

text: There was a certain rich man , which was clothed in purple and fine linen , and fared sumptuously every day :
text2: Va dooinney berchagh dy row va coamrit ayns gorrym - jiarg , as sheeidey , as farrail dy soaillagh dy chooilley laa .

text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus , which was laid at his gate , full of sores ,
text2: As va boght dy row va enmyssit Lazarus , va ny lhie ec y ghiat echey lane dy hingyn ,

text: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man ' s table : moreover the dogs came and licked his sores .
text2: As geearree dy ve jeant magh lesh y vrooillagh va tuittym jeh boayrd y dooinney berchagh : agh haink ny eer moddee as sliee ad ny chingyn echey .

text: And it came to pass , that the beggar died , and was carried by the angels into Abraham ' s bosom : the rich man also died , and was buried ;
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , dy dooar y dooinney boght baase , as dy dug dy ainleyn lhieu eh gys oghrish Abraham : hooar y dooinney berchagh myrgeddin baase , as v ' eh er ny oanluckey .

text: And in hell he lift up his eyes , being in torments , and seeth Abraham afar off , and Lazarus in his bosom .
text2: As ayns niurin , raad v ' eh er ny horchaghey , hrog eh seose e hooillyn , as honnick eh Abraham foddey veih , as Lazarus ayns e oghrish .

text: And he cried and said , Father Abraham , have mercy on me , and send Lazarus , that he may dip the tip of his finger in water , and cool my tongue ; for I am tormented in this flame .
text2: As deie eh as dooyrt eh , Ayr Abraham , jean myghin orrym , as cur Lazarus , dy vod eh baare e vair y hummey ayns ushtey , as my hengey y eayraghey ; son ta mee er my horchaghey ayns y lossey shoh .

text: But Abraham said , Son , remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things , and likewise Lazarus evil things : but now he is comforted , and thou art tormented .
text2: Agh dooyrt Abrabam , Vac , cooinee uss ayns earish dty vea dy row ayd ' s dy chooilley nhee mie , as myrgeddin ec Lazarus cha row monney agh seaghyn : agh nish t ' eshyn er ny gherjaghey , as t ' ou uss er dty horchaghey ,

text: And beside all this , between us and you there is a great gulf fixed : so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot ; neither can they pass to us , that would come from thence .
text2: As marish shoh ooilley , ta eddyr shinyn as shiuish diunid vooar soit : myr shen adsyn ta aignagh dy gholl yeih shoh hiuish , cha vod ad ; chamoo oddys adsyn cheet hooinyn bailliu cheet veih shen .

text: Then he said , I pray thee therefore , father , that thou wouldest send him to my father ' s house :
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh , Ta mee guee ort er - y - fa shen , ayr , dy choyrt eh gys thie my ayrey :

text: For I have five brethren ; that he may testify unto them , lest they also come into this place of torment .
text2: Son ta queig braaraghyn aym ; dy vod eh feanish y ymmyrkey daue , nagh jig adsyn myrgeddin gys y boayl shoh dy horchagh .

text: Abraham saith unto him , They have Moses and the prophets ; let them hear them .
text2: Dooyrt Abraham rish , Ta Moses as ny phadeyryn oc ; lhig daue clashtyn adsyn .

text: And he said , Nay , father Abraham : but if one went unto them from the dead , they will repent .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Cha nee , O ayr Abraham : agh dy ragh chaghter huc veih ny merriu , ghoghe ad arrys .

text: And he said unto him , If they hear not Moses and the prophets , neither will they be persuaded , though one rose from the dead .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Mannagh der ad geill da Moses as ny phadeyryn , cha greidjagh ad , ga dy n ' irragh fer veih ny merriu .

text: Then said he unto the disciples , It is impossible but that offences will come : but woe unto him , through whom they come !
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn , Cha vod eh ve , agh dy bee oyryn peccah ayn : agh smerg dasyn liorish hig ad .

text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he cast into the sea , than that he should offend one of these little ones .
text2: Veagh eh ny bare dasyn clagh - wyllin ve croghit mysh e wannal , as eh dy ve baiht ayns y cheayn , na eh dy hayrn gys peccah unnane jeh ' n vooinjer veggey shoh .

text: Take heed to yourselves : If thy brother trespass against thee , rebuke him ; and if he repent , forgive him .
text2: Cur - jee twoaie diu hene : My nee dty vraar aggair dhyt , cur oghsan da ; us my ghoys eh arrys , leih da .

text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day , and seven times in a day turn again to thee , saying , I repent ; thou shalt forgive him .
text2: As my nee eh peccah dt ' oi shiaght keayrtyn ' sy laa , as shiaght keayrtyn ' sy laa chyndaa reesht hood as gra , Ta mee goaill arrys ; te ort leih da .

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord , Increase our faith .
text2: As dooyrt ny ostyllyn rish y Chiarn , Bishee yn credjue ainyn .

text: And the Lord said , If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye might say unto this sycamine tree , Be thou plucked up by the root , and be thou planted in the sea ; and it should obey you .
text2: As dooyrt y Chiarn , Dy beagh credjue eu myr grine dy rass mustard , oddagh shiu gra rish y billey - sycamine shoh , Bee er dty hayrn ass ny fraueyn , as bee er dty hoiaghey ayns y cheayn ; as yinnagh eh biallys diu .

text: But which of you , having a servant plowing or feeding cattle , will say unto him by and by , when he is come from the field , Go and sit down to meat ?
text2: Agh quoi eu ta sharvaant echey traaue , ny bochillagh ollagh , jirrys rish chelleeragh , tra vees eh er jeet veih ' n vagher , Immee as soie gys y voayrd ?

text: And will not rather say unto him , Make ready wherewith I may sup , and gird thyself , and serve me , till I have eaten and drunken ; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink ?
text2: As nagh jir hoshiaght rish , Fow aarloo my hibber , as kiartee oo hene dy hirveish orrym ' s , derrey vee ' m erreish gee as giu , us ny lurg shen nee uss gee as giu ?

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him ? I trow not .
text2: Vel booise er da ' n charvaant shen , Son jannoo myr v ' eh oardit ? Er - lhiam nagh vel .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you , say , We are unprofitable servants : we have done that which was our duty to do .
text2: Myr shen neesht shiuish tra vees shiu er n ' yannoo ooilley ny t ' er ny harey diu , abbyr jee . She sharvaantyn neu - frioosagh shin : ta shin er n ' yannoo ynrycan ny va orrin dy yannoo .

text: And it came to pass , as he went to Jerusalem , that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' eh er e vurnah gys Jerusalem , dy jimmee eh trooid mean Samaria as Galilee .

text: And as he entered into a certain village , there met him ten men that were lepers , which stood afar off :
text2: As myr v ' eh goll stiagh ayns balley dy row , haink ny whail jeih deiney va nyn louranee , as hass ad foddey veih :

text: And they lifted up their voices , and said , Jesus , Master , have mercy on us .
text2: As hrog ad seose nyn goraa , as dooyrt ad , Yeesey , Vainshter , jean myghin orrin .

text: And when he saw them , he said unto them , Go shew yourselves unto the priests . And it came to pass , that , as they went , they were cleansed .
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeeaghyn orroo , dooyrt eh roo , Immee - jee as jeeagh - jee shiu hene da ny saggyrtyn . As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' ad goll , dy row ad er nyn ghlenney .

text: And one of them , when he saw that he was healed , turned back , and with a loud voice glorified God ,
text2: As hyndaa fer jeu back , tra honnick eh dy row eh er ny laanaghey , as lesh ard choraa hug eh moylley da Jee ,

text: And fell down on his face at his feet , giving him thanks : and he was a Samaritan .
text2: As huitt eh sheese er e eddin ec ny cassyn echey , cur booise da : as v ' eh ny Samaritan .

text: And Jesus answering said , Were there not ten cleansed ? but where are the nine ?
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , gra , Nagh row jeih er ny ghlenney ? agh cre vel yn nuy ?

text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God , save this stranger .
text2: Cha vel er nyn gheddyn t ' er jyndaa dy chur gloyr da Jee , agh yn ynrycan joarree shoh .

text: And he said unto him , Arise , go thy way : thy faith hath made thee whole .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Irree , immee royd ; ta dty chredjue er dty laanaghey .

text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees , when the kingdom of God should come , he answered them and said , The kingdom of God cometh not with observation :
text2: As tra denee ny Phariseeyn jeh , cre ' n traa harragh reeriaght Yee ? dreggyt eh ad , gra , Cha jig reeriaght Yee lesh stayd chronnal .

text: Neither shall they say , Lo here ! or , lo there ! for , behold , the kingdom of God is within you .
text2: Chamoo jir ad , Jeeagh shoh , ny jeeagh shid : son cur - my - ner , ta reeriaght Yee cheu - sthie jeu .

text: And he said unto the disciples , The days will come , when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man , and ye shall not see it .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn , Hig y traa dy bee shiu aignagh dy akin unnane jeh laghyn Mac y dooinney , as cha vaik shiu eh .

text: And they shall say to you , See here ; or , see there : go not after them , nor follow them .
text2: As jir ad riu , jeeagh - jee ayns shoh , as jeeagh - jee ayns shid : ny roie - jee geiyrt orroo , as ny lhian - jee roo .

text: For as the lightning , that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven , shineth unto the other part under heaven ; so shall also the Son of man be in his day .
text2: Son myr ta ' n tendreil soilshean veih ard dy ard fo yn aer : myr shen myrgeddin vees Mac y dooinney ayns y laa echeysyn .

text: But first must he suffer many things , and be rejected of this generation .
text2: Agh hoshiaght shegin da ymmodee seaghyn y hurranse , as ve beg soit jeh liorish y sheeloghe shoh .

text: And as it was in the days of Noe , so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man .
text2: As myr ve rish lhing Noe , shen myr vees eh neesht ayns laghyn Mac y dooinney .

text: They did eat , they drank , they married wives , they were given in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark , and the flood came , and destroyed them all .
text2: V ' ad gee , v ' ad giu , v ' ad poosey , v ' ad er nyn goyrt ayns poosey , derrey ' n laa hie Noe stiagh ayns yn arg : as haink y thooilley as vaih eh ad ooilley .

text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot ; they did eat , they drank , they bought , they sold , they planted , they builded ;
text2: As er yn aght cheddin myr ve ayns laghyn Lot , v ' ad gee , v ' ad giu v ' ad kionnaghey , v ' ad creck , v ' ad soiaghey biljyn , v ' ad troggal thieyn :

text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven , and destroyed them all .
text2: Agh er yn eer laa hie Lot magh ass Sodom , gheayrt neose orroo aile as brimstone veih niau , as ren eh ad ooilley y stroie :

text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed .
text2: Eer er yn aght cheddin vees eh er y laa vees yn Mac dooinney er ny hoilshaghey .

text: In that day , he which shall be upon the housetop , and his stuff in the house , let him not come down to take it away : and he that is in the field , let him likewise not return back .
text2: Ayns y laa shen , eshyn vees er mullagh y thie , as e chooid sthie , ny lhig da cheet neose dy chur lesh eh : as eshyn ta ayns y vagher , ny lhig dasyn myrgeddin chyndaa back

text: Remember Lot ' s wife .
text2: Cooinee - jee er ben Lot .

text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it ; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it .
text2: Quoi - erbee ta shirrey e vioys y hauail caillee eh eh : as quoi - erbee nee e vioys y choayl , saue - ee eh eh .

text: I tell you , in that night there shall be two men in one bed ; the one shall be taken , and the other shall be left .
text2: Ta mee ginsh diu , ayns yn oie shen dy bee daa ghooinney ayns un lhiabbee : as bee yn derrey yeh goit , as y jeh elley faagit .

text: Two women shall be grinding together ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Bee daa ven blieh cooidjagh , bee yn derrey yeh goit , as y jeh elley faagit .

text: Two men shall be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Bee daa ghooinney ayns y vagher ; bee yn derrey yeh goit , as y jeh elley faagit .

text: And they answered and said unto him , Where , Lord ? And he said unto them , Wheresoever the body is , thither will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: As dreggyr ad , as dooyrt ad rish , C ' raad , Hiarn ? As dooyrt eshyn roo , Raad erbee dy vel yn convayrt , shen - y - raad vees ny urlee er nyn jaglym cooidjagh .

text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end , that men ought always to pray , and not to faint ;
text2: Aa loayr eh coraa - dorraghey roo , dy lhisagh deiney kinjagh padjer y ghoaill , as gyn ad y ve lhiastey ;

text: Saying , There was in a city a judge , which feared not God , neither regarded man :
text2: Gra , Va ayns ard - valley dy row briw nagh row ayns aggle roish Jee , ny soiaghey jeh deiney .

text: And there was a widow in that city ; and she came unto him , saying , Avenge me of mine adversary .
text2: As va ben - treoghe ayns yn ard - valley cheddin , haink huggey , gra , Jean cairys dou er my noid .

text: And he would not for a while : but afterward he said within himself , Though I fear not God , nor regard man ;
text2: As son tammylt cha dug eh geill jee : agh ny lurg shen dooyrt eh rish hene , Ga nagh vel mee goaill aggle roish Jee , ny jannoo soiaghey jeh dooinney :

text: Yet because this widow troubleth me , I will avenge her , lest by her continual coming she weary me .
text2: Ny - yeih er - y - fa dy vel y ven - treoghe shoh dy my voirey , ver - ym cairys jee , er - aggle liorish cheet cha kinjagh dy jean ee skee jee ' m .

text: And the Lord said , Hear what the unjust judge saith .
text2: As dooyrt y Chiarn , Clasht - jee cre ta ' n briw neu - chairagh dy ghra .

text: And shall not God avenge his own elect , which cry day and night unto him , though he bear long with them ?
text2: As nagh jean Jee cooilleeney ass lieh e chloan reiht hene , ta geamagh huggey oie as laa , ga dy vel eh foddey lhiggey shaghey ?

text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily . Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh , shall he find faith on the earth ?
text2: Ta mee ginsh diu dy jean eh dy tappee goaill cooilleeney er nyn son . Ny - yeih tra hig Mac y dooinney , vow eh credjue er y thalloo ?

text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous , and despised others :
text2: As loayr eh yn coraa - dorraghey shoh rish shiartanse va treishteil ayndoo hene dy row ad cairagh , agh soiaghey beg jeh feallagh elley :

text: Two men went up into the temple to pray ; the one a Pharisee , and the other a publican .
text2: Hie daa ghooinney seose gys y chiamble dy ghoaill padjer ; va ' n derrey yeh ny Pharisee , as y jeh elley ny Phublican .

text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself , God , I thank thee , that I am not as other men are , extortioners , unjust , adulterers , or even as this publican .
text2: Hass y Pharisee as ghow eh padjer myr shoh rish hene , Yee , ta mee cur booise dhyt , nagh vel mish myr deiney elley , tranlaasee , neu - chairagh , brishey - poosey , ny foast myr y publican shoh .

text: I fast twice in the week , I give tithes of all that I possess .
text2: Ta mee trostey daa cheayrt ' sy chiaghtin , ta mee cur jaghee jeh ooilley ny t ' ayns my chummal .

text: And the publican , standing afar off , would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven , but smote upon his breast , saying , God be merciful to me a sinner .
text2: As hass y publican foddey veih , as cha b ' lhoys da wheesh as e hooillyn y hroggal seose gys niau , agh woaill eh er e chleeau , gra , Dy row Jee myghinagh dooys ta my ghooinney peccoil .

text: I tell you , this man went down to his house justified rather than the other : for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Ta mee ginsh diu , dy jagh y dooinney shoh sheese gys e hie er ny heyrey roish y jeh elley : son bee dy chooilley er ta dy hoiaghey eh - hene seose er ny injillaghey as bee eshyn ta dy injillaghey eh - hene , er ny hoiaghey seose .

text: And they brought unto him also infants , that he would touch them : but when his disciples saw it , they rebuked them .
text2: As hug ad lhieu huggey myrgeddin cloan aegey , dy ventyn roo : agh tra honnick e ostyllyn shoh , hooar ad foill .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Suffer little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Agh deie Yeesey orroo huggey , as dooyrt eh , Lhig - jee da ny paitchyn cheet hym ' s , as ny jean - jee ad y lhiettal : son jeh nyn lheid ta reeriaght Yee .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Quoi - erbee nagh jean goaill - rish reeriaght Yee myr lhiannoo beg , cha jed eh er aght erbee stiagh ayn .

text: And a certain ruler asked him , saying , Good Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: As denee fer - reill dy row jeh , gra , Vainshter vie , cre t ' orrym dy yannoo dy vod eiraght y ve aym ayns y vea veayn ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good , save one , that is , God .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Cre ' n - fa t ' ou genmys mish mie ? cha vel ayn ny ta mie , agh unnane , ynrycan Jee .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Honour thy father and thy mother .
text2: Shione dhyt ny annaghyn , Ny jean poosey y vrishey , Ny jean dunverys , Ny jean geid , Ny jean feanish foalsey y ymmyrkey , Cur arrym da dty ayr as da dty voir .

text: And he said , All these have I kept from my youth up .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Ooilley shoh ta mee er vreayll veih my aegid .

text: Now when Jesus heard these things , he said unto him , Yet lackest thou one thing : sell all that thou hast , and distribute unto the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , follow me .
text2: Nish tra cheayll Yeesey shoh , dooyrt eh rish , Ta foast ort un red y yannoo : creck as rheynn ooilley ny t ' ayd er ny boghtyn , as bee berchys ayd ayns niau : as tar , as eiyr orrym ' s .

text: And when he heard this , he was very sorrowful : for he was very rich .
text2: As tra cheayll eh shoh , daase eh feer trimshagh , son v ' eh feer verchagh .

text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful , he said , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: As tra honnick Yeesey dy row eh feer trimshagh , dooyrt eh , Cre cha doillee as te dauesyn ta berchys oc , goll stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee !

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle ' s eye , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Son te ny sassey da camel goll trooid croae snaidey , na da dooinney berchagh dy gholl stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee .

text: And they that heard it said , Who then can be saved ?
text2: As dooyrt adsyn cheayll eh , Quoi eisht oddys v ' er ny hauail ?

text: And he said , The things which are impossible with men are possible with God .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Ta ny reddyn shoh neu phossible da deiney , agh t ' ad possible da Jee .

text: Then Peter said , Lo , we have left all , and followed thee .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Peddyr , Cur - my - ner , ta shinyn er dreigeil ooilley , as er n ' eiyrt ort ' s .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or parents , or brethren , or wife , or children , for the kingdom of God ' s sake ,
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Nagh vel dooinney erbee t ' er dreigeil thie , ny ayr ny moir , ny braaraghyn , ny ben , ny cloan , er graih reeriaght Yee ,

text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time , and in the world to come life everlasting .
text2: Nagh vow ymmodee fillee smoo ' sy traa t ' ayn nish , as ayns y theihll ta ry - heet yn vea dy bragh farraghtyn .

text: Then he took unto him the twelve , and said unto them , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem , and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished .
text2: Eisht ghow eh huggey yn daa ostyl yeig , as dooyrt eh roo , Cur - my - ner ta shin goll seose gys Jerusalem , as bee dy chooilley nhee ta scruit liorish ny phadeyryn , my chione yn Mac dooinney , er ny chooilleeney .

text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles , and shall be mocked , and spitefully entreated , and spitted on :
text2: Son bee eh er ny vrah gys ny Ashoonee , as nee ad craidey mysh , as dellal dy roonagh rish , as ceau shellaghyn er ;

text: And they shall scourge him , and put him to death : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: As scuitchee ad eh , as ver ad eh gy baase ; as y trass laa nee eh girree reesht .

text: And they understood none of these things : and this saying was hid from them , neither knew they the things which were spoken .
text2: As cha hoig ad veg jeh ny reddyn va fys oc er ny reddyn va loayrit .

text: And it came to pass , that as he was come nigh unto Jericho , a certain blind man sat by the way side begging :
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , tra v ' eh er jeet er gerrey da Jericho , dy row dooinney doal dy row ny hoie rish lhiattee yn raad , shirrey jeirk .

text: And hearing the multitude pass by , he asked what it meant .
text2: As tra cheayll eh yn pobble goll shaghey , denee eh cre v ' ayn .

text: And they told him , that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by .
text2: As dinsh ad da , dy row Yeesey dy Nazateth goll shaghey .

text: And he cried , saying , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: As dyllee eh , gra , Yeesey , vac Ghavid , jean myghin orrym .

text: And they which went before rebuked him , that he should hold his peace : but he cried so much the more , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: As hug y vooinjer hie roish oghsan da dy ve ny - host : agh dyllee eshyn wheesh shen smoo , Vac Ghavid , jean myghin orrym .

text: And Jesus stood , and commanded him to be brought unto him : and when he was come near , he asked him ,
text2: As hass Yeesey , as doardee eh yn dooinney dy ve er ny choyrt lesh huggey : as tra v ' eh er jeet er - gerrey , denee eh jeh ,

text: Saying , What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee ? And he said , Lord , that I may receive my sight .
text2: Gra , Cre bailt mee dy yannoo er dy hon ? As dooyrt eh , Hiarn , dy voddym my hoilshey y gheddyn .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Receive thy sight : thy faith hath saved thee .
text2: As doogrt Yeesey rish , Dty hoilshey dy row ayd : ta dty chredjue er dty hauail .

text: And immediately he received his sight , and followed him , glorifying God : and all the people , when they saw it , gave praise unto God .
text2: As chelleeragh hooar eh e hoilshey , as deiyr eh er , cur gloyr da Jee : ooilley yn pobble , tra honnick ad eh , hug ad moylley da Jee .

text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho .
text2: As hie Yeesey stiagh , as jimmee eh trooid Jericho .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Zacchaeus , which was the chief among the publicans , and he was rich .
text2: As cur - my - ner , va dooinney va enmyssit Zaccheus , va ny ard - ghooinney mastey ny publicanee , as v ' eh berchagh .

text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was ; and could not for the press , because he was little of stature .
text2: As v ' eh shirrey Yeesey y akin quoi v ' eh , as cha dod eh kyndagh rish y pobble , son v ' eh ny ghooinney giare .

text: And he ran before , and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him : for he was to pass that way .
text2: As roie eh roish , as hie eh seose er billey - sycamore dy gheddyn shilley jeh ; son v ' eh dy gholl shaghey yn raad shen .

text: And when Jesus came to the place , he looked up , and saw him , and said unto him , Zacchaeus , make haste , and come down ; for to day I must abide at thy house .
text2: As tra va Yeesey er jeet gys yn ynnyd , yeeagh eh seose , as honnick eh eh , as dooyrt eh rish , Zaccheus , jean siyr , as tar neose ; son jiu ta mish dy ghoaill aght ec dty hie .

text: And he made haste , and came down , and received him joyfully .
text2: As ren eh siyr , as haink eh neose , as hug eh oltaghey - bea gennal da .

text: And when they saw it , they all murmured , saying , That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner .
text2: As tra honnick ad shoh , v ' ad ooilley jymmoosagh , gra , Dy row eh er gholl stiagh dy ee as dy iu marish dooinney dy ghrogh vea .

text: And Zacchaeus stood , and said unto the Lord ; Behold , Lord , the half of my goods I give to the poor ; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation , I restore him fourfold .
text2: As hass Zaccheus magh , as dooyrt eh rish y Chiarn , Cur - my - ner , Hiarn , yn derrey lieh jeh my chooid ta mee dy choyrt da ny boghtyn : as my ta mee er ghoaill red erbee dy molteyragh veih dooinney erbee , ta mee jannoo lhiassaghey kiare - filley da .

text: And Jesus said unto him , This day is salvation come to this house , forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Jiu ta saualtys er jeet gys y thie shoh , ayns wheesh as dy vel eshyn myrgeddin ny vac da Abraham .

text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
text2: Son ta Mac y dooinney er jeet dy hirrey as dy hauail shen ny va caillit .

text: And as they heard these things , he added and spake a parable , because he was nigh to Jerusalem , and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear .
text2: As erreish daue shoh y chlahtyn , hie eh ny sodjey er e hoshiaght , as loayr eh coraa - dorraghey er - y - fa dy row eh er - gerrey da Jerusalem , as liorish dy row ad smooinaghtyn dy beagh reeriaght Yee dy gerrit er ny hoilshaghey :

text: He said therefore , A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom , and to return .
text2: Dooyrt eh er - y - fa shen , Hie dooinney ooasle dy row gys cheer foddey , dy gheddyn da hene reeriaght , as dy heet back reesht .

text: And he called his ten servants , and delivered them ten pounds , and said unto them , Occupy till I come .
text2: As deie eh er ny jeih sharvaantyn echey , as livrey eh daue jeih puint , as dooyrt eh roo , Jean - jee dellal derrey hig - ym .

text: But his citizens hated him , and sent a message after him , saying , We will not have this man to reign over us .
text2: Agh dirree yn theay shen magh n ' oi as hug ad chaghteraght geiyrt er , gra , Cha naill - lhieu yn dooinney shoh dy reill harrin .

text: And it came to pass , that when he was returned , having received the kingdom , then he commanded these servants to be called unto him , to whom he had given the money , that he might know how much every man had gained by trading .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , tra v ' eh er jeet reesht , erreish da yn reeriaght y gheddyn , dy doardee eh ny sharvaantyn shen dy ve eit huggey , daue v ' eh er choyrt yn argid , dy gheddyn fys cre - woad va dy chooilley ghooinney er chosney liorish e ghellal .

text: Then came the first , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained ten pounds .
text2: Eisht haink y chied er , gra , Hiarn , ta dty phunt er chosney jeih puint .

text: And he said unto him , Well , thou good servant : because thou hast been faithful in a very little , have thou authority over ten cities .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , S ' mie shen , harvaant vie : er - yn - oyr dy vel oo er ve firrinagh ayns red feer fardalagh , gow uss yn reill er jeih ard - valjyn .

text: And the second came , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained five pounds .
text2: As haink yn nah er , gra , Hiarn , ta dty phunt er chosney queig puint .

text: And he said likewise to him , Be thou also over five cities .
text2: As dooyrt eh myrgeddin rishyn , Gow uss yn reill neesht er queig ard - valjyn .

text: And another came , saying , Lord , behold , here is thy pound , which I have kept laid up in a napkin :
text2: As haink fer elley , gra , Hiarn , cur - my ner , shoh dty phunt , t ' er ny ve aym ' s tashtit ayns naptin :

text: For I feared thee , because thou art an austere man : thou takest up that thou layedst not down , and reapest that thou didst not sow .
text2: Son va mee ayns aggle royd , er - y - fa dy nee dooinney creoi oo : t ' ou troggal shen nagh dug oo sheese , as buinn shen nagh ren oo cuirr .

text: And he saith unto him , Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee , thou wicked servant . Thou knewest that I was an austere man , taking up that I laid not down , and reaping that I did not sow :
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Ass dty veeal hene nee ' m oo y vriwnys , uss ghrogh harvaant , Va fys ayd dy row mee my ghooinney creoi , troggal shen nagh dug mee sheese , as buinn shen nagh chuirr mee :

text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank , that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury ?
text2: Cre ' n - fa nagh dug oo my argid magh er use , tra harrin thie , dy voddin v ' er droggal my chooid hene lesh bishaghey .

text: And he said unto them that stood by , Take from him the pound , and give it to him that hath ten pounds .
text2: As dooyrt eh roosyn , va kionfenish Gow - jee yn punt voishyn as cur - jee eh da fer ny jeih puint .

text: ( And they said unto him , Lord , he hath ten pounds . )
text2: ( As dooyrt ad rish , Hiarn , ta jeih puint echey shen . )

text: For I say unto you , That unto every one which hath shall be given ; and from him that hath not , even that he hath shall be taken away from him .
text2: Son ta mee gra riu , Da dy chooilley unnane ta echey , vees er ny choyrt , as eshyn nagh vel echey , bee shen hene ny ta echey er ny ghoaill veih .

text: But those mine enemies , which would not that I should reign over them , bring hither , and slay them before me .
text2: Agh ad shen my noidyn nagh bailliu mish dy reill harrystoo , cur - jee lhieu ad ayns shoh , as cur - jee ad gy - baase kiongoyrt rhym .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he went before , ascending up to Jerusalem .
text2: As tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , hie eh rhymboo , myr v ' ad goll seose gys Jerusalem ,

text: And it came to pass , when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount called the mount of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , tra v ' ad er jeet er - gerrey da Bethphage as Bethany , ec y chronk va enmyssit cronk ny oliveyn , dy dug eh jees jeh e ostyllyn er chaghteraght ,

text: Saying , Go ye into the village over against you ; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied , whereon yet never man sat : loose him , and bring him hither .
text2: Gra , Gow - jee gys y balley - beg ta rhymbiu ; as tra hig shiu gys shen , yiow shiu lhiy er - eistyr , er nagh ren rieau dooinney markiagh : feayshil - jee as cur - jee lhieu eh gys shoh .

text: And if any man ask you , Why do ye loose him ? thus shall ye say unto him , Because the Lord hath need of him .
text2: As my enys dooinney erbee j ' iu , Cre ' n fa ta shiu dy eaysley eh ? Shoh myr nee shiu gra rish , Er - y - fa dy ve feme ec y Chiarn er .

text: And they that were sent went their way , and found even as he had said unto them .
text2: As hie ny chaghteryn rhymboo , as hooar ad eh myr v ' eh er ghra roo .

text: And as they were loosing the colt , the owners thereof said unto them , Why loose ye the colt ?
text2: As myr v ' ad feaysley yn lhiy , dooyrt y vooinjer by - liesh eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu feaysley yn lhiy ?

text: And they said , The Lord hath need of him .
text2: As dooyrt adsyn , Ta feme ec y Chiarn er .

text: And they brought him to Jesus : and they cast their garments upon the colt , and they set Jesus thereon .
text2: As hug ad lhieu eh gys Yeesey : as hilg ad nyn gharmadyn er y lhiy , as hug ad Yeesey ny hoie orroo .

text: And as he went , they spread their clothes in the way .
text2: As myr v ' eh goll , skeayll ad nyn eaddagh er y raad .

text: And when he was come nigh , even now at the descent of the mount of Olives , the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen ;
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet er - gerrey , eer ec goll - sheese cronk ny oliveyn , ghow yn slane sheshaght jeh e eiyrtyssee toshiaght dy ghoaill boggey , as dy chur moylley da Jee lesh ard - choraa , son ooilley ny obbraghyn mirrillagh v ' ad er n ' akin ,

text: Saying , Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord : peace in heaven , and glory in the highest .
text2: Gra , Bannit dy row yn Ree ta cheet ayns ennym y Chiarn : shee ayns niau , as gloyr ayns yn yrjid .

text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him , Master , rebuke thy disciples .
text2: As dooyrt paart jeh ny Phariseeyn rish veih mastey yn pobble , Vainshter , cur oghsan da dty eiyrtyssee .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I tell you that , if these should hold their peace , the stones would immediately cry out .
text2: As dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Ta mee ginsh diu , my chummagh ad shoh nyn jengey , dy jinnagh ny eer claghyn troggal seose nyn goraa .

text: And when he was come near , he beheld the city , and wept over it ,
text2: As tra v ' eh er jeet er - gerrey , yeeagh eh er yn ard - valley , as cheayn eh harrish .

text: Saying , If thou hadst known , even thou , at least in this thy day , the things which belong unto thy peace ! but now they are hid from thine eyes .
text2: Gra , Dy beagh toiggal er ve ayd ' s , dy jarroo ayd ' s , ayns dty laa shoh hene , jeh ny reddyn ta bentyn rish dty hee ! agh nish t ' ad follit veih dty hooillyn .

text: For the days shall come upon thee , that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee , and compass thee round , and keep thee in on every side ,
text2: Son hig ny laghyn ort , tra nee dty noidyn jeeg y yannoo mood , as soie - ee ad ad - hene mygeayrt , as cruinnee ad oo stiagh er dy chooilley heu .

text: And shall lay thee even with the ground , and thy children within thee ; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another ; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation .
text2: As lhieggee ad oo kiart rish y thalloo , as dty chloan cheu - sthie jeed ; as cha vaag ad aynyd un chlagh er clagh elley : er - yn - oyr nagh dug oo tastey da ' n earish haink mish dy dty yeeaghyn .

text: And he went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold therein , and them that bought ;
text2: As hie eh stiagh ayns y chiamble , as ren eh toshiaght dy eiyrt magh yn vooinjer va creck as kionnaghey ayn

text: Saying unto them , It is written , My house is the house of prayer : but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Gra roo , Te scruit , Ta my hie ' s thie yn phadjer : agh ta shiuish er n ' yannoo eh ny ooig dy vaarlee .

text: And he taught daily in the temple . But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him ,
text2: As v ' eh gynsagh ad gagh laa ayns y chiamble . Agh va ny ard - saggyrtyn , as ny scrudeyryn , as leeideilee yn phobble shirrey eh y stroie ,

text: And could not find what they might do : for all the people were very attentive to hear him .
text2: As cha row fys oc kys dy heet my geayrt - y - mysh ; son va ooilley yn pobble feer aggindagh er clashtyn eh .

text: And it came to pass , that on one of those days , as he taught the people in the temple , and preached the gospel , the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders ,
text2: AS haink eh gy - kione er unnane jeh ny laghyn shen , myr v ' eh gynsaghey yn pobble ayns y chiamble as preacheil y sushtal , dy ren ny ard - saggrtyn as ny scrudeyryn soiaghey er , marish y chanstyr ,

text: And spake unto him , saying , Tell us , by what authority doest thou these things ? or who is he that gave thee this authority ?
text2: As loayr ad rish , gra , Insh dooin , Cre ' n phooar t ' ayd dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh ? ny quoi eh hug y phooar shoh dhyt ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , I will also ask you one thing ; and answer me :
text2: As dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh roo , Fenyms jiuish myrgeddin un red ; as freggyr - jee mee :

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ?
text2: Bashtey Ean , nee veih niau ve , ny veih deiney ?

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then believed ye him not ?
text2: As loayr ad nyn mast ' oc hene , gra , My jir mayd , Veih niau ; jir eshyn , Cre ' n - fa eisht nagh chred shiu eh ?

text: But and if we say , Of men ; all the people will stone us : for they be persuaded that John was a prophet .
text2: Agh my jir mayd , Veih deiney ; nee ooilley yn pobble nyn glaghey shin ; son t ' ad dy shickyr credjal Ean dy ve ny adeyr .

text: And they answered , that they could not tell whence it was .
text2: As dreggyr ad , nagh voddagh ad ginsh cre voish v ' eh .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Chamoo insh yms diuish cre ' n phooar t ' aym dy yannoo ny reddyn shoh .

text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable ; A certain man planted a vineyard , and let it forth to husbandmen , and went into a far country for a long time .
text2: Eisht hie eh er e hoshiaght dy loayrt rish y pobble yn coraa - dorraghey shoh : Va dooinney dy row ren garey - feeyney y hoiaghey , as hoie eh eh rish , eirinnee , as hie eh gys cheer foddey son choud shen dy hraa .

text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen , that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard : but the husbandmen beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: As ec yn imbagh , hug eh fer - mooinjerey gys ny eirinnee , dy choyrt da jeh mess y gharey - feeyney : agh woaill ny eirinnee eh , as hug ad eh ersooyl follym .

text: And again he sent another servant : and they beat him also , and entreated him shamefully , and sent him away empty .
text2: As reesht hug eh fer - mooinjerey elley ; as woaill ad eshyn myrgeddin , as ghell ad dy scammyltagh rish , as hug ad eh ersooyl follym .

text: And again he sent a third : and they wounded him also , and cast him out .
text2: As reesht hug eh yn trass ; as vroo ad eshyn myrgeddin , as deiyr ad eh ersooyl .

text: Then said the lord of the vineyard , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son : it may be they will reverence him when they see him .
text2: Eisht dooyrt chiarn y gharey - feeyney Cre nee ' m ? Ver - ym huc my vac graihagh foddee dy der ad arrym da tra hee - ys ad eh .

text: But when the husbandmen saw him , they reasoned among themselves , saying , This is the heir : come , let us kill him , that the inheritance may be ours .
text2: Agh tra honnick ny eirinnee eh , loayr ad eddyr ad - hene , gra , Shoh yn eirey : tar - jee , lhig dooin eh y varroo , dy vod yn eiraght ve lhien hene .

text: So they cast him out of the vineyard , and killed him . What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them ?
text2: Myr shen cheau ad eh magh ass y gharey - feeyney , as varr ad eh . Cre nee Chiarn y gharey - feeyney er - y - fa shen roo ?

text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen , and shall give the vineyard to others . And when they heard it , they said , God forbid .
text2: Hig eh as stroie - ee eh ny eirinnee shoh , as ver eh yn garey - feeyney da feallagh elley . As tra cheayll ad shen , dooyrt ad , Nar lhig eh Jee .

text: And he beheld them , and said , What is this then that is written , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner ?
text2: As yeeagh eh orroo , as dooyrt eh , Cre shoh eisht ta scruit , Ta ' n chlagh ren ny masoonee y vee - lowal , er jeet dy ve yn ard - chlagh chorneilagh ?

text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken ; but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Quoi - erbee huittys er y chlagh shen , hee eh er ny vroo : agh er quoi - erbee huittys y chlagh shen , nee ee cha meen as joan jeh .

text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him ; and they feared the people : for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them .
text2: As va ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny scrudeyryn ayns yn oor cheddin shirrey eh y ghoaill ; agh ghow ad aggle roish y pobble : son dennee ad dy row eh er loayrt yn coraa - dorraghey shoh nyn noisyn .

text: And they watched him , and sent forth spies , which should feign themselves just men , that they might take hold of his words , that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor .
text2: As va sooill oc er , as hug ad magh peeikearyn va dy lhiggey orroo dy ve deiney cairagh , er - chee tayrtyn eh nyns e ghlare , as myr shen dy livrey eh gys pooar as reill y chiannoort .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly , neither acceptest thou the person of any , but teachest the way of God truly :
text2: As denee ad jeh , gra , Vainshter , ta fys ain dy vel oo loayrt as gynsaghey cairagh ; chamoo t ' ou soiaghey jeh persoon erbee , agh gynsaghey raad Yee dy firrinagh

text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar , or no ?
text2: Vel eh lowal dooin keesh y eeck da Cesar , mannagh vel ?

text: But he perceived their craftiness , and said unto them , Why tempt ye me ?
text2: Agh dennee eh yn foalsaght oc , as dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu shirrey da my ghoaill ayns ribbey ?

text: Shew me a penny . Whose image and superscription hath it ? They answered and said , Caesar ' s .
text2: Jeeagh - jee dou ping : quoi ta ' n jalloo as y scrieu t ' er cowraghey ? Dreggyr ad as dooyrt ad , Cesar .

text: And he said unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar ' s , and unto God the things which be God ' s .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Eeck - jee er - y - fa shen da Cesar shen ny ta bentyn gys Cesar ; as da Jee shen ny ta bentyn gys Jee .

text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people : and they marvelled at his answer , and held their peace .
text2: As cha voddagh ad greme y ghoaill er e ghoan kiongoyrt rish y pobble : as ghow ad yindys jeh ' n ansoor echey , as chum ad nyn jengey .

text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees , which deny that there is any resurrection ; and they asked him ,
text2: Eisht haink huggey shiartanse jeh ny Sadduceeyn ( ta gobbal yn irree - seose - reesht veih ny merriu ) as denee ad jeh ,

text: Saying , Master , Moses wrote unto us , If any man ' s brother die , having a wife , and he die without children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Gra , Vainshter , ta Moses er scrieu dooin , My ta braar dooinney erbee geddyn baase , as ben echey , as eh dy gheddyn baase gyn chloan , dy vel e vraar dy phoosey yn ven echey , as dy hroggal seose sluight gys e vraar .

text: There were therefore seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and died without children .
text2: Va er - y - fa shen shiaght braaraghyn : as hooar y braar shinney , tra v ' eh er phoosey ben , baase gyn chloan .

text: And the second took her to wife , and he died childless .
text2: As ghow yn nah vraar ee son ben , as hooar eshyn baase dyn chloan .

text: And the third took her ; and in like manner the seven also : and they left no children , and died .
text2: As ghow yn trass ee : as er yn aght cheddin yn chiaght . As cha daag ad cloan , as hooar ad baase .

text: Last of all the woman died also .
text2: Er - jerrey ooilley hooar y ven ee hene baase myrgeddin .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she ? for seven had her to wife .
text2: Ec yn irree - reesht er - y - fa shen , quoi jeu vees ee echey son ben ? son v ' ee ny ben da ' n chiaght .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , The children of this world marry , and are given in marriage :
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Ta cloan y theihll shoh poosey , as er nyn goyrt ayns poosey :

text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world , and the resurrection from the dead , neither marry , nor are given in marriage :
text2: Agh adsyn vees coontit feeu jeh ' n theihll shen , as jeh yn irree - reesht veih ny merriu , cha vel ad poosey , ny er nyn goyrt ayns poosey .

text: Neither can they die any more : for they are equal unto the angels ; and are the children of God , being the children of the resurrection .
text2: Chamoo oddys ad baase y gheddyn arragh ; son t ' ad corrym rish ny ainleyn , as nyn gloan dy Yee , liorish dy vel ad cloan yn irree - seose reesht .

text: Now that the dead are raised , even Moses shewed at the bush , when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
text2: Nish dy n ' irree ny merriu , hoilshee Moses hene ec y thammag , tra t ' eh genmys y Chiarn , Jee Abraham , as Jee Isaac , as Jee Yacob .

text: For he is not a God of the dead , but of the living : for all live unto him .
text2: Son cha nee Jee ny merriu eh , agh Jee ny bioee : son ta ooilley bio huggeysyn .

text: Then certain of the scribes answering said , Master , thou hast well said .
text2: Eisht dreggyr shiartanse jeh ny scrudeyryn as doo ~ yt ad , Vainshter , t ' ou er ghra dy mie .

text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all .
text2: As ny lurg shen cha by - lhoys daue question erbee sodjey y chur huggey .

text: And he said unto them , How say they that Christ is David ' s son ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Kys t ' ad gra dy nee Creest mac Ghavid ?

text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: As dy vel David eh hene ayns lioar ny psalmyn gra , Dooyrt y Chiarn rish my Hiarn ' s , Soie uss er my laue yesh ,

text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: Derrey ver - ym dty noidyn son stoyl dty choshey .

text: David therefore calleth him Lord , how is he then his son ?
text2: Ta David er - y - fa shen genmys eh ny Hiarn , kys t ' eh eisht yn mac echey ?

text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Eisht ayns clashtyn ooilley yn pobble , dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn ,

text: Beware of the scribes , which desire to walk in long robes , and love greetings in the markets , and the highest seats in the synagogues , and the chief rooms at feasts ;
text2: Bee - jee er nyn dwoaie jeh ny scrudeyryn , ta geearree shooyll ayns coamraghyn liauyrey , as shynney lhieu dy vannaghey daue ayns ny margaghyn , as ny stuill syrjey y ve oc ayns kialteenyn , as ny ard ynnydn - soie ec cuirraghyn .

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a shew make long prayers : the same shall receive greater damnation .
text2: T ' ad cur - mow thieyn mraane - treoghe , as son scaa dy chraueeaght lhiggey orroo dy ve mennick ayns padjer : ta briwnys strimmey nyn gour oc shoh .

text: And he looked up , and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury .
text2: As yeeagh eh seose , as honnick eh ny berchee tilgey ny giootyn oc ayns kishtey yn stoyr .

text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites .
text2: As honnick eh myrgeddin ben voght treoghe dy row , tilgey ayn daa vite .

text: And he said , Of a truth I say unto you , that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all :
text2: As dooyrt eh , Ayns firrinys ta mee gra riu , dy vel y ven voght treoghe shoh er hilgey ayn ny smoo na ad ooilley .

text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had .
text2: Son t ' ad shoh ooilley ayns nyn balchey er chur gys ourallyn Yee : agh t ' eeish myr s ' boght ee , er choyrt ayn ooilley ny v ' eck dy veaghey er .

text: And as some spake of the temple , how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts , he said ,
text2: As myr va paart loayrt jeh ' n chiamble , kys ve er ny hoiaghey magh lesh clagh yn aalin , as giootyn , dooyrt eh ,

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Son ny reddyn shoh ta shiu dy akin hig ny laghyn , tra nagh bee faagit un chlagh er clagh elley nagh bee er ny lhieggal .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: As denee ad jeh , gra , Vainshter , agh cuin vees ny reddyn shoh ? as cre vees yn cowrey tra hig ny reddyn shoh gy - kione ?

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Cur - jee twoaie nagh bee shiu er nyn molley : son hig ymmodee ayns m ' ennym ' s , gra , Mish Creest ; as ta ' n traa tayrn er - gerrey : ny gow - jee shiuish er - y - fa shen geiyrt orroo .

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Agh tra chlinnys shiu jeh caggaghyn as irree - magh , ny bee aggle erriu : son shegin da ny reddyn shoh hoshiaght cheet gy - kione , agh cha bee yn jerrey foast .

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh roo , Nee ashoon girree - magh noi ashoon , as reeriaght noi reeriaght .

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: As bee craaghyn - thallooin mooar ayns ymmodee ynnydyn , as gennaghyn , as crampyn , as shillaghyn agglagh , as bee cowraghyn mooarey veih niau .

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: Agh roish ooilley shoh gowee ad shiu , ss nee ad tranlaase erriu , as livrey ee ad shiu seose gys quaiylyn , as gys pryssoonyn , as bee shiu er nyn goyrt fenish reeaghyn as fir - reill er coontey yn ennym aym ' s
