text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: As myr shoh hig shiuish dy ve son feanishyn dooys .

text: Settle it therefore in your hearts , not to meditate before what ye shall answer :
text2: Kiare - jee eh - er - y - fa shen ayns nyn gree , gyn shiu dy smooinaghtyn ro - laue cre nee shiu y reggyrt .

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: Son ver - yms diu beeal as creenaght , nagh bee ooilley nyn noidyn son loayrt ny shassoo magh n ' oi .

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: As bee shiu er nyn mrah chammah liorish ayraghyn as moiraghyn , as braaragh yn as deiney mooinjerey , as caarjyn ; as ver ad er paart eu ve er nyn goyrt gy - baase .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: As ver yn ymmodee feoh diu er coontey yn ennym aym ' s .

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: Agh cha jed wheesh reuaig jeh nyn ghing naardey .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: Fo ooilley nyn seaghyn cum - jee seose nyn gree .

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: As tra hee shiu sheshaghtyn - caggee mygeayrt Jerusalem , eisht toig - jee dy vel y traartys eck er - gerrey .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: Eisht lhig dauesyn ta ayns Judea , chea gys ny sleityn ; as lhig dauesyn ta cheu - sthie jee , cosney ass - jee ; as ny lhig dauesyn ta mooie er y cheer cheet stiagh aynjee .

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Son t ' ad shoh laghyn y chooilleeney , son jannoo mie dy chooilley nhee ta scruit .

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: Agh smerg dauesyn ta torragh , as dauesyn ta cur keeagh ayns ny laghyn shen : son bee trimshey mooar ayns y cheer , as corree noi yn pobble shoh .

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: As tuittee ad er foyr y chliwe , as bee ad er nyn ghoaill ersooyl nyn gappeeyn gys dy chooilley ashoon : as bee Jerusalem er ny stampey sheese liorish ny Ashoonee , derrey vees traa ny Ashoonee er ny chooilleeney .

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: As bee cowraghyn ayns y ghrian , as ayns ny rollageyn : as er y thalloo seaghyn er ashoonyn , as angaish ; yn faarkey , as ny tonnyn freaney ;

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Creeaghyn deiney gannooinaghey lesh aggle , as lesh jeeaghyn jei ny reddyn ta ry heet er y thalloo : son bee pooaraghyn yn aer er nyn graa .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: As eisht hee ad Mac y dooinney cheet ayns bodjal lesh pooar as ard - ghloyr .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: As tra ghoys ny reddyn shoh toshiaght dy heet gy - kione , eisht jeeagh - jee shiuish seose , as trog - jee nyn ghing ; son ta ' n livrey - ys eu tayrn er - gerrey .

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: As loayr eh roo coraa - dorraghey . Cur - jee my - ner yn billey - figgagh as ooilley ny billjn ;

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: Tra t ' ad nish cur magh duillagyn , ta shiu fakin as toiggal jiu hene , dy vel y sourey er - gerrey .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Myr shen shiuish neesht , tra hee shiu ny reddyn shoh cheet gy - kione , toig - jee dy vel reeriaght Yee er - gerrey .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: Dy firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Nagh bee yn cheeloghe shoh ec kione , derrey vees ooilley shoh er ny chooilleeney .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Nee yn aer as yn ooir cherraghtyn , agh my ghoan ' s cha jean cherraghtyn .

text: And take heed to yourselves , lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting , and drunkenness , and cares of this life , and so that day come upon you unawares .
text2: As cur - jee twoaie diu hene , er - aggle ec traa erbee dy bee ny creeaghyn eu rouyr laadit lesh jooid as meshtyrys , as kiarailyn y vea shoh , as myr shoh yn laa shen dy heet erriu doaltattym .

text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth .
text2: Son myr ribbey hig eh er ooilley cummaltee ny hooirey .

text: Watch ye therefore , and pray always , that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass , and to stand before the Son of man .
text2: Bee - jee er nyn dwoaie er - y - fa shen , as bee - jee kinjagh ayns padjer , dy vod shiu ve coontit feeu dy scapail ooilley ny reddyn shoh hig gy - kione , as dy hassoo kiongoyrt rish Mac y dooinney .

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .
text2: As ayns y laa v ' eh gynsagh ' sy chiamble , as ec yn oie goll magh as goaill aaght ec y chronk ta enmyssit cronk ny Oliveyn .

text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple , for to hear him .
text2: As va ooilley yn pobble cheet huggey dy moghey gys y chiamble , dy eaishtagh rish .

text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh , which is called the Passover .
text2: ISH va feuilley yn arran - millish tayrn er - gerrey , ta enmyssit y Chaisht .

text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him ; for they feared the people .
text2: As va ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny scrudeyryn shirrey kys oddagh ad eh y choyrt gy - bause ; son v ' adayns sggle roish y pobble .

text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot , being of the number of the twelve .
text2: Eisht hie yn drogh - spyrryd stiagh ayns Yuaase va slennooit Iscariot , va jeh earroo yn daa ostyl yeig .

text: And he went his way , and communed with the chief priests and captains , how he might betray him unto them .
text2: As hie eh roish , as loayr eh rish ny ard saggyrtyn as ny captanyn mychione eh y vrah daue .

text: And they were glad , and covenanted to give him money .
text2: As ghow adsyn boggey jeh , as ren ad conaant dy chur argid da .

text: And he promised , and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude .
text2: As hug eh gialdyn , as v ' eh shirrey caa dy vrah eh tra nagh beagh y pobble marish .

text: Then came the day of unleavened bread , when the passover must be killed .
text2: Eisht haink laa yn arran - millish , tra va ' n Eayn - caisht dy ve er ny varroo .

text: And he sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare us the passover , that we may eat .
text2: As hug eh magh Peddyr as Ean , gra , Immee - jee , as aarlee - jee yn Eayn - caisht dy vod mayd gee .

text: And they said unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare ?
text2: As dooyrt ad rish , C ' raad sailt shin dy yannoo aarloo ?

text: And he said unto them , Behold , when ye are entered into the city , there shall a man meet you , bearing a pitcher of water ; follow him into the house where he entereth in .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cur - my - ner , tra vees shiu er gholl stiagh ayns yn ard valley hig dooinney nyn guail lesh saagh - craie dy ushtey ; eiyr - jee er gys y thie hed eh stiagh ayn .

text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house , The Master saith unto thee , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: As abbyr - jee tish y fer - thie , Ta ' n mainshter gra rhyt , Cre vel shamyr ny goaldee , raad nee ' m yn Eayn - caisht y ee marish my ostyllyn ?

text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished : there make ready .
text2: As jeeaghee eh diu ard - room mooar vees soit magh : ayns shen jean - jee aarloo .

text: And they went , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: As hie ad as hooar ad myr v ' eh er ghra roo : as daarlee ad yn Eayn - caisht .

text: And when the hour was come , he sat down , and the twelve apostles with him .
text2: As tra va ' n oor er jeet , hoie eh sheese as y daa ostyl yeig marish .

text: And he said unto them , With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer :
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Lesh yeearree jeean ta mee er ve aignagh yn Eayn - caisht shoh y ee meriu roish my jean - ym surranse .

text: For I say unto you , I will not any more eat thereof , until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God .
text2: Son ta mee gra riu , Nagh n ' ee - ym maghey shoh jeh , derrey vees eh cooilleenit ayns reeriaght Yee .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and said , Take this , and divide it among yourselves :
text2: As ghow eh yn cappan , as hug eh booise , as dooyrt eh , Gow - jee shoh , as rheynn - jee eh ny mast ' eu hene .

text: For I say unto you , I will not drink of the fruit of the vine , until the kingdom of God shall come .
text2: Son ta mee gra riu , Nagh n ' iu - ym jeh mess y villey - feeyney , derrey hig reeriaght Yee .

text: And he took bread , and gave thanks , and brake it , and gave unto them , saying , This is my body which is given for you : this do in remembrance of me .
text2: As ghow eh arran , as hug eh booise , as vrish eh eh , as hug eh eh daue , gra , Shoh my chorp t ' er ny choyrt er nyn son eu shoh jean - jee ayns cooinaghtyn jeem ' s .

text: Likewise also the cup after supper , saying , This cup is the new testament in my blood , which is shed for you .
text2: As er yn aght cheddin yn cappan lurg shibber , gra , Yn cappan shoh yn conaant noa ayns my uill ' s , t ' er ny gheayrtey er ny son eu .

text: But , behold , the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table .
text2: Agh cur - my - ner , ta ' n laue echeysyn ta dy my vrah , marym er y voayrd .

text: And truly the Son of man goeth , as it was determined : but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed !
text2: As dy firrinagh ta ' n Mac dooinney goll myr ve kiarit : agh smerg da ' n dooinney shen liorish t ' eh er ny vrah .

text: And they began to inquire among themselves , which of them it was that should do this thing .
text2: As ren ad toshiaght dy vriaght nyn mast ' oc hene , quoi jeu yinnagh shoh .

text: And there was also a strife among them , which of them should be accounted the greatest .
text2: Nish va streeu myrgeddin nyn mast ' oc , quoi jeu syrjey veagh coontit .

text: And he said unto them , The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Ta reeaghyn ny Ashoonee gymmyrkey reill harrystoo : as as t ' adsyn t ' ayns pooar nyn mastey , enmyssit deiney ooasle .

text: But ye shall not be so : but he that is greatest among you , let him be as the younger ; and he that is chief , as he that doth serve .
text2: Agh cha bee shiuish myr shen : agh quoi - erbee shinney ta nyn mast eu , lhig da ve myr y fer saa ; as eshyn syrjey ta , myr y fer ta shirveish .

text: For whether is greater , he that sitteth at meat , or he that serveth ? is not he that sitteth at meat ? but I am among you as he that serveth .
text2: Son quoi syrjey , eshyn ta ny hoie ec bee , ny ' n fer ta shirveish ? nagh nee eshyn ta ny hoie ec bee ? agh ta mish nyn mast ' eu myr y fer ta shirveish .

text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations .
text2: She shiuish t ' er hannaghtyn marym ayns my heaghyn .

text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom , as my Father hath appointed unto me ;
text2: As ta mee pointeil diu reeriaght , myr ta my Ayr er phointeil dooys .

text: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom , and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: Dy vod shiu gee as giu ec my voayrd ayns my reeriaght , as soie er stuill - reeoil , briwnys daa heeloghe yeig Israel .

text: And the Lord said , Simon , Simon , behold , Satan hath desired to have you , that he may sift you as wheat :
text2: As dooyrt y Chiarn , Simon , Simon , cur - my - ner , ta Satan er yeearree shiuish y ghoaill , dy chreearey shiu myr curnaght :

text: But I have prayed for thee , that thy faith fail not : and when thou art converted , strengthen thy brethren .
text2: Agh ta mish er ghuee er dty hon ' s , nagh jean dty chredjue failleil ; as tra vees oo er jyndaa , niartee dty vraaraghyn .

text: And he said unto him , Lord , I am ready to go with thee , both into prison , and to death .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Hiarn , ta mish aarloo dy gholl mayrt chammah gys pryssoon , as gys baase .

text: And he said , I tell thee , Peter , the cock shall not crow this day , before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Ta mee ginsh dhyt , Pheddyr roish gerrym y chellee jiu dy jean uss gobbal three keayrtyn dy nhione dhyt mee .

text: And he said unto them , When I sent you without purse , and scrip , and shoes , lacked ye any thing ? And they said , Nothing .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Tra hug mee shiu magh fegooish sporran , as spagey , as braagyn , row nhee erbee dy laccal erriu ? As dooyrt ad , Cha row nhee erbee .

text: Then said he unto them , But now , he that hath a purse , let him take it , and likewise his scrip : and he that hath no sword , let him sell his garment , and buy one .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh roo , Agh nish eshyn ta sporran echey , lhig da y ghoaill eh , as myrgeddin e spaagey : as eshyn nagh vel cliwe echey , lhig da creck e gharmad , as cliwe y chionnaghey .

text: For I say unto you , that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me , And he was reckoned among the transgressors : for the things concerning me have an end .
text2: Son ta mee gra riu , Dy nhegin da shoh ny ta scruit , ve foast cooilleenit aynym ' s , As v ' eh er ny earroo marish ny drogh yantee : son ta jerrey er ny reddyn ta my mychione ' s .

text: And they said , Lord , behold , here are two swords . And he said unto them , It is enough .
text2: As dooyrt ad , Hiarn , cur - my - ner ta daa chliwe ayns shoh . As dooyrt eh roo , Te dy liooar .

text: And he came out , and went , as he was wont , to the mount of Olives ; and his disciples also followed him .
text2: As haink eh magh , as hie eh myr v ' eh cliaghtey , gys cronk ny Oliveyn ; as deiyr ny ostyllyn myrgeddin er .

text: And when he was at the place , he said unto them , Pray that ye enter not into temptation .
text2: As tra v ' eh ec yn ynnyd , dooyrt eh roo , Gow - jee padjer , nagh duitt shiu ayns miolagh .

text: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone ' s cast , and kneeled down , and prayed ,
text2: As hie eh voue , mysh choud as hilgagh fer clagh , as huitt eh er e ghlioonyn , as ghow eh padjer

text: Saying , Father , if thou be willing , remove this cup from me : nevertheless not my will , but thine , be done .
text2: Gra , Ayr , my she dty aigney eh , scugh yn cappan shoh voym : ny - yeih cha nee my aigney ' s , agh dt ' aigney ' s dy row jeant .

text: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven , strengthening him .
text2: As haink huggey ainle veih niau , dy niartaghey eh ,

text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly : and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground .
text2: As v ' eh ayns angaish vooar , as ghow eh padjer ny s ' jeeaney : as va ' n ollish echey myr bineyn mooarey folley tuittym gys y thalloo .

text: And when he rose up from prayer , and was come to his disciples , he found them sleeping for sorrow ,
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' irree veih padjer , as er jeet gys e ostyllyn , hooar eh ad nyn gadley lesh trimshey ,

text: And said unto them , Why sleep ye ? rise and pray , lest ye enter into temptation .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu cadley ? irree - jee as gow - jee padjer , nagh duitt shiu ayns miolagh .

text: And while he yet spake , behold a multitude , and he that was called Judas , one of the twelve , went before them , and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him .
text2: As choud as v ' eh foast loayrt , cur - my - ner haink sheshaght vooar , as eshyn va enmyssit Yuaase , fer jeh ' n daa ostyl yeig , nyn leeideilagh , as hayrn eh er - gerrey da Yeesey dy chur paag da .

text: But Jesus said unto him , Judas , betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss ?
text2: Agh dooyrt Yeesey rish , Yuaase , vel oo brah Mac y dooinney lesh paag ?

text: When they which were about him saw what would follow , they said unto him , Lord , shall we smite with the sword ?
text2: Tra honnick adsyn va mygeayrt - y - mysh cre va ry - heet , dooyrt ad rish , Hiarn , bwoaill mayd lesh y chliwe ?

text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest , and cut off his right ear .
text2: As woaill fer jeu fer - mooinjerey yn ard - saggyrt , as ghiare eh yn chleaysh yesh jeh .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Suffer ye thus far . And he touched his ear , and healed him .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh , Slioar shoh hene . As venn eh rish e chleaysh , as laanee eh eh .

text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests , and captains of the temple , and the elders , which were come to him , Be ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and staves ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish ny ard saggyrtyn as captanyn y chiamble , as y chanstyr v ' er jeet magh huggey , Vel shiu er jeet magh , myr noi maarliagh , lesh cliwenyn as luirg ?

text: When I was daily with you in the temple , ye stretched forth no hands against me : but this is your hour , and the power of darkness .
text2: Tra va mee meriu gagh laa ayns y chiamble , cha heeyn shiu magh laue m ' oi : agh shoh yn oor eu , as pooar y dorraghys .

text: Then took they him , and led him , and brought him into the high priest ' s house . And Peter followed afar off .
text2: Eisht ghow ad eh , as leeid ad ersooyl eh , as hug ad lhieu eh gys thie yn ard - saggyrt . As deiyr Peddyr er foddey ny yei .

text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall , and were set down together , Peter sat down among them .
text2: As tra v ' ad er voaddey aile ayns mean ny halley , as er hoie sheese cooidjagh , hoie Peddyr sheese ny mast ' oc .

text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire , and earnestly looked upon him , and said , This man was also with him .
text2: Agh hug ben - aeg dy row tastey da , myr v ' eh ny hoie ec yn aile , as yeeagh ee dy gyere er , as dooyrt ee , v ' eh shoh myrgeddin marish .

text: And he denied him , saying , Woman , I know him not .
text2: As dob eh , gra , Ven , cha vel enney aym er .

text: And after a little while another saw him , and said , Thou art also of them . And Peter said , Man , I am not .
text2: As tammylt ny lurg shen , honnick fer elley eh , as dooyrt eh , She fer jeu myrgeddin uss . As dooyrt Peddyr , Ghooinney , cha nee .

text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed , saying , Of a truth this fellow also was with him : for he is a Galilaean .
text2: As mysh oor ny lurg shen , hass fer elley er dy creoi , gra , Ayns firrinys v ' eh shoh myrgeddin marish ; son she Galilean eh ,

text: And Peter said , Man , I know not what thou sayest . And immediately , while he yet spake , the cock crew .
text2: As dooyrt Peddyr , Ghooinney , cha s ' aym cre t ' ou dy ghra . As chelleeragh , choud as v ' eh foast loayrt , gherr y kellagh .

text: And the Lord turned , and looked upon Peter . And Peter remembered the word of the Lord , how he had said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: As hyndaa yn Chiarn , as yeeagh eh er Peddyr ; as chooinee Peddyr er yn ockle va ' n Chiarn er ghra rish , Roish gerrym y chellee , nee uss mish y obbal three keayrtyn .

text: And Peter went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: As hie Peddyr magh , as cheayn eh dy sharroo .

text: And the men that held Jesus mocked him , and smote him .
text2: As ren ny deiney v ' er ghoaill Yeesey gannidys er , as y woalley eh .

text: And when they had blindfolded him , they struck him on the face , and asked him , saying , Prophesy , who is it that smote thee ?
text2: As tra v ' ad er choodaghey ny sooillyn echey , woaill ad eh er yn eddin , as denee ad jeh , gra , Jean phadeyrys , quoi ta dy dty woalley ?

text: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him .
text2: As ymmodee reddyn elley loayr ad dy mollaghtagh n ' oi .

text: And as soon as it was day , the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together , and led him into their council , saying ,
text2: As cha leah as va ' n laa rish , haink shanstyr yn phobble , as ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny scrudeyryn cooidjagh , as hug ad lhieu eh gys y choonceil oc ,

text: Art thou the Christ ? tell us . And he said unto them , If I tell you , ye will not believe :
text2: Gra , Nee oo yn Creest ? insh dooin . As dooyrt eh roo , My inshym diu , cha jean shiu credjal .

text: And if I also ask you , ye will not answer me , nor let me go .
text2: As my neem ' s myrgeddin shiuish y qhuestional , cha jean shiu my reggyrt , ny lhiggey yn raad dou .

text: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God .
text2: Ny lurg shoh nee Mac y dooinney soie er laue yesh pooar Yee .

text: Then said they all , Art thou then the Son of God ? And he said unto them , Ye say that I am .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ad ooilley , Nee oo eisht Mac Yee ? As dooyrt eh roo , Ta shiuish gra ny ta mee .

text: And they said , What need we any further witness ? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth .
text2: As dooyrt ad , Cre ' n feme sodjey t ' ain er feanishyn ? son ta shin hene er chlashtyn veih ' n veeal echey hene .

text: And the whole multitude of them arose , and led him unto Pilate .
text2: As dirree yn slane sheshaght jea , as hug ad lhieu eh gys Pilate .

text: And they began to accuse him , saying , We found this fellow perverting the nation , and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar , saying that he himself is Christ a King .
text2: As ren ad toshiaght dy loayrt n ' oi , gra , Hooar shin eh shoh cur yn ashoon ain er shaghryn , as lhiettal sleih veih geeck keesh da Cesar , gra , Dy nee eh - hene Creest yn ree .

text: And Pilate asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answered him and said , Thou sayest it .
text2: As denee Pilate jeh , ghra , Nee ree ny Hewnyn oo ? As dreggyr eh , as dooyrt eh , T ' ou uss dy ghra eh .

text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people , I find no fault in this man .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Pilate rish ny ard - saggyrt yn as rish y pobble , Cha vel mish er gheddyn foill erbee ayns y dooinney shoh .

text: And they were the more fierce , saying , He stirreth up the people , teaching throughout all Jewry , beginning from Galilee to this place .
text2: As v ' ad wheesh shen s ' chenney er , gra , T ' eh boirey yn pobble , gynsaghey trooid ooilley Judea , goaill toshiaght veih Galilee derrey shoh .

text: When Pilate heard of Galilee , he asked whether the man were a Galilaean .
text2: Tra cheayll Pilate jeh Galilee , denee eh nee Galilean va ' n dooinney .

text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod ' s jurisdiction , he sent him to Herod , who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time .
text2: As cha leah as hooar eh fys dy nee gys reill Herod v ' eh bentyn , hug eh eh gys Herod , va myrgeddin eh - hene ec Jerusalem ec y traa shen .

text: And when Herod saw Jesus , he was exceeding glad : for he was desirous to see him of a long season , because he had heard many things of him ; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him .
text2: As tra honnick Herod Yeesey , v ' eh feer wooiagh : son v ' eh aignagh ry - foadey dy akin eh , er - yn - oyr dy row eh er chlashtyn ymmodee reddyn jeh ; as dy row eh jerkal dy akin mirril ennagh jeant liorish .

text: Then he questioned with him in many words ; but he answered him nothing .
text2: Eisht denee en ymmodee questionyn jeh ; agh cha dug eh ansoor erbee da .

text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him .
text2: As hass ny ard - sagggrtyn as ny scrudeyryn as loayr ad dy elgyssagh - n ' oi .

text: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought , and mocked him , and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe , and sent him again to Pilate .
text2: As ren Herod as e gheiney - caggee beg y hoiaghey jeh , as chraid ad mysh , as choamree ad eh lesh coamrey moyrnagh , as hug ad eh reesht gys Pilate .

text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together : for before they were at enmity between themselves .
text2: As y laa cheddin va coardail er ny yannoo eddyr Pilate as Herod ; son roie v ' ad ayns noidys ry - cheilley .

text: And Pilate , when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people ,
text2: As dele Pilate er ny ard - saggyrtyn cooidjagh , as er ny fir - reill as y pobble .

text: Said unto them , Ye have brought this man unto me , as one that perverteth the people : and , behold , I , having examined him before you , have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him :
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Ta shiu er chur lhieu yn dooinney shoh hym ' s , myr fer ta cur shaghrynys er y pobble : as cur - my - ner ta mish er veysht eh kiongoyrt riu , as cha vel mee er gheddyn foill erbee ayns y dooinney shoh , mychione ny reddyn ta shiuish cur ny lieh ;

text: No , nor yet Herod : for I sent you to him ; and , lo , nothing worthy of death is done unto him .
text2: Chamoo ta Herod : son hug mee shiu huggeysyn , as cur - my - ner , cha vel nhee erbee ta toilchin baase er ny cherraghey er .

text: I will therefore chastise him , and release him .
text2: Smaghtee - ym eh er - y - fa shen , as lhiggym y raad da .

text: ( For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast . )
text2: Son beign da fer y eaysley daue ec y feailley .

text: And they cried out all at once , saying , Away with this man , and release unto us Barabbas :
text2: As deie ooilley yn cheshaght , gra , Ersooyl lesh y dooinney shoh , as feayshil dooin Barabbas :

text: ( Who for a certain sedition made in the city , and for murder , was cast into prison . )
text2: ( Va son irree - magh dy row , va jeant ayns yn ard - valley , as son dunverys tilgit ayns pryssoon ) .

text: Pilate therefore , willing to release Jesus , spake again to them .
text2: Va Pilate er - y - fa shen aggindagh dy choyrt feaysley da Yeesey , as loayr eh reesht roo .

text: But they cried , saying , Crucify him , crucify him .
text2: Agh dyllee adsyn , gra , Jean y chrossey eh , jean y chrossey eh .

text: And he said unto them the third time , Why , what evil hath he done ? I have found no cause of death in him : I will therefore chastise him , and let him go .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo yn trass cheayrt Cammah , cre ' n olk t ' eh er n ' yannoo ? cha vel mish er gheddyn oyr baaish erbee ayn : smaghtee - ym eh er - y - fa shen , as lhiggym y raad da

text: And they were instant with loud voices , requiring that he might be crucified . And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed .
text2: As loayr ad ny s ' jeeaney lesh ard choraaghyn , guee dy beagh eh er ny chrossey : as ren y coraa ocsyn as coraa ny ard - saggyrtyn raad y ghoaill .

text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required .
text2: As hug Pilate briwnys cordail rish nyn aigney .

text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison , whom they had desired ; but he delivered Jesus to their will .
text2: As deayshil eh daue , eshyn va son irree - magh as dunverys tilgit ayns pryssoon eh v ' ad hene er n ' yeearree ; agh livrey eh Yeesey gys nyn aigney .

text: And as they led him away , they laid hold upon one Simon , a Cyrenian , coming out of the country , and on him they laid the cross , that he might bear it after Jesus .
text2: As myr v ' ad dy chur lhieu eh , haare ad greme er Simon Cyrenian dy row , myr v ' eh cheet jeh ' n cheer , as ersyn hug ad y chrosh , dy ymmyrkey eh geiyrt er Yeesey .

text: And there followed him a great company of people , and of women , which also bewailed and lamented him .
text2: As deiyr er earroo mooar dy leih as dy vraane , va myrgeddin - keayney as jannoo dobberan er e hon .

text: But Jesus turning unto them said , Daughters of Jerusalem , weep not for me , but weep for yourselves , and for your children .
text2: Agh hyndaa Yeesey huc , as dooyrt eh Inneenyn Yerusalem , ny keayn - jee er my hon ' s , agh keayn - jee er nyn son hene , as son nyn gloan .

text: For , behold , the days are coming , in the which they shall say , Blessed are the barren , and the wombs that never bare , and the paps which never gave suck .
text2: Son cur - my - ner , ta ny laghyn cheet , tra jir ad , Bannit ta ny mraane gennish , as ny breinyn nagh ren gymmyrkey , as ny keeaghyn nagh dug bainney .

text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains , Fall on us ; and to the hills , Cover us .
text2: Eisht nee ad toshiaght dy ghra rish ny sleityn , Tuitt - jee orrin ; as rish ny cruink , Coodee - jee shin .

text: For if they do these things in a green tree , what shall be done in the dry ?
text2: Son my t ' ad jannoo ny reddyn shoh rish y billey oor , cre vees er ny yannoo rish y billey creen ?

text: And there were also two other , malefactors , led with him to be put to death .
text2: As va myrgeddin daa chimmagh elley er nyn leeideil magh marish , dy ve er nyn goyrt gy - baase .

text: And when they were come to the place , which is called Calvary , there they crucified him , and the malefactors , one on the right hand , and the other on the left .
text2: As tra v ' ad er jeet gys yn ynnyd ta enmyssit Calvary , ayns shen ren ad eshyn y chrossey , as ny kimmee ; yn derrey yeh er y laue yesh , as y jeh elley er y laue chiare .

text: Then said Jesus , Father , forgive them ; for they know not what they do . And they parted his raiment , and cast lots .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey , Ayr jean leih daue ; son cha vel fys oc cre t ' ad dy yannoo . As rheynn ad e choamrey , as hilg ad lottyn .

text: And the people stood beholding . And the rulers also with them derided him , saying , He saved others ; let him save himself , if he be Christ , the chosen of God .
text2: As va ' n pobble nyn shassoo cur - my - ner : as maroo ren ny fir - reill myrgeddin gannidys er , as gra , Haue eh feallagh elley ; lhig da eh - hene y hauail my she Creest fer reiht Yee eh .

text: And the soldiers also mocked him , coming to him , and offering him vinegar ,
text2: As va ny sidooryn myrgeddin jannoo faghid er , cheet huggey , as chebbal da vinegar ,

text: And saying , If thou be the king of the Jews , save thyself .
text2: As gra , My she ree ny Hewnyn oo , saue oo hene .

text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek , and Latin , and Hebrew , THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: As va ' n scrieu shoh myrgeddin soit erskyn e chione , ayns letteryn dy Ghreek as dy Latin , as dy Hebrew , SHOH REE NY HEWNYN .

text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him , saying , If thou be Christ , save thyself and us .
text2: As ren fer jeh ny kimmee v ' er nyn groghey loayrt dy lunagh n ' oi , gra , My she oo yn Creest , saue oo hene as shinyn .

text: But the other answering rebuked him , saying , Dost not thou fear God , seeing thou art in the same condemnation ?
text2: Agh dreggyr y jeh elley , cur oghsan da , as gra , Nagh vel aggle ort roish Jee , fakin dy vel uss fo yn vriwnys cheddin ?

text: And we indeed justly ; for we receive the due reward of our deeds : but this man hath done nothing amiss .
text2: As shinyn dy jarroo dy cairagh ; son ta shin er gheddyn toilchinys cooie yn jannoo ain : agh cha vel y dooinney shoh er n ' yannoo aggair erbee .

text: And he said unto Jesus , Lord , remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish Yeesey , Hiarn , cooinee orryms tra hig oo gys dty reeriaght .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , To day shalt thou be with me in paradise .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , Dy firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , Dy bee uss marym ' s jiu ayns Paradise .

text: And it was about the sixth hour , and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour .
text2: As ve mysh y cheyoo oor , as va dorraghys harrish ooilley yn cheer gys yn nuyoo oor .

text: And the sun was darkened , and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst .
text2: As va ' n ghrian dorraghey , as va curtan scarree yn chiamble raipit veih - my cheilley .

text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice , he said , Father , into thy hands I commend my spirit : and having said thus , he gave up the ghost .
text2: As tra va Yeesey er n ' eamagh lesh ard - choraa , dooyrt eh , Ayr , gys dty laueyn ta mish chymney my spyrryd : as tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , phaart eh .

text: Now when the centurion saw what was done , he glorified God , saying , Certainly this was a righteous man .
text2: Nish tra honnick y centurion cre va er jeet gy - kione , hug eh moylley da Jee , gra , Ayns firrinys v ' eh shoh ny ghooinney cairagh .

text: And all the people that came together to that sight , beholding the things which were done , smote their breasts , and returned .
text2: As ooilley yn pobble v ' er jeet cooidjagh gys y shilley shen , hug ad my - ner ny reddyn va jeant , as goaill ad nyn gleeau , haink ad rhymboo .

text: And all his acquaintance , and the women that followed him from Galilee , stood afar off , beholding these things .
text2: As ooilley e ainjyssee , as ny mraane deiyr er veih Galilee , hass ad foddey jeh cur - my - ner ny reddyn shoh .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Joseph , a counseller ; and he was a good man , and a just :
text2: As cur - my - ner va dooinney va enmyssit Joseph , va ny er - coyrlee , as ny ghooinney mie as cairagh :

text: ( The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them ; ) he was of Arimathaea , a city of the Jews : who also himself waited for the kingdom of God .
text2: ( Cha row ayrt ny paart echey shoh ayns y choyrle ny yn jannoo oc ) v ' eh veih Arimathea , ard - valley jeh ny Hewnyn , ( va myrgeddin eh - hene farkiaght son reeriaght Yee . )

text: This man went unto Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus .
text2: Hie yn dooinney shoh gys Pilate , as yeearree eh corp Yeesey ,

text: And he took it down , and wrapped it in linen , and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone , wherein never man before was laid .
text2: As ghow eh neose eh , as hoiII eh eh ayns aanrit , as doanluck eh eh ayns oaie va cleight ayns creg , raad nagh row rieau dooinney oanluckit roie .

text: And that day was the preparation , and the sabbath drew on .
text2: As va shen laa yn aarlaghey , as va yn doonaght tayrn er - gerrey .

text: And the women also , which came with him from Galilee , followed after , and beheld the sepulchre , and how his body was laid .
text2: As hie ny mraane myrgeddin haink marish veih Galilee geiyrt er y corp , as hug ad my - ner yn oaie , as kys va ' n corp er ny oanluckey .

text: And they returned , and prepared spices and ointments ; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment .
text2: As haink ad rhymboo , as hooar ad aarloo spisyn as ooilyn ; as ghow ad fea er laa yn doonaght cordail rish yn anney .

text: Now upon the first day of the week , very early in the morning , they came unto the sepulchre , bringing the spices which they had prepared , and certain others with them .
text2: Nish er y chied laa jeh ' n chiaghtin , eer sy vadran , haink ad gys yn oaie , cur lhieu ny spisyn v ' ad er gheddyn aarloo , as mraane elley maroo .

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre .
text2: As hooar ad y chlagh rowlit ersooyl jeh ' n oaie .

text: And they entered in , and found not the body of the Lord Jesus .
text2: As hie ad stiagh , as cha dooar ad corp y Chiarn Yeesey .

text: And it came to pass , as they were much perplexed thereabout , behold , two men stood by them in shining garments :
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' ad ayns imnea mooar son shoh , cur - my - ner hass daa ghooinney lioroo ayns coamrey sollys .

text: And as they were afraid , and bowed down their faces to the earth , they said unto them , Why seek ye the living among the dead ?
text2: As myr v ' ad ayns aggle , as croymmey sheese lesh nyn eddin gys y thalloo , dooyrt ad roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu shirrey yn vio mastey ny merriu ?

text: He is not here , but is risen : remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee ,
text2: Cha vel eh ayns shoh , agh t ' eh er n ' irree : cooinee - jee cre dooyrt eh - hene riu choud ' s v ' eh foast ayns Galilee ,

text: Saying , The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men , and be crucified , and the third day rise again .
text2: Gra , Shegin da ' n Mac dooinney v ' er ny lirrey gys laueyn deiney peccoil , as ve er ny chrossey , as girree reesht er y trsss laa .

text: And they remembered his words ,
text2: As chooinee ad er e ghoan ,

text: And returned from the sepulchre , and told all these things unto the eleven , and to all the rest .
text2: As haink ad back veih yn oaie , as dinsh ad ooilley shoh da ' n un ostyl yeig , as da ooilley yn vooinjer elley .

text: It was Mary Magdalene , and Joanna , and Mary the mother of James , and other women that were with them , which told these things unto the apostles .
text2: She Moirrey Malaine , as Joanna as Moirrey moir Yamys , as mraane elley va maroo , dinsh ny reddyn shoh da ny ostjllyn ,

text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales , and they believed them not .
text2: As ghow ad y ghlare oc myr skeeal branlaadee , a cha dug ad geill daue .

text: Then arose Peter , and ran unto the sepulchre ; and stooping down , he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves , and departed , wondering in himself at that which was come to pass .
text2: Eisht dirree Peddyr as roie eh gys yn oaie , as chroym eh sheese , as honnick eh ny aanrityn nyn lhie er - lheh , as jimmee eh roish , goaill yindys ec ny va er daghyrt .

text: And , behold , two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus , which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs .
text2: As cur - my - ner hie Jees jeu yn laa cheddin gys balley va enmyssit Emmaus , va mysh shiaght veeilley veih Jerusalem .

text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened .
text2: As v ' ad taggloo ry - cheilley mychione dy chooilley nhee v ' er daghyrt .

text: And it came to pass , that , while they communed together and reasoned , Jesus himself drew near , and went with them .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , choud as v ' ad taggloo as resooney ry - cheilley , dy daink Yeesey hene er - gerrey , as dy jagh eh maroo .

text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him .
text2: As va ny sooillyn oc er ny lhiettal nagh dug ad enney er .

text: And he said unto them , What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another , as ye walk , and are sad ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cre ny naightyn shoh ta shiu dy insh yn derrey yeh da ' n jeh elley , myr ta shiu shooyll dy trimshagh er y raad ?

text: And the one of them , whose name was Cleopas , answering said unto him , Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem , and hast not known the things which are come to pass therein these days ?
text2: As dreggyr fer jeu , va ' n ennym echey Cleopas , as dooyrt eh rish , Vel uss agh joarree ayns Jerusalem , as gyn fys ayd er ny reddyn t ' ayns shen er jeet gy - kione er ny laghyn shoh ?

text: And he said unto them , What things ? And they said unto him , Concerning Jesus of Nazareth , which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people :
text2: As dooyrt eh , Cre ny reddyn ? As dooyrt adsyn rish , Mychione Yeesey dy Nazareth , va ny adeyr , as pooaral ayns jannoo as goo , kiongoyrt rish Jee ; as ooilley yn pobble :

text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death , and have crucified him .
text2: As kys ren ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny fir - reill ain y livrey eh dy ve er ny gheyrey gys baase , as t ' ad er chrossey eh .

text: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel : and beside all this , to day is the third day since these things were done .
text2: Agh va shinyn treishteil dy nee eshyn veagh er chur livrey - ys da Israel : as marish shoh ooilley , jiu yn trass laa neayr as hie ny reddyn shoh er jannoo .

text: Yea , and certain women also of our company made us astonished , which were early at the sepulchre ;
text2: Myrgeddin va shiartanse dy vraane jeh ' n cheshaght ain , hug orrin lane yindys y ghoaill , liorish dy row ad dy moghey ec yn oaie :

text: And when they found not his body , they came , saying , that they had also seen a vision of angels , which said that he was alive .
text2: As tra nagh dooar ad yn corp echey , haink ad as dooyrt ad , dy row ad er vakin ashlish dy ainleyn dinsh daue dy row eh bio .

text: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre , and found it even so as the women had said : but him they saw not .
text2: As hie shiartanse jeusyn va marinyn gys yn oaie , as hooar ad eh eer myr va ny mraane er ghra ; agh eh - hene cha vaik ad .

text: Then he said unto them , O fools , and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken :
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh roo , O shiuish gheiney mee hushtagh , as faase - chredjuagh , nagh vel goaill baght jeh ooilley ny ta ny phadeyryn er loayrt !

text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things , and to enter into his glory ?
text2: Nagh beign da Creest ny reddyn shoh y hurranse as goll stiagh ayns e ghloyr ?

text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets , he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself .
text2: As goaill toshiaght ec Moses , as ooilley ny phadeyryn , hug eh bun daue er ooilley ny scriptyryn jeh dy chooilley nhee va bentyn rish hene .

text: And they drew nigh unto the village , whither they went : and he made as though he would have gone further .
text2: As haink ad er - gerrey da ' n balley , raad v ' ad goll : as v ' eh myr dy beagh eh kiarit dy gholl ny - sodjey .

text: But they constrained him , saying , Abide with us : for it is toward evening , and the day is far spent . And he went in to tarry with them .
text2: Agh lhie ad er , gra , Fuirree marin , son ta ' n fastyr er , as bunnys y laa ceaut . As hie eh stiagh dy uirriaght maroo .

text: And it came to pass , as he sat at meat with them , he took bread , and blessed it , and brake , and gave to them .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , myr v ' eh ny hoie ec bee maroo , dy ghow eh arran , as vannee eh , as vrish eh , as hirveish eh orroo eh .

text: And their eyes were opened , and they knew him ; and he vanished out of their sight .
text2: As va ny sooillyn oc er nyn vosley , as hug ad enney er ; as skell eh ersooyl ass nyn shilley .

text: And they said one to another , Did not our heart burn within us , while he talked with us by the way , and while he opened to us the scriptures ?
text2: As dooyrt y derrey yeh jeu rish y jeh elley , Nagh row ny creeaghyn ain lossey cheu - sthie j ' in , choud as v ' eh taggloo rooin er y raad , as choud as v ' eh fosley dooin ny scriptyryn ?

text: And they rose up the same hour , and returned to Jerusalem , and found the eleven gathered together , and them that were with them ,
text2: As hrog ad orroo yn oor cheddin , as hyndaa ad gys Jerusalem , as hooar ad yn un ostyl yeig er nyn jaglym cooidjagh , as y cheshaght va maroo .

text: Saying , The Lord is risen indeed , and hath appeared to Simon .
text2: Dooyrt roo , Ta ' n Chiarn er n ' irree son shickyrys , as v ' eh er ny akin liorish Simon .

text: And they told what things were done in the way , and how he was known of them in breaking of bread .
text2: Eisht dinsh adsyn cre ny reddyn va jeant er y raad , as kys hug ad enney er , liorish brishey arran .

text: And as they thus spake , Jesus himself stood in the midst of them , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: As myr v ' ad myr shoh loayrt , hass Yeesey hene ayns y vean oc , as dooyrt eh roo , Shee dy row hiu .

text: But they were terrified and affrighted , and supposed that they had seen a spirit .
text2: Agh v ' ad seaghnit ayns nyn aigney as agglit , as heill ad dy nee scaan v ' ad dy akin .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye troubled ? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts ?
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cre ' n - fa ta shiu seaghnit , as cre ' n - fa ta mee - ourys troggal ayns nyn greeaghyn ?

text: Behold my hands and my feet , that it is I myself : handle me , and see ; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones , as ye see me have .
text2: Jeeagh - jee er my laueyn as my chassyn dy nee mish mee - hene t ' ayn : loaghtee - jee mee , as jeeagh - jee , son cha vel feill as craueyn ec scaan , myr hee shiu aym ' s .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he shewed them his hands and his feet .
text2: As tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , yeeagh eh daue e laueyn as e chassyn .

text: And while they yet believed not for joy , and wondered , he said unto them , Have ye here any meat ?
text2: As choud as nagh row ad foast credjal son boggey , agh goaill yindys , dooyrt eh roo , Vel veg y veaghey eu ayns shoh ?

text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish , and of an honeycomb .
text2: As hug ad da peesh dy eeast roast as dy chere - volley .

text: And he took it , and did eat before them .
text2: As ghow eh , as d ' ee eh kiongoyrt roo .

text: And he said unto them , These are the words which I spake unto you , while I was yet with you , that all things must be fulfilled , which were written in the law of Moses , and in the prophets , and in the psalms , concerning me .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Shoh ny goan loayr mish riu , choud as va mee foast meriu dy beign da dy chooilley nhee ve cooilleenit va scruit ayns leigh Voses , as ayns ny phadeyryn , as ayns ny psalmyn my - mychione ' s .

text: Then opened he their understanding , that they might understand the scriptures ,
text2: Eisht doshil eh yn tushtey oc , dy voddagh ad ny scriptyryn , y hoiggal ,

text: And said unto them , Thus it is written , and thus it behoved Christ to suffer , and to rise from the dead the third day :
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Shoh myr te scruit , as shoh myr ve kiarit da Creest dy hurranse , as dy irree yn trass laa veih ny merriu :

text: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations , beginning at Jerusalem .
text2: As arrys as leih peccaghyn dy ve er nyn breacheil ayns yn ennym echey , mastey dy chooilley ashoon , goaill toshiaght ec Jerusalem .

text: And ye are witnesses of these things .
text2: As ta shiuish nyn veanishyn jeh ny reddyn shoh .

text: And , behold , I send the promise of my Father upon you : but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem , until ye be endued with power from on high .
text2: As cur - my - ner , ver - yms hiu gialdyn my Ayrey : agh fuirree - jee ayns ard - valley Yerusalem , derrey vees shiu coamrit lesh pooar veih ' n yrjid .

text: And he led them out as far as to Bethany , and he lifted up his hands , and blessed them .
text2: As hug eh lesh magh ad choud as gys Bethany : as hrog eh seose e laueyn as vannee eh ad .

text: And it came to pass , while he blessed them , he was parted from them , and carried up into heaven .
text2: As haink eh gy - kione , choud as v ' eh dy vannaghey ad , dy row eh er ny scarrey voue , as er ny hroggal seose gys niau .

text: And they worshipped him , and returned to Jerusalem with great joy :
text2: As hug ad ooashley da , as hyndaa ad gys Jerusalem lesh boggey mooar :

text: And were continually in the temple , praising and blessing God . Amen .
text2: As v ' ad kinjagh ayns y chiamble , cur moylley as gloyr da Jee .

text: In the beginning was the Word , and the Word was with God , and the Word was God .
text2: Ayns y toshiaght va ' n Goo , as va ' n Goo marish Jee , as va ' n Goo Jee .

text: The same was in the beginning with God .
text2: Va ' n Goo cheddin ayns y toshiaght marish Jee .

text: All things were made by him ; and without him was not any thing made that was made .
text2: Liorishyn va dy chooilley nhee er ny yannoo ; as n ' egooish cha row nhee erbee jeant va er ny yannoo ;

text: In him was life ; and the life was the light of men .
text2: Aynsyn va bea , as va ' n vea soilshey deiney .

text: And the light shineth in darkness ; and the darkness comprehended it not .
text2: As ren y soilshey soilshean ayns y dorraghys , as cha ren y dorraghys goaill - rish .

text: There was a man sent from God , whose name was John .
text2: Va dooinney er ny choyrt veih Jee va enmyssit Ean .

text: The same came for a witness , to bear witness of the Light , that all men through him might believe .
text2: Haink eh shoh son feanish , dy ymmyrkey feanish jeh ' n toilshey , liorishyn dy vod dagh dy chooilley ghooinney credjal .

text: He was not that Light , but was sent to bear witness of that Light .
text2: Cha nee eh va ' n soilshey shen , agh v ' eh er ny choyrt dy ymmyrkey feanish jeh ' n toilshey shen .

text: That was the true Light , which lighteth every man that cometh into the world .
text2: Shen va ' n soilshey firrinagh , ta soilshean ayns dy chooilley ghooinney ta cheet er y theihll .

text: He was in the world , and the world was made by him , and the world knew him not .
text2: V ' eh ayns y theihll as va ' n seihll er ny yannoo liorishyn , as y seihll cha dug enney er .

text: He came unto his own , and his own received him not .
text2: Haink eh gys e vooinjer hene , agh cha ren e vooinjer hene soiaghey jeh .

text: But as many as received him , to them gave he power to become the sons of God , even to them that believe on his name :
text2: Agh whilleen as ren soiaghey jeh , dauesyn hug eh pooar dy ve nyn mec dy Yee , eer dauesyn ta credjal ayns yn ennym echey :

text: Which were born , not of blood , nor of the will of the flesh , nor of the will of man , but of God .
text2: Va er nyn ruggey , cha nee jeh fuill , ny jeh aigney ny foalley , ny jeh aigney dooinney , agh jeh Jee .

text: And the Word was made flesh , and dwelt among us , ( and we beheld his glory , the glory as of the only begotten of the Father , ) full of grace and truth .
text2: As ghow yn Goo er dooghys ny foalley , as ren eh baghey nyn mast ' ain ( as hug shin my - ner yn ghloyr echey , yn ghloyr myr jeh ' n ynrycan Mac er - ny - gheddyn jeh ' n Ayr ) lane dy ghrayse as dy irrinys .

text: John bare witness of him , and cried , saying , This was he of whom I spake , He that cometh after me is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: ( Dymmyrk Ean feanish jeh , as deie eh , gra , Shoh eh jeh ren mish loayrt , T ' eshyn ta cheet my yei er ny hoiaghey roym ; son v ' eh roym )

text: And of his fulness have all we received , and grace for grace .
text2: As jeh ' n slane towse echey ta shin ooilley er gheddyn ayrn , as grayse er grayse .

text: For the law was given by Moses , but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ .
text2: Son va ' n leigh er ny choyrt liorish Moses agh haink grayse as firrinys liorish Yeesey Creest .

text: No man hath seen God at any time ; the only begotten Son , which is in the bosom of the Father , he hath declared him .
text2: Cha vel unnane erbee er vakin Jee ec traa erbee ; yn ynrycan Mac v ' er ny - gheddyn , ta ayns oghrish yn Ayr , eshyn t ' er hoilshaghey eh .

text: And this is the record of John , when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him , Who art thou ?
text2: As shoh feanish Ean , tra hug ny Hewnyn saggyrtyn as Leyiteyn veih Jerusalem dy enaght jeh , Quoi oo hene ?

text: And he confessed , and denied not ; but confessed , I am not the Christ .
text2: As ghow eh rish , as cha dob eh ; agh ghow eh rish , Cha nee mish yn Creest .

text: And they asked him , What then ? Art thou Elias ? And he saith , I am not . Art thou that prophet ? And he answered , No .
text2: As denee ad jeh , Quoi eisht ? Nee oo Elias ? As dooyrt eshyn , Cha nee . Nee oo yn phadeyr shen ? As dansoor eh , Cha nee .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? that we may give an answer to them that sent us . What sayest thou of thyself ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt ad rish , Quoi oo ? dy vod mayd ansoor y choyrt dauesyn t ' er choyrt shin : Cre t ' ou gra my - dty - chione hene ?

text: He said , I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness , Make straight the way of the Lord , as said the prophet Esaias .
text2: Dooyrt eh , Mish coraa fer fockley magh ayns yn aasagh , Kiartee - jee raad y Chiarn , myr dooyrt y phadeyr Esaias .

text: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees .
text2: As v ' adsyn v ' er nyn goyrt , jeh ny Phariseeyn .

text: And they asked him , and said unto him , Why baptizest thou then , if thou be not that Christ , nor Elias , neither that prophet ?
text2: As denee ad jeh , as dooyrt ad rish , Cre ' n - fa t ' ou bashtey eisht mannagh nee oo yn Creest , ny Elias , ny ' n phadeyr shen ?

text: John answered them , saying , I baptize with water : but there standeth one among you , whom ye know not ;
text2: Dreggyr Ean ad , gra , Ta mish bashtey lesh ushtey : agh ta fer shassoo nyn mast ' eu , nagh vel enney eu er ;

text: He it is , who coming after me is preferred before me , whose shoe ' s latchet I am not worthy to unloose .
text2: Eshyn eh ta cheet my yei , agh t ' er ny hoiaghey roym , kiangley ny braagyn echey cha vel mish feeu dy eaysley .

text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan , where John was baptizing .
text2: Va ny reddyn shoh jeant ayns Bethabara er cheu elley jeh Jordan , raad va Ean bashtey

text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him , and saith , Behold the Lamb of God , which taketh away the sin of the world .
text2: Yn nah laa honnick Ean Yeesey cheet ny whail , as dooyrt eh , Cur - my - ner Eayn Yee , ta goaill ersooyl peccah yn theihll .

text: This is he of whom I said , After me cometh a man which is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Shoh eshyn mychione dooyrt mee , My yei ta dooinney cheet , t ' er ny hoiaghey roym ; son v ' eh roym .

text: And I knew him not : but that he should be made manifest to Israel , therefore am I come baptizing with water .
text2: As cha row enney aym ' s er : agh dy beagh eh er ny hoilshaghey da Israel , shen - y - fa haink mish bashtey lesh ushtey .

text: And John bare record , saying , I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove , and it abode upon him .
text2: As dymmyrk Ean feanish , gra , Honnick mee yn Spyrryd cheet neose veih niau myr calmane , as tannaghtyn er .

text: And I knew him not : but he that sent me to baptize with water , the same said unto me , Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending , and remaining on him , the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost .
text2: As cha dug mish enney er : agh eshyn ren mish y choyrt dy vashtey lesh ushtey , dooyrt eh shen rhym , Ersyn hee oo yn Spyrryd cheet neose as tannaghtyn er , shen eh ta bashtey lesh y Spyrryd Noo .

text: And I saw , and bare record that this is the Son of God .
text2: As honnick mee eh , as dymmyrk mee feanish , dy nee shoh Mac Yee .

text: Again the next day after John stood , and two of his disciples ;
text2: Yn nah laa reesht va Ean ny hassoo , as jees jeh e ynseydee :

text: And looking upon Jesus as he walked , he saith , Behold the Lamb of God !
text2: As yeeagh eh er Yeesey , myr v ' eh shooyl , as dooyrt eh , Cur - my - ner Eayn Yee .

text: And the two disciples heard him speak , and they followed Jesus .
text2: As cheayll yn daa ynseydagh eh loayrt , as deiyr ad er Yeesey .

text: Then Jesus turned , and saw them following , and saith unto them , What seek ye ? They said unto him , Rabbi , ( which is to say , being interpreted , Master , ) where dwellest thou ?
text2: Eisht hyndaa Yeesey , as honnick eh ad geiyrt er , as dooyrt eh roo , Cre ta shiu dy hirrey ? Dooyrt adsyn rish , Rabbi ( ta shen dy ghra , ' sy ghlare ainyn , Vainshter ) cre raad t ' ou baghey ?

text: He saith unto them , Come and see . They came and saw where he dwelt , and abode with him that day : for it was about the tenth hour .
text2: Dooyrt eh roo , Tar - jee as hee shiu . Haink ad as honnick ad c ' raad v ' eh baghey , as duirree ad marish yn laa shen : son ve mysh y jeihoo oor .

text: One of the two which heard John speak , and followed him , was Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother .
text2: Eer jeh ' n jees cheayll Ean loayrt , as deiyr er , va Andreays , braar Simon Peddyr .

text: He first findeth his own brother Simon , and saith unto him , We have found the Messias , which is , being interpreted , the Christ .
text2: Hooar eshyn hoshiaght e vraar hene Simon , as dooyrt eh rish , Ta shin er gheddyn yn Messias ta shen dy ghra , Yn Creest .

text: And he brought him to Jesus . And when Jesus beheld him , he said , Thou art Simon the son of Jona : thou shalt be called Cephas , which is by interpretation , A stone .
text2: As hug eh lesh eh gys Yeesey . As tra honnick Yeesey eh , dooyrt eh , Uss Simon mac Jona : bee oo enmyssit Cephas , ta shen dy ghra Peddyr .

text: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee , and findeth Philip , and saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Yn laa er - giyn she aigney Yeesey ve dy gholl magh gys Galilee , as hooar eh Philip , as dooyrt eh rish , Eiyr orrym .

text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida , the city of Andrew and Peter .
text2: Nish va Philip veih Bethsaida , ard valley Andreays as Peddyr .

text: Philip findeth Nathanael , and saith unto him , We have found him , of whom Moses in the law , and the prophets , did write , Jesus of Nazareth , the son of Joseph .
text2: Veeit Philip rish Nathanael , as dooyrt eh rish , Ta shin er gheddyn eshyn , jeh ren Moses ayns y leigh , as ny phadeyryn scrieu , Yeesey dy Nazareth , mac Yoseph .

text: And Nathanael said unto him , Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth ? Philip saith unto him , Come and see .
text2: As dooyrt Nathanael rish , Vod nhee erbee mie cheet magh ass Nazareth ? Dooyrt Philip rish , Tar royd as hee oo .

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him , and saith of him , Behold an Israelite indeed , in whom is no guile !
text2: Honnick Yeesey Nathanael cheet ny whail , as dooyrt eh jehsyn , Cur - my - ner Israelite firrinagh , ayn nagh vel molteyrys erbee .

text: Nathanael saith unto him , Whence knowest thou me ? Jesus answered and said unto him , Before that Philip called thee , when thou wast under the fig tree , I saw thee .
text2: Dooyrt Nathanael rish , Cre ' n enney t ' ayd orrym ' s ? Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , Roish my deie Philip ort , tra v ' ou fo yn villey - figgagh , honnick mee oo .

text: Nathanael answered and saith unto him , Rabbi , thou art the Son of God ; thou art the King of Israel .
text2: Dreggyr Nathanael as dooyrt eh rish , Rabbi , oo mac Yee , oo ree Israel .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Because I said unto thee , I saw thee under the fig tree , believest thou ? thou shalt see greater things than these .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , Er - y - fa dy dooyrt mee rhyt , dy vaik mee oo fo ' n villey - figgagh , vel oo credjal ? hee oo reddyn smoo na ad shoh .

text: And he saith unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Hereafter ye shall see heaven open , and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Ny lurg shoh hee shiu niau foshlit , as ainleyn Yee goll seose as cheet neose er Mac y dooinney .

text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee ; and the mother of Jesus was there :
text2: AS er y trass laa va poosey ayns Cana dy Ghalilee ; as va moir Yeesey ayns shen .

text: And both Jesus was called , and his disciples , to the marriage .
text2: As va chammah Yeesey cuirt , as e ynseydee , gys y vannish .

text: And when they wanted wine , the mother of Jesus saith unto him , They have no wine .
text2: As tra v ' ad laccal feeyn , dooyrt moir Yeesey rish , Cha vel feeyn oc .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , what have I to do with thee ? mine hour is not yet come .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Ven , cre t ' ain dy yannoo rish shen ? cha vel my oor foast er jeet .

text: His mother saith unto the servants , Whatsoever he saith unto you , do it .
text2: Dooyrt e voir rish y vooinjer , Jean - jee shiuish cre - erbee jir eh riu .

text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone , after the manner of the purifying of the Jews , containing two or three firkins apiece .
text2: As va soit ayns shen shey siyn cloaie ry - hoi ushtey , lurg cliaghtey ny Hewnyn son glenney , cummal ghaa ny three dy firkinyn y pheesh .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Fill the waterpots with water . And they filled them up to the brim .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Lhieen - jee ny siyn lesh ushtey . As lhieen ad ad seose gys yn oirr .

text: And he saith unto them , Draw out now , and bear unto the governor of the feast . And they bare it .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Tayrn - jee nish , as cur - jee lhieu gys mainshter ny cuirraghyn . As hug ad lhieu eh .

text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine , and knew not whence it was : ( but the servants which drew the water knew ; ) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom ,
text2: Tra va mainshter ny cuirraghyn er vlashtyn er yn ushtey va chyndait gys , feeyn , as nagh row fys echey cre voish ve ( agh va fys ec ny sharvaantyn va tayrn yn ushtey ~ deie mainshter ny cuirraghyn er y dooinney phoosee

text: And saith unto him , Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine ; and when men have well drunk , then that which is worse : but thou hast kept the good wine until now .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Ta dy chooilley ghooinney ec y toshiaght soiaghey magh feeyn mie ; as tra ta deiney er n ' iu dy mie , eisht feeyn smessey : agh t ' ou uss er vreayll y feeyn mie derrey nish .

text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee , and manifested forth his glory ; and his disciples believed on him .
text2: Yn toshiaght shoh dy virrilyn ren Yeesey ayns Cana dy Ghalilee , as hoilshee eh magh e ghloyr ; as ren e ynseydee credjal ayn .

text: After this he went down to Capernaum , he , and his mother , and his brethren , and his disciples : and they continued there not many days .
text2: Ny lurg shen , hie eh - hene , as e voir , as e vraaraghyn , as e ynseydee sheese gys Capernaum ; as cha nhimmey laa duirree ad ayns shen .

text: And the Jews ' passover was at hand , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem ,
text2: As va Caisht ny Hewnyn er - gerrey , as hie Yeesey seose gys Jerusalem ,

text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves , and the changers of money sitting :
text2: As hooar eh ayns y chiamble feallagh va creck dew , as kirree , as calmaneyn , as y vooinjer va caghlaa argid nyn soie :

text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords , he drove them all out of the temple , and the sheep , and the oxen ; and poured out the changers ' money , and overthrew the tables ;
text2: As tra v ' eh er n ' yannoo kip dy choyrdyn keylley , deiyr eh ad ooilley ass y chiamble , as ny kirree , as ny dew ; as spreih eh magh yn argid ocsyn va caghlaa , as hilg eh harrish ny buird ;

text: And said unto them that sold doves , Take these things hence ; make not my Father ' s house an house of merchandise .
text2: As dooyrt eh roosyn va creck calmaneyn , Ersooyl - jee lesh ny reddyn shoh , ny jean - jee thie my Ayrey ny hie margee .

text: And his disciples remembered that it was written , The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up .
text2: As chooinee e ynseydee dy row eh scruit , Ta graih jeean dty hie er my chur mow .

text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him , What sign shewest thou unto us , seeing that thou doest these things ?
text2: Eisht dreggyr ny Hewnyn , as dooyrt ad rish , Cre ' n cowrey t ' ou dy yeeaghyn dooin , fakin dy vel oo jannoo ny reddyn

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Destroy this temple , and in three days I will raise it up .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Lhieg - jee yn chiamble shoh , as trog - yms eh reesht ayns three laa .

text: Then said the Jews , Forty and six years was this temple in building , and wilt thou rear it up in three days ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn , Shey bleeaney as da - eed va ' n chiamble shoh dy hroggal , as Jean uss troggal eh ayns three laa ?

text: But he spake of the temple of his body .
text2: Agh mychione chiamble e chorp hene loayr eshyn .

text: When therefore he was risen from the dead , his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them ; and they believed the scripture , and the word which Jesus had said .
text2: Shen - y - fa tra v ' eh er n ' irree veih ny merriu , chooinee ny ynseydee dy row eh er ghra shoh roo : as chred ad yn scriptyr , as y raa va Yeesey er loayrt .

text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover , in the feast day , many believed in his name , when they saw the miracles which he did .
text2: Nish tra v ' eh ec Jerusalem ec y chaisht , rish earish ny feailley , ren ymmodee credjal ayns yn ennym echey , tra honnick ad y mirrilyn v ' eh er n ' yannoo .

text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them , because he knew all men ,
text2: Agh cha hreisht Yeesey eh - hene orroo , er - yn - oyr dy row enney echey er dy chooilley ghooinney ,

text: And needed not that any should testify of man : for he knew what was in man .
text2: As nagh row feme echey er unnane erbee dy ymmyrkey feanish jeh dooinney : son va ys echey cre va ayns dooinney .

text: There was a man of the Pharisees , named Nicodemus , a ruler of the Jews :
text2: VA dooinney jeh ny Phariseeyn enmyssit Nicodemus , Dy ard - ghooinney mastey ny Hewnyn :

text: The same came to Jesus by night , and said unto him , Rabbi , we know that thou art a teacher come from God : for no man can do these miracles that thou doest , except God be with him .
text2: Haink eh shoh gys Yeesey ayns yn oie , as dooyrt eh rish , Rabbi , ta fys ain dy nee fer - ynsee as t ' er jeet veih Jee : son cha vod dooinney erbee ny mirrilyn shen y yannoo t ' ou uss dy yannoo , mannagh bee Jee marish .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of God .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , Mannagh bee dooinney er ny ruggey reesht , cha vod eh reeriaght Yee y akin .

text: Nicodemus saith unto him , How can a man be born when he is old ? can he enter the second time into his mother ' s womb , and be born ?
text2: Dooyrt Nicodemus rish , Kys oddys dooinney v ' er ny ruggey tra t ' eh shenn ? vod eh goll stiagh yn nah cheayrt ayns brein , e vayrey , as cheet er y theihll ?

text: Jesus answered , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , Mannagh bee dooinney er ny ruggey jeh ushtey as jeh ' n spyrryd , cha vod eh goll stiagh ayns reeriaght Yee .

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh ; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit .
text2: Shen t ' er ny ruggey jeh ' n eill , te foalley ; as shen t ' er ny ruggey jeh ' n Spyrryd , te spyrrydoil .

text: Marvel not that I said unto thee , Ye must be born again .
text2: Ny gow yindys dy dooyrt mee rhyt , Shegin diu v ' er nyn ruggey reesht .

text: The wind bloweth where it listeth , and thou hearest the sound thereof , but canst not tell whence it cometh , and whither it goeth : so is every one that is born of the Spirit .
text2: Ta ' n gheay sheidey raad saillee , as t ' ou clashtyn y sheean eck , agh cha s ' ayd cre voish t ' ee cheet , ny cre ' n raad t ' ee goll : myr shen ta dy chooilley unnane t ' er ny ruggey Jeh ' n Spyrryd .

text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him , How can these things be ?
text2: Dreggyr Nicodemus as dooyrt eh rish , Kys oddys ny reddyn shoh y ve ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Art thou a master of Israel , and knowest not these things ?
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , Vel uss dty er - ynsee ayns Israel , as nagh vel toiggal ayd jeh ny reddyn shoh ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , We speak that we do know , and testify that we have seen ; and ye receive not our witness .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , ta shin loayrt shen ta fys ain er , as gymmyrkey feanish Jeh ny ta shin er vakin ; as cha vel shiu soiaghey jeh ' n eanish ain .

text: If I have told you earthly things , and ye believe not , how shall ye believe , if I tell you of heavenly things ?
text2: My ta mish er loayrt riu jeh reddyn seihltagh , as nagh vel shiu dy my chredjal , kys nee shiu my chredjal my loayr - ym riu jeh reddyn flaunyssagh ?

text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven , but he that came down from heaven , even the Son of man which is in heaven .
text2: As cha vel dooinney erbee er gholl seose gys niau , agh eshyn haink neose veih niau , eer yn Mac dooinney ta ayns niau .

text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness , even so must the Son of man be lifted up :
text2: As myr ren Moses yn ard - nieu y hroggal seose ayns yn aasagh , myr shen shegin da Mac y dooinney v ' er ny hroggal seose :

text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have eternal life .
text2: Nagh jean quoi - erbee ta credjal ayn cherraghtyn , agh dy bee yn vea ta dy bragh farraghtyn echey .

text: For God so loved the world , that he gave his only begotten Son , that whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have everlasting life .
text2: Son lheid y ghraih shen hug Jee da ' n theihll , dy dug eh e ynrycan Vac v ' er ny gheddyn , nagh jinnagh quoi - erbee chred jagh aynsyn cherraghtyn , agh yn vea ta dy bragh farraghtyn y chosney .

text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world ; but that the world through him might be saved .
text2: Son cha dug Jee e vac gys y theihll , dy gheyrey yn seihll ; agh dy voddagh y seihll liorishyn v ' er ny hauail .

text: He that believeth on him is not condemned : but he that believeth not is condemned already , because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God .
text2: Eshyn ta credjal ayn , cha vel eh er ny gheyrey : agh eshyn nagh vel credjal ayn , t ' eh er ny gheyrey hannah , er - yn - oyr nagh vel eh er chredjal ayns ennym yn ynrycan Mac v ' er ny gheddyn dy Yee .

text: And this is the condemnation , that light is come into the world , and men loved darkness rather than light , because their deeds were evil .
text2: As shoh yn vriwnys , dy vel soilshey er jeet gys y theihll , as dy row deiney ny s ' graihee er y dorraghys ( na er y toilshey , er - y fa dy row nyn obbraghyn olk .

text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light , neither cometh to the light , lest his deeds should be reproved .
text2: Son ta dy chooilley unnane ta jannoo dy holk , cur feoh da ' n toilshey , chamoo t ' eh cheet gys y toilshey , son nagh jig brah er ny obbraghyn echey .

text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light , that his deeds may be made manifest , that they are wrought in God .
text2: Agh eshyn ta jannoo firrinys , t ' eh cheet gys y toilshey , dy vod e obbraghyn v ' er nyn soilshaghey magh , dy vel ad er nyn obbraghey ayns Jee .

text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea ; and there he tarried with them , and baptized .
text2: Ny lurg shoh haink Yeesey as e ynseydee gys cheer Yudea , as duirree eh ayns shen maroo , as ren eh bashtey .

text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim , because there was much water there : and they came , and were baptized .
text2: As va Ean myrgeddin bashtey ayns Enon , er - gerrey da Salem , er - y - fa dy row palchey dy ushtey ayns shen : as haink ad as v ' ad er nyn mashtey .

text: For John was not yet cast into prison .
text2: Son cha row Ean foast tilgit ayns pryssoon .

text: Then there arose a question between some of John ' s disciples and the Jews about purifying .
text2: Eisht dirree question eddyr paart jeh ynseydee Ean as ny Hewnyn , mychione bashtey .

text: And they came unto John , and said unto him , Rabbi , he that was with thee beyond Jordan , to whom thou barest witness , behold , the same baptizeth , and all men come to him .
text2: As haink ad gys Ean , as dooyrt ad rish Rabbi , eshyn va mayrt er cheu elley dy Yordan , da ren oo feanish y ymmyrkey , cur my - ner , t ' eshyn bashtey , as ta dy chooilley ghooinney cheet huggey .

text: John answered and said , A man can receive nothing , except it be given him from heaven .
text2: Dreggyr Ean as dooyrt eh , Cha vod dooinney nhee erbee y ghoaill er hene , mannagh bee eh er ny choyrt da veih niau .

text: Ye yourselves bear me witness , that I said , I am not the Christ , but that I am sent before him .
text2: Ren shiuish shiu hene feanish y ymmyrkey lhiam , dy dooyrt mee , Cha nee mish yn Creest , agh dy vel mee er my choyrt roish .

text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom : but the friend of the bridegroom , which standeth and heareth him , rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom ' s voice : this my joy therefore is fulfilled .
text2: Eshyn dooinney yn phoosee ta ben y phoosee echey : agh ta carrey dooinney yn phoosee ta ny hassoo as geaishtagh rish , goaill boggey mooar jeh coraa yn dooinney poosee : ta shoh my voggey ' s er - y - fa shen jeant magh .

text: He must increase , but I must decrease .
text2: Shegin dasyn bishaghey , agh shegin dooys parail .

text: He that cometh from above is above all : he that is of the earth is earthly , and speaketh of the earth : he that cometh from heaven is above all .
text2: Eshyn ta cheet veih ' n yrjid , t ' eh er skyn ooilley : eshyn ta jeh yn thalloo , t ' eh thallooinagh , as loayrt jeh ' n thalloo : eshyn ta cheet veih niau , t ' eh erskyn ooilley .

text: And what he hath seen and heard , that he testifieth ; and no man receiveth his testimony .
text2: As y red t ' eh er vakin as er chlashtyn , shen t ' eh gymmyrkey feanish jeh ; as cha vel dooinney erbee soiaghey jeh ' n eanish echey .

text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true .
text2: Eshyn t ' er n ' yannoo soiaghey jeh ' n eanish echey , t ' eh er chur y seal echey huggey , dy vel Jee firrinagh .

text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God : for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him .
text2: Son t ' eshyn ta Jee er choyrt , loayrt goan Yee : son cha nee liorish towse ta Jee cur y Spyrryd da .

text: The Father loveth the Son , and hath given all things into his hand .
text2: Ta ' n Ayr graihagh er y Mac , as t ' eh er chur dy chooilley nhee fo yn laue echey .

text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life : and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life ; but the wrath of God abideth on him .
text2: Eshyn ta credjal ayns y Mac , ta ' n vea ta dy bragh farraghtyn echey : as eshyn nagh vel credjal yn Mac , cha vaik eh yn vea , agh nee Jymmoose Yee tannaghtyn er .

text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John ,
text2: TRA va fys ec y Chiarn er - y - fa shen , kys va ny Phariseeyn er chlashtyn dy row Yeesey jannoo as bashtey ny sliee dy eiyrtyssee na va Ean .

text: ( Though Jesus himself baptized not , but his disciples , )
text2: ( Ga nagh row Yeesey hene bashtey , agh e ynseydee )

text: He left Judaea , and departed again into Galilee .
text2: Daag eh Judea , as jimmee eh reesht gys Galilee .

text: And he must needs go through Samaria .
text2: As beign da goll trooid Samaria .

text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria , which is called Sychar , near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph .
text2: Eisht haink eh gys ard - valley dy Samaria , ta enmyssit Sychar , er - gerrey da ' n pheesh dy halloo hug Jacob da e vac Joseph .

text: Now Jacob ' s well was there . Jesus therefore , being wearied with his journey , sat thus on the well : and it was about the sixth hour .
text2: Nish va chibbyr Yacob ayns shen . Myr va Yeesey er - y - fa shen skee lesh e yurnah , hoie eh sheese ayns shen liorish y chibbyr : as ve mysh y cheyoo oor .

text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water : Jesus saith unto her , Give me to drink .
text2: Haink ben dy Samaria dy hayrn ushtey : dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Cur dou jough .

text: ( For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat . )
text2: Son va ny ostyllyn er n ' gholl gys y valley dy chionnaghey beaghey .

text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him , How is it that thou , being a Jew , askest drink of me , which am a woman of Samaria ? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans .
text2: Eisht dooyrt y ven dy Samaria rish , Kys dy vel uss , ta dty Hew , shirrey jough orrym ' s , ta my ven dy Samaria ? son cha vel veg y dellal ec ny Hewnyn rish ny Samaritanee .

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , If thou knewest the gift of God , and who it is that saith to thee , Give me to drink ; thou wouldest have asked of him , and he would have given thee living water .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh r ' ee , Dy beagh fys ayd ' s er gioot Yee , as quoi eh ta gra rhyt , Cur jough dou ! veagh oo er hirrey ersyn , as veagh eh er chur dhyt ushtey bio .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , thou hast nothing to draw with , and the well is deep : from whence then hast thou that living water ?
text2: Dooyrt y ven rish , Vainshter , cha vel red erbee ayd dy hayrn lesh , as ta ' n chibbyr dowin : cre voish eisht ta ' n ushtey bio shen ayd ?

text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob , which gave us the well , and drank thereof himself , and his children , and his cattle ?
text2: Vel uss ny s ' ooasle na ' n ayr ain Jacob , hug dooin y chibbyr shoh , as diu j ' ee eh hene , as e chloan , as y maase echey ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again :
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh r ' ee , Quoi - erbee iu - ys jeh ' n ushtey shoh bee eh paagh reesht :

text: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst ; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life .
text2: Agh quoi - erbee iu - ys jeh ' n ushtey ver - yms da , cha bee eh dy bragh paagh : agh bee yn ushtey ver - ym da ny farrane ushtey ayn nee geill gys y vea ta dy bragh farraghtyn .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , give me this water , that I thirst not , neither come hither to draw .
text2: Dooyrt y ven rish , Vainshter , cur dooys yn ushtey shoh , nagh bee ' m paagh , as nagh jig - ym ayns shoh dy hayrn .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Go , call thy husband , and come hither .
