text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Immee as eie er dty heshey , as tar ayns shoh .

text: The woman answered and said , I have no husband . Jesus said unto her , Thou hast well said , I have no husband :
text2: Dreggyr y ven as dooyrt ee , Cha vel sheshey aym . Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , t ' ou er ghra dy mie , Cha vel sheshey aym :

text: For thou hast had five husbands ; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband : in that saidst thou truly .
text2: Son ta queig deiney er ny ve ayd , as eshyn t ' ayd nish , cha nee dty heshey - poost eh : ayns shen t ' ou er ghra yn irriney ,

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , I perceive that thou art a prophet .
text2: Dooyrt y ven rish , Vainshter , ta mee cur tastey dy nee phadeyr oo .

text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain ; and ye say , that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship .
text2: Ren ny ayraghyn ain ooashlaghey Jee er y clieau shoh ; as ta shiuish gra , dy nee ayns Jerusalem ta ' n boayl raad lhisagh sleih ooashlaghey .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , believe me , the hour cometh , when ye shall neither in this mountain , nor yet at Jerusalem , worship the Father .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Ven , cred mish , ta ' n oor cheet tra nagh jean shiu er y clieau shoh , ny foast ec Jerusalem ooashley ' choyrt da ' n Ayr .

text: Ye worship ye know not what : we know what we worship : for salvation is of the Jews .
text2: Ta shiuish cur ooashley da , cha s ' eu cre : ta fys ainyn cre ta shin cur ooashley da ; son ta saualtys jeh ny Hewnyn .

text: But the hour cometh , and now is , when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth : for the Father seeketh such to worship him .
text2: Agh ta ' n oor cheet , as nish ayn dy jean ny ooashleyderyn firrinagh ooashlaghey yn Ayr ayns Spyrryd as ayns firrinys : son ta ' n Ayr shirrey nyn lheid oc shoh dy chur ooashley da .

text: God is a Spirit : and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth .
text2: Ta Jee ny Spyrryd , as shegin dauesyn ta ooashlaghey eh , ooashley y choyrt da ayns Spyrryd as ayns firrinys .

text: The woman saith unto him , I know that Messias cometh , which is called Christ : when he is come , he will tell us all things .
text2: Dooyrt y ven rish , Ta fys aym dy vel Messias cheet ta enmyssit Creest : tra hig eshyn , inshee eh dooin dy chooilley nhee .

text: Jesus saith unto her , I that speak unto thee am he .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , She mish ta loayrt rhyt eh shen .

text: And upon this came his disciples , and marvelled that he talked with the woman : yet no man said , What seekest thou ? or , Why talkest thou with her ?
text2: As er shen haink e ostyllyn , as ghow ad yindys dy row eh taggloo rish y ven : foast cha dooyrt dooinney erbee , Cre t ' ou dy hirrey ? ny , Cre ' n - fa t ' ou taggloo r ' ee ?

text: The woman then left her waterpot , and went her way into the city , and saith to the men ,
text2: Daag yn ven eisht yn saagh - ushtey eck , as hie ee rhymbee gys y valley , as dooyrt ee rish ny deiney

text: Come , see a man , which told me all things that ever I did : is not this the Christ ?
text2: Tarjee as hee shiu dooinney t ' er n ' insh dou ooilley ny ren mee rieau : nagh nee shoh yn Creest ?

text: Then they went out of the city , and came unto him .
text2: Eisht hie ad magh ass y valley as haink ad huggey .

text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him , saying , Master , eat .
text2: Ayns y traa shen ghuee e ostyllyn er , gra , Vainshter , gow beaghey .

text: But he said unto them , I have meat to eat that ye know not of .
text2: Agh dooyrt eshyn roo , Ta bee aym ' s dy ee nagh vel fys euish er .

text: Therefore said the disciples one to another , Hath any man brought him ought to eat ?
text2: Shen - y - fa dooyrt ny ostyllyn yn derrey yeh rish y jeh elley , Vel dooinney erbee er chur lesh nhee erbee huggey dy ee ?

text: Jesus saith unto them , My meat is to do the will of him that sent me , and to finish his work .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Yn beaghey aym ' s eh , dy yannoo yn aigney echeysyn t ' er my choyrt , as dy chooilleeney yn obbyr echey .

text: Say not ye , There are yet four months , and then cometh harvest ? behold , I say unto you , Lift up your eyes , and look on the fields ; for they are white already to harvest .
text2: Nagh vel shiu gra , dy vel kiare meeghyn foast , as eisht ta ' n fouyr cheet ? cur - my ner ta mish gra riu , Trog - jee seose nyn sooillyn , as jeeagh - jee er ny magheryn ; son t ' ad bane hannah son y fouyr .

text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages , and gathereth fruit unto life eternal : that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together .
text2: As ta ' n beaynee geddyn faill , as chaglym mess gys y vea veayn : dy vod chammah yn correyder as y beaynee boggey y ghoaill cooidjagh .

text: And herein is that saying true , One soweth , and another reapeth .
text2: As ayns shoh ta ' n raa shen firrinagh , Ta fer cuirr , as fer elley buinn .

text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour : other men laboured , and ye are entered into their labours .
text2: Hug mish shiu magh dy vuinn cooid nagh ren shiu y laboragh : ta deiney elley er laboragh , as ta shiuish er gholl stiagh er y laboraght oc .

text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman , which testified , He told me all that ever I did .
text2: As ren ymmodee jeh Samaritanee yn ard - valley shen credjal ayn , kyndagh rish raa yn ven , ren feanish y ymmyrkey , Dinsh eh dou ooilley ny ren mee rieau .

text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him , they besought him that he would tarry with them : and he abode there two days .
text2: Myr shoh tra va ny Samaritanee el jeet huggey , ghuee ad er , eh dy uirriaght maroo : as duirree eh ayns shen daa laa .

text: And many more believed because of his own word ;
text2: As ren ymmodee elley credjal ayn e coontey e ghoo hene ;

text: And said unto the woman , Now we believe , not because of thy saying : for we have heard him ourselves , and know that this is indeed the Christ , the Saviour of the world .
text2: As dooyrt ad rish y ven , Nish ta shin credjal , cha nee son y raa ayd ' s ; son ta shiu hene er chlashtyn eh , as ta fys ain , dy nee shoh dy jarroo yn Creest Saualtagh y theihll .

text: Now after two days he departed thence , and went into Galilee .
text2: Nish lurg daa laa jimmee eh veih shen , as hie eh roish gys Galilee :

text: For Jesus himself testified , that a prophet hath no honour in his own country .
text2: Son ren Yeesey hene feanish y ymmyrkey , nagh vel ooashley ec phadeyr ayns e heer hene ,

text: Then when he was come into Galilee , the Galilaeans received him , having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast : for they also went unto the feast .
text2: Tra v ' eh eisht er jeet gys Galilee , ren ny Galileanee mooar jeh , liorish dy row ad er vakin ooilley ny ren eh ec Jerusalem , ec y feailley : son v ' adsyn er ve ec y feailley .

text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee , where he made the water wine . And there was a certain nobleman , whose son was sick at Capernaum .
text2: Myr shen haink Yeesey reesht gys Cana ayns Galilee , raad v ' eh er hyndaa yn ushtey gys feeyn . As va chiarn dy row , va ' n mac echey ching ec Capernaum .

text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee , he went unto him , and besought him that he would come down , and heal his son : for he was at the point of death .
text2: Tra cheayll eh dy row Yeesey er jeet veih Judea gys Galilee , hie eh huggey , as ghuee eh er , eh dy heet neose dy lheihys e vac : son v ' eh raad y vaaish .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Except ye see signs and wonders , ye will not believe .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish , Mannagh vaik shiu cowraghyn as yindyssyn , cha jean shiu credjal .

text: The nobleman saith unto him , Sir , come down ere my child die .
text2: Dooyrt y chiarn rish , Vainshter , tar neose roish my vow my lhiannoo baase .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Go thy way ; thy son liveth . And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him , and he went his way .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Immee royd ; ta dty vac bio . As chred y dooinney yn ockle va Yeesey er loayrt rish , as hie eh roish .

text: And as he was now going down , his servants met him , and told him , saying , Thy son liveth .
text2: As tra v ' eh nish goll sheese , haink ny sharvaantyn echey ny whail , as dinsh ad da , gra , Ta dty vac bio .

text: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend . And they said unto him , Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him .
text2: Eisht denee eh jeu cre ' n oor ren eh toshiaght dy choural : as dooyrt ad rish , Jea ec y chiaghtoo oor daag y chiassaghey eh .

text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour , in the which Jesus said unto him , Thy son liveth : and himself believed , and his whole house .
text2: Myr shen va fys ec yn ayr dy nee ayns yn oor cheddin va Yeesey er ghra rish , Ta dty vac bio ; as ren eh - hene credjal as ooilley e hie .

text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did , when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee .
text2: Shoh neesht yn nah virril ren Yeesey , tra v ' eh er jeet veih Judea gys Galilee .

text: After this there was a feast of the Jews ; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
text2: NY lurg shoh va feailley ny Hewnyn , as hie Yeesey seose gys Jerusalem .

text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool , which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda , having five porches .
text2: Nish ta ec Jerusalem liorish giat ny geyrragh , loghan , ta enmyssit ayns y ghlare Hebrewnagh Bethesda , ta queig porchyn er .

text: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk , of blind , halt , withered , waiting for the moving of the water .
text2: Ayndoo shoh va nyn lhie ymmodee dy leih dourinagh , doail , baccee , shirgeydee , as v ' ad fieau er gleashaght yn ushtey .

text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool , and troubled the water : whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had .
text2: Son va ainle goll sheese ec lheid y traa shen ayns yn ushtey , as seiy yn ushtey : quoi erbee eisht va hoshiaght goll sheese lurg seiy yn ushtey , v ' eh er ny laanaghey jeh doghan erbee dy row er .

text: And a certain man was there , which had an infirmity thirty and eight years .
text2: As va ayns shen dooinney dy row , va doghan er ve er rish hoght bleeaney jeig as feed .

text: When Jesus saw him lie , and knew that he had been now a long time in that case , he saith unto him , Wilt thou be made whole ?
text2: Tra honnick Yeesey eh ny lhie , as fys echey dy row eh er ve myr shen ry - foddey dy hraa , dooyrt eh rish , Nailt ve er dty laanaghey ?

text: The impotent man answered him , Sir , I have no man , when the water is troubled , to put me into the pool : but while I am coming , another steppeth down before me .
text2: Dreggyr yn annooinagh eh , Vainshter , cha vel dooinney erbee aym , tra ta ' n ushtey seiyt , dy my cur sheese ayns y loghan : agh choud as ta mee cheet , ta fer elley goll sheese roym .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Rise , take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Trog ort , gow seose dty lhiabbee as jean shooyll .

text: And immediately the man was made whole , and took up his bed , and walked : and on the same day was the sabbath .
text2: As er - y - chooyl va ' n dooinney er ny lheihys , as ghow eh seose e lhiabbee , as huill eh : as er y laa shen va ' n doonaght .

text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured , It is the sabbath day : it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed .
text2: Dooyrt ny Hewnyn er - y - fa shen rishyn v ' er ny lheihys , She laa yn doonaght t ' ayn ; cha vel eh lowal dhyt gymmyrkey dty lhiabbee .

text: He answered them , He that made me whole , the same said unto me , Take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Dreggyr eshyn ad , Eshyn ren m ' y laanaghey , dooyrt eh shen rhym , Trog dty lhiabbee as shooill .

text: Then asked they him , What man is that which said unto thee , Take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Eisht denee ad jeh , Quoi va yn dooinney shen dooyrt rhyt , Trog dty lhiabbee as shooill ?

text: And he that was healed wist not who it was : for Jesus had conveyed himself away , a multitude being in that place .
text2: As cha row fys echeysyn v ' er ny lheihys , quoi v ' eh : son va Yeesey er gholl dy lhiattee , liorish dy row chaglym mooar dy leih ayns y voayl shen .

text: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple , and said unto him , Behold , thou art made whole : sin no more , lest a worse thing come unto thee .
text2: Ny lurg shen hooar Yeesey eh ayns y chiamble , as dooyrt eh rish , Cur - my - ner , t ' ou er dty laanaghey : ny jean peccah ny smoo , er - aggle dy jig red smessey ort .

text: The man departed , and told the Jews that it was Jesus , which had made him whole .
text2: Jimmee yn dooinney roish , as dinsh eh da ny Hewnyn dy nee Yeesey v ' er laanaghey eh .

text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus , and sought to slay him , because he had done these things on the sabbath day .
text2: As er - yn - oyr shen ren ny Hewnyn tranlaase er Yeesey , as v ' ad shirrey eh y choyrt gy - baase , er - y - fa dy row eh er n ' yannoo ny red dyn shoh er laa yn doonaght .

text: But Jesus answered them , My Father worketh hitherto , and I work .
text2: Agh dreggyr Yeesey ad , Ta my Ayr gobbraghey derrey nish : as ta mish gobbraghey .

text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him , because he not only had broken the sabbath , but said also that God was his Father , making himself equal with God .
text2: Shen - y - fa va ny Hewnyn wheesh shen smoo shleeuit er cur dy baase eh ; er - yn - oyr dy row eh cha nee ynrycan er vrishey yn doonaght , agh er ghra myrgeddin dy nee Jee va ' n Ayr echey , jannoo eh - hene corrym rish Jee .

text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , The Son can do nothing of himself , but what he seeth the Father do : for what things soever he doeth , these also doeth the Son likewise .
text2: Eisht dreggyr Yeesey , as dooyrt eh roo , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Cha vod y Mac nhee erbee y yannoo jeh hene , agh ny t ' eh fakin yn Ayr dy yannoo : son cre - erbee t ' eshyn dy yannoo , ta ' n Mac jannoo myrgeddin .

text: For the Father loveth the Son , and sheweth him all things that himself doeth : and he will shew him greater works than these , that ye may marvel .
text2: Son ta ' n Ayr graihagh er y Mac , as t ' eh soilshaghey da dy chooilley nhee t ' eh hene dy yannoo : as soilshee eh da obbragh yn smoo na ad shoh , dy vod shiu yindys y ghoaill .

text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead , and quickeneth them ; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will .
text2: Son myr ta ' n Ayr troggal seose , as cur bioys da ny merriu : eer myr shen ta ' n Mac bioghey yn vooinjer saillish .

text: For the Father judgeth no man , but hath committed all judgment unto the Son :
text2: Son cha vel yn Ayr briwnys dooinney erbee ; agh t ' eh er livrey dy chooilley vriwnys gys y Mac :

text: That all men should honour the Son , even as they honour the Father . He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him .
text2: Dy voddagh dy chooilley ghooinney ooashley y choyrt da ' n Mac , myr t ' ad cur ooashley da ' n Ayr . Eshyn nagh vel cur ooashley da ' n Mac , cha vel eh coyrt ooashley da ' n Ayr ren y choyrt eh .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that heareth my word , and believeth on him that sent me , hath everlasting life , and shall not come into condemnation ; but is passed from death unto life .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Eshyn ta clashtyn my ghoo ' s , as credjal ayn syn t ' er my choyrt , ta ' n vea ta dy bragh farraghtyn echey , as cha jig eh gys coayl - anmey : agh t ' eh er gholl veih baase gys bea .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The hour is coming , and now is , when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God : and they that hear shall live .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Ta ' n oor cheet , as nish ayn , tra nee ny merriu clashtyn coraa Mac Yee : as bee adsyn chlinnys er nyn mioghey .

text: For as the Father hath life in himself ; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself ;
text2: Son ' naght myr ta ec yn Ayr bioys ayn hene ; myr shen t ' eh er choyrt da ' n Mac bioys y ve echey ayn hene ;

text: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also , because he is the Son of man .
text2: As t ' eh er choyrt da pooar dy yannoo briwnys myrgeddin , er - y - fa dy nee Mac y dooinney eh .

text: Marvel not at this : for the hour is coming , in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice ,
text2: Ny gow - jee yindys jeh shoh : son ta ' n oor cheet , tra chlinnys ooilley ny t ' ayns ny oaiaghyn e choraa ,

text: And shall come forth ; they that have done good , unto the resurrection of life ; and they that have done evil , unto the resurrection of damnation .
text2: As hig ad magh ; adsyn t ' er n ' yannoo dy mie , gys irree - seose - reesht y vea ; as adsyn t ' er n ' yannoo dy olk , gys irree - seose reesht y choayl - anmey .

text: I can of mine own self do nothing : as I hear , I judge : and my judgment is just ; because I seek not mine own will , but the will of the Father which hath sent me .
text2: Cha voddym jee ' m pene nhee erbee y yannoo : myr ta mee clashtyn , ta mee briwnys : as ta my vriwnys cairagh , er - yn - oyr nagh vel mee shirrey my aigney hene , agh aigney yn Ayr t ' er my choyrt .

text: If I bear witness of myself , my witness is not true .
text2: My ta mee gymmyrkey feanish jee ' m pene , cha vel my eanish firrinagh .

text: There is another that beareth witness of me ; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true .
text2: Ta fer elley ta gymmyrkey feanish jee ' m , as ta fys aym dy vel yn eanish t ' eh dy ymmyrkey jee ' m firrinagh .

text: Ye sent unto John , and he bare witness unto the truth .
text2: Hug shiuish fys gys Ean , as dymmyrk eh feanish gys yn irriney .

text: But I receive not testimony from man : but these things I say , that ye might be saved .
text2: Agh cha vel mish goaill fenish veih dooinney : agh shoh ta mee dy ghra , dy vod shiu v ' er nyn sauail .

text: He was a burning and a shining light : and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light .
text2: V ' eshyn ny hoilshey gial as sollys : as va shiu booiagh son earish boggey ' ghoaill ayns y soilshey echey .

text: But I have greater witness than that of John : for the works which the Father hath given me to finish , the same works that I do , bear witness of me , that the Father hath sent me .
text2: Agh ta feanish stroshey aym ' s na Ean : son ny obbraghyn hug my Ayr dou dy chooilleeney , ny obbraghyn cheddin ta mee dy yannoo , t ' ad gymmyrkey feanish jee ' m , dy vel yn Ayr er my choyrt .

text: And the Father himself , which hath sent me , hath borne witness of me . Ye have neither heard his voice at any time , nor seen his shape .
text2: As ta ' n Ayr hene t ' er my choyrt , er n ' ymmyrkey feanish jee ' m . Cha vel shiuish er chlashtyn e choraa ec traa erbee , ny er vakin e chaslys .

text: And ye have not his word abiding in you : for whom he hath sent , him ye believe not .
text2: As cha vel eu yn goo echeysyn tannaghtyn ayndiu : son eshyn t ' eh er choyrt , aynsyn cha vel shiu credjal .

text: Search the scriptures ; for in them ye think ye have eternal life : and they are they which testify of me .
text2: Ronsee - jee ny scriptyryn , son ayndoosyn ta shiu smooinaghtyn dy vel y vea veayn eu , as she ad shen ta gymmyrkey feanish jeem ' s .

text: And ye will not come to me , that ye might have life .
text2: As cha vel shiu booiagh cheet hym ' s , dy vod yn vea y ve eu .

text: I receive not honour from men .
text2: Cha vel mish soiaghey jeh ooashley deiney .

text: But I know you , that ye have not the love of God in you .
text2: Agh ta toiggal aym jiuish , nagh vel graih Yee ayndiu .

text: I am come in my Father ' s name , and ye receive me not : if another shall come in his own name , him ye will receive .
text2: Ta mish er jeet ayns ennym my Ayrey , as cha vel shiu goaill rhym : my hig fer elley ayns e ennym hene , rishyn nee shiu goaill .

text: How can ye believe , which receive honour one of another , and seek not the honour that cometh from God only ?
text2: Kys oddys shiuish credjal ta geddyn ooashley yn derrey yeh veih yn jeh elley , as nagh vel shirrey yn ooashley ta veih Jee ny lomarcan ?

text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father : there is one that accuseth you , even Moses , in whom ye trust .
text2: Ny smooinee - jee dy jean - yms plaiynt erriu gys yn Ayr : ta ayn ta plaiynt nyn ' oi eu , eer Moses , ayn ta shiu treishteil .

text: For had ye believed Moses , ye would have believed me : for he wrote of me .
text2: Son dy beagh shiu er chredjal Moses , veagh shiu er chredjal aynym ' s ; son scrieu eh jeem ' s .

text: But if ye believe not his writings , how shall ye believe my words ?
text2: Agh mannagh gred shiu ny screeuyn echeysyn , kys nee shiu credjal ny goan aym ' s ?

text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee , which is the sea of Tiberias .
text2: NY lurg shoh hie Yeesey harrish faarkey Ghalilee , ny Tiberias .

text: And a great multitude followed him , because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased .
text2: As deiyr earroo mooar dy leih er , er - y - fa dy vaik ad ny mirrilyn ren eh orroosyn va doghanit .

text: And Jesus went up into a mountain , and there he sat with his disciples .
text2: As hie Yeesey seose er slieau , as hoie eh ayns shen marish e ostyllyn .

text: And the passover , a feast of the Jews , was nigh .
text2: As va ' n Chaisht , feailley ny Hewnyn er gerrey .

text: When Jesus then lifted up his eyes , and saw a great company come unto him , he saith unto Philip , Whence shall we buy bread , that these may eat ?
text2: Tra va Yeesey eisht er hroggal seose e hooillyn , as fakin earroo mooar dy leih cheet huggey , dooyrt eh rish Philip , Cre - voish oddys mayd arran y chionnaghey , dy yannoo magh ad shoh ?

text: And this he said to prove him : for he himself knew what he would do .
text2: ( As shoh dooyrt eh dy phrowal eh : son v ' eh hene kiarit cre dy yannoo . )

text: Philip answered him , Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them , that every one of them may take a little .
text2: Dreggyr Philip eh , Cha bee feeagh daa cheead ping dy arran dy liooar daue , dy vod dagh unnane oc kuse y ghoaill .

text: One of his disciples , Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother , saith unto him ,
text2: Dooyrt fer jeh ny ostyllyn echey , Andreays , braar Simon Peddyr , rish ,

text: There is a lad here , which hath five barley loaves , and two small fishes : but what are they among so many ?
text2: Ta scollag ayns shoh ta queig bwilleenyn oarn echey , as daa eeast veggey ; agh cre t ' ad shen mastey whilleen ?

text: And Jesus said , Make the men sit down . Now there was much grass in the place . So the men sat down , in number about five thousand .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey , Cur - jee er ny deiney soie sheese . Nish va lane faiyr ayns yn ynnyd . Myr shen hoie ny deiney sheese ayns earroo mysh queig thousaneyn .

text: And Jesus took the loaves ; and when he had given thanks , he distributed to the disciples , and the disciples to them that were set down ; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would .
text2: As ghow Yeesey ny bwilleenyn , as tra v ' eh er chur booise , rheynn eh ad er e ostyllyn , as rheynn adsyn ad orroosyn myr v ' ad soie ; as myrgeddin jeh ny eeastyn wheesh as bailloo .

text: When they were filled , he said unto his disciples , Gather up the fragments that remain , that nothing be lost .
text2: Tra v ' ad jeant magh , dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn , Jean - jee yn vrooilliagh ta er - mayrn y haglym cooidjagh nagh bee nhee erbee caillit .

text: Therefore they gathered them together , and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves , which remained over and above unto them that had eaten .
text2: Er shen ren ad eh y haglym , as lhieen ad daa vaskad jeig lesh fooilliagh ny queig bwilleenyn oarn , va er - mayrn erreish daue v ' er n ' ee .

text: Then those men , when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did , said , This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ny deiney shen , tra v ' ad er vakin y mirril va Yeesey er n ' yannoo . She shoh ayns firrinys yn phadeyr shen va ry - hoi cheet gys y theihll .

text: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force , to make him a king , he departed again into a mountain himself alone .
text2: Tra dennee Yeesey er - y - fa shen dy darragh ad , as dy goghe ad eh er - niart , dy yannoo eh ny ree , hie eh seose reesht er slieau eh - hene ny - lomarcan .

text: And when even was now come , his disciples went down unto the sea ,
text2: As tra va ' n fastyr er , hie e ostyllyn sheese gys y cheayn .

text: And entered into a ship , and went over the sea toward Capernaum . And it was now dark , and Jesus was not come to them .
text2: As ghow ad lhuingys , as haink ad harrish y cheayn gys Capernaum : as ve nish dorraghey , as cha row Yeesey er jeet huc .

text: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew .
text2: As dhatt y keayn lesh niart stermagh ny geayee .

text: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs , they see Jesus walking on the sea , and drawing nigh unto the ship : and they were afraid .
text2: Myr shen tra v ' ad er n ' ymmyrt mysh kiare veeilley , honnick ad Yeesey shooyl er y cheayn , as tayrn er - gerrey da ' n lhong : as ghow ad aggle .

text: But he saith unto them , It is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Agh dooyrt eshyn roo , She mish t ' ayn , ny bee aggle erriu .

text: Then they willingly received him into the ship : and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went .
text2: Eisht ghow ad eh dy arryltagh stiagh ayns y lhong : as chelleeragh va ' n lhong ec y thalloo raad v ' ad goll .

text: The day following , when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there , save that one whereinto his disciples were entered , and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat , but that his disciples were gone away alone ;
text2: Yn laa er - giyn , tra honnick yn pobble va nyn shassoo cheu elley jeh ' n cheayn nagh row baatey erbee elley ayns shen , cheu - mooie jeh ' n un vaatey shen va ny ostyllyn er n ' ghoaill , as nagh jagh Yeesey maroosyn ayns y vaatey , agh dy row ny ostyllyn er n ' gholl ersooyl nyn - lomarcan :

text: ( Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread , after that the Lord had given thanks : )
text2: ( Ny - yeih va baatyn elley er jeet veih Tiberias , er - gerrey da ' n boayl ren ad arran y ee ayn , erreish da ' n Chiarn v ' er chur booise . )

text: When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there , neither his disciples , they also took shipping , and came to Capernaum , seeking for Jesus .
text2: Tra honnick y pobble er - y - fa shen nagh row Yeesey ayns shen , ny e ostyllyn , ghow adsyn myrgeddin lhuingys , as haink ad gys Capernaum , briaght son Yeesey .

text: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea , they said unto him , Rabbi , when camest thou hither ?
text2: As tra hooar ad eh er y cheu elley jeh ' n cheayn , dooyrt ad rish , Rabbi , cuin haink oo ayns shoh ?

text: Jesus answered them and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Ye seek me , not because ye saw the miracles , but because ye did eat of the loaves , and were filled .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , as dooyrt eh , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Ta shiu dy my hirrey ' s , cha nee er - yn - oyr dy vaik shiu ny mirrilyn , agh son dy d ' ee shiu jeh ny bwilleenyn , as dy row shiu jeant magh .

text: Labour not for the meat which perisheth , but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life , which the Son of man shall give unto you : for him hath God the Father sealed .
text2: Ny bee - jee imneagh son y beaghey ta cherraghtyn , agh son y beaghey shen ta tannaghtyn gys y vea veayn , nee yn Mac dooinney y choyrt diu : son eshyn ta Jee yn Ayr er chowraghey .

text: Then said they unto him , What shall we do , that we might work the works of God ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt ad rish , Cre nee mainyn , dy vod mayd obbraghyn Yee y yannoo ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , This is the work of God , that ye believe on him whom he hath sent .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Shoh obbyr Yee , shiu dy chredjal aynsyn t ' eh er choyrt .

text: They said therefore unto him , What sign shewest thou then , that we may see , and believe thee ? what dost thou work ?
text2: Dooyrt ad er - y - fa shen rish , Cre ' n cowrey t ' ou dy yeeaghyn eisht , dy vod mayd fakin as credjal aynyd ? cre ta dty obbyr ?

text: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert ; as it is written , He gave them bread from heaven to eat .
text2: D ' ee ny ayraghyn ain manna ayns yn aasagh ; myr te scruit , Hug eh daue arran veih niau dy ee .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Moses gave you not that bread from heaven ; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Cha dug Moses diu yn arran shen veih niau , agh my Ayr ta coyrt diu yn arran firrinagh veih niau .

text: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven , and giveth life unto the world .
text2: Son arran Yee eshyn ta cheet neose veih niau , as ta cur e vioys son y theihll .

text: Then said they unto him , Lord , evermore give us this bread .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ad rish , Cur dooinyn dy bragh yn arran shoh .

text: And Jesus said unto them , I am the bread of life : he that cometh to me shall never hunger ; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Mish arran y vea : eshyn ta cheet hym ' s , cha bee eh dy bragh accryssagh ; as eshyn ta credjal aynym , cha bee eh dy bragh paagh .

text: But I said unto you , That ye also have seen me , and believe not .
text2: Agh ta mish er ghra riu , dy vel shiu myrgeddin er my akin ' s , as nagh vel shiu credjal .

text: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me ; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out .
text2: Hig adsyn ooilley hym ' s ta ' n Ayr dy chur dou ; as eshyn ta cheet hym , cha jeanym er aght erbee y yiooldey voym .

text: For I came down from heaven , not to do mine own will , but the will of him that sent me .
text2: Son haink mish neose veih niau , cha nee dy yannoo my aigney hene , agh yn aigney echeysyn ren m ' y choyrt .

text: And this is the Father ' s will which hath sent me , that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing , but should raise it up again at the last day .
text2: As shoh aigney yn Ayr ta er my choyrt , jeh ooilley ny hug eh dou nagh gaillin veg , agh dy droggin eh seose reesht ec y laa jerrinagh .

text: And this is the will of him that sent me , that every one which seeth the Son , and believeth on him , may have everlasting life : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: As shoh yn aigney echeysyn ta er my choyrt , dy chooilley unnane ta fakin y Mac as credjal ayn , yn vea dy bragh farraghtyn dy ve echey : as trog - yms seose eh ec y laa jerrinagh .

text: The Jews then murmured at him , because he said , I am the bread which came down from heaven .
text2: Eisht va ny Hewnyn jymmoosagh rish , er - y - fa dy dooyrt eh , Mish arran y vea haink neose veih niau .

text: And they said , Is not this Jesus , the son of Joseph , whose father and mother we know ? how is it then that he saith , I came down from heaven ?
text2: As dooyrt ad , Nagh nee shoh Yeesey Mac Yoseph , yn ayr as y voir echey shione dooin ? kys eisht dy vel eh gra , Haink mee neose veih niau ?

text: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them , Murmur not among yourselves .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey er - y - fa shen as dooyrt eh roo , Ny lhig da jymmoose ve ny mast ' eu .

text: No man can come to me , except the Father which hath sent me draw him : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Cha vod dooinney erbee cheet hym ' s , mannagh jean yn Ayr t ' er my choyrt y hayrn eh : as trog - yms seose eh ec y laa jerrinagh .

text: It is written in the prophets , And they shall be all taught of God . Every man therefore that hath heard , and hath learned of the Father , cometh unto me .
text2: Te scruit ayns ny phadeyryn , As bee ad ooilley ynsit liorish Jee . Dy chooilley ghooinney er - y - fa shen t ' er chlashtyn , as er n ' ynsaghey veih yn Ayr , t ' eh cheet hym ' s .

text: Not that any man hath seen the Father , save he which is of God , he hath seen the Father .
text2: Cha nee dy vel dooinney erbee er va kin yn Ayr , cheu - mooie jehsyn ta veih Jee , t ' eh shen er vakin yn Ayr .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me hath everlasting life .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Eshyn ta credjal ayn - yms ta ' n vea ta dy bragh farraghtyn echey .

text: I am that bread of life .
text2: Mish arran y vea .

text: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness , and are dead .
text2: D ' ee ny ayraghyn euish manna ayns yn aasagh , as t ' ad marroo .

text: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven , that a man may eat thereof , and not die .
text2: Shoh yn arran ta cheet neose veih niau , dy vod dooinney gee jeh , as gyn baase y gheddyn .

text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven : if any man eat of this bread , he shall live for ever : and the bread that I will give is my flesh , which I will give for the life of the world .
text2: Mish yn arran bio , haink neose veih niau : my ee - ys dooinney erbee jeh ' n arran shoh , bee eh bio son dy bragh : as yn arran neem ' s y choyrt , she my eill eh , ver - yms son bioys y theihll .

text: The Jews therefore strove among themselves , saying , How can this man give us his flesh to eat ?
text2: Va ec ny Hewnyn er - y - fa shen argane nyn mast oc hene , gra , Kys oddys y dooinney shoh cur dooin e eill dy ee ?

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man , and drink his blood , ye have no life in you .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Dy firrinagh focklagh ta mee gra riu , Mannagh jean shiu feill yn Mac dooinney y ee , as e uill y iu , cha vel y vea eu ayndiu .

text: Whoso eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , hath eternal life ; and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Eshyn ta gee my eill , as giu my uill , ta ' n vea veayn echey , as trog - yms seose eh ec y laa jerrinagh .

text: For my flesh is meat indeed , and my blood is drink indeed .
text2: Son dy firrinagh she bee my eill , as dy firrinagh she jough my uill .

text: He that eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , dwelleth in me , and I in him .
text2: Eshyn ta gee my eill as giu my uill , t ' eh baghey aynym ' s , as mish aynsyn

text: As the living Father hath sent me , and I live by the Father : so he that eateth me , even he shall live by me .
text2: Myr ta ' n Ayr bio er my choyrt ' s , as ta mee bio liorish yn Ayr : myr shen neesht vees eshyn ta dy my ee ' s , bio liorym .

text: This is that bread which came down from heaven : not as your fathers did eat manna , and are dead : he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever .
text2: Shoh yn arran haink neese veih niau ; cha nee myr ren ny ayraghyn eu manna y ee , as t ' ad marroo : bee eshyn ta gee jeh ' n arran shoh , bio son dy bragh .

text: These things said he in the synagogue , as he taught in Capernaum .
text2: Ny goan shoh loayr eh ayns y synagogue , myr v ' eh gynsaghey ayns Capernaum .

text: Many therefore of his disciples , when they had heard this , said , This is an hard saying ; who can hear it ?
text2: Dooyrt ymmodee er - y - fa shen jeh e eiyrtee , tra cheayll ad shoh , Shoh raa creoi , quoi oddys y chlashtyn eh ?

text: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it , he said unto them , Doth this offend you ?
text2: Tra va fys ec Yeesey ayn hene dy row e eiyrtee jymmoosagh son shoh , dooyrt eh roo , Vel shoh cheet ayns raad y chredjue eu ?

text: What and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before ?
text2: Cre my hee shiu Mac y dooinney goll seose raad v ' eh roie ?

text: It is the spirit that quickeneth ; the flesh profiteth nothing : the words that I speak unto you , they are spirit , and they are life .
text2: She yn spyrryd ta bioghey , cha vel yn eill jannoo veg y vie : ny goan ta mish dy loayrt riu , t ' ad spyrryd as t ' ad bea .

text: But there are some of you that believe not . For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not , and who should betray him .
text2: Agh ta paart jiuish nagh vel credjal . Son va fys ec Yeesey er - dyn toshiaght , quoi v ' ad nagh row credjal , as quoi yinnagh eh y vrah .

text: And he said , Therefore said I unto you , that no man can come unto me , except it were given unto him of my Father .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Shen - y - fa dooyrt mish riu , nagh vod dooinney erbee cheet hym ' s mannagh bee eh er ny choyrt da liorish my Ayr .

text: From that time many of his disciples went back , and walked no more with him .
text2: Veih yn traa shen hie ymmodee jeh e eiyrtee back , as cha huill ad arragh marish .

text: Then said Jesus unto the twelve , Will ye also go away ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish y daa ostyl yeig , Jed shiuish myrgeddin reue ?

text: Then Simon Peter answered him , Lord , to whom shall we go ? thou hast the words of eternal life .
text2: Eisht dreggyr Simon Peddyr eh , Hiarn , quoi gys hem mayd ? ayd ' s ta goan y vea veayn .

text: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ , the Son of the living God .
text2: As ta shin credjal , as shickyr jeh dy nee uss yn Creest , Mac y Jee bio .

text: Jesus answered them , Have not I chosen you twelve , and one of you is a devil ?
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , Nagh vel mish er reih shiuish yn ghaa - yeig , as ta fer j ' iu ny youyl ?

text: He spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon : for he it was that should betray him , being one of the twelve .
text2: Loayr eh jeh Yuaase Iscariot mac Simon : son eshyn eh va dy vrah eh , as v ' eh fer jeh ' n daa ostyl yeig .

text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee : for he would not walk in Jewry , because the Jews sought to kill him .
text2: NY lurg shoh duirree Yeesey ayns Galillee : son cha row eh booiagh cummal ayns Judea , er - yn - oyr dy row ny Hewnyn shirrey eh y varroo .

text: Now the Jews ' feast of tabernacles was at hand .
text2: Nish va feailley cabbaneyn ny Hewnyn er - gerrey .

text: His brethren therefore said unto him , Depart hence , and go into Judaea , that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest .
text2: Dooyrt e vraaraghyn er - y - fa shen rish , Faag y voayl shoh , as immee gys Judea , dy vod ny eiyrtee t ' ayd ayns shen myrgeddin fakin ny obbraghyn t ' ou dy yannoo .

text: For there is no man that doeth any thing in secret , and he himself seeketh to be known openly . If thou do these things , shew thyself to the world .
text2: Son cha vel dooinney erbee freayll e obbraghyn follit , as eh - hene shirrey dy ve cronnal : My t ' ou jannoo ny reddyn shoh soilshee oo hene da ' n theihll .

text: For neither did his brethren believe in him .
text2: Son chamoo ren e vraaraghyn hene credjal ayn .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , My time is not yet come : but your time is alway ready .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Cha vel my hraa ' s foast er jeet : agh ta ' n traa euish dy kinjagh jesh diu .

text: The world cannot hate you ; but me it hateth , because I testify of it , that the works thereof are evil .
text2: Cha vod y seihll dwoaie y chur diuish , agh dooys te cur dwoaie ; er - yn - oyr dy vel mee gymmyrkey feanish jeh , dy vel ny obbraghyn echey olk .

text: Go ye up unto this feast : I go not up yet unto this feast ; for my time is not yet full come .
text2: Immee - jee shiuish seose gys y feailley shoh : cha vel mish son goll seose foast gys y feailley shoh , er - yn - oyr nagh vel my hraa foast er jeet .

text: When he had said these words unto them , he abode still in Galilee .
text2: Tra v ' eh er ghra ny goan shoh roo duirree eh myr v ' eh ayns Galilee .

text: But when his brethren were gone up , then went he also up unto the feast , not openly , but as it were in secret .
text2: Agh tra va e vraaraghyn er gholl seose , eisht hie eshyn myrgeddin seose gys y feailley , cha nee dy foshlit , agh myr dy beagh eh dy follit .

text: Then the Jews sought him at the feast , and said , Where is he ?
text2: Eisht va ny Hewnyn briaght er e hon ec y feailley , as dooyrt ad , Cre vel eh ?

text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him : for some said , He is a good man : others said , Nay ; but he deceiveth the people .
text2: As va lane argane mastey yn pobble mychione echey : son va paart gra , She dooinney mie eh : as feallagh elley gra , Cha nee ; agh t ' eh molley yn pobble .

text: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews .
text2: Ny - yeih , cha loayr dooinney erbee dy foshlit jeh , goaill aggle roish ny Hewnyn .

text: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple , and taught .
text2: Nish mysh mean y feailley , hie Yeesey seose gys y chiamble , as dynsee eh .

text: And the Jews marvelled , saying , How knoweth this man letters , having never learned ?
text2: As ghow ny Hewnyn yindys , gra , Kys ta lheid yn ynsagh ec y dooinney shoh , nagh row eh - hene rieau ynsit ?

text: Jesus answered them , and said , My doctrine is not mine , but his that sent me .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , as dooyrt eh , Cha vel my ynsagh lhiam pene , agh leshyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: If any man will do his will , he shall know of the doctrine , whether it be of God , or whether I speak of myself .
text2: My vees dooinney erbee aggindagh yn aigney echeysyn y yannoo , yiow eh toiggal jeh ' n ynsagh , nee veih Jee te , ny vel mee loayrt jee ' m pene .

text: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory : but he that seeketh his glory that sent him , the same is true , and no unrighteousness is in him .
text2: Eshyn ta loayrt jeh hene , t ' eh shirrey e ooashley hene : agh eshyn ta shirrey yn ooashley echeysyn t ' er choyrt eh , t ' eh shen firrinagh , as cha vel neu - chairys erbee ayn .

text: Did not Moses give you the law , and yet none of you keepeth the law ? Why go ye about to kill me ?
text2: Nagh dug Moses yn leigh diu , as cha vel fer j ' iu freayll yn leigh ? Cre ' n - fa ta shiu shirrey my vioys y ghoaill ?

text: The people answered and said , Thou hast a devil : who goeth about to kill thee ?
text2: Dreggyr y pobble eh , as dooyrt ad , Ta drogh - spyrryd breagagh aynyd : Quoi ta shirrey dty vioys y ghoaill ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , I have done one work , and ye all marvel .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Ta mish er n ' yannoo yn un obbyr shoh , as ta shiu ooilley goaill yindys .

text: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision ; ( not because it is of Moses , but of the fathers ; ) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man .
text2: Hug Moses er - y - fa shen yn giarey chymmylt diu , ( cha nee son dy vel eh jeh Moses , agh jeh ny ayraghyn ) as ta shiu er laa yn doonaght giarey - chymmylt dooinney .

text: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision , that the law of Moses should not be broken ; are ye angry at me , because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day ?
text2: My ta dooinney er y doonaght goaill giarey chymmylt , son nagh bee leigh Voses er ny vrishey ; vel shiuish jymmoosagh rhym ' s , son dy vel mee er n ' yannoo dooinney ooilley magh slane er y doonaght ?

text: Judge not according to the appearance , but judge righteous judgment .
text2: Ny jean - jee briwnys rere yn caslys , agh jean - jee briwnys cairagh .

text: Then said some of them of Jerusalem , Is not this he , whom they seek to kill ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt paart jeusyn va veih Jerusalem , Nagh nee shoh eh t ' ad shirrey dy varroo ?

text: But , lo , he speaketh boldly , and they say nothing unto him . Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ ?
text2: Agh cur - my - ner , t ' eh loayrt dy foshlit , as cha vel ad gra veg n ' oi : vel dy jarroo fys ec ny firreill dy nee shoh yn Creest firrinagh ?

text: Howbeit we know this man whence he is : but when Christ cometh , no man knoweth whence he is .
text2: Ny - yeih ta enney ain er y dooinney shoh cre - voish t ' eh : agh tra hig Creest , cha bee fys ec dooinney erbee cre - voish t ' eh .

text: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught , saying , Ye both know me , and ye know whence I am : and I am not come of myself , but he that sent me is true , whom ye know not .
text2: Eisht deie Yeesey ayns y chiamble myr v ' eh gynsaghey , gra , Ta chammah enney eu orrym ' s , aa ta fys eu cre - voish ta mee : as cha vel mish er jeet jee ' m pene , agh t ' eshyn t ' er ny choyrt firrinagh , eshyn cha nione diu .

text: But I know him : for I am from him , and he hath sent me .
text2: Agh shione dooys eh , son ta mee veih , as t ' eh er my choyrt .

text: Then they sought to take him : but no man laid hands on him , because his hour was not yet come .
text2: Eisht v ' ad shirrey y ghoaill eh : agh cha dug dooinney erbee laue er , son nagh row yn oor echey foast er jeet .

text: And many of the people believed on him , and said , When Christ cometh , will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done ?
text2: As ren ymmodee jeh ' n pobble credjal ayn , as dooyrt ad , Tra hig Creest , jean eh ny shlee mirril na ad shoh ta ' n dooinney shoh er n ' yannoo ?

text: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him ; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him .
text2: Cheayll ny Phariseeyn dy row yn pobble tallagh myr shoh my - e - chione : as hug ny Phariseeyn as ny ard - saggyrtyn magh sidooryn dy ghoaill eh .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Yet a little while am I with you , and then I go unto him that sent me .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Foast tammylt beg ta mish meriu , as eisht ta mee goll huggeysyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come .
text2: Shirree shiu mee agh cha vow shiu mee : as y raad ta mish , cha vod shiuish cheet .

text: Then said the Jews among themselves , Whither will he go , that we shall not find him ? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles , and teach the Gentiles ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn nyn mast ' oc hene , C ' raad hed eh , nagh vow mayd eh ? jed eh gys ny Hewnyn t ' er nyn skeayley mastey ny Ashoonee , as adsyn y ynsaghey .

text: What manner of saying is this that he said , Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come ?
text2: Cre ' n monney dy raa shoh t ' eh er loayrt , Shirree shiu mee , agh cha vow shiu mee : as y raad ta mish cha vod shiuish cheet ?

text: In the last day , that great day of the feast , Jesus stood and cried , saying , If any man thirst , let him come unto me , and drink .
text2: Er y laa s ' jerree , laa mooar ny feailley , hass Yeesey , as deie eh , gra , My ta dooinney erbee paagh , lhig da cheet hym ' s as giu .

text: He that believeth on me , as the scripture hath said , out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water .
text2: Eshyn ta credjal aynym ' s , myr ta ' n scriptyr er ghra , Ass y chree echeysyn roieys strooanyn dy ushtey bio .

text: ( But this spake he of the Spirit , which they that believe on him should receive : for the Holy Ghost was not yet given ; because that Jesus was not yet glorified . )
text2: ( Agh shoh loayr eh jeh ' n Spyrryd , v ' adsyn va credjal ayn ry - hoi gheddyn : son cha row yn Spyrryd Noo foast er ny choyrt , er yn - oyr nagh row Yeesey foast er ny ghloyraghey . )

text: Many of the people therefore , when they heard this saying , said , Of a truth this is the Prophet .
text2: Dooyrt ymmodee jeh ' n phobble er - y fa shen , tra cheayll ad y raa shoh , Ayns firrinys shoh yn phadeyr .

text: Others said , This is the Christ . But some said , Shall Christ come out of Galilee ?
text2: Dooyrt feallagh elley , She shoh yn Creest . Agh dooyrt paart , Jig Creest ass Galilee ?

text: Hath not the scripture said , That Christ cometh of the seed of David , and out of the town of Bethlehem , where David was ?
text2: Nagh vel y scriptyr er ghra , dy vel Creest dy heet jeh sluight Ghavid , as ass y balley Bethlehem , raad ruggyr David ?

text: So there was a division among the people because of him .
text2: Myr shen va streeu mastey ' n pobble mychione echey .

text: And some of them would have taken him ; but no man laid hands on him .
text2: As va paart jeu son goaill eh ; agh cha dug dooinney jeu laue er .

text: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees ; and they said unto them , Why have ye not brought him ?
text2: Eisht haink ny sidooryn gys ny ard saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn , dooyrt roo , Cre ' n - fa nagh dug shiu lhieu eh ?

text: The officers answered , Never man spake like this man .
text2: Dreggyr ny sidooryn , Cha ren rieau dooinney loayrt myr y dooinney shoh .

text: Then answered them the Pharisees , Are ye also deceived ?
text2: Eisht dreggyr ny Phariseeyn ad , Vel shiuish myrgeddin er nyn molley ?

text: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him ?
text2: Vel veg jeh ny fir - reill , as jeh ny Phariseeyn er chredjal ayn ?

text: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed .
text2: Agh ta ' n pobble shoh , nagh vel toiggal yn leigh , fo mollaght .

text: Nicodemus saith unto them , ( he that came to Jesus by night , being one of them , )
text2: Dooyrt Nicodemus roo ( eh haink gys Yeesey ayns yn oie , v ' eh fer jeusyn . )

text: Doth our law judge any man , before it hear him , and know what he doeth ?
text2: Vel y leigh ainyn deyrey dooinney erbee roish clashtyn y choyrt da , as prowal oc n ' oi cre t ' eh er n ' yannoo ?

text: They answered and said unto him , Art thou also of Galilee ? Search , and look : for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet .
text2: Dreggyr adsyn , as dooyrt ad rish , Nee ass Galilee t ' ou uss myrgeddin ? jean - jee ronsaghey as jeeaghyn : son cha vel phadeyr erbee er droggal ayns Galilee .

text: And every man went unto his own house .
text2: As jimmee dy chooilley ghooinney roish gys e hie hene .

text: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives .
text2: HIE Yeesey gys cronk ny Oliveyn .

text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple , and all the people came unto him ; and he sat down , and taught them .
text2: As dy moghey laa - ny - vairagh hie eh reesht gys y chiamble , as haink ooilley yn phobble huggey ; as hoie eh sheese , as dynsee eh ad .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery ; and when they had set her in the midst ,
text2: As hug ny scrudeyryn as ny Phariseeyn lhieu huggey ben va goit ayns brishey - poosey ; as tra v ' ad er hoiaghey ee kiongoyrt rish ,

text: They say unto him , Master , this woman was taken in adultery , in the very act .
text2: Dooyrt ad rish , Vainshter , va ' n ven shoh goit ayns brishey - poosey , ayns yn eer peccah .

text: Now Moses in the law commanded us , that such should be stoned : but what sayest thou ?
text2: Nish ta Moses ayns y leigh er chur sarey dooin , e lheid dy ve er ny claghey , agh cre t ' ou uss dy ghra ?

text: This they said , tempting him , that they might have to accuse him . But Jesus stooped down , and with his finger wrote on the ground , as though he heard them not .
text2: Shoh dooyrt ad dy phrowal eh , dy vod dagh cooish chassid y ve oc n ' oi . Agh chroym Yeesey sheese , as lesh e vair scrieu eh er y laare , myr nagh beagh eh dy nyn glashtyn .

text: So when they continued asking him , he lifted up himself , and said unto them , He that is without sin among you , let him first cast a stone at her .
text2: As myr lhie ad er son ansoor , hrog eh eh - hene seose , as dooyrt eh roo , Lhig dasyn ta fegooish peccah nyn mast ' eu tilgey yn chied chlagh urree .

text: And again he stooped down , and wrote on the ground .
text2: As chroym eh sheese reesht , as scrieu eh er y laare .

text: And they which heard it , being convicted by their own conscience , went out one by one , beginning at the eldest , even unto the last : and Jesus was left alone , and the woman standing in the midst .
text2: As v ' adsyn cheayll eh , er nyn gheyrey liorish nyn gooin - sheanse hene , as hie ad magh fer lurg fer jeu , goaill toshiaght veih yn er - shinney gys yn er - saa : as va Yeesey faagit ny - lomarcan , as y ven ny shassoo kiongoyrt rish .

text: When Jesus had lifted up himself , and saw none but the woman , he said unto her , Woman , where are those thine accusers ? hath no man condemned thee ?
text2: Tra hrog Yeesey eh - hene seose , as nagh vaik eh unnane erbee agh y ven , dooyrt eh r ' ee , Ven , cre vel ad shen dty chassidee ? vel dooinney erbee er dty gheyrey ?

text: She said , No man , Lord . And Jesus said unto her , Neither do I condemn thee : go , and sin no more .
text2: Dooyrt ish , Cha vel dooinney erbee , Hiarn . As dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Chamoo ta mish dy dty gheyrey : immee royd , as ny jean peccah arragh .

text: Then spake Jesus again unto them , saying , I am the light of the world : he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness , but shall have the light of life .
text2: Eisht loayr Yeesey roo reesht , gra , Mish soilshey yn theihll : eshyn ta geiyrt orrym ' s , cha shooyllee eh ayns y dorraghys , agh bee echeysyn soilshey yn vea ,

text: The Pharisees therefore said unto him , Thou bearest record of thyself ; thy record is not true .
text2: Dooyrt ny Phariseeyn er - y - fa shen rish , T ' ou gymmyrkey feanish jeed hene ; cha vel dty eanish firrinagh .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Though I bear record of myself , yet my record is true : for I know whence I came , and whither I go ; but ye cannot tell whence I come , and whither I go .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh roo , Ga dy vel mee gymmyrkey feanish jee ' m pene , foast ta ' n eanish firrinagh : son ta fys aym cre - voish haink mee , as c ' raad ta mee goll ; agh cha s ' euish cre - voish haink mee ny c ' raad ta mee goll .

text: Ye judge after the flesh ; I judge no man .
text2: Ta shiuish briwnys lurg briwnys ny foalley ; cha vel mish briwnys dooinney erbee .

text: And yet if I judge , my judgment is true : for I am not alone , but I and the Father that sent me .
text2: As foast my ta mee briwnys , ta my vriwnys firrinagh : son cha vel mish my lomarcan , agh mish as yn Ayr t ' er my choyrt , t ' eh marym .

text: It is also written in your law , that the testimony of two men is true .
text2: Eer ayns y leigh eu hene te scruit , dy vel feanish daa ghooinney firrinagh .

text: I am one that bear witness of myself , and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me .
text2: Ta mish gymmyrkey feanish dou hene , as ta ' n Ayr t ' er my choyrt gymmyrkey feanish dou .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is thy Father ? Jesus answered , Ye neither know me , nor my Father : if ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ad rish , Cre vel dty Ayr ? Dreggyr Yeesey , Cha vel enney eu orrym ' s , ny er my Ayr : dy beagh enney er ve eu orrym s , veagh enney er ve eu er my Ayr myrgeddin .

text: These words spake Jesus in the treasury , as he taught in the temple : and no man laid hands on him ; for his hour was not yet come .
text2: Ny goan shoh loayr Yeesey ' sy room tashtee , myr v ' eh gynsaghey ayns y chiamble : as cha dug dooinney erbee laue er , son cha row yn oor echey foast er jeet .

text: Then said Jesus again unto them , I go my way , and ye shall seek me , and shall die in your sins : whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo reesht , Ta mee goll roym , as nee shiu my hirrey , as yiow shiu baase ayns nyn beccaghyn : raad ta mish goll , cha vod shiuish cheet .

text: Then said the Jews , Will he kill himself ? because he saith , Whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn , Jean eh eh hene y varroo ? er - yn - oyr dy vel eh gra , raad ta mish goll , cha vod shiuish cheet .

text: And he said unto them , Ye are from beneath ; I am from above : ye are of this world ; I am not of this world .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Ta shiuish veih heese ta mish veih heose : ta shiuish jeh ' n theihll shoh , cha vel mish jeh ' n theihll shoh .

text: I said therefore unto you , that ye shall die in your sins : for if ye believe not that I am he , ye shall die in your sins .
text2: Dooyrt mee er - y - fa shen riu , dy voghe shiu baase ayns nyn beccaghyn : son mannagh vel shiu credjal dy nee mish eh , yiow shiu baase ayns nyn beccaghyn .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? And Jesus saith unto them , Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ad rish , Quoi oo hene ? As dooyrt Yeesey roo , Yn fer cheddin dooyrt mee riu er - dyn toshiaght .

text: I have many things to say and to judge of you : but he that sent me is true ; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him .
text2: Ta ymmodee reddyn aym ' s dy ghra as dy vriwnys jiuish : agh ta eshyn t ' er my choyrt firrinagh as ta mee loayrt rish y theihll shen ta mee er chlashtyn veihsyn .

text: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father .
text2: Cha hoig ad dy row eh loayrt roo my chione yn Ayr .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , When ye have lifted up the Son of man , then shall ye know that I am he , and that I do nothing of myself ; but as my Father hath taught me , I speak these things .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Tra vees shiu erreish yn Mac dooinney y hroggal seose , eisht bee fys eu dy nee mish eh , as nagh vel mee jannoo nhee erbee jee ' m pene ; agh dy vel mee loayrt ny reddyn shen ta my Ayr er chur roym .

text: And he that sent me is with me : the Father hath not left me alone ; for I do always those things that please him .
text2: As ta eshyn t ' er my choyrt marym : cha vel yn Ayr er my aagail my lomarcan : son ta mee dy kinjagh jannoo ny reddyn shen ta dy wooiys eh .

text: As he spake these words , many believed on him .
text2: Choud as v ' eh loayrt ny goan shoh ren ymmodee credjal ayn .

text: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him , If ye continue in my word , then are ye my disciples indeed ;
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish ny Hewnyn shen va credjal ayn , My nee shiu tannaghtyn ayns my ghoo , eisht bee shiu dy jarroo ny ynseydee ayms ;

text: And ye shall know the truth , and the truth shall make you free .
text2: As bee toiggal eu jeh ' n irriney , as nee yn irriney shiu y heyrey .

text: They answered him , We be Abraham ' s seed , and were never in bondage to any man : how sayest thou , Ye shall be made free ?
text2: Dreggyr adsyn eh , She sluight Abraham shin , as cha row shin rieau ayns bondiaght da dooinney erbee : cre ' n aght t ' ou gra eisht , Bee shiu er nyn yannoo seyr ?

text: Jesus answered them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , Dy firrinagh - focklagh ta mee gra riu , Quoi - erbee ta cur - rish peccah , t ' eh ayns bondiaght peccah .

text: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever : but the Son abideth ever .
text2: As cha vel y charvaant tannaghtyn kinjagh ayns y thie : agh ta ' n Mac tannaght yn kinjagh .

text: If the Son therefore shall make you free , ye shall be free indeed .
text2: My nee yn Mac er - y - fa shen shiuish seyr , bee shiu seyr dy jarroo .

text: I know that ye are Abraham ' s seed ; but ye seek to kill me , because my word hath no place in you .
text2: Ta fys aym dy nee sluight Abraham shiu ; agh ta shiu shirrey mish y varroo , er - y - fa nagh vel my ghoo er ghoaill greme erriu .

text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father : and ye do that which ye have seen with your father .
text2: Ta mish loayrt shen ny ta mee er n ' akin ec my Ayr ' s : as ta shuish jannoo shen ny ta shiu er vakin ec yn ayr euish .

text: They answered and said unto him , Abraham is our father . Jesus saith unto them , If ye were Abraham ' s children , ye would do the works of Abraham .
text2: Dreggyr ad as dooyrt ad rish , Abraham yn ayr ainyn . Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Dy beagh shiuish nyn gloan da Abraham , yinnagh shiu obbraghyn Abraham .

text: But now ye seek to kill me , a man that hath told you the truth , which I have heard of God : this did not Abraham .
text2: Agh nish ta shiu shirrey mish y varroo , dooinney t ' er n ' insh diu yn irriney , ta mee er chlashtyn veih Jee : shoh cha ren Abraham .

text: Ye do the deeds of your father . Then said they to him , We be not born of fornication ; we have one Father , even God .
text2: Ta shiuish cur - rish obbraghyn nyn ayrey hene . Eisht dooyrt ad rish , Cha ruggyr shinyn ayns maarderys ; cha vel agh un Ayr ain , ta shen , Jee .

text: Jesus said unto them , If God were your Father , ye would love me : for I proceeded forth and came from God ; neither came I of myself , but he sent me .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Dy beagh Jee yn Ayr eu , veagh shiu graihagh orrym ' s ; son hie mee magh , as haink mee veih Jee ; as cha daink mee jee ' m pene , agh eshyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: Why do ye not understand my speech ? even because ye cannot hear my word .
text2: Cre ' n - fa nagh vel shiu toiggal my ghlare ? te son nagh vel shiu cur geill da my ghoo .

text: Ye are of your father the devil , and the lusts of your father ye will do . He was a murderer from the beginning , and abode not in the truth , because there is no truth in him . When he speaketh a lie , he speaketh of his own : for he is a liar , and the father of it .
text2: Ta shiuish jeh ' n ayr eu yn drogh spyrryd , as saynt nyn ayrey ver shiu rish : v ' eshyn ny ghunver er - dyn toshiaght , as cha ren eh tannaghtyn ' syn ynrickys , son nagh vel yn irriney ayn . Tra t ' eh loayrt breg , t ' eh loayrt jeh e chooid hene : son t ' eh ny vreagerey , as ayr ny breagey .

text: And because I tell you the truth , ye believe me not .
text2: As ga dy vel mee ginsh diu yn irriney , cha vel shiu dy my chredjal .

text: Which of you convinceth me of sin ? And if I say the truth , why do ye not believe me ?
text2: Quoi jiuish ta cur peccah my lieh ? as my ta mee gra yn irriney , cre ' n - fa nagh vel shiu dy my chredjal ?

text: He that is of God heareth God ' s words : ye therefore hear them not , because ye are not of God .
text2: Eshyn ta veih Jee , t ' eh cur geill da goan Yee : agh cha vel shiuish cur geill daue , son nagh vel shiu veih Jee .

text: Then answered the Jews , and said unto him , Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan , and hast a devil ?
text2: Eisht dreggyr ny Hewnyn , as dooyrt ad rish , Nagh vel shin gra yn irriney , dy nee Samaritan oo , as dy vel drogh - spyrryd aynyd .

text: Jesus answered , I have not a devil ; but I honour my Father , and ye do dishonour me .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , Cha vel drogh - spyrryd aynym ' s ; agh ta mee cur ooashley da my Ayr , as ta shiuish cur mee - ooashley dooys .

text: And I seek not mine own glory : there is one that seeketh and judgeth .
text2: As cha vel mee shirrey my ghloyr hene : ta fer ayn ta shirrey as briwnys .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , If a man keep my saying , he shall never see death .
text2: Dy firrinagh - focklagh ta mee gra riu , My ta dooinney freayll my raa ' s , cha vaik eh yn baase dy bragh beayn .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Now we know that thou hast a devil . Abraham is dead , and the prophets ; and thou sayest , If a man keep my saying , he shall never taste of death .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn rish , Nish ta fys ain dy vel drogh - spyrryd aynyd . Ta Abraham marroo as ny phadeyryn ; as t ' ou uss gra , My ta dooinney freayll my raa ' s , cha jean eh blashtyn er y baase dy bragh beayn .

text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham , which is dead ? and the prophets are dead : whom makest thou thyself ?
text2: Vel uss ny s ' ooasle na ' n ayr ain Abraham , ta marroo ? as ta ny phadeyryn marroo : quoi t ' ou jannoo jeed hene ?

text: Jesus answered , If I honour myself , my honour is nothing : it is my Father that honoureth me ; of whom ye say , that he is your God :
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , My ta mee cur ooashley dou hene , cha vel my ooashley agh beggan feeu : she my Ayr ta cur ooashley dou , jehsyn ta shiuish loayrt , dy nee yn Jee eu eh :

text: Yet ye have not known him ; but I know him : and if I should say , I know him not , I shall be a liar like unto you : but I know him , and keep his saying .
text2: Ny - yeih cha nione diuish eh ; agh shione dooys eh : as dy n ' yiarrin nagh nione dou eh , veign my vreagerey goll riuish : agh shione dooys eh , as ta mee freayll yn raa echey .

text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day : and he saw it , and was glad .
text2: Ghow yn ayr eu Abraham foddiaght dy akin yn laa aym ' s : as honnick eh eh , as ghow eh boggey .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Thou art not yet fifty years old , and hast thou seen Abraham ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn rish , Cha vel uss foast jeih bleeaney as da - eed dy eash , as vel oo er vakin Abraham ?

text: Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Before Abraham was , I am .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Roish my row Abraham , Ta mish .

text: Then took they up stones to cast at him : but Jesus hid himself , and went out of the temple , going through the midst of them , and so passed by .
text2: Eisht hrog ad claghyn dy cheau er : agh cheill Yeesey eh - hene voue , as hie eh magh ass y chiamble , goll trooid y cheeid oc as myr shen hie eh shaghey .

text: And as Jesus passed by , he saw a man which was blind from his birth .
text2: AS myr va Yeesey goll shaghey , honnick eh dooinney v ' er ny ruggey doal .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , Master , who did sin , this man , or his parents , that he was born blind ?
text2: As denee e ostyllyn jeh , gra , Vainshter quoi ren peccah , eh shoh ny e ayr as e voir , dy row eh er ny ruggey doal ?

text: Jesus answered , Neither hath this man sinned , nor his parents : but that the works of God should be made manifest in him .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , Cha nee son peccah dy ren eh shoh , ny e ayr as e voir : agh dy vod dagh obbraghyn Yee v ' er nyn soilshaghey magh ayn .

text: I must work the works of him that sent me , while it is day : the night cometh , when no man can work .
text2: Shegin dooys gobbraghey ny obbraghyn echeysyn t ' er my choyrt , choud as ta ' n laa ayn : ta ' n oie cheet tra nagh vod dooinney erbee gobbraghey .

text: As long as I am in the world , I am the light of the world .
text2: Choud as ta mee ayns y theihll , mee soilshey yn theihll .

text: When he had thus spoken , he spat on the ground , and made clay of the spittle , and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay ,
text2: Tra v ' eh erreish shoh y loayrt , cheau eh shelley er y thalloo , as ren eh cray jeh ' n shelley , as hug eh yn chray rish sooillyn y dooinney doal .

text: And said unto him , Go , wash in the pool of Siloam , ( which is by interpretation , Sent . ) He went his way therefore , and washed , and came seeing .
text2: As dooyrt eh rish , Immee as oonlee oo hene ayns poyll Siloam ( ta shen ' sy ghlare ainyn , Er ny choyrt ) Hie eh roish er - y - fa shen , as doonlee eh eh - hene , as haink eh as e hoilshey echey .

text: The neighbours therefore , and they which before had seen him that he was blind , said , Is not this he that sat and begged ?
text2: Dooyrt ny naboonyn er - y - fa shen , as adsyn va roie er vakin eh dy row eh doal , Nagh nee shoh eshyn boallagh soie shirrey jeirk ?

text: Some said , This is he : others said , He is like him : but he said , I am he .
text2: Dooyrt paart , She shoh eh : dooyrt feallagh elley , T ' eh goll - rish : agh dooyrt eh hene , She mish eh .

text: Therefore said they unto him , How were thine eyes opened ?
text2: Shen y fa dooyrt aa rish , Kys va dty hooillyn er nyn vosley ?

text: He answered and said , A man that is called Jesus made clay , and anointed mine eyes , and said unto me , Go to the pool of Siloam , and wash : and I went and washed , and I received sight .
text2: Dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh , Ren dooinney va enmyssit Yeesey , cray , as hug eh rish my hooillyn eh , as dooyrt eh rhym , Immee gys poyll Siloam , as oolee oo hene : as hie mee , as doonlee mee mee - hene , as hooar mee my hoilshey .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is he ? He said , I know not .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ad rish , Cre vel eh ? Dooyrt eshyn , Cha s ' aym .

text: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind .
text2: Hug ad lhieu gys ny Phariseeyn eshyn va roish shen doal .

text: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay , and opened his eyes .
text2: As she er y doonaght va Yeesey er n ' yannoo yn chray , as er vosley ny sooillyn echey .

text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight . He said unto them , He put clay upon mine eyes , and I washed , and do see .
text2: Eisht denee ny Phariseeyn jeh reesht , kys v ' eh er gheddyn e hoilshey . Dooyrt eh roo , Hug eh cray er my hooillyn , as doonlee mee , as ta mee fakin .

text: Therefore said some of the Pharisees , This man is not of God , because he keepeth not the sabbath day . Others said , How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles ? And there was a division among them .
text2: Shen - y - fa dooyrt paart jeh ny Phariseeyn , Cha vel y dooinney shoh veih Jee , er - yn - oyr nagh vel eh freayll yn doonaght . Dooyrt feallagh elley , Kys oddys dooinney ta ny ghrogh - yantagh lheid ny mirrilyn y yannoo ? As va streeu nyn mast ' oc .

text: They say unto the blind man again , What sayest thou of him , that he hath opened thine eyes ? He said , He is a prophet .
text2: Dooyrt ad rish y dooinney doal reesht , Cre t ' ou uss dy ghra my - e - chione , dy doshil eh dty hooillyn ? Dooyrt eh , She phadeyr eh .

text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him , that he had been blind , and received his sight , until they called the parents of him that had received his sight .
text2: Agh cha ren ny Hewnyn credjal mychione echey , dy row eh er ve doal , as dy dooar eh e hoilshey reesht , derrey deie ad er yn ayr as yn voir echeysyn v ' er gheddyn e hoilshey .

text: And they asked them , saying , Is this your son , who ye say was born blind ? how then doth he now see ?
text2: As denee ad jeu , gra , Nee shoh yn mac euish , ta shiu gra va er ny ruggey doal ? kys eisht t ' eh nish fakin ?

text: His parents answered them and said , We know that this is our son , and that he was born blind :
text2: Dreggyr e ayr as e voir ad , gra , Ta fys ain dy nee shoh yn mac ain , as dy row eh er ny ruggey doal :

text: But by what means he now seeth , we know not ; or who hath opened his eyes , we know not : he is of age ; ask him : he shall speak for himself .
text2: Agh kys t ' eh nish fakin , cha s ' ain ; ny quoi t ' er vosley ny sooillyn echey , cha vel fys ain : t ' eh ec eash , fenee - jee jehsyn , loayree eh er e hon hene .

text: These words spake his parents , because they feared the Jews : for the Jews had agreed already , that if any man did confess that he was Christ , he should be put out of the synagogue .
text2: Ny goan shoh loayr e ayr as e voir , son dy row ad ayns aggle roish ny Hewnyn : son va ny Hewnyn er choardail hannah , my ghoghe dooinney erbee rish dy nee eh va ' n Creest , dy beagh eh er ny ghiarey magh ass y synagogue .

text: Therefore said his parents , He is of age ; ask him .
text2: Shen - y - fa dooyrt yn ayr as y voir echey , T ' eh ec eash , fenee - jee jeh hene .

text: Then again called they the man that was blind , and said unto him , Give God the praise : we know that this man is a sinner .
text2: Eisht deie ad reesht er y dooinney v ' er ny ve doal , as dooyrt ad rish , Cur y moylley da Jee : ta fys ain dy nee drogh - ghooinney eh shoh .

text: He answered and said , Whether he be a sinner or no , I know not : one thing I know , that , whereas I was blind , now I see .
text2: Dreggyr eshyn , as dooyrt eh , Cha s ' aym ' s dy nee drogh - ghooinney eh : un red ta fys aym er , dy row mee doal , as nish dy vel my hoilshey aym .

text: Then said they to him again , What did he to thee ? how opened he thine eyes ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt ad rish reesht , Cre ren eh rhyt ? kys doshil eh dty hooillyn ?

text: He answered them , I have told you already , and ye did not hear : wherefore would ye hear it again ? will ye also be his disciples ?
text2: Dreggyr eshyn ad , Ta mee er n ' insh diu hannah , as cha dug shiu geill : cre ' n - fa bailliu y chlashtyn reesht eh ? vel shiuish myrgeddin son goaill - rish yn ynsagh echeysyn ?

text: Then they reviled him , and said , Thou art his disciple ; but we are Moses ' disciples .
text2: Eisht doltooan ad eh , as dooyrt ad , T ' ou uss ' syn ynsaghey echeysyn : agh ta shinyn ayns ynsaghey Voses .

text: We know that God spake unto Moses : as for this fellow , we know not from whence he is .
text2: Ta fys ain dy loayr Jee rish Moses : agh son eh shoh , cha s ' ain cre veih t ' eh .

text: The man answered and said unto them , Why herein is a marvellous thing , that ye know not from whence he is , and yet he hath opened mine eyes .
text2: Dreggyr y dooinney as dooyrt eh roo , Ta shen red yindyssagh , nagh s ' eu cre veih t ' eh ? as ny - yeih dy vel eh er vosley my hooillyn ' s .

text: Now we know that God heareth not sinners : but if any man be a worshipper of God , and doeth his will , him he heareth .
text2: Nish ta fys ain nagh vel Jee cur clashtyn da drogh - yantee : agh my ta dooinney erbee cur ooashley da Jee , as jannoo e aigney , dasyn t ' eh cur clashtyn .

text: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind .
text2: Er - dy hoshiaght y theihll cha row eh er ny chlashtyn dy doshil dooinney erbee sooillyn fer va er ny ruggey doal .

text: If this man were not of God , he could do nothing .
text2: Er - be dy vel y dooinney shoh veih Jee , cha voddagh eh nhee erbee y yannoo .

text: They answered and said unto him , Thou wast altogether born in sins , and dost thou teach us ? And they cast him out .
text2: Dreggyr ad as dooyrt ad rish , V ' ou uss er dty ruggey ooilley cooidjagh ayns peccaghyn , as vel oo goaill ort dy ynsaghey shinyn ? As ghiare ad magh eh .

text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out ; and when he had found him , he said unto him , Dost thou believe on the Son of God ?
text2: Cheayll Yeesey dy row ad er yiarey magh eh ; as tra v ' eh er gheddyn eh , dooyrt eh rish , Vel oo credjal ayns Mac Yee ?

text: He answered and said , Who is he , Lord , that I might believe on him ?
text2: Dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt eh , Quoi eh , Hiarn , dy voddym credjal ayn ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Thou hast both seen him , and it is he that talketh with thee .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey rish , T ' ou chammah er vakin eh , as she eshyn eh ta taggloo rhyt .

text: And he said , Lord , I believe . And he worshipped him .
text2: As dooyrt eh , Hiarn , ta mee credjal . As hug eh ooashley da .

text: And Jesus said , For judgment I am come into this world , that they which see not might see ; and that they which see might be made blind .
text2: As dooyrt Yeesey , Son briwnys haink mish gys y theihll shoh : dy vod adsyn nagh vel fakin , fakin ; as adsyn ta fakin , dy vod ad v ' er nyn yannoo doal .

text: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words , and said unto him , Are we blind also ?
text2: As cheayll paart jeh ny Phariseeyn va marish ny goan shoh , as dooyrt ad rish , Vel shinyn doal neesht ?

text: Jesus said unto them , If ye were blind , ye should have no sin : but now ye say , We see ; therefore your sin remaineth .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Dy beagh shiu doal , cha beagh peccah eu : agh nish ta shiu gra , Ta shin fakin ; shen - y - fa ta nyn beccah tannaghtyn erriu .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold , but climbeth up some other way , the same is a thief and a robber .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Eshyn nagh vel goll stiagh er y dorrys ayns bwoaillee ny geyrragh , agh ta drappal seose er aght ennagh elley , t ' eh shen ny vaarliagh as ny roosteyr .

text: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep .
text2: Agh eshyn ta goll stiagh er y dorrys , ta ' n fer cheddin bochilley ny geyrragh .

text: To him the porter openeth ; and the sheep hear his voice : and he calleth his own sheep by name , and leadeth them out .
text2: Dasyn ta ' n dorrysser fosley ; as ta ny kirree clashtyn e choraa : as t ' eh geamagh er e chirree hene lurg nyn ennym , as dy leeideil ad magh .

text: And when he putteth forth his own sheep , he goeth before them , and the sheep follow him : for they know his voice .
text2: As tra t ' eh cur magh e chirree hene , t ' eh goll rhymboo , as ta ny kirree geiyrt er : son ta enney oc er e choraa .

text: And a stranger will they not follow , but will flee from him : for they know not the voice of strangers .
text2: As joarree cha n ' eiyr ad er , agh roie ee ad er - chea veih : son cha vel enney oc er coraa joarree .

text: This parable spake Jesus unto them : but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them .
text2: Yn coraa - dorraghey shoh loayr Yeesey roo : agh cha hoig ad shen ny v ' eh er loayrt roo .

text: Then said Jesus unto them again , Verily , verily , I say unto you , I am the door of the sheep .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo reesht , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Mish dorrys ny geyrragh .

text: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers : but the sheep did not hear them .
text2: Ta ooilley ny haink roym ' s , nyn maarlee as nyn roosteyryn : agh cha dug ny kirree geill daue .

text: I am the door : by me if any man enter in , he shall be saved , and shall go in and out , and find pasture .
text2: Mish y dorrys : liorym ' s my ta dooinney erbee goll stiagh , bee eh er ny hauail , as hed eh stiagh as magh , as yiow eh fassaghey .

text: The thief cometh not , but for to steal , and to kill , and to destroy : I am come that they might have life , and that they might have it more abundantly .
text2: Cha vel y maarliagh cheet agh dy gheid , as dy varroo as dy stroie : haink mish dy voddagh bea y ve oc , as dy voddagh eh y ve oc ayns mooarane palchey .

text: I am the good shepherd : the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep .
text2: Mish y bochilley mie : ta ' n bochilley mie cur e vioys son ny kirree .

text: But he that is an hireling , and not the shepherd , whose own the sheep are not , seeth the wolf coming , and leaveth the sheep , and fleeth : and the wolf catcheth them , and scattereth the sheep .
text2: Agh eshyn ta failt , as cha nee yn bochilley hene , as nagh vel ny kirree lesh hene , t ' eh fakin yn moddey - oaldey cheet , as t ' eh faagail ny kirree , as roie er - chea : as ta ' n moddey - oaldey dyn dayrtyn ad , as skeayley ny kirree .

text: The hireling fleeth , because he is an hireling , and careth not for the sheep .
text2: Ta fer - ny - failley chea , er - y - fa dy nee fer - failt eh , as nagh mooar - lesh son ny kirree .

text: I am the good shepherd , and know my sheep , and am known of mine .
