text2: Mish y bochilley mie , as ta enney aym er my chirree , as ta enney ocsyn orrym ' s .

text: As the Father knoweth me , even so know I the Father : and I lay down my life for the sheep .
text2: Myr ta enney ec yn Ayr orrym ' s , shen myr ta enney aym ' s er yn Ayr : as ta mee scarrey rish my vioys son ny kirree .

text: And other sheep I have , which are not of this fold : them also I must bring , and they shall hear my voice ; and there shall be one fold , and one shepherd .
text2: As kirree elley t ' aym , nagh vel jeh ' n woaillee shoh : ad shen neesht shegin dou y chur lhiam , as cluinnee ad my choraa ; as bee un woaillee ayn , as un vochilley .

text: Therefore doth my Father love me , because I lay down my life , that I might take it again .
text2: Shen - y - fa ta my Ayr graihagh orrym ' s , er - yn - oyr dy vel mee scarrey rish my vioys , dy voddym y ghoaill reesht eh .

text: No man taketh it from me , but I lay it down of myself . I have power to lay it down , and I have power to take it again . This commandment have I received of my Father .
text2: Cha vel dooinney erbee dy ghoaill voym eh , agh m ' aigney hene eh dy scarrey rish : Ta pooar aym dy scarrey rish , as ta pooar aym dy ghoaill reesht eh . Yn sarey shoh hooar mee veih my Ayr .

text: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings .
text2: Va streeu er - y - fa shen reesht mastey ny Hewnyn son ny raaghyn shoh .

text: And many of them said , He hath a devil , and is mad ; why hear ye him ?
text2: As dooyrt ymmodee jeu , Ta drogh spyrryd ayn , as t ' eh ass e cheeayl ; cre ' n - fa ta shiu geaishtagh rish ?

text: Others said , These are not the words of him that hath a devil . Can a devil open the eyes of the blind ?
text2: Dooyrt feallagh elley , Cha vel ad shoh goan fer ta drogh - spyrryd ayn : Vod drogh spyrryd sooillyn ny doail y osley ?

text: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication , and it was winter .
text2: As haghyr shoh ec Jerusalem , ec feailley casherickey yn chiamble ; as nish va ' n geurey .

text: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon ' s porch .
text2: As va Yeesey shooyl ayns y chiamble ayns porch Solomon .

text: Then came the Jews round about him , and said unto him , How long dost thou make us to doubt ? If thou be the Christ , tell us plainly .
text2: Eisht haink ny Hewnyn mygeayrt - y - mysh , as dooyrt ad rish , Caid t ' ou freayll shin fo mee - ourys ? My she yn Creest oo , insh dooin dy ynrick .

text: Jesus answered them , I told you , and ye believed not : the works that I do in my Father ' s name , they bear witness of me .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , Ta mee er n ' insh diu hannah , as cha ren shiu my chredjal : ta ny obbraghyn ta mee dy yannoo ayns ennym my Ayrey gymmyrkey fenish jee ' m .

text: But ye believe not , because ye are not of my sheep , as I said unto you .
text2: Agh cha vel shiuish credjal ; er - yn - oyr nagh vel shiu jeh my hioltane , myr dooyrt mee riu .

text: My sheep hear my voice , and I know them , and they follow me :
text2: Ta my chirree clashtyn my choraa , as ta enney aym orroo , as eiyree ad orrym .

text: And I give unto them eternal life ; and they shall never perish , neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand .
text2: As ta mee cur daue yn vea veayn , as cha jean ad dy bragh cherraghtyn , as cha n ' ghow fer erbee ad ass my laue er - niart .

text: My Father , which gave them me , is greater than all ; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father ' s hand .
text2: Ta my Ayr hug dou ad , pooaral erskyn ooilley : as cha jarg fer erbee y ghoaill ad ass laue my Ayrey .

text: I and my Father are one .
text2: Ta mish as my Ayr unnane .

text: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him .
text2: Eisht hrog ny Hewnyn claghyn reesht dy chlaghey eh .

text: Jesus answered them , Many good works have I shewed you from my Father ; for which of those works do ye stone me ?
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , Shimmey yn obbyr vie ta mee er hoilshaghey diu veih my Ayr ; son quoi j ' eh ny obbraghyn cheddin ta shiu ry - hoi m ' y chlaghey ?

text: The Jews answered him , saying , For a good work we stone thee not ; but for blasphemy ; and because that thou , being a man , makest thyself God .
text2: Dreggyr ny Hewnyn eh , gra , Son obbyr vie cha vel shin dy dty chlaghey ; agh son goan - mollaghtagh , as er - yn - oyr dy vel uss , ta dty ghooinney , jannoo oo hene Jee .

text: Jesus answered them , Is it not written in your law , I said , Ye are gods ?
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , Nagh vel eh scruit ayns y leigh eu , Dooyrt mee , She Jeeghyn shiu ?

text: If he called them gods , unto whom the word of God came , and the scripture cannot be broken ;
text2: My t ' eh genmys adsyn Jeeghyn , dauesyn va goo Yee er ny choyrt , as nagh vod y scriptyr v ' er ny rassey :

text: Say ye of him , whom the Father hath sanctified , and sent into the world , Thou blasphemest ; because I said , I am the Son of God ?
text2: Vel shiu gra mychionesyn ta ' n Ayr er chasherickey , as er choyrt gys y theihll , T ' ou loayrt goan - mollaghtagh ; er - yn - oyr dy dooyrt mee , She Mac Yee mee ?

text: If I do not the works of my Father , believe me not .
text2: Mannagh vel mee jannoo obbraghyn m ' Ayrey , ny cred - jee mee .

text: But if I do , though ye believe not me , believe the works : that ye may know , and believe , that the Father is in me , and I in him .
text2: Agh my ta mee jannoo ad , ga nagh gred shiu mish , cred - jee ny obbraghyn : dy vod shiu toiggal as credjal , dy vel yn Ayr aynym ' s , as mish aynsyn .

text: Therefore they sought again to take him : but he escaped out of their hand ,
text2: Er shoh v ' ad reesht son y ghoaill eh : agh chossyn eh ass nyn laueyn

text: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized ; and there he abode .
text2: As hie eh roish reesht er cheu elley dy Yordan , gys y boayl raad ren Ean hoshiaght bashtey ; as duirree eh ayns shen .

text: And many resorted unto him , and said , John did no miracle : but all things that John spake of this man were true .
text2: As va ymmodee cheet huggey , as gra , Cha ren Ean mirril erbee : agh va dy chooilley nhee loayr Ean jeh ' n dooinney shoh firrinagh .

text: And many believed on him there .
text2: As ren ymmodee credjal ayn ayns shen .

text: Now a certain man was sick , named Lazarus , of Bethany , the town of Mary and her sister Martha .
text2: NISH va dooinney dy row ching , va enmyssit Lazarus dy Vethany , balley Voirrey as y chuyr eck Martha .

text: ( It was that Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment , and wiped his feet with her hair , whose brother Lazarus was sick . )
text2: ( She yn Voirrey cheddin v ' ayn , ish ren ooillaghey yn Chiarn , as rub ny cassyn , echey lesh e folt , yn braar eck Lazarus va ching ) .

text: Therefore his sisters sent unto him , saying , Lord , behold , he whom thou lovest is sick .
text2: Shen - y - fa hug ny shayraghyn echey fys huggey , gra , Hiarn , cur - my - ner , t ' eshyn shynney lhiat ching .

text: When Jesus heard that , he said , This sickness is not unto death , but for the glory of God , that the Son of God might be glorified thereby .
text2: Tra cheayll Yeesey shoh , dooyrt eh , Cha vel y chingys shoh gys baase , agh son gloyr Yee , dy vod Mac Yee v ' er ny ghloyraghey liorish .

text: Now Jesus loved Martha , and her sister , and Lazarus .
text2: Nish bynney lesh Yeesey Martha , as y chuyr eck , as Lazarus .

text: When he had heard therefore that he was sick , he abode two days still in the same place where he was .
text2: Shen - y - fa tra v ' eh er chlashtyn dy row eh ching , duirree eh foast daa laa ayns yn un voayl raad v ' eh .

text: Then after that saith he to his disciples , Let us go into Judaea again .
text2: Eisht ny lurg shen dooyrt eh rish e ostyllyn , Lhig dooin goll reesht gys Judea .

text: His disciples say unto him , Master , the Jews of late sought to stone thee ; and goest thou thither again ?
text2: Dooyrt e ostyllyn rish , Vainshter , cha voddey neayr as va ny Hewnyn shirrey dty chlaghey ; as vel oo son goll gys shen reesht ?

text: Jesus answered , Are there not twelve hours in the day ? If any man walk in the day , he stumbleth not , because he seeth the light of this world .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , Nagh vel daa oor yeig ' sy laa ? My ta dooinney erbee shooyll ayns y laa , cha vel eh snapperal , er - y - fa dy vel eh fakin soilshey yn theihll shoh .

text: But if a man walk in the night , he stumbleth , because there is no light in him .
text2: Agh my ta dooinney shooyll ayns yn oie , t ' eh snapperal , er - y - fa nagh vel soilshey ayn .

text: These things said he : and after that he saith unto them , Our friend Lazarus sleepeth ; but I go , that I may awake him out of sleep .
text2: Ny goan shoh loayr eh : as ny lurg shen dooyrt eh roo , Ta nyn garrey Lazarus ny chadley ; agh ta mish goll dy ghoostey eh ass e chadley .

text: Then said his disciples , Lord , if he sleep , he shall do well .
text2: Eisht dooyrt e ostyllyn rish , Hiarn , my t ' eh cadley , nee eh coural .

text: Howbeit Jesus spake of his death : but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep .
text2: Ny - yeih loayr Yeesey jeh ' n vaase echey : agh heill adsyn dy row eh er loayrt jeh fea y ghoaill ayns cadley .

text: Then said Jesus unto them plainly , Lazarus is dead .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo dy foshlit , Ta Lazarus marroo .

text: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there , to the intent ye may believe ; nevertheless let us go unto him .
text2: As ' smie lhiam er y choontey euish , nagh row mee ayns shen ( son niartaghey nyn gredjue ) ny - yeih hooin - jee huggey .

text: Then said Thomas , which is called Didymus , unto his fellowdisciples , Let us also go , that we may die with him .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Thomase ta enmyssit Didymus rish e heshey - ostyllyn , Lhig dooinyn goll neesht , dy vod mayd baase y gheddyn marish .

text: Then when Jesus came , he found that he had lain in the grave four days already .
text2: Eisht tra va Yeesey er jeet gys Bethany , hooar eh dy row eh er ve kiare laa hannah ' syn oaie .

text: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem , about fifteen furlongs off :
text2: ( Nish va Bethany er - gerrey da Jerusalem , mysh daa veeilley jeh ) .

text: And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary , to comfort them concerning their brother .
text2: As va ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn er jeet magh gys Martha as Moirrey , dy gherjaghey ad son nyn mraar .

text: Then Martha , as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming , went and met him : but Mary sat still in the house .
text2: Eisht cha leah as cheayll Martha dy row Yeesey cheet , hie ee magh ny whail : agh hoie Moirrey ayns y thie .

text: Then said Martha unto Jesus , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Martha rish Yeesey , Hiarn , dy beagh uss er ve ayns shoh , cha beagh my vraar er gheddyn baase .

text: But I know , that even now , whatsoever thou wilt ask of God , God will give it thee .
text2: Agh ta fys aym , eer foast , cre - erbee nee oo y yeearree er Jee , dy der Jee dhyt eh .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Thy brother shall rise again .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Nee dty vraar girree reesht .

text: Martha saith unto him , I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day .
text2: Dooyrt Martha rish , Ta fys aym dy n ' irree eh reesht ec yn irree - seose ' sy laa jerrinagh .

text: Jesus said unto her , I am the resurrection , and the life : he that believeth in me , though he were dead , yet shall he live :
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Mish yn irree seose - reesht veih ny merriu as yn vea : bee eshyn ta credjal aynym ' s bio , ga dy vow eh baase ;

text: And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die . Believest thou this ?
text2: As quoi - erbee ta bio , as credjal aynym ' s , cha vow eh yn baase dy bragh farraghtyn . Vel uss credjal shoh ?

text: She saith unto him , Yea , Lord : I believe that thou art the Christ , the Son of God , which should come into the world .
text2: Dooyrt ee rish , Ta , Hiarn : ta mee credjal dy nee uss yn Creest Mac Yee va ry - hoi cheet gys y theihll .

text: And when she had so said , she went her way , and called Mary her sister secretly , saying , The Master is come , and calleth for thee .
text2: As tra v ' ee er ghra shoh , hie ee rhym bee , as deie ee er e shuyr Moirrey er - lheh as dooyrt ee , Ta ' n Mainshter er jeet , as t ' eh geamagh ort .

text: As soon as she heard that , she arose quickly , and came unto him .
text2: Cha leah as cheayll ee shen , dirree ee dy tappee dy tappee , as haink ee huggey .

text: Now Jesus was not yet come into the town , but was in that place where Martha met him .
text2: Nish cha row Yeesey foast er jeet stiagh ayns y valley , agh v ' eh ayns y voayl raad haink Martha ny whail

text: The Jews then which were with her in the house , and comforted her , when they saw Mary , that she rose up hastily and went out , followed her , saying , She goeth unto the grave to weep there .
text2: Ny Hewnyn eisht va maree ayns y thie dy gherjaghey ee , tra honnick ad dy dirree Moirrey dy tappee , as dy jagh ee magh , deiyr ad urree , gra , T ' ee goll gys yn oaie dy cheayney ayns shen .

text: Then when Mary was come where Jesus was , and saw him , she fell down at his feet , saying unto him , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Eisht tra va Moirrey er jeet raad va Yeesey , as jeeaghyn er , huitt ee sheese ec e chassyn , gra rish , Hiarn , dy beagh uss er ve ayns shoh , cha beagh my vraar er gheddyn baase .

text: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping , and the Jews also weeping which came with her , he groaned in the spirit , and was troubled ,
text2: Tra honnick Yeesey ee er - y - fa shen keayney , as ny Hewnyn myrgeddin keayney v ' er jeet maree , hayrn eh osney hrome , as v ' eh seaghnit ;

text: And said , Where have ye laid him ? They said unto him , Lord , come and see .
text2: As dooyrt eh , C ' raad ta shiu er choyrt eh ? Dooyrt adsyn rish , Hiarn , tarr as hee oo .

text: Jesus wept .
text2: Ren Yeesey keayney .

text: Then said the Jews , Behold how he loved him !
text2: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn , Cur - jee my - ner , cre ' n ghraih v ' echey er .

text: And some of them said , Could not this man , which opened the eyes of the blind , have caused that even this man should not have died ?
text2: As dooyrt paart jeu , Nagh voddagh yn dooinney shoh , ren fosley sooillyn ny doail , v ' er lhiettal baase y dooinney shoh ?

text: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave . It was a cave , and a stone lay upon it .
text2: Hayrn Yeesey er - y - fa shen osney hrome reesht veih e chree , as haink eh gys yn oaie . She ooig v ' ayn , as va clagh er e beeal .

text: Jesus said , Take ye away the stone . Martha , the sister of him that was dead , saith unto him , Lord , by this time he stinketh : for he hath been dead four days .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey , Scugh - jee yn chlagh . Dooyrt Martha shuyr y varroo rish , Hiarn , ta nish soar trome jeh : son t ' eh er ve kiare laa marroo .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Said I not unto thee , that , if thou wouldest believe , thou shouldest see the glory of God ?
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Nagh dooyrt mee rhyt , my chredjagh oo , dy vaikagh oo gloyr Yee ?

text: Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid . And Jesus lifted up his eyes , and said , Father , I thank thee that thou hast heard me .
text2: Eisht scugh ad y chlagh jeh ' n boayl raad va ' n marroo ny lhie . As hrog Yeesey seose e hooillyn , as dooyrt eh , Ayr , ta mee cur booise dhyt dy vel oo er my chlashtyn .

text: And I knew that thou hearest me always : but because of the people which stand by I said it , that they may believe that thou hast sent me .
text2: As va fys aym dy vel oo rieau dy my chlashtyn : agh er coontey yn phobble ta mygeayrt - y - moom dooyrt mee shoh , dy vod ad credjal dy vel oo er my choyrt .

text: And when he thus had spoken , he cried with a loud voice , Lazarus , come forth .
text2: As tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , deie eh lesh ard - choraa , Lazarus , tar magh .

text: And he that was dead came forth , bound hand and foot with graveclothes : and his face was bound about with a napkin . Jesus saith unto them , Loose him , and let him go .
text2: As haink eshyn va marroo magh soillit cass as laue ayns aanrityn oanluckee : as bussal mysh e eddin . Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Feayshil - jee eh , as lhig - jee yn raad da .

text: Then many of the Jews which came to Mary , and had seen the things which Jesus did , believed on him .
text2: Eisht ren ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn v ' er jeet magh gys Moirrey , as v ' er vakin ny reddyn ren Yeesey , credjal ayn .

text: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees , and told them what things Jesus had done .
text2: Agh hie paart jeu rhymboo gys ny Phariseeyn , as dinsh ad daue cre ny reddyn va Yeesey er n ' yannoo .

text: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council , and said , What do we ? for this man doeth many miracles .
text2: Eisht deie ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn er y choonceil cooidjagh , as dooyrt ad , Cre ta shinyn dy yannoo ? son ta ' n dooinney shoh jannoo ymmodee mirrilyn .

text: If we let him thus alone , all men will believe on him : and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation .
text2: My lhiggys mayd da , nee dy chooilley ghooinney credjal ayn ; as hig ny Romanee as ver ad mow chammah yn ynnyd casherick as yn ashoon ain .

text: And one of them , named Caiaphas , being the high priest that same year , said unto them , Ye know nothing at all ,
text2: As va fer jeu va enmyssit Caiaphas , ny ard - saggyrt yn vlein shen , as dooyrt eh roo , Cha vel toiggal eu jeh nhee erbee ,

text: Nor consider that it is expedient for us , that one man should die for the people , and that the whole nation perish not .
text2: Chamoo ta shiu goaill eu hene kys dy vel eh ymmyrchagh er ny son ain , un dooinney dy gheddyn baase son y pobble , as gyn y slane ashoon dy herraghtyn .

text: And this spake he not of himself : but being high priest that year , he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation ;
text2: As shoh loayr eh , cha nee jeh hene : agh v ' eh ny ard - saggyrt yn vlein shen , as ren e phadeyrys dy voghe Yeesey baase son yn ashoon shen :

text: And not for that nation only , but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad .
text2: As cha nee ynrycan son yn ashoon shen , agh myrgeddin dy jinnagh eh cloan Yee va skeaylt dy lhean , y hayrn gys unnaneys ry - cheilley .

text: Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death .
text2: Eisht veih ' n laa shen magh v ' ad cur nyn goyrle dy cheilley dy choyrt eh gy baase .

text: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews ; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness , into a city called Ephraim , and there continued with his disciples .
text2: Cha jimmee Yeesey er - y - fa shen ny smoo dy foshlit mastey ny Hewnyn ; agh hie eh veih shen gys cheer va er - gerrey da ' n aasagh , gys ard - valley enmyssit Ephraim , as duirree eh ayns shen marish e ostyllyn .

text: And the Jews ' passover was nigh at hand : and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover , to purify themselves .
text2: As va caisht ny Hewnyn tayrn er gerrey : as va ymmodee ass y cheer goll seose gys Jerusalem roish y chaisht dy ghlenney ad hene er y hon .

text: Then sought they for Jesus , and spake among themselves , as they stood in the temple , What think ye , that he will not come to the feast ?
text2: As v ' ad briaght son Yeesey , as loayrt nyn mast ' oc hene , myr v ' ad nyn shassoo ayns y chiamble , Cre ta shiu dy smooinaghtyn , nagh jig eh seose gys y feailley ?

text: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment , that , if any man knew where he were , he should shew it , that they might take him .
text2: Nish va chammah ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn er chur sarey , my va fys ec dooinney erbee c ' raad v ' eh , dy row ad dy choyrt briaght er cour y ghoaill eh .

text: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany , where Lazarus was which had been dead , whom he raised from the dead .
text2: EISHT shey laa roish y Chaisht , haink Yeesey gys Bethany , raad va Lazarus v ' er ny ve marroo , yn fer cheddin v ' eh er hroggal veih ny merriu .

text: There they made him a supper ; and Martha served : but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him .
text2: Ayns shen ren ad shibber er e hon , as va Martha shirveish orroo : agh va Lazarus fer jeusyn va nyn soie ec y voayrd marish .

text: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard , very costly , and anointed the feet of Jesus , and wiped his feet with her hair : and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment .
text2: Eisht ghow Moirrey punt dy ooil dy spikenard feer chostal , as ren ee cassyn Yeesey y ooilaghey , as rub ee e chassyn lesh e folt : as va ' n thie er ny lhieeney lesh soar yn ooil .

text: Then saith one of his disciples , Judas Iscariot , Simon ' s son , which should betray him ,
text2: Eisht dooyrt fer jeh ny ostyllyn echey , Yuaase Iscariot mac Simon , va ry - hoi y vrah eh .

text: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence , and given to the poor ?
text2: Cre ' n - fa nagh row yn ooil shoh creckit son three cheead ping , as er ny choyrt da ny boghtyn ?

text: This he said , not that he cared for the poor ; but because he was a thief , and had the bag , and bare what was put therein .
text2: Shoh dooyrt eh , cha nee ayns kiarail erbee son ny boghtyn , agh dy row eh ny vaarliagh , er va currym y sporran , as eshyn va gymmyrkey ny v ' ayn .

text: Then said Jesus , Let her alone : against the day of my burying hath she kept this .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey , Faag - jee veue ee : cour laa my oanluckey t ' ee er reayll shoh .

text: For the poor always ye have with you ; but me ye have not always .
text2: Son ny boghtyn t ' ad eu kinjagh meriu ; agh mish cha vel eu kinjagh .

text: Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there : and they came not for Jesus ' sake only , but that they might see Lazarus also , whom he had raised from the dead .
text2: Va fys er - y - fa shen ec ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn dy row eh ayns shen : as haink ad , cha nee er coontey Yeesey ny - lomarcan , agh dy voddagh ad Lazarus y akin myrgeddin , eh v ' eshyn er hroggal veih ny merriu .

text: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death ;
text2: Agh hug ny ard - saggyrtyn nyn goyrle dy cheilley , mychione Lazarus myrgeddin y choyrt gy - baase ;

text: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away , and believed on Jesus .
text2: Son dy row ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn kyndagh rishyn er hreigeil adsyn , as er chredjal ayns Yeesey .

text: On the next day much people that were come to the feast , when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem ,
text2: Laa - ny - vairagh hie shiartanse mooar dy leih , v ' er jeet gys y feailley , tra cheayll ad dy row Yeesey er y raad gys Jerusalem .

text: Took branches of palm trees , and went forth to meet him , and cried , Hosanna : Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: As ghow ad banglaneyn dy viljyn palm , as hie ad magh ny whail , as deie ad , Hosanna ; bannit ta ree Israel ta cheet ayns ennym y Chiarn .

text: And Jesus , when he had found a young ass , sat thereon ; as it is written ,
text2: As tra va Yeesey er gheddyn assyl aeg , varkee eh er : myr te scruit ,

text: Fear not , daughter of Sion : behold , thy King cometh , sitting on an ass ' s colt .
text2: Ny gow aggle , inneen Sion : cur - my - ner ta dty ree cheet , markiagh er lhiy assyl .

text: These things understood not his disciples at the first : but when Jesus was glorified , then remembered they that these things were written of him , and that they had done these things unto him .
text2: Ny reddyn shoh cha hoig e ostyllyn ec y toshiaght : agh tra va Yeesey er ny ghloyraghey , eisht chooinee ad dy row ny reddyn shoh scruit jeh , as dy row ad er n ' yannoo ny reddyn shoh rish .

text: The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave , and raised him from the dead , bare record .
text2: Ren y pobble er - y - fa shen va marish , tra deie eh er Lazarus ass yn oaie , as tra hrog eh eh veih ny merriu feanish y ymmyrkey .

text: For this cause the people also met him , for that they heard that he had done this miracle .
text2: Er - yn - oyr shoh va ' n pobble myrgeddin er gholl magh ny whail , son dy geayll ad dy row eh er n ' yannoo yn mirril shoh .

text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves , Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing ? behold , the world is gone after him .
text2: Dooyrt ny Phariseeyn er - y - fa shen nyn mast ' oc hene , Nagh vaik shiu , nagh vaardee shiu monney ? cur - my - ner ta ' n seihll er gholl geiyrt er .

text: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast :
text2: As va shiartanse dy Ghreekyn nyn mast ' oc , v ' er jeet seose dy chur ooashley ec y feailley :

text: The same came therefore to Philip , which was of Bethsaida of Galilee , and desired him , saying , Sir , we would see Jesus .
text2: Haink ad shoh er - y - fa shen gys Philip , va veih Bethsaida ayns Galilee , as ghuee ad er , gra , Vainshter , veagh shin booiagh dy akin Yeesey .

text: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew : and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus .
text2: Haink Philip as dinsh eh da Andreays , as reesht dinsh Andreays as Philip shoh da Yeesey .

text: And Jesus answered them , saying , The hour is come , that the Son of man should be glorified .
text2: As dreggyr Yeesey ad , gra , Ta ' n oor er jeet , dy vel yn Mac dooinney dy ve er ny ghloyraghey .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die , it abideth alone : but if it die , it bringeth forth much fruit .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Mannagh vel y grine curnaght tuittym ayns y thalloo , as goll eig , te cummal ny un ghrine kinjagh : agh my te goll eig : te gymmyrkey magh mooarane mess .

text: He that loveth his life shall lose it ; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal .
text2: Eshyn shynney lesh e vioys , caillee eh eh : agh eshyn nagh vel soiaghey jeh e vioys ' sy theihll shoh , freillee eh eh gys y vea veayn .

text: If any man serve me , let him follow me ; and where I am , there shall also my servant be : if any man serve me , him will my Father honour .
text2: My nee dooinney erbee mish y hirveish , lhig da geiyrt orrym ; as y raad ta mish , shen y raad myrgeddin vees my harvaant : my nee dooinney erbee mish y hirveish , dasyn ver my Ayr onnor .

text: Now is my soul troubled ; and what shall I say ? Father , save me from this hour : but for this cause came I unto this hour .
text2: Nish ta my annym seaghnit ; as cre jir - ym ? Ayr , saue mee veih ' n oor shoh : agh er yn oyr shoh haink mee gys yn oor shoh .

text: Father , glorify thy name . Then came there a voice from heaven , saying , I have both glorified it , and will glorify it again .
text2: Ayr , cur gloyr da dty ennym hene . Eisht haink coraa veih niau , gra , Ta mee hannah er ghloyraghey eh , as nee ' m eh y ghloyraghey reesht .

text: The people therefore , that stood by , and heard it , said that it thundered : others said , An angel spake to him .
text2: Dooyrt y pobble er - y - fa shen va kionfenish , as cheayll yn coraa , dy nee taarnagh v ' ayn - dooyrt feallagh elley , dy nee ainle ren loayrt rish .

text: Jesus answered and said , This voice came not because of me , but for your sakes .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , as dooyrt eh , Cha daink y coraa shoh er y choontey aym ' s , agh er y choontey euish .

text: Now is the judgment of this world : now shall the prince of this world be cast out .
text2: Nish ta briwnys y theihll shoh : nish vees prince y theihll shoh er ny hilgey magh .

text: And I , if I be lifted up from the earth , will draw all men unto me .
text2: As my veem ' s er my hroggal seose jeh ' n thalloo , tayrn - ym dy chooilley ghooinney hym .

text: This he said , signifying what death he should die .
text2: ( Shoh loayr eh , cowraghey liorish shen cre ' n monney dy vaase v ' eh dy hurranse )

text: The people answered him , We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever : and how sayest thou , The Son of man must be lifted up ? who is this Son of man ?
text2: Dreggyr y pobble eh , Ta shin er chlashtyn ass y leigh , dy vel Creest tannaghtyn son dy bragh : as kys t ' ou uss gra , dy vel y Mac dooinney dy ve troggit seose ? quoi yn Mac dooinney shoh ?

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Yet a little while is the light with you . Walk while ye have the light , lest darkness come upon you : for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Foast tammylt beg ta ' n soilshey meriu : shooill - jee choud as ta ' n soilshey eu , er - aggle dy jig y dorraghys erriu : son cha vel fys echeysyn ta shooyll ayns y dorraghys c ' raad t ' eh goll .

text: While ye have light , believe in the light , that ye may be the children of light . These things spake Jesus , and departed , and did hide himself from them .
text2: Choud as ta soilshey eu , cred - jee ayns y toilshey , dy vod shiu ve nyn gloan jeh ' n toilshey . Ny goan shoh loayr Yeesey , as jimmee eh roish , as dollee eh eh - hene voue .

text: But though he had done so many miracles before them , yet they believed not on him :
text2: Agh ga dy ren eh whilleen mirril kiongoyrt roo , foast cha chred ad ayn :

text: That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled , which he spake , Lord , who hath believed our report ? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed ?
text2: As shen myr va goan Esaias y phadeyr cooilleenit , Hiarn , quoi ta er chredjal yn goo ain ? as quoi gys ta roih yn Chiarn er ve soilshit ?

text: Therefore they could not believe , because that Esaias said again ,
text2: Shen - y - fa cha voddagh ad credjal , rere myr dooyrt Esaias ayns ynnyd elley .

text: He hath blinded their eyes , and hardened their heart ; that they should not see with their eyes , nor understand with their heart , and be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: T ' eh er lhiggey lhieu dolley ny sooillyn oc , as creoghey nyn gree ; nagh vaikagh ad lesh nyn sooillyn , as nagh doigagh ad lesh nyn gree , dy beagh ad er nyn jyndaa , as dy jinnin ad y lheihys .

text: These things said Esaias , when he saw his glory , and spake of him .
text2: Ny reddyn shoh loayr Esaias , tra honnick eh e ghloyr as loayr eh jeh .

text: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him ; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him , lest they should be put out of the synagogue :
text2: Ny - yeih mastey ny eer ard - reiltee ren ymmodee credjal ayn ; agh kyndagh rish ny Phariseeyn cha ghow ad rish , er - aggle , dy beagh ad er ny ghiarey - magh veih yn agglish .

text: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God .
text2: Son v ' ad ny s ' aggindee er moylley gheiney , ny moylley Yee .

text: Jesus cried and said , He that believeth on me , believeth not on me , but on him that sent me .
text2: Hrog Yeesey seose e choraa as dooyrt eh , Eshyn ta credjal aynym ' s , cha nee aynym ' s t ' eh credjal , agh aynsyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me .
text2: As eshyn ta dy my akin , t ' eh fakin eshyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: I am come a light into the world , that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness .
text2: Ta mish er jeet my hoilshey gys y theihll , quoi - erbee nee credjal aynym ' s nagh jean eh tannaghtyn ayns y dorraghys

text: And if any man hear my words , and believe not , I judge him not : for I came not to judge the world , but to save the world .
text2: As my ta dooinney erbee ta clashtyn , as nagh vel freayll my ghoan , cha vel mish dy vriwnys eh : son cha daink mee dy vriwnys y seihll , agh dy hauail y seihll .

text: He that rejecteth me , and receiveth not my words , hath one that judgeth him : the word that I have spoken , the same shall judge him in the last day .
text2: Eshyn ta soiaghey beg jeem ' s , as nagh vel goaill rish my ghoan , ta shen echey ta dy vriwnys eh : eer yn goo ta mish er loayrt , nee shen y vriwnys eh ec y laa jerrinagh .

text: For I have not spoken of myself ; but the Father which sent me , he gave me a commandment , what I should say , and what I should speak .
text2: Son cha vel mish er loayrt jee ' m pene ; agh yn Ayr t ' er my choyrt , eshyn hug sarey dou , cre v ' orrym dy ghra , as cre lhisin loayrt .

text: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting : whatsoever I speak therefore , even as the Father said unto me , so I speak .
text2: As ta fys aym dy vel yn sarey echeysyn yn vea dy bragh beayn : cre - erbee er - y - fa shen ta mee dy loayrt , she myr ta ' n Ayr er ghra rhym , eer myr shen ta mee loayrt .

text: Now before the feast of the passover , when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father , having loved his own which were in the world , he loved them unto the end .
text2: NISH , roish feailley ny Caisht , as fys ec Yeesey , dy row yn oor echey er jeet , tra v ' eh dy gholl ass y theihll shoh gys yn Ayr , myr v ' eh graihagh er e vooinjer hene , va ayns y theihll , hug eh graih daue gys y jerrey .

text: And supper being ended , the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot , Simon ' s son , to betray him ;
text2: As myr v ' ad gee nyn shibber ( va ' n drogh - spyrryd nish er choyrt eh ayns cree Yuaase Iscariot mac Simon , dy vrah eh )

text: Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands , and that he was come from God , and went to God ;
text2: Va fys ec Yeesey dy row yn Ayr er chur dy chooilley nhee ayns ny laueyn echey , as dy nee veih Jee haink eh , as dy nee gys Jee v ' eh goll ,

text: He riseth from supper , and laid aside his garments ; and took a towel , and girded himself .
text2: Dirree eh veih shibber , as hug eh jeh e gharmadyn , as ghow eh aanrit , as chryss eh eh mysh hene .

text: After that he poureth water into a bason , and began to wash the disciples ' feet , and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded .
text2: Eisht hug eh ushtey ayns saagh , as ren eh toshiaght dy niee cassyn e ostyllyn , as dy rubbey ad lesh yn aanrit va ec e chryss .

text: Then cometh he to Simon Peter : and Peter saith unto him , Lord , dost thou wash my feet ?
text2: Eisht haink eh gys Simon Peddyr : as dooyrt eshyn rish , Hiarn , vel uss son niee my chassyn ' s ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , What I do thou knowest not now ; but thou shalt know hereafter .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , Cre ta mee dy yannoo cha vel oo toiggal nish ; agh bee toiggal ayd jeh ny - yei shoh .

text: Peter saith unto him , Thou shalt never wash my feet . Jesus answered him , If I wash thee not , thou hast no part with me .
text2: Dooyrt Peddyr rish , My chassyn ' s cha niee oo dy bragh . Dreggyr Yeesey eh , mannagh nieeyms oo , cha vod ayrn erbee ve ayd marym .

text: Simon Peter saith unto him , Lord , not my feet only , but also my hands and my head .
text2: Dooyrt Simon Peddyr rish , Hiarn , cha nee ynrycan eisht my chassyn , agh myrgeddin my laueyn , as my chione .

text: Jesus saith to him , He that is washed needeth not save to wash his feet , but is clean every whit : and ye are clean , but not all .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Eshyn ta nieet , cha vel feme echey agh dy niee e chassyn , as t ' eh glen ooilley harrish : as ta shiuish glen , agh cha vel shiu ooilley myr shen .

text: For he knew who should betray him ; therefore said he , Ye are not all clean .
text2: Son va fys echey quoi va ry - hoi y vrah eh : shen - y - fa dooyrt eh , Cha vel shiu ooilley glen .

text: So after he had washed their feet , and had taken his garments , and was set down again , he said unto them , Know ye what I have done to you ?
text2: Myr shen erreish da v ' er niee ny cassyn oc , as tra v ' eh er ghoaill e gharmadyn , as er hoie sheese reesht , dooyrt eh roo , Vel fys eu cre ta mee er n ' yannoo riu ?

text: Ye call me Master and Lord : and ye say well ; for so I am .
text2: Ta shiu genmys mish nyn Mainshter , as Chiarn : as ta shiu gra dy mie ; son she shen mee .

text: If I then , your Lord and Master , have washed your feet ; ye also ought to wash one another ' s feet .
text2: My ta mish eisht yn Chiarn as y Mainshter eu er niee nyn gassyn , lhisagh shiuish myrgeddin yn derrey yeh eu cassyn y jeh elley y niee .

text: For I have given you an example , that ye should do as I have done to you .
text2: Son ta mish er chur diu sampleyr ; shiuish dy yannoo myr ta mish er n ' yannoo riu .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord ; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Cha vel y charvaant ny syrjey na e hiarn , ny eshyn t ' er ny choyrt , ny syrjey na eshyn ren y choyrt eh .

text: If ye know these things , happy are ye if ye do them .
text2: My ta fys eu er ny reddyn shoh , s ' maynrey vees shiu my nee shiu ad y yannoo .

text: I speak not of you all : I know whom I have chosen : but that the scripture may be fulfilled , He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me .
text2: Cha vel mee loayrt j ' iu ooilley ; ta fys aym quoi ta mee er reih : agh dy vod y scriptyr ve cooilleenit , T ' eshyn ta gee arran marym , er hroggal e voyn m ' oi .

text: Now I tell you before it come , that , when it is come to pass , ye may believe that I am he .
text2: Nish ta mee ginsh diu ro - laue , tra hig eh gy - kione , dy vod shiu credjal dy nee mish eh .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me ; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu Eshyn ta jannoo soiagh jeh quoi - erbee ta mee dy choyrt , t ' eh jannoo soiagh jeem ' s : as eshyn ta soiaghey jeem ' s , t ' eh soiaghey jehsyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: When Jesus had thus said , he was troubled in spirit , and testified , and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , that one of you shall betray me .
text2: Tra va Yeesey er ghra shoh , v ' eh seaghnit ayns e spyrryd , as dymmyrk eh feanish , as dooyrt eh , Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , dy jean fer jiuish mish y vrah .

text: Then the disciples looked one on another , doubting of whom he spake .
text2: Eisht yeeagh ny ostyllyn er y cheilley ayns ourys quoi er v ' eh cheet .

text: Now there was leaning on Jesus ' bosom one of his disciples , whom Jesus loved .
text2: Nish va ny lhie er oghrish Yeesey , fer jeh e ostyllyn bynney lesh .

text: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him , that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake .
text2: Chrie Simon Peddyr er - y - fa shen er , eh dy enaght quoi er v ' eh cheet .

text: He then lying on Jesus ' breast saith unto him , Lord , who is it ?
text2: Myr v ' eh eisht ny lhie rish oghrish Yeesey , dooyrt eh rish , Hiarn , quoi eh ?

text: Jesus answered , He it is , to whom I shall give a sop , when I have dipped it . And when he had dipped the sop , he gave it to Judas Iscariot , the son of Simon .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , She eshyn eh da verym greme dy arran , tra vee ' m er hummey eh . As tra v ' eh er hummey yn greme , hug eh eh da Yuaase Iscariot mac Simon .

text: And after the sop Satan entered into him . Then said Jesus unto him , That thou doest , do quickly .
text2: As lurg y greme , hie yn drogh - spyrryd stiagh ayn . Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish , Shen t ' ou dy yannoo , jean eh dy tappee .

text: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him .
text2: Nish cha row fys ec dooinney jeu ec y voayrd cre ' n - fa loayr eh shoh rish .

text: For some of them thought , because Judas had the bag , that Jesus had said unto him , Buy those things that we have need of against the feast ; or , that he should give something to the poor .
text2: Son heill paart , er - yn - oyr dy nee ec Yuaase va ' n sporran , dy row Yeesey er ghra rish Kionnee ny vees mayd feme cour y feailley : ny eh dy chur jeirk da ny boghtyn .

text: He then having received the sop went immediately out : and it was night .
text2: Erreish da eisht v ' er n ' ghoaill y greme dy arran , hie eh chelleeragh magh : as va ' n oie ayn .

text: Therefore , when he was gone out , Jesus said , Now is the Son of man glorified , and God is glorified in him .
text2: Shen - y - fa erreish da v ' er n ' gholl magh , dooyrt Yeesey , Nish ta ' n Mac dooinney er ny ghloyraghey , as ta Jee er ny ghloyraghey ayn .

text: If God be glorified in him , God shall also glorify him in himself , and shall straightway glorify him .
text2: My ta Jee er ny ghloyraghey ayn , nee Jee myrgeddin eshyn y ghloyraghey ayn hene , as nee eh dy gerrit eh y ghloyraghey .

text: Little children , yet a little while I am with you . Ye shall seek me : and as I said unto the Jews , Whither I go , ye cannot come ; so now I say to you .
text2: Chloan veggey , foast tammylt beg ta mish meriu . Nee shiu my hirrey : as myr dooyrt mee rish ny Hewnyn , Raad ta mish goll , cha vod shiuish cheet ; myr shen ta mec nish gra riuish .

text: A new commandment I give unto you , That ye love one another ; as I have loved you , that ye also love one another .
text2: Sarey noa ta mee dy choyrt diu , Shiu dy ve graihagh yn derrey yeh er y jeh elley ; myr ta mish er ve graihagh erriuish dy der shiuish myrgeddin graih yn derrey yeh da ' n jeh elley .

text: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples , if ye have love one to another .
text2: Liorish shoh vees fys ec dy chooilley ghooinney dy vel shiu gynsaghey voym ' s , my vees shiu graihagh yn derrey yeh er y jeh elley .

text: Simon Peter said unto him , Lord , whither goest thou ? Jesus answered him , Whither I go , thou canst not follow me now ; but thou shalt follow me afterwards .
text2: Dooyrt Simon Peddyr rish , Hiarn , c ' raad t ' ou goll ? Dreggyr Yeesey eh , Raad ta mee goll , cha vod oo geiyrt orrym nish ; agh eiyree oo orrym ny lurg shoh .

text: Peter said unto him , Lord , why cannot I follow thee now ? I will lay down my life for thy sake .
text2: Dooyrt Peddyr rish , Hiarn , cre ' n - fa nagh voddym geiyrt ort nish ? scarrym rish my vioys er dty ghraih .

text: Jesus answered him , Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake ? Verily , verily , I say unto thee , The cock shall not crow , till thou hast denied me thrice .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey eh , Jean oo scarrey rish dty vioys er my ghraih ' s ? Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , Nagh jean y kellagh gerrym , derrey obbys oo mish three keayrtyn .

text: Let not your heart be troubled : ye believe in God , believe also in me .
text2: NY lhig da ' n cree eu ve seaghnit : . ta shiu credjal ayns Jee , cred - jee myrgeddin aynym ' s .

text: In my Father ' s house are many mansions : if it were not so , I would have told you . I go to prepare a place for you .
text2: Ayns thie my Ayrey ta ymmodee ynnydyn - vaghee ; dy beagh eh er aght elley , veign er n ' insh diu : ta mee goll dy yannoo aarloo ynnyd er nyn son .

text: And if I go and prepare a place for you , I will come again , and receive you unto myself ; that where I am , there ye may be also .
text2: As my hem ' s dy yannoo aarloo ynnyd er nyn son , hig - ym reesht , as goym shiu hym pene , raad ta mish dy vod shiuish ve myrgeddin .

text: And whither I go ye know , and the way ye know .
text2: As ta fys eu cre ' n raad ta mee goll , as shione diu yn raad .

text: Thomas saith unto him , Lord , we know not whither thou goest ; and how can we know the way ?
text2: Dooyrt Thomase rish , Hiarn , cha s ' ain cre ' n raad t ' ou goll , as kys oddys enney y ve ain er y raad ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , I am the way , the truth , and the life : no man cometh unto the Father , but by me .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Mish y raad , yn irriney , as y vea : cha vel dooinney erbee cheet gys yn Ayr , agh lioryms .

text: If ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also : and from henceforth ye know him , and have seen him .
text2: Dy beagh enney er ve eu orrym ' s , veagh enney eu er my Ayr myrgeddin : as nish ta enney eu er , as ta shiu er vakin eh .

text: Philip saith unto him , Lord , shew us the Father , and it sufficeth us .
text2: Dooyrt Philip rish , Hiarn , jeeagh dooin yn Ayr , as s ' lioar dooin eh .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Have I been so long time with you , and yet hast thou not known me , Philip ? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father ; and how sayest thou then , Shew us the Father ?
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Vel mish er ve choud shen meriu , as nagh nione dhyt ' s mee foast , Philip ? eshyn t ' er n ' akin mish , t ' eh er vakin yn Ayr ; as kys t ' ou uss gra eisht , Jeeagh dooin yn Ayr ?

text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father , and the Father in me ? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself : but the Father that dwelleth in me , he doeth the works .
text2: Nagh vel oo credjal dy vel mish ayns yn Ayr , as yn Ayr aynym ' s ? ny goan ta mish dy loayrt riu , cha vel mee loayrt jee ' m pene : agh yn Ayr ta tannaghtyn aynym , eshyn ta jannoo ny obbraghyn .

text: Believe me that I am in the Father , and the Father in me : or else believe me for the very works ' sake .
text2: Cred - jee mish , dy vel mee ayns yn Ayr , as yn Ayr aynym ' s : er - nonney cred - jee mee er graih ny eer obbraghyn .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me , the works that I do shall he do also ; and greater works than these shall he do ; because I go unto my Father .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Eshyn ta credjal aynym ' s , ny obbraghyn ta mish dy yannoo nee eshyn myrgeddin , as obbraghyn smoo na ad shoh nee eh ; er - y - fa dy vel mish goll roym gys my Ayr .

text: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name , that will I do , that the Father may be glorified in the Son .
text2: As cre - erbee nee shiu y hirrey ayns yn ennym aym ' s , shen neem ' s y yannoo , dy vod yn Ayr v ' er ny ghloyraghey ayns y Mac .

text: If ye shall ask any thing in my name , I will do it .
text2: My hirrys shiu nhee erbee ayns yn ennym aym ' s , nee ' m eh y yannoo .

text: If ye love me , keep my commandments .
text2: My ta shiu graihagh orrym ' s , freill jee my annaghyn .

text: And I will pray the Father , and he shall give you another Comforter , that he may abide with you for ever ;
text2: As guee - yms gys yn Ayr , as ver eh hiu Fer - gerjagh elley dy hannaghtyn meriu son dy bragh .

text: Even the Spirit of truth ; whom the world cannot receive , because it seeth him not , neither knoweth him : but ye know him ; for he dwelleth with you , and shall be in you .
text2: Eer Spyrryd ny firriney , nagh vod y seihll goaill - rish , er - y - fa nagh vel ad dy akin eh , as nagh nione daue eh : agh shione diuish eh , son t ' eh tannaghtyn meriu , as bee eh ayndiu .

text: I will not leave you comfortless : I will come to you .
text2: Cha vaag - ym shiu gyn gerjagh ; higyms hiu .

text: Yet a little while , and the world seeth me no more ; but ye see me : because I live , ye shall live also .
text2: Foast tammylt beg , as cha vel y seihll dy my akin ny smoo ; agh ta shiuish dy my akin : er - yn - oyr dy vel mish bio , bee shiuish bio myrgeddin .

text: At that day ye shall know that I am in my Father , and ye in me , and I in you .
text2: Ayns y laa shen vees fys eu dy vel mish ayns my Ayr , as shiuish aynym ' s , as mish ayndiuish .

text: He that hath my commandments , and keepeth them , he it is that loveth me : and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father , and I will love him , and will manifest myself to him .
text2: Eshyn ta my annaghyn ' s echey , as ta freayll ad , eshyn eh ta graihagh orrym ' s : as eshyn ta graihagh orrym , ver my Ayr graih da , as ver - yms graih da , as soilshee - ym mee hene da .

text: Judas saith unto him , not Iscariot , Lord , how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us , and not unto the world ?
text2: Dooyrt Yuaase rish , cha nee Iscariot , Hiarn , kys te dy jean oo oo - hene y hoilshaghey dooinyn , as cha nee da ' n seihll ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , If a man love me , he will keep my words : and my Father will love him , and we will come unto him , and make our abode with him .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt eh rish , My ta dooinney graihagh orrym , freillee eh my ghoan : as ver my Ayr graih da , as hig mayd huggey , as nee mayd tannaghtyn marish .

text: He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings : and the word which ye hear is not mine , but the Father ' s which sent me .
text2: Eshyn nagh vel graihagh orrym ' s , cha vel eh freayll my ghoan : as y goo ta shiu dy chlashtyn , cha nee lhiam ' s eh , agh goo yn Ayr t ' er my choyrt .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , being yet present with you .
text2: Ny reddyn shoh ta mee er loayrt riu , choud ' s ta mee foast meriu .

text: But the Comforter , which is the Holy Ghost , whom the Father will send in my name , he shall teach you all things , and bring all things to your remembrance , whatsoever I have said unto you .
text2: Agh nee Fer - ny - gherjagh , ta shen , yn Spyrryd Noo , eh nee yn Ayr y choyrt ayns yn ennym aym ' s , gynsaghey diu dy chooilley nhee , as tayrnee eh dy chooilley nhee gys nyn gooinaghtyn , cre - erbee ta mish er ghra riu .

text: Peace I leave with you , my peace I give unto you : not as the world giveth , give I unto you . Let not your heart be troubled , neither let it be afraid .
text2: Shee ta mee dy aagail meriu , my hee ta mee dy choyrt diu : cha nee myr ta ' n seihll coyrt , ta mish dy choyrt eh diu . Ny lhig da ' n cree eu ve seaghnit , chamoo lhig da aggle y ve er .

text: Ye have heard how I said unto you , I go away , and come again unto you . If ye loved me , ye would rejoice , because I said , I go unto the Father : for my Father is greater than I .
text2: Ta shiu er chlashtyn kys dooyrt mee riu , Ta mee goll roym , as cheet reesht hiu . Dy beagh shiu graihagh orrym , ghoghe shiu boggey , er - y - fa dy dooyrt mee , Ta mee goll roym gys my Ayr : son ta my Ayr ny syrjey na mish .

text: And now I have told you before it come to pass , that , when it is come to pass , ye might believe .
text2: As nish ta mee er n ' insh diu ro - laue , tra hig eh gy - kione , dy vod shiu credjal

text: Hereafter I will not talk much with you : for the prince of this world cometh , and hath nothing in me .
text2: Veih shoh magh cha loayr - ym cooidvooar riu : son ta prince y theihll shoh cheet , as cha vel nhee erbee echey aynym ' s .

text: But that the world may know that I love the Father ; and as the Father gave me commandment , even so I do . Arise , let us go hence .
text2: Agh dy vod fys y ve ec y theihll dy vel mish graihagh er yn Ayr ; as myr hug yn Ayr sarey dou , myr shen ta mee jannoo . Trog - jee erriu , lhig dooin goll roin .

text: I am the true vine , and my Father is the husbandman .
text2: NISH y billey - feeyney firrinagh , as my Ayr yn eirinnagh .

text: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away : and every branch that beareth fruit , he purgeth it , that it may bring forth more fruit .
text2: Dy chooilley vanglane aynym ' s nagh vel gymmyrkey mess , t ' eh dy ghoaill ersooyl : as dy chooilley vanglane ta gymmyrkey mess , t ' eh dy phollal , dy vod eh ve ny s ' messoil .

text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you .
text2: Nish ta shiuish glen trooid y goo ta mish er loayrt riu .

text: Abide in me , and I in you . As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself , except it abide in the vine ; no more can ye , except ye abide in me .
text2: Jean - jee tannaghtyn aynym ' s , as mish ayndiuish . Myr nagh vod y banglane mess y ymmyrkey jeh hene , mannagh vel eh tannaghtyn ayns y villey - feeyney : chamoo oddys shiuish , mannagh jean shiu tannaghtyn aynym ' s .

text: I am the vine , ye are the branches : He that abideth in me , and I in him , the same bringeth forth much fruit : for without me ye can do nothing .
text2: Mish y billey - feeyney , shiuish ny banglaneyn : eshyn ta tannaghtyn aynym ' s , as mish aynsyn , t ' eh shoh cur magh mooarane mess : son scarrit voym ' s cha vod shiu jannoo monney dy vie .

text: If a man abide not in me , he is cast forth as a branch , and is withered ; and men gather them , and cast them into the fire , and they are burned .
text2: Mannagh vel dooinney tannaghtyn aynym ' s t ' eh tilgit magh myr banglane , as t ' eh fioghey ; as t ' ad dyn deiy as dyn dilgey ad ayns yn aile , as t ' ad er nyn lostey .

text: If ye abide in me , and my words abide in you , ye shall ask what ye will , and it shall be done unto you .
text2: My nee shiu tannaghtyn aynym ' s , as my ghoan ' s tannaghtyn ayndiuish , shirree shiu cre sailliu , as bee eh jeant er nyn son .

text: Herein is my Father glorified , that ye bear much fruit ; so shall ye be my disciples .
text2: Liorish shoh ta my Ayr er ny ghloyraghey , shiu dy chur magh lane mess , as shoh myr vees shiu ny ynseydee aym ' s .

text: As the Father hath loved me , so have I loved you : continue ye in my love .
text2: Myr ta ' n Ayr graihagh orrym ' s , myr shen ta mish er ve graihagh erriuish : jean - jee tannaghtyn ayns y ghraih aym ' s .

text: If ye keep my commandments , ye shall abide in my love ; even as I have kept my Father ' s commandments , and abide in his love .
text2: My nee shiu my annaghyn y reayll , nee shiu tannaghtyn ayns my ghraih : eer myr ta mish er vreayll annaghyn my Ayrey , as tannaghtyn ayns y ghraih echeysyn .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , that my joy might remain in you , and that your joy might be full .
text2: Ny goan shoh ta mee er loayrt riu , dy vod y boggey aym ' s ve er - mayrn ayndiu , as dy vod y boggey euish v ' er ny yannoo magh .

text: This is my commandment , That ye love one another , as I have loved you .
text2: Shoh my harey , Shiu dy chur graih yn derrey yeh da ' n jeh elley , myr ta mish er ve graihagh erriuish .

text: Greater love hath no man than this , that a man lay down his life for his friends .
text2: Graih smoo na shoh cha vel ec dooinney erbee , na dooinney dy scarrey rish e vioys son e chaarjyn .

text: Ye are my friends , if ye do whatsoever I command you .
text2: She my chaarjyn shiuish , my nee shiu ny ta mish dy harey diu .

text: Henceforth I call you not servants ; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth : but I have called you friends ; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you .
text2: Veih shoh magh cha vel mee dy enmys shiu sharvaantyn ; son cha vel fys ec y charvaant , cre ta e hiarn dy yannoo : agh ta mee er n ' enmys shiu caarjyn ; son dy chooilley nhee ta mee er chlashtyn veih my Ayr , ta mee er hoilshaghey diuish .

text: Ye have not chosen me , but I have chosen you , and ordained you , that ye should go and bring forth fruit , and that your fruit should remain : that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name , he may give it you .
text2: Cha vel shiuish er my reih , agh ta mish er reih shiuish , as er chur shiu ayns pooar , dy vod shiu goll magh as mess y ymmyrkey , as dy vod y mess eu ve beayn : cre erbee nee shiu y hirrey er yn Ayr ayns yn ennym aym ' s , dy vod eh y chur diu eh .

text: These things I command you , that ye love one another .
text2: Ny reddyn shoh ta mish dy harey diu , dy vod shiu ve graihagh yn derrey yeh er y jeh elley .

text: If the world hate you , ye know that it hated me before it hated you .
text2: My ta dwoaie ec y seihll erriu , ta fys eu dy dug eh dwoaie dooys hoshiaght .

text: If ye were of the world , the world would love his own : but because ye are not of the world , but I have chosen you out of the world , therefore the world hateth you .
text2: Dy beagh shiuish jeh ' n theihll , veagh y seihll graihagh er e vooinjer hene : agh son nagh vel shiu jeh ' n theihll , agh dy vel mish er reih shiu ass y theihll , shen - y - fa ta dwoaie ec y theihll erriu .

text: Remember the word that I said unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord . If they have persecuted me , they will also persecute you ; if they have kept my saying , they will keep yours also .
text2: Cooinee - jee er y raa loayr mish riu , Cha vel y charvaant ny syrjey na e hiarn . My t ' ad er n ' yannoo tranlaase orrym ' s , nee ad myrgeddin tranlaase erriuish : my t ' ad er vreayll my ghoan ' s , freillee ad ny goan euish myrgeddin .

text: But all these things will they do unto you for my name ' s sake , because they know not him that sent me .
text2: Agh dy chooilley nhee jeu shoh nee ad riu kyndagh rish yn ennym aym ' s , er - y - fa nagh vel enney oc ersyn t ' er my choyrt .

text: If I had not come and spoken unto them , they had not had sin : but now they have no cloke for their sin .
text2: Mannagh beign ' s er jeet as er loayrt roo , cha beagh peccah er ve oc : agh nish cha vel leshtal oc son nyn beccah .

text: He that hateth me hateth my Father also .
text2: Eshyn ta dwoaie echey orrym ' s , ta dwoaie echey er my Ayr myrgeddin .

text: If I had not done among them the works which none other man did , they had not had sin : but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father .
text2: Mannagh beign ' s er n ' yannoo nyn mast ' oc lheid ny obbraghyn as nagh ren rieau dooinney erbee elley , cha beagh peccah er ve oc : agh nish t ' ad er vakin , as er chur dwoaie chammah dooys as da my Ayr .

text: But this cometh to pass , that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law , They hated me without a cause .
text2: Agh ta shoh , dy vod y raa ve cooilleenit ta scruit ayns y leigh oc , Hug ad dwoaie dou gyn oyr .

text: But when the Comforter is come , whom I will send unto you from the Father , even the Spirit of truth , which proceedeth from the Father , he shall testify of me :
text2: Agh tra vees Fer - ny - gherjagh er jeet , eh ver - yms hiu veih yn Ayr , ta shen , Spyrryd ny firriney , ta cheet magh veih yn Ayr , nee eh feanish y ymmyrkey jeem ' s .

text: And ye also shall bear witness , because ye have been with me from the beginning .
text2: As nee shiuish myrgeddin feanish y ymmyrkey , er - y - fa dy vel shiu er ve marym er - dyn toshiaght .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , that ye should not be offended .
text2: NY goan shoh ta mee er loayrt riu , son nagh bee nyn gredjue er ny lhaggaghey .

text: They shall put you out of the synagogues : yea , the time cometh , that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service .
text2: Ver ad shiu magh ass ny kialteenyn : as ta ' n oor cheet , quoi - erbee varrys shiu , dy smooinee eh dy bee eh shirveish Jee .

text: And these things will they do unto you , because they have not known the Father , nor me .
text2: As ny reddyn shoh nee ad riu , er - yn - oyr nagh vel enney oc er yn Ayr , ny orrym ' s .

text: But these things have I told you , that when the time shall come , ye may remember that I told you of them . And these things I said not unto you at the beginning , because I was with you .
text2: Agh ny reddyn shoh ta mish er n ' insh diu , tra hig yn earish , dy vod shiu cooinaghtyn dy dinsh mee diu jeu . As ny goan shoh cha loayr mee riu ec y toshiaght , er - y - fa dy row mee meriu .

text: But now I go my way to him that sent me ; and none of you asketh me , Whither goest thou ?
text2: Agh nish ta mee goll roym huggeysyn t ' er my choyrt , as cha vel fer j ' iu fenaght jee ' m c ' raad t ' ou goll ?

text: But because I have said these things unto you , sorrow hath filled your heart .
text2: Agh er - yn - oyr dy vel mee er ghra ny reddyn shoh riu , ta trimshey er lhieeney ny creeaghyn eu .

text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth ; It is expedient for you that I go away : for if I go not away , the Comforter will not come unto you ; but if I depart , I will send him unto you .
text2: Ny - yeih ta mish ginsh diu yn irriney ; Te ymmyrchagh er nyn son mish dy gholl roym : son mannagh jem roym , cha jig Fer ny - gherjagh hiu ; agh my hem ' s roym , verym hiu eh .

text: And when he is come , he will reprove the world of sin , and of righteousness , and of judgment :
text2: As tra vees eh er jeet , nee eh yn seihll y gheyrey mychione peccah , as cairys , as briwnys :

text: Of sin , because they believe not on me ;
text2: Mychione peccah , son nagh vel ad credjal aynym ' s ;

text: Of righteousness , because I go to my Father , and ye see me no more ;
text2: Mychione cairys , son dy vel mee goll roym gys yn Ayr , as nagh vaik shiu mee arragh ;

text: Of judgment , because the prince of this world is judged .
text2: Mychione briwnys , son dy vel prince y theihll shoh er ny vriwnys .

text: I have yet many things to say unto you , but ye cannot bear them now .
text2: Shimmey red ta aym ' s foast dy ghra riu , agh cha vod shiu ad y ymmyrkey nish .

text: Howbeit when he , the Spirit of truth , is come , he will guide you into all truth : for he shall not speak of himself ; but whatsoever he shall hear , that shall he speak : and he will shew you things to come .
text2: Agh tra hig eshyn , Spyrryd ny firriney , leeidee eh shiu gys dy chooilley irrinys : son cha loayr eh jeh hene , agh cre - erbee nee eh y chlashtyn , shen loayrys eh ; as soilshee eh diu reddyn ta ry - heet .

text: He shall glorify me : for he shall receive of mine , and shall shew it unto you .
text2: Nee eh mish y ghloyraghey : son yiow eh jeh ny ta lhiam ' s as soilshee eh diuish eh .

text: All things that the Father hath are mine : therefore said I , that he shall take of mine , and shall shew it unto you .
text2: Ta dy chooilley nhee t ' ec yn Ayr lhiam ' s : shen - y - fa dooyrt mee , dy gow eh jeh ny ta lhiam ' s , as dy soilshee eh diuish eh .

text: A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me , because I go to the Father .
text2: Tammylt beg as cha vaik shiu mee : as reesht , tammylt beg , as hee shiu mee , er - y - fa dy vel mee goll roym gys yn Ayr .

text: Then said some of his disciples among themselves , What is this that he saith unto us , A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me : and , Because I go to the Father ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt paart jeh e ostyllyn eddyr ad - hene , Cre shoh t ' eh dy ghra rooin , Tammylt beg as cha vaik shiu mee : as reesht , tammylt beg , as hee shiu mee : as , Er - yn - oyr dy vel mee goll roym gys yn Ayr ?

text: They said therefore , What is this that he saith , A little while ? we cannot tell what he saith .
text2: Dooyrt ad er - y - fa shen , Cre shoh t ' eh dy ghra , Tammylt beg ? cha s ' ain cre t ' eh dy ghra .

text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him , and said unto them , Do ye inquire among yourselves of that I said , A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me ?
text2: Nish va fys ec Yeesey dy row ad aignagh dy enaght jeh , as dooyrt eh roo , Vel shiu briaght nyn mast ' eu hene , er - y - fa dy dooyrt mee , Tammylt beg , as cha vaik shiu mee : as reesht , tammylt beg as hee shiu mee ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , That ye shall weep and lament , but the world shall rejoice : and ye shall be sorrowful , but your sorrow shall be turned into joy .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Dy jean shiuish keayney as dobberan , agh nee yn seihll boggey y ghoaill : as bee shiuish trimshagh , agh bee yn trimshey eu er ny hyndaa gys boggey .

text: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow , because her hour is come : but as soon as she is delivered of the child , she remembereth no more the anguish , for joy that a man is born into the world .
text2: Ta ben , tra t ' ee er - troailt , as trimshey eck , er - yn - oyr dy vel yn oor eck er jeet : agh cha leah as t ' ee er ny livrey jeh ' n lhiannoo , cha vel ee ny sodjey cooinaghtyn er yn angaish , son boggey dy vel dooinney er ny ruggey gys y theihll .

text: And ye now therefore have sorrow : but I will see you again , and your heart shall rejoice , and your joy no man taketh from you .
text2: As ta nish er - y - fa shen trimshey euish : agh hee - yms shiu reesht , as gowee yn cree eu boggey , as y boggey eu cha gow dooinney erbee veue .

text: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing . Verily , verily , I say unto you , Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name , he will give it you .
text2: As ayns y laa shen cha jean shiu nhee erbee y enaght jeem ' s : Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu , Cre - erbee hirrys shiu er yn Ayr ayns yn ennym aym ' s , ver eh diu eh .

text: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name : ask , and ye shall receive , that your joy may be full .
text2: Cha vel shiu foast er hirrey nhee erbee ayns yn ennym aym ' s shir - jee as yiow shiu , dy vod y boggey eu v ' er ny yannoo magh .

text: These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs : but the time cometh , when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs , but I shall shew you plainly of the Father .
text2: Ny reddyn shoh ta mee er loayrt riu ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey : agh ta ' n traa cheet tra nagh loayrym riu ny smoo ayns coraaghyn - dorraghey , agh soilshee - ym diu dy foshlit jeh ' n Ayr .

text: At that day ye shall ask in my name : and I say not unto you , that I will pray the Father for you :
text2: Ayns y laa shen nee shiu geearree ayns y ennym aym ' s : as cha vel mee gra riu , dy guee - ym gys yn Ayr er nyn son :

text: For the Father himself loveth you , because ye have loved me , and have believed that I came out from God .
text2: Son ta ' n Ayr hene graihagh erriu , er - y - fa dy vel shiuish er ve graihagh orrym ' s , as dy chred shiu dy daink mee magh veih Jee .

text: I came forth from the Father , and am come into the world : again , I leave the world , and go to the Father .
text2: Haink mee magh veih ' n Ayr , as ta mee er jeet gys y theihll : reesht , ta mee faagail y seihll , as goll roym gys yn Ayr .

text: His disciples said unto him , Lo , now speakest thou plainly , and speakest no proverb .
text2: Dooyrt e ostyllyn rish , Cur - my - ner , nish t ' ou loayrt dy foshlit , as cha vel oo loayrt coraa - dorraghey erbee .

text: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things , and needest not that any man should ask thee : by this we believe that thou camest forth from God .
text2: Nish ta shin shickyr dy vel fys ayd er dy chooilley nhee , as nagh vel feme ayd dooinney erbee dy enaght jeed : liorish shoh ta shin credjal dy daink oo magh veih Jee .

text: Jesus answered them , Do ye now believe ?
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey ad , Vel shiu nish credjal ?

text: Behold , the hour cometh , yea , is now come , that ye shall be scattered , every man to his own , and shall leave me alone : and yet I am not alone , because the Father is with me .
text2: Cur - my - ner ta ' n oor cheet , as eer nish er jeet , dy bee shiu er nyn skeayley dy chooilley ghooinney gys e ynnyd hene , as dy vaag shiu mish my lomarcan : as foast cha vel mee my lomarcan , er - y - fa dy vel yn Ayr marym .

text: These things I have spoken unto you , that in me ye might have peace . In the world ye shall have tribulation : but be of good cheer ; I have overcome the world .
text2: Ny reddyn shoh ta mee er loayrt riu , aynym ' s dy vod shee y ve eu . Ayns y theihll vees seaghyn eu : agh bee - jee dy yien mie , ta mish er gheddyn barriaght er y theihll .

text: These words spake Jesus , and lifted up his eyes to heaven , and said , Father , the hour is come ; glorify thy Son , that thy Son also may glorify thee :
text2: NY goan shoh loayr Yeesey ; as hrog eh seose e hooillyn gys niau , as dooyrt eh , Ayr , ta ' n oor er jeet ; jean dty Vac y ghloyraghey , dy vod dty Vac myrgeddin uss y ghloyraghey .

text: As thou hast given him power over all flesh , that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him .
text2: Myr t ' ou er chur da pooar harrish ooilley sheelnaue , dy vod eh yn vea veayn y choyrt da whilleen as t ' ou er chur da .

text: And this is life eternal , that they might know thee the only true God , and Jesus Christ , whom thou hast sent .
text2: As shoh yn vea veayn , tushtey y ve oc jeed ' s yn ynrycan Jee firrinagh , as jeh Yeesey Creest t ' ou uss er choyrt .

text: I have glorified thee on the earth : I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do .
text2: Ta mee er ghloyraghey oo er y thalloo : ta mee er chooilleeney yn obbyr hug oo dou dy yannoo .

text: And now , O Father , glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was .
text2: As nish , O Ayr , jean mish y ghloyraghey mayrt hene , lesh y ghloyr v ' aym mayrt roish my row seihll ayn .

text: I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world : thine they were , and thou gavest them me ; and they have kept thy word .
text2: Ta mee er hoilshaghey dty ennym gys ny deiney hug oo dou ass y theihll : lhiat ' s ad , as hug oo ad dooys ; as t ' ad er vreayll dty ghoo .

text: Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee .
text2: Nish t ' ad er hoiggal dy nee void ' s ta dy chooilley nhee t ' ou er choyrt dou .

text: For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me ; and they have received them , and have known surely that I came out from thee , and they have believed that thou didst send me .
text2: Son hug mish dauesyn ny goan hug uss dooys ; as t ' ad er ghoaill huc hene ad , as er hoiggal ayns shickyrys dy daink mee magh voids , as t ' ad er chredjal dy ren oo my choyrt .

text: I pray for them : I pray not for the world , but for them which thou hast given me ; for they are thine .
text2: Ta mee guee ort er nyn son : cha vel mee guee son theihll , agh er ny son ocsyn t ' ou er choyrt dou , son she lhiat hene ad .

text: And all mine are thine , and thine are mine ; and I am glorified in them .
text2: As ta ooilley ny ta lhiam ' s lhiat ' s , as ny ta lhiat ' s lhiam ' s , as ta mee er my ghloyraghey ayndoo .

text: And now I am no more in the world , but these are in the world , and I come to thee . Holy Father , keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me , that they may be one , as we are .
text2: As nish cha vel mish dy ve ny sodjey ayns y theihll , agh t ' ad shoh ayns y theihll , as ta mish cheet hood ' s . Ayr chasherick , freill trooid dty ennym hene adsyn t ' ou er chur dou , dy vod adsyn ve unnane , myr ta shinyn unnane .

text: While I was with them in the world , I kept them in thy name : those that thou gavest me I have kept , and none of them is lost , but the son of perdition ; that the scripture might be fulfilled .
text2: Choud as va mee maroo ayns y theihll , dreill mee ad ayns dty ennym ' s : adsyn hug oo dou dreill mee , as cha vel unnane oc caillit , mannagh vel mac y toyrt - mow : dy voddagh yn scriptyr ve cooilleenit .

text: And now come I to thee ; and these things I speak in the world , that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves .
text2: As nish ta mee cheet hood ' s , as ny reddyn shoh ta mee dy loayrt ayns y theihll , dy vod y boggey aym ' s y ve oc jeant magh ayndoo hene .

text: I have given them thy word ; and the world hath hated them , because they are not of the world , even as I am not of the world .
text2: Ta mee er chur daue dty ghoo ; as ta ' n seihll er chur dwoaie daue , er - y - fa nagh vel ad jeh ' n theihll , myr nagh vel mish jeh ' n theihll .

text: I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world , but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil .
text2: Cha vel mee guee ort dy ghoaill ad ass y theihll , agh oo dy reayll ad veih ' n olk .

text: They are not of the world , even as I am not of the world .
text2: Cha vel adsyn jeh ' n theihll , myr nagh vel mish jeh ' n theihll .

text: Sanctify them through thy truth : thy word is truth .
text2: Jean ad y chasherickey son dty irriney : dty ghoo she firrinys eh .

text: As thou hast sent me into the world , even so have I also sent them into the world .
text2: Myr t ' ou uss er my choyrt gys y theihll , myr shen ta mish myrgeddin er chur adsyn gys y theihll .

text: And for their sakes I sanctify myself , that they also might be sanctified through the truth .
text2: As er y ghraih ocsyn ta mish dy chasherickey mee hene , dy vod adsyn myrgeddin v ' er nyn gasherickey gys yn irriney .

text: Neither pray I for these alone , but for them also which shall believe on me through their word ;
text2: Chamoo ta mee guee er ny son oc shoh nyn lomarcan , agh myrgeddin er ny son ocsyn nee credjal aynym ' s trooid y goo oc .

text: That they all may be one ; as thou , Father , art in me , and I in thee , that they also may be one in us : that the world may believe that thou hast sent me .
text2: Dy vod ad ooilley ve unnane , myr t ' ou uss ayr aynym ' s , as mish aynyd ' s ; dy vod adsyn myrgeddin ve unnane ayninyn : dy vod y seihll credjal dy ren oo my choyrt .

text: And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them ; that they may be one , even as we are one :
text2: As y ghloyr hug uss dooys , ta mish er chur dauesyn : dy vod ad ve unnane , eer myr ta shinyn unnane .

text: I in them , and thou in me , that they may be made perfect in one ; and that the world may know that thou hast sent me , and hast loved them , as thou hast loved me .
text2: Mish ayndoosyn , as uss aynym ' s , dy vod ad ve jeant slane firrinagh ayns unnaneys , as dy vod fys ve ec y seihll dy vel oo er my choyrt , as dy vel oo er ve graihagh orroosyn , myr t ' ou er ve graihagh orrym ' s

text: Father , I will that they also , whom thou hast given me , be with me where I am ; that they may behold my glory , which thou hast given me : for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world .
text2: Ayr , ta mee geearree adsyn t ' ou er chur dou dy ve marym raad ta mee ; dy vod ad fakin my ghloyr t ' ou er chur dou : son t ' ou er ve graihagh orrym ' s roish my row yn seihll er ny chroo .

text: O righteous Father , the world hath not known thee : but I have known thee , and these have known that thou hast sent me .
text2: Ayr chairagh , cha ghow yn seihll tushtey jeed ; agh ta tushtey er ve aym ' s jeed , as t ' ad shoh er hoiggal dy vel oo er my choyrt .

text: And I have declared unto them thy name , and will declare it : that the love wherewith thou hast loved me may be in them , and I in them .
text2: As ta mee er hoilshaghey daue dt ' ennym ' s , as nee ' m y hoilshaghey eh : dy vod y graih , liorish t ' ou er ve graihagh orrym ' s , ve ayndoo , as mish ayndoosyn .

text: When Jesus had spoken these words , he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron , where was a garden , into the which he entered , and his disciples .
text2: TRA va Yeesey er loayrt ny goan shoh , hie eh magh marish e ostyllyn harrish y strooan Cedron , raad va garey , as hie eshyn as e ostyllyn stiagh ayn .

text: And Judas also , which betrayed him , knew the place : for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples .
text2: As bione da Yuaase neesht va dy vrah eh , yn ynnyd : son boallagh Yeesey dy mennick taaghey yn voayl shen marish e ostyllyn .

text: Judas then , having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees , cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons .
text2: Hooar Yuaase eisht sheshaght dy gheiney , as sidooryn veih ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn , as haink eh ayns shen lesh lonteyryn , as torchyn , as armyn .

text: Jesus therefore , knowing all things that should come upon him , went forth , and said unto them , Whom seek ye ?
text2: Va fys ec Yeesey er - y - fa shen er dy chooilley nhee harragh er , as hie eh magh , as dooyrt eh roo , Quoi ta shiu dy hirrey ?

text: They answered him , Jesus of Nazareth . Jesus saith unto them , I am he . And Judas also , which betrayed him , stood with them .
text2: Dreggyr ad eh , Yeesey dy Nazareth . Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Mish eh . As va Yuaase myrgeddin ren y vrah eh ny hassoo maroo .

text: As soon then as he had said unto them , I am he , they went backward , and fell to the ground .
text2: Cha leah eisht as v ' eh er ghra roo , Mish eh , hie ad gour nyn drommey , as huitt ad gys y thalloo .

text: Then asked he them again , Whom seek ye ? And they said , Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Eisht denee eh jeu reesht , Quoi ta shiu dy hirrey ? As dooyrt adsyn , Yeesey dy Nazareth .

text: Jesus answered , I have told you that I am he : if therefore ye seek me , let these go their way :
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , Ta mee er n ' insh diu dy nee mish eh . My ta shiu er - y - fa shen dy my hirrey , lhig - jee daue shoh goll roue :

text: That the saying might be fulfilled , which he spake , Of them which thou gavest me have I lost none .
text2: Shoh myr va ' n raa shen loayr eh cooilleenit , Jeusyn hug oo dou , cha vel mee er choayll unnane .

text: Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it , and smote the high priest ' s servant , and cut off his right ear . The servant ' s name was Malchus .
text2: Eisht va cliwe ec Simon Peddyr , as hayrn eh eh , as woaill eh fer - mooinjerey yn ard - saggyrt , as ghiare eh yn chleaysh jeh . Va ennym yn er - mooinjerey shen Malchus .

text: Then said Jesus unto Peter , Put up thy sword into the sheath : the cup which my Father hath given me , shall I not drink it ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish Peddyr , Cur seose dty chliwe ayns y fine : yn cappan ta my Ayr er chur dou , nagh niu - ym eh ?

text: Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus , and bound him ,
text2: Eisht ghow yn cheshaght , as y captan , as fir - oik ny Hewnyn Yeesey , as chiangle ad eh .

text: And led him away to Annas first ; for he was father in law to Caiaphas , which was the high priest that same year .
text2: As hug ad lhieu ersooyl eh gys Annas hoshiaght ( son v ' eh shen ny ayr - ' sy - leigh da Caiaphas , va ny ard - saggyrt yn vlein shen ) .

text: Now Caiaphas was he , which gave counsel to the Jews , that it was expedient that one man should die for the people .
text2: Nish she Caiaphas v ' er choyrlaghey ny Hewnyn , dy row eh ymmyrchagh un dooinney dy ve er ny choyrt gy - baase son y pobble .

text: And Simon Peter followed Jesus , and so did another disciple : that disciple was known unto the high priest , and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest .
text2: As deiyr Simon Peddyr as ostyl elley er Yeesey . Yn ostyl shen va ainjys ec yn ard - saggyrt er , as hie eh stiagh marish Yeesey gys thie yn ard - saggyrt ,

text: But Peter stood at the door without . Then went out that other disciple , which was known unto the high priest , and spake unto her that kept the door , and brought in Peter .
text2: Agh hass Peddyr ec y dorrys er cheu mooie . Eisht hie magh yn ostyl elley shen va ainjys ec yn ard - saggyrt er , as loayr eh reeish va currym y dorrys urree , as hug eh lesh stiagh Peddyr .

text: Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter , Art not thou also one of this man ' s disciples ? He saith , I am not .
text2: Eisht dooyrt y ven - aeg va currym y dorrys urree rish Peddyr , Nagh nee fer jeh eiyrtyssee yn dooinney shoh uss neesht ? Dooyrt eshyn , Cha nee .

text: And the servants and officers stood there , who had made a fire of coals ; for it was cold : and they warmed themselves : and Peter stood with them , and warmed himself .
text2: As va ny sharvaantyn as ny fir - oik nyn shassoo ayns shen , ec aile geayil v ' ad er n ' yannoo ( son ve feayr ) as v ' ad dyn jiow ad - hene .

text: The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples , and of his doctrine .
