text2: Denee yn ard - saggyrt eisht jeh Yeesey mychione e eiyrtyssee , as mychione yn ynsagh echey .

text: Jesus answered him , I spake openly to the world ; I ever taught in the synagogue , and in the temple , whither the Jews always resort ; and in secret have I said nothing .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey eh , Loayr mee dy foshlit rish y theihll : dynsee mee kinjagh ayns y cheeill , as ayns y chiamble , raad ta ny Hewnyn kinjagh taaghey , as dy follit cha vel mee er ghra nhee erbee

text: Why askest thou me ? ask them which heard me , what I have said unto them : behold , they know what I said .
text2: Cre ' n - fa t ' ou fenaght jeem ' s ? fenee jeusyn t ' er my chlashtyn , cre ta mee er ghra roo : cur - my - ner ta fys ocsyn cre ta mee er ghra .

text: And when he had thus spoken , one of the officers which stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand , saying , Answerest thou the high priest so ?
text2: As tra v ' eh erreish ny goan shoh y loayrt woaill fer jeh ny fir - oik va ny hassoo ayns shen Yeesey lesh bass e laue , gra , Nee shen myr t ' ou freggyrt yn ard - saggyrt ?

text: Jesus answered him , If I have spoken evil , bear witness of the evil : but if well , why smitest thou me ?
text2: Dansoor Yeesey eh , My ta mee er loayrt dy olk , ymmyrk feanish jeh ' n olk : agh my loayr mee dy mie , cre ' n - fa woaill uss mee ?

text: Now Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest .
text2: ( Nish va Annas er choyrt eh kianlt gys Caiaphas yn ard - saggyrt )

text: And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself . They said therefore unto him , Art not thou also one of his disciples ? He denied it , and said , I am not .
text2: As va Simon Peddyr ny hassoo as dy hiow eh - hene : dooyrt ad er - y - fa shen rish , Nagh nee fer jeh e eiyrtyssee uss neesht ? Dob eh , as dooyrt eh , Cha nee .

text: One of the servants of the high priest , being his kinsman whose ear Peter cut off , saith , Did not I see thee in the garden with him ?
text2: Dooyrt fer jeh sharvaantyn yn ard saggyrt ( va mooinjerys dasyn va Peddyr er ghiarey yn chleaysh jeh ) Nagh vaik mish oo marish ayns y gharey ?

text: Peter then denied again : and immediately the cock crew .
text2: Eisht dob Peddyr reesht , as chelleeragh gherr y kellagh .

text: Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment : and it was early ; and they themselves went not into the judgment hall , lest they should be defiled ; but that they might eat the passover .
text2: Eisht hug ad lhieu Yeesey veih Caiaphas gys halley ny briwnys : as ve moghey , as cha jagh ad - hene stiagh ayns halley ny briwnys , er - aggle dy beagh ad anchasherick ; as nagh voddagh ad yn Eayncaisht y ee .

text: Pilate then went out unto them , and said , What accusation bring ye against this man ?
text2: Hie Pilate eisht magh huc , as dooyrt eh , Cre ta shiu dy chur gys lieh yn dooinney shoh ?

text: They answered and said unto him , If he were not a malefactor , we would not have delivered him up unto thee .
text2: Dreggyr adsyn as dooyrt ad , Er - be dy nee drogh - yantagh eh , cha beagh shin er livrey hood ' s eh .

text: Then said Pilate unto them , Take ye him , and judge him according to your law . The Jews therefore said unto him , It is not lawful for us to put any man to death :
text2: Eisht dooyrt Pilate roo Gow - jee shiuish eh , as jean - jee eh y vriwnys cordail rish y leigh eu hene . Dooyrt ny Hewnyn er - y - fa shen rish , Cha vel eh lowal dooinyn dooinney erbee y chur gy - baase :

text: That the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled , which he spake , signifying what death he should die .
text2: Shoh myr va cooilleenit yn raa loayr Yeesey , cowraghey cre ' n baase v ' eh dy hurranse .

text: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again , and called Jesus , and said unto him , Art thou the King of the Jews ?
text2: Eisht hie Pilate stiagh reesht ayns halley ny briwnys , as deie eh er Yeesey , as dooyrt eh rish , Nee ree ny Hewnyn oo ?

text: Jesus answered him , Sayest thou this thing of thyself , or did others tell it thee of me ?
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey eh , Vel uss dy ghra shoh jeed hene , ny nee feallagh elley dinsh dhyt eh my - mychione ' s ?

text: Pilate answered , Am I a Jew ? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me : what hast thou done ?
text2: Dreggyr Pilate , Vel mish my Hew ? she dty ashoon hene as ny ard - saggyrtyn t ' er livrey oo seose hym ' s : Cre t ' ou er n ' yannoo ?

text: Jesus answered , My kingdom is not of this world : if my kingdom were of this world , then would my servants fight , that I should not be delivered to the Jews : but now is my kingdom not from hence .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , Cha vel my reeriaght ' s jeh ' n theihll shoh : dy beagh my reeriaght jeh ' n theihll shoh ; eisht veagh my harvaantyn er chaggey , nagh beign er my livrey gys ny Hewnyn , agh nish cha nee veih shoh ta my reeriaght .

text: Pilate therefore said unto him , Art thou a king then ? Jesus answered , Thou sayest that I am a king . To this end was I born , and for this cause came I into the world , that I should bear witness unto the truth . Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice .
text2: Dooyrt Pilate er - y - fa shen rish , Vel oo dty ree eisht ? Dreggyr Yeesey , T ' ou uss er ghra eh , ta mee my ree . Er son shoh ruggyr mee , as er - yn - oyr shoh haink mee gys y theihll , dy ymmyrkey feanish gys yn irriney , Ta dy chooilley unnane ta jeh ' n irriney clashtyn my choraa .

text: Pilate saith unto him , What is truth ? And when he had said this , he went out again unto the Jews , and saith unto them , I find in him no fault at all .
text2: Dooyrt Pilate rish , Cre ta ' n irriney shen ? as tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , hie eh magh reesht gys ny Hewnyn , as dooyrt eh roo , Cha vel mish er gheddyn foill erbee ayn .

text: But ye have a custom , that I should release unto you one at the passover : will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews ?
text2: Agh ta cliaghtey eu mee dy eaysley diu fer ec y Chaisht : nailliu er - y - fa shen mee dy eaysley diu ree ny Hewnyn ?

text: Then cried they all again , saying , Not this man , but Barabbas . Now Barabbas was a robber .
text2: Eisht deie ad ooilley reesht , gra , Cha nee eh shoh , agh Barabbas . Nish va Barabbas ny roosteyr .

text: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus , and scourged him .
text2: EISHT ghow Pilate er - y - fa shen Yeesey , as doardee eh eh dy ve scuitchit .

text: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns , and put it on his head , and they put on him a purple robe ,
text2: As fee ny sidooryn attey dy ghrineyn , as hug ad eh er e chione , as hug ad er coamrey purple .

text: And said , Hail , King of the Jews ! and they smote him with their hands .
text2: As dooyrt ad , Dy vannee dhyt ' s , Ree ny Hewnyn : as woaill ad eh lesh nyn laueyn .

text: Pilate therefore went forth again , and saith unto them , Behold , I bring him forth to you , that ye may know that I find no fault in him .
text2: Haink Pilate er - y - fa shen magh reesht , as dooyrt eh roo , Cur - my - ner , ta mish dy choyrt lhiam magh hiu eh , dy vod fys y ve eu nagh vel mish er gheddyn foill erbee ayn .

text: Then came Jesus forth , wearing the crown of thorns , and the purple robe . And Pilate saith unto them , Behold the man !
text2: Eisht haink Yeesey magh , ceau yn attey dy ghrineyn as y coamrey purple . As dooyrt Pilate roo , Cur - jee my - ner yn dooinney .

text: When the chief priests therefore and officers saw him , they cried out , saying , Crucify him , crucify him . Pilate saith unto them , Take ye him , and crucify him : for I find no fault in him .
text2: Shen - y - fa tra honnick ny ard - saggyrtyn as ny fir - oik eh , deie ad , gra , Jean y chrossey eh , jean y chrossey eh . Dooyrt Pilate roo , Gow - jee shiuish eh , as Jean - jee eh y chrossey : son cha vel mish er gheddyn foill er bee ayn .

text: The Jews answered him , We have a law , and by our law he ought to die , because he made himself the Son of God .
text2: Dreggyr ny Hewnyn eh , Ta leigh ainyn , as liorish y leigh ain lhisagh eh v ' er ny choyrt gy - baase , er - y - fa dy ghow eh er dy nee Mac Yee v ' eh .

text: When Pilate therefore heard that saying , he was the more afraid ;
text2: Tra cheayll Pilate er - y - fa shen yn raa shoh , v ' eh ny s ' agglee ;

text: And went again into the judgment hall , and saith unto Jesus , Whence art thou ? But Jesus gave him no answer .
text2: As hie Pilate reesht gys halley ny briwnys , as dooyrt eh rish Yeesey , Cre voish t ' ou ? Agh cha dug Yeesey ansoor da .

text: Then saith Pilate unto him , Speakest thou not unto me ? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee , and have power to release thee ?
text2: Eisht dooyrt Pilate rish , Nagh loayr oo rhym ' s ? nagh vel fys ayd dy vel pooar aym ' s dy dty chrossey , as pooar dy dty eaysley ?

text: Jesus answered , Thou couldest have no power at all against me , except it were given thee from above : therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin .
text2: Dreggyr Yeesey , Cha voddagh pooar erbee y ve ayd harrym ' s , mannagh beagh eh er ny choyrt dhyt veih ' n yrjid ; shen - y - fa ta peccah smoo lhie ersyn ren m ' y livrey hood .

text: And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release him : but the Jews cried out , saying , If thou let this man go , thou art not Caesar ' s friend : whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar .
text2: As veih shen magh va Pilate shirrey dy eaysley eh : agh deie ny Hewnyn , gra , My lhiggys oo yn raad da yn dooinney shoh , cha nee carrey da Cesar oo : quoi - erbee ta jannoo eh - hene ny ree , t ' eh loayrt noi Cesar .

text: When Pilate therefore heard that saying , he brought Jesus forth , and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement , but in the Hebrew , Gabbatha .
text2: Tra cheayll Pilate er - y - fa shen yn raa shoh , hug eh lesh Yeesey magh , as hoie eh sheese er stoyl ny briwnys , ayns ynnyd ta enmyssit yn Pavement , agh ayns Hebrew , Gabbatha .

text: And it was the preparation of the passover , and about the sixth hour : and he saith unto the Jews , Behold your King !
text2: As she er laa aarlaghey ny Caisht ve , as mysh y cheyoo oor : as dooyrt eh rish ny Hewnyn , Cur - jee my - ner yn ree eu .

text: But they cried out , Away with him , away with him , crucify him . Pilate saith unto them , Shall I crucify your King ? The chief priest answered , We have no king but Caesar .
text2: Agh dyllee ad , Ersooyl lesh , ersooyl lesh , jean y chrossey eh . Dooyrt Pilate roo , Jean - ym yn ree euish y chrossey ? Dreggyr ny ard - saggyrtyn , Cha vel ree ainyn agh Cesar .

text: Then delivered he him therefore unto them to be crucified . And they took Jesus , and led him away .
text2: Er shoh ren eh eshyn y livrey huc dy ve er ny chrossey . As ghow ad Yeesey as leeid ad eh ersooyl .

text: And he bearing his cross went forth into a place called the place of a skull , which is called in the Hebrew Golgotha :
text2: As dymmyrk eh e chrosh , as hie eh magh gys ynnyd yiarragh ad ynnyd y vollag rish , ta enmyssit ayns Hebrew , Golgotha .

text: Where they crucified him , and two other with him , on either side one , and Jesus in the midst .
text2: Raad ren ad eshyn y chrossey , as jees elley marish , fer er dagh cheu , as Yeesey ayns y vean .

text: And Pilate wrote a title , and put it on the cross . And the writing was , JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: As ren Pilate screeuyn , as hug eh er y chrosh eh . As va ' n screeu , YEESEY DY NAZARETH REE NY HEWNYN .

text: This title then read many of the Jews : for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city : and it was written in Hebrew , and Greek , and Latin .
text2: Yn screeu shoh eisht ren ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn y lhaih , son va ' n boayl raad v ' eh er ny chrossey er - gerrey da ' n ard valley : as ve scruit ayns Hebrew , as Greek , as Latin .

text: Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate , Write not , The King of the Jews ; but that he said , I am King of the Jews .
text2: Eisht dooyrt ard - saggyrtyn ny Hewnyn rish Pilate , Ny scrieu , Ree ny Hewnyn ; agh dy dooyrt eh , She ree ny Hewnyn mee .

text: Pilate answered , What I have written I have written .
text2: Dreggyr Pilate , Ny ta scruit aym , te scruit .

text: Then the soldiers , when they had crucified Jesus , took his garments , and made four parts , to every soldier a part ; and also his coat : now the coat was without seam , woven from the top throughout .
text2: Eisht ghow ny sidooryn , tra v ' ad er chrossey Yeesey , e gharmadyn ( as ren ad kiare ayrnyn jeu , ayrn da dy chooilley hidoor ) as myrgeddin e chooat : nish va ' n cooat ooilley feeit , veih heose dy heese , fegooish seam .

text: They said therefore among themselves , Let us not rend it , but cast lots for it , whose it shall be : that the scripture might be fulfilled , which saith , They parted my raiment among them , and for my vesture they did cast lots . These things therefore the soldiers did .
text2: Dooyrt ad er - y - fa shen nyn mast ' oc hene , Ny lhig dooin y raipey eh , agh lhottyn y hilgey er , quoi echey vees eh : dy voddagh y scriptyr ve cooilleenit , ta gra , Reynn ad my gharmad nyn mast ' oc , as er my chooat ren ad lottyn y hilgey . Shoh myr ren ny sidooryn .

text: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother , and his mother ' s sister , Mary the wife of Cleophas , and Mary Magdalene .
text2: Nish va nyn shassoo liorish crosh Yeesey , e voir , as shuyr e vayrey , Moirrey ben Cleopas , as Moirrey Malaine .

text: When Jesus therefore saw his mother , and the disciple standing by , whom he loved , he saith unto his mother , Woman , behold thy son !
text2: Tra honnick Yeesey er - y - fa shen e voir , as yn ostyl bynney lesh ny hassoo lioree , dooyrt eh rish e voir , Ven , cur - my - ner dty vac .

text: Then saith he to the disciple , Behold thy mother ! And from that hour that disciple took her unto his own home .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish yn ostyl , Cur - my - ner dty voir . As veih ' n oor shen ghow yn ostyl ee gys e hie hene .

text: After this , Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished , that the scripture might be fulfilled , saith , I thirst .
text2: Ny lurg shoh , son dy row fys ec Yeesey dy row dy chooilley nhee nish cooilleenit , dy voddagh y scriptyr ve jeant mie , dooyrt eh , Ta mee paagh .

text: Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar : and they filled a spunge with vinegar , and put it upon hyssop , and put it to his mouth .
text2: Nish va saagh er ny hoiaghey lane vinegar : as lhieen ad spunge leih y vinegar , as hug ad eh er hyssop , as heeyn ad eh seose gys e veeal .

text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar , he said , It is finished : and he bowed his head , and gave up the ghost .
text2: Tra va Yeesey er - y - fa shen er ghoaill y vinegar , dooyrt eh , Te cooilleenit : as chroym eh e chione , as phaart eh .

text: The Jews therefore , because it was the preparation , that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day , ( for that sabbath day was an high day , ) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken , and that they might be taken away .
text2: Shen - y - fa son dy nee laa yn aarlaghey ve , as nagh beagh ny kirp er y chrosh er laa yn doonaght ( son va ' n doonaght shen ny ard - laa ) ghuee ny Hewnyn er Pilate , ny lurgaghyn oc dy ve brisht , as ad dy ve goit ersooyl .

text: Then came the soldiers , and brake the legs of the first , and of the other which was crucified with him .
text2: Eisht haink ny sidooryn as vrish ad lurgaghyn y chied er , as y jeh elley v ' er ny chrossey marish .

text: But when they came to Jesus , and saw that he was dead already , they brake not his legs :
text2: Agh tra haink ad gys Yeesey , as dy vaik ad dy row eh hannah marroo , cha vrish ad ny lurgaghyn echeysyn .

text: But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side , and forthwith came there out blood and water .
text2: Agh ren fer jeh ny sidooryn lesh shleiy yn lhiattee echey y hoylley , as chelleeragh haink magh ass fuill as ushtey .

text: And he that saw it bare record , and his record is true : and he knoweth that he saith true , that ye might believe .
text2: As dymmyrk eshyn honnick eh feanish , as ta ' n eanish echey firrinagh : as ta fys echey dy vel eh gra yn irriney , dy vod shiuish credjal .

text: For these things were done , that the scripture should be fulfilled , A bone of him shall not be broken .
text2: Son liorish jannoo ny reddyn shoh va ' n scriptyr cooilleenit , Cha bee craue jeh er ny vrishey .

text: And again another scripture saith , They shall look on him whom they pierced .
text2: As reesht ta scriptyr elley gra , Jeeaghee ad ersyn t ' ad er hoylley .

text: And after this Joseph of Arimathaea , being a disciple of Jesus , but secretly for fear of the Jews , besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus : and Pilate gave him leave . He came therefore , and took the body of Jesus .
text2: As ny lurg shoh ren Joseph dy Arimathea ( va fer jeh ynseydee Yeesey , agh dy follit , ayns aggle roish ny Hewnyn ) guee er - Pilate , eh dy lhiggey da corp Yeesey y ghoaill ersooyl ; as hug Pilate kied da : Haink eh er - y - fa shen , as hug eh lesh corp Yeesey .

text: And there came also Nicodemus , which at the first came to Jesus by night , and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes , about an hundred pound weight .
text2: As haink myrgeddin Nicodemus ( va roie er jeet gys Yeesey ayns yn oie ) as hug eh lesh mysh keead punt dy vyrrh as dy aloes kione y cheilley .

text: Then took they the body of Jesus , and wound it in linen clothes with the spices , as the manner of the Jews is to bury .
text2: Eisht ghow ad corp Yeesey , as hoill ad eh ayns aanrityn , lesh spiceyn , myr va cliaghtey ny Hewnyn dy oanluckey .

text: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden ; and in the garden a new sepulchre , wherein was never man yet laid .
text2: Nish er - gerrey da ' n ynnyd raad v ' eh er ny chrossey , va garey ; as ayns y gharey oaie noa , ayn nagh jagh rieau dooinney er coyrt .

text: There laid they Jesus therefore because of the Jews ' preparation day ; for the sepulchre was nigh at hand .
text2: Ayns shen ren ad Yeesey er - y - fa shen y oanluckey , son dy nee laa aarlaghey ny Hewnyn ve , as dy row yn oaie er - gerrey daue .

text: The first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early , when it was yet dark , unto the sepulchre , and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre .
text2: ER y chied laa jeh ' n chiaghtin , haink Moirrey Malaine dy moghey , tra ve foast dorraghey , gys yn oaie , as honnick ee yn chlagh goit ersooyl jeh ' n oaie .

text: Then she runneth , and cometh to Simon Peter , and to the other disciple , whom Jesus loved , and saith unto them , They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulchre , and we know not where they have laid him .
text2: Eisht roie ee , as haink ee gys Simon Peddyr , as gys yn ostyl elley bynney lesh Yeesey , as dooyrt ee roo , T ' ad er ghoaill ersooyl y Chiarn ass yn oaie , as cha s ' ain c ' raad t ' ad er choyrt eh .

text: Peter therefore went forth , and that other disciple , and came to the sepulchre .
text2: Hie Peddyr er - y - fa shen magh , as yn ostyl elley shen , as haink ad gys yn oaie .

text: So they ran both together : and the other disciple did outrun Peter , and came first to the sepulchre .
text2: Son v ' ad ny - neesht er roie cooidjagh : agh va ' n ostyl elley er roie ny s ' bieau na Peddyr , as er jeet hoshiaght gys yn oaie .

text: And he stooping down , and looking in , saw the linen clothes lying ; yet went he not in .
text2: As chroym eh sheese , as honnick eh ny aanrityn nyn lhie , ny - yeih cha jagh eh stiagh .

text: Then cometh Simon Peter following him , and went into the sepulchre , and seeth the linen clothes lie ,
text2: Eisht haink Simon Peddyr geiyrt er , as hie eh stiagh ' syn oaie , as honnick eh ny aanrityn nyn lhie .

text: And the napkin , that was about his head , not lying with the linen clothes , but wrapped together in a place by itself .
text2: As y naptin va mysh e chione , cha nee ny lhie marish ny aanrityn elley , agh fillit er - y - cheilley ayns ynnyd er - lheh .

text: Then went in also that other disciple , which came first to the sepulchre , and he saw , and believed .
text2: Eisht hie stiagh myrgeddin yn ostyl elley shen haink hoshiaght gys yn oaie , as honnick eh as ren eh credjal .

text: For as yet they knew not the scripture , that he must rise again from the dead .
text2: Son cha row foast toiggal oc jeh ' n scriptyr , dy beign da girree veih ny merriu .

text: Then the disciples went away again unto their own home .
text2: Eisht hie ny ostyllyn rhymboo reesht gys nyn dhie hene .

text: But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping : and as she wept , she stooped down , and looked into the sepulchre ,
text2: Agh va Moirrey ny shassoo cheu mooie jeh ' n oaie keayney : as myr v ' ee keayney , chroym ee sheese as yeeagh ee stiagh ayns yn oaie .

text: And seeth two angels in white sitting , the one at the head , and the other at the feet , where the body of Jesus had lain .
text2: As honnick ee daa ainle nyn soie ayns coamraghyn sollys , yn derrey yeh ec y chione , as y jeh elley ec ny cassyn raad va corp Yeesey ny lhie .

text: And they say unto her , Woman , why weepest thou ? She saith unto them , Because they have taken away my Lord , and I know not where they have laid him .
text2: As dooyrt ad r ' ee , Ven , cre ' n - fa t ' ou keayney ? Dooyrt ish roo , Er - yn - oyr dy vel ad er ghoaill ersooyl my Hiarn , as nagh s ' aym c ' raad t ' ad er choyrt eh .

text: And when she had thus said , she turned herself back , and saw Jesus standing , and knew not that it was Jesus .
text2: As tra v ' ee er ghra shoh , hyndaa ee mygeayrt , as honnick ee Yeesey ny hassoo , as cha row fys eck dy nee Yeesey v ' ayn .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , why weepest thou ? whom seekest thou ? She , supposing him to be the gardener , saith unto him , Sir , if thou have borne him hence , tell me where thou hast laid him , and I will take him away .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Ven , cre ' n - fa t ' ou keayney ? quoi t ' ou dy hirrey ? Heill ish dy nee yn gareyder v ' ayn , as dooyrt ee rish , Vainshter , my t ' ou er chur lhiat ass shoh eh , insh dou c ' raad t ' ou er choyrt eh , as goym ersooyl eh .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Mary . She turned herself , and saith unto him , Rabboni ; which is to say , Master .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey , Voirrey . Hyndaa ee ee - hene , as dooyrt ee rish , Rabboni , ta shen dy ghra , Vainshter .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Touch me not ; for I am not yet ascended to my Father : but go to my brethren , and say unto them , I ascend unto my Father , and your Father ; and to my God , and your God .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey r ' ee , Ny benn rhym ; son cha vel mee foast er gholl seose gys my Ayr ; agh gow gys my vraaraghyn , as abbyr roo , Ta mee goll seose gys my Ayr ' s as yn Ayr euish , as gys my Yee ' s as y Jee euish .

text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord , and that he had spoken these things unto her .
text2: Haink Moirrey Malaine as dinsh ee da ny ostyllyn , dy row ee er vakin y Chiarn , as dy row eh er loayrt ny goan shoh r ' ee .

text: Then the same day at evening , being the first day of the week , when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews , came Jesus and stood in the midst , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: Eisht er y laa cheddin , yn chied laa jeh ' n chiaghtin , ayns yn astyr , tra va ny dorryssyn dooint , raad va ny ostyllyn er nyn jaglym cooidjagh ayns aggle roish ny Hewnyn , haink Yeesey as hass eh kiongoyrt roo , as dooyrt eh roo , Shee dy row hiu .

text: And when he had so said , he shewed unto them his hands and his side . Then were the disciples glad , when they saw the Lord .
text2: As tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , yeeagh eh daue e laueyn as e lhiattee . Eisht ghow ny ostyllyn boggey tra honnick ad y Chiarn .

text: Then said Jesus to them again , Peace be unto you : as my Father hath sent me , even so send I you .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo reesht , Shee dy row hiu ; myr ta my Ayr er my choyrt ' s , myr shen ta mish coyrt shiuish

text: And when he had said this , he breathed on them , and saith unto them , Receive ye the Holy Ghost :
text2: As tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , heid eh orroo , as dooyrt eh roo , Gow - jee yn Spyrryd Noo .

text: Whose soever sins ye remit , they are remitted unto them ; and whose soever sins ye retain , they are retained .
text2: Da quoi - erbee ta shiuish leih peccaghyn , t ' ad er nyn leih daue ; as da quoi erbee nagh vel shiu cur feaysley , cha vel ad feayshlit .

text: But Thomas , one of the twelve , called Didymus , was not with them when Jesus came .
text2: Agh cha row Thomase , fer jeh ' n daa ostyl yeig va enmyssit Didymus , maroo tra haink Yeesey .

text: The other disciples therefore said unto him , We have seen the Lord . But he said unto them , Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails , and put my finger into the print of the nails , and thrust my hand into his side , I will not believe .
text2: Dooyrt ny ostyllyn elley er - y - fa shen rish , Ta shin er vakin y Chiarn . Agh dooyrt eshyn roo , Mannagh vaikym ayns ny laueyn echey ynnyd ny treinaghyn , as mannagh derrym my vair ayns ynnyd ny treinaghyn , as my laue y choyrt stiagh ayns e lhiattee , cha greidym .

text: And after eight days again his disciples were within , and Thomas with them : then came Jesus , the doors being shut , and stood in the midst , and said , Peace be unto you .
text2: As lurg hoght laa reesht va ny ostyllyn echey sthie , as Thomase maroo : eisht haink Yeesey , as ny dorryssyn dooint , as hass eh kiongoyrt roo , as dooyrt eh , Shee dy row hiu .

text: Then saith he to Thomas , reach hither thy finger , and behold my hands ; and reach hither thy hand , and thrust it into my side : and be not faithless , but believing .
text2: Eisht dooyrt eh rish Thomase , Sheeyn ayns shoh dty vair , as loaghtee my laueyn ; as sheeyn dty laue , as cur ee stiagh ayns my lhiattee : as ny bee mee - chredjuagh , agh credjuagh .

text: And Thomas answered and said unto him , My Lord and my God .
text2: As dreggyr Thomase as dooyrt eh rish , My Hiarn , as my Yee .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Thomas , because thou hast seen me , thou hast believed : blessed are they that have not seen , and yet have believed .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rishyn , Homase , Er - y fa dy vel oo er my akin , t ' ou er chredjal ; bannit t ' adsyn nagh vel er vakin , as foast ta er chredjal .

text: And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples , which are not written in this book :
text2: As ymmodee cowraghyn elley dy jarroo ren Yeesey ayns fenish e ostyllyn , nagh vel scruit ayns y lioar shoh .

text: But these are written , that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ , the Son of God ; and that believing ye might have life through his name .
text2: Agh t ' ad shoh scruit , dy voddagh shiuish credjal dy nee Yeesey yn Creest Mac Yee , as liorish credjal shiu dy chosney bea trooid yn ennym echeysyn .

text: After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias ; and on this wise shewed he himself .
text2: LURG shoh hoilshee Yeesey eh - hene reesht da ny ostyllyn , ec faarkey Tiberias ; as er yn aght shoh hoilshee eh eh - hene .

text: There were together Simon Peter , and Thomas called Didymus , and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee , and the sons of Zebedee , and two other of his disciples .
text2: Va Simon Peddyr , as Thomase sliennooit Didymus , as Nathanael dy Chana ayns Galilee ; as mec Zebedee , as jees elley jeh ny ostyllyn er nyn jaglym dy cheilley .

text: Simon Peter saith unto them , I go a fishing . They say unto him , We also go with thee . They went forth , and entered into a ship immediately ; and that night they caught nothing .
text2: Dooyrt Simon Peddyr roo , Ta mish son goll dy eeastagh . Dooyrt adsyn rish , Hem mainyn myrgeddin mayrt . Hie ad magh , as er - y - chooyl ghow ad lhuingys ; as yn oie shen cha haare ad monney .

text: But when the morning was now come , Jesus stood on the shore : but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus .
text2: Agh ' sy vadran , va Yeesey ny hassoo er y traie : agh cha row fys ec ny ostyllyn dy nee Yeesey v ' ayn .

text: Then Jesus saith unto them , Children , have ye any meat ? They answered him , No .
text2: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo , Chloan , vel shiu er dayrtyn veg y veaghey ? Dooyrt adsyn rish , Cha vel .

text: And he said unto them , Cast the net on the right side of the ship , and ye shall find . They cast therefore , and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes .
text2: As dooyrt eh roo , Cuir - jee magh yn lieen er y cheu - yesh jeh ' n lhong , as bee eh eu . Eisht chuir ad : as nish cha row dy niart oc yn lieen y ghoaill stiagh va lhied y thummyd eeast ayn .

text: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter , It is the Lord . Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord , he girt his fisher ' s coat unto him , ( for he was naked , ) and did cast himself into the sea .
text2: Shen - y - fa dooyrt yn ostyl shen bynney lesh Yeesey rish Peddyr , She yn Chiarn t ' ayn . Nish tra cheayll Simon Peddyr dy nee yn Chiarn v ' ayn , hug eh e chooat - eeastee mysh ( son v ' eh ' sy lheiney ) as hilg eh eh - hene ayns y cheayn .

text: And the other disciples came in a little ship ; ( for they were not far from land , but as it were two hundred cubits , ) dragging the net with fishes .
text2: As haink ny ostyllyn elley ayns lhong veg ( son cha row ad foddey veih ' n thalloo , agh mysh keead stundayrt ) sleodey lhieu yn lieen as yn eeast ayn .

text: As soon then as they were come to land , they saw a fire of coals there , and fish laid thereon , and bread .
text2: Cha leah eisht as v ' ad er jeet gys y thalloo , honnick ad aile smarageagh , as eeast ny lhie er , as arran liorish .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Bring of the fish which ye have now caught .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Cur - jee lhieu jeh ' n eeast ta shiu nish er ghoaill .

text: Simon Peter went up , and drew the net to land full of great fishes , and hundred and fifty and three : and for all there were so many , yet was not the net broken .
text2: Hie Simon Peddyr er - board , as hayrn eh yn lieen gys thalloo lane dy eeastyn mooarey , shiaght - feed as three - jeig : as son ooilley dy row whilleen ayn , ny - yeih cha vrish y lieen .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Come and dine . And none of the disciples durst ask him , Who art thou ? knowing that it was the Lord .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey roo , Tar - jee gys nyn mee . Agh cha by - lhoys da fer jeh ny ostyl nyn fenaght jeh , Quoi oo hene ? cur enney er dy nee eh va ' n Chiarn .

text: Jesus then cometh , and taketh bread , and giveth them , and fish likewise .
text2: Eisht haink Yeesey , as ghow eh arran , as hirveish eh orroo eh , as eeast myrgeddin .

text: This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples , after that he was risen from the dead .
text2: Shoh nish yn trass cheayrt hoilshee Yeesey eh - hene da e ostyllyn , erreish da v ' er n ' irree veill ny merriu .

text: So when they had dined , Jesus saith to Simon Peter , Simon , son of Jonas , lovest thou me more than these ? He saith unto him , Yea , Lord ; thou knowest that I love thee . He saith unto him , Feed my lambs .
text2: Myr shen tra v ' ad erreish bee , dooyrt Yeesey rish Simon Peddyr , Simon mac Yonas , vel oo ny s ' graihlee orrym ' s na orroo shoh ? Dooyrt eh rish , Ta mee , Hiarn ; ta fys ayd dy vel graih aym ort . Dooyrt eh rish , Jeeagh dy mie da my eayin .

text: He saith to him again the second time , Simon , son of Jonas , lovest thou me ? He saith unto him , Yea , Lord ; thou knowest that I love thee . He saith unto him , Feed my sheep .
text2: Dooyrt eh rish reesht yn nah cheayrt , Simon mac Yonas , vel oo graihagh orrym ? Dooyrt eh rish , Ta mee , Hiarn ; ta fys ayd hene dy vel graih aym ort . Dooyrt eh rish , Bee dty vochilley mie er my chirree .

text: He saith unto him the third time , Simon , son of Jonas , lovest thou me ? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time , Lovest thou me ? And he said unto him , Lord , thou knowest all things ; thou knowest that I love thee . Jesus saith unto him , Feed my sheep .
text2: Dooyrt eh rish yn trass cheayrt , Simon mac Yonas , vel oo graihagh orrym ? Va Peddyr mooar - seaghnit dy dooyrt eh rish yn trass cheayrt , Vel oo graihagh orrym ? As dooyrt eh rish , Hiarn , ta fys ayd ' s er dy chooilley nhee , as fys ayd hene dy vel mee graihagh ort . Dooyrt Yeesey rish , Jeeagh dy mie da my chirree .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , When thou wast young , thou girdedst thyself , and walkedst whither thou wouldest : but when thou shalt be old , thou shalt stretch forth thy hands , and another shall gird thee , and carry thee whither thou wouldest not .
text2: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt , Tra v ' ou aeg ren oo oo - hene y chryssey , as jimmee oo raad erbee dy bailt : agh tra vees oo shenn , sheeynee oo magh dty laueyn , as nee fer elley oo y chryssey , as ver eh lesh oo raad nagh nailt .

text: This spake he , signifying by what death he should glorify God . And when he had spoken this , he saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Shoh loayr eh , cowraghey liorish cre ' n baase v ' eh dy ghloyraghey Jee . As tra v ' eh er ghra shoh , dooyrt eh rish , Eiyr orrym .

text: Then Peter , turning about , seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following ; which also leaned on his breast at supper , and said , Lord , which is he that betrayeth thee ?
text2: Eisht hyndaa Peddyr mygeayrt , as honnick eh cheet geiyrt orroo yn ostyl bynney lesh Yeesey ; yn fer cheddin ren lhie rish e oghrish ec shibber , as dooyrt Hiarn , quoi eh ta dy dty vrah ?

text: Peter seeing him saith to Jesus , Lord , and what shall this man do ?
text2: Honnick Peddyr eh shoh , as dooyrt eh rish Yeesey , Hiarn , as cre ' n erree hig er y dooinney shoh ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , If I will that he tarry till I come , what is that to thee ? follow thou me .
text2: Dooyrt Yeesey rish , My she m ' aigney ' s eh eshyn dy uirriaght derrey hig - ym , cre ta shen dhyt ' s ? Eiyr uss orrym ' s .

text: Then went this saying abroad among the brethren , that that disciple should not die : yet Jesus said not unto him , He shall not die ; but , If I will that he tarry till I come , what is that to thee ?
text2: Eisht hie yn raa shen magh mastey ny braaraghyn , nagh row yn ostyl shen dy gheddyn baase : agh cha dooyrt Yeesey rish , Cha vow eh baase : agh , My she m ' aigney ' s eh eshyn dy uirriaght derrey hig - yms , cre ta shen dhyt ' s .

text: This is the disciple which testifieth of these things , and wrote these things : and we know that his testimony is true .
text2: Shoh yn ostyl dymmyrk feanish jeh ny reddyn shoh , as ren ny reddyn shoh y scrieu : as ta fys ain dy vel yn eanish echey firrinagh .

text: And there are also many other things which Jesus did , the which , if they should be written every one , I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written . Amen .
text2: As ta myrgeddin ymmodee reddyn elley ren Yeesey , dy beagh ad ooilley scruit , ta mee dy heiltyn nagh gummagh y seihll hene ny lioaryn veagh scruit . Amen .
